text2: ayi Jakop ku Jɔn , wɛɛt ke Dhebedhayo , kɔc room kaŋ ne Thimon , acik piɔth pau aya . Go Yecu Thimon yɔɔk , yan , Du riɔc ; yin bi kɔc aa dɔm , gɔl ekoole aɣet rial .

text: And when they had brought their ships to land , they forsook all , and followed him .
text2: Na wen , acik abeelken thɛl biic , ke ke jɔ kaŋ nyaaŋ piny kedhie , ku jɔki kuany cok .

text: And it came to pass , when he was in a certain city , behold a man full of leprosy : who seeing Jesus fell on his face , and besought him , saying , Lord , if thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: Na ɣɔn , te nu yen panydit tok , di , ke raan cii wɛth dɔm aret bɔ ; na wen , aci Yecu tiŋ , ke cuɛt rot piny e yenɔm , ku jɔ lɔŋ , yan , Bɛnydit , te de yin piɔu luɔi bi yin a tɔ waar , yin dueer a tɔ waar .

text: And he put forth his hand , and touched him , saying , I will : be thou clean . And immediately the leprosy departed from him .
text2: Go yecin riɛny tueŋ , ku jiɛk , ku jɔ lueel , yan , Anu e yapiɔu : jɔ waar . Na tethiine , ke wɛth dap jal e yeguop .

text: And he charged him to tell no man : but go , and shew thyself to the priest , and offer for thy cleansing , according as Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: Go yɔɔk , yan , Mathdien , e cin raan lɛke yen : lɔ tei , nyuothe rot bɛny de ka ke Nhialic , ku yiene kedaŋ ne waar ci yin guop waar , cit man ci Mothe e lueel , abi aa caatɔ e kɔc niim .

text: But so much the more went there a fame abroad of him : and great multitudes came together to hear , and to be healed by him of their infirmities .
text2: Go rinke lɔ ke ke thiei e piny nɔm aret : ku gueer kut dit ke kɔc bik bɛn piŋ , ku bike tɔ dem e ka nu e kegup .

text: And he withdrew himself into the wilderness , and prayed .
text2: Go ya cool e wony rot le jɔɔric , le lɔŋ .

text: And it came to pass on a certain day , as he was teaching , that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by , which were come out of every town of Galilee , and Judaea , and Jerusalem : and the power of the Lord was present to heal them .
text2: Na wen , ekool tok e ninke yiic , ke weet kɔc , ku ade Parithai ku bany e kɔc wɛɛt e loŋ areerki etɛɛn , kɔc e bɔ bei e bɛi ke Galili kedhie , ku Judaya , ku Jeruthalem : ku ciɛth riɛl e Bɛnydit keke yen , bi en kɔc tɔ dem .

text: And , behold , men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy : and they sought means to bring him in , and to lay him before him .
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc e ke bɔ kɔc ɣɛɛc raan ci duany e laŋarep nɔm : ku jɔki te bi kek e bɛɛi ɣot kɔɔr , bik bɛn taau piny e yenɔm .

text: And when they could not find by what way they might bring him in because of the multitude , they went upon the housetop , and let him down through the tiling with his couch into the midst before Jesus .
text2: Na wen , acin te cik yok , te bi kek e bɛɛi ɣot , ne biak de kut e kɔc , ke ke jɔ lɔ nhial e ɣot nɔm , agoki ɣot ŋaany nɔm e biak , ku jɔki raan luai piny keke laŋarepde e kɔc yiic cil e Yecu nɔm .

text: And when he saw their faith , he said unto him , Man , thy sins are forgiven thee .
text2: Go gamden tiŋ , ku jɔ yɔɔk , yan , Mɛnhe , karɛcku acike pal yin .

text: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason , saying , Who is this which speaketh blasphemies ? Who can forgive sins , but God alone ?
text2: Go kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr ku Parithai goki teer gɔl , ku thiecki , yan , Eeŋa eraane raan lat Nhialic ? Eeŋa dueer karac pɔl , cie Nhialic etok ?

text: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts , he answering said unto them , What reason ye in your hearts ?
text2: Na wen , aŋic Yecu teer teer kek , ke jɔ bɛɛr , yan , Eeŋo tɛɛrki e wepiɔth ?

text: Whether is easier , to say , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Rise up and walk ?
text2: Ee kenou piɔl e keek , te luɛɛl ɛn en , yan , Karɛcku acike pal yin ; ku te luɛɛl ɛn en , yan , Jɔt rot , cathe ?

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins , ( he said unto the sick of the palsy , ) I say unto thee , Arise , and take up thy couch , and go into thine house .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , luɔi ba wek e ŋic , nɔn ciɛthe Wen e raan ke riɛl bi en karac pɔl e piny nɔm , ( ke jɔ raan ci duany yɔɔk , yan , ) yin yɔɔk , yan , Jɔt rot , jɔt laŋarepdu , ku lɔ paandu .

text: And immediately he rose up before them , and took up that whereon he lay , and departed to his own house , glorifying God .
text2: Go rot jɔt enɔnthiine e keniim , ku jɔt ke wen niin en e yenɔm , ku jɔ lɔ paande , ke lec Nhialic .

text: And they were all amazed , and they glorified God , and were filled with fear , saying , We have seen strange things to day .
text2: Goki gai kedhie , ku jɔki Nhialic leec , ku ci riɔɔc ke dɔm , agoki lueel , yan , Wo ci kagai tiŋ ekoole .

text: And after these things he went forth , and saw a publican , named Levi , sitting at the receipt of custom : and he said unto him , Follow me .
text2: Na wen , aci kake thok , ke jɔ lɔ biic , ku tiŋ raan e atholbo tɔ kut , raan cɔl Lebi , ke rɛɛr e maktap de atholbo : go yɔɔk , yan , Kuany acok .

text: And he left all , rose up , and followed him .
text2: Go kaŋ nyaaŋ piny kedhie , ku jɔt rot , kuɛny cok .

text: And Levi made him a great feast in his own house : and there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat down with them .
text2: Go Lebi luoi kecamdit ɣonde guop : ku ade kut ditt e kɔc e atholbo tɔ kut ayi kɔc kɔk kɔc wen rɛɛr ne yen etok .

text: But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples , saying , Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners ?
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr ku Parithai ke ke jɔ dok e keyac ne kɔckɛn e piooce , ku thiecki , yan , Eeŋo cam wek ku dɛkki weke kɔc e atholbo tɔ kut ayi kɔc e kerac looi ?

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , They that are whole need not a physician ; but they that are sick .
text2: Go Yecu pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Kɔc piɔl gup aciki akiim e kɔɔr ; ee kɔc tok tei .

text: I came not to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Yɛn e cii bɔ ba kɔc piɛthpiɔth bɛn cɔɔl , bik kepiɔth puk , ee kɔc e kerac looi kek aa ba bɛn cɔɔl .

text: And they said unto him , Why do the disciples of John fast often , and make prayers , and likewise the disciples of the Pharisees ; but thine eat and drink ?
text2: Agoki bɛ thieec , yan , Eeŋo ye kɔc e piooce Jɔn cool e reec cam , ku yek cool e pal , ayi kɔc e piooce Parithai aya ; ku kɔckuon e piooce ayek cam ku dekki ?

text: And he said unto them , Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast , while the bridegroom is with them ?
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Duɛɛrki mathken e mony thiek tɔ reec cam , te ŋoote mony thiek ke rɛɛr ke keek ?

text: But the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them , and then shall they fast in those days .
text2: Akool abik bɛn tei , kool bi mony thiek jɔt e keyiic , ku abik cam jɔ rɛɛc e akoolke .

text: And he spake also a parable unto them ; No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old ; if otherwise , then both the new maketh a rent , and the piece that was taken out of the new agreeth not with the old .
text2: Go ke lɛk kaaŋ aya ; yan , Acin raan bi lupɔ ci piac ɣɔɔc kaac e lupɔ thɛɛr kɔu ; na loi yen aya , ke ke ci piac ɣɔɔc jɔ lupɔ thɛɛr tɔ rɛɛt , ku lupɔ wen ci bɛɛi bei e lupɔ ci piac ɣɔɔcyic acii ram ke lupɔ thɛɛr aya .

text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles ; else the new wine will burst the bottles , and be spilled , and the bottles shall perish .
text2: Ku acin raan bi wany ci piac dhiim taau e atheep thɛɛr yiic ; na loi en aya , ke wany ci piac dhiim ke jɔ atheep tɔ rɛɛt yiic , ku jɔ lɔ wei , ku jɔ atheep riaak .

text: But new wine must be put into new bottles ; and both are preserved .
text2: Wany ci piac dhiim aye taau e atheep ci piac coŋ yiic ; agoki tɔu apiɛth kedhie .

text: No man also having drunk old wine straightway desireth new : for he saith , The old is better .
text2: Ku acin raan ci wany ci ceŋ dek bi wany ci piac dhiim dap kɔɔr : abi lueel , yan , Ke ci ceŋ en aŋuan .

text: And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first , that he went through the corn fields ; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn , and did eat , rubbing them in their hands .
text2: Na ɣɔn , ekool toŋ e thabath , ke Yecu tek e dum ke rap yiic ; ago kɔckɛn e piooce rap dhoŋ , ku dɔcki ke , ku camki ke .

text: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them , Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days ?
text2: Go Parithai kɔk ke thieec , yan , Eeŋo luɔɔi wek ke ci pɛn kɔc e luɔi ekool e thabath ?

text: And Jesus answering them said , Have ye not read so much as this , what David did , when himself was an hungred , and they which were with him ;
text2: Go Yecu pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Acakaa kene kɛnki kɔn kueen , ke ci Dabid looi , ɣɔn nɛke cɔk en , ayi kɔc cath ne yen ;

text: How he went into the house of God , and did take and eat the shewbread , and gave also to them that were with him ; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone ?
text2: luɔi ci en lɔ ɣon e Nhialic , ku le kuin ci gam Nhialic noom , ku ciɛm , ku jɔ gam kɔc cath ne yen aya ; ku aye kuin cii raan daŋ dueer cam , ee bany ke ka ke Nhialic kapac ?

text: And he said unto them , That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath .
text2: Go ke yɔɔk , yan , Wen e raan ee Bɛnydiit e thabath aya .

text: And it came to pass also on another sabbath , that he entered into the synagogue and taught : and there was a man whose right hand was withered .
text2: Na ɣɔn , ekool daŋ e thabath , ke jɔ lɔ ɣon e Nhialic le weet ; ku nu raan etɛɛn raan ci ciin cuec riɔu .

text: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him , whether he would heal on the sabbath day ; that they might find an accusation against him .
text2: Go kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr ku Parithai goki woi guop , nɔn bi en raan tɔ dem ekool e thabath ; ke ke bi kedaŋ yok ke bi kek e lɔ gaany .

text: But he knew their thoughts , and said to the man which had the withered hand , Rise up , and stand forth in the midst . And he arose and stood forth .
text2: Go ke cik tak e kepiɔth ŋic , ku jɔ raan ci cin riɔu yɔɔk , yan , Jɔt rot , kaace e ciɛɛlic etɛɛn . Go rot jɔt ku kɛɛc .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , I will ask you one thing ; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good , or to do evil ? to save life , or to destroy it ?
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk ; yan , We ba thiec cook tok ; yan , Ci pal kɔc e akool e thabath bik kepiɛth aa looi , ku bik kerac aa looi ? bik kɔc aa kony wei , ku bik kɔc aa nɔk ?

text: And looking round about upon them all , he said unto the man , Stretch forth thy hand . And he did so : and his hand was restored whole as the other .
text2: Na wen , ke ke lieec kedhie , ku jɔ raan yɔɔk , yan , Riny yicin . Go ecin riny : go cin bɛ pial cit man e ciin daŋ .

text: And they were filled with madness ; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus .
text2: Agoki niim mum aret , ku jɔki guiir kapac , ne ke bik luoi Yecu .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that he went out into a mountain to pray , and continued all night in prayer to God .
text2: Na wen , e ninke , ke jɔ jal le e kuurdit nɔm le lɔŋ , ku jɔ ruu e laŋ Nhialic aruwe piny .

text: And when it was day , he called unto him his disciples : and of them he chose twelve , whom also he named apostles ;
text2: Na wen , aci piny jɔ ru , ke jɔ kɔckɛn e piooce cɔɔl ; go kɔc kathieer ku rou lɔc e keyiic , ku ciek keek , an , tuuc aya ;

text: Simon , ( whom he also named Peter , ) and Andrew his brother , James and John , Philip and Bartholomew ,
text2: yi Thimon , raan ci cak , an , Petero aya , ku Andereya manhe , ku Jakop keke Jɔn , ku Pilip keke Bartholomayo ,

text: Matthew and Thomas , James the son of Alphaeus , and Simon called Zelotes ,
text2: ku Mathayo keke Thoma , ku Jakop wen Alapayo , ku Thimon cɔl Dhelote ,

text: And Judas the brother of James , and Judas Iscariot , which also was the traitor .
text2: ku Judath wen e Jakop , ku Judath Yithkariɔt , raan bi e nyiɛɛn .

text: And he came down with them , and stood in the plain , and the company of his disciples , and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem , and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon , which came to hear him , and to be healed of their diseases ;
text2: Go bɛn piny keke keek etok , bi ku kɛɛc te ci rai keke kut e kɔckɛn e piooce ayi kut dit e kɔc wen bɔ bei e Judayayic ebɛn ku Jeruthalem , ku wɛɛrthok de Turo keke Thidon , kɔc wen ci bɛn bik bɛn piŋ , ku bik bɛn dem ne ka nu e kegup ;

text: And they that were vexed with unclean spirits : and they were healed .
text2: ayi kɔc cii jɔɔk rac dɔm ; agoki gup waar .

text: And the whole multitude sought to touch him : for there went virtue out of him , and healed them all .
text2: Ku kɔɔr kut e kɔc ebɛn luɔi bi kek e jak ; riɛl aci bɛn bei e yeguop , ku tɔ ke dem kedhie .

text: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples , and said , Blessed be ye poor : for yours is the kingdom of God .
text2: Na wen , ke jɔ kɔckɛn e piooce lieec , ku lueel , yan , Thieithieei wek kɔc kuany nyiin , ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic ee kedun .

text: Blessed are ye that hunger now : for ye shall be filled . Blessed are ye that weep now : for ye shall laugh .
text2: Thieithieei wek kɔc nɛk cɔk enɔɔne , we bi tɔ kueth . Thieithieei wek kɔc dhieu enɔɔne , we bi dɔl .

text: Blessed are ye , when men shall hate you , and when they shall separate you from their company , and shall reproach you , and cast out your name as evil , for the Son of man ' s sake .
text2: Thieithieei week , te mɛɛne kɔc week , ku te tɔ kek week e kɔc mɛɛn , ku te lɛt kek week , ku te reec kek rinkun tɔki ke nhiany , ne baŋ de Wen e raan .

text: Rejoice ye in that day , and leap for joy : for , behold , your reward is great in heaven : for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets .
text2: Jaki piɔth miɛt ekoole abak kɛɛc nhial e piɔnmit : tieŋki , ariopdun adit paannhial ; warken aake ye nebii luoi yikya .

text: But woe unto you that are rich ! for ye have received your consolation .
text2: Ku amawoou ne week wek kɔc ci bany ! adutdun acak guɔ noom .

text: Woe unto you that are full ! for ye shall hunger . Woe unto you that laugh now ! for ye shall mourn and weep .
text2: Amawoou ne week wek kɔc ci kuɛth ! we bii cɔk nɔk . Amawoou ne week , wek kɔc dɔl enɔɔne ! we bi dhuoor e dhieeu .

text: Woe unto you , when all men shall speak well of you ! for so did their fathers to the false prophets .
text2: Amawoou ne week , te leece week e kɔc kedhie ! warken aake ye nebii aluɛth luoi yikya .

text: But I say unto you which hear , Love your enemies , do good to them which hate you ,
text2: Ku wek yɔɔk , wek kɔc piŋ , yan , Nhiaarki kɔc dɛ wek ater , yak kɔc man week luooi apiɛth ,

text: Bless them that curse you , and pray for them which despitefully use you .
text2: yak kɔc e wek lam kerac thieei , ku yak lɔŋ ne biak de kɔc e week luoi kerac .

text: And unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the other ; and him that taketh away thy cloke forbid not to take thy coat also .
text2: Ku raan biak yin gem tok , ke yi wel gem daŋ aya ; ku raan rum lupɔduon thiine , ke du pen lupɔduon dit aya .

text: Give to every man that asketh of thee ; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask them not again .
text2: Miɔc raan ebɛn raan lip yin ; ku raan rum weuku , du ke be kɔɔr tede yen .

text: And as ye would that men should do to you , do ye also to them likewise .
text2: Ku acit man kaar wek ke bi kɔc aa luoi week , ke ke jaki ya luooi wakya ayadaŋ .

text: For if ye love them which love you , what thank have ye ? for sinners also love those that love them .
text2: Ku na nhiaarki kɔc nhiaar week , ee lɛc ŋo cath ke week ? kɔc e kerac looi ayek kɔc nhiaar keek nhiaar .

text: And if ye do good to them which do good to you , what thank have ye ? for sinners also do even the same .
text2: Ku na luooiki kɔc apiɛth kɔc luui week apiɛth , ee lɛc ŋo cath ke week ? kɔc e kerac looi ayek luui yikya ayadaŋ .

text: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive , what thank have ye ? for sinners also lend to sinners , to receive as much again .
text2: Ku na dhɛnki kɔc kaŋ kɔc ŋathki nɔn ba wek kaŋ bɛ noom tede keek , ee lɛc ŋo cath ke week ? kɔc e kerac looi ayek kɔc e kerac looi dhɛn kaŋ , yan , bik kaŋ bɛ aa noom ka cit ka cik aa dhɛɛn .

text: But love ye your enemies , and do good , and lend , hoping for nothing again ; and your reward shall be great , and ye shall be the children of the Highest : for he is kind unto the unthankful and to the evil .
text2: Ku week , yak kɔc de ater ne week nhiaar , ku yak ke luooi apiɛth , ku dhɛnki ke kaŋ , ke cin ke ŋathki ; ke ariopdun abi dit , ku we bi aa mith ke Nhialic Awarjaŋ ; ee piɔu adhuɛŋ keke kɔc cin piɔth ayi kɔc racpiɔth .

text: Be ye therefore merciful , as your Father also is merciful .
text2: Yak piɔth kok cit man ee Wuoordun piɔu kok .

text: Judge not , and ye shall not be judged : condemn not , and ye shall not be condemned : forgive , and ye shall be forgiven :
text2: Duoki kɔc e jɔɔny , ke we cii bi aa jɔɔny : duoki kɔc e gɔk , ke we cii bi aa gɔk : yak kɔc pal karɛcken , ke we bi aa pal karɛckun ;

text: Give , and it shall be given unto you ; good measure , pressed down , and shaken together , and running over , shall men give into your bosom . For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again .
text2: yak miooc , ke we bi aa miɔɔc ; we bii kɔc yiek yoth kaŋ ne ke ci thiaŋ , ku ci cook , ku ci yiek , abi nɔm lɔ wei . Them thɛm wek kɔc kaŋ yen abi kɔc bɛ them week aya .

text: And he spake a parable unto them , Can the blind lead the blind ? shall they not both fall into the ditch ?
text2: Go keek lɛk kaaŋ , yan , De cɔɔr dueer cɔɔr daŋ thel ? ciki bi loony e pulic kedhie ?

text: The disciple is not above his master : but every one that is perfect shall be as his master .
text2: Raan ŋoot ke piooce acii raan weet en e woor : ku raan ebɛn raan ci thok e weet abi thoŋ ke raan e weet en .

text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother ' s eye , but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye ?
text2: Ku eeŋo woi yin wɛɛl thiin nu e mɛnhkui nyin , ku cii tim diit nu e yinyin e tiŋ ?

text: Either how canst thou say to thy brother , Brother , let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye , when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye ? Thou hypocrite , cast out first the beam out of thine own eye , and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother ' s eye .
text2: Ku duɛɛre mɛnhkui yɔɔk adi , yan , Mɛnhkai , tɔ ya miite wɛlthiin nu e yinyin bei , ku yin guop yin cii timditt nu e yinyine woi ? Yin ee raan de yic aguk , kɔne tim diit nu e yinyine bɛɛi bei , na ele , ke yin bi daai egɔk , ke yin dueer wɛɛl thiin nu e mɛnhkui nyin dap bɛɛi bei .

text: For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit ; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit .
text2: Tim piɛth acie luɔk e mith rac ; ayi tim rac , acie luɔk e mith piɛth .

text: For every tree is known by his own fruit . For of thorns men do not gather figs , nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes .
text2: Tim ebɛn aye ŋic ne mɛnhdɛn ee yen luɔk . Kɔc aciki ŋaap e tet e kiir kɔu , ku aciki eenap e tet e peth kɔu .

text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good ; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil : for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh .
text2: Raan piɛth ee kepiɛth bɛɛi bei ne piath e yenpiɔu ; ku raan rac ee kerac bɛɛi bei ne kerɛɛc nu e yepiɔu : thok ee jam ne ke ci piɔu thiɔɔŋ nɔm .

text: And why call ye me , Lord , Lord , and do not the things which I say ?
text2: Ku eeŋo caal wek ɛn , yan , Bɛnydit , Bɛnydit , ku caki ka luɛɛl e looi ?

text: Whosoever cometh to me , and heareth my sayings , and doeth them , I will shew you to whom he is like :
text2: Raan ebɛn raan bɔ tede yɛn , ago welki piŋ , ku jɔ keek aa looi , we ba nyuoth raan kit kek ;

text: He is like a man which built an house , and digged deep , and laid the foundation on a rock : and when the flood arose , the stream beat vehemently upon that house , and could not shake it : for it was founded upon a rock .
text2: acit raan ci ɣot yik , ku jɔ keerkeer wec abi thuth , aci kuur lɔ yok : na wen , ke piny mol aret , go pieeu rot jap e ɣone kɔu , ku cii dueer tɔ lɔ nieŋnieŋ : luɔi ci keerkeerde wec e kuur nɔm .

text: But he that heareth , and doeth not , is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth ; against which the stream did beat vehemently , and immediately it fell ; and the ruin of that house was great .
text2: Ku raan e wel piŋ , ku cii keek e looi , yen acit raan e ɣot yik e tiɔp nɔm ke cin keerkeer ci wec ; go pieeu rot jap e ɣone kɔu , ku jɔ dap wiik enɔnthiine ; go ɣone riaak e riaak dit .

text: Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people , he entered into Capernaum .
text2: Na ɣɔn , aci welke thok e luɛl e kɔc yith kedhie , ke jɔ lɔ Kapernaum .

text: And a certain centurion ' s servant , who was dear unto him , was sick , and ready to die .
text2: Ku lim toŋ de bɛny de nɔm alathkeer kabɔt ade guop juai , akɔɔr thuɔɔu , ku ye lim nhiɛɛr bɛnyde .

text: And when he heard of Jesus , he sent unto him the elders of the Jews , beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant .
text2: Na wen , aci kede Yecu piŋ , ke toc roordit ke Judai , lek lɔŋ , an , bi bɛn bi limde bɛn tɔ dem .

text: And when they came to Jesus , they besought him instantly , saying , That he was worthy for whom he should do this :
text2: Goki bɛn te nu Yecu , bik ku laŋki aret , luelki , yan , Raane ee raan piɛth raan duɛɛre kony ne luɔiye :

text: For he loveth our nation , and he hath built us a synagogue .
text2: anhiaar jurda , ku aci wo yiek ɣon e Nhialic yenguop .

text: Then Jesus went with them . And when he was now not far from the house , the centurion sent friends to him , saying unto him , Lord , trouble not thyself : for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof :
text2: Go Yecu lɔ ke keek . Na wen , aci guɔ thiɔk ke ɣot , ke bɛny de nɔm alathkeer kabɔt ke jɔ mathke tuoc en , ku lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , du yiguop dak : yɛn cii piɛth luɔi bi yin lɔ ɣondi :

text: Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee : but say in a word , and my servant shall be healed .
text2: yen aa kɛn ɛn rot tɔ piɛth aya luɔi ban lɔ tede yin : jɔ jam lueel tei , ke mɛnhdi abi dem .

text: For I also am a man set under authority , having under me soldiers , and I say unto one , Go , and he goeth ; and to another , Come , and he cometh ; and to my servant , Do this , and he doeth it .
text2: Ku yɛn aya yɛn ee raan ci taau e bany cok , ku nu alathkeer e yacok ; na yɔɔk tok , yan , Lɔ , ka lɔ ; ku na yɔɔk daŋ , yan , Ba , ka bɔ ; ku na yɔɔk limdi , yan , Loi kene , ka looi .

text: When Jesus heard these things , he marvelled at him , and turned him about , and said unto the people that followed him , I say unto you , I have not found so great faith , no , not in Israel .
text2: Na wen , te ci Yecu kake piŋ , ke jɔ gai e yen , go rot puk , ku yook kut e kɔc kuany ecok , yan , Wek yɔɔk , yan , Gam diit cit ekene akɛn kɔn yok , acakaa Yithraelic .

text: And they that were sent , returning to the house , found the servant whole that had been sick .
text2: Na wen , te ci kɔc ci tooc keniim dhuony ɣot , ke ke jɔ lim wen tok yok ke ci guop pial .

text: And it came to pass the day after , that he went into a city called Nain ; and many of his disciples went with him , and much people .
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , ke jɔ lɔ panydiit cɔl Nain : ku cath kɔc juec ne yen , kɔckɛn e piooce , ku kut diit e kɔc .

text: Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city , behold , there was a dead man carried out , the only son of his mother , and she was a widow : and much people of the city was with her .
text2: Na wen , aci ɣet e kalthok e panydit di , ke jɔ rɔm ke raan ci thou a ket kɔc , leere roor , ku ye mɛnh tok ne man nɔm , ku man acin nɔm moc : ku cath kut e kɔc ke panydit ne yen .

text: And when the Lord saw her , he had compassion on her , and said unto her , Weep not .
text2: Te ci Bɛnydit e tiŋ , ke jɔ piɔu kok ke yen , ku yook , yan , Du dhiau .

text: And he came and touched the bier : and they that bare him stood still . And he said , Young man , I say unto thee , Arise .
text2: Go bɛn ku jiɛk ket : go kɔc ket raan goki kɔɔc . Go lueel , yan , Dhuŋe , yin yɔɔk , yan , Jɔt rot .

text: And he that was dead sat up , and began to speak . And he delivered him to his mother .
text2: Go raan wen ci thou ago yethar ɣany piny , ku gɔl jam . Go bɛ yinn man .

text: And there came a fear on all : and they glorified God , saying , That a great prophet is risen up among us ; and , That God hath visited his people .
text2: Go kɔc dɔm e riɔɔc kedhie : ku jɔki Nhialic leec , luelki , yan , Nebi dit aci tuol e woyiic ; ku , yan , Nhialic aci kɔcke bɛn neem .

text: And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judaea , and throughout all the region round about .
text2: Go jam de luɔi ci looiye go ɣet piny de Judaya ebɛn , ku bɛi nu e yekec .

text: And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things .
text2: Go kɔcpiooce Jɔn goki Jɔn lɛk kake kedhie .

text: And John calling unto him two of his disciples sent them to Jesus , saying , Art thou he that should come ? or look we for another ?
text2: Na wen , ke Jɔn jɔ kɔckɛn e piooce cɔɔl kaarou , ku jɔ ke tuoc Yecu , lek thieec , yan , Ye raan wen , an , bi bɛn ? ku de raan daŋ buk tiit ?

text: When the men were come unto him , they said , John Baptist hath sent us unto thee , saying , Art thou he that should come ? or look we for another ?
text2: Na wen , aci kɔc ɣet te nu yen , ke jɔki lueel , yan , Wok cii Jɔn Baptith tuoc yin , buk yin bɛn thieec , yan , Ye raan wen , an , bi bɛn ? ku de raan daŋ buk tiit ?

text: And in that same hour he cured many of their infirmities and plagues , and of evil spirits ; and unto many that were blind he gave sight .
text2: Ku ekool mane guop ke jɔ kɔc juec tɔ dem ne tɔɔkden ku ne ka ye ke cuil gup ku ne jɔɔk rac ci ke dɔm ; ku tɔ coor juec yien .

text: Then Jesus answering said unto them , Go your way , and tell John what things ye have seen and heard ; how that the blind see , the lame walk , the lepers are cleansed , the deaf hear , the dead are raised , to the poor the gospel is preached .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yook keek , yan , Laki , lɛkki Jɔn ka cak tiŋ ku ka cak piŋ ; coor acike tɔ yien , ŋol aciɛthki , kɔc cii wɛth dɔm acike tɔ waar , miŋ apiŋki , kɔc ci thou acike tɔ ɣɔɔr , kɔc kuany nyiin ayeke guieer welpiɛth .

text: And blessed is he , whosoever shall not be offended in me .
text2: Ku na de raan cii bi tɔ kɔth ne kedi , ka ci thieei .

text: And when the messengers of John were departed , he began to speak unto the people concerning John , What went ye out into the wilderness for to see ? A reed shaken with the wind ?
text2: Na wen , aci kɔc tuuce Jɔn jal , ke gɔl jam keke kut e kɔc ne kede Jɔn , yan , E we lɔ jɔɔric lak ŋo tiŋ ? ee aruoor nieŋe yom , yen a lak tiŋ ?

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A man clothed in soft raiment ? Behold , they which are gorgeously apparelled , and live delicately , are in kings ' courts .
text2: Ku e we lɔ biic lak ŋo tiŋ ? ee raan ceŋ lupɔ lɔ nip ? Tieŋki , kɔc ceŋ lupɔ ci lakelak , ku yek kak e mitemit cam , kek aye tɔu e ɣoot ke mahik yiic .

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A prophet ? Yea , I say unto you , and much more than a prophet .
text2: Ku e we lɔ biic lak ŋo tiŋ ? ee nebi ? Yeka , wek yɔɔk , yan , ee raan war nebi e kajuec aya .

text: This is he , of whom it is written , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Yen raan cii jam gɔɔr ne kede ki , yan , Tiŋ , yɛn tooc tunydi e yinɔm tueŋ , Raan bi kueerdu looiyic apiɛth e yinɔm tueŋ .

text: For I say unto you , Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist : but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he .
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Ne kɔc yiic kɔc ci dhieeth e diaar , acin nebi nu nebi diit war Jɔn Baptith ; ku raan koor cin naamde raan nu e ciɛɛŋ de Nhialicyic yen adit awar en .

text: And all the people that heard him , and the publicans , justified God , being baptized with the baptism of John .
text2: Go kɔc ci welke piŋ kedhie , ayi kɔc e atholbo tɔ kut , agoki piath e Nhialic piɔu leec , wen ci ke baptith e baptinh e Jɔn .

text: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves , being not baptized of him .
text2: Ku Parithai keke bany e kɔc wɛɛt e loŋ , ke ke jɔ jam nu e Nhialic piɔu ne keden rɛɛc , wen keneke baptith e baptinh e Jɔn .

text: And the Lord said , Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation ? and to what are they like ?
text2: Go Bɛnydit lueel , yan , Ba rem e ekoole jɔ thɔɔŋ ŋo ? ku citki ŋo ?

text: They are like unto children sitting in the marketplace , and calling one to another , and saying , We have piped unto you , and ye have not danced ; we have mourned to you , and ye have not wept .
text2: Acitki miththii rɛɛr e thuukic , ke ke ye rot cɔɔl , yan , Wo ci kaaŋ kuoth week , ku wek ken coŋ ; wo ci dhuoor e weniim , ku wek ken dhiau .

text: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine ; and ye say , He hath a devil .
text2: Jɔn Baptith aci bɛn ke cie cam e kuin ku cie dek e mɔu ; aguɔki lueel , yan , Ciɛth ke jɔŋ rac .

text: The Son of man is come eating and drinking ; and ye say , Behold a gluttonous man , and a winebibber , a friend of publicans and sinners !
text2: Wen e raan aci bɛn ke ye cam ku deh ; aguɔki lueel , yan , Tiŋ raane , ee mamith ku ye raan e dek e mɔu aret , ku ye mɛthe e kɔc e atholbo tɔ kut keke kɔc e kerac looi !

text: But wisdom is justified of all her children .
text2: Ku pɛlenɔm aye tɔ ye yic ne mithke kedhie .

text: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him . And he went into the Pharisee ' s house , and sat down to meat .
text2: Na wen , ke cɔɔl raan toŋ de Parithai , yan , bi cam ke ye . Ku jɔ lɔ ɣon e Parithai , le ku nyuuc ten ee kɔc cam .

text: And , behold , a woman in the city , which was a sinner , when she knew that Jesus sat at meat in the Pharisee ' s house , brought an alabaster box of ointment ,
text2: Ku ade tiiŋ nu panydit , tiiŋ rac ; na wen , aci piŋ nɔn reere Yecu ten ee kɔc cam ɣon e Parithai , ke bii gun e alabatha deyic miok ci tumetum ,

text: And stood at his feet behind him weeping , and began to wash his feet with tears , and did wipe them with the hairs of her head , and kissed his feet , and anointed them with the ointment .
text2: bi ku kɛɛc e yecok cieen ke dhiau , ku gɔl e wɛk ecok e piu ke nyin , ku jɔ ke weec e nhiim ke yenɔm , ku ciim cok , ku tɔc keek e miok ci tumetum .

text: Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw it , he spake within himself , saying , This man , if he were a prophet , would have known who and what manner of woman this is that toucheth him : for she is a sinner .
text2: Na wen , ke Parithai wen ci Yecu cɔɔl , te ci en e tiŋ , ke jɔ lueel e yepiɔu , yan , Raane , tee ye nebi , adi ci tiiŋe ŋic , tiiŋ e jak en , ku adi ci taude ŋic ; ee tiiŋ e kerac looi .

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , Simon , I have somewhat to say unto thee . And he saith , Master , say on .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yook , yan , Thimon , yɛn de ke lɛk yi . Go lueel , yan , Bɛny e weet , luel kedu .

text: There was a certain creditor which had two debtors : the one owed five hundred pence , and the other fifty .
text2: Go lueel , an , Ade raan nu raan ci kɔc dhɛɛn kaarou : ŋɛk aci dhɛn weu cit jinii kathieer , ku dhɛn ŋɛk ke cit jini tok tei .

text: And when they had nothing to pay , he frankly forgave them both . Tell me therefore , which of them will love him most ?
text2: Na wen , te cin kek weu bik bɛ cuol en , ke ke jɔ pɔl kaarou ne dhueeŋ . Jɔ lɛk ɛn , yan , Ne keek kaarou , eeŋa bi e nhiaar aret ?

text: Simon answered and said , I suppose that he , to whom he forgave most . And he said unto him , Thou hast rightly judged .
text2: Go Thimon bɛɛr , yan , Aya lueel , yan , Raan ci pal kajuec , en abi e nhiaar aret . Go yɔɔk , yan , Yin e loŋ tiiŋ nɔm .

text: And he turned to the woman , and said unto Simon , Seest thou this woman ? I entered into thine house , thou gavest me no water for my feet : but she hath washed my feet with tears , and wiped them with the hairs of her head .
text2: Go yenɔm wɛl tik , ku yook Thimon , yan , Ci tiiŋe tiŋ ? Yɛn e bɛn ɣondu , ku yin ken a gam piu waak ɛn ke yacok : ku tiiŋe aci a waak cok e piu ke nyin , ku weec keek e nhiim ke yenɔm .

text: Thou gavest me no kiss : but this woman since the time I came in hath not ceased to kiss my feet .
text2: Yin ken a ciim ; ku tiiŋe , gɔl te wen ba yɛn ɣot , aɣet ci enɔɔne aken a pɔl cok e ciem .

text: My head with oil thou didst not anoint : but this woman hath anointed my feet with ointment .
text2: Yin ken a tɔc nɔm e miok : ku tiiŋe aci a tɔc cok e miok ci tumetum .

text: Wherefore I say unto thee , Her sins , which are many , are forgiven ; for she loved much : but to whom little is forgiven , the same loveth little .
text2: Yen a lɛk ɛn e yin , yan , Karɛcke , ciɛk an , juecki , acike pal en ; nɔn ci en a nhiaar aret : ku raan ci pal kethiinakaŋ , nhieerde abi kuur tei .

text: And he said unto her , Thy sins are forgiven .
text2: Ku jɔ tik yɔɔk , yan , Karɛcku acike pɔl .

text: And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves , Who is this that forgiveth sins also ?
text2: Go kɔc rɛɛr e yen etok ten ee kɔc cam , agoki jam gɔl e kepiɔth , yan , Eeŋa eraane raan e karac pɔl aya ?

text: And he said to the woman , Thy faith hath saved thee ; go in peace .
text2: Go tik yɔɔk , yan , Gamdu aci yi kony ; lɔ tei , acin kerac .

text: And it came to pass afterward , that he went throughout every city and village , preaching and shewing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God : and the twelve were with him ,
text2: Na wen , aci kake thok , ke jɔ piny caath , ee lɔ panydiite ku le panyditte , ku le paane ku le paane , le kɔc aa wɛɛt ku guiir keek welpiɛth ke ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic : ku cath kɔc kathieer ku rou ne yen ,

text: And certain women , which had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities , Mary called Magdalene , out of whom went seven devils ,
text2: ayi dieer ci tɔ dem ne jɔɔk rɛc ci ke dɔm ayi juei , yi Mari cɔl Magdalene , tiiŋ cii jɔɔk rac kadherou bɛn bei e yeguop ,

text: And Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod ' s steward , and Susanna , and many others , which ministered unto him of their substance .
text2: ku Joana thŋ de Cudha raan e ka ke dhien e Kerod dot , ku Thuthana , ku dieer juec kɔk , dieer wen e ye kony ne weuken .

text: And when much people were gathered together , and were come to him out of every city , he spake by a parable :
text2: Na wen , aci kut ditt e kɔc gueer , ku kɔc kɔk aŋootki ke ke bɔ te nu yen e baaiyic ebɛn , ke jɔ jam ne kaaŋ : yan ,

text: A sower went out to sow his seed : and as he sowed , some fell by the way side ; and it was trodden down , and the fowls of the air devoured it .
text2: Raan e com e lɔ domic le kɔthke com : na wen , te cum en , ke kɔth kɔk ke ke loony piny e kueer kec ; goke dum e kɔc cok , ku cam diɛt nhial keek .

text: And some fell upon a rock ; and as soon as it was sprung up , it withered away , because it lacked moisture .
text2: Ku loony kɔk piny de kuur ; na wen , acik goŋ , ke ke dap biɔɔr , ne cien tiɔptiɔɔp e piny .

text: And some fell among thorns ; and the thorns sprang up with it , and choked it .
text2: Ku loony kɔk e kuɔɔth yiic ; na wen , ke kuɔɔth e ke jɔ cil ne keek etok , goki ke nyiɛɛc .

text: And other fell on good ground , and sprang up , and bare fruit an hundredfold . And when he had said these things , he cried , He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Ku loony kɔk e tiɔm piɛthic , agoki cil , ku lokki , nyin tok abi bɔt bɛɛi . Te ci en ekake lueel , ke jɔ coot , yan , Raan de yith ee yen ke piŋ , ke piŋ .

text: And his disciples asked him , saying , What might this parable be ?
text2: Go kɔckɛn e piooce thieec , yan , Kaaŋe enɔɔne , tharde akou ?

text: And he said , Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God : but to others in parables ; that seeing they might not see , and hearing they might not understand .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Aci gam week ke we bi jam ci thiaan ŋic , jam de ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic : kɔc kɔk ayeke wɛɛt e kɛŋ ; luɔi bi kek aa daai , ku ciki e daai apiɛth , ku luoi bi kek aa piŋ , ku ciki kaŋ e yok yiic .

text: Now the parable is this : The seed is the word of God .
text2: Kaaŋ thar ki : Kɔth kek aye jam e Nhialic .

text: Those by the way side are they that hear ; then cometh the devil , and taketh away the word out of their hearts , lest they should believe and be saved .
text2: Ka nu e kueer kec kek aye kɔc e jam piŋ ; na ele ke jɔŋditt rac bɔ , bi ku jɔt jam e kepiɔth , ke ke cii bi gam agoke kony wei .

text: They on the rock are they , which , when they hear , receive the word with joy ; and these have no root , which for a while believe , and in time of temptation fall away .
text2: Ku ka nu piny de kuur , ayek kɔc e jam piŋ , ku dɔmki ne piɔnmit : ku acinki mei , agoki gam tethiinakaŋ , ku bik rot dak cieen ekool theme ke .

text: And that which fell among thorns are they , which , when they have heard , go forth , and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of this life , and bring no fruit to perfection .
text2: Ku ka ci loony e kuɔɔth yiic ayek kɔc e jam piŋ , ku jɔki lɔ , agoke nyiɛɛc ne diɛɛr ee kek dieer e kaŋ ku bany ci kek bany ku kamit yek kɔɔr ka ke piire , ku ciki e luɔk apiɛth .

text: But that on the good ground are they , which in an honest and good heart , having heard the word , keep it , and bring forth fruit with patience .
text2: Ku ka nu e tiɔm piɛthic ayek kɔc ci jam piŋ , ku jɔki muk ne piɔn yic ku piɛth , agoki luɔk ne rum ee kek kepiɔth rom .

text: No man , when he hath lighted a candle , covereth it with a vessel , or putteth it under a bed ; but setteth it on a candlestick , that they which enter in may see the light .
text2: Acin raan e manyealath kooth , ku jɔ kuom nɔm piny e tony , ku tɛɛu e laŋarep thar aya ; aye taau e kedaŋ nɔm , ke kɔc bɔ ɣot ke ke bi mac tiŋ .

text: For nothing is secret , that shall not be made manifest ; neither any thing hid , that shall not be known and come abroad .
text2: Acin ke ci thiaan , ke cii bi tic ; ku acin ke ci moony , ke cii bi ŋic , ago tic e kɔc niim .

text: Take heed therefore how ye hear : for whosoever hath , to him shall be given ; and whosoever hath not , from him shall be taken even that which he seemeth to have .
text2: Yak rot tht ne piŋ aa wek piŋ : raan de nɔm kaŋ , abi bɛ miɔɔc ; ku raan cin nɔm kaŋ , acakaa ke ye tɔ ye kede abi noom tede ye .

text: Then came to him his mother and his brethren , and could not come at him for the press .
text2: Na wen , ke man bɔ tede yen keke mithekɔcken , ku cin te bi kek ɣeet te nu yen ne baŋ de kut e kɔc .

text: And it was told him by certain which said , Thy mother and thy brethren stand without , desiring to see thee .
text2: Ku aci lɛk en , yan , Moor ka kaac biice keke mithekɔckun , akɔɔrki yin .

text: And he answered and said unto them , My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God , and do it .
text2: Go pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Kɔcke kɔc e jam e Nhialic piŋ , ku loiki , kek aye maar ku yek mithekɔckuɔ .

text: Now it came to pass on a certain day , that he went into a ship with his disciples : and he said unto them , Let us go over unto the other side of the lake . And they launched forth .
text2: Na wen , ekool tok e akoolke yiic , ke lɔ e abelic keke kɔckɛn e piooce , ku jɔ keek yɔɔk , yan , Bak teemku lɔɔk . Agoki abel lony .

text: But as they sailed he fell asleep : and there came down a storm of wind on the lake ; and they were filled with water , and were in jeopardy .
text2: Na wen , aciɛthki e abelic , ke jɔ nhi : ku jɔ amaŋ rot tuk e baaric , arek abi abel duɛɛr thiaŋ , abik duɛɛr diir .

text: And they came to him , and awoke him , saying , Master , master , we perish . Then he arose , and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water : and they ceased , and there was a calm .
text2: Ku jɔki bɛn tede yen , bik ku packi , yan , Bɛny , wok thou . Go rot jɔt , ku nen yom ku athiakthiak de piu ; agoki kɔɔc , ku lɔ wɛɛr diu .

text: And he said unto them , Where is your faith ? And they being afraid wondered , saying one to another , What manner of man is this ! for he commandeth even the winds and water , and they obey him .
text2: Go ke thieec , yan , Nu gamdun tenou ? Agoki riɔɔc , ku gɛiki , ku jɔki lueel kapac , yan , Ee raan cit ŋo ekene ? raan ee yi yom yɔɔk ayi piu , agoki kede piŋ ?

text: And they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes , which is over against Galilee .
text2: Agoki ɣet paan e Gadarai , tuoom nɔm keke Galili .

text: And when he went forth to land , there met him out of the city a certain man , which had devils long time , and ware no clothes , neither abode in any house , but in the tombs .
text2: Na wen , aci bɛn biic e abelic , ke ram ke raan toŋ bɔ bei e panyditic , raan de guop jɔɔk rac ecaŋɣɔn , ku acin lupɔ ee cieŋ , ku cie reer ɣoot , ku ye reer e rɛɛŋ yiic .

text: When he saw Jesus , he cried out , and fell down before him , and with a loud voice said , What have I to do with thee , Jesus , thou Son of God most high ? I beseech thee , torment me not .
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu tiŋ , ke jɔ coot , ku cuɛt rot piny e yenɔm , ku jɔ lueel e rol dit , yan , Eeŋoda ne yin , Yecu , Wen e Nhialic Awarjaŋ ? Yin laŋ , du ya leŋ wei .

text: ( For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man . For oftentimes it had caught him : and he was kept bound with chains and in fetters ; and he brake the bands , and was driven of the devil into the wilderness . )
text2: Aci jɔŋ rac kɔn yɔɔk , an , Ba bei e raan guop . Aa ye cool e dɔm en e : go aa rek e kuɛɛt ku joth , ku jɔ aa tiit ; ku jɔ kake ye mac aa dhoŋ , ku ye jɔŋ rac kuaath roor .

text: And Jesus asked him , saying , What is thy name ? And he said , Legion : because many devils were entered into him .
text2: Go Yecu thieec , yan , Cɔl yin ŋa ? Go lueel , yan , Remdit ; luɔi ci jɔɔk juec lɔ e yeguop .

text: And they besought him that he would not command them to go out into the deep .
text2: Goki lɔŋ , an , Du wo cieec tethuth aloŋloŋ .

text: And there was there an herd of many swine feeding on the mountain : and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into them . And he suffered them .
text2: Ku ade lunydiit e kudhuur etɛɛn , ke ke nyuath e kuurdit nɔm : goki lɔŋ , an , bi ke pal lɔ e keyiic . Go ke pɔl .

text: Then went the devils out of the man , and entered into the swine : and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake , and were choked .
text2: Go jɔɔk rac bɛn bei e raan guop , bik ku lek e kudhuur gup : go luny ebɛn lɔ piny e ke riŋ aret lek te lɔ luooŋlaŋ e baaric , ku jɔki mou .

text: When they that fed them saw what was done , they fled , and went and told it in the city and in the country .
text2: Na wen , aci tiit ke ci looi tiŋ , ke ke jɔ kat , lek lɛk kɔc e panyditic ayi rɛɛr .

text: Then they went out to see what was done ; and came to Jesus , and found the man , out of whom the devils were departed , sitting at the feet of Jesus , clothed , and in his right mind : and they were afraid .
text2: Go kɔc lɔ biic lek ke ci looi tiŋ ; goki bɛn te nu Yecu , ku yokki raan wen ci jɔɔk rac jal e yeguop , arɛɛr e Yecu cok , ke ceŋ lupɔ , aci nɔm piath ; agoki riɔɔc .

text: They also which saw it told them by what means he that was possessed of the devils was healed .
text2: Go kɔc wen ci e tiŋ , goki keek guieer luɔi ci raan tɔ dem raan wen cii jɔɔk rac dɔm .

text: Then the whole multitude of the country of the Gadarenes round about besought him to depart from them ; for they were taken with great fear : and he went up into the ship , and returned back again .
text2: Na wen , ke kut e kɔc ebɛn kɔc ke piny e Gadarai , piny thiaak keke tɛɛn , ke jɔki lɔŋ , an , bi jal pinyden ; aci riɔɔc dit ke dɔm : go lɔ e abelic , ku jɔ enɔm puk .

text: Now the man out of whom the devils were departed besought him that he might be with him : but Jesus sent him away , saying ,
text2: Go raan wen ci jɔɔk rac jal e yeguop go lɔŋ , an , bi tɔu ke yen ;

text: Return to thine own house , and shew how great things God hath done unto thee . And he went his way , and published throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done unto him .
text2: go Yecu tɔ jel , yan , Dhuonye yinɔm paandu , ke jɔ kɔc guieer kadit cii Nhialic luoi yin . Go jal , ku jɔ lɔ le guieer kɔc e panyditic ebɛn kadit cii Yecu luoi yen .

text: And it came to pass , that , when Jesus was returned , the people gladly received him : for they were all waiting for him .
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu enɔm dhuny , ke jɔ loor e kɔc ; aa tiit kɔc kedhie .

text: And , behold , there came a man named Jairus , and he was a ruler of the synagogue : and he fell down at Jesus ' feet , and besought him that he would come into his house :
text2: Na wen , ke raan bɔ raan cɔl Jairo , ku ye bɛny e ɣon e Nhialic : ku jɔ rot cuat piny e Yecu cok , ago lɔŋ , an , bi bɛn ɣonde ;

text: For he had one only daughter , about twelve years of age , and she lay a dying . But as he went the people thronged him .
text2: ade nɔm nyan tok tei , runke acitki thieer ku rou , ku adhɔt piny ke kɔɔr thuɔɔu . Go lɔ , ku jɔ giŋ e kut e kɔc .

text: And a woman having an issue of blood twelve years , which had spent all her living upon physicians , neither could be healed of any ,
text2: Ku tik anu , tiiŋ e cool e kueer e riɛm e run kathieer ku rou , ku aci weuke thol kedhie riɔp en akiim , ku acin akim toŋ ci e leu ,

text: Came behind him , and touched the border of his garment : and immediately her issue of blood stanched .
text2: na wen , ke bɔ e yekɔu cieen , bi ku jiɛk lupɔde thok : go riɛm a ŋeu enɔnthiine .

text: And Jesus said , Who touched me ? When all denied , Peter and they that were with him said , Master , the multitude throng thee and press thee , and sayest thou , Who touched me ?
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Eeŋa e jak ɛn ? Go kɔc jai kedhie , go Petero ku kɔc cath ne yen lueel , yan , Bɛny , yin giŋ kut e kɔc ku thanyki yin , ku ba jɔ lueel , yan , Eeŋa e jak ɛn ?

text: And Jesus said , Somebody hath touched me : for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , an , Ade raan toŋ ci a jak : aŋiɛc nɔn ci riɛl bɛn bei e yaguop .

text: And when the woman saw that she was not hid , she came trembling , and falling down before him , she declared unto him before all the people for what cause she had touched him and how she was healed immediately .
text2: Na wen , aci tik e tiŋ nɔn cii en dueer mɔɔny , ke jɔ bɛn ke lɛthe , bi ku cuɛt rot piny e yenɔm , go lɛk en e kɔc niim kedhie yen ke jiɛk en en , ku dem ci en dem enɔnthiine .

text: And he said unto her , Daughter , be of good comfort : thy faith hath made thee whole ; go in peace .
text2: Go yɔɔk , yan , Nyane , rit rot : gamdu aci yi tɔ dem ; lɔ tei , acin kerac .

text: While he yet spake , there cometh one from the ruler of the synagogue ' s house , saying to him , Thy daughter is dead ; trouble not the Master .
text2: Te ŋoot en ke jam , ke raan bɔ paan e bɛny e ɣon e Nhialic , bi ku yook , yan , Nyandu e thou ; du Bɛny e weet be jut .

text: But when Jesus heard it , he answered him , saying , Fear not : believe only , and she shall be made whole .
text2: Go Yecu piŋ , ku jɔ bɛɛr , yan , Du riɔc : gam tei , abi guop pial .

text: And when he came into the house , he suffered no man to go in , save Peter , and James , and John , and the father and the mother of the maiden .
text2: Na wen , aci bɛn ɣot , ke cin raan pɛl lɔ ɣot , ee Petero , ku Jakop , ku Jɔn , ku wun duet ku man , keek kapac .

text: And all wept , and bewailed her : but he said , Weep not ; she is not dead , but sleepeth .
text2: Kɔc aake dhiau kedhie , dhieuki meth ; ku jɔ lueel , yan , Duoki dhiau ; aken thou , anin tei .

text: And they laughed him to scorn , knowing that she was dead .
text2: Goki dɔl guop , aŋicki nɔn ci en thou .

text: And he put them all out , and took her by the hand , and called , saying , Maid , arise .
text2: Go ke ciɛɛc biic kedhie , ku jɔ duet dɔm cin , ku coot , yan , Nyanthiine , jɔ paac .

text: And her spirit came again , and she arose straightway : and he commanded to give her meat .
text2: Go weike keniim bɛ puk , ku jɔ rot jɔt enɔnthiine : go ke yɔɔk , an , bik miɔɔc e kecam .

text: And her parents were astonished : but he charged them that they should tell no man what was done .
text2: Go yi wun gai keke man : ku jɔ ke lom thook , ke ke cii ke ci tic bi lɛk raan daŋ .

text: Then he called his twelve disciples together , and gave them power and authority over all devils , and to cure diseases .
text2: Go kɔc kathieer ku rou cɔɔl , ku gɛm keek riɛl bi kek jɔɔk rac cieŋ kedhie , ku tɔki juai waar .

text: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God , and to heal the sick .
text2: Go ke tooc lek kɔc aa guieer ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic , ku tɔki kɔc tok dem .

text: And he said unto them , Take nothing for your journey , neither staves , nor scrip , neither bread , neither money ; neither have two coats apiece .
text2: Ku yook keek , yan , Duoki ka ke kueeric muk , acin thieec , ayi athep , ayi kuin , ayi weu ; ku duoki aluluut leer kaarou .

text: And whatsoever house ye enter into , there abide , and thence depart .
text2: Ku ɣon ba we lɔ thin , jaki reer thin , ku bak jal etɛɛn .

text: And whosoever will not receive you , when ye go out of that city , shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them .
text2: Ku na de kɔc reec week nyuooc , te jal wek paanden , ke we teŋ abui wei e wecok , abi aa caatɔ bi dɛ ater ke keek .

text: And they departed , and went through the towns , preaching the gospel , and healing every where .
text2: Goki jal , ku jɔki bɛi caath yiic , ke ke guiir welpiɛth , ku tɔki kɔc dem e baaiyic ebɛn .

text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him : and he was perplexed , because that it was said of some , that John was risen from the dead ;
text2: Na wen , ke Kerod tetararki ke jɔ ke ci looi piŋ ebɛn ; go gai aret , ne ke ci lueel e kɔc kɔk , yan , ci Jɔn rot jɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic ;

text: And of some , that Elias had appeared ; and of others , that one of the old prophets was risen again .
text2: ku lueel kɔc kɔk , yan , ci Elija tuol ; ku ne kɔk , yan , ci raan toŋ de nebii thɛɛr rot bɛ jɔt .

text: And Herod said , John have I beheaded : but who is this , of whom I hear such things ? And he desired to see him .
text2: Go Kerod lueel , yan , Jɔn aca kiɛp nɔm wei ; ku eeŋa eraane , raan can ka cit ekake piŋ ne kede ? Ku ade piɔu luɔi bi en e tiŋ .

text: And the apostles , when they were returned , told him all that they had done . And he took them , and went aside privately into a desert place belonging to the city called Bethsaida .
text2: Na wen , aci kɔc ci tooc keniim puk , ke jɔki guieer ka cik looi . Go ke lɛɛr , ku jɔ rot wuony te cin kɔc e jɔɔric jɔɔr e panydiit cɔl Bethaida .

text: And the people , when they knew it , followed him : and he received them , and spake unto them of the kingdom of God , and healed them that had need of healing .
text2: Na wen , aci kut e kɔc e ŋic , ke jɔki biɔɔth cok : go keek loor , ku jɔ keek guieer ka ke ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic , ku tɔ kɔc dem kɔc de ke nu e kegup .

text: And when the day began to wear away , then came the twelve , and said unto him , Send the multitude away , that they may go into the towns and country round about , and lodge , and get victuals : for we are here in a desert place .
text2: Go akɔl rot puk ; ku jɔ kɔc kathieer ku rou bɛn , bik ku luelki , yan , Tɔ kut e kɔc jel , bik lɔ e wuot yiic ku bɛi yiic tethiɔk , lek te tɔɔc kek kɔɔr , ayi kecam : piny tɔu wok thin ee jɔɔric tei .

text: But he said unto them , Give ye them to eat . And they said , We have no more but five loaves and two fishes ; except we should go and buy meat for all this people .
text2: Go keek yɔɔk , yan , Week , miacki keek e kecamki . Goki lueel , yan , Acin ke cath ke wook , ee kuiin ci pam kadhic tei , ku rec kaarou ; wu , buk lɔ , buk kecam lɔ ɣɔc kɔcke kedhie ?

text: For they were about five thousand men . And he said to his disciples , Make them sit down by fifties in a company .
text2: Aake cit agum kadhiny e roor . Go kɔckɛn e piooce yɔɔk , yan , Taki ke nyuc e bniuuk , bniuŋ tok ee thierdhic , ku buluŋ tok ee thierdhic .

text: And they did so , and made them all sit down .
text2: Goki looi aya , tɔki ke nyuc kedhie .

text: Then he took the five loaves and the two fishes , and looking up to heaven , he blessed them , and brake , and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude .
text2: Na wen , ke kuany kuiin ci pam kadhic ku rec kaarou , ku jɔ tenhial iieec , go ke thieei , ku wɛk keyiic , gɛm ke kɔcpiooce , bik ke lɔ taau e kut e kɔc niim .

text: And they did eat , and were all filled : and there was taken up of fragments that remained to them twelve baskets .
text2: Goki cam , abik kuɛth kedhie : ku jɔki ka lɔ thueithuei kuany e dioony yiic dioony kathieer ku rou ne ka ci both .

text: And it came to pass , as he was alone praying , his disciples were with him : and he asked them , saying , Whom say the people that I am ?
text2: Na wen , ke laŋ etok , ku tɔu kɔckɛn e piooce ne yen : go ke thieec , yan , Ye kɔc ɛn tɔ ye ŋa ?

text: They answering said , John the Baptist ; but some say , Elias ; and others say , that one of the old prophets is risen again .
text2: Goki bɛɛr , yan , Jɔn Baptith ; ku lueel kɔk , yan , Elija ; ku ne kɔk , yan , ee raan toŋ de nebii thɛɛr en ci rot bɛ jɔt .

text: He said unto them , But whom say ye that I am ? Peter answering said , The Christ of God .
text2: Go keek thieec , yan , Na week , yak a tɔ ye ŋa ? Go Petero bɛɛr , yan , Yin ee Kritho de Nhialic .

text: And he straitly charged them , and commanded them to tell no man that thing ;
text2: Go ke lom thook , ku yook keek aret , yan , E cin raan lɛkki ekene :

text: Saying , The Son of man must suffer many things , and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes , and be slain , and be raised the third day .
text2: ku lueel , yan , Wen e raan abi kajuec dhil guum , ku abii roordit rɛɛc , ku banydit ke ka ke Nhialic , ku kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr , ku abi nɔk , ku be rot jɔt ekool ee kek diak .

text: And he said to them all , If any man will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross daily , and follow me .
text2: Go keek yɔɔk kedhie , yan , Na de raan de piɔu luɔi bi en a kuany cok , e ye rot nyɔŋ , ku ye timdɛn ci riiu nɔm jɔt e akooinyiin , ku kuɛny acok .

text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it : but whosoever will lose his life for my sake , the same shall save it .
text2: Raan kɔɔr luɔi bi en weike kony , ka bi ke moor ; ku raan mar weike ne biakdi , yen abi weike kony .

text: For what is a man advantaged , if he gain the whole world , and lose himself , or be cast away ?
text2: Te ciɛme raan piny nɔm ebɛn , ku mɛɛr rot , ku nɔn tɔ yen rot riaak , ee piathou bi yok thin ?

text: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words , of him shall the Son of man be ashamed , when he shall come in his own glory , and in his Father ' s , and of the holy angels .
text2: Raan ci guop riɔɔc ne biakdi ku ne biak de welki , raane abi Wen e raan guop riɔɔc ne biakde , te bi yen ke dhueeŋ de yenguop , ku dhueeŋ de wun , ku dhueeŋ de tuucnhial ɣerpiɔth .

text: But I tell you of a truth , there be some standing here , which shall not taste of death , till they see the kingdom of God .
text2: Ku wek lɛk yic , yan , Ade kɔc kaac etene , kɔc cii thuɔɔu bi thieep , te ŋoot kek ke ke ken ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic kɔn tiŋ .

text: And it came to pass about an eight days after these sayings , he took Peter and John and James , and went up into a mountain to pray .
text2: Na wen , aci welke thok te cit nin kabɛt , ke jɔ Petero noom , ku Jɔn ku Jakop , go lɔ e kuurdit nɔm , le lɔŋ .

text: And as he prayed , the fashion of his countenance was altered , and his raiment was white and glistering .
text2: Ku te ŋoot en ke laŋ , ke tau de yenyin puk rot , go lupɔde jɔ ɣɛɛr abi lɔ bilbil .

text: And , behold , there talked with him two men , which were Moses and Elias :
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc kaarou e ke jam ne yen , ke yi Mothe keke Elija :

text: Who appeared in glory , and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem .
text2: acik tuol ne dhueeŋ , ke ke jam ne kede jal bi en jal e piny nɔm e Jeruthalem .

text: But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep : and when they were awake , they saw his glory , and the two men that stood with him .
text2: Ku Petero keke kɔc cath ne yen aci nhi ke nɔk : na wen , acik guɔ paac , ke ke jɔ dhueeŋde tiŋ , ku tiŋki kɔc kaarou ke ke kaac ne yen .

text: And it came to pass , as they departed from him , Peter said unto Jesus , Master , it is good for us to be here : and let us make three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Moses , and one for Elias : not knowing what he said .
text2: Na wen , ajel kɔc e yelɔɔm , ke Petero yook Yecu , yan , Bɛny , tau tɔu wok ene en apiɛth : jɔku kɛɛt looi kadiak , ee tok kedu , ku ee tok kede Mothe ku ee tok kede Elija : akuc ke lueel .

text: While he thus spake , there came a cloud , and overshadowed them : and they feared as they entered into the cloud .
text2: Te ŋoot en ke jam , ke luat bɔ , kum ke piny : goki riɔɔc te le kek e luatic .

text: And there came a voice out of the cloud , saying , This is my beloved Son : hear him .
text2: Ku bɔ rol bei e luatic , yan , Wendien nhiaar ki ; yak kake piŋ !

text: And when the voice was past , Jesus was found alone . And they kept it close , and told no man in those days any of those things which they had seen .
text2: Te ci rol mim , ke ke jɔ Yecu yok etok . Goki lɔ ku mimki , ku cin ke cik lɛk raan daŋ e akoolke ne ka wen cik tiŋ .

text: And it came to pass , that on the next day , when they were come down from the hill , much people met him .
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , acik bɛn piny e kuurdit nɔm , ke jɔ rɔm ke kut diit e kɔc .

text: And , behold , a man of the company cried out , saying , Master , I beseech thee , look upon my son : for he is mine only child .
text2: Na wen , ke raan toŋ e kut e kɔc yiic cot , yan , Bɛny , yin laŋ , woi wendi : ee mɛnhdien tok :

text: And , lo , a spirit taketh him , and he suddenly crieth out ; and it teareth him that he foameth again , and bruising him hardly departeth from him .
text2: ku tiŋ , aye jɔk dɔm , go dap rol ethiau ; aye tɔ lɔ juɔklaŋ , abi ayok gut e yethok , ku acie dap pɔl , aye kɔn bɔɔt guop .

text: And I besought thy disciples to cast him out ; and they could not .
text2: Aguɔ kɔckuon e piooce lɔŋ , an , bik cieec biic ; agoki cuo leu .

text: And Jesus answering said , O faithless and perverse generation , how long shall I be with you , and suffer you ? Bring thy son hither .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Rem reec gam oou , rem e loŋ yalic oou , ba reer e weyiic e run kadi , ku ba kakun guum e run kadi ? bɛɛiye wendu etene .

text: And as he was yet a coming , the devil threw him down , and tare him . And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit , and healed the child , and delivered him again to his father .
text2: Na wen , te ŋoot en ke bɔ , ke wite jɔŋ rac piny , ku tɔ lɔ juɔklaŋ aret . Go Yecu jɔŋ rac jɔɔny , ku tɔ meth waar , ku jɔ bɛ yien wun .

text: And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God . But while they wondered every one at all things which Jesus did , he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Goki gai aret kedhie ne riɛl diit gok e Nhialic . Na wen , te ŋoot kek ke ke gai kedhie ne kerieec cii Yecu looi , ke jɔ kɔckɛn e piooce yɔɔk , yan ,

text: Let these sayings sink down into your ears : for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men .
text2: Taki welke loony e weyith ya : Wen e raan e thiɔk ke luɔi bi e taau e kɔc cin .

text: But they understood not this saying , and it was hid from them , that they perceived it not : and they feared to ask him of that saying .
text2: Ku akenki jame gith thar , aci mɔny keek , ke ciki bi yokic : ku acik riɔɔc ne lop bi kek e luɔp e jame .

text: Then there arose a reasoning among them , which of them should be greatest .
text2: Na wen , ke ater cak rot e keyiic , yan , ee raanou bi lɔ tueŋ e keyiic .

text: And Jesus , perceiving the thought of their heart , took a child , and set him by him ,
text2: Go Yecu ke cik tak e kapiɔth ŋic , go mɛnhthiinakaŋ noom , ku tɛɛu e yelɔɔm ,

text: And said unto them , Whosoever shall receive this child in my name receiveth me : and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me : for he that is least among you all , the same shall be great .
text2: go ke yɔɔk , yan , Raan bi mɛnhthiine dɔm ne rinki , ka ye yɛn e dɔm : ku raan bi a dɔm , ka ye Raan e toc ɛn , yen e dɔm ; ku raan koor e weyiic wedhie , yen abi dit .

text: And John answered and said , Master , we saw one casting out devils in thy name ; and we forbad him , because he followeth not with us .
text2: Go Jɔn bɛɛr ku lueel , yan , Bɛny , wo e raan tiŋ ke ciec jɔɔk rac ne rinku ; agoku peen , luɔi cii en e cath ke wook .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Forbid him not : for he that is not against us is for us .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Du pen : raan cin ater ke wook , yen aye mat ke wook .

text: And it came to pass , when the time was come that he should be received up , he stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem ,
text2: Na ɣɔn , aci nin thiɔk nin ke leer bi ye lɛɛr nhial , ke jɔ enɔm wɛl te lɔ Jeruthalem , an , bi dhil lɔ ,

text: And sent messengers before his face : and they went , and entered into a village of the Samaritans , to make ready for him .
text2: ku tooc tuuc bik lɔ e yenɔm tueŋ ; goki jal , lek paan toŋ e Thamaria , lek kede guik .

text: And they did not receive him , because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem .
text2: Na wen , ke reecki nyuooc , luɔi de en nyin lɔ Jeruthalem .

text: And when his disciples James and John saw this , they said , Lord , wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven , and consume them , even as Elias did ?
text2: Na wen , aci kɔckɛn e piooce yi Jakop ku Jɔn e tiŋ , ke jɔki lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , de yi piɔu luɔi bi wo mac cɔɔl piny tenhial , cit man ci Elija e looi aya ?

text: But he turned , and rebuked them , and said , Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of .
text2: Go rot puk , jieeny keek , yan , Wek kuc wei cath ke week nɔn ee kek wei cit ŋo .

text: For the Son of man is not come to destroy men ' s lives , but to save them . And they went to another village .
text2: Wen e raan aa cii bɔ bi kɔc bɛn riɔɔk wei , ee kunydewei en e bi yen . Goki lɔ paan daŋ .

text: And it came to pass , that , as they went in the way , a certain man said unto him , Lord , I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest .
text2: Na wen , aciɛthki kueer , ke lueel raan tok , yan , Bɛnydit , yin ba kuany cok te de en te le yin thin .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Foxes have holes , and birds of the air have nests ; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Awaan adeki ɣootkɛn ci wec piny , ku diɛt nhial adeki ɣoot , ku Wen e raan acin te kɛn en enɔm .

text: And he said unto another , Follow me . But he said , Lord , suffer me first to go and bury my father .
text2: Go lɛk raan daŋ , yan , Kuany acok . Go lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , pal ɛn e ya kɔn lɔ la waar thiɔk .

text: Jesus said unto him , Let the dead bury their dead : but go thou and preach the kingdom of God .
text2: Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Pal kɔc ci thou e ke thiak kɔckɛn ci thou : ku yin lɔ , guieere kɔc ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic .

text: And another also said , Lord , I will follow thee ; but let me first go bid them farewell , which are at home at my house .
text2: Ku lueel raan daŋ aya , yan , Bɛnydit , yin ba kuany cok ; ku pal ɛn e ya kɔn lɔ la kɔc nu paanda tɔɔŋ .

text: And Jesus said unto him , No man , having put his hand to the plough , and looking back , is fit for the kingdom of God .
text2: Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Raan e puur dɔm e yeciin , ku be cieen lieec , acii roŋ ke ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic .

text: After these things the Lord appointed other seventy also , and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place , whither he himself would come .
text2: Na wen , aci kake thok , ke Bɛnydit jɔ kɔc kɔk kathierdherou cɔɔl aya , ku tɔɔc keek rene kapac ku rene kapac , bik lɔ panydit ebɛn ku baai ebɛn , te bi en dap bɛn thin .

text: Therefore said he unto them , The harvest truly is great , but the labourers are few : pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest , that he would send forth labourers into his harvest .
text2: Go keek yɔɔk , yan , Ka ci luɔk ajuecki , ku kɔc e luui aliki . Yen aa wek Bɛnydit e ka ci luɔk lɔŋ , yan , bi kɔc e luui tuɔɔc domdɛn ci luɔk .

text: Go your ways : behold , I send you forth as lambs among wolves .
text2: Laki tei : tieŋki , wek tuɔɔc cit man ee amithook lɔ e aŋuooth yiic .

text: Carry neither purse , nor scrip , nor shoes : and salute no man by the way .
text2: Duoki kiith e weu muk , ayi athep , ayi war : ku duoki raan daŋ e thieec kueer .

text: And into whatsoever house ye enter , first say , Peace be to this house .
text2: Ku ɣon ba wek lɔ thin , ke jaki kɔn lueel , yan , E mat tɔu ke ɣone .

text: And if the son of peace be there , your peace shall rest upon it : if not , it shall turn to you again .
text2: Ku na nu raan nhiaar mat thin , ke mandun abi reer ke yen : ku na liu , ka bi rot pɔk week .

text: And in the same house remain , eating and drinking such things as they give : for the labourer is worthy of his hire . Go not from house to house .
text2: Ku jaki cool e ɣone guop , ke we ye cam ku dɛkki ne ka bi yien week : raan e luui ee roŋ ke ariopde . Duoki ɣoot wil .

text: And into whatsoever city ye enter , and they receive you , eat such things as are set before you :
text2: Ku panyditt la wek thin , ku tɔ kɔc week e kamaan , ke we ye ka ci taau e weniim cam :

text: And heal the sick that are therein , and say unto them , The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you .
text2: ku taki kɔc tok dem kɔc nu thin , ku yɔɔkki keek , yan , Ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic aci ɣeet tethiɔk ke week .

text: But into whatsoever city ye enter , and they receive you not , go your ways out into the streets of the same , and say ,
text2: Ku panydiit la wek thin , ku cii kɔc we tɔ ye kamaan , ke we jɔ lɔ biic e ciɛɛr ke paane yiic , ku luɛlki , yan ,

text: Even the very dust of your city , which cleaveth on us , we do wipe off against you : notwithstanding be ye sure of this , that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you .
text2: Ayi tɔɔr e panyduondit tɔɔr wen ci nuɛt e wogup , yen a weecku wei , jany jieeny wok week ka ! Ku jaki kene ŋic , yan , Ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic aci ɣeet tethiɔk ke week .

text: But I say unto you , that it shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom , than for that city .
text2: Ku week yɔɔk , yan , Ketuc bii Thɔdom yok acii bi kit keke ketuc bii panydiite yok ekoole .

text: Woe unto thee , Chorazin ! woe unto thee , Bethsaida ! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon , which have been done in you , they had a great while ago repented , sitting in sackcloth and ashes .
text2: Amawoou ne yin , Koradhin ! Amawoou ne yin , Bethaida ! tee kadit ril ci looi e Turo ku Thidon cit man ci ke looi e weyiic , adi cik kepiɔth puk ɣɔn thɛɛr , ke ke ceŋ cuɛl ku yek reer e aropic .

text: But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment , than for you .
text2: Ku ketuc bii Turo ku Thidon yok acii bi kit keke ketuc bak yok .

text: And thou , Capernaum , which art exalted to heaven , shalt be thrust down to hell .
text2: Ku yin Kapernaum , yin ci jat nhial aɣet paannhial , yin bi bɛɛi piny aɣet paan e kɔc ci thou .

text: He that heareth you heareth me ; and he that despiseth you despiseth me ; and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me .
text2: Raan piŋ kedun , ke piŋ kedi ; ku raan reec week , ke reec ɛn ; ku raan reec ɛn , ke reec raan e toc ɛn .

text: And the seventy returned again with joy , saying , Lord , even the devils are subject unto us through thy name .
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc kathierdherou ke ke jɔ keniim dhuny , ke ke mit piɔth , ku jɔki lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , aɣɔl jɔɔk rac ayek keda gam ne rinku .

text: And he said unto them , I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven .
text2: Go ke yɔɔk , yan , Yɛn e Catan tiŋ ke loony piny paannhial cit man e wiledeŋ .

text: Behold , I give unto you power to tread on serpents and scorpions , and over all the power of the enemy : and nothing shall by any means hurt you .
text2: Tieŋki , wek gam riɛl ba wek karac kac e wecok , ayi mancieei , ku gam week riɛl ba wek riɛl diit e raan de ater tiaam ebɛn : ku acin ke bi week nɔk anandun .

text: Notwithstanding in this rejoice not , that the spirits are subject unto you ; but rather rejoice , because your names are written in heaven .
text2: Ku duoki piɔth mit ne ecooke , yan , ee jɔɔk rac kedun gam ; aŋuan luɔi ba wek piɔth miɛt ne gaar ci rinkun gɔɔr paannhial .

text: In that hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit , and said , I thank thee , O Father , Lord of heaven and earth , that thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent , and hast revealed them unto babes : even so , Father ; for so it seemed good in thy sight .
text2: Ku ne thaar mane guop ke Yecu jɔ piɔu miɛt ne Weidit , ku lueel , yan , Yin lɛɛc , Waar , luɔi ci yin kake mɔny kɔc pel ku kɔc de niim , ku jɔ keek nyuoth mithi . thiiatetet : ee yen , Waar ; en aci guɔ miɛt e yiniɔu .

text: All things are delivered to me of my Father : and no man knoweth who the Son is , but the Father ; and who the Father is , but the Son , and he to whom the Son will reveal him .
text2: Kaŋ kedhie aci Waar ke yien ɛn : ku acin raan ŋic Wende , nɔn ee yen ŋa , ee Wun etok , ku acin raan ŋic Wun , nɔn ee yen ŋa , ee Wende etok , ku raan nu e Wende piɔu luɔi bi en e nyuoth en .

text: And he turned him unto his disciples , and said privately , Blessed are the eyes which see the things that ye see :
text2: Go rot pɔk kɔcpiooce , ku yook keek kapac , yan , Thieithieei e nyin tiŋ ka tieŋki :

text: For I tell you , that many prophets and kings have desired to see those things which ye see , and have not seen them ; and to hear those things which ye hear , and have not heard them .
text2: wek yɔɔk , yan , Nebii juec ayi maliik acik piɔth dɛ luɔi tiŋ kek ka wɔiki , ku akenki ke tiŋ ; ku luɔi piŋ kek ka piɛŋki , ku akenki ke piŋ .

text: And , behold , a certain lawyer stood up , and tempted him , saying , Master , what shall I do to inherit eternal life ?
text2: Na wen , ke raan tok jɔt rot , ee bɛny de loŋ , ku jɔ them , thieec , yan , Bɛny e weet , eeŋo ba looi ke ban piir athɛɛr lɔɔk lak ?

text: He said unto him , What is written in the law ? how readest thou ?
text2: Go lueel , yan , Eeŋo ci gɔɔr e loŋic ? Ye kueen adi ?

text: And he answering said , Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy strength , and with all thy mind ; and thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: Go bɛɛr , yan , Yin bi Bɛnydit Nhialicdu nhiaar e piɔndu ebɛn , ku weiku ebɛn , ku riɛldu ebɛn , ku nɔmdu ebɛn : ku nhiaar raan rɛɛr ke yin cit man nhiɛɛr yin rot .

text: And he said unto him , Thou hast answered right : this do , and thou shalt live .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Aci tiiŋ nɔm : na loiye wule , ke yin bi piir .

text: But he , willing to justify himself , said unto Jesus , And who is my neighbour ?
text2: Go kɔɔr luɔi bi en rot kɔl , en eraane , ku jɔ Yecu thieec , yan , Ku raan rɛɛr ke yɛn yen ee ŋa ?

text: And Jesus answering said , A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho , and fell among thieves , which stripped him of his raiment , and wounded him , and departed , leaving him half dead .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Ade raan e jel Jeruthalem le Jeriko , ku jɔ rɔm ke cuɛɛr ; na wen , ke ke door lupɔde bei e yeguop , goki dui , ku jɔki jal , ku nyieeŋki piny ke deyic wei .

text: And by chance there came down a certain priest that way : and when he saw him , he passed by on the other side .
text2: Na wen , ke bɛny toŋ e ka ke Nhialic ke biiye piny e kueere , go tiŋ , ku jɔ rot yal e kueer biaktui , ku teek .

text: And likewise a Levite , when he was at the place , came and looked on him , and passed by on the other side .
text2: Ayi raan e Lebi aya , te ci en ɣeet te nu raan , ke woi , ku jɔ rot yal e kueer biaktni , ku teek .

text: But a certain Samaritan , as he journeyed , came where he was : and when he saw him , he had compassion on him ,
text2: Na wen , ke raan toŋ e Thamaria keny etɛɛn , ku jɔ bɛn te nu raane : na wen , aci e tiŋ , ke jɔ piɔu kok ke yen ,

text: And went to him , and bound up his wounds , pouring in oil and wine , and set him on his own beast , and brought him to an inn , and took care of him .
text2: ago lɔ te nu yen , ku jɔ ɣaan tok deer , wen ci en ke tɔc e miok keke wany , ku tɛɛu e mulde kɔu , ku bii ɣon e kamaan , go jɔ muk apiɛth .

text: And on the morrow when he departed , he took out two pence , and gave them to the host , and said unto him , Take care of him ; and whatsoever thou spendest more , when I come again , I will repay thee .
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , te jel en , ke jɔ rial bɛɛi bei , yin raan de ɣot , ku yook , yan , Muk apiɛth ; ku na de weu kɔk ci yin ke ye ɣɔɔc , ke yin ba cuoot miak , te can bɛn .

text: Which now of these three , thinkest thou , was neighbour unto him that fell among the thieves ?
text2: Ne yin , an , Ne keyiic kadiak eeŋa ci rot tɔ ye raan rɛɛr ke raan wen ram ke cuɛɛr e kaŋ rum ?

text: And he said , He that shewed mercy on him . Then said Jesus unto him , Go , and do thou likewise .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Ee raan wen ci piɔu kok ke yen . Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Lɔ , ku ye looi wuya .

text: Now it came to pass , as they went , that he entered into a certain village : and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house .
text2: Na wen , aciɛɛthki kueer , ke jɔ lɔ paan tok ; go nyuooc e tiiŋ toŋ cɔl Martha .

text: And she had a sister called Mary , which also sat at Jesus ' feet , and heard his word .
text2: Ku ade nɔm nyankene cɔl Mari , nyan ci nyuc e Yecu cok , ke piŋ welke .

text: But Martha was cumbered about much serving , and came to him , and said , Lord , dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone ? bid her therefore that she help me .
text2: Na wen , ke Martha nuan aret ke luɔi dit , ku jɔ bɛn te nu yen , bi ku lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , luɔi ci nyankai a pal luɔi yatok , cin kedu thin ? Yɔɔke bi a kony .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto her , Martha , Martha , thou art careful and troubled about many things :
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yook , an , Martha , Martha , yin ci piɔu diɛɛr ku ci nuan e kajuec :

text: But one thing is needful : and Mary hath chosen that good part , which shall not be taken away from her .
text2: ee tok tei en dak : ku Mari aci baŋ piɛth lɔc , baŋ cii bi nyaai tede yen .

text: And it came to pass , that , as he was praying in a certain place , when he ceased , one of his disciples said unto him , Lord , teach us to pray , as John also taught his disciples .
text2: Na ɣɔn , a lɛŋ tedaŋ , ku jɔ lɔŋ pɔl , go raan toŋ e kɔcken e piooce lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , wɛɛte wook e lɔŋ , acit man waan weete Jɔn kɔckɛn e piooce aya .

text: And he said unto them , When ye pray , say , Our Father which art in heaven , Hallowed be thy name . Thy kingdom come . Thy will be done , as in heaven , so in earth .
text2: Go ke yɔɔk , yan , Te ya wek lɔŋ , ke yak lueel , yan , Waada nu paannhial , tɔ rinku rieuwe . Tɔ ciɛɛŋdu bɔ . Ye kede piɔndu tɔ loi e piny nɔm , cit man e ye looi paannhial .

text: Give us day by day our daily bread .
text2: Ye wo miɔɔc e akoolnyiin e ke buk aa cam .

text: And forgive us our sins ; for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us . And lead us not into temptation ; but deliver us from evil .
text2: Ku ye wo pal karɛckuɔ ; ku wook aya wo ye kɔc pɔl kedhie kɔc cath ne kanykuɔ . Ku du wook e lɛɛr e themic ; ye wo luok e kerac .

text: And he said unto them , Which of you shall have a friend , and shall go unto him at midnight , and say unto him , Friend , lend me three loaves ;
text2: Go lɛk keek , yan , Eeŋa ne weyiic , raan de mɛthe , ku bi lɔ tede yen e wɛɛric cil , le ku lueel , yan , Math , dhɛne ya kuiin ci pam kadiak ;

text: For a friend of mine in his journey is come to me , and I have nothing to set before him ?
text2: ade mɛthedien ci bɛn te nuo yɛn , ke keny , ku acin ke gɔɔŋ ɛn en ;

text: And he from within shall answer and say , Trouble me not : the door is now shut , and my children are with me in bed ; I cannot rise and give thee .
text2: go raan nu ɣoot lueel , yan , Du ya jut guop : ɣot aci guɔ gaar , ku mithki acik tɔc e yayɔu ; yɛn cii rot dueer jɔt , la yi miɔɔc ?

text: I say unto you , Though he will not rise and give him , because he is his friend , yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth .
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Ciɛk , an , cii rot bi cak jɔt , miɔɔc , ne baŋ de maath , ka bi rot dhil jɔt ku jɔ miɔɔc ne ka kɔɔr kedhie , ne baŋ wen cool en e lip .

text: And I say unto you , Ask , and it shall be given you ; seek , and ye shall find ; knock , and it shall be opened unto you .
text2: Ku wek yɔɔk , yan , Yak lip , ke we bi aa miɔɔc ; yak koor , ku abak aa yok ; yak ɣot tɔɔŋ thok , ku abi liep week .

text: For every one that asketh receiveth ; and he that seeketh findeth ; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened .
text2: Raan ebɛn raan e lip , aa ye miɔɔc ; ku raan e koor ee yok ; ku raan e ɣot tɔɔŋ thok aye liep ɣot .

text: If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father , will he give him a stone ? or if he ask a fish , will he for a fish give him a serpent ?
text2: Ku na de raan e weyiic raan de nɔm mith , ku te lip mɛnhde kuin tede yen , bi miɔɔc e kɔɔi ? Ku na lip rɛc , bi miɔɔc e kerac , le enyin e rɛcic ?

text: Or if he shall ask an egg , will he offer him a scorpion ?
text2: Ku na lip tuɔŋ , bi miɔɔc e mancieei ?

text: If ye then , being evil , know how to give good gifts unto your children : how much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him ?
text2: Ku te ŋiɛc wek mithkun miɔɔc ne kapiɛth , wek kɔc rac , na Wuoorduon nu paannhial cii kɔc lip en bi dhil miɔɔc ne Weidit Ɣer ?

text: And he was casting out a devil , and it was dumb . And it came to pass , when the devil was gone out , the dumb spake ; and the people wondered .
text2: Na ɣɔn , acieec jɔŋ rac jɔŋ cin thok . Na wen , aci bɛn bei , ke raan wen cin thok , ke jam ; go kut e kɔc gai .

text: But some of them said , He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils .
text2: Go kɔc kɔk e keek lueel , yan , Ee jɔɔk rac cieec ne Beeldhebub bɛnydiit e jɔɔk rac .

text: And others , tempting him , sought of him a sign from heaven .
text2: Ku them e kɔc kɔk , ke ke kɔɔr gok tede yen , gok bɔ nhial .

text: But he , knowing their thoughts , said unto them , Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation ; and a house divided against a house falleth .
text2: Go ke cik tak e kepiɔth ŋic , ku lueel , yan , Na teer kɔc ke paan tok ke baai aa riaak ; ku na teer kɔc ke dhien tok ke dhien aa riaak .

text: If Satan also be divided against himself , how shall his kingdom stand ? because ye say that I cast out devils through Beelzebub .
