text2: Ku na teer Catan rot , ke ciɛɛŋde bi kɔɔc adi ? Ne jamduon luɛlki , yan , aa jɔɔk rac cieec ne Beeldhebub .

text: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils , by whom do your sons cast them out ? therefore shall they be your judges .
text2: Ku na ya jɔɔk rac cieec ne Beeldhebub , ku na mithkun , yek jɔɔk rac cieec ne ŋa ? Keek abik aa kɔc e loŋdun jɔɔny .

text: But if I with the finger of God cast out devils , no doubt the kingdom of God is come upon you .
text2: Ku na ya jɔɔk rac cieec ne ciin e Nhialic , ke ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic ki , ci bɛn tede weeke .

text: When a strong man armed keepeth his palace , his goods are in peace :
text2: Te muke raan ril ka ke tɔŋ ku tiit paande , ke weuke ayek jɔ tɔu apiɛth ;

text: But when a stronger than he shall come upon him , and overcome him , he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted , and divideth his spoils .
text2: ku te bi raan ril e yen , ku tiɛɛm en , ke jɔ kakɛn e tɔŋ noom tede yen , kakɛn ee yen ke rot ŋɔɔth , ku jɔ weukɛn ci peec tek .

text: He that is not with me is against me : and he that gathereth not with me scattereth .
text2: Raan reec mat keke yɛn ka de ater ke yɛn ; ku raan reec gueer e yalɔɔm ke thiei wei .

text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man , he walketh through dry places , seeking rest ; and finding none , he saith , I will return unto my house whence I came out .
text2: Te ci jɔŋ rac bɛn bei e raan guop , ke jɔ te cin piu aa caath , ke kɔɔr te bi en lɔŋ thin ; na wen , acin te ci yok , ke jɔ lueel , yan , Yɛn bi anɔm dhuony ɣondien waan jal ɛn thin .

text: And when he cometh , he findeth it swept and garnished .
text2: Na wen , aci bɛn , ke yok ɣot aci weec aci yic lak .

text: Then goeth he , and taketh to him seven other spirits more wicked than himself ; and they enter in , and dwell there : and the last state of that man is worse than the first .
text2: Go lɔ , ku cɔl jɔɔk rɛc kɔk kadherou jɔɔk war en e rac , goki bɛn , ku lek ɣot , ku jɔki ɣap thin ; ago tau de raane taudɛn cieen go rac awar taudɛn thɛɛr .

text: And it came to pass , as he spake these things , a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice , and said unto him , Blessed is the womb that bare thee , and the paps which thou hast sucked .
text2: Na wen , te ŋoot en ke luel kake , ke tiiŋ tok e kut e kɔc yiic ke jɔ yerol jɔt , lueel , yan , Thieithieei e yany ci yi dhieeth , ku thin ci thuat !

text: But he said , Yea rather , blessed are they that hear the word of God , and keep it .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Aŋuan luɔi bi yin e lueel , yan , Thieithieei e koc e jam e Nhialic piŋ , ku yek dot .

text: And when the people were gathered thick together , he began to say , This is an evil generation : they seek a sign ; and there shall no sign be given it , but the sign of Jonas the prophet .
text2: Na wen , aci kut ditt e kɔc gueer , ke gieŋic , ke jɔ jam gɔl , yan , Rem enɔɔne ee rem rac , akɔɔrki gok bik tiŋ ; ku acin gok bi yien keek , ee gok de nebi Jona tei .

text: For as Jonas was a sign unto the Ninevites , so shall also the Son of man be to this generation .
text2: Acit man ɣɔn ee Jona gok cii kɔc ke Ninebe tiŋ agoki gai , en abi Wen e raan aa gok bii rem enɔɔne tiŋ agoki gai .

text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation , and condemn them : for she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon ; and , behold , a greater than Solomon is here .
text2: Tiiŋ malik de piny cieen abi rot jɔt ekool e guieereloŋ keke rem de enɔɔne etok , ago ke yiek yieth gaak : aci bɛn te le piny thar guut , bi wel ke Tholomon bɛn piŋ wel ke pɛlenɔm ; ku raan dit e Tholomon ki ene .

text: The men of Nineve shall rise up in the judgment with this generation , and shall condemn it : for they repented at the preaching of Jonas ; and , behold , a greater than Jonas is here .
text2: Kɔc ke Ninebe abik rot jɔt ekool e guieereloŋ ne rem de enɔɔne etok , agoki ke yiek yieth gaak : acik kepiɔth puk ne guieer cii Jona ke guieer wel ; ku raan dit e Jona ki ene .

text: No man , when he hath lighted a candle , putteth it in a secret place , neither under a bushel , but on a candlestick , that they which come in may see the light .
text2: Acin raan e manycalath kooth , ku jɔ taau te cii en tiec , ku cii tɛɛu e kedaŋ thar aya , aye taau nhial e kedaŋ nɔm , ke kɔc bɔ ɣot ke ke bi mac tiŋ apiɛth .

text: The light of the body is the eye : therefore when thine eye is single , thy whole body also is full of light ; but when thine eye is evil , thy body also is full of darkness .
text2: Nyin ee many e guop riaau : na piath nyindu , ke yin ɣer guop ebɛn ; ku na rac nyindu , ke yin col guop ecut ayik yiyic .

text: Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness .
text2: Ye rot tiit ke keɣer nu yiguop ke cii bi aa cuɔl .

text: If thy whole body therefore be full of light , having no part dark , the whole shall be full of light , as when the bright shining of a candle doth give thee light .
text2: Te ci guopdu ɣɛɛr ebɛn , ku cin tethiin col , ka bi jɔ ɣɛɛr ewic ebɛn , cit man ee riau de manyealath yi riaau .

text: And as he spake , a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him : and he went in , and sat down to meat .
text2: Na wen , te ŋoot en ke jam , ke cɔɔl raan toŋ de Parithai , yan , bi lɔ cam ke yen : go lɔ ɣot , le ku nyuuc ten ee kɔc cam .

text: And when the Pharisee saw it , he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner .
text2: Go raan e Parithai tiŋ wen ciem en ke ken kɔn piny , go gai .

text: And the Lord said unto him , Now do ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter ; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness .
text2: Go Bɛnydit yɔɔk , yan , Wek Parithai enɔɔne , wek ee biny coth kɔu abi ɣɛɛr , ku cuɔthki aduɔk kɔu ; ku weyiic thin acik thiaŋ e wath ku kerac .

text: Ye fools , did not he that made that which is without make that which is within also ?
text2: Wek dhan , Acieŋ e cak ke nu biic , ken ke nu thin cak aya ?

text: But rather give alms of such things as ye have ; and , behold , all things are clean unto you .
text2: Aŋuan luɔi ba wek kɔc kuany nyiin miɔɔc ne ka cath ne week ; ku tieŋki , kaŋ kedhie ayek ɣɛɛr tede week .

text: But woe unto you , Pharisees ! for ye tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs , and pass over judgment and the love of God : these ought ye to have done , and not to leave the other undone .
text2: Amawoou ne week , wek Parithai ! we ye wal juaar , yi mint , ku rue , ku wal ebɛn , gamki Nhialic toŋ wen thieer kek , ku yak guieereloŋ woocyic keke nhieer e Nhialic : kake adi cak ke dhil aa looi , ku caki kak awen e pɔl ayadaŋ .

text: Woe unto you , Pharisees ! for ye love the uppermost seats in the synagogues , and greetings in the markets .
text2: Amawoou ne week , wek Parithai ! wek nhiaar reer aa wek reer e thony piɛth niim e ɣoot ke Nhialic yiic , ku nhiaarki thiec ee kɔc week thieec e thuk yiic .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye are as graves which appear not , and the men that walk over them are not aware of them .
text2: Amawoou ne week , wek kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr ku Parithai , kɔc de yac aguk ! wek cit rɛŋ cii tiec , go kɔc cath e keniim nhial goki kuc .

text: Then answered one of the lawyers , and said unto him , Master , thus saying thou reproachest us also .
text2: Go raan tok e bany ke loŋ jɔ bɛɛr , yook , yan , Bɛny e weet , luɛl lueel yin ekake , ke yin e wook lat aya .

text: And he said , Woe unto you also , ye lawyers ! for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne , and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Amawoou ne week aya , wek bany ke loŋ ! wek ee kɔc yink kɔɔth kathiek e ke doony , ku wegup we cii kathiek e jak e ciin tok .

text: Woe unto you ! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets , and your fathers killed them .
text2: Amawoou ne week ! wek ee rɛŋ ke nebii yik , nebii ɣɔn cii warkun nɔk .

text: Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers : for they indeed killed them , and ye build their sepulchres .
text2: Ee yin , wek ee caatɔɔ enɔɔne e gam ca wek luɔi de warkun gam ; ee kek e nak keek , ku wek aye rɛŋken yik .

text: Therefore also said the wisdom of God , I will send them prophets and apostles , and some of them they shall slay and persecute :
text2: Yen a lueele Nhialic en ne pɛl e yenɔm , yan , Yɛn bi nebii tuoc keek ayi tuuc , ku abik kɔc kɔk e keek nɔk abik thou , ku yɔŋki kɔk :

text: That the blood of all the prophets , which was shed from the foundation of the world , may be required of this generation ;
text2: ke riɛm de nebii kedhie , riɛm ci leu gɔl te ɣɔn ciɛke piny aɣet ci enɔɔne , ke bi thieec tede rem de enɔɔne ;

text: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias , which perished between the altar and the temple : verily I say unto you , It shall be required of this generation .
text2: gɔl e riɛm de Aabel aɣet riɛm de Dhakaria , raan ci nɔk e kaam de yin de lam keke luaŋdiit e Nhialic : wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Abi thieec tede rem de enɔɔne .

text: Woe unto you , lawyers ! for ye have taken away the key of knowledge : ye entered not in yourselves , and them that were entering in ye hindered .
text2: Amawoou ne week , wek bany ke loŋ ! we ci mukihaar de ŋinydekaŋ jɔt ; wegup wek ken lɔ ɣot , ku kɔc wen , an , lek ɣot , acak ke peen .

text: And as he said these things unto them , the scribes and the Pharisees began to urge him vehemently , and to provoke him to speak of many things :
text2: Na wen , te lueel en kake , ke kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr ku Parithai ke ke gɔl ater ne yen aret , ku themki luɔi bi kek e tɔ jam ne kajuec :

text: Laying wait for him , and seeking to catch something out of his mouth , that they might accuse him .
text2: acik buuth , luɔi bi kek e cak thok ne ke lueel , ke bik lɔ gaany .

text: In the mean time , when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people , insomuch that they trode one upon another , he began to say unto his disciples first of all , Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees , which is hypocrisy .
text2: Ɣɔn aci kuut ke kɔc jɔ gueer , kuut cii raan ke dueer leu e kuɛn , arek abi kɔc kecok aa kac , ke jɔ jam gɔl keke kɔckɛn e piooce , yan , Yak rot tht e luɔu de Parithai , yen aye aguk nu e raan yac .

text: For there is nothing covered , that shall not be revealed ; neither hid , that shall not be known .
text2: Acin ke ci kum , ke cii bi liep nɔm ; ku acin ke ci moony , ke cii bi ŋic .

text: Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light ; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops .
text2: Yen ka , kerieec cak lueel tecol ebɛn abike piŋ teɣer ; ku ke cak tuom e raan yin e ɣoot yiic thin abi guiir e rol dit e ɣoot niim .

text: And I say unto you my friends , Be not afraid of them that kill the body , and after that have no more that they can do .
text2: Ku wek yɔɔk , wek mathki , yan , Duoki e riɔɔc e kɔc nak kɔc gup abik thou , ku acin daŋ bik bɛ leu .

text: But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear : Fear him , which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell ; yea , I say unto you , Fear him .
text2: Ku we ba nyuoth raan ba wek aa riɔɔc e yen : Yak riɔɔc ne raan e kɔc kɔn nɔk abik thou , na ele , ke de riɛl bi en ke cuat e giɛnayin ; yeka , wek yɔɔk , yan , Yak riɔɔc ne yen .

text: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings , and not one of them is forgotten before God ?
text2: Amɔr kadhic cike e ɣaac e miliim kaarou ? ku acin tok e keek toŋ ee Nhialic moor nɔm .

text: But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered . Fear not therefore : ye are of more value than many sparrows .
text2: Acakaa nhim gup nhim ke weniim acike kueen kedhie . Duoki riɔc : wek war amɔɔr juec ne piath .

text: Also I say unto you , Whosoever shall confess me before men , him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God :
text2: Wek yɔɔk aya , yan , Raan ebɛn raan e ya gam e kɔc niim , yen abii Wen e raan gam aya e tuuc ke Nhialic niim :

text: But he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God .
text2: ku raan e ya jai e kɔc niim , yen aba jai e tuuc ke Nhialic niim .

text: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man , it shall be forgiven him : but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven .
text2: Ku raan ebɛn raan e Wen e raan lɛk jam rac , ka dueere pal en : ku raan e Weidit Ɣer laat acii dueere pɔl .

text: And when they bring you unto the synagogues , and unto magistrates , and powers , take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall answer , or what ye shall say :
text2: Ku te ye kek week bɛɛi e ɣoot ke Nhialic yiic ku bany niim bany e loŋ guiir , ku bany e kɔc cieŋ , ke we duoki e diɛɛr ne wel bak bɛɛr , ku ne ke bak lueel :

text: For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say .
text2: Weidit Ɣer abik we wɛɛt e thaar mane guop ne ke bak dhil lueel .

text: And one of the company said unto him , Master , speak to my brother , that he divide the inheritance with me .
text2: Na wen , ke leke raan toŋ de kut e kɔc en , yan , Bɛny , lɛke wanmaath , buk ka cii waada nyaaŋ piny tek .

text: And he said unto him , Man , who made me a judge or a divider over you ?
text2: Go lueel , yan , Ŋadi , eeŋa ci a tɔ ye bɛnyduon e luk ku ye bɛny e week tɛk kaŋ ?

text: And he said unto them , Take heed , and beware of covetousness : for a man ' s life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth .
text2: Go keek yɔɔk , yan , Yak rot tiŋ , ku tiɛtki rot ne kɔɔr e kajuec ; juec de ka nu raan cin acii en ke e piir .

text: And he spake a parable unto them , saying , The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully :
text2: Go keek lɛk kaaŋ , yan , Raan ci bany anu raan ci pinyde luɔk aret ;

text: And he thought within himself , saying , What shall I do , because I have no room where to bestow my fruits ?
text2: ago cat e yepiɔu , yan , Eeŋo ba looi , nɔn cin en te ban kakien ci luɔk taau , thin ?

text: And he said , This will I do : I will pull down my barns , and build greater ; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Aba looi ale : Adhɛɛnki aba ke ŋaany , aguɔ ka war keek yik : ku ja kakien ci luɔk kedhie taau thin ayi weuki .

text: And I will say to my soul , Soul , thou hast much goods laid up for many years ; take thine ease , eat , drink , and be merry .
text2: Ku yɛn bi piɔndi yɔɔk , yan , Piɔndi , kakuon juec acike tɔɔu bik run juec lɛɛr ; jɔ lɔŋ tei , ye cam , ku ye dek , aba piɔu aa miɛt .

text: But God said unto him , Thou fool , this night thy soul shall be required of thee : then whose shall those things be , which thou hast provided ?
text2: Na wen , ke yook e Nhialic , yan , Yin dhɔn , elewakɔu weiku abike cɔɔl tede yin : ku kakuon ci guik bi guɔ aa ka ke ŋa ?

text: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself , and is not rich toward God .
text2: Raan ee rot kuɛt weu juec , ku cie bany e ka ke Nhialic , yen acit eraane .

text: And he said unto his disciples , Therefore I say unto you , Take no thought for your life , what ye shall eat ; neither for the body , what ye shall put on .
text2: Na wen , ke yook kɔckɛn e piooce , yan , Yen a yɔɔk ɛn week , yan , Duoki e diɛɛr e weikun ne ke bak aa cam ; ku duoki e diɛɛr e wegup , ne ke bak aa cieŋ .

text: The life is more than meat , and the body is more than raiment .
text2: Wei aditki awarki kecam , ku guop apiɛth awar lupɔ .

text: Consider the ravens : for they neither sow nor reap ; which neither have storehouse nor barn ; and God feedeth them : how much more are ye better than the fowls ?
text2: Wɔiki gɛk col , aciki e pur , ku aciki e tem ; ku acinki ɣondɛn e rap ayi adhaan ; ku aye Nhialic ke caam : ŋuan ŋuaan wek e diɛt yindi ?

text: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit ?
text2: Ku eeŋa ne weyiic raan dueer bɛɛrde ŋuak e kaam tok ne diɛɛr wen ee yen diɛɛr ?

text: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least , why take ye thought for the rest ?
text2: Na caki ye bi leu ayi te ciɛk en aa luɔi koor , ke eeŋo ya wek diɛɛr ne luɔi kɔk kedhie ?

text: Consider the lilies how they grow : they toil not , they spin not ; and yet I say unto you , that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these .
text2: Wɔiki agurbiok cil ciil kek : acin luɔi yek looi , ku acin alɛɛth yek wii ; ku wek yɔɔk , yan , Acakaa Tholomon keke dhueeŋde ebɛn aken rot piɔth cit tok ne kake yiic .

text: If then God so clothe the grass , which is to day in the field , and to morrow is cast into the oven ; how much more will he clothe you , O ye of little faith ?
text2: Ku na ye Nhialic wɛl roor piɔth ale , wɛl tɔu roor ekoole , ku na miak ke cuɛte mɛɛc ; ke cii we bi piɔth e pioth war piothden aret , wek kɔc dɛk e gam ?

text: And seek not ye what ye shall eat , or what ye shall drink , neither be ye of doubtful mind .
text2: Ku duoki ke bak aa cam e kɔɔr , ayi ka bak aa dek , ku duoki e diɛɛr e wepiɔth .

text: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after : and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things .
text2: Kake kedhie aye juɔor ke piny nɔm ke kɔɔr : ku aŋic Wuoordun nɔn ba wek dhil dɛ kake .

text: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God ; and all these things shall be added unto you .
text2: Yak ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic kɔn kɔɔr , ku kake abike juɛk week kedhie .

text: Fear not , little flock ; for it is your Father ' s good pleasure to give you the kingdom .
text2: Du riɔc , yin luny koor : anu e Wuoordun piɔu luɔi bi en we miɔɔc e ciɛɛŋ .

text: Sell that ye have , and give alms ; provide yourselves bags which wax not old , a treasure in the heavens that faileth not , where no thief approacheth , neither moth corrupteth .
text2: Ɣaacki ka cath ne week , ku miacki kɔc kuany nyiin ; yak rot luɔi kith cii bi dhiap , yak weu kuot paannhial weu cii bi thok , te cin cuɛɛr bi ɣeet tethiɔk , ku te cin kɔm bi ke riɔɔk .

text: For where your treasure is , there will your heart be also .
text2: Te nu weukun , yen abi piɔndun nu thin aya .

text: Let your loins be girded about , and your lights burning ;
text2: Yak tɔu ke we duoot yiic , ku dɛp mɛckuon e alath ;

text: And ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord , when he will return from the wedding ; that when he cometh and knocketh , they may open unto him immediately .
text2: ku wegup yak reer cit kɔc tit bɛnyden , dhuny bi en enɔm a dhuny e thieekic ; na ele , bi ku tɔɔŋ ɣot thok , ka bik dap liep en enɔnthiine .

text: Blessed are those servants , whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching : verily I say unto you , that he shall gird himself , and make them to sit down to meat , and will come forth and serve them .
text2: Thieithieei liimke , liim bii bɛny yok ke ke tit kaŋ , kool bi en bɛn : wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Abi eyic duut , ku jɔ ke tɔ nyuc ten ee cam , ago bɛn ku yin ke kecam .

text: And if he shall come in the second watch , or come in the third watch , and find them so , blessed are those servants .
text2: Ku na bi te ci piny dit , ku te kiiuwe ajith , ku yok keek aya , thieithieei hiimke .

text: And this know , that if the goodman of the house had known what hour the thief would come , he would have watched , and not have suffered his house to be broken through .
text2: Ku jaki kene ŋic , yan , Tee bɛny de ɣot ŋic thaar bi cuɛɛr bɛn thin , adi ci yin , ku cii ɣonde pal a thur kɔu .

text: Be ye therefore ready also : for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not .
text2: Ku week , yak rot coc aya ; Wen e raan abɔ e thaar kuocki .

text: Then Peter said unto him , Lord , speakest thou this parable unto us , or even to all ?
text2: Go Petero thieec , yan , Bɛnydit , kaaŋe lɛke wook , ku lɛke kɔc kedhie ayadaŋ ?

text: And the Lord said , Who then is that faithful and wise steward , whom his lord shall make ruler over his household , to give them their portion of meat in due season ?
text2: Go Bɛnydit lueel , yan , Eeŋa ye raan tit dhien , raan adot ku de nɔm , raan bii bɛnyde taau e dhiende nɔm , bi kɔc aa tɛk kecam ekooldɛn ci lueel ?

text: Blessed is that servant , whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing .
text2: Thieithieei lime , lim bii bɛnyde yok ekool bii yen , ke looi aya .

text: Of a truth I say unto you , that he will make him ruler over all that he hath .
text2: Wek lɛk yic , yan , Abi jɔ taau e kake niim kedhie .

text: But and if that servant say in his heart , My lord delayeth his coming ; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens , and to eat and drink , and to be drunken ;
text2: Ku na jam lime e yepiɔu , yan , Bɛnydi aci gaau e bɛnde ; ago wɛɛt liim gɔl e dui ayi duet liim , ku ye cam ku ye dek ku ye rot tɔ wit mɔu ;

text: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him , and at an hour when he is not aware , and will cut him in sunder , and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers .
text2: ke bɛny de lime abi bɛn ekool kene ye tiit , ku ne thaar kuc , ku jɔ dui aret , ago mat keke kɔc reec gam .

text: And that servant , which knew his lord ' s will , and prepared not himself , neither did according to his will , shall be beaten with many stripes .
text2: Ku lim waan ŋic kede piɔn e bɛnyde , ku cii rot e coc , ku cii kede piɔn e bɛnyde e looi , yen abi dui e wɛt juec :

text: But he that knew not , and did commit things worthy of stripes , shall be beaten with few stripes . For unto whomsoever much is given , of him shall be much required : and to whom men have committed much , of him they will ask the more .
text2: ku raan ci kede piɔn e bɛny kuc , ku ci kaŋ looi ka roŋ e luɔi bi ye dui , yen abi dui e wɛt lik . Raan ebɛn raan ci yien kajuec , abi thiec kajuec ; ku raan ci kɔc kuɛi kajuec , en abik thiec kajuec awar kɔc kɔk .

text: I am come to send fire on the earth ; and what will I if it be already kindled ?
text2: Yɛn e bɔ ba mac bɛn cuat e piny nɔm ; ku dɛ piɔu ŋo , te ci e guɔ kooth ?

text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with ; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished !
text2: Ku yɛn de baptinh bi a dhil baptith e ye ; ku yɛn ci rok alal te ŋoot en ke ken kɔn thok !

text: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth ? I tell you , Nay ; but rather division :
text2: Luɛlki nɔn ba yɛn ba mat bɛn bɛɛi e piny nɔm ? Wek yɔɔk , yan , Acie yen ; ater en a bɛɛi :

text: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided , three against two , and two against three .
text2: gɔl enɔɔne , kɔc kadhic abik keyiic tek ɣon tok , diak abik dɛ ater ne rou , ku rou ne diak .

text: The father shall be divided against the son , and the son against the father ; the mother against the daughter , and the daughter against the mother ; the mother in law against her daughter in law , and the daughter in law against her mother in law .
text2: Wun meth abi dɛ ater ke wende , ku bi wende dɛ ater ke wun ; ku man duet keke nyande , ku nyande keke man ; ayi man mony e duet keke tiiŋ de wende , ku tiiŋ de wende keke man monyde .

text: And he said also to the people , When ye see a cloud rise out of the west , straightway ye say , There cometh a shower ; and so it is .
text2: Ku yook kɔc aya , yan , Te tieŋ wek luat ke tul ten ee akɔl lɔ piny , ke wek ayak dap lueel , yan , Deŋ abɔ ; ago bɛn .

text: And when ye see the south wind blow , ye say , There will be heat ; and it cometh to pass .
text2: Ku te pute yom ke ye wowic , ke wek ayak lueel , yan , Piny abi tuoc : ago tuoc .

text: Ye hypocrites , ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth ; but how is it that ye do not discern this time ?
text2: Wek kɔc de yac aguk , wek ee tenhial ŋic ayi piny tau bi ke tɔu ; ku eeŋo kuoc wek ekoole tau bi en tɔu ?

text: Yea , and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right ?
text2: Ku eeŋo ca wek loŋ e guiir apiɛth wapac ayadaŋ ?

text: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate , as thou art in the way , give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him ; lest he hale thee to the judge , and the judge deliver thee to the officer , and the officer cast thee into prison .
text2: Na lɔ we raan de ater ke yin e bɛny nɔm , ke yi them mat weke yen kueer ; ke cii yi bi thɛl e bɛny e loŋ guiir nɔm , ago bɛny e loŋ guiir yi yien cawic , ku bi cawic yi cuat e aloocic .

text: I tell thee , thou shalt not depart thence , till thou hast paid the very last mite .
text2: Yin yɔɔk , yan , Yin cii bi bɛn bei , te ŋoot yin ke yi ken kaŋ cool kedhie , ayi niiliim .

text: There were present at that season some that told him of the Galilaeans , whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices .
text2: Ku ade kɔc e nu etɛɛn ekoole guop kɔc e lek Yecu ne kede kɔc ke Galili , kɔc waan cii Pilato riɛmden liaap keke kakɛn cik lam ku nakki ke .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , Suppose ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans , because they suffered such things ?
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yook keek , yan , Wak rac kɔc ke Galilike , warki kɔc ke Galili kedhie , luɔi ci kek ka cit ekake yok ?

text: I tell you , Nay : but , except ye repent , ye shall all likewise perish .
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Acie yen ; ku te kɛn wek wepiɔth puk , ke we bi thou wedhie cit man e kek .

text: Or those eighteen , upon whom the tower in Siloam fell , and slew them , think ye that they were sinners above all men that dwelt in Jerusalem ?
text2: Ayi kɔcke kathieer ku bɛt , kɔc waan ci alooc baar nu Thiloam wiik e keniim , ago ke nɔk , wak rɛcki awarki kɔc rɛɛr e Jeruthalem kedhie ?

text: I tell you , Nay : but , except ye repent , ye shall all likewise perish .
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Acie yen ; ku te kɛn wek wepiɔth puk , ke we bi thou wedhie cit man e kek .

text: He spake also this parable ; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard ; and he came and sought fruit thereon , and found none .
text2: Na wen , ke luel kaaŋe aya ; yan , Ŋadi ade ŋaap ci com domde ; na wen , ke bɔ bi mithke bɛn kɔɔr , ku acin ke ci yok .

text: Then said he unto the dresser of his vineyard , Behold , these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree , and find none : cut it down ; why cumbereth it the ground ?
text2: Ku jɔ raan e luui e domic yɔɔk , yan , Tiŋ , run kadiak yɛn ee mith bɛn kɔɔr tede ŋaape , ku acin ke ca yok ; yiɛpe wei ; eeŋo kum en piny youyou ?

text: And he answering said unto him , Lord , let it alone this year also , till I shall dig about it , and dung it :
text2: Go bɛɛr , lueel , yan , Bɛny , bɛye pɔl a tɔu e run toŋe aya , aba wec thar , aguɔ yiek thar war :

text: And if it bear fruit , well : and if not , then after that thou shalt cut it down .
text2: aa le luɔk , ka piɛth : na ken luɔk , ka ba jɔ yiɛp wei .

text: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath .
text2: Ku aa weet kɔc ɣon tok e ɣoot ke Nhialic yiic ekool e thabat .

text: And , behold , there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years , and was bowed together , and could in no wise lift up herself .
text2: Ku ade tiiŋ nu etɛɛn , di , tiiŋ cath ke jɔŋ e ye tɔ kɔc guop e run kathieer ku bɛt , ku acii jɔk tot kɔu , ku aci ekɔu e leu e jot .

text: And when Jesus saw her , he called her to him , and said unto her , Woman , thou art loosed from thine infirmity .
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu ye tiŋ , ke jɔ cɔɔl , yook , yan , Tiiŋe , yin ci lony e jɔŋdu .

text: And he laid his hands on her : and immediately she was made straight , and glorified God .
text2: Go ecin thany e yeguop : na wen , e tethiine , ke jɔ yekɔu ric , ago Nhialic leec .

text: And the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation , because that Jesus had healed on the sabbath day , and said unto the people , There are six days in which men ought to work : in them therefore come and be healed , and not on the sabbath day .
text2: Go bɛny de ɣon e Nhialic gɔth , luɔi ci Yecu raan tɔ dem ekool e thabath , ku jɔ bɛɛr , yook kɔc , yan , Akool kadhetem anuki kool dueere kɔc ke luui thin : yak bɛn e akoolke yiic bi we bɛn tɔ dem , ku duoki e bɛn ekool e thabath .

text: The Lord then answered him , and said , Thou hypocrite , doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall , and lead him away to watering ?
text2: Go Bɛnydit puk nɔm , yook , yan , Yin raan de yac aguk , raan ebɛn e weyiic cii miɔɔrde e lony ayi mulde ten ee yen rem thin ekool e thabath , ku jɔ thɛl wiir le dek ?

text: And ought not this woman , being a daughter of Abraham , whom Satan hath bound , lo , these eighteen years , be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day ?
text2: Ku na tiiŋe , nyan e Abraɣam , nyan cii Catan mac , di , e run kathieer ku bɛt , cii dueere lony e jonh mɛc en ekool e thabath ?

text: And when he had said these things , all his adversaries were ashamed : and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him .
text2: Na wen , aci kake lueel , ke kɔc de ater ne yen ke ke jɔ yaar : go kɔc piɔth miɛt kedhie ne ka ci looi ka deyiic dhueeŋ kedhie .

text: Then said he , Unto what is the kingdom of God like ? and whereunto shall I resemble it ?
text2: Go lueel , yan , Cit ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic ŋo ? ku ba thɔŋ ŋo ?

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed , which a man took , and cast into his garden ; and it grew , and waxed a great tree ; and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it .
text2: Acit nyin toŋ de matharda , ci raan noom , ku cuɛt e domdeyic ; ago cil , abi aa tim dit ; ku jɔ diɛt nhial aa reer e keerke niim .

text: And again he said , Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God ?
text2: Go bɛ lueel , yan , Ba ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic thɔŋ ŋo ?

text: It is like leaven , which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal , till the whole was leavened .
text2: Acit luɔu cii tik noom , ku jɔ taau e akop wacic , cit aduuk kadiak , aɣet te bi en tuak ebɛn .

text: And he went through the cities and villages , teaching , and journeying toward Jerusalem .
text2: Go pɛɛnydit caath yiic ayi bɛi yiic , ke jɔ cath ke weet kɔc , ke lɔ Jeruthalem .

text: Then said one unto him , Lord , are there few that be saved ? And he said unto them ,
text2: Go raan tok thieec , yan , Bɛnydit , kɔc bi kony wei , kek iik ? Go ke yɔɔk , yan ,

text: Strive to enter in at the strait gate : for many , I say unto you , will seek to enter in , and shall not be able .
text2: Yak cok e thɛm wek en aret luɔi ba wek teek e kalthok thoŋ kooric : wek yɔɔk , yan , kɔc juec abik lɔ thin kɔɔr , ku aciki bi leu .

text: When once the master of the house is risen up , and hath shut to the door , and ye begin to stand without , and to knock at the door , saying , Lord , Lord , open unto us ; and he shall answer and say unto you , I know you not whence ye are :
text2: Rial , te ci bɛny de ɣot rot guɔ jɔt ku jɔ ɣot thiook thok , ku we bi jɔ kɔɔc biic , ku taŋki ɣotthok , ku luɛlki , yan , Bɛnydit , Bɛnydit , liepe wo ɣot ; ku abi bɛɛr , yook week , yan , Wek kuoc te ba wek thin ;

text: Then shall ye begin to say , We have eaten and drunk in thy presence , and thou hast taught in our streets .
text2: ku bak jɔ lueel , yan , Wok aa ye cam ku yok dek e yinɔm , ku yin aa ye weet e kuɛɛrkuɔ yiic ;

text: But he shall say , I tell you , I know you not whence ye are ; depart from me , all ye workers of iniquity .
text2: ku abi lueel , yan , Wek yɔɔk , yan , Wek kuoc te ba wek thin ; jalki e yalɔɔm , wek kɔc e kerac looi wedhie .

text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth , when ye shall see Abraham , and Isaac , and Jacob , and all the prophets , in the kingdom of God , and you yourselves thrust out .
text2: Te ca week Abraɣam tiŋ , ku tieŋki Yithak , ku Jakop , ku nebii kedhie , e ciɛɛŋ de Nhialicyic , ku wegup ku ci we ciɛɛc biic , ke dhieeu abi nu keke ŋeny de lec .

text: And they shall come from the east , and from the west , and from the north , and from the south , and shall sit down in the kingdom of God .
text2: Ku kɔc abik bɛn ten ee akɔl thok bɛn ku biki ten ee akɔl lɔ piny , ku rut , ku wowic , bik ku nyucki e ciɛɛŋ de Nhialicyic .

text: And , behold , there are last which shall be first , and there are first which shall be last .
text2: Ku tieŋki , ade kɔc nu cieen enɔɔne kɔc bi lɔ tueŋ , ku de kɔc nu tueŋ enɔɔne kɔc bi lɔ cieen .

text: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees , saying unto him , Get thee out , and depart hence : for Herod will kill thee .
text2: Na ɣɔn , ekool mane guop , ke kɔc kɔk e Parithai ke ke bɔ , bik ku yookki , yan , Nyai , jel etene : Kerod ade piɔu luɔi bi en yi nɔk .

text: And he said unto them , Go ye , and tell that fox , Behold , I cast out devils , and I do cures to day and to morrow , and the third day I shall be perfected .
text2: Go keek yɔɔk , yan , Laki , yɔɔkki awantui , yan , Tiŋ , yɛn ciec jɔɔk rac ku ja kɔc tɔ dem ekoole ku miak , ku na ekool ee kek diak ke yɛn e guɔ thok .

text: Nevertheless I must walk to day , and to morrow , and the day following : for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem .
text2: Ku yɛn bi dhil cath ekoole ku miak ku miak ruu : acin nebi dueer thou roor ku cii thou e Jeruthalem .

text: O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , which killest the prophets , and stonest them that are sent unto thee ; how often would I have gathered thy children together , as a hen doth gather her brood under her wings , and ye would not !
text2: Jeruthalem oou , Jeruthalem oou , paan e nebi nɔk , ku biook kɔc ne kur kɔc ci tuoc yin ; ee nin kadi can piɔu dɛ kum kuom ɛn mithku , cit man ee ajith mithke kum e yewuok , ku acak rɛɛc ?

text: Behold , your house is left unto you desolate : and verily I say unto you , Ye shall not see me , until the time come when ye shall say , Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: Tieŋki , ɣondun aci nyaaŋ week ke yaar : ku wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , We cii a bi bɛ tiŋ , aɣet kool ba wek e lueel , yan , Thieithieei raan bɔ ne rin ke Bɛnydit .

text: And it came to pass , as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day , that they watched him .
text2: Na ɣɔn , ke lɔ ɣon e bɛny tok e bany ke Parithai yiic , le cam e kuin ekool e thabath , ku jɔki toom guop .

text: And , behold , there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy .
text2: Ku ade raan tɔu e yenɔm , di , raan ci bɔɔt guop .

text: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees , saying , Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day ?
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , thieec bany ke loŋ ku Parithai , yan , Ci pal kɔc , an , bik kɔc tɔ dem ekool e thabath ?

text: And they held their peace . And he took him , and healed him , and let him go ;
text2: Goki lɔ lik . Na wen , ke noom , tɔ dem , ku tɔ jel .

text: And answered them , saying , Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a pit , and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day ?
text2: Ku jɔ pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Eeŋa ne weyiic , raan de muul ayi miɔɔr , na loony yiith , ke cii bi dap mieet bei ekool e thabath ?

text: And they could not answer him again to these things .
text2: Agoki welke cuo leu e beer .

text: And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden , when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms ; saying unto them ,
text2: Na wen , ke jɔ kɔc wen ci cɔɔl lɛk kaaŋ , wen ci en keek tiŋ , acik tepiɛth ee reer lɔc ; yook keek , yan ,

text: When thou art bidden of any man to a wedding , sit not down in the highest room ; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him ;
text2: Te ci raan yi cɔɔl e thieekic , ke yi du nyuc tepiɛth ; na ele , lɔ raan diit e yin cɔɔl ,

text: And he that bade thee and him come and say to thee , Give this man place ; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room .
text2: ku jɔ raan e cɔl week bɛn , bi ku yook yin , yan , Nyai , pate raane ; ke yin bi jɔ yaar , ku jɔ lɔ nyuc kec ya .

text: But when thou art bidden , go and sit down in the lowest room ; that when he that bade thee cometh , he may say unto thee , Friend , go up higher : then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee .
text2: Ku na cɔl raan yin , ke yi jɔ nyuc kec ; na ele , lɔ raan wen e cɔl yin bɛn , ke jɔ yi yɔɔk , yan , Math , ba tepiɛth : ke yin bi lɛc yok e kɔc niim kɔc rɛɛr ne yin etok tede cam .

text: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Raan ebɛn raan e ro tɔ dit abi tɔ koor ; ku raan e ro kuɔɔr piny , yen abi tɔ dit .

text: Then said he also to him that bade him , When thou makest a dinner or a supper , call not thy friends , nor thy brethren , neither thy kinsmen , nor thy rich neighbours ; lest they also bid thee again , and a recompence be made thee .
text2: Go raan wen cɔl en yɔɔk , yan , Te looi yin kecamdit ayi miak ayi theen , ke yi du mathku cɔl , ayikɔc raan wek , ayi kɔc rɛɛr wek etok kɔc ci bany ; ke ke cii yi bi bɛ cɔɔl , cuutki yin .

text: But when thou makest a feast , call the poor , the maimed , the lame , the blind :
text2: Ku te looi yin kecamdit , ke yi cɔl kɔc kuany nyiin , ku ŋol , ku kɔc e kɔm , ku coor :

text: And thou shalt be blessed ; for they cannot recompense thee : for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just .
text2: ke yin bi jɔ thieei ; ne luɔi cin kek ke bi kek yi cuoot : yin bi cuoot tei ekool e jonerot e kɔc piɛthpiɔth .

text: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things , he said unto him , Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God .
text2: Na wen , ke raan tok e kɔc wen rɛɛr ne yen etok tede cam , te ci en ekake piŋ , ke jɔ lueel , yan , Thieithieei raan bi kuin cam e ciɛɛŋ de Nhialicic .

text: Then said he unto him , A certain man made a great supper , and bade many :
text2: Go yɔɔk , yan , Ŋadi aci kecamdit looi ; ku jɔ kɔc juec cɔɔl :

text: And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden , Come ; for all things are now ready .
text2: na wen , aci kool e cam guɔ bɛn , ke toc limde le kɔc wen ci cɔɔl lɔ yɔɔk , yan , Baki ; kaŋ acik guɔ thok kedhie .

text: And they all with one consent began to make excuse . The first said unto him , I have bought a piece of ground , and I must needs go and see it : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: Goki kethook mat ne kɔc bi kek rot kɔc . Aci raan tok lueel , yan , Yɛn e dom piac ɣɔɔc , ka ba dhil lɔ tiŋ . Yin laŋ , an , Pal ɛn .

text: And another said , I have bought five yoke of oxen , and I go to prove them : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: Ku jɔ raan daŋ lueel , yan , Yɛn e mioor ɣɔɔc kathieer , bik aa luui , rene pei ku rene pei , ku yɛn lɔ la keek them : yin laŋ , an , Pal ɛn .

text: And another said , I have married a wife , and therefore I cannot come .
text2: Ku be daŋ lueel , yan , Yɛn ci tiiŋdi thiaak , en aca yɛn dueer lɔ .

text: So that servant came , and shewed his lord these things . Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant , Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city , and bring in hither the poor , and the maimed , and the halt , and the blind .
text2: Go lim lɔ bɛn ku jɔ bɛnyde lɛk kake . Go bɛny de ɣot gɔth , ku yook limde , yan , Dap lɔ biic lɔ kuɛɛr ke panydit kuɛɛr dit yiic ku kuɛɛr kor yiic , lɔ bɛɛiye kɔc kuany nyiin etene , ku ŋol , ku kɔc e kɔm , ku coor .

text: And the servant said , Lord , it is done as thou hast commanded , and yet there is room .
text2: Na wen , ke jɔ lim lueel , yan , Bɛny , welkuon wen aca ke looi , ku ɣot aŋoot ke dakic .

text: And the lord said unto the servant , Go out into the highways and hedges , and compel them to come in , that my house may be filled .
text2: Go bɛny lim yɔɔk , yan , Jel lɔ e ciɛɛr yiic ku kɛl kɔɔth , ku dhil ke thel abik dhil bɛn , ke ɣondi abi thiaŋ .

text: For I say unto you , That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper .
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Acin raan toŋ de kɔc ca kɔn cɔɔl bi kecamdi thieep .

text: And there went great multitudes with him : and he turned , and said unto them ,
text2: Ku cath kuut dit ke kɔc ne yen : go rot puk , yook keek , yan ,

text: If any man come to me , and hate not his father , and mother , and wife , and children , and brethren , and sisters , yea , and his own life also , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: Na bɔ raan tede yɛn , ku cii wun man , ku cii man man , ku mithke , ku mithekɔcken , ku nyiirekɔcken , yeka , acakaa weike guop ayadaŋ , ka cii dueer aa raandien e piooce .

text: And whosoever doth not bear his cross , and come after me , cannot be my disciple .
text2: Ku raan cii timdɛn ci riiu nɔm e ɣaac , ku jɔ yɛn aa kuany cok , ka cii dueer aa raandien e piooce .

text: For which of you , intending to build a tower , sitteth not down first , and counteth the cost , whether he have sufficient to finish it ?
text2: Eeŋa ne weyiic , raan de piɔu luɔi bi en aloocdit baar yik , ke cii bi kɔn nyuc piny , ke jɔ weu bi kɔɔr kueen , nɔn de weu cath ne yen bi en ke ye thol ?

text: Lest haply , after he hath laid the foundation , and is not able to finish it , all that behold it begin to mock him ,
text2: Na ken e looi , ke miak , te cien alooc kiɛɛr piny , ku ken leu ne thol , ka bii kɔc geet , kɔc ci e tiŋ , luelki ,

text: Saying , This man began to build , and was not able to finish .
text2: yan , Raane aci aloocditt baar gɔl e yik , ku aken bɛn leu e thol .

text: Or what king , going to make war against another king , sitteth not down first , and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand ?
text2: Ku ye malikou , te de yen piɔu luɔi bi en tɔŋ yien malik daŋ , ke cii bi kɔn nyuc piny , ago yenɔm cat , nɔn dueer en lɔ keke agum de kɔc kathieer le tɔŋ yien bɛny cath ke agum de kɔc kathierou ?

text: Or else , while the other is yet a great way off , he sendeth an ambassage , and desireth conditions of peace .
text2: Ku na ci e dhal , te ŋoote bɛny daŋ ke mec , ke jɔ kɔc tɔɔc lek mat thieec tede yen .

text: So likewise , whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: Yen acit week aya , raan ebɛn e weyiic raan cii kake pal kedhie , ka cii dueer aa raandien e piooce .

text: Salt is good : but if the salt have lost his savour , wherewith shall it be seasoned ?
text2: Amilɔ yen apiɛth : ku te ci amilɔ jɔ liɛɛr , ke bi bɛ wac adi ?

text: It is neither fit for the land , nor yet for the dunghill ; but men cast it out . He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Acii piɛth ke dɔm , ku cii piɛth e toŋ e dhien ; aye kɔc cuat wei tei . Raan de yith ee yen ke piŋ , ke piŋ .

text: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him .
text2: Na ɣɔn , ke kɔc e atholbo tɔ kut keke kɔc e kerac looi ke ke jɔ rot cuot te nu yen bik bɛn piŋ .

text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured , saying , This man receiveth sinners , and eateth with them .
text2: Na wen , ke Parithai keke kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr ke ke jɔ ŋun e keyac , luelki , yan , Raane ee kɔc e kerac looi dɔm tɔ ke ye kɔcke , ku ye cam ke keek etok .

text: And he spake this parable unto them , saying ,
text2: Go keek lɛk kaaŋe , yan ,

text: What man of you , having an hundred sheep , if he lose one of them , doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness , and go after that which is lost , until he find it ?
text2: Ee raanou e weyiic , raan de thok kabɔt , na mar tok e keyiic , ke cii thierdheŋuan ku dheŋuan bi nyaaŋ roor , ku jɔ ke ci maare lɔ kɔɔr , aɣet te bi en e yok ?

text: And when he hath found it , he layeth it on his shoulders , rejoicing .
text2: Na ele , te ci en e yok , ke jɔ taau e yeyeth , ke ye piɔu miɛt .

text: And when he cometh home , he calleth together his friends and neighbours , saying unto them , Rejoice with me ; for I have found my sheep which was lost .
text2: Ku na ci ɣet bei , ke jɔ mathke cɔɔl ku kɔc rɛɛr e yen etok , ku lek keek , yan , Jaki piɔth miɛt ne yɛn etok ; yɛn e thɔkdien wen ci maar yok .

text: I say unto you , that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth , more than over ninety and nine just persons , which need no repentance .
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Miɛtepiɔu abi dit paannhial aya ne biak de raan tok raan e kerac looi , ku be yepiɔu puk , awar miɛt mite kɔc piɔth ne biak de kɔc kathierdheŋuan ku dheŋuan kɔc cin puŋdepiɔu kɔɔrki .

text: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver , if she lose one piece , doth not light a candle , and sweep the house , and seek diligently till she find it ?
text2: Ku ye tiiŋou , tiiŋ de riet kathieer , ku na mɛɛr rial tok , ke cii manyealath bi kooth , ku jɔ ɣot napic , ago cok e kɔɔr en en aɣet te bi en e yok ?

text: And when she hath found it , she calleth her friends and her neighbours together , saying , Rejoice with me ; for I have found the piece which I had lost .
text2: Na ele , te ci en e yok , ke jɔ mathke cɔɔl keke kɔc rɛɛr ne yen etok , ku lueel , yan , Jaki piɔth miɛt ne yɛn etok ; yɛn e rial wen ca mɔɔr yok .

text: Likewise , I say unto you , there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth .
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Yen abi ciet miɛt ee kɔc piɔth miɛt e tuuc ke Nhialic niim ne biak de raan tok raan e kerac looi , ku be yepiɔu puk .

text: And he said , A certain man had two sons :
text2: Go lueel , yan , Ade raan nu raan de wɛɛtke kaarou :

text: And the younger of them said to his father , Father , give me the portion of goods that falleth to me . And he divided unto them his living .
text2: na wen , ke mɛnh koor jɔ wun yɔɔk , yan , Waar , game yɛn biak bi lɔɔk aa biakdi e weuku yiic . Go keek tɛk weuke .

text: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together , and took his journey into a far country , and there wasted his substance with riotous living .
text2: Na leer akool like , ke mɛnh koor jɔ weuke kut kedhie , ku jɔ jal keny paan mec , go weuke lɔ thiai wei etɛɛn ne thueec thueec en e kaŋ .

text: And when he had spent all , there arose a mighty famine in that land ; and he began to be in want .
text2: Na wen , aci weuke thol kedhie , ke cɔŋdit jɔ tuol epinye ; go kake jɔ dak .

text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country ; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine .
text2: Go lɔ ku mɛt rot e raan lɔɔm raan toŋ de epinye ; go tɔ lɔ e dumke yiic le kudhuur aa tiit .

text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat : and no man gave unto him .
text2: Ku aa de piɔu aret luɔi bi en eyac aa thiɔɔŋ ne thel ee kudhuur cam : ku acin raan e ye miɔɔc .

text: And when he came to himself , he said , How many hired servants of my father ' s have bread enough and to spare , and I perish with hunger !
text2: Na wen , aci nɔm jɔ bɛn , ke jɔ lueel , yan , Kɔc e luui e weu tede waar yekdi , kɔc e kuɛth e kuin ku yek kɔk both , ku yɛn , yɛn thou wo cɔk !

text: I will arise and go to my father , and will say unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and before thee ,
text2: Yɛn bi rot jɔt , la tede waar , la ku luɛɛl , yan , Waar , yɛn e kerac luoi Nhialic , ku luoi yin kerac aya :

text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son : make me as one of thy hired servants .
text2: yɛn cii be roŋ ne luɔi bi a cɔl wendu : tɔ ya cit raan toŋ e luui e weu tede yin .

text: And he arose , and came to his father . But when he was yet a great way off , his father saw him , and had compassion , and ran , and fell on his neck , and kissed him .
text2: Go rot jɔt , bi tede wun . Na wen , ke tiŋ wun ke ŋoot ke mec , go piɔu kok ke ye , ku jɔ kat , le ku kuɛk yeth , ku ciim .

text: And the son said unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and in thy sight , and am no more worthy to be called thy son .
text2: Go wende lueel yan , Waar , yɛn e kerac luoi Nhialic , ku luoi yin kerac aya , ku yɛn cii be roŋ ne luɔi bi a cɔl wendu .

text: But the father said to his servants , Bring forth the best robe , and put it on him ; and put a ring on his hand , and shoes on his feet :
text2: Go wun liimke yɔɔk , yan , Bɛɛiki lupɔ piɛth alaldiite , ku taauki e yekɔu ; ku bɛɛiki guelɔ kede yencin , ku war ka ke yencok :

text: And bring hither the fatted calf , and kill it ; and let us eat , and be merry :
text2: ku jaki miɔɔr a lɔ jot bɛɛi bei miɔɔr cuai , ku nakki ; buk cuet , ku jɔku piɔth miɛt :

text: For this my son was dead , and is alive again ; he was lost , and is found . And they began to be merry .
text2: wendiene aa ci thou , ku e bɛ piir enɔɔne ; aa ci maar , ku aci jɔ yok . Goki piɔth jɔ miɛt .

text: Now his elder son was in the field : and as he came and drew nigh to the house , he heard musick and dancing .
text2: Ku nu wen tueŋ domic : na wen , aci bɛn , aci thiɔk ke baai , ke piŋ diɛt cɔŋe ke lɔɔr .

text: And he called one of the servants , and asked what these things meant .
text2: Go mɛnh tok cɔɔl e mith e luui yiic , ku jɔ kake luɔp thar , yan , Ee kaŋo ?

text: And he said unto him , Thy brother is come ; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf , because he hath received him safe and sound .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Wanmuuth aci bɛn ; ku wuur e miɔɔr a lɔ jot nɔk miɔɔr cuai , nɔn ci en e bɛ yok ke piɔl guop .

text: And he was angry , and would not go in : therefore came his father out , and intreated him .
text2: Go gɔth , ku reec lɔ ɣot ; go wun bɛn bei , bi ku lɛŋ .

text: And he answering said to his father , Lo , these many years do I serve thee , neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment : and yet thou never gavest me a kid , that I might make merry with my friends :
text2: Go bɛɛr , yook wun , yan , Tiŋ , yin ca luooi e run juecke cit man e lim , ku acin keduon ca kɔn wooc anandi , ku acin nyɔŋ thiin ci gam ɛn ecaŋɣɔn , ban piɔu miɛt woke mathki .

text: But as soon as this thy son was come , which hath devoured thy living with harlots , thou hast killed for him the fatted calf .
text2: Ku enɔn ci wenduone bɛne , wen ci weuku thiai wei keke akɔɔrroor , ke jɔ nak miɔɔr a lɔ jot , miɔɔr cuai .

text: And he said unto him , Son , thou art ever with me , and all that I have is thine .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Wendi , yin rɛɛr we yɛn e akooinyiin , ku kaki kedhie ee kaku .

text: It was meet that we should make merry , and be glad : for this thy brother was dead , and is alive again ; and was lost , and is found .
text2: Ee kepiɛth yen dɔl dɔl wok ku mitku piɔth : wanmuuthe aci thou , ku jɔ bɛ piir , aci maar , ku beye yok .

text: And he said also unto his disciples , There was a certain rich man , which had a steward ; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods .
text2: Go kɔckɛn e piooce bɛ yɔɔk aya , yan , Ade raan nu raan juec e kake , ku aci raan taau e dhiende nɔm ; ku raane aci gɔny bɛnyde , yan , ci kake thiai wei .

text: And he called him , and said unto him , How is it that I hear this of thee ? give an account of thy stewardship ; for thou mayest be no longer steward .
text2: Go cɔɔl , ku yook , yan , Ee kaŋo ekene ke ca piŋ tede yin ? kuɛne ya ka ke luɔiduon e dhien ; yin cii bi bɛ aa raan nu e dhiendi nɔm .

text: Then the steward said within himself , What shall I do ? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship : I cannot dig ; to beg I am ashamed .
text2: Go raan nu e dhien nɔm lueel e yepiɔu , yan , Ba ŋo looi ? bɛnydi abii ya bei e dhien nɔm : yɛn cii pɔɔr e leu ; ku yɛn dueer yaar e lip .

text: I am resolved what to do , that , when I am put out of the stewardship , they may receive me into their houses .
text2: Yɛn ŋic ke ba looi , ke bi kɔc ɛn aa nyuooc e ɣootken , miak , te ci a cieec e dhien nɔm .

text: So he called every one of his lord ' s debtors unto him , and said unto the first , How much owest thou unto my lord ?
text2: Go kɔc cɔɔl kedhie , kɔc wen cath e ka ke bɛnyde ; na wen , ke thiec raan bɔ tueŋ , yan , Cathe we ka ke bɛnydi kadi ?

text: And he said , An hundred measures of oil . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and sit down quickly , and write fifty .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Alogoor ke miok kabɔt . Go yook , yan , Nom awarekdu , ku dap nyuc piny , ku jɔ thierdhic gɔɔr .

text: Then said he to another , And how much owest thou ? And he said , An hundred measures of wheat . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and write fourscore .
text2: Ku jɔ daŋ thieec , yan , Ku yin , cathe we di ? Go , yan , Cuɛl ke agamɔ kabɔt . Go yɔɔk , yan , Nom awarekdu , ku jɔ thierbɛt gɔɔr .

text: And the lord commended the unjust steward , because he had done wisely : for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light .
text2: Go bɛnyde raan rac nu e dhiende nɔm leec , ne luɔi ci en luui ne pɛl : wɛɛt ke piny de enɔɔne ayek wɛɛt ke ɣɛɛrepiny woor ne pɛl e remdenic .

text: And I say unto you , Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness ; that , when ye fail , they may receive you into everlasting habitations .
text2: Ku wek yɔɔk , yan , Yak rot kɔɔr mathkun ne weu rɛc ke piny nɔm ; na rial , aci kakun dak , ka bik week nyuooc ɣoot ɣoot bi tɔu athɛɛr .

text: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much : and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much .
text2: Raan e kalikkaŋ ŋiec dot , yen aye kajuec ŋiec dot ayadaŋ : ku raan e kalikkaŋ kuoc dot , yen aye kajuec kuoc dot ayadaŋ .

text: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon , who will commit to your trust the true riches ?
text2: Ku na kɛnki weu ke piny nɔm ŋiec aa dot kek weu rac , ke eeŋa bi we kuɛi weu yith ?

text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man ' s , who shall give you that which is your own ?
text2: Ku na kɛnki kede raan daŋ ŋiec aa dot , ke eeŋa bi we gam kedun guop .

text: No servant can serve two masters : for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to the one , and despise the other . Ye cannot serve God and mammon .
text2: Acin raan dueer bany luooi kaarou : nɔn bi en tok maan , ku nhiɛɛr tok ; ku nɔn bi en lɔ kuakkuak keke tok , ku tɔ tok cin naamde . Wek cii Nhialic dueer luooi ku luɔɔiki weu ayadaŋ .

text: And the Pharisees also , who were covetous , heard all these things : and they derided him .
text2: Go Parithai , kɔc nhiaar weu , goki kake piŋ kedhie ; ku jɔki geet guop .

text: And he said unto them , Ye are they which justify yourselves before men ; but God knoweth your hearts : for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God .
text2: Go keek yɔɔk , yan , We ye rot tɔ ye kɔc piɛthpiɔth e kɔc niim ; ku Nhialic aŋic wepiɔth tei : ke de naamde tede kɔc ee kenhiany tede Nhialic .

text: The law and the prophets were until John : since that time the kingdom of God is preached , and every man presseth into it .
text2: Loŋ ku nebii aake nu aɣet ɣɔn bii Jɔn ; na wen , aci bɛn , ke jɔ ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic aa guieer kɔc , go raan rot riɛɛny thin ebɛn .

text: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass , than one tittle of the law to fail .
text2: Jel bi tenhial jal ayi piny , en ee kepiɔl , ne luɔi dueere cook thiin toŋ de loŋ maar .

text: Whosoever putteth away his wife , and marrieth another , committeth adultery : and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery .
text2: Raan pɔk ke tiiŋde , ku jɔ daŋ thiaak , ka ye lɔ ke tiiŋ lci ; ku raan thiak tiiŋ ci pɔk ke monyde , ka ye lɔ ke tiiŋ lei .

text: There was a certain rich man , which was clothed in purple and fine linen , and fared sumptuously every day :
text2: Raan anu raan juec e kake , ku ye lupɔ thiith amujuŋ cieŋ , lupɔ piɛth lɔ mot , ku ye cam e kamit ku ye reer ke ye adhuɛŋ e akoolnyiin kedhie .

text: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus , which was laid at his gate , full of sores ,
text2: Ku ade raan kuany nyin cɔl Ladharo , raan e ye taau e kalde thok , ku ye guop thiaŋ ke tetok ,

text: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man ' s table : moreover the dogs came and licked his sores .
text2: ku ye kɔɔr luɔi bi ye muk ne kak athueithuei wen e loony piny te wen ee raan cuai cam : ku jɔk ayek bɛn aya , bik ku nyanki ɣaantok nu e yeguop .

text: And it came to pass , that the beggar died , and was carried by the angels into Abraham ' s bosom : the rich man also died , and was buried ;
text2: Na wen , ke raan kuany nyin thou , ku jɔt e tuucnhial leerki e Abraɣam yɔu . Ku jɔ raan cuai thou aya , go thiɔk ;

text: And in hell he lift up his eyes , being in torments , and seeth Abraham afar off , and Lazarus in his bosom .
text2: na wen , te reer en paan e kɔc ci thou , ke ye leeŋ wei , ku jɔ enyin jɔt , go Abraɣam tiŋ temec , ku tiŋ Ladharo e yeyɔu .

text: And he cried and said , Father Abraham , have mercy on me , and send Lazarus , that he may dip the tip of his finger in water , and cool my tongue ; for I am tormented in this flame .
text2: Go coot , lueel , yan , Waada Abraɣam , kok piɔu we yɛn , ku jɔ Ladharo tooc , bi cin nɔm bɛn juɔɔl e piu yiic , bi liemdi tɔ lir ; yɛn e leeŋ wei e manyeyic .

text: But Abraham said , Son , remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things , and likewise Lazarus evil things : but now he is comforted , and thou art tormented .
text2: Go Abraɣam lueel , yan , Wendi , cate yinɔm , waan piir yin , yin e kepiɛth yok , ku yok Ladharo karac ; ku enɔɔne aci duut piɔu , ku yin dhiau piɔu .

text: And beside all this , between us and you there is a great gulf fixed : so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot ; neither can they pass to us , that would come from thence .
text2: Ku pal cooke , daŋ anu , tethuth diit laauwic aci taau e kaamda ne week ; ago kɔc wen , an , bik teek ke ke lɔ tede week , agoki cuo leu ; ku cii kɔc e leu aya , kɔc wen , an , bik jal etɛɛn , bik tede wook .

text: Then he said , I pray thee therefore , father , that thou wouldest send him to my father ' s house :
text2: Go bɛ lueel , yan , Yin ja lɔŋ , Waar , yan , ba tuɔɔc dhien e waar ;

text: For I have five brethren ; that he may testify unto them , lest they also come into this place of torment .
text2: wɛɛtemathkuɔ anuki kadhic ; toc abi aa caatɔ bi ke lɔ cok e yook en ke , ke ke cii bi bɛn etene aya , te ye kɔc leeŋ wei thin .

text: Abraham saith unto him , They have Moses and the prophets ; let them hear them .
text2: Go Abraɣam lueel , yan , Adeki Mothe ku nebii ; tɔ ke piŋ keden .

text: And he said , Nay , father Abraham : but if one went unto them from the dead , they will repent .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Ei , Abraɣam waar : ku na de raan toŋ e kɔc ci thou yiic lɔ tede keek , ka bik kepiɔth puk .

text: And he said unto him , If they hear not Moses and the prophets , neither will they be persuaded , though one rose from the dead .
text2: Go yɔɔk , yan , Na reecki kede Mothe piŋ ayi nebii , ka cike bi tɔ gam , acakaa raan tok yen e jɔt rot e kɔc ci thou yiic .

text: Then said he unto the disciples , It is impossible but that offences will come : but woe unto him , through whom they come !
text2: Go kɔcpiooce yɔɔk , yan , Ka ye kɔc tɔ wac kaŋ abik dhil bɛn : ku amawoou ne raan e keek tɔ bɔ !

text: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he cast into the sea , than that he should offend one of these little ones .
text2: Adueer ŋuan tede yen , te mɛce yeyeth pii ee guar , ku deenye wiir , ne luɔi bi en toŋ de miththiike tɔ wac kaŋ .

text: Take heed to yourselves : If thy brother trespass against thee , rebuke him ; and if he repent , forgive him .
text2: Yak rot tiit : na lui mɛnhkui yin kerac , ke jany ; ku te puk en epiɔu , ke pal .

text: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day , and seven times in a day turn again to thee , saying , I repent ; thou shalt forgive him .
text2: Ku te lni en yin kerac raandherou ekool tok , ku be rot pɔk yin raandherou , yan , Yɛn ci apiɔu puk ; ka ba dhil pɔl .

text: And the apostles said unto the Lord , Increase our faith .
text2: Go tuuc Bɛnydit yɔɔk , yan , Ŋuak gamda nyin .

text: And the Lord said , If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed , ye might say unto this sycamine tree , Be thou plucked up by the root , and be thou planted in the sea ; and it should obey you .
text2: Go Bɛnydit lueel , yan , Na thoŋ gamdun keke nyin toŋ de mathada , ke we dueer ŋaape yɔɔk , yan , Tɔ rot wuthe bei weke meeidu , ku tɔ rot pith wiir ; ku adueer kedun gam .

text: But which of you , having a servant plowing or feeding cattle , will say unto him by and by , when he is come from the field , Go and sit down to meat ?
text2: Ku eeŋa ne weyiic , raan de lim e pur , ku nɔn ee yen thok tiit , ke bi yɔɔk , te ci en bɛn domic , yan , Dap bɛn , nyuc piny ku came ?

text: And will not rather say unto him , Make ready wherewith I may sup , and gird thyself , and serve me , till I have eaten and drunken ; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink ?
text2: Ku cii bi kɔn yɔɔk , yan , Guik ke ba cam , ku jɔ yiyin duut , yinne ya kecam , ba cam ku dɛk : na ele , ke yin bi jɔ cam ku dɛke ?

text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him ? I trow not .
text2: Bi liime yɔɔk , yan , Thieithieei , luɔi ci en ka ci lɛk en looi ? Acie yen .

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you , say , We are unprofitable servants : we have done that which was our duty to do .
text2: Yen acit week aya , na cak kakun thol kedhie , ka ci lɛk week , ke jaki lueel , yan , Wok ee liim cin naamda tei : kedan , an , buk dhil looi acuk looi tei .

text: And it came to pass , as he went to Jerusalem , that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee .
text2: Na wen , ale Jeruthalem , ke jɔ Thamaria reetic ayi Galili .

text: And as he entered into a certain village , there met him ten men that were lepers , which stood afar off :
text2: Ku te ci en ɣet paan tok , ke jɔ rɔm ke roor kathieer , roor de gup wɛth , ke ke kaac temec :

text: And they lifted up their voices , and said , Jesus , Master , have mercy on us .
text2: ku cotki e rol dit , yan , Yecu , Bɛnydit , kok piɔu we wook .

text: And when he saw them , he said unto them , Go shew yourselves unto the priests . And it came to pass , that , as they went , they were cleansed .
text2: Na wen , aci ke tiŋ , ke yook keek , yan , Laki , nyuothki rot bany ke ka ke Nhialic . Na wen , aleki , ke ke jɔ dem kueer .

text: And one of them , when he saw that he was healed , turned back , and with a loud voice glorified God ,
text2: Go raan tok e keek , te ci en e tiŋ nɔn ci en dem , ke puk enɔm cieen , ke lec Nhialic ne rol dit ,

text: And fell down on his face at his feet , giving him thanks : and he was a Samaritan .
text2: ku jɔ piny ciim e Yecu cok , go lueel , yan , Thieithieei : ku ye raan e Thamaria .

text: And Jesus answering said , Were there not ten cleansed ? but where are the nine ?
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Kek kathieer kenki dem ? ku kɔc kadheŋuan akou ?

text: There are not found that returned to give glory to God , save this stranger .
text2: Cin raan ci rot yok , raan bi enɔm puk bi Nhialic bɛn lɛc nɔm , ee raan lɛɛne tei ?

text: And he said unto him , Arise , go thy way : thy faith hath made thee whole .
text2: Go yɔɔk , yan , Jɔt rot , lɔ tei : gamdu aci yi tɔ piɔl .

text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees , when the kingdom of God should come , he answered them and said , The kingdom of God cometh not with observation :
text2: Na wen , aci Parithai en thieec , yan , Bi ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic bɛn nɛn ? ke jɔ bɛɛr , yan , Ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic acii bi bɛn ke kɔc e ke daai e ye .

text: Neither shall they say , Lo here ! or , lo there ! for , behold , the kingdom of God is within you .
text2: Ku aciki bi lueel , yan , Yeki ene ! ku , yan , Yeka etɛɛn ! tieŋki , ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic anu e weyiic .

text: And he said unto the disciples , The days will come , when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man , and ye shall not see it .
text2: Go kɔcpiooce yɔɔk , yan , Akool abik bɛn , kool ba wek piɔth dɛ tiŋ tieŋ wek kool toŋ de akool ke Wen e raan yiic , ku acaki bi tiŋ .

text: And they shall say to you , See here ; or , see there : go not after them , nor follow them .
text2: Ku we bii kɔc yɔɔk , yan , Yeki ene ! ku , yan , Yeka etɛɛn ! duoki lɔ e kecok , ku duoki ke kuany cok .

text: For as the lightning , that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven , shineth unto the other part under heaven ; so shall also the Son of man be in his day .
text2: Acit man e wiledeŋ ee wil nhial biak a le gut nhial biak tɛɛn ; yen abi aa tau de Wen e raan ne koolde .

text: But first must he suffer many things , and be rejected of this generation .
text2: Ku abi kajuec dhil kɔn guum , ku abii rem de enɔɔne rɛɛc .

text: And as it was in the days of Noe , so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man .
text2: Ku acit man ɣɔn tɔuwe kaŋ e akool ke Noa , yen abi ciet tau bi kaŋ tɔu aya e akool ke Wen e raan .

text: They did eat , they drank , they married wives , they were given in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark , and the flood came , and destroyed them all .
text2: Aa yek cam , ku yek dek , ku yek thieek , ku yeke thiaak , aɣet kool ɣɔn le Noa e abeiic , ku jɔ amool bɛn , bi ku nɛk keek kedhie .

text: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot ; they did eat , they drank , they bought , they sold , they planted , they builded ;
text2: Ku yen aye tau de kaŋ e akool ke Lot aya ; aa yek cam , ku yek dek , ku yek ɣooc , ku yek kaŋ ɣaac , ku yek com , ku yek yik ;

text: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven , and destroyed them all .
text2: ku kool e jele Lot e Thɔdom , kool mane guop , ke mac lony nhial keke thiilpur , bi ku nɛk keek kedhie :

text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed .
text2: acit tau mane guop en abi kaŋ tɔu ekool bi Wen e raan ro nyuɔɔth .

text: In that day , he which shall be upon the housetop , and his stuff in the house , let him not come down to take it away : and he that is in the field , let him likewise not return back .
text2: Ekoole , ke raan nu e ɣot nɔm , ku tɔu weuke ɣoot , e cii bɔ piny , bi ke bɛn jɔt : ayi raan nu domic , e cii enɔm dhuny cieen aya .

text: Remember Lot ' s wife .
text2: Yak weniim tak e tiiŋ de Lot .

text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it ; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it .
text2: Raan kɔɔr luɔi bi en weike kony , ka bi ke mɔɔr ; ku raan mar weike , ka bi ke kony .

text: I tell you , in that night there shall be two men in one bed ; the one shall be taken , and the other shall be left .
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Wɛɛrwakɔuwe , abi dɛ kɔc kaarou ci tɔc e laŋarep tok nɔm ; tok abi jɔt , ku nyieeŋe tok piny .

text: Two women shall be grinding together ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Abi dɛ diaar kaarou dieer guar etok ; tok abi jɔt , ku nyieeŋe tok piny .

text: Two men shall be in the field ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Abi dɛ kɔc nu domic kaarou ; tok abi jɔt , ku nyieeŋe tok piny .

text: And they answered and said unto him , Where , Lord ? And he said unto them , Wheresoever the body is , thither will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: Goki bɛɛr , thiecki , yan , Ee tenou , Bɛnydit ? Go ke yɔɔk , yan , Te nu ke ci thou , yen aye te bi cuɔɔr guɛɛr thin .

text: And he spake a parable unto them to this end , that men ought always to pray , and not to faint ;
text2: Go keek lɛk kaaŋ , ke kɔc e ke bi dhil aa cool e lɔŋ , ku ciki e bap ;

text: Saying , There was in a city a judge , which feared not God , neither regarded man :
text2: lueel , yan , Bɛny e loŋ guiir anu panydiit tok , bɛny cii Nhialic e rieu , ku cii kɔc e theek aya :

text: And there was a widow in that city ; and she came unto him , saying , Avenge me of mine adversary .
text2: ku nu tiiŋ cin nɔm moc e panydiite ; na wen , ke bɔ te nu yen , bi ku lueel , yan , Kony ɛn ne raan cam ɛn .

text: And he would not for a while : but afterward he said within himself , Though I fear not God , nor regard man ;
text2: Go kɔn yok ke reec : na ɣɔn , ke jɔ lueel e yepiɔu , yan , Ciɛk , an , ca Nhialic e rieu , ku ca raan e theek aya ;

text: Yet because this widow troubleth me , I will avenge her , lest by her continual coming she weary me .
text2: ku ne baŋ de jun wen ee tiiŋe ya jut , ka ba kony tei , ago a cuo be jut ne bɛn wen ee yen cool e bɛn .

text: And the Lord said , Hear what the unjust judge saith .
text2: Go Bɛnydit lueel , yan , Piɛŋki ke lueel bɛny rac , bɛny e loŋ guiir .

text: And shall not God avenge his own elect , which cry day and night unto him , though he bear long with them ?
text2: Ku cii Nhialic kɔckɛn ci lɔc bi kony , kɔcke guop , kek kɔc e cool e cɔl en akool ku wakɔu , acakaa yen e cool e gum kaŋ ne keden ?

text: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily . Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh , shall he find faith on the earth ?
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Abi ke dap kony . Ku na Wen e raan , te bi en rial , bi gam yok e piny nɔm ?

text: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous , and despised others :
text2: Go kaaŋe bɛ lɛk kɔc kɔk kɔc wen e rot ŋɔɔth , yan , piɛthki piɔth , ku yek kɔc kɔk tɔ ye kɔc rac :

text: Two men went up into the temple to pray ; the one a Pharisee , and the other a publican .
text2: yan , Kɔc kaarou acik lɔ luaŋdiit e Nhialic , lek lɔŋ ; tok ee raan e Parithai , ku tok ee raan e atholbo tɔ kut .

text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself , God , I thank thee , that I am not as other men are , extortioners , unjust , adulterers , or even as this publican .
text2: Go raan e Parithai kɔɔc nhial ku jɔ lɔŋ ale e yepiɔu , yan , Nhialic , yin lɛc nɔm , nɔn can cit kɔc kɔk , kɔc e kaŋ rum , kɔc e kɔc cam , kɔc e dieer lei kɔɔr , ku ca cit raane aya , raan e atholbo tɔ kute .

text: I fast twice in the week , I give tithes of all that I possess .
text2: Yɛn ee cam rɛɛc e akool kaarou e akool kadherou yiic , ku yin aa miɔɔc ne kaki kedhie ne toŋ wen thieer kek .

text: And the publican , standing afar off , would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven , but smote upon his breast , saying , God be merciful to me a sinner .
text2: Go raan e atholbo tɔ kut kɔɔc temec , ku reec enyin jat nhial , ku jɔ yepiɔu biɔɔk , ku lueel , yan , Nhialic , kok piɔu we yɛn , yɛn ee raan e kerac looi .

text: I tell you , this man went down to his house justified rather than the other : for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Raane aci yenɔm dhuony paande , ke ci tɔ piɛthpiɔu awar raan wen : raan ebɛn raan e rot tɔ dit abi tɔ koor : ku raan e rot kuɔɔr piny abi tɔ dit .

text: And they brought unto him also infants , that he would touch them : but when his disciples saw it , they rebuked them .
text2: Na wen , ke ke bii miththiiakaŋ tede yen aya , bi ke bɛn jak gup : ku te ci kɔckɛn e piooce e tiŋ , ke ke jɔki jɔɔny .

text: But Jesus called them unto him , and said , Suffer little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Go Yecu ke cɔɔl , ku lueel , yan , Palki miththiiakaŋ e ke bɔ te nuo yɛn , ku duoki ke pen : ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic ee kede kɔc cit keek .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Raan reec ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic noom cit man e mɛnhthiinakaŋ , ka cii bi lɔ thin etaitai .

text: And a certain ruler asked him , saying , Good Master , what shall I do to inherit eternal life ?
text2: Go thieec e bɛny tok , yan , Bɛny piɛth bɛny e weet , eeŋo ba looi ke ban piir athɛɛr lɔɔk lak ?

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? none is good , save one , that is , God .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Eeŋo e yin a tɔ piɛth ? acin raan toŋ piɛth nu , ee Nhialic etok .

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Honour thy father and thy mother .
text2: Yin ŋic cok ke loŋ , yan , Du dieer lei e kɔɔr , du ye nak , du ye kual , du ye ya caatɔ alueeth , ye wuur rieu ayi moor .

text: And he said , All these have I kept from my youth up .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Cokke aca ke ya dot kedhie ɣɔn aa yɛn meth aɣet ci enɔɔne .

text: Now when Jesus heard these things , he said unto him , Yet lackest thou one thing : sell all that thou hast , and distribute unto the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , follow me .
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu kake piŋ , ke jɔ yɔɔk , yan , Ee tok tei yen ŋoot ke dak yin . Jɔ kaku ɣaac kedhie , ku tɛke ke kɔc kuany nyiin , ke yin bi dɛ weu paannhial : ku jɔ bɛn , kuany acok .

text: And when he heard this , he was very sorrowful : for he was very rich .
text2: Ku te ci en ekake piŋ , ke dhiau piɔu aret : luɔi juece kake aret .

text: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful , he said , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu dhien dhiɛɛu en piɔu tiŋ , ke jɔ lueel , yan , Lɔ bi kɔc juec e kaken lɔ e ciɛɛŋ de Nhialicyic , ee keril oou !

text: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle ' s eye , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Teek bi thɔrol teek e hipɔ nyin , yen ee kepiɔl , ne luɔi bi raan juec e kake lɔ e ciɛɛŋ de Nhialicyic .

text: And they that heard it said , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Go kɔc wen cii kake piŋ goki thieec , yan , Ka ye ŋa dueere jɔ kony wei ?

text: And he said , The things which are impossible with men are possible with God .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Kak e kɔc dhal aye Nhialic ke leu .

text: Then Peter said , Lo , we have left all , and followed thee .
text2: Ku jɔ Petero lueel , yan , Tiŋ , wo e kaŋ nyaaŋ piny kedhie , ku kuanyku yicok .

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , There is no man that hath left house , or parents , or brethren , or wife , or children , for the kingdom of God ' s sake ,
text2: Go lɛk keek , yan , Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Acin raan ci ɣot pɔl , ku pɛl wun ku man , ku mithekɔcken , ku tik , ku mith , ne biak de ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic ,

text: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time , and in the world to come life everlasting .
text2: ku cii kajuec bi yok e pinye nɔm enɔɔne , awarki kakɛn ci pɔl , ku miak ne piny bi bɛn , ke jɔ piir athɛɛr yok .

text: Then he took unto him the twelve , and said unto them , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem , and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished .
text2: Na wen , ke cɔl kɔcke kathieer ku rou , ku yook keek , yan , Tieŋki , wo lɔ Jeruthalem , ku kaŋ kedhie ka ci gɔɔr e nebii ne kede Wen e raan abike thol e luɔi .

text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles , and shall be mocked , and spitefully entreated , and spitted on :
text2: Abi yien Juoor , ku abi geet guop , ku lɛɛte , ku ŋuute guop :

text: And they shall scourge him , and put him to death : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: ku abik dui , ku jɔki nɔk abi thou : go rot bɛ jɔt ekool ee kek diak .

text: And they understood none of these things : and this saying was hid from them , neither knew they the things which were spoken .
text2: Ku acin cook toŋ cik yokic ne kake yiic : jame aci mɔny keek , agoki ka ci lueel cuo ŋic .

text: And it came to pass , that as he was come nigh unto Jericho , a certain blind man sat by the way side begging :
text2: Na wen , aci thiɔk ke Jeriko , ke yok cɔɔr a rɛɛr e kueer kec ke lip :

text: And hearing the multitude pass by , he asked what it meant .
text2: ku jɔ kut e kɔc piŋ a tek , go thiec , yan , Ee kaŋo ?

text: And they told him , that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by .
text2: Goki yɔɔk , yan , Yecu de Nadhareth yeki teke .

text: And he cried , saying , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Go coot , yan , Yecu Wen e Dabid , kok piɔu we yɛn .

text: And they which went before rebuked him , that he should hold his peace : but he cried so much the more , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Go jɔɔny e kɔc wen cath tueŋ , yan , Mim ; go ŋuak e cɔt , yan , Wen e Dabid , kok piɔu we yɛn .

text: And Jesus stood , and commanded him to be brought unto him : and when he was come near , he asked him ,
text2: Na wen , ke Yecu kaac , ku jɔ kɔc yɔɔk , an , Bɛɛiki : ku te ci en bɛn tethiɔk , ke thieec , yan ,

text: Saying , What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee ? And he said , Lord , that I may receive my sight .
text2: Eeŋo nu e yipiɔu , ke ba luoi yin ? Go lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , ee luɔi ban bɛ yin yen akaar .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Receive thy sight : thy faith hath saved thee .
text2: Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Yiene : gamdu aci yi kony .

text: And immediately he received his sight , and followed him , glorifying God : and all the people , when they saw it , gave praise unto God .
text2: Go dap yin enɔnthime , ku jɔ kuany cok , ke lec Nhialic : go kɔc ebɛn , te ci kek e tiŋ , goki Nhialic leec .

text: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho .
text2: Na wen , ke lɔ ku reet Jerikoyic .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Zacchaeus , which was the chief among the publicans , and he was rich .
text2: Ku ade raan , di , raan cɔl Dhakayo , ku ye bɛny e kɔc e atholbo tɔ kut , ku ye raan juec e weuke .

text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was ; and could not for the press , because he was little of stature .
text2: Ku akɔɔr e yepiɔu luɔi bi en Yecu tiŋ nɔn ee yen raan yindi ; ku acin luɔi dueer en e tiŋ e baŋ de kut e kɔc , ne ciɛk cek en .

text: And he ran before , and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him : for he was to pass that way .
text2: Go kat , ke lɔ tueŋ , le ku kɛɛc e ŋaap nɔm , ke bi tiŋ : luɔi kɔɔr en teek etɛɛn .

text: And when Jesus came to the place , he looked up , and saw him , and said unto him , Zacchaeus , make haste , and come down ; for to day I must abide at thy house .
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu ɣet etɛɛn , ke jɔ nhial iieec , go tiŋ , ku yook , yan , Dhakayo , dap bɛn piny ; yɛn bi dhil reer ɣondu ekoole .

text: And he made haste , and came down , and received him joyfully .
text2: Go dap kɛɛc piny , ku jɔ loor ke mit piɔu .

text: And when they saw it , they all murmured , saying , That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner .
text2: Na wen , acik e tiŋ , ke ke ŋun e keyac kedhie , luelki , yan , Aci rot lɔ tɔ ye kaman e raan e kerac looi .

text: And Zacchaeus stood , and said unto the Lord ; Behold , Lord , the half of my goods I give to the poor ; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation , I restore him fourfold .
text2: Go Dhakayo rot jɔt , ku yook Bɛnydit , yan , Tiŋ , Bɛnydit , biak toŋ de kaki aba yɛn ke kɔc kuany nyiin miɔɔc ; ku na de kede raan daŋ ca noom ne goony elueth , ka ba bɛ cuoot e ŋuan .

text: And Jesus said unto him , This day is salvation come to this house , forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Kunydewei aci bɛn e ɣone ekoole , luɔi ee yen wen e Abraɣam aya .

text: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost .
text2: Wen e raan aa bɔ bi ke ci maar bɛn kɔɔr , ku bi bɛn kony wei .

text: And as they heard these things , he added and spake a parable , because he was nigh to Jerusalem , and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear .
text2: Na wen , apiŋki welke , ke jɔ jam ŋuak lek keek kaaŋ , luɔi ci en thiɔk ke Jeruthalem , agoki lueel , e kepiɔth , yan , bi ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic dap tuol .

text: He said therefore , A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom , and to return .
text2: Ago lueel , yan , Ade bɛny ci keny paan mec , le lupɔ noom etɛɛn , bi aa malik cieŋ piny , ku bi yenɔm bɛ lɔ dhuny .

text: And he called his ten servants , and delivered them ten pounds , and said unto them , Occupy till I come .
