text2: Na wen , ke cɔl liimke kathieer , ku gɛm keek jinii kathieer , go keek yɔɔk , yan , Ɣaacki keek aɣet te ban lɔ bɛn .

text: But his citizens hated him , and sent a message after him , saying , We will not have this man to reign over us .
text2: Ku amɛɛn kɔc ke paanden , goki kɔc tuɔɔc e yecok , kɔc bi e lɔ lueel , yan , Wo cii raane kɔɔr luɔi bi en wo cieŋ .

text: And it came to pass , that when he was returned , having received the kingdom , then he commanded these servants to be called unto him , to whom he had given the money , that he might know how much every man had gained by trading .
text2: Na wen , aci enɔm dhuny , ke ci aa malik cieŋ piny , ku jɔ kɔc yɔɔk , an , bi himke cɔl en , kɔc waan ci yien weu , ke bi ke cik yok e ɣooc ŋic , raan ebɛn .

text: Then came the first , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained ten pounds .
text2: Go lim tok kɔn bɛn tueŋ , bi ku lueel , yan , Bɛny , jinidu aci jinii bɛɛi kathieer .

text: And he said unto him , Well , thou good servant : because thou hast been faithful in a very little , have thou authority over ten cities .
text2: Go yɔɔk , yan , Apiɛth , yin ee lim piɛth : nɔn ci yin kethiinakaŋ ŋiec dot , ke yin bi aa bɛny ceŋ pɛɛnydit kathieer .

text: And the second came , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained five pounds .
text2: Na wen , ke iim ee kek rou jɔ bɛn , bi ku lueel , yan , Bɛny , jinidu aci jinii bɛɛi kadhic .

text: And he said likewise to him , Be thou also over five cities .
text2: Go mɛnhe yɔɔk aya , yan , Yin aya yin bi aa bɛny ceŋ pɛɛnydit kadhic .

text: And another came , saying , Lord , behold , here is thy pound , which I have kept laid up in a napkin :
text2: Na wen , ke lim daŋ bɔ , bi ku lueel , yan , Bɛny , tiŋ , jinidu ki , aca duut e lupɔ ku taau ;

text: For I feared thee , because thou art an austere man : thou takest up that thou layedst not down , and reapest that thou didst not sow .
text2: yɛn e riɔɔc e yin , luɔi ee yin raan rilic , yin ee kaŋ kuany ka kɛne taau piny , ku yin ee kaŋ tem ka kɛne com .

text: And he saith unto him , Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee , thou wicked servant . Thou knewest that I was an austere man , taking up that I laid not down , and reaping that I did not sow :
text2: Go yɔɔk , yan , Ne welkuon ci lueel , kek aban ke loŋdu guiir , yin ee lim rac . Yin ci a ŋic nɔn aa yɛn raan rilic , nɔn aa yɛn kaŋ kuany ka kɛn taau piny , ku nɔn aa yɛn kaŋ tem ka kɛn com :

text: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank , that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury ?
text2: eeŋo ken yin weuki yien kɔc e kaŋ kan , na enɔɔn can bɛne , ka di ca kaki yok acike nyin ŋuak ?

text: And he said unto them that stood by , Take from him the pound , and give it to him that hath ten pounds .
text2: Go kɔc kaac etɛɛn yɔɔk , yan , Namki jini tede yen , ku gamki raan wen de jinii kathieer .

text: ( And they said unto him , Lord , he hath ten pounds . )
text2: Goki lueel , yan , Bɛny , acath ke jinii kathieer .

text: For I say unto you , That unto every one which hath shall be given ; and from him that hath not , even that he hath shall be taken away from him .
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Raan cath ke kaŋ abi miɔɔc ; ku raan cin ke cath ke yen , acakaa ke cath ke yen abi noom tede yen .

text: But those mine enemies , which would not that I should reign over them , bring hither , and slay them before me .
text2: Ku jaki kɔcke bɛɛi kɔc de ater ne yɛn , kɔc waan reec ɛn , yan , ca bi aa malik bi keek cieŋ , bɛɛiki ke ku nakki ke e yanɔm .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he went before , ascending up to Jerusalem .
text2: Na wen , aci kake lueel , ke lɔ e keniim tueŋ , kuany kueer lɔ Jeruthalem .

text: And it came to pass , when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount called the mount of Olives , he sent two of his disciples ,
text2: Na wen , aci thiɔk ke Bethpagi keke Bethani , ne kuurdiit cɔl kuur e Olip , ke jɔ kɔckɛn e piooce tooc kaarou ,

text: Saying , Go ye into the village over against you ; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied , whereon yet never man sat : loose him , and bring him hither .
text2: ku lueel , yan , Laki paan nu e weniim tueŋ ; ku te ca we lɔ thin , ke we bi mɛnh e muni yok ke mac , mɛnh cin raan ci kɔn cath e yekɔu : luɔnyki , ku bɛɛiki etene .

text: And if any man ask you , Why do ye loose him ? thus shall ye say unto him , Because the Lord hath need of him .
text2: Ku na de raan thieec week , yan , Eeŋo luɔnyki yen ? ka bak pɔk nɔm en ale , yan , Ee luɔi kɔɔre Bɛnydit en .

text: And they that were sent went their way , and found even as he had said unto them .
text2: Go kɔc wen ci tooc lɔ , lek ku yokki ke cit man wen ci e lueel .

text: And as they were loosing the colt , the owners thereof said unto them , Why loose ye the colt ?
text2: Na wen , an , lonyki ye , ke ke jɔ kɔc de mɛnh e muul thieec , yan , Eeŋo luɔnyki mɛnh e muul ?

text: And they said , The Lord hath need of him .
text2: Goki lueel , yan , Ee Bɛnydit en a kɔɔr en .

text: And they brought him to Jesus : and they cast their garments upon the colt , and they set Jesus thereon .
text2: Goki bɛɛi tede Yecu : ku jɔki lupɔɔken cuat e mɛnh e muul kɔu , ku tɛɛuki Yecu e yekɔu .

text: And as he went , they spread their clothes in the way .
text2: Na wen , te ciɛth en , ke ke jɔ lupɔɔken aa thiɛth piny kueer .

text: And when he was come nigh , even now at the descent of the mount of Olives , the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen ;
text2: Ku te ci en guɔ thiɔk ke panydit , ku ci ɣet e kuur e Olip thar , ke kut diit e kɔcpiooce ebɛn ke ke jɔ piɔth miɛt ku lecki Nhialic e rol dit ne baŋ de luɔi dit ebɛn luɔi cik tiŋ ;

text: Saying , Blessed be the King that cometh in the name of the Lord : peace in heaven , and glory in the highest .
text2: luelki , yan , Thieithieei Malik bɔ ne rin ke Bɛnydit ! E mat tɔu paannhial , ku tɔu dhueeŋ tenhial ya !

text: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him , Master , rebuke thy disciples .
text2: Go kɔc kɔk ke Parithai nu e kut e kɔc yiic , goki lueel , yan , Bɛny , jany kɔckuon e piooce .

text: And he answered and said unto them , I tell you that , if these should hold their peace , the stones would immediately cry out .
text2: Go pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Wek yɔɔk , yan , Te miime kɔcke , ke kɔi gup adueerki coot enɔnthiine .

text: And when he was come near , he beheld the city , and wept over it ,
text2: Na wen , aci guɔ thiɔk , ke woi panydit , ku jɔ dhiau ,

text: Saying , If thou hadst known , even thou , at least in this thy day , the things which belong unto thy peace ! but now they are hid from thine eyes .
text2: lueel , yan , Tee yi ci ka ke mandu guɔ ŋic oou , yin guop , ekoolduone yoou ! ku enɔɔne , acike guɔ thiaan e yinyin .

text: For the days shall come upon thee , that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee , and compass thee round , and keep thee in on every side ,
text2: Akool abik bɛn tede yin , akool bi kɔc dɛ wek ater yi geeu ne rek , agoki yi tuɔɔk , ku jɔki yi pɛn lɔ biic e wut kec ebɛn ,

text: And shall lay thee even with the ground , and thy children within thee ; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another ; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation .
text2: ku abik yi rai piny aba nɔm kit we piny , yin weke niithkuon nu e yiyic ; ku acin kuur toŋ bik nyaaŋ piny e kuur daŋ nɔm e yiyic ; luɔi kuc yin kool e nɛmduon ci yi neem .

text: And he went into the temple , and began to cast out them that sold therein , and them that bought ;
text2: Go lɔ e luaŋdiit e Nhialicyic , le ku cieec kɔc wen e kaŋ ɣaac thin , ayi kɔc wen e kaŋ ɣɔɔc ;

text: Saying unto them , It is written , My house is the house of prayer : but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: ku yook keek , yan , E gɔɔr , yan , Luaŋdi ee luaŋ e lɔŋ : ku week , acak tɔ ye ɣon e cuɛɛr .

text: And he taught daily in the temple . But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him ,
text2: Go kɔc aa wɛɛt e luaŋditic e akool nyiin . Ku banydit ke ka ke Nhialic ku kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr ku kɔc dit e kɔc yiic akɔɔrki naŋ bi kek e nɔk .

text: And could not find what they might do : for all the people were very attentive to hear him .
text2: Ku acin ke cik yok ke bik looi : kɔc ebɛn ayek gɛɛk e yelɔɔm , ke ke piŋ welke .

text: And it came to pass , that on one of those days , as he taught the people in the temple , and preached the gospel , the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders ,
text2: Na ɣɔn , ekool tok e ninke yiic , te weet en kɔc luaŋdiit e Nhialic , ku guiir welpiɛth , ke banydit ke ka ke Nhialic ku kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr , ke ke jɔ bɛn ne roordit etok ,

text: And spake unto him , saying , Tell us , by what authority doest thou these things ? or who is he that gave thee this authority ?
text2: bik ku luelki , yan , Lɛke wook , ee riɛlou ee yin ekake looi ? ku eeŋa eraan e gɛm yin eriɛle ?

text: And he answered and said unto them , I will also ask you one thing ; and answer me :
text2: Go pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Ku yɛn aya , we ba thiec cook tok ; ku abak bɛɛr :

text: The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or of men ?
text2: yan , Baptinh e Jɔn , e bɔ nhial , ku e bɔ tede kɔc ?

text: And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then believed ye him not ?
text2: Goki keniim cat kapac , yan , Te lueel wok en , yan , Aa bɔ nhial ; ka bi lueel , yan , Eeŋodaŋ kɛn wek e gam ?

text: But and if we say , Of men ; all the people will stone us : for they be persuaded that John was a prophet .
text2: Ku na luelku yen , an , Aa bɔ tede kɔc ; wo bii kɔc biɔɔk e kɔi kedhie : luɔi ci kek Jɔn gam egɔk , yan , ee nebi .

text: And they answered , that they could not tell whence it was .
text2: Goki bɛɛr , yan , Akucku te e bi en thin .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Ayi yɛn aya , we ca lek riɛl luɔɔi ɛn ekake .

text: Then began he to speak to the people this parable ; A certain man planted a vineyard , and let it forth to husbandmen , and went into a far country for a long time .
text2: Na wen , ke jɔ kɔc lɛk kaaŋe : yan , Raan anu raan ci dom com , dom de tim mit cɔl enap , ago kuɛi kɔc bi en aa tiit , ku jɔ keny paan mec e pɛi juec .

text: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen , that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard : but the husbandmen beat him , and sent him away empty .
text2: Na wen , aci pɛɛi e luɔk e tiim bɛn , ke jɔ lim tok tuoc kɔc e dom tiit , yan , bik miɔɔc ne ka ci luɔk e dom e tiimic : go kɔc e dom tiit goki dui , ku jɔki cieec , ke cin ke muk .

text: And again he sent another servant : and they beat him also , and entreated him shamefully , and sent him away empty .
text2: Go lim daŋ bɛ tooc : agoki dui aya , ku lɛɛtki aret , ku jɔki cieec , ke cin ke muk .

text: And again he sent a third : and they wounded him also , and cast him out .
text2: Go daŋ bɛ tooc , goki dui abik yiek tetok , ku jɔki cuat e dom kec .

text: Then said the lord of the vineyard , What shall I do ? I will send my beloved son : it may be they will reverence him when they see him .
text2: Na wen , ke jɔ bɛny de dom lueel , yan , Eeŋo ba looi ? wendien nhiaar aba tooc : abi dɛ te bi kek e rieu te tiŋ kek en .

text: But when the husbandmen saw him , they reasoned among themselves , saying , This is the heir : come , let us kill him , that the inheritance may be ours .
text2: Ku te ci kɔc e dom tiit e tiŋ , ke ke jɔ kethook mat , yan , Wen bi kaŋ lɔɔk lak ki : bak nakku , ke ke bi lɔɔk lak bi aa keda .

text: So they cast him out of the vineyard , and killed him . What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them ?
text2: Goki cuat biic e dom kec , ku jɔki nɔk . Bi bɛny de dom ke jɔ luoi ŋo ?

text: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen , and shall give the vineyard to others . And when they heard it , they said , God forbid .
text2: Abi bɛn hi kɔc e dom tiite bɛn nɔk , ku jɔ dom yien kɔc kɔk . Na wen , acik e piŋ , ke jɔki lueel , yan , Tɔ peen Nhialic en ekene .

text: And he beheld them , and said , What is this then that is written , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner ?
text2: Go keek woi , ku lueel , yan , Kene ee kaŋo ke ci gɔɔre , yan , Kuur cii yiik rɛɛc , Yen mane guop aci tɔ ye kuur e aguk nɔm ?

text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken ; but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: Raan ebɛn raan bi lony e kuure nɔm abi dhuɔŋ ; ku raan bi kuure loony e yenɔm , ka bi mot abi ciet abuui !

text: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him ; and they feared the people : for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them .
text2: Ku banydit ke ka ke Nhialic ku kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr akɔɔrki luɔi bi kek e dɔm e thaar mane guop ; ee riɔɔc riɔɔc kek e kɔc tei : aŋicki nɔn e lueel en kaaŋe ne keden .

text: And they watched him , and sent forth spies , which should feign themselves just men , that they might take hold of his words , that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor .
text2: Goki tht , ku jɔki neem tooc , kɔc bi rot kɔc tɔki rot e kɔc piɛth , bik jamdɛn bi wooc bɛn jɔt , agoki yien mudhiir , le loŋde guiir .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly , neither acceptest thou the person of any , but teachest the way of God truly :
text2: Goki thieec , yan , Bɛny e weet , yin ŋicku nɔn e yin kaŋ lueel apiɛth ku wɛɛte kɔc apiɛth , ku cii kɔc e kuany yiic , ku ye kɔc wɛɛt e kueer e Nhialic ne yin .

text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar , or no ?
text2: Ci pal wook , an , buk Kaithar kuot atholbo , ku cie ye ?

text: But he perceived their craftiness , and said unto them , Why tempt ye me ?
text2: Go rueenyden ŋic , ku yook keek , yan , Eeŋo thɛm wek ɛn ?

text: Shew me a penny . Whose image and superscription hath it ? They answered and said , Caesar ' s .
text2: Nyuothki yɛn rial tok . Ee raanou ci gɔɔr e yekɔu , ayi rinke ? Goki bɛɛr , yan , Ee Kaithar .

text: And he said unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar ' s , and unto God the things which be God ' s .
text2: Go keek yɔɔk , yan , Yak Kaithar yinn ka ke Kaithar , ku yak Nhialic yien ka ke Nhialic .

text: And they could not take hold of his words before the people : and they marvelled at his answer , and held their peace .
text2: Ku akenki leu ne jon bi kek jame jɔt e kɔc niim : acik gai ne beer ci en e bɛɛr , ku jɔki mim .

text: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees , which deny that there is any resurrection ; and they asked him ,
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc kɔk ke Thadokai ke ke jɔ bɛn tede yen , kek kɔc wen e jai , yan , acin jon bi kɔc rot jɔt nu ; bik ku thiecki ,

text: Saying , Master , Moses wrote unto us , If any man ' s brother die , having a wife , and he die without children , that his brother should take his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: yan , Bɛny e weet , aci Mothe gaar wook , yan , Te ci manhe e raan thou , ku de nɔm tik , ku thou ke cin meth , ke manhe abi reer keke thŋde , dhieeth manhe nɔm .

text: There were therefore seven brethren : and the first took a wife , and died without children .
text2: Kɔc anuki kadherou wɛɛt ke raan tok : ku jɔ wendit tik thiaak , ago thou ke cin meth .

text: And the second took her to wife , and he died childless .
text2: Na wen , ke wen lɔ e yecok jɔ reer keke tiiŋde , ku jɔ thou ke cin meth .

text: And the third took her ; and in like manner the seven also : and they left no children , and died .
text2: Go wen ee kek diak jɔ reer keke yen ; ayi wɛɛt cieen kedhie ayadaŋ : ku acin mith cik nyaaŋ piny , ku jɔki thou .

text: Last of all the woman died also .
text2: Na wen , ke tik look thou e kecok cieen aya .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she ? for seven had her to wife .
text2: Na enɔɔne , ekool e jonerot e kɔc , ke tiiŋe bi aa tiiŋ e ŋa e keyiic ? aci reer ke keek kadherou .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , The children of this world marry , and are given in marriage :
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yook keek , yan , Mith ke pinye nɔm ayek thieek , ku yeke thiaak :

text: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world , and the resurrection from the dead , neither marry , nor are given in marriage :
text2: ku kɔc bi tɔ ye kɔc roŋ ne ɣet bi kek ɣet pinytui , ku yokki jonerɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic , aciki bi aa thieek , ku cike bi aa thiaak :

text: Neither can they die any more : for they are equal unto the angels ; and are the children of God , being the children of the resurrection .
text2: ku ciki dueer bɛ thou aya : acik thoŋ e tuucnhial ; ku ayek wɛɛt ke Nhialic , wɛɛt ke jonerot .

text: Now that the dead are raised , even Moses shewed at the bush , when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob .
text2: Ku jon ee kɔc ci thou jɔt , en aci Mothe nyuoth week ne gaardɛn ɣɔn gɛɛr ne kede tim cek , ɣɔn ci en Bɛnydit tɔ ye Nhialic de Abraɣam , ku Nhialic de Yithak , ku Nhialic de Jakop .

text: For he is not a God of the dead , but of the living : for all live unto him .
text2: Acie Nhialic de kɔc ci thou , ee Nhialic de kɔc piir : kɔc kedhie apiirki ne yen .

text: Then certain of the scribes answering said , Master , thou hast well said .
text2: Go kɔc kɔk e kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr goki bɛɛr , yan , Bɛny e weet , yin e loŋ tiiŋ nɔm .

text: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all .
text2: Na wen , ke ke jɔ riɔɔc ne thiec bi kek e bɛ thiec kaŋ .

text: And he said unto them , How say they that Christ is David ' s son ?
text2: Go ke thieec , yan , Eeŋo lueele kɔc en , yan , Kritho ee wen e Dabid ?

text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms , The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand ,
text2: Ku aci Dabid guop lueel ne awarek de Thaamic , yan , Bɛnydit aci Bɛnydiendit yɔɔk , yan , Nyuc e ciin cuenydi ,

text: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool .
text2: Aɣet te ban kɔc de ater ne yin tɔ ye ken ee yin yicok dhɔɔr .

text: David therefore calleth him Lord , how is he then his son ?
text2: Aye Dabid tɔ ye Bɛnydit , ku jɔ aa wende adi ?

text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Na wen , ke yook kɔckɛn e piooce abi kɔc piŋ kedhie , yan ,

text: Beware of the scribes , which desire to walk in long robes , and love greetings in the markets , and the highest seats in the synagogues , and the chief rooms at feasts ;
text2: Yak rot tiit e kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr , kɔc kɔɔr cath ke ke ceŋ lupɔɔ bar , ku nhiaarki thiec ee koc rot thiec e thuk yiic , ku nhiaarki ɣaan piɛth e ɣoot ke Nhialic yiic ayi ɣoot ke kecam yiic ;

text: Which devour widows ' houses , and for a shew make long prayers : the same shall receive greater damnation .
text2: ku yek ɣoot ke dieer cin niim roor cam yiic , ku yek lɔŋ e lɔŋ baar thiɛɛn kek kerɛɛcden : kedɛn tuc bik yok kek ekɔcke abi dit .

text: And he looked up , and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury .
text2: Na wen , ke liec nhial , ku jɔ kɔc juec e weuken tiŋ ke ke cuɛt kaken te wen ee ye Nhialic miɔɔc .

text: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites .
text2: Ago tiiŋ tok tiŋ aya tiiŋ kuany nyin cin nɔm moc , ke cuɛt weu thiiakaŋ kaarou thin , ka cit niiliim .

text: And he said , Of a truth I say unto you , that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all :
text2: Go lueel , yan , Wek lɛk eyic , yan , Tiiŋ kuany nyine tiiŋ cin nɔm moc aci kaŋ cuat thin awar kɔc kedhie :

text: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God : but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had .
text2: kɔcke kedhie acik kaŋ cuat ten ee Nhialic miɔɔc ne juec e weuken : ku thŋe ne kuany wen kuɛɛny en nyin aci kedɛn bi en piir cuat thin ebɛn .

text: And as some spake of the temple , how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts , he said ,
text2: Na wen , a jam kɔc kɔk e kede luaŋdiit e Nhialic , kieer ci e kur e kur ci lak ku ka ci kɔc gam Nhialic , ke jɔ lueel , yan ,

text: As for these things which ye behold , the days will come , in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: Na kake ka wɔiki , akool abik bɛn , kool bi ke dhuoor piny , ka cin kuur toŋ bi bɛ tɔu e kuur daŋ nɔm .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , but when shall these things be ? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass ?
text2: Goki thieec , yan , Bɛny e weet , bi kake jɔ tic nɛn ? Ku bi kɔc akool ŋic ne ŋo kool kɔɔr ekake tuol ?

text: And he said , Take heed that ye be not deceived : for many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and the time draweth near : go ye not therefore after them .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Yak rot tiit , ke we cii bi math : kɔc juec abik bɛn ne rinki , bik ku luelki , yan , Ya ki ! ku , yan , Piny e guɔ thiɔk ! Duoki ke kuany cok .

text: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions , be not terrified : for these things must first come to pass ; but the end is not by and by .
text2: Ku te ya wek tɔɔŋ piŋ ayi awenwen e kɔc , duoki piɔth e pau : kake abik dhil kɔn tic ; ku thok bi kaŋ thok aŋoot .

text: Then said he unto them , Nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom :
text2: Go keek yɔɔk , yan , Jure abi tɔŋ yien jure , ku yin paane tɔŋ paane :

text: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places , and famines , and pestilences ; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven .
text2: ku piny abi rot niɛŋ tɛɛn ku tɛɛn , ku bɔ cɔŋdit ku jɔɔk e kɔc thol ; ku ka ye kɔc tiŋ agoki riɔɔc abik nu ayi kagook bɔ nhial .

text: But before all these , they shall lay their hands on you , and persecute you , delivering you up to the synagogues , and into prisons , being brought before kings and rulers for my name ' s sake .
text2: Ku te ŋoote kake wei , ke we bii kɔc dɔm , ku yɔŋki week , ku leerki week e ɣoot ke Nhialic yiic , ku tɛɛuki week e aloc yiic , ku we bi aa bɛɛi e mahik niim ku bany niim ne biak de rinki .

text: And it shall turn to you for a testimony .
text2: Ku abi rot pɔk week ago aa caatɔdun .

text: Settle it therefore in your hearts , not to meditate before what ye shall answer :
text2: Yen aa wek loŋ dhek e wepiɔth , ke we cii bi diɛɛr e wepiɔth ne beer ba wek aa beer :

text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom , which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist .
text2: we ba gam thook pɛlenɔm , ke koc de ater ne week ke ke cii beer beer kek kedun bi leu , ayi teer teer kek ne week aya .

text: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents , and brethren , and kinsfolks , and friends ; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death .
text2: Ku we bi kɔc e dhieth week nyiɛɛn , ku nyiin mithekɔckun week , ayi kɔc raan e week , ayi mathkun ; ku kɔk ne weyiic abike tɔ nak abik thou .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake .
text2: Ku we bii kɔc maan kedhie ne biak de rinki .

text: But there shall not an hair of your head perish .
text2: Ku acin nhiem toŋ de wekniim bi maar .

text: In your patience possess ye your souls .
text2: We bi weikun yok ne guom aa wek kaŋ ŋiec guum .

text: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies , then know that the desolation thereof is nigh .
text2: Ku na tieŋki Jeruthalem aci tuɔɔk e rɛm ke tɔŋ , ke jaki ŋic nɔn ci riaakde thiɔk .

text: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains ; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out ; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto .
text2: Ekoole , e kɔc nu Judaya e ke kɔt leki e kurdit niim , ku kɔc nu baai e ke jel lek biic ; ku kɔc nu rɛɛr ya e ke cii be lɔ thin .

text: For these be the days of vengeance , that all things which are written may be fulfilled .
text2: Akoolke ee akool ke guur , kool bi kacigɔɔr thol e luɔi kedhie .

text: But woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck , in those days ! for there shall be great distress in the land , and wrath upon this people .
text2: Ku amawoou ne dieer liac ku dieer thuat e akoolke ! jiɛthepiɔu abi dit e piny nɔm , ku tɔu agonhdit e kɔcke yieth .

text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword , and shall be led away captive into all nations : and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles , until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled .
text2: Ku abike nɔk e abatau , ku pecke leereke e Juoor yiic ebɛn : ku Jeruthalem abi kacic e Juoor , a thooke run ke Juoor .

text: And there shall be signs in the sun , and in the moon , and in the stars ; and upon the earth distress of nations , with perplexity ; the sea and the waves roaring ;
text2: Ku kagook abik tic e akɔl nyin , ku pɛɛi nyin , ku kuɛl nyiin ; ku ne piny nɔm jiɛthepiɔu abi nu e juoor yiic , ku mumenɔm , abapdit abi awuoou de apiɔɔk a maŋ thin ;

text: Men ' s hearts failing them for fear , and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth : for the powers of heaven shall be shaken .
text2: kɔc abik wei miɛt ne riɔɔc , ku diɛɛr ee kek diɛɛr ne ke bɔ e piny nɔm ; karil nu tenhial abike niɛŋ .

text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory .
text2: Na ele , ke kɔc abik Wen e raan tiŋ a bɔ e luatic ke cath ke riɛldit ku dhueeŋ dit .

text: And when these things begin to come to pass , then look up , and lift up your heads ; for your redemption draweth nigh .
text2: Ku te ci kake rot gɔl e bɛn , jaki nhial lieec , ku jatki weniim ; wɛɛrduon bi we wɛɛr bei ee guɔ thiɔk .

text: And he spake to them a parable ; Behold the fig tree , and all the trees ;
text2: Go keek lɛk kaaŋ : yan , Wɔiki ŋaap , ayi tiim kedhie :

text: When they now shoot forth , ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand .
text2: te ci kek guɔ nyok , ke jaki tiŋ aguɔki ŋic gup nɔn ci ruel thiɔk .

text: So likewise ye , when ye see these things come to pass , know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand .
text2: Yen a ba wek thiɔk ci ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic thiɔk ŋic aya , te tieŋ wek kake abɔ .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass away , till all be fulfilled .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan Rem de enɔɔne acii bi thok , te ŋoote kake ke ke ken thok e bɛn kedhie .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away : but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Tenhial ku piny abik liu , ku welki aciki bi liu ananden .

text: And take heed to yourselves , lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting , and drunkenness , and cares of this life , and so that day come upon you unawares .
text2: Yak rot tiit , ke we cii piɔth bi aa thiaŋ ne kajuec yak cam , ku win ee mɔu we wit , ku diɛɛr ne ka ke piir enɔɔne , ke we cii ekoole bi mook ethiau :

text: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth .
text2: ku acit man dhie dɔme lɛi e wien yen abi ekoole kɔc mook kedhie ethiau kɔc rɛɛr e tiɔp nɔm ebɛn .

text: Watch ye therefore , and pray always , that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass , and to stand before the Son of man .
text2: Yen aa wek rot tiit , ku yak cool e lɔŋ e akooinyiin kedhie , ke bi we tɔ ye kɔc e roŋ ne luɔi ba wek poth e ka bi bɛne kedhie , aguɔki kɔɔc e Wen e raan nɔm .

text: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple ; and at night he went out , and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives .
text2: Ku ye kɔc wɛɛt luaŋdiit e Nhialic akol ; na theen , ke ye lɔ biic le nhi e kuur e Olip .

text: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple , for to hear him .
text2: Go kɔc aa rieel miak etɛɛn kedhie bik tede yen luaŋdiit e Nhialic , bik kede bɛn piŋ .

text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh , which is called the Passover .
text2: Ku aliith e knin cinic luɔu aci thiɔk , ahith cɔl Winythok .

text: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him ; for they feared the people .
text2: Go banydit ke ka ke Nhialic ku kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr goki ke bi kek e nɔk kɔɔr ; acik riɔɔc e kɔc .

text: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot , being of the number of the twelve .
text2: Na wen , ke Catan lɔ e Judath piɔu , rinkɛn kɔk acɔlke Yithkariɔt , ku ye raan toŋ e kɔc kathieer ku rou yiic .

text: And he went his way , and communed with the chief priests and captains , how he might betray him unto them .
text2: Go lɔ le jam guiir keke bany ke ka ke Nhialic ku bany ke alathkeer , ne nyiin bi en e nyien keek .

text: And they were glad , and covenanted to give him money .
text2: Goki piɔth miɛt , ku matki kethook , an , bik gam weu .

text: And he promised , and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude .
text2: Go keden gam , ku jɔ kool piɛth kɔɔr kool dueer en e nyien keek te hiuwe kut e kɔc .

text: Then came the day of unleavened bread , when the passover must be killed .
text2: Na wen , ke akool e kuin cinic luɔu bɔ , kool bi nyɔŋ de Winythok dhil nɔk .

text: And he sent Peter and John , saying , Go and prepare us the passover , that we may eat .
text2: Go Yecu Petero tooc keke Jɔn , yan , Lak guiekki wook ka ke Winythok , buk lɔ cuet .

text: And they said unto him , Where wilt thou that we prepare ?
text2: Goki thieec , yan , Ee tenou kɔɔr e yipiɔu te bi wok guik thin ?

text: And he said unto them , Behold , when ye are entered into the city , there shall a man meet you , bearing a pitcher of water ; follow him into the house where he entereth in .
text2: Go ke yɔɔk , yan , Tieŋki , te ca wek lɔ panydit , ke we bi rɔm ne mony ɣɛɛc tony e piu ; jaki kuany cok ɣon bi en lɔ thin .

text: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house , The Master saith unto thee , Where is the guestchamber , where I shall eat the passover with my disciples ?
text2: Ku we bi raan de ɣot yɔɔk , yan , Yin thieec Bɛny e weet , yan , Nu ɣon e kamaan tenou , ɣon bi wo Winythok lɔ cuet thin woke kɔckien e piooce ?

text: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished : there make ready .
text2: Ku abi we nyuoth ɣondiit nu nhial ɣon deyic kaŋ : jaki guik thin .

text: And they went , and found as he had said unto them : and they made ready the passover .
text2: Goki lɔ , ku yokki ke cit man wen ci en e lɛk keek ; goki ka ke Winythok guik .

text: And when the hour was come , he sat down , and the twelve apostles with him .
text2: Na wen , aci thaar ee cam bɛn , ke jɔ nyuc , ku nyuc tuuc kathieer ku rou ne yen etok .

text: And he said unto them , With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer :
text2: Go ke yɔɔk , yan , Aa ya cok e kaar ɛn en e yapiɔu ne luɔi bi wok Winythok cuet woke week etok , te ŋuɔɔt ɛn ke ya ken kaŋ guɔ guum :

text: For I say unto you , I will not any more eat thereof , until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God .
text2: wek yɔɔk , yan , Yɛn cii bi bɛ cuet e ye eliŋliŋ , te ŋoot en ke ken guɔ thok e ciɛɛŋ de Nhialicyic .

text: And he took the cup , and gave thanks , and said , Take this , and divide it among yourselves :
text2: Na wen , ke nom biny , ku leec Nhialic , ku lueel , yan , Namki kene , bak tɛk rot .

text: For I say unto you , I will not drink of the fruit of the vine , until the kingdom of God shall come .
text2: Wek yɔɔk , yan , Yɛn cii bi bɛ dek ne mith ke enap , te ŋoote ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic ke ken bɛn .

text: And he took bread , and gave thanks , and brake it , and gave unto them , saying , This is my body which is given for you : this do in remembrance of me .
text2: Na wen , ke nom knin ci pam , ku leec Nhialic , ku wɛɛkic , ku yin keek , lueel , yan , Guopdi ki , guopdien ci gam ne baŋdun week ; yak kene looi ne taŋ ba wek weniim aa tak ne yɛn .

text: Likewise also the cup after supper , saying , This cup is the new testament in my blood , which is shed for you .
text2: Ku te ci kecam thok , ke jɔ looi aya ne biny , ku lueel , yan , Binye ee loŋ ci piac mac ne riɛmdi , riɛm bi kueer ne baŋdun week .

text: But , behold , the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table .
text2: Ku tieŋki , ciin e raan nyiin ɛn anu e pam e cam nɔm keke ciindi etok .

text: And truly the Son of man goeth , as it was determined : but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed !
text2: Wen e raan alɔ eyic , cit man ci e kɔn lueel , an , bi dhil lɔ : ku amawoou ne eraane raan bi e nyiɛɛn !

text: And they began to inquire among themselves , which of them it was that should do this thing .
text2: Ku jɔki rot luɔp , yan , Eeŋa ne woyiic raan bi kene looi ?

text: And there was also a strife among them , which of them should be accounted the greatest .
text2: Go ater rot cak e keyiic , yan , Ee raanou bi tɔ dit e woyiic .

text: And he said unto them , The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them ; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors .
text2: Go keek yɔɔk , yan , Mahik ke Juoor ayek kɔc cieŋ , ku bany e kɔc cieŋ ayeke tɔ ye adhueŋ .

text: But ye shall not be so : but he that is greatest among you , let him be as the younger ; and he that is chief , as he that doth serve .
text2: Ku week , we cii bi ciet keek ; ku raan e dit e weyiic ne ye ciet mɛnh koor : ku raan e ya bɛny , ka bi ya ciet raan e kɔc luooi .

text: For whether is greater , he that sitteth at meat , or he that serveth ? is not he that sitteth at meat ? but I am among you as he that serveth .
text2: Ku eeŋa dit , raan e reer ten ee cam , ku ye raan e kɔc luooi ? cie raan e reer ten ee cam ? ku yɛn ee tɔu e weyiic cil cit raan e kɔc luooi .

text: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations .
text2: Ku week , di , wek ee kɔc ee cool e tɔu ne yɛn etok e themdien ci a themic ;

text: And I appoint unto you a kingdom , as my Father hath appointed unto me ;
text2: ku wek yien ciɛɛŋ , cit man e ci e yien ɛn e Waar ,

text: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom , and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel .
text2: bak aa cam ku dɛkki e pamdi nɔm e ciɛɛŋdiyic ; ku we bi aa reer e thony niim ku guiɛɛrki loŋ de dhien ke Yithrael kathieer ku rou .

text: And the Lord said , Simon , Simon , behold , Satan hath desired to have you , that he may sift you as wheat :
text2: Na wen , ke lueel Bɛnydit , yan , Thimon , Thimon , tiŋ , Catan aci we kɔɔr aret luɔi bi en we noom , bi we kiic cit man e agamɔ :

text: But I have prayed for thee , that thy faith fail not : and when thou art converted , strengthen thy brethren .
text2: ku yɛn ci lɔŋ ne biakdu , ke gamdu cii bi dak : ku yin , te ci yin yipiɔu guɔ puk , ke yi rit mithekɔckun piɔth .

text: And he said unto him , Lord , I am ready to go with thee , both into prison , and to death .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , te mɛce wo wo yin etok e aloocyic , arek te ciɛk wok thou etok , ke yɛn dueer gam .

text: And he said , I tell thee , Peter , the cock shall not crow this day , before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Yin yɔɔk , Petero , yan , Ajith acii bi kɔn kiu ekoole , te ŋoot yin ke yi ken a jai raandiak , yan , Akuoc .

text: And he said unto them , When I sent you without purse , and scrip , and shoes , lacked ye any thing ? And they said , Nothing .
text2: Na wen , ke ke thieec , yan , Waan tuɔɔc ɛn week ke cin kuth e weu , ku cin athep e kecam , ku cin war , de ke ci we bɛn dak ? Goki , yan , Acinkedaŋ .

text: Then said he unto them , But now , he that hath a purse , let him take it , and likewise his scrip : and he that hath no sword , let him sell his garment , and buy one .
text2: Go ke yɔɔk , yan , Ku enɔɔne , raan de kuth e weu , ke noom , ku nom athep e kecam aya : ku raan cin nɔm abatau , ke ɣɔɔc lupɔde , ɣoc en rot abatau ;

text: For I say unto you , that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me , And he was reckoned among the transgressors : for the things concerning me have an end .
text2: wek yɔɔk , yan , Cooke , cook ci gɔɔr ne kedi , aŋoot ke bi dhil thok e yaguop , cook ci lueel , yan , Aci mat keke kɔc e loŋ dhɔŋic etok : ka ke yɛn adeki thokden aya , thok bi kek thok .

text: And they said , Lord , behold , here are two swords . And he said unto them , It is enough .
text2: Goki lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , tiŋ , abatɛɛu ki , kaarou . Go lueel , yan , E loi .

text: And he came out , and went , as he was wont , to the mount of Olives ; and his disciples also followed him .
text2: Na wen , ke lɔ biic , le kuur e Olip , cit man ee yen cool e lɔ ; ku kuɛny kɔckɛn e piooce cok aya .

text: And when he was at the place , he said unto them , Pray that ye enter not into temptation .
text2: Ku te ci en ɣet etɛɛn , ke ke jɔ yɔɔk , yan , Laŋki , ke we cii bi lɔ e themic .

text: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone ' s cast , and kneeled down , and prayed ,
text2: Ago rot mɛɛc ke keek te dueer raan cuoop te dɛɛny en kɔɔi ; go emiɔl tuk , ku lɛŋ ,

text: Saying , Father , if thou be willing , remove this cup from me : nevertheless not my will , but thine , be done .
text2: yan , Waar , na nu e yipiɔu , ke yi nom binye tede yɛn ; ku acie kede piɔndi tei , tɔ loi e kede piɔndu .

text: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven , strengthening him .
text2: Go tunynhial tuol tede yen , ke bɔ nhial , bi ye bɛn riit piɔu .

text: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly : and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground .
text2: Na wen , aci piɔu jiɛth aret , ke jɔ lɔŋ aret awar man awen : arek abi tucde aa thuat cit man e rim dit kɔɔth ke ke loony piny .

text: And when he rose up from prayer , and was come to his disciples , he found them sleeping for sorrow ,
text2: Na wen , aci rot jɔt tedɛn e lɛŋ en , ke jɔ bɛn tede kɔcpiooce , ku yok keek anin ne jiɛth wen ci kek piɔth jiɛth ;

text: And said unto them , Why sleep ye ? rise and pray , lest ye enter into temptation .
text2: go ke yɔɔk , yan , Eeŋo nienki ? jatki rot , laŋki , ke we cii bi them .

text: And while he yet spake , behold a multitude , and he that was called Judas , one of the twelve , went before them , and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him .
text2: Ku te ŋoot en ke jam , di , ke kut e kɔc e ke bɔ , awɛt raan cɔl Judath keek , ee raan toŋ de kɔc kathieer ku rou ; ku jɔ ɣet te nu Yecu le ciim .

text: But Jesus said unto him , Judas , betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss ?
text2: Go Yecu thieec , yan , Judath , nyiɛɛne Wen e raan ne ciem ?

text: When they which were about him saw what would follow , they said unto him , Lord , shall we smite with the sword ?
text2: Na wen , aci kɔc nu e yelɔɔm ke bi lɔɔk tic tiŋ , ke jɔki thieec , yan , Bɛnydit , buk kip e abatau ?

text: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest , and cut off his right ear .
text2: Go raan tok e keek go lim de bɛnyditt tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic kiɛp yic wei , yiny cuec .

text: And Jesus answered and said , Suffer ye thus far . And he touched his ear , and healed him .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Jaki pɔl e pek aya . Na wen , ke jiɛk yin , tɔ dem .

text: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests , and captains of the temple , and the elders , which were come to him , Be ye come out , as against a thief , with swords and staves ?
text2: Go Yecu banydit ke ka ke Nhialic thieec ku thieec bany ke luaŋdiit e Nhialic , ku roordit , kɔc wen bii tɔŋ tede yen , yan , Cak bɛn biic cit man e ka yin tɔŋ cuɛɛr , ke we muk tɔɔŋ ku thieec ?

text: When I was daily with you in the temple , ye stretched forth no hands against me : but this is your hour , and the power of darkness .
text2: Waan aa yɛn cool e reer woke week luaŋdiit e Nhialic , wek e ken a dɔm : apiɛth , thaardun ki ekene , ku ye riɛl e cuɔlepiny .

text: Then took they him , and led him , and brought him into the high priest ' s house . And Peter followed afar off .
text2: Na wen , ke dɔmki , ku thelki , leerki ɣon e bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic . Go Petero lɔɔk kuany cok ke mec .

text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall , and were set down together , Peter sat down among them .
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc e ke koth mac e gɔɔlic cil , ku jɔki nyuc etok , go Petero lɔ nyuc e keyiic .

text: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire , and earnestly looked upon him , and said , This man was also with him .
text2: Na wen , ke tiŋ nyan tok e mac nɔm ku jɔ toom guop aret , go lueel , yan , Raane aa cath ke yen aya .

text: And he denied him , saying , Woman , I know him not .
text2: Go jai , yan , Tik , ee raan kuoc .

text: And after a little while another saw him , and said , Thou art also of them . And Peter said , Man , I am not .
text2: Na wen , etethiine , ke tiŋ raan daŋ , go lueel , yan , Yin ee raan toŋden aya . Go Petero jai , yan , Mɔny , yɛn cie raanden .

text: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed , saying , Of a truth this fellow also was with him : for he is a Galilaean .
text2: Na wen , te cit thaar tok , ke ŋɛk e raan daŋ , yan , Ee yic , raane aa ye cath ke yen ; e luɔi ee yen raan e Galili .

text: And Peter said , Man , I know not what thou sayest . And immediately , while he yet spake , the cock crew .
text2: Go Petero lueel , yan , Mɔny , yɛn kuc ke luel . Na wen , aŋoot ke jam , ke ajith jɔ guɔ kiu enɔnthiine .

text: And the Lord turned , and looked upon Peter . And Peter remembered the word of the Lord , how he had said unto him , Before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: Go Bɛnydit rot puk , woi Petero . Go Petero yenɔm tak e wel ke Bɛnydit , ne lek ci en e lɛk en , yan , Te ŋoote ajith ke ken kiu ekoole , ke yin bi a jai raandiak .

text: And Peter went out , and wept bitterly .
text2: Go lɔ biic , le dhiau e dhien kec .

text: And the men that held Jesus mocked him , and smote him .
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc muk Yecu ke getki guop , ku duiki .

text: And when they had blindfolded him , they struck him on the face , and asked him , saying , Prophesy , who is it that smote thee ?
text2: Agoki kum nyin , ku jɔki yup nyin , ku thiecki , yan , Luel : eeŋa raan e yup yin ?

text: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him .
text2: Ku lɛɛtki arac ne wel juec kɔk wel rac .

text: And as soon as it was day , the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together , and led him into their council , saying ,
text2: Na wen , aci piny guɔ ru , ke yan e roordit jɔ gueer , keke banydit ke ka ke Nhialic ayi kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr , goki thel leerki e loŋdenic , ku luelki , yan ,

text: Art thou the Christ ? tell us . And he said unto them , If I tell you , ye will not believe :
text2: Ten ee yin Kritho , ke lɛke wook . Go lueel , yan , Ciɛk , an , lɛke week , ka caki bi gam ;

text: And if I also ask you , ye will not answer me , nor let me go .
text2: ku te thiɛɛc ɛn week , ka caki bi bɛɛr , ku caki ya pal .

text: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God .
text2: Gɔl enɔɔne , ke Wen e raan abi reer e biak cueny de riɛldiit e Nhialic .

text: Then said they all , Art thou then the Son of God ? And he said unto them , Ye say that I am .
text2: Goki thieec kedhie , yan , Ka yin jɔ ya Wen e Nhialic ? Go ke yɔɔk , yan , Ye ka , ke cak lueele .

text: And they said , What need we any further witness ? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth .
text2: Goki lueel , yan , Eeŋodaŋ kɔɔr wok caatɔ daŋ ? wokgup acuk piŋ e yethok .

text: And the whole multitude of them arose , and led him unto Pilate .
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc wen ci gueer e ke jɔt rot , ku biiki e Pilato nɔm .

text: And they began to accuse him , saying , We found this fellow perverting the nation , and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar , saying that he himself is Christ a King .
text2: Ku jɔki gaany , yan , Wo e raane yok , ee jurda thoi nɔm , ee kɔc pɛn luɔi yin kek Kaidhar atholbo , ku ye lueel nɔn ee yen Kritho malik .

text: And Pilate asked him , saying , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And he answered him and said , Thou sayest it .
text2: Go Pilato thieec , yan , Ye malik de Judai ? Go bɛɛr , yan , Yeka , ke ci lueele .

text: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people , I find no fault in this man .
text2: Go Pilato lɛk banydit ke ka ke Nhialic ku kuut ke kɔc , yan , Acin kerɛɛc ca yok tede eraane .

text: And they were the more fierce , saying , He stirreth up the people , teaching throughout all Jewry , beginning from Galilee to this place .
text2: Goki ŋak nɔm awar man awen , luelki , yan , Ee kɔc riir niim , e weet ee yen kɔc wɛɛt e paan e Judai ebɛn , gɔl e Gahli , aɣet ci ene .

text: When Pilate heard of Galilee , he asked whether the man were a Galilaean .
text2: Na wen , aci Pilato ye piŋ , ke jɔ luɔp nɔn ee yen raan e Galili .

text: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod ' s jurisdiction , he sent him to Herod , who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time .
text2: Ku te ci en e ŋic nɔn nu yen e ciɛɛŋ de Kerodic , ke jɔ tuoc Kerod , luɔi tɔu en e Jeruthalem e akoolke yen Kerod .

text: And when Herod saw Jesus , he was exceeding glad : for he was desirous to see him of a long season , because he had heard many things of him ; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him .
text2: Na wen , aci Kerod Yecu tiŋ , ke jɔ piɔu miɛt alal ; aa ye kɔɔr e yepiɔu ecaŋɣɔn luɔi bi en e tiŋ , luɔi ci en kajuec piŋ ne kede ; ku aŋath luɔi bi en kegok bi looi tiŋ .

text: Then he questioned with him in many words ; but he answered him nothing .
text2: Go thieec e wel juec ; go cien ke ci bɛɛr .

text: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him .
text2: Ku kaac banydit ke ka ke Nhialic ku kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr , ke gɔɔnyki aret .

text: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought , and mocked him , and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe , and sent him again to Pilate .
text2: Na wen , ke dhalki guop , yen Kerod keke remdɛn e tɔŋ , ku jɔki geet guop , agoki yiek kɔu lupɔ ci lɔ riauriau , ku jɔki bɛ pɔk nɔm Pilato .

text: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together : for before they were at enmity between themselves .
text2: Go Kerod keke Pilato goki jɔ mat kapac ekool mane guop : waan aake de ater ne rot .

text: And Pilate , when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people ,
text2: Na wen , ke Pilato cɔl banydit ke ka ke Nhialic , ku cɔɔl bany ceŋ piny ayi kɔc kedhie , yan , bik gueer ,

text: Said unto them , Ye have brought this man unto me , as one that perverteth the people : and , behold , I , having examined him before you , have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him :
text2: ku lek keek , yan , Raane acak bɛɛi tede yɛn , yan , ee raan e kɔc thoi niim : ku tieŋki , aca luɔp e weniim , ku acin kerɛɛc ca yok tede raane ne ka gaany wek en :

text: No , nor yet Herod : for I sent you to him ; and , lo , nothing worthy of death is done unto him .
text2: acakaa Kerod aya , acin ke ci yok ; aci bɛ pɔk nɔm wook ; ku tieŋki , acin ke ci looi ke dueer en roŋ ke thuɔɔu .

text: I will therefore chastise him , and release him .
text2: Aba jɔ dui tei , ku ja pɔl .

text: ( For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast . )
text2: ( Abi raan tok dhil luony keek ekool e aliithe . )

text: And they cried out all at once , saying , Away with this man , and release unto us Barabbas :
text2: Goki coot e rol tok , yan , Nyaaiye raane , ku luonye wook Barabath .

text: ( Who for a certain sedition made in the city , and for murder , was cast into prison . )
text2: Barabath ee raan ci taau e aloocyic ne baŋ de tɔŋ ci yien miric e panyditic , ku ne baŋ de naŋ de raan .

text: Pilate therefore , willing to release Jesus , spake again to them .
text2: Go Pilato bɛ jam ke keek , akɔɔr luɔi bi en Yecu lony ;

text: But they cried , saying , Crucify him , crucify him .
text2: goki coot , luelki , yan , Piaate , piaate .

text: And he said unto them the third time , Why , what evil hath he done ? I have found no cause of death in him : I will therefore chastise him , and let him go .
text2: Go keek bɛ yɔɔk raandiak , yan , Ee kaŋo , ee kerɛɛc ŋo ci raane looi ? Acin ke ca yok tede yen ke dueere ye nɔk : yen a ban e dui , ku ja lony .

text: And they were instant with loud voices , requiring that he might be crucified . And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed .
text2: Goki ŋak nɔm e rol dit , ke laŋki , an , bi piaat e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu . Go Pilato tiaam e rolden .

text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required .
text2: Go loŋ teem , an , bi looi acit man e kedɛn kɔɔrki .

text: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison , whom they had desired ; but he delivered Jesus to their will .
text2: Go raan luony keek , raan waan ci taau e aloocyic ne baŋ de tɔŋ ci yien miric ku naŋ de raan , raan wen kɔɔrki ; ku jɔ Yecu yien keek , bik luoi kede piɔnden .

text: And as they led him away , they laid hold upon one Simon , a Cyrenian , coming out of the country , and on him they laid the cross , that he might bear it after Jesus .
text2: Na wen , athelki ye wei , ke ke dɔm raan cɔl Thimon raan e Kurene , ke bɔ rɛɛr , goki tim ci riiu nɔm taau e yeket , bi ɣaac e Yecu cok .

text: And there followed him a great company of people , and of women , which also bewailed and lamented him .
text2: Ku kuany cok e kut diit e kɔc , ku diaar , dieer biek kepiɔth ku dhieuki .

text: But Jesus turning unto them said , Daughters of Jerusalem , weep not for me , but weep for yourselves , and for your children .
text2: Go Yecu yenɔm wɛl keek , ku lueel , yan , Wek nyiir ke Jeruthalem , duoki ya dhieu , dhieuki rot , ku mithkun .

text: For , behold , the days are coming , in the which they shall say , Blessed are the barren , and the wombs that never bare , and the paps which never gave suck .
text2: Tieŋki , akool abik bɛn , akool bi kɔc yen aa lueel , yan , Thieithieei e dieer ci rol , ku madhieth ken guɔ dhieth , ku thin kene kɔn thuat .

text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains , Fall on us ; and to the hills , Cover us .
text2: E akoolke abi kɔc kurdit yɔɔk , yan , Wieekki e woniim ; ku yookki kur kor , yan , Kuomki wo piny .

text: For if they do these things in a green tree , what shall be done in the dry ?
text2: Ku na loiki kake e tim tiɔpic , eeŋo bik looi ne tim ci riɛlic ?

text: And there were also two other , malefactors , led with him to be put to death .
text2: Ku ade kɔc kɔk kaarou , kɔc ci kerac looi , ke ke thel ne yen etok lɔ ke nɔk .

text: And when they were come to the place , which is called Calvary , there they crucified him , and the malefactors , one on the right hand , and the other on the left .
text2: Na wen , acik ɣet te cɔl Apet , ke jɔki piaat etɛɛn e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu , ku pieetki kɔc ci kerac looi , tok e baŋ cuenyde , ku tok e baŋ cam .

text: Then said Jesus , Father , forgive them ; for they know not what they do . And they parted his raiment , and cast lots .
text2: Na wen , ke lueel Yecu , yan , Waar , pal keek ; ne kuny kuc kek ke loiki . Goki lupɔɔke tɛk rot ne deeny deeny kek gɛk .

text: And the people stood beholding . And the rulers also with them derided him , saying , He saved others ; let him save himself , if he be Christ , the chosen of God .
text2: Ku kaac kɔc juec e ke daai . Go bany ceŋ piny goki geet guop aya , luelki , yan , Aci kɔc kɔk kony ; tɔ kony rot , ten ee yen Kritho de Nhialic , raandɛn ci lɔc .

text: And the soldiers also mocked him , coming to him , and offering him vinegar ,
text2: Ku get guop alathkeer ayadaŋ , acik bɛn tede yen , gɛmki mɔn ci wac ,

text: And saying , If thou be the king of the Jews , save thyself .
text2: ku luelki , yan , Ten ee yin Malik de Judai , ke yi kony rot .

text: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek , and Latin , and Hebrew , THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: Ku ade jam ci gɔɔr e yenɔm nhial , ne gaar de Giriki ku Roma ku Eberu , yan , KENE EE MALIK DE JUDAI .

text: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him , saying , If thou be Christ , save thyself and us .
text2: Na wen , ke raan toŋ de kɔc ci piaat ne yen etok , kɔc ci kerac looi , ke jɔ lat e lɛt rac , ku lueel , yan , Na ye Kritho , ke yi kony rot ku kony wook aya .

text: But the other answering rebuked him , saying , Dost not thou fear God , seeing thou art in the same condemnation ?
text2: Go raan daŋ ci piaat keke yen bɛɛr , jieeny , yan , Kɛne cak riɔɔc e Nhialic , nɔn jiɛɛm yin wuya , ke yin ci ketuc mane yok aya ?

text: And we indeed justly ; for we receive the due reward of our deeds : but this man hath done nothing amiss .
text2: Ku ketuc cuk yok wook aci tiiŋ nɔm egɔk ; wo ci ke roŋ ke luɔida jɔ yok : ku raane acin kerɛɛc ci looi .

text: And he said unto Jesus , Lord , remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom .
text2: Ku lek Yecu , yan , Bɛnydit , tak yinɔm e yɛn , te ci yin lɔ e ciɛɛŋduyic .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Verily I say unto thee , To day shalt thou be with me in paradise .
text2: Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Yin yɔɔk eyic , yan , Ekoole ke yin bi nu weke yɛn e Paradeitho .

text: And it was about the sixth hour , and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour .
text2: Na wen , te cit thaar kadhetem , ke mɔɔth bɔ e piny nɔm ebɛn aɣet thaar dheŋuan ,

text: And the sun was darkened , and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst .
text2: akɔl e maar : ku jɔ lupɔ diit de luaŋdiit e Nhialic yic rɛɛt e ciɛɛlic .

text: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice , he said , Father , into thy hands I commend my spirit : and having said thus , he gave up the ghost .
text2: Na wen , ke Yecu cot e rol diit , lueel , yan , Waar , weiki a taau keek e yicin : ku te ci en welke lueel , ke jɔ thook .

text: Now when the centurion saw what was done , he glorified God , saying , Certainly this was a righteous man .
text2: Na wen , ke bɛny de nɔm alathkeer kabɔt , te ci en ke ci tic tiŋ , ke lec Nhialic , lueel , yan , Raane ee raan piɛthpiɔu eyic .

text: And all the people that came together to that sight , beholding the things which were done , smote their breasts , and returned .
text2: Ku kuut ke kɔc kedhie , kɔc wen ci gueer bik bɛn daai e kene , te ci kek ke ci looi tiŋ , ke ke dhuny keniim , ku biakki kepiɔth .

text: And all his acquaintance , and the women that followed him from Galilee , stood afar off , beholding these things .
text2: Go kɔc ŋic en kedhie ku dieer waan e ye kuany cok ne Galili , goki kɔɔc temec , ku dɛɛiki ne kake .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Joseph , a counseller ; and he was a good man , and a just :
text2: Na wen , di , ke raan cɔl Jothep , raan nu e loŋ de kɔc ditic , ku ye raan piɛth ku piɛth e loŋ ,

text: ( The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them ; ) he was of Arimathaea , a city of the Jews : who also himself waited for the kingdom of God .
text2: ( raan ken loŋden gam ayi luɔidɛn cik looi ) , ee raan e Arimathayo , panydiit toŋ de Judai , ku yenguop aŋath ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic :

text: This man went unto Pilate , and begged the body of Jesus .
text2: e lɔ tede Pilato en eraane , le ku lip guop de Yecu .

text: And he took it down , and wrapped it in linen , and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone , wherein never man before was laid .
text2: Go bɛɛi piny , ku deer e lupɔ linon , ku jɔ taau e raŋic , raŋ ci wec e kuuric , raŋ cin raan ci kɔn tɔɔu thin .

text: And that day was the preparation , and the sabbath drew on .
text2: Ku aa ye kool e guiɛɛk , ku ci kool e thabath thiɔk .

text: And the women also , which came with him from Galilee , followed after , and beheld the sepulchre , and how his body was laid .
text2: Na wen , ke dieer waan ci bɛn bei e Galili ne yen etok , ke kuanyki cok , ke ke jɔ raŋ tiŋ , ku tiŋki tau ci guopde tɔɔu .

text: And they returned , and prepared spices and ointments ; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment .
text2: Goki keniim dhuny , lek wɛl ci ŋireŋir guik ku miok . Goki lɔŋ ekool e thabath cit man ci e lueel e loŋic .

text: Now upon the first day of the week , very early in the morning , they came unto the sepulchre , bringing the spices which they had prepared , and certain others with them .
text2: Na wen , ekool tueŋ wen e akool dherou , te ci piny ru , ke ke bɔ te nu raŋ , abiiki wɛl wen cik guik wɛl ci ŋireŋir , ku cath kɔc kɔk ne keek .

text: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre .
text2: Goki kuur yok aci laar wei e raŋ thok .

text: And they entered in , and found not the body of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Na wen , acik lɔ thin , goki guop de Bɛnydit Yecu kɛn yok .

text: And it came to pass , as they were much perplexed thereabout , behold , two men stood by them in shining garments :
text2: Na wen , aŋootki ke ke gai ne kene , di , ke ke tiŋ kɔc kaarou ke ke kaac e kelɔm , aceŋki lupɔɔ lɔ bilbil :

text: And as they were afraid , and bowed down their faces to the earth , they said unto them , Why seek ye the living among the dead ?
text2: na wen , ke ke pau piɔth , abik kenyin guoot piny , agoki ke thieec , yan , Eeŋo kaar wek raan piir tede kɔc ci thou ?

text: He is not here , but is risen : remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee ,
text2: Aliu etene , e rot jɔt : takki weniim ne wel waan ci lɛk week , ɣɔn ŋoot en Galili ,

text: Saying , The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men , and be crucified , and the third day rise again .
text2: yan , Wen e raan abi dhil yien kɔc rac , ku bi piaat e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu , ku bi rot bɛ jɔt ekool ee kek diak .

text: And they remembered his words ,
text2: Goki keniim tak e welke ,

text: And returned from the sepulchre , and told all these things unto the eleven , and to all the rest .
text2: ku dhunyki keniim e raŋ nɔm , lek kake kedhie lɛk kɔc kathieer ku tok , ayi kɔc kɔk .

text: It was Mary Magdalene , and Joanna , and Mary the mother of James , and other women that were with them , which told these things unto the apostles .
text2: Ee yi Mari Magdalene , keke Joana , ku Mari man Jakop , ku dieer kɔk cath ne keek , kek aa lek tuuc ekake .

text: And their words seemed to them as idle tales , and they believed them not .
text2: Go welken ciet ɣaar yiic tede keek , agoki ke cuo gam .

text: Then arose Peter , and ran unto the sepulchre ; and stooping down , he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves , and departed , wondering in himself at that which was come to pass .
text2: Na wen , ke Petero jɔt rot , kɔt ke lɔ e raŋ nɔm : le ku guŋ luiit raŋic , go lupɔɔ linon tiŋ ke ke tɔu kapac ; go jal le paanden ke gai ne ke ci tic .

text: And , behold , two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus , which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs .
text2: Na wen , di , ke kɔc kaarou e keyiic aake cath ekool mane guop ke ke lɔ paan cɔl Emauth , kaam de paane ke Jeruthalem acit mail kadherou .

text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened .
text2: Ku jɔki guiir kapac ne ke ci tice kedhie .

text: And it came to pass , that , while they communed together and reasoned , Jesus himself drew near , and went with them .
text2: Na wen , aguiirki kapac , ku yek rot luɔp , ke Yecu guop cut rot tethiɔk , ku le cath ke keek etok .

text: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him .
text2: Ku acike kum nyiin , agoki cuo ŋic .

text: And he said unto them , What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another , as ye walk , and are sad ?
text2: Go ke thieec , yan , Ee jam ŋo guieerki wapac , ke we cath ? Goki gak ke ke kaac , ke ke gut kenyin piny .

text: And the one of them , whose name was Cleopas , answering said unto him , Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem , and hast not known the things which are come to pass therein these days ?
text2: Go raan tok e keek , cɔl Kleopath , go bɛɛr , yan , Yin , ye kaman rɛɛr yitok e Jeruthalem , ku kuc ke ci tic etɛɛn e akoolke ?

text: And he said unto them , What things ? And they said unto him , Concerning Jesus of Nazareth , which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people :
text2: Go ke thieec , yan , Ee kaŋo ? Goki lueel , yan , Ka ke Yecu de Nadhareth , ee nebi ril e luɔide ku welke e Nhialic nɔm ku kɔc niim kedhie :

text: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death , and have crucified him .
text2: ku luɔi ci banydit ke ka ke Nhialic e yien miric , ayi banykuɔn e wo cieŋ , bi loŋde teem , an , nak , goki piaat e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu .

text: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel : and beside all this , to day is the third day since these things were done .
text2: Ku wook , aa yok ŋɔɔth , nɔn ee yen raan bi Yithiael wɛɛr bei . Ku mate cooke e cokke yiic ayadaŋ , yan , Nin acik aa diak ekoole te waan tice kake .

text: Yea , and certain women also of our company made us astonished , which were early at the sepulchre ;
text2: Ku dieer kɔk ne dieer ke remda acik wo tɔ gai ayadaŋ , dieer ci dap rieel e raŋ nɔm wenamiak ;

text: And when they found not his body , they came , saying , that they had also seen a vision of angels , which said that he was alive .
text2: na wen , akenki guopde yok , ke ke jɔ bɛn , bik ku luelki , yan , cik tuucnhial tiŋ , tuuc wen lueel en , yan , a piir .

text: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre , and found it even so as the women had said : but him they saw not .
text2: Go kɔc kɔk ne kɔc rɛɛr ne wook goki lɔ e raŋ nɔm , lek ku yokki ke cit man wen ci diaar e lueel : ku yenguop akenki tiŋ .

text: Then he said unto them , O fools , and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken :
text2: Go ke yɔɔk , yan , Agai kɔc dhan oou , kɔc e kaŋ rɛɛc dap gam ka ci nebii lueel kedhie !

text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things , and to enter into his glory ?
text2: Ken Kritho kake dhil guum , ku jɔ lɔ tedɛn e dhueeŋ ?

text: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets , he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself .
text2: Na wen , ke ke weer jam nu e kacigɔɔr yiic kedhie , jam de kede yenguop , gɔl e Mothe aɣɔl nebii kedhie .

text: And they drew nigh unto the village , whither they went : and he made as though he would have gone further .
text2: Na wen , acik thiɔk e paan le kek thin , go , an , le tueŋ .

text: But they constrained him , saying , Abide with us : for it is toward evening , and the day is far spent . And he went in to tarry with them .
text2: Goki peen , yan , Rɛɛre we wook , piny aci aa theen ; akɔl e thiɔk ke lɔ piny . Go lɔ ɣot le reer ke keek .

text: And it came to pass , as he sat at meat with them , he took bread , and blessed it , and brake , and gave to them .
text2: Na wen , aci nyuc ke keek ten ee cam , ke nom kuin ci pam , leec Nhialic , ku wɛɛkic , ku gɛm keek .

text: And their eyes were opened , and they knew him ; and he vanished out of their sight .
text2: Goke liep nyin , ku jɔki ŋic ; go lɔ riar piny e kenyin .

text: And they said one to another , Did not our heart burn within us , while he talked with us by the way , and while he opened to us the scriptures ?
text2: Goki rot thieec kapac , yan , Kenku piɔth dep e woyiic thin , wen jiɛɛm en ke wook kueer , ke weer wo kacigɔɔr ?

text: And they rose up the same hour , and returned to Jerusalem , and found the eleven gathered together , and them that were with them ,
text2: Goki rot jɔt e thaar mane guop , ku beki keniim dhuony Jeruthalem , agoki kɔc kathieer ku tok yok acik gueer , keke kɔc e reer ne keek ,

text: Saying , The Lord is risen indeed , and hath appeared to Simon .
text2: ku luelki , yan , Bɛny dit aci rot jɔt eyic , ku aci tuol tede Thimon .

text: And they told what things were done in the way , and how he was known of them in breaking of bread .
text2: Go kɔc wen kaarou goki ka ci tic kueer guiir , ku ŋiny ci kek e jɔ ŋic e wɛɛk ci en kuin ci pam waakic .

text: And as they thus spake , Jesus himself stood in the midst of them , and saith unto them , Peace be unto you .
text2: Na wen , aŋootki ke ke luel kake , ke Yecu guop ke jɔ tuol e keyiic cil , yook keek , yan , E mat tɔu e weyiic .

text: But they were terrified and affrighted , and supposed that they had seen a spirit .
text2: Goki piɔth pau ku riɔcki aret , luelki , an , ee jɔk en e tiŋki .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye troubled ? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts ?
text2: Go ke thieec , yan , Eeŋo pau wek piɔth ? ku eeŋo luɛɛl wek kajuec e wepiɔth ?

text: Behold my hands and my feet , that it is I myself : handle me , and see ; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones , as ye see me have .
text2: Wɔiki yacin ku yacok , nɔn ee yen yɛnguop ? tiɛcki yɛn , ku tieŋki ; jɔk acin riŋ ku yom , cit man ca wek e tiŋ nɔn ciɛth kek e yɛn .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he shewed them his hands and his feet .
text2: Ku te ci en kene lueel , ke jɔ ecin nyuoth keek ayi yecok .

text: And while they yet believed not for joy , and wondered , he said unto them , Have ye here any meat ?
text2: Na wen , aŋoothki ke ke ken guɔ gam ne miɛt mit kek piɔth , ke ke gai , ke ke jɔ thieec , yan , Dɛki kecam etene ?

text: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish , and of an honeycomb .
text2: Goki miɔɔc ne baŋ toŋ de rɛc ci geet , ku athin e kiec .

text: And he took it , and did eat before them .
text2: Go noom , ku jɔ cam e keniim .

text: And he said unto them , These are the words which I spake unto you , while I was yet with you , that all things must be fulfilled , which were written in the law of Moses , and in the prophets , and in the psalms , concerning me .
text2: Go keek yɔɔk , yan , Welki ki , wel waan ca lɛk week , waan ŋuɔɔt ɛn ke ya tɔu wo week , yan , Kaŋ kedhie abik dhil aa yith , ka ci gɔɔr ne kedi e loŋ de Motheyin , ku nebii yiic , ku thaam yiic .

text: Then opened he their understanding , that they might understand the scriptures ,
text2: Go kaŋ wɛɛr keek apiɛth , ke ke bi kacigɔɔr aa yok yiic ,

text: And said unto them , Thus it is written , and thus it behoved Christ to suffer , and to rise from the dead the third day :
text2: ku yook keek , yan , Aci gɔɔr ale , yan , Kritho abi kaŋ dhil guum , ku be rot jɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic ekool ee kek diak ;

text: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations , beginning at Jerusalem .
text2: ku , yan , Puŋdepiɔu ku pal e karac abike ya guieer juoor ebɛn ne rinke , gɔl e Jeruthalem .

text: And ye are witnesses of these things .
text2: Ku wek ee caatɔɔ de kake .

text: And , behold , I send the promise of my Father upon you : but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem , until ye be endued with power from on high .
text2: Ku tieŋki , wek tuoc ke cii Waar lueel , an , bi gam : ku week , jaki reer e panydit Jeruthalem , aɣet te bi we piɔth ne riɛldiit bɔ nhial .

text: And he led them out as far as to Bethany , and he lifted up his hands , and blessed them .
text2: Na wen , ke ke leer biic ɣeet keek Bethani : ku jɔ ecin jat nhial , thieei keek .

text: And it came to pass , while he blessed them , he was parted from them , and carried up into heaven .
text2: Na wen , aŋoot ke ke thieei , ke jel e keyiic , ku jɔ jɔt leere paannhial .

text: And they worshipped him , and returned to Jerusalem with great joy :
text2: Goki lam , ku beki keniim dhuony Jeruthalem ke ke ci piɔth miɛt aret :

text: And were continually in the temple , praising and blessing God . Amen .
text2: ku yek cool e tɔu luaŋdiit e Nhialic , ke ke ye Nhialic leec . Amen .

text: In the beginning was the Word , and the Word was with God , and the Word was God .
text2: Tᴇ ɣɔn thɛɛr gɔle kaŋ Jam aa nu , ku nu Jam keke Nhialic , ku Jam yen aye Nhialic .

text: The same was in the beginning with God .
text2: Yenguop aa nu keke Nhialic te ɣɔn gɔle kaŋ .

text: All things were made by him ; and without him was not any thing made that was made .
text2: Kaŋ kedhie yen aa cak keek ; ku acin ke ci cak ke liiu yen thin .

text: In him was life ; and the life was the light of men .
text2: Yen aa deyic piir ; ku piire aa ye ɣɛɛrepiny e kɔc .

text: And the light shineth in darkness ; and the darkness comprehended it not .
text2: Ku ɣɛɛrepiny aa ye riau tecol , ku aacii cuɔlepiny e tiŋ .

text: There was a man sent from God , whose name was John .
text2: Ade raan e tooc Nhialic , raan cɔl Jɔn .

text: The same came for a witness , to bear witness of the Light , that all men through him might believe .
text2: Aa bɔ ke ye caatɔ , bi kɔc bɛn lɛk ɣɛɛrepiny , bi kɔc kedhie ya gam ne liemde .

text: He was not that Light , but was sent to bear witness of that Light .
text2: Acie yen ee ɣɛɛrepinye , aa bɔ bi kɔc bɛn lɛk ɣɛɛrepiny .

text: That was the true Light , which lighteth every man that cometh into the world .
text2: Ɣɛɛrepiny yic ka , ɣɛɛrepiny e raan riaau ebɛn , raan e bɛn e piny nɔm .

text: He was in the world , and the world was made by him , and the world knew him not .
text2: Aa nu e piny nɔm , ku yen aa cak piny , ku aa kuc piny .

text: He came unto his own , and his own received him not .
text2: Aa bɔ tede kɔcke , ago kɔcke cuo ye gam .

text: But as many as received him , to them gave he power to become the sons of God , even to them that believe on his name :
text2: Ku kɔc ci gam , kek aa miɔɔc e riɛl bik aa mith ke Nhialic , kek kɔc gam rinke :

text: Which were born , not of blood , nor of the will of the flesh , nor of the will of man , but of God .
text2: kɔc kene dhieeth e riɛm , ku keneke dhieeth e kede guop , ku keneke dhieeth e kede piɔn e moc , aake dhieeth Nhialic .

text: And the Word was made flesh , and dwelt among us , ( and we beheld his glory , the glory as of the only begotten of the Father , ) full of grace and truth .
text2: Ago Jam aa guop , ku tɔu e woyiic ( agoku dhueeŋde tiŋ dhueeŋ cit dhueeŋ e Wen toŋ cii Wun dhieeth etok ) , aci piɔu thiaŋ ke dhueeŋ ku yic .

text: John bare witness of him , and cried , saying , This was he of whom I spake , He that cometh after me is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Jɔn aa ye caatɔ de yen , ago coot , an , Raan waan aa yɛn kede lueel ki , yan , Raan bi bɛn e yacok , yen anu e yanɔm tueŋ : e luɔi ee yen e kɔn nu ne yɛn .

text: And of his fulness have all we received , and grace for grace .
text2: Ku ne kuɛth ci en kuɛth yen aci wok kaŋ yok wodhie , ayi dhueeŋdepiɔu dhueeŋ ci ro ŋuak .

text: For the law was given by Moses , but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ .
text2: Loŋ aa gɛme Mothe , ku dhueeŋdepiɔu ku yic aake bɔ ne Yecu Kritho .

text: No man hath seen God at any time ; the only begotten Son , which is in the bosom of the Father , he hath declared him .
text2: Acin raan ci Nhialic kɔn tiŋ ekool tok ; ee Wen toŋdɛn ci dhieeth etok , Wen nu e Wun yɔu , yen aa nyuuth en .

text: And this is the record of John , when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him , Who art thou ?
text2: Jam e lueel Jɔn ki , ɣɔn tooce Judai bany ke ka ke Nhialic ku Lebii , toocki keek e Jeruthalem lek thieec , yan , Ee yin ŋa ?

text: And he confessed , and denied not ; but confessed , I am not the Christ .
text2: Ago lɔ gam , ku cii jai ; gɛm , an , Yɛn cie Kritho .

text: And they asked him , What then ? Art thou Elias ? And he saith , I am not . Art thou that prophet ? And he answered , No .
text2: Agoki thieec , yan , Ka yee ŋa ? Ye Eiija ? Go , yan , Ei , yɛn cie Elija . Goki , yan , Ka ye nebi waane ? Go bɛɛr , jiɛi , yan , Ɣei .

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? that we may give an answer to them that sent us . What sayest thou of thyself ?
text2: Agoki be thieec , yan , Ku ee yin ŋa ? luɔi bi wok e lɔ lɛk kɔc e toc wook . Ka yin , jɔ aa ŋa ?

text: He said , I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness , Make straight the way of the Lord , as said the prophet Esaias .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Yɛn ee rol e raan cot e jɔɔric , yan , Riecki kueer e Bɛnydit , acit man ci nebi Yithaya ye lueel .

text: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees .
text2: Ku kɔc waan ci tooc aake ye kɔc ke Parithai .

text: And they asked him , and said unto him , Why baptizest thou then , if thou be not that Christ , nor Elias , neither that prophet ?
text2: Agoki thieec , yan , Eeŋo ee yin kɔc baptith , te cii yin e Kritho , ku cie Elija , ku cie nebi waane ?

text: John answered them , saying , I baptize with water : but there standeth one among you , whom ye know not ;
text2: Go Jɔn puk nɔm , yan , Yɛn ee kɔc baptith ne piu : ku ade raan kaac e weyiic cil , raan kuocki ,

text: He it is , who coming after me is preferred before me , whose shoe ' s latchet I am not worthy to unloose .
text2: yen ee raan bɔ e yacok , raan nu e yanɔm tueŋ , raan can roŋ woke luɔi duɛɛr ɛn thion e warde dɔk .

text: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan , where John was baptizing .
text2: Kake aake loi e Bethabara e Jordan nɔm lɔŋtni , te waan e Jɔn kɔn baptith thin .

text: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him , and saith , Behold the Lamb of God , which taketh away the sin of the world .
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , ke Jɔn tiŋ Yecu ke bɔ tede yen , go lueel , yan , Wɔiki , Amɛthok de Nhialic ki , anyiɛɛi kerɛɛc de piny nɔm !

text: This is he of whom I said , After me cometh a man which is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Ye ki , yen raan waan aa yɛn kede lueel , yan , Ade raan bɔ e yacok , raan nu e yanɔm tueŋ , e luɔi ee yen e kɔn nu e yɛn .

text: And I knew him not : but that he should be made manifest to Israel , therefore am I come baptizing with water .
text2: Ku aa kuoc guop ; ku luɔi bi e ŋic e Yithrael , yen aa ba yɛn , ba kɔc bɛn baptith ne piu .

text: And John bare record , saying , I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove , and it abode upon him .
text2: Go Jɔn kede lueel , yan , Yɛn aa tiŋ Weidit ke ke bɔ nhial ke cit guop guuk , bi ku reer e yenɔm .

text: And I knew him not : but he that sent me to baptize with water , the same said unto me , Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending , and remaining on him , the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Ku aa kuoc guop : ku raan e toc ɛn ba kɔc bɛn baptith ne piu , yen aa leke yɛn , yan , Raan ba tiŋ a bi Weidit piny bik ku reerki e yenɔm , yen aye raan bi kɔc aa baptith e Weidit Ɣer .

text: And I saw , and bare record that this is the Son of God .
text2: Aguɔ tiŋ , ku ja lɛk kɔc , yan , Kene ee Wen e Nhialic .

text: Again the next day after John stood , and two of his disciples ;
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , ke Jɔn be kɔɔc keke kɔckɛn e piooce kaarou ;

text: And looking upon Jesus as he walked , he saith , Behold the Lamb of God !
text2: go Yecu woi guop te ciɛth en , go lueel , yan , Wɔiki , Amɛthok de Nhialic ki !

text: And the two disciples heard him speak , and they followed Jesus .
text2: Go kɔcpiooceke kaarou goki piŋ , te jiɛɛm en , agoki Yecu kuany cok .

text: Then Jesus turned , and saw them following , and saith unto them , What seek ye ? They said unto him , Rabbi , ( which is to say , being interpreted , Master , ) where dwellest thou ?
text2: Go Yecu liec , ago ke tiŋ akuanyki ecok , ku jɔ ke thieec , yan , Eeŋo kaarki ? Goki lueel , yan , Rabi ( yen aye Bɛny e weet , ne thoŋda ) , yan , Rɛɛre tenou ?

text: He saith unto them , Come and see . They came and saw where he dwelt , and abode with him that day : for it was about the tenth hour .
text2: Go ke yɔɔk , yan , Bak tieŋki . Goki bɛn ku tiŋki te reer en thin , ku jɔki cool e yen ekoole : te waan le kek aa cit thaar kathieer .

text: One of the two which heard John speak , and followed him , was Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother .
text2: Raan tok e keek kaarou , kɔc wen piŋ jam de Jɔn ku kuanyki Yecu cok , acɔl Andereyo , manhe e Thimon Petero .

text: He first findeth his own brother Simon , and saith unto him , We have found the Messias , which is , being interpreted , the Christ .
text2: Go Thimon manhe guop kɔn yok , ku lek en , yan , Wok e Mathia yok ( yen aye Kritho , ne thoŋda ) .

text: And he brought him to Jesus . And when Jesus beheld him , he said , Thou art Simon the son of Jona : thou shalt be called Cephas , which is by interpretation , A stone .
text2: Go bɛɛi tede Yecu . Go Yecu woi guop , ku lueel , yan , Yin Thimon , wen e Jona : yin bi cɔɔl Kepath ( yen aye Petero , ku ye Kuur , ne thoŋda ) .

text: The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee , and findeth Philip , and saith unto him , Follow me .
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , ke Yecu de piɔu jal le Galili , ago Pilip yok : ku jɔ lɛk en , yan , Kuany acok .

text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida , the city of Andrew and Peter .
text2: Ku Pilip ee raan e Bethaida , ee panydit , paan e yi Andereya keke Petero .

text: Philip findeth Nathanael , and saith unto him , We have found him , of whom Moses in the law , and the prophets , did write , Jesus of Nazareth , the son of Joseph .
text2: Go Pilip Nathanyel yok , ku jɔ lɛk en , yan , Wok e raan yok , raan ci Mothe kede gɔɔr e loŋic , ayi nebii , Yecu de Nadhareth , wen e Jothep .

text: And Nathanael said unto him , Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth ? Philip saith unto him , Come and see .
text2: Go Nathanyel thieec , yan , Dueer kepiɛth bɛn bei e Nadhareth ? Go Pilip lueel , yan , Ba tiŋ .

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him , and saith of him , Behold an Israelite indeed , in whom is no guile !
text2: Na wen , ke Yecu tiŋ Nathanyel ke bɔ tede yen , go lueel , yan , Wɔiki , raan e Yithrael egɔk ka , raan cin yac rueeny !

text: Nathanael saith unto him , Whence knowest thou me ? Jesus answered and said unto him , Before that Philip called thee , when thou wast under the fig tree , I saw thee .
text2: Go Nathanyel thieec , yan , E yi ŋic ɛn tenou ? Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Waaŋ ŋoot Pilip ke ken yin cɔɔl , waan reer yin e ŋaap thar , yin eca tiŋ .

text: Nathanael answered and saith unto him , Rabbi , thou art the Son of God ; thou art the King of Israel .
text2: Go Nathanyel bɛɛr , lueel , yan , Rabi , yin ee Wen e Nhialic ! ku yin ee Malik de Yithrael !

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Because I said unto thee , I saw thee under the fig tree , believest thou ? thou shalt see greater things than these .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , lueel , yan , Nɔn can e lɛk yin , yan , Yin e tieŋ e ŋaap thaar , yen a gɛm yin ? Yin bi kadit tiŋ kawar kake .

text: And he saith unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Hereafter ye shall see heaven open , and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man .
text2: Ago lɛk en , yan , Yin yɔɔk eyic , yan , Wadaŋ , we bi paannhial tiŋ aɣɔɔr , ku tieŋki tuucnhial ke Nhialic ke ke lɔ nhial ku biki piny ne Wen e raan nɔm .

text: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee ; and the mother of Jesus was there :
text2: Na wen , ekool ee kek diak , ade thieŋ ci lueel e Kana de Galili ; ku nu man Yecu etɛɛn :

text: And both Jesus was called , and his disciples , to the marriage .
text2: ayi Yecu ayi kɔckɛn e piooce acike cɔɔl e thieekic ayadaŋ .

text: And when they wanted wine , the mother of Jesus saith unto him , They have no wine .
text2: Na wen , aci mɔu dak , mɔndɛn cɔl wany , ke Yecu yook e man , yan , Acin keniim wany .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , what have I to do with thee ? mine hour is not yet come .
text2: Go Yecu puk nɔm , yan , Tiiŋe , eeŋoda ne yin ? Thaardi aŋoot ke ken bɛn .

text: His mother saith unto the servants , Whatsoever he saith unto you , do it .
text2: Go man kɔc yin kɔc miith yɔɔk , yan , Te de yen ke lek week , ke luɔiki .

text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone , after the manner of the purifying of the Jews , containing two or three firkins apiece .
text2: Ade tony dit ci cap etɛɛn kadhetem , tony ke piu , tony e cuec e kuur , kak ee kɔc ke piny , cit man e ciɛɛŋ de Judai , tony tok adueer roŋ keke thapiɔɔ kaŋuan ayi dhetem .
