text: Jesus saith unto them , Fill the waterpots with water . And they filled them up to the brim .
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Thiaŋki tony e piu . Goki ke thiɔɔŋ acin kethook te dak .

text: And he saith unto them , Draw out now , and bear unto the governor of the feast . And they bare it .
text2: Ago lɛk keek , yan , Gɛmki ke bei enɔɔne , lɛɛrki ke tede raan nu e thieek nɔm . Goki ke lɛɛr .

text: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine , and knew not whence it was : ( but the servants which drew the water knew ; ) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom ,
text2: Na wen , aci raan nu e thieek nɔm piu thieep , piu wen ci rot tɔ ye wany , ku kuc te bi en thin ( ku ŋic kɔc yin kɔc miith kɔc wen gem piu ) , ke raan nu e thieek nɔm jɔ mony de thieek cɔɔl ,

text: And saith unto him , Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine ; and when men have well drunk , then that which is worse : but thou hast kept the good wine until now .
text2: ku lek en , yan , Raan ebɛn ee wany piɛth kɔn taau ; na ele , te ci kɔc yiic a niak , ke jɔ wany piɛth emaath bɛɛi : ku yin e wany piɛth peen aɣet ci enɔɔne .

text: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee , and manifested forth his glory ; and his disciples believed on him .
text2: Gol e gɔle gook bi kɔc ke gai , ki , ke cii Yecu looi e Kana de Galili , abi dhueeŋde nyuɔɔth ; go kɔckɛn e piooce goki kede gam .

text: After this he went down to Capernaum , he , and his mother , and his brethren , and his disciples : and they continued there not many days .
text2: Na wen , aci kene wan , ke jel le Kapernaum , yen ku man , ku mithekɔcken , ku kɔckɛn e piooce : agoki ceŋ etɛɛn akool cii juec .

text: And the Jews ' passover was at hand , and Jesus went up to Jerusalem ,
text2: Ahith e Judai e guɔ thiɔk , aliith cɔl Winythok , go Yecu lɔ Jeruthalem .

text: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves , and the changers of money sitting :
text2: Ago kɔc yok luaŋditt e Nhialic , kɔc e mioor ɣaac ayi thok ayi guk , ku yok kɔc e weu waar yiic ke ke rɛɛr .

text: And when he had made a scourge of small cords , he drove them all out of the temple , and the sheep , and the oxen ; and poured out the changers ' money , and overthrew the tables ;
text2: Go tiaar yieer e keet , ku cieec ke biic kedhie ne luaŋdiit e Nhialicic , ayi thok , ayi mioor ; ku luuŋ weu piny weu ke kɔc e weu waar yiic , ago pɛɛmken pɔk yiic piny ;

text: And said unto them that sold doves , Take these things hence ; make not my Father ' s house an house of merchandise .
text2: ku lek kɔc e guk ɣaac , yan , Nyaaiki kake etene ; duoki ɣon e Waar e tɔ ye ɣon e ɣooc .

text: And his disciples remembered that it was written , The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up .
text2: Ago kɔckɛn e piooce agoki keniim cat nɔn ci e gɔɔr , yan , Dit aa yɛn piɔu dit e kede ɣondu e ya cuet piɔu .

text: Then answered the Jews and said unto him , What sign shewest thou unto us , seeing that thou doest these things ?
text2: Go Judai bɛɛr , thiecki , yan , Ee gok ŋo nyuothe wook , ke loi yin ekake ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Destroy this temple , and in three days I will raise it up .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , lek keek , yan , Riakki luaŋ e Nhialice , ku aba bɛ tɔ kaac e nin kadiak .

text: Then said the Jews , Forty and six years was this temple in building , and wilt thou rear it up in three days ?
text2: Go Judai lueel , yan , Luaŋe aa leer run kathierŋuan ku dhetem ke yik , ku ba bɛ tɔ kaac e nin kadiak ?

text: But he spake of the temple of his body .
text2: Ku aa jam ne kede guopde , aci tɔ ye luaŋ de Nhialic .

text: When therefore he was risen from the dead , his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them ; and they believed the scripture , and the word which Jesus had said .
text2: Na ɣɔn aci ro guɔ jɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic , go kɔckɛn e piooce agoki tak nɔn ci en kene lɛk keek ; goki kecigɔɔr gam , ayi jam waan cii Yecu lueel .

text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover , in the feast day , many believed in his name , when they saw the miracles which he did .
text2: Ɣɔn nu yen e Jeruthalem e akool ke Winythok , go kɔc juec rinke gam , te ci kek gook tiŋ gook wen ci looi .

text: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them , because he knew all men ,
text2: Ku Yecu aken ro pal keek , luɔi ŋic en kɔc kedhie ,

text: And needed not that any should testify of man : for he knew what was in man .
text2: ku acin caatɔ dueer dhil kɔɔr caatɔ bi kede raan lueel ; yen guop ee ke nu e raan piɔu ŋic .

text: There was a man of the Pharisees , named Nicodemus , a ruler of the Jews :
text2: Raan aa nu raan e Parithai , cɔl Nikodemo , ee bɛny e Judai .

text: The same came to Jesus by night , and said unto him , Rabbi , we know that thou art a teacher come from God : for no man can do these miracles that thou doest , except God be with him .
text2: E bɛn tede Yecu wakɔu , bi ku lueel , yan , Rabi , yin ŋicku nɔn ee yin raan e weet raan e bɔ tede Nhialic : acin raan dueer gook loiye looi , te cii Nhialic cath ke yen .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born again , he cannot see the kingdom of God .
text2: Go Yecu puk nɔm , yan , Yin yɔɔk eyic , yan , Te kene raan bɛ dhieeth , ka cii ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic dueer tiŋ .

text: Nicodemus saith unto him , How can a man be born when he is old ? can he enter the second time into his mother ' s womb , and be born ?
text2: Go Nikodemo thieec , yan , Dueere raan bɛ dhieeth adi , te ci en dit ? dueer bɛ lɔ e man yac , ku beye dhieeth ?

text: Jesus answered , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit , he cannot enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Go Yecu puk nɔm , yan , Yin yɔɔk eyic , yan , Te kene raan dhieeth ne piu keke Wei , ka cii dueer lɔ e ciɛɛŋ de Nhialicic .

text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh ; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit .
text2: Ke ci dhieeth ne guop ee guop ; ku ke ci dhieeth e Wei ee wei .

text: Marvel not that I said unto thee , Ye must be born again .
text2: Du gai nɔn can e lɛk yin , an , We bi dhil bɛ dhieeth .

text: The wind bloweth where it listeth , and thou hearest the sound thereof , but canst not tell whence it cometh , and whither it goeth : so is every one that is born of the Spirit .
text2: Yom ee pot tede piɔnde , ku yin ee awooude piŋ , ku kuc te bi yen thin , ayi te le yen thin : raan ebɛn raan ci dhieeth e Wei yen acit en .

text: Nicodemus answered and said unto him , How can these things be ?
text2: Go Nikodemo bɛɛr , thieec , yan , Dueer kake tic adi ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Art thou a master of Israel , and knowest not these things ?
text2: Go Yecu puk nɔm , lueel , yan , Yee raan e Yithrael wɛɛt , ku kuc kake ?

text: Verily , verily , I say unto thee , We speak that we do know , and testify that we have seen ; and ye receive not our witness .
text2: Yin yɔɔk eyic , yan , Wok ee ke ŋicku lueel , ku yok caatɔɔ ne ka cuk tiŋ ; ku wek cii keda e gam .

text: If I have told you earthly things , and ye believe not , how shall ye believe , if I tell you of heavenly things ?
text2: Te can week lɛk ka ke piny nɔm , ku caki gam , ku na lɛk week ka ke paannhial , bak gam wakdi ?

text: And no man hath ascended up to heaven , but he that came down from heaven , even the Son of man which is in heaven .
text2: Acin raan ci lɔ paannhial , ee raan ci bɛn piny paannhial etok , yen aye Wen e raan Wen nu paannhial .

text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness , even so must the Son of man be lifted up :
text2: Acit man ci Mothe kerac jat nhial e jɔɔric , yen acit jon bi Wen e raan dhil jat nhial aya :

text: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have eternal life .
text2: ke raan gam en cii bi maar , ku bi dɛ piir athɛɛr , raan ebɛn .

text: For God so loved the world , that he gave his only begotten Son , that whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have everlasting life .
text2: Nhialic e piny nɔm nhiaar alal , arek abi miɔɔc e Wendɛn ci dhieeth etok , ke raan gam en cii bi maar , raan ebɛn , ku bi dɛ piir athɛɛr .

text: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world ; but that the world through him might be saved .
text2: Nhialic aacii Wende tuuc e piny nɔm , bi kɔc ke piny nɔm yiek yieth gaak , ee luɔi bi kɔc kony wei kɔc ke piny nɔm , en e tuuc en en .

text: He that believeth on him is not condemned : but he that believeth not is condemned already , because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God .
text2: Raan gam en acin gaak nu e yeyeth : ku raan reec gam , e guɔ yiek yeth gaak enɔɔne , luɔi reec en gam ne rin ke Wen e Nhialic , Wen ci dhieeth etok .

text: And this is the condemnation , that light is come into the world , and men loved darkness rather than light , because their deeds were evil .
text2: Gaak ci taau e kɔc yicth ki , yan , Ɣɛɛrepiny e bɛn e piny nɔm , go kɔc cuɔlepiny nhiaar awar ɣɛɛrepiny ; e luɔi rɛɛce luɔiden .

text: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light , neither cometh to the light , lest his deeds should be reproved .
text2: Raan ebɛn raan e kerac looi , ee ɣɛɛrepiny maan , ku ye rɛɛc bɛn teɣer , ke luɔide cii bi aa jɔɔny .

text: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light , that his deeds may be made manifest , that they are wrought in God .
text2: Ku raan e yic looi ee bɛn teɣer , ke luɔide bi aa tic , nɔn ci e looi ne Nhialic .

text: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea ; and there he tarried with them , and baptized .
text2: Na wen , aci kake wan , ke Yecu bɔ piny de Judaya keke kɔckɛn e piooce ; go reer ke keek etɛɛn , ku ye kɔc baptith .

text: And John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim , because there was much water there : and they came , and were baptized .
text2: Ku Jɔn ayadaŋ aa ye kɔc baptith Ainon thiaak ke Thalim , luɔi nu piu juec etɛɛn : ago kɔc bɛn , bike bɛn baptith .

text: For John was not yet cast into prison .
text2: Jɔn aŋoot ke kene guɔ cuat e aloocic .

text: Then there arose a question between some of John ' s disciples and the Jews about purifying .
text2: Na wen , ke kɔcpiooce Jɔn ke ke teer ne Judai ne kede waak .

text: And they came unto John , and said unto him , Rabbi , he that was with thee beyond Jordan , to whom thou barest witness , behold , the same baptizeth , and all men come to him .
text2: Agoki bɛn tede Jɔn , bik ku luelki , yan , Rabi , raan e rɛɛr wek etok e Jordan nɔm lɔŋtui , raan ci yin kede lueel , tiŋ , ee kɔc baptith , go kɔc aa lɔ tede yen kedhie .

text: John answered and said , A man can receive nothing , except it be given him from heaven .
text2: Go Jɔn bɛɛr , lueel , yan , Acin ke dueere raan yok , te kene ye gam en nhial .

text: Ye yourselves bear me witness , that I said , I am not the Christ , but that I am sent before him .
text2: Week gup wek ee caatɔɔ ne ke can lueel , yan , Yɛn cie Kritho , ku yɛn aa kɔne tuooc e yenɔm tueŋ .

text: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom : but the friend of the bridegroom , which standeth and heareth him , rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom ' s voice : this my joy therefore is fulfilled .
text2: Raan thiak nyan lueele thieeke , yen aye mony de thieek : ku mɛthe mony de thieek , raan kaac etɛɛn ku piŋ jamde , ee piɔu miɛt alal e rol e mony de thieek : miɛt miɛt ɛn piɔu ki , aci guɔ aa yic .

text: He must increase , but I must decrease .
text2: Yen abi ro dhil aa ŋuak , ku yɛn bi dhil aa lɔ cieen .

text: He that cometh from above is above all : he that is of the earth is earthly , and speaketh of the earth : he that cometh from heaven is above all .
text2: Raan bɔ nhial yen anu e kɔc niim kedhie . Raan bɔ e piny nɔm , yen aye kede piny , ku ye ka ke piny lueel : raan bɔ paannhial anu e kɔc niim kedhie .

text: And what he hath seen and heard , that he testifieth ; and no man receiveth his testimony .
text2: Go ya caatɔ ne ka ci tiŋ ku ne ka ci piŋ , go kede aa lueel ; ku acin raan e kede gam .

text: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true .
text2: Raan e kede gam , aci gɔɔr e katimde , yan , Nhialic yen aye yic .

text: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God : for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto him .
text2: Raan e tuuc e Nhialic ee wel ke Nhialic lueel : ku Nhialic acii e miɔɔc e Wei ne them them en keek .

text: The Father loveth the Son , and hath given all things into his hand .
text2: Waada anhiaar Wende , ago kaŋ taau e yecin kedhie .

text: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life : and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life ; but the wrath of God abideth on him .
text2: Raan gam Wende ee cath ke piir athɛɛr ; ku raan reec Wende gam , acii piir bi tiŋ , agonh e Nhialic ee reer e yeyeth .

text: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John ,
text2: Na wen , aci Bɛnydit e ŋic nɔn ci Parithai e piŋ nɔn e Yecu kɔc juec tɔ ye kɔcpiooce ku ye keek baptith awar Jɔn ,

text: ( Though Jesus himself baptized not , but his disciples , )
text2: ( ku Yecu guop aacii kɔc e baptith , ee kɔckɛn e piooce kek aye kɔc baptith ) ,

text: He left Judaea , and departed again into Galilee .
text2: ke jel e Judaya , be lɔ Galili ,

text: And he must needs go through Samaria .
text2: dhil Thamaria reetic .

text: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria , which is called Sychar , near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph .
text2: Ago bɛn te nu paan toŋ de Thamaria , ee panyditt cɔl Thukara , athiaak keke piny cii Jakop gam wendɛn Jothep .

text: Now Jacob ' s well was there . Jesus therefore , being wearied with his journey , sat thus on the well : and it was about the sixth hour .
text2: Ku yinh e Jakop aa nu etɛɛn . Go Yecu nyuc e yich nɔm aya , ke ye dakke cath . Ee te cit nɔn e thaar kadhetem .

text: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water : Jesus saith unto her , Give me to drink .
text2: Na wen , ke tiiŋ e Thamaria bɔ , bi bɛn gem e piu : go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Miɔc ɛn e ka dɛk .

text: ( For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat . )
text2: Kɔckɛn e piooce acik guɔ jal lek panydit lek ɣooc e kecam .

text: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him , How is it that thou , being a Jew , askest drink of me , which am a woman of Samaria ? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans .
text2: Go tiiŋ e Thamaria puk nɔm , yan , Ee kaŋo ke lip yin ɛn e piu , ku ye Judai , ku ya tiiŋ e Thamaria ? Judai keke kɔc ke Thamaria aciki raan .

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , If thou knewest the gift of God , and who it is that saith to thee , Give me to drink ; thou wouldest have asked of him , and he would have given thee living water .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , lueel , yan , Tee yi ŋic miɔc de Nhialic , ku ŋic raan wen thɛɛr yook yin , yan , Miɔc ɛn e ka dɛk ; adi ci lip tede yen , ku adi ci yi gam piu piir .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , thou hast nothing to draw with , and the well is deep : from whence then hast thou that living water ?
text2: Go tik lueel , yan , Bɛny , yin cin ken ee yin gem , ku yith amec thar ; ba piu piire yok tenou ?

text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob , which gave us the well , and drank thereof himself , and his children , and his cattle ?
text2: Dit awar kuɛɛredan Jakop , raan e gɛm wook yith , ku ye dek e ye , yen , ku mithke , ku ɣɔkke ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again :
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , lueel , yan , Raan ebɛn raan e dek e piuke abi bɛ aa yal :

text: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst ; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life .
text2: ku raan ebɛn raan e dek e piu ba gam en acii bi bɛ aa yal anande ; piu ba gam en abik aa awaŋ e yith e yeyac , awaŋ bi aa cool e tul aɣet piir athɛɛr .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , give me this water , that I thirst not , neither come hither to draw .
text2: Go tik lueel , yan , Bɛny , miɔc ɛn e piuke , ke ya cii bi bɛ aa yal , ku ca bi bɛ aa bɛn etene ba bɛn gem .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Go , call thy husband , and come hither .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Lɔ , cɔl monydu , ku baki ene .

text: The woman answered and said , I have no husband . Jesus said unto her , Thou hast well said , I have no husband :
text2: Go tik bɛɛr , lueel , yan , Yɛn cin nɔm moc . Go Yecu lueel , yan , Yin e yic lueel , yan , Yɛn cin nɔm moc :

text: For thou hast had five husbands ; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband : in that saidst thou truly .
text2: roorku acik aa dhiec ; ku mony rɛɛr wek etok enɔɔne acie monydu : keduon ci lueele ee yic .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , I perceive that thou art a prophet .
text2: Go tik lueel , yan , Bɛny , yin ŋiɛc aye nebi .

text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain ; and ye say , that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship .
text2: Kuarkuɔ aake ye lam e kuure nɔm , ku yak lueel , yan , ee Jeruthalem en ee te bi kɔc dhil aa lam thin .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , believe me , the hour cometh , when ye shall neither in this mountain , nor yet at Jerusalem , worship the Father .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Tiiŋe , gam kedi , yan , Thaar abi bɛn thaar ba wek Waada lam thin , ku aci e kuure nɔm , ku aci e Jeruthalem aya .

text: Ye worship ye know not what : we know what we worship : for salvation is of the Jews .
text2: Wek ee ke kuocki lam : ee ke ŋicku yen ayok lam : kunydewei abɔ tede Judai .

text: But the hour cometh , and now is , when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth : for the Father seeketh such to worship him .
text2: Ku ade thaar bɔ , ku anu enɔɔne , thaar bii kɔc Waada lam thin ne wei ku ne yic , kek kɔc e lam yic kɔɔr : ku Waada ee kɔc cit kek kɔɔr bik aa kɔc e ye lam .

text: God is a Spirit : and they that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth .
text2: Nhialic ee Wei , ku kɔc lam en abik e dhil aa lam ne wei ku ne yic .

text: The woman saith unto him , I know that Messias cometh , which is called Christ : when he is come , he will tell us all things .
text2: Go tik lueel , yan , Aŋiɛc nɔn bi Mathia bɛn ( yen acɔl Kritho ) : ku te ci en bɛn , ka bi wo guieer kaŋ kedhie .

text: Jesus saith unto her , I that speak unto thee am he .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Yɛn aye yen , yɛn eraan jam wo yine .

text: And upon this came his disciples , and marvelled that he talked with the woman : yet no man said , What seekest thou ? or , Why talkest thou with her ?
text2: Na wen , ke kɔckɛn e piooce e ke bɔ ; goki gai e ke jiɛɛm en keke tik ; ku acin raan ci e thieec , yan , Eeŋo kɔɔr ? ku , yan , Eeŋo jiɛɛm yin weke yen ?

text: The woman then left her waterpot , and went her way into the city , and saith to the men ,
text2: Go tik tonydɛn e piu nyaaŋ piny , ku jel le panydit , le lɛk kɔc , yan ,

text: Come , see a man , which told me all things that ever I did : is not this the Christ ?
text2: Baki , tieŋki raan ci a lɛk kaŋ kedhie ka ca looi ecaŋɣɔn : cii dhil aa Kritho ekene ?

text: Then they went out of the city , and came unto him .
text2: Goki lɔ biic panydit , bik tede yen .

text: In the mean while his disciples prayed him , saying , Master , eat .
text2: Na wen , aŋootki wei , ke lɛŋ kɔcpiooce , yan , Bɛny , came .

text: But he said unto them , I have meat to eat that ye know not of .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Yɛn de miith cam nhith kuocki .

text: Therefore said the disciples one to another , Hath any man brought him ought to eat ?
text2: Go kɔcpiooce rot thieec kapac , yan , De kecam ci yicn en ?

text: Jesus saith unto them , My meat is to do the will of him that sent me , and to finish his work .
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Luɔi luɔi ɛn kede piɔn e raan e toc ɛn , ayi thol ban luɔide thol , yen aye kecamdi .

text: Say not ye , There are yet four months , and then cometh harvest ? behold , I say unto you , Lift up your eyes , and look on the fields ; for they are white already to harvest .
text2: Caki e lueel , yan , Ŋoot pɛi wei kaŋuan , pɛi ke tem e rap ? Wɔiki , wek yɔɔk , yan , Jatki wenyin nhial , ku wɔiki dum , acik guɔ ɣɛɛr , aci aa te temeke .

text: And he that reapeth receiveth wages , and gathereth fruit unto life eternal : that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together .
text2: Ku raan e tem ee ariop yok , ku ye rap kut niim e kede piir athɛɛr ; ago raan e com ayi raan e tem agoki piɔth miɛt etok .

text: And herein is that saying true , One soweth , and another reapeth .
text2: Ago jam waane go aa yic , yan , Ŋɛk ee com , ku tem ŋɛk .

text: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour : other men laboured , and ye are entered into their labours .
text2: Wek e tuɔɔc bak dom lɔ tem dom kɛn wek kɔn luui thin : kɔc kɔk acik luui , ku wek e lɔɔk look e luɔidenic .

text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman , which testified , He told me all that ever I did .
text2: Go kɔc juec kɔc ke Thamarai kɔc ke panydiite agoki kede gam ne baŋ de jam de tik , wen ci en e lueel , yan , Aci a lɛk kaŋ kedhie ka ca looi ecaŋɣɔn .

text: So when the Samaritans were come unto him , they besought him that he would tarry with them : and he abode there two days .
text2: Na wen , aci kɔc ke Thamaria bɛn tede yen , ke jɔki lɔŋ , an , bi reer ke keek : go reer etɛɛn e akool kaarou .

text: And many more believed because of his own word ;
text2: Go kɔc juec gam awarki kɔc waan alal , ne biak de jamde guop ;

text: And said unto the woman , Now we believe , not because of thy saying : for we have heard him ourselves , and know that this is indeed the Christ , the Saviour of the world .
text2: agoki lɛk tik , yan , Wok e gam enɔɔne , ku acie biak de jamdu : acuk piŋ e wokgup , agoku ŋic nɔn ee yen Kritho ne yic , konydewei ke jaŋ ebɛn .

text: Now after two days he departed thence , and went into Galilee .
text2: Na wen , e nin kaarou , ke jɔ jal etɛɛn le Galili .

text: For Jesus himself testified , that a prophet hath no honour in his own country .
text2: Yecu guop ee jame gam , yan , ee yic , yan , Nebi acin rieu ee yok paanden guop .

text: Then when he was come into Galilee , the Galilaeans received him , having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast : for they also went unto the feast .
text2: Na wen , aci guɔ bɛn Galili , ke loor kɔc ke Galili , luɔi ci kek kaŋ tiŋ kedhie ka ci looi e Jeruthalem e akool ke ahith : aake ci lɔ tede aliith ayadaŋ .

text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee , where he made the water wine . And there was a certain nobleman , whose son was sick at Capernaum .
text2: Na wen , ke be bɛn Kana de Galili , te waan puk en piu aye wany . Ku ade bɛny etɛɛn , bɛny tooke wende e Kapernaum .

text: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee , he went unto him , and besought him that he would come down , and heal his son : for he was at the point of death .
text2: Te ci en e piŋ nɔn ci Yecu bɛn bei e Judaya bi Galili , ke jɔ lɔ tede yen , go lɔŋ , an , bi lɔ , le wende tɔ dem ; meth akɔɔr thuɔɔu .

text: Then said Jesus unto him , Except ye see signs and wonders , ye will not believe .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Te kɛn wek gook tiŋ ayi kagɛi , ka caki bi gam anandun .

text: The nobleman saith unto him , Sir , come down ere my child die .
text2: Go bɛny lueel , yan , Bɛny , loku tei te ŋoote mɛnhdien thiine ke ken thou .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Go thy way ; thy son liveth . And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him , and he went his way .
text2: Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Lɔ , wendu apiir . Go raan jam gam , jam ci Yecu lɛk en , ku jɔ jal .

text: And as he was now going down , his servants met him , and told him , saying , Thy son liveth .
text2: Ku te ŋoot en kueer , ke ram ke liimkɛn leke yen , yan , Mɛnhdu apiir .

text: Then inquired he of them the hour when he began to amend . And they said unto him , Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him .
text2: Go ke luɔp , yan , E pɛle juai piny e thaar kadi ? Goki lueel , yan , Waanakol , e thaar kadherou , yen aa pɛle juai en .

text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour , in the which Jesus said unto him , Thy son liveth : and himself believed , and his whole house .
text2: Go wun meth ŋic nɔn ee yen thaar man waan leke Yecu e yen , yan , Wendu apiir : go gam , yen keke dhiende ebɛn .

text: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did , when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee .
text2: Gok ee kek rou ki , gok cii Yecu looi , te ci en bɛn bei e Judaya bi Galili .

text: After this there was a feast of the Jews ; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Na wen , aci kake thok , ke Judai e ke jɔ ahith looi , ago Yecu jal le Jeruthalem .

text: Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool , which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda , having five porches .
text2: Ku ade awol nu Jeruthalem awol thiaak ke kal thok kal e amɛl , awol de gol kadhic , ku acɔl Bethetheda ne thoŋ de Eberu .

text: In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk , of blind , halt , withered , waiting for the moving of the water .
text2: Ku ade kut ditt e kɔc e tɔc e golke yiic , kɔc tok , ayi coor , ayi ŋol ayi aduɛɛny ; ke ke ye kool bi piu weer tiit .

text: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool , and troubled the water : whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had .
text2: Ade tunynhial e bɛn piny le e awolic ekool mɛɛn , bi piu bɛn weer : ku raan e kɔn lɔ e piu yiic , te ci ke . weer , ka bi waar e juandɛn nu e yeguop .

text: And a certain man was there , which had an infirmity thirty and eight years .
text2: Ku ade raan etɛɛn , raan e took e run kathierdiak ku bɛt .

text: When Jesus saw him lie , and knew that he had been now a long time in that case , he saith unto him , Wilt thou be made whole ?
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu e tiŋ adhɔt piny , ku ŋic nɔn ci e took e run juec , ke jɔ thieec , yan , De yi piɔu nɔn bi yin guop pial ?

text: The impotent man answered him , Sir , I have no man , when the water is troubled , to put me into the pool : but while I am coming , another steppeth down before me .
text2: Go raan tok puk nɔm , yan , Bɛny , yɛn cin nɔm raan bi a taau e awolic , te ci piu weer : ku ten aa yɛn ŋoot kueer , ke raan daŋ ee guɔ lɔ e yanɔm tueŋ .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Rise , take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Jɔt tot , jɔt bioŋdu , cathe .

text: And immediately the man was made whole , and took up his bed , and walked : and on the same day was the sabbath .
text2: Go raan guop waar enɔnthiine , go bioŋde jɔt , ku ciɛth . Ku ekoole ee kool e thabath .

text: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured , It is the sabbath day : it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed .
text2: Na wen , ke Judai ke ke yook raan wen ci dem , yan , Ekoole ee kool e thabath , acii piɛth luɔi ɣɛɛc yin bioŋdu .

text: He answered them , He that made me whole , the same said unto me , Take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: Go pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Raan e tɔ ya piɔl guop , yen aa yook ɛn , yan , Jɔt bioŋdu , cathe .

text: Then asked they him , What man is that which said unto thee , Take up thy bed , and walk ?
text2: Goki thieec , yan , Ee raan ŋa e yook yin , yan , Jɔt bioŋdu , cathe ?

text: And he that was healed wist not who it was : for Jesus had conveyed himself away , a multitude being in that place .
text2: Ku kuc raan ci dem nɔn ee yen ŋa : Yecu aci jal , ne baŋ de kut e kɔc nu etɛɛn .

text: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple , and said unto him , Behold , thou art made whole : sin no more , lest a worse thing come unto thee .
text2: Te ci kake thok , ke Yecu jɔ raane yok luaŋditt e Nhialic , go lɛk en , an , Tiŋ , yin ci guop waar : du kaŋ e bɛ wooc , ke yi cii kerac bi yok kerɛɛc war kewaan .

text: The man departed , and told the Jews that it was Jesus , which had made him whole .
text2: Go raane jal le lɛk Judai nɔn ee yen Yecu , yen e tɔ yen dem .

text: And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus , and sought to slay him , because he had done these things on the sabbath day .
text2: Yen aa ye Judai Yecu yɔŋ , ku yek kɔɔr , an , bik nɔk , ne ke ci en kake looi ekool e thabath .

text: But Jesus answered them , My Father worketh hitherto , and I work .
text2: Go Yecu pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Waar ee luui , aɣet ci enɔɔne , ku yɛn ee luui aya .

text: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him , because he not only had broken the sabbath , but said also that God was his Father , making himself equal with God .
text2: Yen a kɔɔr Judai luɔi nɛk kek en , acie luɔi ci en kool e thabath rɛc theek etok , ee luɔi ci en Nhialic tɔ ye Wun aya , ago rot thɔɔŋ keke Nhialic .

text: Then answered Jesus and said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , The Son can do nothing of himself , but what he seeth the Father do : for what things soever he doeth , these also doeth the Son likewise .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yook keek , yan , Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Wende acin ken e leu etok , ee ke ci tiŋ aye Waada looi , yen aye looi : kaŋ kedhie kak ee Waada looi , kek aye Wende ke looi ayadaŋ .

text: For the Father loveth the Son , and sheweth him all things that himself doeth : and he will shew him greater works than these , that ye may marvel .
text2: Waada anhiaar Wende , go ya nyuoth kaŋ kedhie kak ee looi : ku bi nyuoth luɔi diit war ekake , ke we bi gai .

text: For as the Father raiseth up the dead , and quickeneth them ; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will .
text2: Acit man ee Waada kɔc ci thou jɔt , tɔ keek piir , yen aye kede Wende aya , ee kɔc tɔ piir kɔc nu e yenpiɔu .

text: For the Father judgeth no man , but hath committed all judgment unto the Son :
text2: Acin raan ee Waada loŋde guiir , aci guieereloŋ taau e Wende cin ebɛn ;

text: That all men should honour the Son , even as they honour the Father . He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him .
text2: ke kɔc e ke bi Wende aa rieu kedhie , cit man ee kek Waada rieu . Raan reec Wende rieu , ka reec Waada rieu aya , raan e toc e .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that heareth my word , and believeth on him that sent me , hath everlasting life , and shall not come into condemnation ; but is passed from death unto life .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Raan piŋ welki , ku gɛm raan e toc ɛn , ka cath ke piir athɛɛr , ku acin gaak bi taau e yeyeth , aci bɛn bei e thuɔɔuwic , le te nu piir .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , The hour is coming , and now is , when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God : and they that hear shall live .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Thaar abɔ , ku anu enɔɔne , thaar bi kɔc ci thou rol e Wen e Nhialic piŋ ; ku kɔc e piŋ abik piir .

text: For as the Father hath life in himself ; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself ;
text2: Acit man ciɛthe Waada ke piir e yenhde etok , yen aci en Wende miɔɔc aya , ke bi cath ke piir e yenhde etok ;

text: And hath given him authority to execute judgment also , because he is the Son of man .
text2: ago gam bɛɛny , bi en loŋ de kɔc aa guiir , luɔi ee yen Wen e raan .

text: Marvel not at this : for the hour is coming , in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice ,
text2: Duoki gai ne kene : thaar abɔ , thaar bi kɔc nu e rɛŋ yiic rolde piŋ kɔc kedhie ,

text: And shall come forth ; they that have done good , unto the resurrection of life ; and they that have done evil , unto the resurrection of damnation .
text2: agoki bɛn biic ; kɔc e kepiɛth looi , abik rot jɔt ne jonerot de piir ; ku jɔt kɔc e kerac looi rot , ne jonerot e gaak nu e keyieth .

text: I can of mine own self do nothing : as I hear , I judge : and my judgment is just ; because I seek not mine own will , but the will of the Father which hath sent me .
text2: Yɛn cin ken aa leu yatok : ken aa piŋ , yen aya yɛn loŋ guiir : ku piɛth guieerdi , ne ke can kede piɔndi e kɔɔr , ee kede piɔn ee Waar , raan e toc ɛn , yen aya kɔɔr .

text: If I bear witness of myself , my witness is not true .
text2: Te ta yɛn rot e caatɔ e rot , ke kedi acie yic .

text: There is another that beareth witness of me ; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true .
text2: Ee raan daŋ yen aye caatɔdi ; ku kedɛn lueel e kedi aŋiɛc nɔn ee yen yic .

text: Ye sent unto John , and he bare witness unto the truth .
text2: Wek e kɔc tuoc Jɔn , ku aci aa caatɔ de yic .

text: But I receive not testimony from man : but these things I say , that ye might be saved .
text2: Ku yɛn cii kede raan e gam : kake a lɛk ke week tei , ke we bi kony wei .

text: He was a burning and a shining light : and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light .
text2: Yen aaye many e dep ku ye piny riaau : ku wek e piɔth dɛ luɔi ba wek piɔth miɛt ne manyde tethiinakaŋ .

text: But I have greater witness than that of John : for the works which the Father hath given me to finish , the same works that I do , bear witness of me , that the Father hath sent me .
text2: Ku yɛn cath wo caatɔ war Jɔn : luɔi ci Waada yien ɛn , ba ke bɛn thol , luɔi luɔɔiye , keek aye caatɔɔki , lueel en , an , ee yen Waada yen e toc ɛn .

text: And the Father himself , which hath sent me , hath borne witness of me . Ye have neither heard his voice at any time , nor seen his shape .
text2: Ku Waada guop , raan e toc ɛn , yen aye caatɔdi . Rolde akɛnki piŋ anandun , ayi tau tɔu en akɛnki tiŋ .

text: And ye have not his word abiding in you : for whom he hath sent , him ye believe not .
text2: Ku jamde acie tɔu e weyiic : luɔi ca wek raan e gam , raan e tooc .

text: Search the scriptures ; for in them ye think ye have eternal life : and they are they which testify of me .
text2: We ye kacigɔɔr cok e kuɛɛn wek keyiic , luɔi aa wek e lueel , an , yak piir athɛɛr yok ne keyiic ; ku kake ayek caatɔɔki ;

text: And ye will not come to me , that ye might have life .
text2: ku wek ee rɛɛc bɛn tede yɛn , bak piir bɛn yok .

text: I receive not honour from men .
text2: Yɛn cii lɛc e gam tede kɔc .

text: But I know you , that ye have not the love of God in you .
text2: Ku wek ŋiɛc , nɔn hiuwe nhieer e Nhialic e weyiic .

text: I am come in my Father ' s name , and ye receive me not : if another shall come in his own name , him ye will receive .
text2: Yɛn e bɔ ne rin ke Waar , ku we ken a gam : te bi raan daŋ ne rin ke yenguop , yen abak gam .

text: How can ye believe , which receive honour one of another , and seek not the honour that cometh from God only ?
text2: Duɛɛrki gam leu wakdi , wek kɔc e lɛc gam lɛc aa wek rot leec wapac , ku caki lɛc e kɔɔr lɛc bɔ tede Nhialic etok ?

text: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father : there is one that accuseth you , even Moses , in whom ye trust .
text2: Duoki e lueel nɔn ban we lɔ gaany e Waar nɔm : raan gɔɔny week anu , yen Mothe raan ŋathki .

text: For had ye believed Moses , ye would have believed me : for he wrote of me .
text2: Tee we ci Mothe gam , adi cak ɛn gam aya : aci kedi gɔɔr . Ku te reec wek kakɛn ci gɔɔr gam , ke we bi welki gam wakdi ?

text: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee , which is the sea of Tiberias .
text2: Na wen , aci kake wan , ke Yecu jel le wɛɛr e Galili nɔm lɔŋtui , yen aye wɛɛr e Tiberia .

text: And a great multitude followed him , because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased .
text2: Ku jɔ biɔɔth cok e kut diit e kɔc , ne ke ci kek gook tiŋ ka ci luoi kɔc tok .

text: And Jesus went up into a mountain , and there he sat with his disciples .
text2: Go Yecu lɔ e kuurdit nɔm , le ku nyuuc etɛɛn keke kɔckɛn e piooce .

text: And the passover , a feast of the Jews , was nigh .
text2: Ku Winythok , ahith e Judai , e guɔ thiɔk .

text: When Jesus then lifted up his eyes , and saw a great company come unto him , he saith unto Philip , Whence shall we buy bread , that these may eat ?
text2: Na wen , ke Yecu jɔt enyin nhial , ku tiŋ kut ditt e kɔc abɔ tede yen , go Pilip thieec , yan , Buk kuin ɣɔɔc tenou , knin bii kɔcke cam ?

text: And this he said to prove him : for he himself knew what he would do .
text2: Aa lueel kene them en en : yen guop aŋic ke bi looi .

text: Philip answered him , Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them , that every one of them may take a little .
text2: Go Pilip puk nɔm , yan , Kuin ci pam ɣɔc e jinii kathieer acii keek dueer leu , luɔi bi ŋɛk dɛ kethiinakaŋ , ku de ŋɛk kethiinakaŋ , raan ebɛn .

text: One of his disciples , Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother , saith unto him ,
text2: Go raan toŋ de kɔckɛn e piooce , raan cɔl Andereya , manhe e Thimon Petero , go lɛk en , yan ,

text: There is a lad here , which hath five barley loaves , and two small fishes : but what are they among so many ?
text2: Ade mɛdhthiin nu ene , mɛnh muk kunn ci pam kadhic kuiin ke barli , ku rec thiiakaŋ kaarou : ku naamden akou tede kɔc juec yinya ?

text: And Jesus said , Make the men sit down . Now there was much grass in the place . So the men sat down , in number about five thousand .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Tɔ kɔc nyuc piny . Wɛl juec anuki etɛɛn . Go roor nyuc piny , kuenden acit agum kadhic .

text: And Jesus took the loaves ; and when he had given thanks , he distributed to the disciples , and the disciples to them that were set down ; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would .
text2: Na wen , ke Yecu nom kuiin ci pam ; ku te ci en thieithieei lueel , ke ke jɔ tɛk kɔckɛn e piooce , go kɔckɛn e piooce ke tɛk kɔc wen ci nyuc piny ; ayi rec aya , ne kedɛn e kepiɔth .

text: When they were filled , he said unto his disciples , Gather up the fragments that remain , that nothing be lost .
text2: Na wen , acik kuɛth kedhie , ke jɔ lɛk kɔckɛn e piooce , yan , Kuotki dhuɔtdɛn ci doŋ , ke cin ke bi maar .

text: Therefore they gathered them together , and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves , which remained over and above unto them that had eaten .
text2: Agoki ke kut , ku thiaŋki dioony kathieer ku rou ne dhuɔth e kuiin ci pam kadhic , kuiin ke barli , dhuɔth ci doŋ piny tede kɔc wen cam .

text: Then those men , when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did , said , This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world .
text2: Ago kɔcke , te ci kek gok e loi Yecu tiŋ , agoki lueel , yan , Ee yic , raane ee nebi waan , an , bi bɛn e piny nɔm .

text: When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force , to make him a king , he departed again into a mountain himself alone .
text2: Te ci Yecu e ŋic nɔn kɔɔr kek luɔi bi kek e bɛn jɔt , bik bɛn tɔ ye malik , ke jɔ ro kual be lɔ e kuurdit nɔm etok .

text: And when even was now come , his disciples went down unto the sea ,
text2: Na wen , aci akɔl thei , ke kɔckɛn e piooce ke ke jɔ lɔ e wɛɛryɔu ;

text: And entered into a ship , and went over the sea toward Capernaum . And it was now dark , and Jesus was not come to them .
text2: lek ku lek e abelic , yan , lek lɔɔk Kapernaum . Ku ci piny guɔ cuɔl , ke Yecu ŋoot wei .

text: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew .
text2: Go wɛɛr lɔ tialtial , wen ci yom pɔt alal .

text: So when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs , they see Jesus walking on the sea , and drawing nigh unto the ship : and they were afraid .
text2: Na wen , acik abel gɛɛr te cit mail kadiak , ku nɔn ee kek ŋuan , ke ke tiŋ Yecu acath e wɛɛric e piu niim , ke bɔ te nu abel : agoki riɔɔc .

text: But he saith unto them , It is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Ago lɛk keek , yan , Ee yɛn , duoki riɔc .

text: Then they willingly received him into the ship : and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went .
text2: Goki gam tɔki lɔ e abelic : ku jɔ abel guɔ ɣet lɔɔk enɔnthiine , te wen le kek thin .

text: The day following , when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there , save that one whereinto his disciples were entered , and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat , but that his disciples were gone away alone ;
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , ke kut e kɔc waan kaac e wɛɛr nɔm , lɔŋ e jel kek thin , acin abel daŋ e cik tiŋ etɛɛn , ee abel waan ci kɔckɛn e piooce lɔ thin etok , ku acik Yecu tiŋ waan nɔn ken en lɔ e abelic keke kɔckɛn e piooce , kɔckɛn e piooce aake jel kapac ;

text: ( Howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread , after that the Lord had given thanks : )
text2: ( ku abeel kɔk aake bɔ e Tiberia tei , bik tethiaak ke te waan ciɛme kɔc kuin ci pam , ke Bɛnydit ci thieithieei kɔn lueel ) :

text: When the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there , neither his disciples , they also took shipping , and came to Capernaum , seeking for Jesus .
text2: na wen , aci kut e kɔc e tiŋ nɔn hiuwe Yecu etɛɛn , ayi kɔckɛn e piooce , ke ke jɔ lɔ e abeel yiic kekgup , bik Kapernaum , ke ke kɔɔr Yecu .

text: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea , they said unto him , Rabbi , when camest thou hither ?
text2: Na wen , acik e yok lɔŋtui , ke jɔki thieec , yan , Rabi , e yi bɔ ene nɛn ?

text: Jesus answered them and said , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Ye seek me , not because ye saw the miracles , but because ye did eat of the loaves , and were filled .
text2: Go Yecu pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Acie luɔi ca wek gook tiŋ , ee luɔi ca wek cam ne kuiin ci pam , abak kuɛth , yen aa kaar wek ɛn .

text: Labour not for the meat which perisheth , but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life , which the Son of man shall give unto you : for him hath God the Father sealed .
text2: Duoki e luui ne kecam e riaak , yak luui ne kecam e tɔu aɣet piir athɛɛr , piir bii Wen e raan gam week : yen acii Nhialic Waada gaar guop rinke .

text: Then said they unto him , What shall we do , that we might work the works of God ?
text2: Goki thieec , yan , Eeŋo buk dhil looi , buk luɔi de Nhialic aa looi ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , This is the work of God , that ye believe on him whom he hath sent .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Luɔi de Nhialic ki , yan , Gam gam wek raan ci tooc .

text: They said therefore unto him , What sign shewest thou then , that we may see , and believe thee ? what dost thou work ?
text2: Goki thieec , yan , Ee gok ŋo loi enɔɔne , ke buk tiŋ , agoku yi gam ? Ee luɔi ŋo loi ?

text: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert ; as it is written , He gave them bread from heaven to eat .
text2: Kuarkuɔ aake ye mana cam e jɔɔric ; acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Aa ye keek miɔɔc e knin bɔ paannhial yek cam .

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Moses gave you not that bread from heaven ; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven .
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Acie Mothe yen eye week gam knine , kuin bɔ paannhial ; ee Waar yen ee we miɔɔc e kuin yic bɔ paannhial .

text: For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven , and giveth life unto the world .
text2: Knin e Nhialic ee ke bɔ piny paannhial , ku ye piny nɔm gam piir .

text: Then said they unto him , Lord , evermore give us this bread .
text2: Agoki lɛk en , yan , Bɛny , ye wo miɔɔc e kuine ecaŋɣɔn .

text: And Jesus said unto them , I am the bread of life : he that cometh to me shall never hunger ; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst .
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Yɛn ee kuin e piir : raan bɔ tede yɛn , acin cɔŋ bi ye bɛ nɔk , ku raan gam ɛn , acii bi bɛ yal anande .

text: But I said unto you , That ye also have seen me , and believe not .
text2: Ku we ca yɔɔk , yan , We ci a tiŋ , ku caki ya gam .

text: All that the Father giveth me shall come to me ; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out .
text2: Kɔc kedhie kɔc ci Waar gam ɛn , abik bɛn tede yɛn ; ku raan bɔ tede yɛn aca bi cieec anandi .

text: For I came down from heaven , not to do mine own will , but the will of him that sent me .
text2: Yɛn ecii bɔ piny paannhial , ba kede piɔndi bɛn aa looi , yɛn e bɔ ba kede piɔn e raan e toc ɛn bɛn aa looi .

text: And this is the Father ' s will which hath sent me , that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing , but should raise it up again at the last day .
text2: Ku kene ee kede piɔn e raan e toc ɛn , yan , Ne kaŋ kedhie ka ci gam ɛn , acin toŋ ba mɔɔr , ku aba bɛ jat nhial ekool rial wadaŋ .

text: And this is the will of him that sent me , that every one which seeth the Son , and believeth on him , may have everlasting life : and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Kede piɔn e Waar ki , yan , Raan ebɛn raan tiŋ Wende , ku gɛm , ka bi dɛ piir athɛɛr ; ku aba jat nhial ekool rial wadaŋ .

text: The Jews then murmured at him , because he said , I am the bread which came down from heaven .
text2: Go Judai ŋun e keyac , ne jam wen ci lueel , yan , Yɛn ee kuin e bɔ piny paannhial .

text: And they said , Is not this Jesus , the son of Joseph , whose father and mother we know ? how is it then that he saith , I came down from heaven ?
text2: Goki lueel , yan , Kene cie Yecu , wen e Jothep , raan ŋic wok wun ayi man ? ku eeŋo jɔ en e lueel , yan , Yɛn e bɔ piny paannhial ?

text: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them , Murmur not among yourselves .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yook keek , yan , Duoki ŋun wapac .

text: No man can come to me , except the Father which hath sent me draw him : and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Acin raan dueer bɛn tede yɛn , te kene ye dhil tɔ bɔ ne Waada raan e toc ɛn ; ku aba jat nhial ekool rial wadaŋ .

text: It is written in the prophets , And they shall be all taught of God . Every man therefore that hath heard , and hath learned of the Father , cometh unto me .
text2: E gɔɔr e nebii , yan , Kɔc abike wɛɛt e Nhialic kedhie . Ago raan ebɛn raan ci kaŋ piŋ tede Waada , ku ci weet , go bɛn tede yɛn .

text: Not that any man hath seen the Father , save he which is of God , he hath seen the Father .
text2: Acin raan ci Waada tiŋ tei , ee raan e bɔ tede Nhialic etok , yen aci Waada tiŋ .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that believeth on me hath everlasting life .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Raan gam ɛn acath ke piir athɛɛr .

text: I am that bread of life .
text2: Yɛn ee kuin e piir .

text: Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness , and are dead .
text2: Kuarkun aake ye mana cam e jɔɔric , ku acik thou .

text: This is the bread which cometh down from heaven , that a man may eat thereof , and not die .
text2: Kene ee kuin bɔ piny paannhial , bi raan aa cam e ye , ku cii thou .

text: I am the living bread which came down from heaven : if any man eat of this bread , he shall live for ever : and the bread that I will give is my flesh , which I will give for the life of the world .
text2: Yɛn ee kuin e piir kuin e bɔ piny paannhial : te ciɛme raan e kuine , ka bi piir athɛɛr : yeka , kuin ba gam en ee riŋdi , riŋ ba gaam ne kede piir bi kɔc piir kɔc ke piny nɔm .

text: The Jews therefore strove among themselves , saying , How can this man give us his flesh to eat ?
text2: Ago Judai teer kapac , luelki , yan , Raane dueer wo gam riŋde adi buk cuet ?

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man , and drink his blood , ye have no life in you .
text2: Go Yecu lɛk keek , yan , Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Te ca wek riiŋ e Wen e raan e cuet , ku dɛkki riɛmde , ka we cin yiic piir .

text: Whoso eateth my flesh , and drinketh my blood , hath eternal life ; and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Raan e riŋdi cuet , ku dek riɛmdi , ee cath ke piir athɛɛr , ku aba jat nhial ekool rial wadaŋ .

text: For my flesh is meat indeed , and my blood is drink indeed .
text2: Riŋdi yen aye kecam yic , ku riɛmdi yen aye kedek yic .

text: He that eateth my flesh , and drinketh my blood , dwelleth in me , and I in him .
text2: Raan e riŋdi cuet , ku dek riɛmdit ka ye reer e yayic , ku rɛɛr e yeyic .

text: As the living Father hath sent me , and I live by the Father : so he that eateth me , even he shall live by me .
text2: Acit Waada , Raan piir , acit man ci en a tooc , ku ya piir ne Waada ; yen acit piir ee raan e ya cam piir e yɛn aya .

text: This is that bread which came down from heaven : not as your fathers did eat manna , and are dead : he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever .
text2: Kene ee knin e bɔ piny paannhial : acii cit man ɣɔn e kuarkuɔ cam ne mana , ku yek thou ; raan e cam e kuine abi piir athɛɛr .

text: These things said he in the synagogue , as he taught in Capernaum .
text2: Kake aake lueel luaŋ e Nhialic , te waan weet en e Kaperuaum .

text: Many therefore of his disciples , when they had heard this , said , This is an hard saying ; who can hear it ?
text2: Ago kɔc juec e kɔckɛn e piooce yiic , te ci kek e piŋ , agoki lueel , yan , Ee jam ril ekene ; eeŋa dueer e piŋ ?

text: When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it , he said unto them , Doth this offend you ?
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu e ŋic e yepiɔu nɔn ŋuune kɔckɛn e piooce ne jame , ke ke jɔ thieec , yan , Ci jame we tɔ diu piɔth ?

text: What and if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before ?
text2: Te ca wek Wen e raan tiŋ ke lɔ nhial te waan nu yen thin , duɛɛrki lueel wakdi ?

text: It is the spirit that quickeneth ; the flesh profiteth nothing : the words that I speak unto you , they are spirit , and they are life .
text2: Ee wei kek ee kaŋ tɔ piir ; guop acin ken ee leu : wel ca lɛk week , kek aye wei , ku yek piir .

text: But there are some of you that believe not . For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not , and who should betray him .
text2: Ku ade kɔc kɔk e weyiic kɔc reec gam . Ɣɔn gɔle kaŋ Yecu aa ŋic kɔc bi ye rɛɛc gam , ku ŋic raan bi ye nyiɛɛn .

text: And he said , Therefore said I unto you , that no man can come unto me , except it were given unto him of my Father .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Yen aa lɛk ɛn week , yan , Acin raan dueer bɛn tede yɛn , te kene ye tɔ bɔ ne Waada .

text: From that time many of his disciples went back , and walked no more with him .
text2: Ekoole ke kɔc juec e kɔckɛn e piooce yiic ke ke dɔk rot cieen , ku ciki e bɛ cath e yen .

text: Then said Jesus unto the twelve , Will ye also go away ?
text2: Go Yecu kɔc kathieer ku rou thieec , yan , Dɛki piɔth jal ayadaŋ ?

text: Then Simon Peter answered him , Lord , to whom shall we go ? thou hast the words of eternal life .
text2: Go Thimon Petero puk nɔm , yan , Bɛnydit , buk lɔ tede ŋa ? Yin cath weke wel ke piir athɛɛr .

text: And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ , the Son of the living God .
text2: Ku acuk gam ku ŋicku nɔn ee yin Kritho Wen e Nhialic plir .

text: Jesus answered them , Have not I chosen you twelve , and one of you is a devil ?
text2: Go Yecu pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Kɛn week lɔc wa thieer ku rou , ku raan tok e weyiic ee jɔŋ rac ?

text: He spake of Judas Iscariot the son of Simon : for he it was that should betray him , being one of the twelve .
text2: Aa lueel kene ne kede Judath Yithkariɔt , wen e Thimon , ee yen ee raan bi e nyiɛɛn , ku ye raan toŋ e kɔc kathieer ku rou .

text: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee : for he would not walk in Jewry , because the Jews sought to kill him .
text2: Na wen , aci kake thok , ke Yecu ye cath e Galili : acin piɔu luɔi bi en aa cath e Judaya , luɔi kɔɔre Judai luɔi bi kek e nɔk .

text: Now the Jews ' feast of tabernacles was at hand .
text2: Ku aliith e Judai e guɔ thiɔk , aliith de kɛɛt .

text: His brethren therefore said unto him , Depart hence , and go into Judaea , that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest .
text2: Go yɔɔk e mithekɔcken , yan , Jel etene , lɔ Judaya , ke kɔckuon e piooce ke ke bi luɔidu tiŋ ayadaŋ luɔi loi .

text: For there is no man that doeth any thing in secret , and he himself seeketh to be known openly . If thou do these things , shew thyself to the world .
text2: Acin raan e kaŋ looi athiɛɛn , te kɔɔr en luɔi bi ye ŋic e kɔc . Te looi yin ekake , ke yi nyuth rot kɔc ke piny nɔm .

text: For neither did his brethren believe in him .
text2: Ayi mithekɔcken aya aake ken kede gam .

text: Then Jesus said unto them , My time is not yet come : but your time is alway ready .
text2: Go Yecu keek yɔɔk , yan , Kooldi aŋoot ke ken bɛn ; ku kooldun ee nu ecaŋɣɔn .

text: The world cannot hate you ; but me it hateth , because I testify of it , that the works thereof are evil .
text2: Kɔc ke piny nɔm aciki we dueer maan ; ee yɛn manki , ne luɛl aa yɛn e lueel , yan , luɔiden arac .

text: Go ye up unto this feast : I go not up yet unto this feast ; for my time is not yet full come .
text2: Laki week te nu ahithe : yɛn cii lɔ te nu aliithe enɔɔne ; kooldi aŋoot wei , aken guɔ bɛn .

text: When he had said these words unto them , he abode still in Galilee .
text2: Te ci en ekene lɛk keek , ke ŋoot ke rɛɛr e Galili .

text: But when his brethren were gone up , then went he also up unto the feast , not openly , but as it were in secret .
text2: Na wen , aci mithekɔcken lɔ tede ahith , ke jɔ lɔɔk lɔ aya , ku cii lɔ e kɔc niim , e ro dhaaŋ .

text: Then the Jews sought him at the feast , and said , Where is he ?
text2: Go Judai ye kɔɔr e aliithic , ku yek thieec , yan , Ee tenou nu yen ?

text: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him : for some said , He is a good man : others said , Nay ; but he deceiveth the people .
text2: Ŋun cii kɔc ŋun ne kede aci dit e kɔc yiic : alueel kɔc kɔk , yan , Ee raan piɛth ; go kɔc kɔk lueel , yan , Acie yen , ee kɔc math tei .

text: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews .
text2: Ku acin raan e jam e kede yen e kɔc yiic , ne riɔɔc wen ci kek riɔɔc e Judai .

text: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple , and taught .
text2: Na wen , te cit ahithic cil , ke Yecu lɔ luaŋdiit e Nhialic , le kɔc wɛɛt .

text: And the Jews marvelled , saying , How knoweth this man letters , having never learned ?
text2: Go Judai gai , ku luelki , yan , Raane e ŋic wel adi , ku kene kɔn wɛɛt anande ?

text: Jesus answered them , and said , My doctrine is not mine , but his that sent me .
text2: Go Yecu pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Weet wɛɛt ɛn kɔc acie kedi , ee kede raan e toc ɛn .

text: If any man will do his will , he shall know of the doctrine , whether it be of God , or whether I speak of myself .
text2: Te kɔɔre raan nɔn bi en kede piɔnde looi , ka bi kede weet dhil ŋic , nɔn e bi yen tede Nhialic , ku nɔn jaam ɛn ne kede yenhdi .

text: He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory : but he that seeketh his glory that sent him , the same is true , and no unrighteousness is in him .
text2: Raan e jam e kede yenhde ee lɛc de yenguop en kɔɔr : ku raan kɔɔr lɛc de raan e toc en , yen aye raan yic , ku cinic kerac .

text: Did not Moses give you the law , and yet none of you keepeth the law ? Why go ye about to kill me ?
text2: Ken Mothe we gam loŋ , ku acin raan tok e weyiic raan e loŋ tiiŋic ? Eeŋo kaar wek luɔi nak wek ɛn ?

text: The people answered and said , Thou hast a devil : who goeth about to kill thee ?
text2: Go kut e kɔc bɛɛr , yan , Yin cath we jɔŋ rac ; eeŋa kɔɔr luɔi bi en yi nɔk ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , I have done one work , and ye all marvel .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , lek keek , yan , Luɔi toŋe aca looi , aguɔki gai wedhie .

text: Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision ; ( not because it is of Moses , but of the fathers ; ) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man .
text2: Mothe aci we yien cuɛl ( ku acie kede Mothe , ee kede kuarkuɔ ) ; ku wek ee raan cueel ekool e thabath .

text: If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision , that the law of Moses should not be broken ; are ye angry at me , because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day ?
text2: Ku enɔɔne , te ye raan cueel ekool e thabath , ke loŋ e Mothe cii bi dhɔŋic , eeŋo gɔth wek ne yɛn , luɔi can raan tɔ piɔl guop eliŋliŋ ekool e thabath ?

text: Judge not according to the appearance , but judge righteous judgment .
text2: Duoki loŋ e guiir ne ke ci tic tei , yak loŋ piɛth guiir .

text: Then said some of them of Jerusalem , Is not this he , whom they seek to kill ?
text2: Go kɔc kɔk ke Jeruthalem lueel , an , Cie yen raan kɔɔr kɔc luɔi nɛk kek en ?

text: But , lo , he speaketh boldly , and they say nothing unto him . Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ ?
text2: Wɔiki , ajam e kɔc yiic , ku acin ke lekki yen . Ci bany ceŋ piny dhil ŋic nɔn ee yen Kritho eyic ?

text: Howbeit we know this man whence he is : but when Christ cometh , no man knoweth whence he is .
text2: Ku raane aŋicku te bi yen thin : ku na miak bɔ Kritho , acin raan ŋic te bi en bɛn tliin .

text: Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught , saying , Ye both know me , and ye know whence I am : and I am not come of myself , but he that sent me is true , whom ye know not .
text2: Go Yecu coot luaŋditt e Nhialic , te weet en kɔc , yan , Wek ŋic ɛn , ayi te e ba yɛn thin aya aŋiɛcki ; ku yɛn ecii bɔ ne kede yenhdi , ku raan e toc ɛn , yen aye raan yic , raan kuocki .

text: But I know him : for I am from him , and he hath sent me .
text2: Ku aŋiɛc yɛn ; luɔi e ba yɛn tede yen , ku yen aa toc ɛn .

text: Then they sought to take him : but no man laid hands on him , because his hour was not yet come .
text2: Agoki piɔth dɛ luɔi bi kek e dɔm : ku acin raan ci ecin taau e yeguop , luɔi ŋoote thaarde ke ken guɔ bɛn .

text: And many of the people believed on him , and said , When Christ cometh , will he do more miracles than these which this man hath done ?
text2: Ku kɔc juec ne kutic acik e gam ; ku luelki , yan , Na Kritho , te ci yen bɛn , bi gook looi gook war ka looi e raane ?

text: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him ; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him .
text2: Go Parithai piŋ nɔn ŋuune kɔc aya ne kede ; go Parithai ku bany dit ke ka ke Nhialic goki cawiic tooc , lek dɔm .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , Yet a little while am I with you , and then I go unto him that sent me .
text2: Go Yecu lɛk keek , yan , E doŋ ke ye tethiinakaŋ ke ya rɛɛr wo week , ku ba jɔ lɔ tede raan e toc ɛn .

text: Ye shall seek me , and shall not find me : and where I am , thither ye cannot come .
text2: We bi a kɔɔr , ku we cii a bi yok ; ku te nuo yɛn thin , aca wek dueer bɛn .

text: Then said the Jews among themselves , Whither will he go , that we shall not find him ? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles , and teach the Gentiles ?
text2: Go Judai lueel kapac , yan , Ee tenou bi raane lɔ thin , te cii wok en bi yok ? bi lɔ tede kɔc ci thiei e Giriku yiic , le Girikii aa wɛɛt ?

text: What manner of saying is this that he said , Ye shall seek me , and shall not find me : and where I am , thither ye cannot come ?
text2: Ee jam e lɛnou ekene , jam ci lueel , yan , We bi a kɔɔr , ku we cii a bi yok : ku , yan , Te nuo yɛn thin , aca wek dueer bɛn ?

text: In the last day , that great day of the feast , Jesus stood and cried , saying , If any man thirst , let him come unto me , and drink .
text2: Na wen , ekool thooke ahith , yen aye kool dit , ke Yecu kaac ku coot , yan , Te de yen raan ci yal , ne bɔ tede yɛn , bi bɛn dek .

text: He that believeth on me , as the scripture hath said , out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water .
text2: Raan gam ɛn , acit man ci kecigɔɔr e lueel , ke kiɛɛr ke piu piir abik aa kueer bei e yeyic .

text: ( But this spake he of the Spirit , which they that believe on him should receive : for the Holy Ghost was not yet given ; because that Jesus was not yet glorified . )
text2: Aa luel kene ne kede Weidit , Wei bii kɔc gam en lɔɔk noom ; Weidit Ɣer aake ŋoot e ke kene guɔ gam ; luɔi ŋoote Yecu ke kene guɔ gam dhueeŋ .

text: Many of the people therefore , when they heard this saying , said , Of a truth this is the Prophet .
text2: Na wen , acik jame piŋ , ke lueel kɔc juec e kut e kɔc yiic , yan , Raane ee nebi eyic .

text: Others said , This is the Christ . But some said , Shall Christ come out of Galilee ?
text2: Ku lueel kɔc kɔk , yan , Raane ee Kritho . Ku ne kɔc kɔk , yan , Cai ! bi Kritho bɛn bei e Galili ?

text: Hath not the scripture said , That Christ cometh of the seed of David , and out of the town of Bethlehem , where David was ?
text2: Kene kecigɔɔr lueel , yan , Kritho abɔ ne kau de Dabid , ku bi bei e Bethlekem , paan ɣɔn nu Dabid thin ?

text: So there was a division among the people because of him .
text2: Go ater ro cak e kut e kɔc yiic ne biakde .

text: And some of them would have taken him ; but no man laid hands on him .
text2: Kɔc kɔk acik piɔth dɛ luɔi dɔm kek en ; ku acin raan ci ecin taau e yeguop .

text: Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees ; and they said unto them , Why have ye not brought him ?
text2: Go cawiic wen goki bɛn tede bany dit ke ka ke Nhialic ku Parithai ; goki keek thieec , yan , Eeŋo kɛn wek en bɛɛi ?

text: The officers answered , Never man spake like this man .
text2: Go cawiic pɔk niim keek , yan , Ecaŋɣɔn acin raan ci kɔn jam cit man e raane .

text: Then answered them the Pharisees , Are ye also deceived ?
text2: Go Parithai pɔk niim keek , yan , Ci we math ayadaŋ ?

text: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him ?
text2: De raan toŋ ci e gam ne bany yiic ayi Parithai yiic ?

text: But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed .
text2: Ku na kut e kɔce kut kuc loŋ , kek adeki gup aciɛɛn .

text: Nicodemus saith unto them , ( he that came to Jesus by night , being one of them , )
text2: Go Nikodemo ( yen aye raan waan bɔ tede yen wakɔu , ku ye raan toŋden ) , go keek thieec , yan ,

text: Doth our law judge any man , before it hear him , and know what he doeth ?
text2: Loŋda ee kede raan guiir , te ken en jam kɔn piŋ e raan thok , ku jɔ ke loi ŋic ?

text: They answered and said unto him , Art thou also of Galilee ? Search , and look : for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet .
text2: Goki bɛɛr , yookki , yan , Ayik yin , yee raan e Galili ? Kɔɔr ku tiŋ : acin nebi e ro jɔt bi bei e Galili .

text: And every man went unto his own house .
text2: Goki jal kedhie , lɔ ŋɛk ɣonde , ku lɔ ŋɛk ɣonde .

text: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives .
text2: Ku lɔ Yecu te nu kuur e Olip .

text: And early in the morning he came again into the temple , and all the people came unto him ; and he sat down , and taught them .
text2: Na wen , aru piny , ke be bɛn luaŋdiit e Nhialic , ku bɔ kɔc te nu yen kedhie ; go nyuc , weet keek .

text: And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery ; and when they had set her in the midst ,
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr keke Parithai ke ke bii tik te nu yen , tiiŋ ci dɔm ke ci lɔ keke mony lei ; agoki taau e ciɛɛlic ,

text: They say unto him , Master , this woman was taken in adultery , in the very act .
text2: ku luelki , yan , Bɛny e weet , tiiŋe aci dɔm ke mony lei , aake yok ke ke nin etok .

text: Now Moses in the law commanded us , that such should be stoned : but what sayest thou ?
text2: Ku wo cii Mothe yɔɔk e loŋic , yan , Kɔc loi kacit ekake adueereke biɔɔk e kur : ku na yin , luel wudi ?

text: This they said , tempting him , that they might have to accuse him . But Jesus stooped down , and with his finger wrote on the ground , as though he heard them not .
text2: Aake lueel kene them kek en , ke bi dɛ te gɔɔny kek en . Go Yecu enɔm guot piny tei , gɛɛr piny e yecin .

text: So when they continued asking him , he lifted up himself , and said unto them , He that is without sin among you , let him first cast a stone at her .
text2: Na wen , acik cool e thieec kek en , ke jɔ ro jɔt , yook keek , yan , Raan cin piɔu kerac e weyiic , e kɔn kuur dɛny en .

text: And again he stooped down , and wrote on the ground .
text2: Go yenɔm bɛ guot piny , gɛɛr piny e yecin .

text: And they which heard it , being convicted by their own conscience , went out one by one , beginning at the eldest , even unto the last : and Jesus was left alone , and the woman standing in the midst .
text2: Te ci kek e piŋ , go piɔthken ke jɔɔny , goki lɔ biic elemlem , gɔl e kɔc dit , leer e kɔc kor : abi Yecu doŋ etok , ku kaac tiiŋe e ciɛɛlic tedɛn wen .

text: When Jesus had lifted up himself , and saw none but the woman , he said unto her , Woman , where are those thine accusers ? hath no man condemned thee ?
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu ro jɔt , ku acin raan ci tiŋ , ee tik etok , ke jɔ thieec , yan , Tiiŋe , kɔc akou kɔc wenthɛɛr gɔɔny yin ? Cin raan ci yin yiek yeth gaak ?

text: She said , No man , Lord . And Jesus said unto her , Neither do I condemn thee : go , and sin no more .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Acin raan , Bɛnydit . Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Ayi yɛn aya , yin ca bi yick yeth gaak : lɔ , du kerac be looi anandu .

text: Then spake Jesus again unto them , saying , I am the light of the world : he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness , but shall have the light of life .
text2: Go Yecu kɔc yɔɔk , yan , Yɛn ee ɣɛɛr e piny nɔm : raan kuany acok acii bi cath tecol , ku bi dɛ ɣɛɛrepiny de piir .

text: The Pharisees therefore said unto him , Thou bearest record of thyself ; thy record is not true .
text2: Go Parithai lueel , yan , Yin e kaŋ lueel e kede yenhdu ; keduon luel acie yic .

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Though I bear record of myself , yet my record is true : for I know whence I came , and whither I go ; but ye cannot tell whence I come , and whither I go .
text2: Go Yecu pɔk nɔm keek , Na ya cak kaŋ lueel ne kede yenhdi , ke kedi ee yic ; yɛn ŋic te e ba yɛn thin ayi te la yɛn thin ; ku week , we kuc te e ba yɛn thin , ku kuocki te la yɛn thin .

text: Ye judge after the flesh ; I judge no man .
text2: Wek ee loŋ guiir ne kede guop tei ; ku yɛn , acin raan aa yɛn loŋde guiir .

text: And yet if I judge , my judgment is true : for I am not alone , but I and the Father that sent me .
text2: Ku na ya cak loŋ aa guiir , ke guieer aa yɛn loŋ guiir ee yic ; yɛn cii rɛɛr atok , ee yɛn woke Waar raan e toc ɛn .

text: It is also written in your law , that the testimony of two men is true .
text2: Ku aci gɔɔr e loŋ dunic aya , yan , Ke lueel caatɔɔ kaarou , yen aye yic .

text: I am one that bear witness of myself , and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me .
text2: Yɛn ee caatɔ e rot atok , ku Waar raan e toc ɛn ee caatɔdi aya .

text: Then said they unto him , Where is thy Father ? Jesus answered , Ye neither know me , nor my Father : if ye had known me , ye should have known my Father also .
text2: Agoki thieec , yan , Nu Wuur enou ? Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Wek kuc ɛn ayi Waar : tee we ŋic ɛn , adi ŋiɛcki Waar aya .

text: These words spake Jesus in the treasury , as he taught in the temple : and no man laid hands on him ; for his hour was not yet come .
text2: Aa luel welke te ye kaŋ juaar thin , te weet en kɔc luaŋdiit e Nhialic : ku acin raan e dɔm en ; luɔi ŋoote thaarde ke ken bɛn .

text: Then said Jesus again unto them , I go my way , and ye shall seek me , and shall die in your sins : whither I go , ye cannot come .
text2: Go Yecu keek bɛ yɔɔk , yan , Yɛn jel e jaldi , ku we bi a kɔɔr , ku we bi thou e kerɛɛcdunic : te la yɛn thin , ke wek cii dueer bɛn .

text: Then said the Jews , Will he kill himself ? because he saith , Whither I go , ye cannot come .
text2: Go Judai lueel , yan , Bi ro nɔk , nɔn lueel en en , yan , Te la yɛn thin , ke wek ci dueer bɛn ?

text: And he said unto them , Ye are from beneath ; I am from above : ye are of this world ; I am not of this world .
text2: Go lɛk keek , yan , Wek e bɔ piny ; ku yɛn e bɔ nhial : wek ee ka ke pinye nɔm ; yɛn cie ke de pinye nɔm .

text: I said therefore unto you , that ye shall die in your sins : for if ye believe not that I am he , ye shall die in your sins .
text2: Yen aa lɛk ɛn e week , yan , We bi thou ne karɛckun yiic : ku te kɛn wek a gam , nɔn aa yɛn en , ke we bi thou e karɛckun yiic .

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? And Jesus saith unto them , Even the same that I said unto you from the beginning .
text2: Goki thieec , yan , Ee yin ŋa ? Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Ee raan waan aa cool e lɛk ɛn e week ecaŋɣɔn .

text: I have many things to say and to judge of you : but he that sent me is true ; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him .
text2: Yɛn de kajuec ba lueel e kedun ayi looŋ juec ba guiir : ku raan e toc ɛn ee yic ; ku ka ca piŋ tede yen , kake aya ke lɛk kɔc ke piny nɔm .

text: They understood not that he spake to them of the Father .
text2: Aake kuc nɔn ci e lɛk keek ne kede Wun .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , When ye have lifted up the Son of man , then shall ye know that I am he , and that I do nothing of myself ; but as my Father hath taught me , I speak these things .
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Te ca wek Wen e raan taau nhial , yen aba wek e ŋic nɔn aa yɛn en , ku nɔn cin en ke ca looi ne kede yenhdi , ku weet cii Waar a wɛɛt , yen aa luɛɛl ɛn kake .

text: And he that sent me is with me : the Father hath not left me alone ; for I do always those things that please him .
text2: Ku raan e toc ɛn , yen areer wok etok ; Waar aken a nyaaŋ piny atok ; luɔi aa yɛn cool e loi kamit e yepiɔu .

text: As he spake these words , many believed on him .
text2: Na wen , alueel kake , ke jɔ kɔc juec kede gam .

text: Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him , If ye continue in my word , then are ye my disciples indeed ;
text2: Go Yecu Judai wen ci ye gam yɔɔk , yan , Te tau wek e jamdiyic , ka wek ee kɔckien e piooce ne yic ;

text: And ye shall know the truth , and the truth shall make you free .
text2: ku we bi yic ŋic , ku yic abi we lony .

text: They answered him , We be Abraham ' s seed , and were never in bondage to any man : how sayest thou , Ye shall be made free ?
text2: Goki bɛɛr , yan , Wok ee kɔth ke Abraɣam , ku wo ken kɔn aa him ke raan daŋ ecaŋɣɔn : eeŋo lueel yin en , yan , We bi lony ?

text: Jesus answered them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Raan ebɛn raan e kerac looi , yen aye lim e kerac .

text: And the servant abideth not in the house for ever : but the Son abideth ever .
text2: Ku lim acie reer ɣoot athɛɛr : ku Wendit yen aye reer athɛɛr .

text: If the Son therefore shall make you free , ye shall be free indeed .
text2: Ku te lonye Wendit week , ke we bi aa kɔc ci lony eyic .

text: I know that ye are Abraham ' s seed ; but ye seek to kill me , because my word hath no place in you .
text2: Wek ŋiɛc nɔn aa wek kɔth ke Abraɣam ; ku wek kɔɔr luɔi nak wek ɛn , luɔi cin en te bi jamdi reer e weyiic .

text: I speak that which I have seen with my Father : and ye do that which ye have seen with your father .
text2: Yɛn ee kaŋ lueel ka ca piŋ tede Waar : ku week aya , wek ee kaŋ looi ka cak piŋ tede woordun .

text: They answered and said unto him , Abraham is our father . Jesus saith unto them , If ye were Abraham ' s children , ye would do the works of Abraham .
text2: Goki bɛɛr , yookki , yan , Abraɣam yen aye waada . Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Tee ya wek mith ke Abraɣam , adi yak luɔi de Abraɣam looi .

text: But now ye seek to kill me , a man that hath told you the truth , which I have heard of God : this did not Abraham .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , wek kɔɔr luɔi nak wek ɛn , raan ci week lɛk yic , ke ca piŋ tede Nhialic : kene akene Abraɣam looi .

text: Ye do the deeds of your father . Then said they to him , We be not born of fornication ; we have one Father , even God .
text2: Wek ee luɔi e woordun looi . Goki lueel , yan , Wo cie adhiethleer ; wo de Waadan tok , Nhialic .

text: Jesus said unto them , If God were your Father , ye would love me : for I proceeded forth and came from God ; neither came I of myself , but he sent me .
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Tee ye Nhialic yen ee Woordun , adi yak a nhiaar : nɔn e ba yɛn tede Nhialic ba ene ; ku yɛn ecii bɔ ne kede yenhdi , yen aa toc ɛn .

text: Why do ye not understand my speech ? even because ye cannot hear my word .
text2: Eeŋo ca we jamdi ŋic ? Ee luɔi ca wek jamdi leu ne piŋ .

text: Ye are of your father the devil , and the lusts of your father ye will do . He was a murderer from the beginning , and abode not in the truth , because there is no truth in him . When he speaketh a lie , he speaketh of his own : for he is a liar , and the father of it .
text2: Wek ee mith ke jɔŋdiit rac woordun , ku kɔɔr kɔɔre woordun kerac , yen aa yak kɔɔr ayadaŋ . Yen aa ye nɛk te ɣɔn ciɛke kaŋ , ku reec ceŋ ne yicic , luɔi hiuwe yic tede yen . Te tɔɔr en lueth , ee kede en lueel ; nɔn ee yen alueeth , ku ye wun lueth .

text: And because I tell you the truth , ye believe me not .
text2: Ku luɔi luɛɛl ɛn yic , yen a ca wek a gam .

text: Which of you convinceth me of sin ? And if I say the truth , why do ye not believe me ?
text2: Eeŋa ne weyiic raan dueer a jɔɔny ne baŋ de kerac ? Ku na luɛɛl yic , eeŋo ca wek a gam ?

text: He that is of God heareth God ' s words : ye therefore hear them not , because ye are not of God .
text2: Raan e Nhialic ee wel ke Nhialic piŋ : yen a ca wek ke piŋ , luɔi ca wek e kɔc ke Nhialic .

text: Then answered the Jews , and said unto him , Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan , and hast a devil ?
text2: Ago Judai bɛɛr , luelki , yan , Cie yic en luelku , yan , Yin ee Thamaritan , ku deye guop jɔŋ rac ?

text: Jesus answered , I have not a devil ; but I honour my Father , and ye do dishonour me .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Yɛn cin guop jɔŋ rac ; ku yɛn rieu Waar , ku wek reec a rieu .

text: And I seek not mine own glory : there is one that seeketh and judgeth .
text2: Ku yɛn cii lɛcdi kɔɔr : raan tok anu raan kɔɔr lɛc bi a leec , ku yen aye loŋ guiir .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , If a man keep my saying , he shall never see death .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Te dote raan welki , ka cii thuɔɔu bi tiŋ anande .

text: Then said the Jews unto him , Now we know that thou hast a devil . Abraham is dead , and the prophets ; and thou sayest , If a man keep my saying , he shall never taste of death .
text2: Go yɔɔk e Judai , yan , Enɔɔne aŋicku nɔn de yin guop jɔŋ rac . Abraɣam e thou , ayi nebii ; ku ye lueel , yan , Te dote raan welki , ka cii thuɔɔu bi thieep anande .

text: Art thou greater than our father Abraham , which is dead ? and the prophets are dead : whom makest thou thyself ?
text2: War waada Abraɣam ne dit , raan ci thou ? ayi nebii acik thou : ye rot tɔ ye ŋa ?

text: Jesus answered , If I honour myself , my honour is nothing : it is my Father that honoureth me ; of whom ye say , that he is your God :
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Te lɛɛe ɛn rot , ke lɛcdi acin naamde : ee Waar yen alec ɛn ; raan yak lueel , an , ee Nhialicdun ;

text: Yet ye have not known him ; but I know him : and if I should say , I know him not , I shall be a liar like unto you : but I know him , and keep his saying .
text2: ku akɛnki ŋic : ku aŋiɛc yɛn ; ku na luɛɛl en , yan , Akuoc , ke yɛn bi ya alueeth cit week : ku aŋiɛc , ku ya jamde dot .

text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day : and he saw it , and was glad .
text2: Kuɛɛredun Abraɣam aa mit piɔu ne tiŋ dueer en kooldi tiŋ ; ago tiŋ , ku jɔ piɔu a yum .

text: Then said the Jews unto him , Thou art not yet fifty years old , and hast thou seen Abraham ?
text2: Go yɔɔk e Judai , yan , Runku yin aŋootki e ke ken aa thierdhic , ku ci Abraɣam tiŋ ?

text: Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Before Abraham was , I am .
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Ɣɔn ŋoote Abraɣam ke liu , yɛn e nu .

text: Then took they up stones to cast at him : but Jesus hid himself , and went out of the temple , going through the midst of them , and so passed by .
text2: Goki kur kuany piny lek biɔɔk : go Yecu thiaan , na wen , ke jel le biic luaŋditt e Nhialic , aa tek e keyiic cil , bɛɛric aya .

text: And as Jesus passed by , he saw a man which was blind from his birth .
text2: Na wen , ateek , ke tiŋ raan e dhieth ke ye cɔɔr .

text: And his disciples asked him , saying , Master , who did sin , this man , or his parents , that he was born blind ?
text2: Go kɔcken e piooce thieec , yan , Rabi , eeŋa e loi kerac , ne yi raane , keke wun ku man , e nɔn e dhiethe ye ke ye cɔɔr ?

text: Jesus answered , Neither hath this man sinned , nor his parents : but that the works of God should be made manifest in him .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Acie raane yen e loi kerac , ku cie wun ayi man : ee tic bi luɔi e Nhialic tic e yeguop .

text: I must work the works of him that sent me , while it is day : the night cometh , when no man can work .
text2: Yɛn bi luɔi dhil aa looi , luɔi e raan e toc ɛn , te ŋoote piny ke ye akol : wakɔu abɔ , te cin raan dueer luui .

text: As long as I am in the world , I am the light of the world .
text2: Te ŋuɔɔt ɛn ke ya nu e piny nɔm , ke yɛn ee ɣɛɛr e piny nɔm .

text: When he had thus spoken , he spat on the ground , and made clay of the spittle , and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay ,
text2: Na wen , aci kake lueel , ke jɔ piny ŋuoot , go tiɔp nuaai e luɛɛth , go cɔɔr rɔɔth nyin e tiɔp ,

text: And said unto him , Go , wash in the pool of Siloam , ( which is by interpretation , Sent . ) He went his way therefore , and washed , and came seeing .
text2: ku yook , yan , Lɔ , waake e awol e Thiloamic ( yen aye Tuc ne thoŋda ) . Go lɔ , ku wɛɛk , ku le bɛn ke daai .

text: The neighbours therefore , and they which before had seen him that he was blind , said , Is not this he that sat and begged ?
text2: Go kɔc rɛɛr e yen etok , ayi kɔc waan e ye tiŋ nɔn ee yen cɔɔr , agoki lueel , yan , Cie raan waan e reer piny ke lip ? Go kɔc kɔk lueel , yan , Ee yen : ku lueel kɔk , yan , Ei , ku acit en : go lueel , yan , Ee yɛn .

text: Therefore said they unto him , How were thine eyes opened ?
text2: Goki thieec , yan , E yi liep nyin adi ?

text: He answered and said , A man that is called Jesus made clay , and anointed mine eyes , and said unto me , Go to the pool of Siloam , and wash : and I went and washed , and I received sight .
text2: Go bɛɛr , yan , Raan cɔl Yecu e tiɔp nuaai , ku rɔɔth anyin , go lɛk ɛn , an , Lɔ waake : guɔ lɔ , ku waak , guɔ piny tiŋ .

text: Then said they unto him , Where is he ? He said , I know not .
text2: Goki thieec , yan , Nu nou yen eraane ? Go lueel , yan , Akuoc .

text: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind .
text2: Goki bɛɛi tede Parithai yen raan waan ee cɔɔr .

text: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay , and opened his eyes .
text2: Ku yen aa ye kool e thabath kool waan nuɛɛiye Yecu tiɔp , ku liep raan nyin .

text: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight . He said unto them , He put clay upon mine eyes , and I washed , and do see .
text2: Go Parithai bɛ thieec ne ke ci en piny tiŋ . Go lek keek , yan , Aa tɛɛu tiɔp e yanyin , ku ja waak , aguɔ jɔ guɔ daai .

text: Therefore said some of the Pharisees , This man is not of God , because he keepeth not the sabbath day . Others said , How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles ? And there was a division among them .
text2: Go Parithai kɔk lueel , yan , Raane aacii bɔ tede Nhialic , ee kool e thabath rɛɛc dot . Ku lueel kɔc kɔk , yan , Raan e kerac looi dueer gook cit ekake looi adi ? Go teer ro cak e keyiic .

text: They say unto the blind man again , What sayest thou of him , that he hath opened thine eyes ? He said , He is a prophet .
text2: Goki cɔɔr be thieec , yan , Yin , luel wudi ne kede , ne ke ci en yi iiep nyin ? Go lueel , yan , Ee nebi .
