text: But the Jews did not believe concerning him , that he had been blind , and received his sight , until they called the parents of him that had received his sight .
text2: Ku reec Judai gam ne kede , nɔn ee yen cɔɔr , ku be piny tiŋ , a kɔn kek wun raan ci tɔ daai cɔɔl ayi man .

text: And they asked them , saying , Is this your son , who ye say was born blind ? how then doth he now see ?
text2: Goki ke thieec , yan , Ee wendun ekene , raan wen luɛlki , yan , e dhieth ke ye cɔɔr ? E jɔ daai adi enɔɔne ?

text: His parents answered them and said , We know that this is our son , and that he was born blind :
text2: Go wun bɛɛr ayi man , luelki , yan , Mɛnhe aŋicku nɔn ee yen wenda , ku ŋicku nɔn e dhiethe yen ke ye cɔɔr :

text: But by what means he now seeth , we know not ; or who hath opened his eyes , we know not : he is of age ; ask him : he shall speak for himself .
text2: ku ke tɔ ye daai enɔɔne akucku : ayi raan e liep yenyin , akucku : ee raan dit ; jaki thieec ; abi kede lueel yen etok .

text: These words spake his parents , because they feared the Jews : for the Jews had agreed already , that if any man did confess that he was Christ , he should be put out of the synagogue .
text2: Kake aake lueel wun keke man , ne riɔɔc riɔɔc kek e Judai : Judai aake ci kethook mat , yan , Te de yen raan gam en , yan , ee Kritho , ka bi ciɛɛc biic luaŋ e Nhialic .

text: Therefore said his parents , He is of age ; ask him .
text2: Yen aa lueel wun ayi man , yan , Ee raan dit ; thiecki .

text: Then again called they the man that was blind , and said unto him , Give God the praise : we know that this man is a sinner .
text2: Goki raan wen ee cɔɔr bɛ cɔɔl raanrou , ku yookki , yan , Lec Nhialic : raane aŋicku nɔn ee yen raan e kerac looi .

text: He answered and said , Whether he be a sinner or no , I know not : one thing I know , that , whereas I was blind , now I see .
text2: Go bɛɛr , yan , Nɔn ee yen raan e kerac looi , ku nɔn cii en e yen , aa ja kuc : ee cook tok yen aŋiɛc , yan , Waan yɛn aa ye cɔɔr , enɔɔne yɛn daai .

text: Then said they to him again , What did he to thee ? how opened he thine eyes ?
text2: Goki bɛ thieec , yan , E loi yin adi ? e liep inyin adi ?

text: He answered them , I have told you already , and ye did not hear : wherefore would ye hear it again ? will ye also be his disciples ?
text2: Go pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Aca kɔn lɛk week wen , ku kɛnki piŋ : eeŋo kaarki , ke bak bɛ piŋ ? kaarki luɔi ba wek aa kɔckɛn e piooce ayadaŋ ?

text: Then they reviled him , and said , Thou art his disciple ; but we are Moses ' disciples .
text2: Agoki lat , ku luelki , yan , Yin ee raandɛn e piooce ; ku wok ee kɔcpiooce Mothe .

text: We know that God spake unto Moses : as for this fellow , we know not from whence he is .
text2: Aŋicku nɔn ci Nhialic jam keke Mothe : ku na yeraane , akucku tedɛn e bi yen thin .

text: The man answered and said unto them , Why herein is a marvellous thing , that ye know not from whence he is , and yet he hath opened mine eyes .
text2: Go raan bɛɛr , lueel , yan , Mane ke ye kɔc tɔ gai , kuny kuoc wek te e bi yen thin , ku yen aa liep anyin .

text: Now we know that God heareth not sinners : but if any man be a worshipper of God , and doeth his will , him he heareth .
text2: Aŋicku nɔn cii Nhialic kede kɔc e kerac looi ye piŋ : ku te rieuwe raan Nhialic , ku ye kede piɔnde looi , kede aye Nhialic piŋ .

text: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind .
text2: Te ɣɔn ciɛke piny akene kɔn piŋ nɔn de yen raan ci raan liep nyin raan ci dhieth ke ye cɔɔr .

text: If this man were not of God , he could do nothing .
text2: Raane , tee cie raan e Nhialic , adi cin ke ye leu .

text: They answered and said unto him , Thou wast altogether born in sins , and dost thou teach us ? And they cast him out .
text2: Goki bɛɛr , yookki , yan , Yin aa dhieth e keracic eliŋliŋ , ku ba wook wɛɛt ? Agoki ciɛɛc biic .

text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out ; and when he had found him , he said unto him , Dost thou believe on the Son of God ?
text2: Ago Yecu piŋ nɔn ci kek e ciɛɛc biic ; go yok , ku thieec , yan , Gam Wen e Nhialic ?

text: He answered and said , Who is he , Lord , that I might believe on him ?
text2: Go bɛɛr , thieec , yan , Ye ŋa , Bɛnydit , ke ban e gam ?

text: And Jesus said unto him , Thou hast both seen him , and it is he that talketh with thee .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Aci tiŋ guop , ku ye ki , ee raan jam keke yine .

text: And he said , Lord , I believe . And he worshipped him .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Aca gam , Bɛnydit . Go lam .

text: And Jesus said , For judgment I am come into this world , that they which see not might see ; and that they which see might be made blind .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Ee guieereloŋ yen aa bii yɛn e piny nɔm , ke kɔc cie daai e ke bi bɛn daai , ku bi kɔc daai bik cɔɔr .

text: And some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words , and said unto him , Are we blind also ?
text2: Te ci Parithai kake piŋ , Parithai nu e yelɔɔm , ke jɔki thieec , yan , Ayi wook , yok coor ?

text: Jesus said unto them , If ye were blind , ye should have no sin : but now ye say , We see ; therefore your sin remaineth .
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Tee we ye coor , adi cin kerɛɛc cath ke week : ku enɔɔne ayak lueel , yan , Wok daai , yen aye tau tɔuwe kerɛɛcdun .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold , but climbeth up some other way , the same is a thief and a robber .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Raan cii tek e agau thok le agan e thokic , ku kɛɛc e agau nɔm e baŋ daŋ , yen aye cuɛɛr , raan e kaŋ kual .

text: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep .
text2: Ku raan tek e agau thok , yen aye tin e thok .

text: To him the porter openeth ; and the sheep hear his voice : and he calleth his own sheep by name , and leadeth them out .
text2: Raan tit agau thok ee agau tuɛɛr en ; go thok rolde piŋ : go thok ke yenguop cɔɔl ne rinken , ku jɔ ke tɔ lɔ biic .

text: And when he putteth forth his own sheep , he goeth before them , and the sheep follow him : for they know his voice .
text2: Ku te tɔ en thok ke yenguop lɔ biic , ke jɔ lɔ e keniim tueŋ , ku kuɛny thok cok , luɔi ŋic kek rolde .

text: And a stranger will they not follow , but will flee from him : for they know not the voice of strangers .
text2: Ku aciki raan lei dueer aa kuany cok ananden , abik aa kat e ye , luɔi kuc kek rol e kɔc lei .

text: This parable spake Jesus unto them : but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them .
text2: Kaaŋe aa leke Yecu keek : goki jam e leke keek cuo yokic .

text: Then said Jesus unto them again , Verily , verily , I say unto you , I am the door of the sheep .
text2: Go Yecu ke bɛ yɔɔk , yan , Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Yɛn ee agau thok , agan e thok .

text: All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers : but the sheep did not hear them .
text2: Kɔc ci kɔn bɛn e yanɔm tueŋ kɔc kedhie , aa yek cuɛɛr , kɔc e kual ; ago thok keden cuo piŋ .

text: I am the door : by me if any man enter in , he shall be saved , and shall go in and out , and find pasture .
text2: Yɛn ee agau thok : raan tek le thin ne yɛn , ka bi kony wei , go ya lɔ thin ku le biic , ago wal aa yok .

text: The thief cometh not , but for to steal , and to kill , and to destroy : I am come that they might have life , and that they might have it more abundantly .
text2: Cuɛɛr acin daŋ e bii yen , ee kuel etok , ku naak , ku riaak de kaŋ : yɛn aa bɔ luɔi bi kek dɛ piir , abik kuɛth e ye .

text: I am the good shepherd : the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep .
text2: Yɛn ee tin piɛth tin e thok : ku tin piɛth ee weike gaam ne baŋ de thok .

text: But he that is an hireling , and not the shepherd , whose own the sheep are not , seeth the wolf coming , and leaveth the sheep , and fleeth : and the wolf catcheth them , and scattereth the sheep .
text2: Ku raan ci kur , ku cie tit , thok aciki e ka ke yen , ee aŋni tiŋ , go thok nyaaŋ piny , ku kɔt , go aŋni thok gɔp , thiei ke :

text: The hireling fleeth , because he is an hireling , and careth not for the sheep .
text2: ee kat , luɔi ee yen raan e kur tei , ku acin kede thin e thok yiic .

text: I am the good shepherd , and know my sheep , and am known of mine .
text2: Yɛn ee tin piɛth , tin e thok ; ku ŋiɛc kaki , ku yɛn ŋic kaki ,

text: As the Father knoweth me , even so know I the Father : and I lay down my life for the sheep .
text2: acit man ŋice Waar yɛn , ku ŋiɛc Waar ; ku yɛn e weiki gaam ne baŋ de thok .

text: And other sheep I have , which are not of this fold : them also I must bring , and they shall hear my voice ; and there shall be one fold , and one shepherd .
text2: Ku yɛn de thok kɔk aya , thok cie ka ke agane : kek ayadaŋ aba ke dhil bɛɛi , agoki roldi piŋ ; agoki ya luny tok , ku tin tok .

text: Therefore doth my Father love me , because I lay down my life , that I might take it again .
text2: Yen a nhiɛɛre Waar ɛn , luɔi gam ɛn weiki , ke ke ba bɛ kuany niim .

text: No man taketh it from me , but I lay it down of myself . I have power to lay it down , and I have power to take it again . This commandment have I received of my Father .
text2: Acin raan ci ke noom tede yɛn , ee yɛn e gɛm keek yatok . Yɛn cath wo riɛl ban ke gaam , ku dɛ riɛl ban ke kuany niim aya . Thone aa yɔk tede waar .

text: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings .
text2: Ago Judai teer bɛ gɔl e biak de welke .

text: And many of them said , He hath a devil , and is mad ; why hear ye him ?
text2: Aa lueel kɔc juec , yan , Ade guop jɔŋ rac , ke ye miɔl ; eeŋo piɛŋ wek kede ?

text: Others said , These are not the words of him that hath a devil . Can a devil open the eyes of the blind ?
text2: Ku lueel kɔc kɔk , yan , Kake aciki e wel ke raan de guop jɔŋ rac . Jɔŋ rac dueer cɔɔr liep nyin ?

text: And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication , and it was winter .
text2: Ku nu ahith e Jeruthalem , aliith e kool cii luaŋdit gam Nhialic : ku piny ee rut ;

text: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon ' s porch .
text2: ku cath Yecu luaŋdiit e Nhialic e gɔɔlic gol e Tholomon .

text: Then came the Jews round about him , and said unto him , How long dost thou make us to doubt ? If thou be the Christ , tell us plainly .
text2: Na wen , ke Judai ke ke bɔ geeuki cil , yooklti , yan , Ba wo tɔ wiel e kaamic ananda ? Na yee Kritho , ke lɛke wook abuk piŋ .

text: Jesus answered them , I told you , and ye believed not : the works that I do in my Father ' s name , they bear witness of me .
text2: Go Yecu pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Aca lɛk week , ku caki gam : ka ya looi ne rin ke Waar , kek aye caatɔdi .

text: But ye believe not , because ye are not of my sheep , as I said unto you .
text2: Ku acaki gam , luɔi ca wek e thokki , cit man wen can e lɛk week .

text: My sheep hear my voice , and I know them , and they follow me :
text2: Thokki ayek roldi prŋ , ku aŋiɛc keek , ku yek a kuany cok :

text: And I give unto them eternal life ; and they shall never perish , neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand .
text2: aguɔ ke miɔɔc ne piir athɛɛr ; ku aciki bi maar athɛɛr , ku acin raan bi keek gɔp bei e yaciin .

text: My Father , which gave them me , is greater than all ; and no man is able to pluck them out of my Father ' s hand .
text2: Waar , raan e gɛm ke yɛn , adit awar jaŋ ebɛn ; ku acin raan dueer ke gɔp bei e Waar ciin .

text: I and my Father are one .
text2: Wok woke Waar wok ee tok .

text: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him .
text2: Go Judai kur bɛ kuany piny , lek biɔɔk .

text: Jesus answered them , Many good works have I shewed you from my Father ; for which of those works do ye stone me ?
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Luɔi piɛth juec aca ke nyuoth week luɔi ca yok tede Waar ; e biak de luɔiyou e biɔɔk wek ɛn e keyiic ?

text: The Jews answered him , saying , For a good work we stone thee not ; but for blasphemy ; and because that thou , being a man , makest thyself God .
text2: Go Judai bɛɛr , yan , Acie biak de luɔi piɛth en e biook wok yin , ee biak de lan ee yin Nhialic lat ; ku luɔi e yin ro tɔ ye Nhialic , ku ye raan tei .

text: Jesus answered them , Is it not written in your law , I said , Ye are gods ?
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Kene gɔɔr e loŋdunic , yan , Aca lueel , yan , Wek ee nhialic ?

text: If he called them gods , unto whom the word of God came , and the scripture cannot be broken ;
text2: Ku te ci en keek tɔ ye nhialic , kek kɔc ɣɔn bii jam e Nhialic tede keek ( ku kecigɔɔr aci dueere dhɔŋic ) ,

text: Say ye of him , whom the Father hath sanctified , and sent into the world , Thou blasphemest ; because I said , I am the Son of God ?
text2: na raan cii Nhialic tɔ ɣerpiɔu , ago tuɔɔc e piny nɔm , bak yɔɔk , yan , Yin e Nhialic lat ; ne luɛl can e lueel , yan , Yɛn ee Wen e Nhialic ?

text: If I do not the works of my Father , believe me not .
text2: Te kɛn ɛn luɔi de Waar aa looi , duoki ya gam .

text: But if I do , though ye believe not me , believe the works : that ye may know , and believe , that the Father is in me , and I in him .
text2: Ku te luɔɔi ɛn en , ciɛk , an , rɛɛcki ya gam , ke we gam luɔi ; ke bak ŋic , ku gamki , nɔn nu Waar e yayic , ku nuo e yeyic .

text: Therefore they sought again to take him : but he escaped out of their hand ,
text2: Agoki bɛ kɔɔr luɔi dɔm kek en : go poth e kecin .

text: And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized ; and there he abode .
text2: Ku be jal le e Jordan nɔm lɔŋtni , le te waan kɔne Jɔn baptith thin ; le reer etɛɛn .

text: And many resorted unto him , and said , John did no miracle : but all things that John spake of this man were true .
text2: Go kɔc juec bɛn te nu yen ; luelki , yan , Jɔn acin gok ci looi : ku kaŋ kedhie kak e lueele Jɔn ne kede raane acik aa yith .

text: And many believed on him there .
text2: Go kɔc juec kede gam etɛɛn .

text: Now a certain man was sick , named Lazarus , of Bethany , the town of Mary and her sister Martha .
text2: Aa de raan e de guop juai , cɔl Ladharo , raan e Bethani , baai e yi Mari keke nyankene Martha .

text: ( It was that Mary which anointed the Lord with ointment , and wiped his feet with her hair , whose brother Lazarus was sick . )
text2: Yen aye Mari waan tɔc Bɛnydit ne miok tum , ku coth cok e nhim ke yenɔm , yen aa tooke manhe Ladharo .

text: Therefore his sisters sent unto him , saying , Lord , behold , he whom thou lovest is sick .
text2: Go nyiirakecken raan tooc le ku lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , raanduon nhiaar ade guop juai .

text: When Jesus heard that , he said , This sickness is not unto death , but for the glory of God , that the Son of God might be glorified thereby .
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu ye piŋ , ke lueel , yan , Juane acie kede thuɔɔu , ee lɛc bii Nhialic lɛc nɔm , ago Wen e Nhialic leec ne yen .

text: Now Jesus loved Martha , and her sister , and Lazarus .
text2: Ku Yecu aa nhiaar Martha , ayi nyankene , ayi Ladharo .

text: When he had heard therefore that he was sick , he abode two days still in the same place where he was .
text2: Te ci en e guɔ piŋ nɔn tooke ye , ke jɔ reer e akool kaarou te waan nu yen thin .

text: Then after that saith he to his disciples , Let us go into Judaea again .
text2: Na wen , ke jɔ kɔckɛn e piooce yɔɔk , yan , Beku lɔ Judaya .

text: His disciples say unto him , Master , the Jews of late sought to stone thee ; and goest thou thither again ?
text2: Go yɔɔk e kɔcpiooce , yan , Rabi , Judai aake kɔɔr yin waan thiɔke , an , bik yin biɔɔk e kur ; ku bɛye lɔ etɛɛn ?

text: Jesus answered , Are there not twelve hours in the day ? If any man walk in the day , he stumbleth not , because he seeth the light of this world .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Thɛɛr akɔl ciki ye thieer ku rou ? Te ciɛthe raan akol , ka cii dueer kɔth , e luɔi tiŋ en ɣɛɛr e pinye nɔm .

text: But if a man walk in the night , he stumbleth , because there is no light in him .
text2: Ku te ciɛthe raan wakɔu , ka kɔth , e luɔi cin en ɣɛɛrepiny cath ke ye .

text: These things said he : and after that he saith unto them , Our friend Lazarus sleepeth ; but I go , that I may awake him out of sleep .
text2: E kake lueel : na wen , ke lek keek , yan , Ladharo mɛtheda e nhi ; ku yɛn lɔ , la pɔɔc .

text: Then said his disciples , Lord , if he sleep , he shall do well .
text2: Go kɔckɛn e piooce lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , na ye nhi , ka bi waar .

text: Howbeit Jesus spake of his death : but they thought that he had spoken of taking of rest in sleep .
text2: Ku Yecu aa jam e kede thonde : ku luelki keek , an , jiɛɛm ne lɔŋ de nin .

text: Then said Jesus unto them plainly , Lazarus is dead .
text2: Go Yecu lɛk keek abik piŋ egɔk , yan , Ladharo aci thou .

text: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there , to the intent ye may believe ; nevertheless let us go unto him .
text2: Ku yɛn mit piɔu ne baŋdun nɔn e liɛɛu yɛn etɛɛn , luɔi ba wek gam ; apiɛth tei , loku te nu yen .

text: Then said Thomas , which is called Didymus , unto his fellowdisciples , Let us also go , that we may die with him .
text2: Go Thoma , raan cɔl Didima , go lɛk kɔc e piooce keek etok , yan , Loku ayadaŋ , buk lɔ thou ne yen etok .

text: Then when Jesus came , he found that he had lain in the grave four days already .
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu bɛn , ke yok aci guɔ taau e raŋic ka ci nin aŋuan .

text: Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem , about fifteen furlongs off :
text2: Ku Bethani athiɔk keke Jeruthalem , cit mail kaarou ;

text: And many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary , to comfort them concerning their brother .
text2: ku Judai juec aake ci bɛn tede Martha ku Mari , bik ke bɛn luk piɔth ne kede manheden .

text: Then Martha , as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming , went and met him : but Mary sat still in the house .
text2: Na wen , aci Martha e piŋ nɔn bi Yecu , ke dap lɔ biic , le loor : ku rɛɛr Mari ɣoot .

text: Then said Martha unto Jesus , Lord , if thou hadst been here , my brother had not died .
text2: Go Martha Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Bɛnydit , tee yi nu ene , ke mɛnhkai adi ken thou .

text: But I know , that even now , whatsoever thou wilt ask of God , God will give it thee .
text2: Ku acakaa enɔɔne , aŋiɛc , yan , te de yen ke ba lip tede Nhialic , ka bii Nhialic gam yin .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Thy brother shall rise again .
text2: Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Mɛnhkni abi ro bɛ jɔt .

text: Martha saith unto him , I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day .
text2: Go Martha pɔk nɔm en , yan , Aŋiɛc nɔn bi en ro bɛ jɔt e jon jɔte kɔc rot ekool rial wadaŋ .

text: Jesus said unto her , I am the resurrection , and the life : he that believeth in me , though he were dead , yet shall he live :
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Yɛn ee jonerot , keke piir : raan gam ɛn , na ciɛk thou , ka bi piir :

text: And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die . Believest thou this ?
text2: ku raan ebɛn raan piir ku gam ɛn , ka cii bi thou athɛɛr . Ci kene gam ?

text: She saith unto him , Yea , Lord : I believe that thou art the Christ , the Son of God , which should come into the world .
text2: Go lɛk en , yan , Ɣɛɛ , Bɛnydit ; yin ca gam nɔn ee yin Kritho , Wen e Nhialic , raan e bɔ e piny nɔm .

text: And when she had so said , she went her way , and called Mary her sister secretly , saying , The Master is come , and calleth for thee .
text2: Te ci en ekake lueel , ke jɔ jal le Mari nyankene cɔɔl , ke kuc jaŋ , go yɔɔk , yan , Bɛny e weet e bɛn , ka cɔl yin .

text: As soon as she heard that , she arose quickly , and came unto him .
text2: Na wen , aci ye piŋ , ke dap ro jɔt , le te nu yen .

text: Now Jesus was not yet come into the town , but was in that place where Martha met him .
text2: ( Ku Yecu aken guɔ ɣeet bei , aŋoot te wen rɛm en keke Martha ) .

text: The Jews then which were with her in the house , and comforted her , when they saw Mary , that she rose up hastily and went out , followed her , saying , She goeth unto the grave to weep there .
text2: Go Judai wen nu ɣoot etok ne yen , kɔc wen luk en piɔu , te ci kek Mari tiŋ , nɔn ci en ro dɔɔr ku le biic , agoki biɔɔth cok , ayek lueel , yan , le e raŋ nɔm le dhiaau etɛɛn .

text: Then when Mary was come where Jesus was , and saw him , she fell down at his feet , saying unto him , Lord , if thou hadst been here , my brother had not died .
text2: Na wen , aci Mari bɛn tede Yecu , ke tuk emiɔl e yecok , lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , tee yi nu ene , ke mɛnhkai adi ken thou .

text: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping , and the Jews also weeping which came with her , he groaned in the spirit , and was troubled ,
text2: Te ci Yecu e tiŋ adhiau , ku tiŋ Judai ke ke dhiau ayadaŋ , kɔc wen bɔ ne yen , ke jɔ keŋ e yepiɔu , e piɔu jiɛth ,

text: And said , Where have ye laid him ? They said unto him , Lord , come and see .
text2: go lueel , yan , Cak tɔɔu tenou ? Goki lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , ba tiŋ .

text: Jesus wept .
text2: Go Yecu dhiau .

text: Then said the Jews , Behold how he loved him !
text2: Go Judai lueel , yan , Wɔiki , nhieer e nhiɛɛr en en .

text: And some of them said , Could not this man , which opened the eyes of the blind , have caused that even this man should not have died ?
text2: Go kɔc kɔk e keyiic lueel , yan , Naa raane , raan waan liep cɔɔr nyin , adi ken raane pɛn thuɔɔu ayadaŋ ?

text: Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave . It was a cave , and a stone lay upon it .
text2: Go Yecu bɛn e raŋ nɔm , aa be keŋ e yeyic . Raŋe ee kok , ku tɔu kuur e yenɔm .

text: Jesus said , Take ye away the stone . Martha , the sister of him that was dead , saith unto him , Lord , by this time he stinketh : for he hath been dead four days .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Nyaaiki kuur . Go Martha , nyankene e raan ci thou , go lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , e nhiany enɔɔne , nin acik aa ŋuan .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Said I not unto thee , that , if thou wouldest believe , thou shouldest see the glory of God ?
text2: Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Kɛn lɛk yin , yan , Te gɛm yin , ke yin bi dhueeŋ e Nhialic tiŋ ?

text: Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead was laid . And Jesus lifted up his eyes , and said , Father , I thank thee that thou hast heard me .
text2: Goki kuur nyaai , te wen ci raan ci thou thiɔk . Go Yecu enyin jat nhial , ku lueel , yan , Waar , thieithieei , nɔn ci yin kedi piŋ .

text: And I knew that thou hearest me always : but because of the people which stand by I said it , that they may believe that thou hast sent me .
text2: Ku aŋiɛc nɔn ee yin kedi piŋ ecaŋɣɔn : ku ne biak de kut e kɔc kaac e yalɔɔm , en aa luɛɛl ɛn en , ke ke bi gam nɔn e tooc yin ɛn .

text: And when he thus had spoken , he cried with a loud voice , Lazarus , come forth .
text2: Na wen , aci kake lueel , ke jɔ coot e rol dit , yan , Ladharo , ba bei .

text: And he that was dead came forth , bound hand and foot with graveclothes : and his face was bound about with a napkin . Jesus saith unto them , Loose him , and let him go .
text2: Go bɛn bei yen raan wen ci thou , ke duoot cin ku cok e lupɔɔ ke tɔɔu ; ku ci deer nyin e mendil . Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Dakki , ku palki e cath .

text: Then many of the Jews which came to Mary , and had seen the things which Jesus did , believed on him .
text2: Go kɔc juec ke Judai , kɔc wen bɔ ne Mari , te ci kek ke looi tiŋ , agoki gam .

text: But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees , and told them what things Jesus had done .
text2: Ku jel kɔc kɔk e keek lek te nu Parithai , lek ke lɛk ka looi Yecu .

text: Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council , and said , What do we ? for this man doeth many miracles .
text2: Go banydit ke ka ke Nhialic ku Parithai agoki yai tɔ gueer , ku luelki , yan , Eeŋo loiku ? raane ee gook juec looi .

text: If we let him thus alone , all men will believe on him : and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation .
text2: Te pel wok en aya , ke kɔc abik kede gam kedhie : ku Romai abik bɛn , bik ku nomki paanda tede wook , ku jɔtki jurda aya .

text: And one of them , named Caiaphas , being the high priest that same year , said unto them , Ye know nothing at all ,
text2: Go raan tok e keek , cɔl Kayapath , ee bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic eruune , go lek keek , yan , Acin ke ŋiɛcki week ,

text: Nor consider that it is expedient for us , that one man should die for the people , and that the whole nation perish not .
text2: ku caki thɔɔŋ e wepiɔth nɔn piɛth en tede wook , te thouwe raan tok e nyin e kɔc yiic , go jurda cuo riaak ebɛn .

text: And this spake he not of himself : but being high priest that year , he prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation ;
text2: Aacii kene luel e kede : ku luɔi ee yen bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic eruune , ke jɔ rot tɔ ye nebi , caar ne thon bi Yecu thou e nyin e jureyic ;

text: And not for that nation only , but that also he should gather together in one the children of God that were scattered abroad .
text2: ku acie nyin e jureyic etok , ee luɔi bi en mith ke Nhialic tɔ mat keyiic etok ayadaŋ , mith ci thiai .

text: Then from that day forth they took counsel together for to put him to death .
text2: Agoki loŋ cam kapac ekoole guop , an , bik nɔk .

text: Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews ; but went thence unto a country near to the wilderness , into a city called Ephraim , and there continued with his disciples .
text2: Yen aacii Yecu e bɛ cath e kɔc niim e Judai yiic , ajel en etɛɛn , le rɛɛr te lɔ jɔɔric , le panydiit cɔl Epuraim , le ku reer etɛɛn keke kɔckɛn e piooce .

text: And the Jews ' passover was nigh at hand : and many went out of the country up to Jerusalem before the passover , to purify themselves .
text2: Ku ahith e Judai cɔl Winythok aci guɔ thiɔk : go kɔc juec jal rɛɛr lek Jeruthalem , te ŋoote Winythok wei , lek kegup tɔ piɛth .

text: Then sought they for Jesus , and spake among themselves , as they stood in the temple , What think ye , that he will not come to the feast ?
text2: Goki Yecu kɔɔr , ku thiecki rot kapac , te kɛɛc kek luaŋdiit e Nhialic , yan , E wepiɔth wakdiaa ? yan , Cii bi bɛn te nu aliith ?

text: Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a commandment , that , if any man knew where he were , he should shew it , that they might take him .
text2: Ku banydit ke ka ke Nhialic ku Parithai acik lɛk kɔc , yan , Na de raan ŋic te nu yen , ke nyuth wook , buk dɔm .

text: Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany , where Lazarus was which had been dead , whom he raised from the dead .
text2: Na wen , aŋoot Winythok wei e akool kadhetem , ke jɔ Yecu bɛn Bethani , paan e nu Ladharo thin , raan waan ci thou , raan waan cii Yecu jɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic .

text: There they made him a supper ; and Martha served : but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him .
text2: Agoki luoi kecam theen etɛɛn : ku yin Martha kɔc kecam ; ku Ladharo ee raanden e kɔc rɛɛr e yen etok tede cam .

text: Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard , very costly , and anointed the feet of Jesus , and wiped his feet with her hair : and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment .
text2: Na wen , ke Mari nom rothol toŋ de miok deyic wɛɛl ci tumetum , miok tuc e ɣoocde , go Yecu tɔc cok , ku coth cok e nhim ke yenɔm ; go ɣotic a pat ebɛn ne atuom e miok .

text: Then saith one of his disciples , Judas Iscariot , Simon ' s son , which should betray him ,
text2: Go raan toŋ e kɔckɛn e piooce , cɔl Judath Yithkariɔt , wen e Thimon , raan kɔɔr luɔi bi en e nyiɛɛn , go lueel , yan ,

text: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence , and given to the poor ?
text2: Eeŋo kene mioke ɣaac e jinii kathieer , agoke gam kɔc kuany nyiin ?

text: This he said , not that he cared for the poor ; but because he was a thief , and had the bag , and bare what was put therein .
text2: Aa lueel kene , acie luɔi nhiɛɛr en kɔc kuany nyiin , ee luɔi ee yen cuɛɛr , ku ye cath ke athep de weu , ye yen ka ci taau thin ɣaac .

text: Then said Jesus , Let her alone : against the day of my burying hath she kept this .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , pal nyane : ee kede kool bi a tɔɔu , yen aa loi en en .

text: For the poor always ye have with you ; but me ye have not always .
text2: Kɔc kuany nyiin ayek cool e nu e weyiic ; ku yɛn , yɛn cie cool e nu e weyiic .

text: Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there : and they came not for Jesus ' sake only , but that they might see Lazarus also , whom he had raised from the dead .
text2: Na wen , ke kut diit e kɔc ke Judai ke jɔki ŋic nɔn nu yen etɛɛn : agoki bɛn , acie biak de Yecu etok , ee luɔi bi kek Ladharo tiŋ ayadaŋ , raan ci jɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic .

text: But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death ;
text2: Go banydit ke ka ke Nhialic loŋ cam kapac , yan , bik Ladharo nɔk ayadaŋ ;

text: Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away , and believed on Jesus .
text2: luɔi jele kɔc juec ne biak de yen , bik Yecu lɔ gam .

text: On the next day much people that were come to the feast , when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem ,
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , ke kut diit e kɔc wen ci bɛn e ahithic , te ci kek e piŋ nɔn bi Yecu Jeruthalem ,

text: Took branches of palm trees , and went forth to meet him , and cried , Hosanna : Blessed is the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: ke ke jɔ ker ke akoot noom , ku lek biic lek loor , ke ke cot , yan , Kothana ! Thieitheei raan bɔ ne rin ke Bɛnydit , yen Malik de Yithiael !

text: And Jesus , when he had found a young ass , sat thereon ; as it is written ,
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu mni koor yok , ke lɔ e yekɔu ; acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan ,

text: Fear not , daughter of Sion : behold , thy King cometh , sitting on an ass ' s colt .
text2: Du riɔc , nyan e Dhiɔn : Malikdu ka bɔye , ke cath e mɛnh e muul kɔu .

text: These things understood not his disciples at the first : but when Jesus was glorified , then remembered they that these things were written of him , and that they had done these things unto him .
text2: Kake akene kɔckɛn e piooce ke yok yiic waan tueŋ : na wen , aci Yecu dhueeŋde guɔ yok , yen aa jɔ kek keniim tak , nɔn ci kake gɔɔr ne kede , ku nɔn ci kɔc kake luoi yen .

text: The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave , and raised him from the dead , bare record .
text2: Go kut e kɔc waan nu ne yen , waan cɔɔl en Ladharo bei e raŋic , ku jɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic , goki aa caatɔɔ luelki keden .

text: For this cause the people also met him , for that they heard that he had done this miracle .
text2: Yen aa le kut e kɔc biic ayadaŋ , lek loor , luɔi ci kek e piŋ nɔn ci en goke looi .

text: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves , Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing ? behold , the world is gone after him .
text2: Go Parithai rot yɔɔk kapac , yan , Kɛnki tiŋ enɔɔne , nɔn cin en ke lɛuki ? wɔiki , piny ebɛn aci lɔ e yecok .

text: And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast :
text2: Ku nu Girikii toktook e kɔc yiic , kɔc waan lɔ lam ekool e ahith :

text: The same came therefore to Philip , which was of Bethsaida of Galilee , and desired him , saying , Sir , we would see Jesus .
text2: agoki bɛn te nu Pilip , raan e Bethaida de Galili , kek kɔcke , bik ku thiecki , yan , Bɛny , wo de piɔth luɔi bi wo Yecu tiŋ .

text: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew : and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus .
text2: Go Pilip bɛn lɛk Andereya : na wen , ke Andereya keke Pilip ke jɔki lɛk Yecu .

text: And Jesus answered them , saying , The hour is come , that the Son of man should be glorified .
text2: Go Yecu pɔk nɔm keek , yan , Thaar aci bɛn thaar bi Wen e raan dhueeŋ yok thin .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , Except a corn of wheat fall into the ground and die , it abideth alone : but if it die , it bringeth forth much fruit .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Nyin toŋ de rap te ken en loony piny , thou , ka rɛɛr etok : ku na thou , ka jɔ luɔk e mith juec .

text: He that loveth his life shall lose it ; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal .
text2: Raan nhiaar weike , abi weike mɔɔr ; ku raan man weike e pinye nɔm , abi weike muk aɣet piir athɛɛr .

text: If any man serve me , let him follow me ; and where I am , there shall also my servant be : if any man serve me , him will my Father honour .
text2: Te de yen raan e kaki looi , ne ye ya biɔɔth cok ; ago te nuo yɛn , yen abi raan e kaki looi nu thin ayadaŋ : te de yen raan e kaki looi , yen abii Waar ŋic .

text: Now is my soul troubled ; and what shall I say ? Father , save me from this hour : but for this cause came I unto this hour .
text2: Ku enɔɔne yɛn e piɔu jiɛth ; ku ba ŋo lueel ? Ba lueel , yan , Waar , kony ɛn e thaare ? Ku ne biak de ekene , en aa ba yɛn tede thaare .

text: Father , glorify thy name . Then came there a voice from heaven , saying , I have both glorified it , and will glorify it again .
text2: Waar , tɔ rinku yok dhueeŋ . Na wen , ke rol bɔ paannhial rol luel en , yan , Aca ke tɔ yok dhueeŋ , ku aba ke bɛ tɔ yok dhueeŋ ayadaŋ .

text: The people therefore , that stood by , and heard it , said that it thundered : others said , An angel spake to him .
text2: Ago kut e kɔc wen kaac etɛɛn , te ci kek rol piŋ , agoki lueel , yan , Deŋ e maar : ku lueel kɔk , yan , Ee tunynhial en aa jam keke yen .

text: Jesus answered and said , This voice came not because of me , but for your sakes .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , lueel , yan , Role aa cii bɔ e biakdi , e biakdun week , en e bi yen .

text: Now is the judgment of this world : now shall the prince of this world be cast out .
text2: Loŋ e pinye nɔm aguiir enɔɔne : bɛnydiit e pinye nɔm abi ciɛɛc biic enɔɔne .

text: And I , if I be lifted up from the earth , will draw all men unto me .
text2: Ku yɛn , te ci a jat nhial e piny nɔm , kɔc kedhie aba ke miɛɛt te nuo yɛn .

text: This he said , signifying what death he should die .
text2: Aa luel kene , nyooth en thon bi en thou , nɔn ee yen thon cit ŋo .

text: The people answered him , We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever : and how sayest thou , The Son of man must be lifted up ? who is this Son of man ?
text2: Go kut e kɔc bɛɛr , yan , Acuk piŋ e loŋic nɔn bi Kritho tɔu athɛɛr : ku eeŋo luel yin en , yan , bi Wen e raan dhil jat nhial ? Eeŋa ye Wen e raane ?

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Yet a little while is the light with you . Walk while ye have the light , lest darkness come upon you : for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth .
text2: Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , E doŋ ke ye tethiinakaŋ te nu ɣɛɛrepiny e weyiic . Cathki te ŋuɔɔt wek e we de ɣɛɛrepiny , ke we cii cuɔlepiny bi mook : raan cath e cuɔlepiny akuc te le yen thin .

text: While ye have light , believe in the light , that ye may be the children of light . These things spake Jesus , and departed , and did hide himself from them .
text2: Te ŋuɔɔt wek e we de ɣɛɛrepiny , jaki ɣɛɛrepiny gam , ke we bi aa mith ke ɣɛɛrepiny . Kake aake lueel Yecu , ku jel , go thiaan e keek .

text: But though he had done so many miracles before them , yet they believed not on him :
text2: Ku acakaa nɔn ci en gook juec looi e keniim , goki ŋoot e ke cii gam :

text: That the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled , which he spake , Lord , who hath believed our report ? and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed ?
text2: luɔi bi jam e nebi Yithaya aa yic , jam ɣɔn lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , eeŋa e jamda gam ? Ku eeŋa ci nyuoth koŋ de Bɛnydit ?

text: Therefore they could not believe , because that Esaias said again ,
text2: Ku yen aacii kek gam leu , ne luɛl ci Yithaya ye bɛ lueel , yan ,

text: He hath blinded their eyes , and hardened their heart ; that they should not see with their eyes , nor understand with their heart , and be converted , and I should heal them .
text2: Aci keek tɔ cɔɔr nyiin , ku tɔ ke ril piɔth ; Ke ke cii bi daai e kenyiin , ku ciki kaŋ bi yok e kepiɔth , Agoki kepiɔth puk , Aguɔ ke tɔ dem .

text: These things said Esaias , when he saw his glory , and spake of him .
text2: Kake aake lueel Yithaya , te ɣɔn tiŋ en dhueeŋde ; ago jam ne kede .

text: Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him ; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him , lest they should be put out of the synagogue :
text2: Ku aa de kɔc juec e bany yiic tei , bany ceŋ piny , kɔc ci kede gam ; ku ne biak de Parithai aake ken gam e kethook , ke ke cii bi cieec luaŋ e Nhialic :

text: For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God .
text2: aake nhiaar lɛc de kɔc awar lɛc de Nhialic .

text: Jesus cried and said , He that believeth on me , believeth not on me , but on him that sent me .
text2: Go Yecu coot , lueel , yan , Raan gam ɛn , acie yɛn e gɛm , ee raan e toc ɛn en a gɛm .

text: And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me .
text2: Ku raan tiŋ ɛn , ka tiŋ raan e toc ɛn .

text: I am come a light into the world , that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness .
text2: Yɛn aa bɔ e piny nɔm , ke ya ye ɣɛɛrepiny , ke raan gam ɛn , ke cii bi reer tecol .

text: And if any man hear my words , and believe not , I judge him not : for I came not to judge the world , but to save the world .
text2: Te de yen raan piŋ welki , ku reec gam , ka yɛn cii loŋde guiir : yɛn aacii bɔ ba loŋ de piny nɔm bɛn guiir , ee luɔi kuɔny ɛn piny nɔm , en aa ba yen .

text: He that rejecteth me , and receiveth not my words , hath one that judgeth him : the word that I have spoken , the same shall judge him in the last day .
text2: Raan reec ɛn , ku cii welki gam , acath ke ke guiir loŋde : jam ca lueel , yen abi loŋde guiir ekool rial wadaŋ .

text: For I have not spoken of myself ; but the Father which sent me , he gave me a commandment , what I should say , and what I should speak .
text2: Yɛn ecii jam ne kede yenhdi ; ku Waar raan e toc ɛn , yen aa lek ɛn ke ba lueel , ku jam ban jam .

text: And I know that his commandment is life everlasting : whatsoever I speak therefore , even as the Father said unto me , so I speak .
text2: Ku loŋde aŋiɛc nɔn ee yen piir athɛɛr : ago ka luɛɛl enɔɔne , acit man ci Waar e lɛk ɛn , yen aa luɛɛl ɛn keek .

text: Now before the feast of the passover , when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father , having loved his own which were in the world , he loved them unto the end .
text2: Na wen , aŋoot aliith e Winythok wei , ke ŋic Yecu nɔn ci thaarde bɛn , thaar bi en jal e piny nɔm le tede Wun , ku nhieer nhiɛɛr en kɔckɛn nu e piny nɔm , yen aa nhiɛɛr en keek a thooke kaŋ .

text: And supper being ended , the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot , Simon ' s son , to betray him ;
text2: Na wen , a cam kɔc theen , ku ci jɔŋdiit rac jam guɔ taau e Judath piɔu , Judath Yithkariɔt wen e Thimon , yan , bi e nyicɛn ;

text: Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands , and that he was come from God , and went to God ;
text2: ku ŋic Yecu nɔn ci Wun kaŋ taau e yecin kedhie , ku ŋic nɔn e bi yen tede Nhialic , ku nɔn le yen tede Nhialic ;

text: He riseth from supper , and laid aside his garments ; and took a towel , and girded himself .
text2: go ro jɔt te e ciem en , ku bii alulutde bei ; go lupɔ ee coth muk , duut e yeyic .

text: After that he poureth water into a bason , and began to wash the disciples ' feet , and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded .
text2: Na wen , ke luuŋ piu e athaanic , ku jɔ kɔcpiooce waak cok , ago ke coth cok ne lupɔ wen ci duoot e yeyic .

text: Then cometh he to Simon Peter : and Peter saith unto him , Lord , dost thou wash my feet ?
text2: Go bɛn tede Thimon Petero , go Petero thieec , yan , Bɛnydit , wak acok ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , What I do thou knowest not now ; but thou shalt know hereafter .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Ke luɔɔi akuc enɔɔne ; aba ŋic tei wadaŋ .

text: Peter saith unto him , Thou shalt never wash my feet . Jesus answered him , If I wash thee not , thou hast no part with me .
text2: Go Petero lueel , yan , Yin cii a bi waak cok anandu . Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Te can yin wak , ka cin keduon nu e kediyic .

text: Simon Peter saith unto him , Lord , not my feet only , but also my hands and my head .
text2: Go Thimon Petero lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , acii acok kapac ke wak , wak acin ayadaŋ ayik anɔm .

text: Jesus saith to him , He that is washed needeth not save to wash his feet , but is clean every whit : and ye are clean , but not all .
text2: Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Raan ci waak , acin te dak e ye , ee wɛk bi e waak cok etok , ku ci guop ɣɛɛr ebɛn : ku week , wek ɣer , ku acie week wedhie .

text: For he knew who should betray him ; therefore said he , Ye are not all clean .
text2: Aa ŋic raan bi e nyiɛɛn ; en aa lueel en en , yan , We cii ɣer wedhie .

text: So after he had washed their feet , and had taken his garments , and was set down again , he said unto them , Know ye what I have done to you ?
text2: Na wen , aci ke waak cok , ke be alulutde noom , ku nyuuc , go ke thieec , yan , Ŋiɛcki ke ca luoi week ?

text: Ye call me Master and Lord : and ye say well ; for so I am .
text2: Wek ee ya tɔ ye Bɛny e weet , ku Bɛnydit : ee yic en luɛlki : ee kaki .

text: If I then , your Lord and Master , have washed your feet ; ye also ought to wash one another ' s feet .
text2: Ku enɔn can week waak cok , ku ya Bɛnydit ku Bɛny e weet , ku enɔɔne , week ayadaŋ we dueer wecok dhil aa waak wapac , ye ŋɛk ŋɛk waak cok .

text: For I have given you an example , that ye should do as I have done to you .
text2: We ca nyuoth luɔi bak dɔmic , luɔi bak aa looi , cit man can e luoi week .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , The servant is not greater than his lord ; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Lim acii bɛnyde e woor e dit ; ayi raan ci tooc , acii raan e toc en war .

text: If ye know these things , happy are ye if ye do them .
text2: Te ŋiɛc wek kake , thieithieei week te ya wek keek looi .

text: I speak not of you all : I know whom I have chosen : but that the scripture may be fulfilled , He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me .
text2: Yɛn cii jam e kedun wedhie : yɛn ŋic kɔc ca lɔc : ku kecigɔɔr abi dhil aa yic , yan , Raan cam knin ke yɛn etok yen aa luui yɛn ater .

text: Now I tell you before it come , that , when it is come to pass , ye may believe that I am he .
text2: Ku enɔɔne wek lɛk kaŋ te ŋoot kek ke ke ken tic ; na miak , te ci kek guɔ tic , ke we bi gam nɔn ee yɛn en .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me ; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Raan gam raan ba tooc , ka gam ɛn ; ku raan gam ɛn , ka gam raan e toc ɛn .

text: When Jesus had thus said , he was troubled in spirit , and testified , and said , Verily , verily , I say unto you , that one of you shall betray me .
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu kake lueel , ke jɔ piɔu jiɛth , ku lek keek , yan , Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Raan tok e week abi a nyiɛɛn .

text: Then the disciples looked one on another , doubting of whom he spake .
text2: Go kɔcpiooce rot woi , akucki raan lueel .

text: Now there was leaning on Jesus ' bosom one of his disciples , whom Jesus loved .
text2: Ku ade raan rɛɛr tede cam ke kɛn rot e Yecu yɔu , ee raan toŋ e kɔckɛn e piooce yiic , raan nhiɛɛr Yecu .

text: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him , that he should ask who it should be of whom he spake .
text2: Ago Thimon Petero raane nieu , yan , bi raan lueel luɔp , nɔn ee yen ŋa .

text: He then lying on Jesus ' breast saith unto him , Lord , who is it ?
text2: Go raan wen kɛn rot e Yecu yɔu go thieec , yan , Bɛnydit , ee ŋa ?

text: Jesus answered , He it is , to whom I shall give a sop , when I have dipped it . And when he had dipped the sop , he gave it to Judas Iscariot , the son of Simon .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Ye ki , raan ban kuin juɔɔl , ku gam en . Na wen , aci knin juɔɔl , ke gɛm Judath Yithkariɔt , wen e Tliimon .

text: And after the sop Satan entered into him . Then said Jesus unto him , That thou doest , do quickly .
text2: Ku te ci en kuin noom , ke Catan lɔ e yepiɔu . Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Na de ke ba looi , ke dap looi .

text: Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him .
text2: Ku acin raan ne kɔc rɛɛr tede cam raan ŋic ke lueel en ekene .

text: For some of them thought , because Judas had the bag , that Jesus had said unto him , Buy those things that we have need of against the feast ; or , that he should give something to the poor .
text2: Ku nɔn ciɛthe Judath ke athep e weu , aye kɔc kɔk lueel , yan , ci Yecu yien lɛk en , an , Ɣɔc ka kɔɔrku tede aliith ; ku , nɔn bi en kɔc kuany nyiin yicn miɔɔc e kaŋ .

text: He then having received the sop went immediately out : and it was night .
text2: Na wen , aci kuin noom , ke lɔ biic enɔnthiine : ku piny ee wakɔu .

text: Therefore , when he was gone out , Jesus said , Now is the Son of man glorified , and God is glorified in him .
text2: Te ci en guɔ jal , ke lueel Yecu , yan , Wen e raan aci gam dhueeŋ enɔɔne , ku gɛme Nhialic dhueeŋ ne yen ;

text: If God be glorified in him , God shall also glorify him in himself , and shall straightway glorify him .
text2: ku te ci Nhialic gam dhueeŋ ne yen , ke Nhialic abi e gam dhueeŋ e yenguop aya , ku abi dap gam dhueeŋ enɔnthiine .

text: Little children , yet a little while I am with you . Ye shall seek me : and as I said unto the Jews , Whither I go , ye cannot come ; so now I say to you .
text2: Week miththiike , e doŋ ke ye tethiinakaŋ te rɛɛr ɛn wo week . We bi a kɔɔr : ku acit man can e lɛk Judai , yan , Te la yɛn thin , ke we cii dueer bɛn , yen a lɛk week enɔɔne .

text: A new commandment I give unto you , That ye love one another ; as I have loved you , that ye also love one another .
text2: Wek thɔn cook ci piac lueel , yan , Nhiaarki rot ; acit man can week nhiaar , ke we bi rot nhiaar wapac ayadaŋ .

text: By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples , if ye have love one to another .
text2: Yen abi kɔc e ŋic kedhie nɔn aa wek kɔckien e piooce , te nhiaar wek rot wapac .

text: Simon Peter said unto him , Lord , whither goest thou ? Jesus answered him , Whither I go , thou canst not follow me now ; but thou shalt follow me afterwards .
text2: Go Thimon Petero thieec , yan , Bɛnydit , e tenou bi yin lɔ ? Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Te la yɛn thin , yin cii a dueer kuany cok enɔɔne ; yin bi a kuany cok wadaŋ .

text: Peter said unto him , Lord , why cannot I follow thee now ? I will lay down my life for thy sake .
text2: Go Petero lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , eeŋo can yi dueer kuany cok enɔɔne ? Yɛn bi weiki gaam e biakdu .

text: Jesus answered him , Wilt thou lay down thy life for my sake ? Verily , verily , I say unto thee , The cock shall not crow , till thou hast denied me thrice .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Ba weiku gaam e biakdi ? Yin yɔɔk eyic , yan , Thɔn ajith acii bi kɔn kiu , te ŋoot yin ke yi ken a jai raandiak .

text: Let not your heart be troubled : ye believe in God , believe also in me .
text2: Duoki wepiɔth tɔ jieth , we ye Nhialic gam , gamki yɛn ayadaŋ .

text: In my Father ' s house are many mansions : if it were not so , I would have told you . I go to prepare a place for you .
text2: Paan e Waar adeyic ɣoot juec : tee ke liu , adi ca lɛk week . Yɛn lɔ la tedun guik .

text: And if I go and prepare a place for you , I will come again , and receive you unto myself ; that where I am , there ye may be also .
text2: Ku te la yɛn , la tedun guik , ke yɛn bi anɔm bɛ lɔ puk , ba we bɛn loor ; ago te nuo yɛn , ke we bi nu etɛɛn aya .

text: And whither I go ye know , and the way ye know .
text2: Ku te la yɛn thin aŋiɛcki , ayi kueer aŋiɛcki .

text: Thomas saith unto him , Lord , we know not whither thou goest ; and how can we know the way ?
text2: Go Thoma lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , wo kuc te le yin thin ; ku dueerku kueer ŋic adi ?

text: Jesus saith unto him , I am the way , the truth , and the life : no man cometh unto the Father , but by me .
text2: Go Yecu lueel , yan , Yɛn aye kueer , ku yɛn aye yic , ku yɛn aye piir : acin raan bɔ tede Waada , te ken en teek tede yɛn .

text: If ye had known me , ye should have known my Father also : and from henceforth ye know him , and have seen him .
text2: Tee we e ya ŋic , adi cak Waada ŋic aya : ku enɔɔne aŋiɛcki , ku acak tiŋ .

text: Philip saith unto him , Lord , shew us the Father , and it sufficeth us .
text2: Go Pilip lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , nyuothe wook Waada , ku acin daŋ buk bɛ kɔɔr .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Have I been so long time with you , and yet hast thou not known me , Philip ? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father ; and how sayest thou then , Shew us the Father ?
text2: Go Yecu yɔɔk , yan , Ca reer wo week ecaŋɣɔn , ku ŋoot e yi kuc ɛn , Pilip ? Raan ci a tiŋ , ka ci Waada tiŋ aya ; ku eeŋo lueel yin en , yan , Nyuothe wook Waada ?

text: Believest thou not that I am in the Father , and the Father in me ? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself : but the Father that dwelleth in me , he doeth the works .
text2: Kɛne ya gam nɔn nuo yɛn e Waadayic , ku nɔn nu Waada e yayic ? Wel lɛk week , aca ke ye lueel e kede yenhdi ; ee Waada raan rɛɛr e yayic yen aye luɔi looi .

text: Believe me that I am in the Father , and the Father in me : or else believe me for the very works ' sake .
text2: Gamki yɛn nɔn nuo yɛn e Waadayic , ku nɔn nu Waada e yayic : na dhɛl week , ke we gam ɛn ne biak de luɔiye guop .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that believeth on me , the works that I do shall he do also ; and greater works than these shall he do ; because I go unto my Father .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Raan gam ɛn , ke ka luɔɔi kek abi en aa looi ayadaŋ ; acakaa luɔi war ekake abi keek aa looi ; luɔi la yɛn tede Waada .

text: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name , that will I do , that the Father may be glorified in the Son .
text2: Ku te de yen ke bak lip ne riniti , ka ba looi , ke Waada bi dhueeŋ yok ne Wende .

text: If ye shall ask any thing in my name , I will do it .
text2: Na de ke liɛpki ne rinki , ka ba looi .

text: If ye love me , keep my commandments .
text2: Te nhiaar wek ɛn , ke we dot loŋ thɔn week .

text: And I will pray the Father , and he shall give you another Comforter , that he may abide with you for ever ;
text2: Ku yɛn bi Waada lip , ka bi we gam Raan daŋ Raan e kɔc riit piɔth , bi aa reer ke week athɛɛr ;

text: Even the Spirit of truth ; whom the world cannot receive , because it seeth him not , neither knoweth him : but ye know him ; for he dwelleth with you , and shall be in you .
text2: yen aye Wei yic : Raan cii dueere dɔm e kɔc ke piny nɔm , luɔi ken kek e tiŋ , ku ciki ŋic aya : ku ŋiɛcki week ; ee reer ke week , ku abi nu e weyiic .

text: I will not leave you comfortless : I will come to you .
text2: We ca bi nyaaŋ piny ke we ye abɛɛr : yɛn bi lɔ bɛn tede week .

text: Yet a little while , and the world seeth me no more ; but ye see me : because I live , ye shall live also .
text2: E doŋ ke ye tethiinakaŋ , ke kɔc ke piny nɔm ke ke cii a bi bɛ tiŋ : ku wek ee ya tiŋ : piir pieer ɛn , yen aba wek piir aya .

text: At that day ye shall know that I am in my Father , and ye in me , and I in you .
text2: Ekoole abak ŋic nɔn nuo yɛn e Waaric , ku nɔn nuo wek e yayic , ku nuo e weyiic .

text: He that hath my commandments , and keepeth them , he it is that loveth me : and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father , and I will love him , and will manifest myself to him .
text2: Raan cath ke ka ca thɔn en , ku muk keek , yen aye raan nhiaar ɛn : ku raan nhiaar ɛn abii Waar nhiaar , ku aba nhiaar aya , aguɔ ro nyuoth en .

text: Judas saith unto him , not Iscariot , Lord , how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us , and not unto the world ?
text2: Go thieec e Judath ( acie Yithkariɔt ) , yan , Bɛnydit , ee kaŋo ke bi yin ro nyuoth wook , ku cii ro bi nyuoth kɔc ke piny nɔm ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , If a man love me , he will keep my words : and my Father will love him , and we will come unto him , and make our abode with him .
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yook , yan , Te nhiɛɛre raan ɛn , ka bi welki muk : go Waar nhiaar , agoku bɛn te nu yen , reerku ne yen etok .

text: He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings : and the word which ye hear is not mine , but the Father ' s which sent me .
text2: Raan cii a nhiaar , ka cii welki e dot : ku jam piɛŋki acie kedi , ee jam e Waar raan e toc ɛn .

text: These things have I spoken unto you , being yet present with you .
text2: Kake aca ke lɛk week , te ŋuɔɔt ɛn ke ya rɛɛr wo week .

text: But the Comforter , which is the Holy Ghost , whom the Father will send in my name , he shall teach you all things , and bring all things to your remembrance , whatsoever I have said unto you .
text2: Ku Raan e kɔc muk piɔth , yen aye Weidit Ɣer , Wei bii Waar tooc ne rinki , yen abi we wɛɛt e kerieec ebɛn , ago we tɔ tak weniim e ka ca lɛk week kedhie .

text: Peace I leave with you , my peace I give unto you : not as the world giveth , give I unto you . Let not your heart be troubled , neither let it be afraid .
text2: Mat en a nyaŋ week ; mandi en a gam week : niiɔc miaac ɛn week , acii cit man e miɔc ee kɔc ke piny nɔm we miɔɔc . Duoki wepiɔth tɔ jieth , ku duoki wepiɔth tɔ riɔc .

text: Ye have heard how I said unto you , I go away , and come again unto you . If ye loved me , ye would rejoice , because I said , I go unto the Father : for my Father is greater than I .
text2: Acak piŋ nɔn can e lɛk week , yan , Yɛn jel , ku yɛn bi lɔ bɛn tede week . Tee we nhiaar ɛn , adi cak piɔth miɛt , nɔn can e lueel , yan , Yɛn lɔ tede Waar : Waar awar ɛn e dit .

text: And now I have told you before it come to pass , that , when it is come to pass , ye might believe .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , aca kɔn lɛk week te ŋoot en ke ken guɔ tic ; na miak , te tic en , ke we bi gam .

text: Hereafter I will not talk much with you : for the prince of this world cometh , and hath nothing in me .
text2: Ele , yɛn cii bi bɛ jam wo week aret : bɛny ceŋ pinye nɔm abɔ , ku acin kedɛn nu tede yɛn ;

text: But that the world may know that I love the Father ; and as the Father gave me commandment , even so I do . Arise , let us go hence .
text2: ku luɔi bi kɔc ke piny nɔm e ŋic nɔn nhiaar ɛn Waar , ku acit man ci Waar a thɔn , en a luɔɔi . Jatki rot , jelku .

text: I am the true vine , and my Father is the husbandman .
text2: Yɛn aye tim yic tim de enap , ku Waar yen aye raan tit jeneen .

text: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away : and every branch that beareth fruit , he purgeth it , that it may bring forth more fruit .
text2: Keer nu e yayic ebɛn keer reec luɔk , ka bii bei : ku keer ebɛn keer e luɔk , ka looi abi kɔu piath , ke bi luɔk alal .

text: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you .
text2: Ku week we e guɔ piath ne jam ca lɛk week .

text: Abide in me , and I in you . As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself , except it abide in the vine ; no more can ye , except ye abide in me .
text2: Rɛɛrki e yayic , ku yɛn e weyiic . Acit man cii keer dueer luɔk etok , te cii en rɛɛr e timic ; yen acit week aya , we cii dueer luɔk , te kɛn wek reer e yayic .

text: I am the vine , ye are the branches : He that abideth in me , and I in him , the same bringeth forth much fruit : for without me ye can do nothing .
text2: Yɛn ee tim de enap , wek ee ker : raan rɛɛr e yayic , ku rɛɛr e yeyic , yen aye raan e luɔk aret : ku te cin en ɛn , ka cin ke duɛɛrki looi .

text: If a man abide not in me , he is cast forth as a branch , and is withered ; and men gather them , and cast them into the fire , and they are burned .
text2: Raan cie reer e yayic , ka cuɛte wei cit man e keer , ago riɔu ; agoke kut niim , ku cuɛteke mɛɛc , agoki nyop .

text: If ye abide in me , and my words abide in you , ye shall ask what ye will , and it shall be done unto you .
text2: Te rɛɛr wek e yayic , ku rɛɛr welki e weyiic , ke ka nu e wepiɔth ebɛn aduɛɛrki ke lip , ku abike luoi week .

text: Herein is my Father glorified , that ye bear much fruit ; so shall ye be my disciples .
text2: Luɔk luɔk wek alal , yen aye Waar tɔ yok dhueeŋ ; yen aba wek aa kɔckien e piooce .

text: As the Father hath loved me , so have I loved you : continue ye in my love .
text2: Acit man ci Waar a nhiaar , en acan we nhiaar aya : rɛɛrki e nhieerdiyic .

text: If ye keep my commandments , ye shall abide in my love ; even as I have kept my Father ' s commandments , and abide in his love .
text2: Te dɔt wek ka ca thɔn week , ke we bi reer e nhieerdiyic ; cit man can ka ci Waar a thɔn dot , aguɔ reer e nhieerdeyic .

text: These things have I spoken unto you , that my joy might remain in you , and that your joy might be full .
text2: Kake aca ke lɛk week , ke miɛt e yɛnpiɔu bi reer e weyiic , aguɔki piɔth miɛt abak piɔth a yum .

text: This is my commandment , That ye love one another , as I have loved you .
text2: Kene ee ke thɔn week , yan , Nhiaarki rot , cit man can week nhiaar .

text: Greater love hath no man than this , that a man lay down his life for his friends .
text2: Acin raan cath ke nhieer diit war ekene , yan , bi raan weike gaam ne biak de mathke .

text: Ye are my friends , if ye do whatsoever I command you .
text2: Wek ee mathki , te ya wek ka ca thɔn week looi .

text: Henceforth I call you not servants ; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth : but I have called you friends ; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you .
text2: We ca bi bɛ tɔ ye liim ; lim akuc ke looi bɛnyde : ku we ca tɔ ye mathki ; luɔi can we tɔ ŋic kerieec ebɛn ke ca piŋ tede Waar .

text: Ye have not chosen me , but I have chosen you , and ordained you , that ye should go and bring forth fruit , and that your fruit should remain : that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name , he may give it you .
text2: Acie week e lɔc ɛn , ee yɛn e lɔc week , ku taau week tedun , yan , bak lɔ luɔk , ago mithkun tɔu : ago na de ke bak lip tede Waar ne rinki , ka bi gam week .

text: These things I command you , that ye love one another .
text2: Loŋ thɔn week ki , yan , Nhiaarki rot wapac .

text: If the world hate you , ye know that it hated me before it hated you .
text2: Te mɛɛne kɔc ke piny nɔm week , ka ŋiɛcki nɔn ci kek a kɔn maan , ke we ŋoot ke we kene maan .

text: If ye were of the world , the world would love his own : but because ye are not of the world , but I have chosen you out of the world , therefore the world hateth you .
text2: Tee we ye kɔckɛn e kɔc ke piny nɔm , ke kɔc ke piny nɔm adi nhiaarki kɔcken : ku enɔɔne , e luɔi ca wek e kɔckɛn e kɔc ke piny nɔm , ku we ca lɔc bei e piny nɔm , yen a mɛɛne kɔc ke piny nɔm week .

text: Remember the word that I said unto you , The servant is not greater than his lord . If they have persecuted me , they will also persecute you ; if they have kept my saying , they will keep yours also .
text2: Takki weniim ne jam ca lɛk week , yan , Lim aci bɛnyde war e dit . Te ci kek a yɔŋ , ka bik we yɔŋ ayadaŋ ; ku te ci kek jamdi dot , ka bik jamdun dot ayadaŋ .

text: But all these things will they do unto you for my name ' s sake , because they know not him that sent me .
text2: Ku abik kake kedhie luoi week ne biak de rinki , ne kuny kuc kek raan e toc ɛn .

text: If I had not come and spoken unto them , they had not had sin : but now they have no cloke for their sin .
text2: Tee ya ken bɛn ba bɛn jam wo keek , adi cin kerɛɛc nu e keyicth : ku enɔɔne , acin te bi kek rot kɔc e kerɛɛcden .

text: He that hateth me hateth my Father also .
text2: Raan man ɛn ka man Waar aya .

text: If I had not done among them the works which none other man did , they had not had sin : but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father .
text2: Tee ya ken kaŋ looi e keyiic , ka kene raan daŋ looi , adi cin kerac e keyieth : ku enɔɔne acik wo tiŋ ku manki wogup wo woke Waar waarou .

text: But this cometh to pass , that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law , They hated me without a cause .
text2: Ku kene e tic , luɔi bi jam aa yic jam ci gɔɔr e loŋdenic , yan , Acik a maan guop youyou .

text: But when the Comforter is come , whom I will send unto you from the Father , even the Spirit of truth , which proceedeth from the Father , he shall testify of me :
text2: Ku Raan e kɔc riit piɔth , Raan ba tuoc week ne Waar lɔɔm , yen aye Wei yic , Wei e bɔ bei e Waar lɔɔm , te ci en bɛn , ka bi aa caatɔdi .

text: And ye also shall bear witness , because ye have been with me from the beginning .
text2: Ku wek ee caatɔɔ ayadaŋ , luɔi nuo wek ne yɛn etok ne gol e gɔle kaŋ .

text: These things have I spoken unto you , that ye should not be offended .
text2: Kake aca ke lɛk week , ke we cii ro bi dak cieen .

text: They shall put you out of the synagogues : yea , the time cometh , that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service .
text2: We bii kɔc cieec e luek ke Nhialic yiic : yeka , ke thaar abɔ , thaar bi raan nak week e lueel e yepiɔu , yan , looi ka ke Nhialic .

text: And these things will they do unto you , because they have not known the Father , nor me .
text2: Ku kake abik ke luoi week , ne kuny kuc kek Waar , ayik ɛn .

text: But these things have I told you , that when the time shall come , ye may remember that I told you of them . And these things I said not unto you at the beginning , because I was with you .
text2: Ku kake aca ke lɛk week : na miak , aci thaarden ɣeet , ke we bi weniim tak nɔn can ke lɛk week . Ku kake akɛn ke lɛk week waan tueŋ , luɔi nuo yɛn woke week .

text: But now I go my way to him that sent me ; and none of you asketh me , Whither goest thou ?
text2: Ku enɔɔne , yɛn jel la te nu raan e toc ɛn ; ku acin raan tok e weyiic raan thiec ɛn , yan , Ee tenou le yin thin ?

text: But because I have said these things unto you , sorrow hath filled your heart .
text2: Ku nɔn can ekake lɛk week , ke we ye piɔth dhiau alal .

text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth ; It is expedient for you that I go away : for if I go not away , the Comforter will not come unto you ; but if I depart , I will send him unto you .
text2: Ku ee yic en lɛk week ayadaŋ ; yan , Jal jal ɛn ade naamde tede week : na ca jel , ke Raan e kɔc riit piɔth acii bi bɛn tede week ; ku te jal ɛn , aba tuoc week .

text: And when he is come , he will reprove the world of sin , and of righteousness , and of judgment :
text2: Ku yen , te ci en bɛn , abi kɔc ke piny nɔm jɔɔny ne kede kerac , ku ne kede piathepiɔu , ku ne kede guiireloŋ :

text: Of sin , because they believe not on me ;
text2: ne kede kerac , luɔi reec kek a gam ;

text: Of righteousness , because I go to my Father , and ye see me no more ;
text2: ne kede piathepiɔu , luɔi jal ɛn la tede Waar , ke we cii a bi bɛ tiŋ ;

text: Of judgment , because the prince of this world is judged .
text2: ne kede guieereloŋ , luɔi ci loŋ de bɛny ceŋ pinye nɔm thok e guieer .

text: I have yet many things to say unto you , but ye cannot bear them now .
text2: Yɛn de kajuec ŋoot e ka ba lɛk week , ku acak ke dueer leu e muk enɔɔne .

text: Howbeit when he , the Spirit of truth , is come , he will guide you into all truth : for he shall not speak of himself ; but whatsoever he shall hear , that shall he speak : and he will shew you things to come .
text2: Ku te ci Raane bɛn , yen aye Wei yic , yen abi we wat te nu yic ebɛn : ku acii bi jam ne kede yenhde ; na de ke ye piŋ , yen abi aa lueel : ku abi we nyuoth kaŋ , ka bi tic wadaŋ .

text: He shall glorify me : for he shall receive of mine , and shall shew it unto you .
text2: Abi ya tɔ yok dhueeŋ : abi kedi noom , ku jɔ nyuoth week .

text: All things that the Father hath are mine : therefore said I , that he shall take of mine , and shall shew it unto you .
text2: Ka nu e Waar cin ayek kaki kedhie : yen aa luɛɛl ɛn en , yan , Abi kedi noom , ku jɔ nyuoth week .

text: A little while , and ye shall not see me : and again , a little while , and ye shall see me , because I go to the Father .
text2: Tethiinakaŋ , ke we cii ya bi tiŋ ; ku na ele tethiinakaŋ , ke we bi ya tiŋ , luɔi jal ɛn la tede Waar .

text: Then said some of his disciples among themselves , What is this that he saith unto us , A little while , and ye shall not see me : and again , a little while , and ye shall see me : and , Because I go to the Father ?
text2: Ago kɔc kɔk e kɔckɛn e piooce goki rot thieec kapac , yan , Ee kaŋo ke lek wook , yan , Tethiinakaŋ , ke we cii ya bi tiŋ ; ku yan , Na ele tethiinakaŋ , ke we bi ya tiŋ ; ku , yan , Luɔi jal ɛn la tede Waar ?

text: They said therefore , What is this that he saith , A little while ? we cannot tell what he saith .
text2: Agoki lueel , yan , Ee kaŋo ke lueel , yan , Tethiinakaŋ ? Akucku yen ke lueel .

text: Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him , and said unto them , Do ye inquire among yourselves of that I said , A little while , and ye shall not see me : and again , a little while , and ye shall see me ?
text2: Aŋic Yecu nɔn kɔɔr kek luɔi thieec kek en , go ke yɔɔk , yan , Week , luɔpki rot wapac ne ke ca lueel , yan , Tethiinakaŋ , ke we cii ya bi tiŋ ; ku , na ele tethiinakaŋ , ke we bi ya tiŋ ?

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , That ye shall weep and lament , but the world shall rejoice : and ye shall be sorrowful , but your sorrow shall be turned into joy .
text2: Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , We bi dhiau abak dhuoor , ku kɔc ke piny nɔm abik piɔth miɛt : ku we bi piɔth rac , ku rac de wepiɔth abi ro puk abi aa miɛtepiɔu .

text: A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow , because her hour is come : but as soon as she is delivered of the child , she remembereth no more the anguish , for joy that a man is born into the world .
text2: Tik , te kɔɔr en dhieth , ee piɔu dhiau nɔn ci thaarde bɛn : ku te ci en pal , ka cii tuocdepiɔu wen be tak , ne biak de miɛt ci en piɔu miɛt luɔi ci raan dhieeth e piny nɔm .

text: And ye now therefore have sorrow : but I will see you again , and your heart shall rejoice , and your joy no man taketh from you .
text2: Ku week aya , we de dhien e wepiɔth enɔɔne : ku we ba bɛ tiŋ , aguɔki piɔth miɛt , ku miɛt e wepiɔth acin raan bi e nyaai tede week .

text: And in that day ye shall ask me nothing . Verily , verily , I say unto you , Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name , he will give it you .
text2: Ku ekoole acin ke bak a luɔp . Wek yɔɔk eyic , yan , Te de yen ke bak iip tede Waar ne rinki , ka bi gam week .

text: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name : ask , and ye shall receive , that your joy may be full .
text2: Aɣet ci enɔɔne acin ke cak lip ne rinki : yak lip , ke we bi aa miɔɔc , aguɔki piɔth miɛt abak piɔth a yum .

text: These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs : but the time cometh , when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs , but I shall shew you plainly of the Father .
text2: Kake aca ke lɛk week e kɛŋ yiic : ku thaar abɔ , thaar can bi bɛ jam woke week e kɛŋ , we ba guieer ka ke Waar egɔk .

text: At that day ye shall ask in my name : and I say not unto you , that I will pray the Father for you :
text2: Ekoole , ke we bi lip e rinki : ku aca lek week nɔn ban Waar lɔŋ e biakdun ;

text: For the Father himself loveth you , because ye have loved me , and have believed that I came out from God .
text2: Waar guop anhiaar week , luɔi nhiaar wek ɛn , ku luɔi ca wek a gam nɔn e ba yɛn tede Nhialic .

text: I came forth from the Father , and am come into the world : again , I leave the world , and go to the Father .
text2: Yɛn e bɔ tede Waar , ba e piny nɔm : ku enɔɔne , yɛn be piny nɔm nyaaŋ piny , la tede Waar .

text: His disciples said unto him , Lo , now speakest thou plainly , and speakest no proverb .
text2: Ago kɔckɛn e piooce lueel , yan , Andi , yin luel jam agɔk enɔɔne , acie kaaŋ yen luel .

text: Now are we sure that thou knowest all things , and needest not that any man should ask thee : by this we believe that thou camest forth from God .
text2: Enɔɔne aŋicku egɔk nɔn ŋic yin kaŋ kedhie , ku acin ke bi raan bɛ thiec yin : kene yen a gɛm wok yin nɔn e bi yin tede Nhialic .

text: Jesus answered them , Do ye now believe ?
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Cak gam enɔɔne ?

text: Behold , the hour cometh , yea , is now come , that ye shall be scattered , every man to his own , and shall leave me alone : and yet I am not alone , because the Father is with me .
text2: Wɔiki , thaar abɔ , yeka bɔye enɔɔne , thaar bi we thiai wei , lɔ ŋɛk tede ku lɔ ŋek tede , ku nyaaŋki ya piny yatok : ku yɛn cii tɔu atok , luɔi nu Waar keke yɛn .

text: These things I have spoken unto you , that in me ye might have peace . In the world ye shall have tribulation : but be of good cheer ; I have overcome the world .
text2: Kake aca ke lɛk week , ke we bi dɛ mat e yayic . Ne piny nɔm ke we bi dɛ ketuny e we dhal : riɛtki wepiɔth tei ; yɛn e piny nɔm tiaam .

text: These words spake Jesus , and lifted up his eyes to heaven , and said , Father , the hour is come ; glorify thy Son , that thy Son also may glorify thee :
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu kake lueel , ke jɔ enyin jat nhial , ku lueel , yan , Waar , thaar e bɛn ; game Wendu dhueeŋ , ke Wendu bi yi tɔ yok dhueeŋ aya :

text: As thou hast given him power over all flesh , that he should give eternal life to as many as thou hast given him .
text2: acit man ci yin e gam riɛl e tiɔp nɔm ebɛn , ke bi kɔc gam piir athɛɛr , kɔc ci gam en kedhie .

text: And this is life eternal , that they might know thee the only true God , and Jesus Christ , whom thou hast sent .
text2: Ku kene yen aye piir athɛɛr , yan , Ŋiny bi kek yin ŋic , yin Nhialic yic , yin yitok , ku ŋicki Yecu Kritho raan e yin e toc en .

text: I have glorified thee on the earth : I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do .
text2: Yin ca tɔ yok dhueeŋ e piny nɔm ; luɔi ci gam ɛn , an , ba looi , aca thol .

text: And now , O Father , glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , yin Waar , tɔ ya yok dhueeŋ woke yin etok , ne dhueeŋ ɣɔn cath ke yɛn woke yin etok ɣɔn ŋoote piny ke liu .

text: I have manifested thy name unto the men which thou gavest me out of the world : thine they were , and thou gavest them me ; and they have kept thy word .
text2: Yɛn e kɔc nyuoth rinku egɔk , kɔc waan ci gam ɛn e piny nɔm : aake ye kɔcku , ku yin aa gɛm ke yɛn ; ku acik jamdu muk .

text: Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are of thee .
text2: Ku acik ŋic enɔɔne nɔn e bi kaŋ tede yin , ka ci gam ɛn kedhie :

text: For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me ; and they have received them , and have known surely that I came out from thee , and they have believed that thou didst send me .
text2: ku wel waan game yɛn aca ke gam keek ; ku acik ke dɔm , agoki ŋic egɔk nɔn e ba yɛn tede yin , ku gamki nɔn ee yin e toc ɛn .

text: I pray for them : I pray not for the world , but for them which thou hast given me ; for they are thine .
text2: Yɛn laŋ ne biakden : yɛn cii laŋ ne biak de kɔc ke piny nɔm , ee biak de kɔc waan game yɛn ; luɔi ee kek kɔcku .

text: And all mine are thine , and thine are mine ; and I am glorified in them .
text2: Ku kaki kedhie ee kaku , ku kaku ee kaki : ku yɛn ee dhueeŋ yok e keyiic .

text: And now I am no more in the world , but these are in the world , and I come to thee . Holy Father , keep through thine own name those whom thou hast given me , that they may be one , as we are .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , yɛn cii be nu e piny nɔm , ku nu kɔcke e piny nɔm , ku la tede yin . Waar , Raan Ɣerpiɔu , muk kɔc ne rinku , kɔc ci gam ɛn , ke ke bi aa raan tok , cit man e wok wo yin .

text: While I was with them in the world , I kept them in thy name : those that thou gavest me I have kept , and none of them is lost , but the son of perdition ; that the scripture might be fulfilled .
text2: Te waan nuo yɛn wo keek etok e piny nɔm , aca ke muk apiɛth e rinku : kɔc ci gam ɛn aca ke tiit , ku acin raan tok e keek ci maar , ee wen e maar e kaŋ etok ; ke kecigɔɔr bi aa yic .

text: And now come I to thee ; and these things I speak in the world , that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , yɛn lɔ tede yin ; ku yɛn luel kake e piny nɔm , e luɔi bi kek cath e miɛt e yɛnpiɔu , abik piɔth a yum .

text: I have given them thy word ; and the world hath hated them , because they are not of the world , even as I am not of the world .
text2: Aca ke gam jamdu ; ku aci kɔc ke piny nɔm ke maan gup , luɔi cii kek e ka ke piny nɔm , cit man e yɛn , yɛn cie ke de piny nɔm .

text: I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world , but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil .
text2: Acie luɔi bi yin ke bɛɛi bei e piny nɔm en laŋ , ee luɔi bi yin ke gel e kerac .

text: They are not of the world , even as I am not of the world .
text2: Aciki e ka ke piny nɔm , cit man e yɛn , yɛn cie ke de piny nɔm .

text: Sanctify them through thy truth : thy word is truth .
text2: Tɔ ke ɣerpiɔth ne yicdu : jamdu yen aye yic .

text: As thou hast sent me into the world , even so have I also sent them into the world .
text2: Acit man ci yin a tuɔɔc e piny nɔm , yen aa tuɔɔc ɛn keek e piny nɔm aya .

text: And for their sakes I sanctify myself , that they also might be sanctified through the truth .
text2: Ku ne biakden yen a ta yɛn apiɔu ɣer , ke ke bi tɔ ɣerpiɔth aya ne yic .

text: Neither pray I for these alone , but for them also which shall believe on me through their word ;
text2: Ku acie biak de kɔcke kapac yen laŋ , e biak de kɔc bi a gam ne biak de jamden aya ;

text: That they all may be one ; as thou , Father , art in me , and I in thee , that they also may be one in us : that the world may believe that thou hast sent me .
text2: ke ke bi aa raan tok kedhie ; acit man nu yin e yayic , Waar , ku nuo e yiyic , ke ke bi aa raan tok ne woyiic ayadaŋ : ago kɔc ke piny nɔm gam nɔn ee yin e toc ɛn .

text: And the glory which thou gavest me I have given them ; that they may be one , even as we are one :
text2: Ku dhueeŋ ci gam ɛn aca gam keek ; ke ke bi aa tok , cit man ee wok tok ;

text: I in them , and thou in me , that they may be made perfect in one ; and that the world may know that thou hast sent me , and hast loved them , as thou hast loved me .
text2: yɛn e keyiic , ku yin e yayic , ke ke bi dikedik abik aa tok ; ago kɔc ke piny nɔm e ŋic nɔn ee yin e toc ɛn , ku nɔn ci yin keek nhiaar , acit man nhiɛɛr yin ɛn .

text: Father , I will that they also , whom thou hast given me , be with me where I am ; that they may behold my glory , which thou hast given me : for thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world .
text2: Yin Waar , kɔc ci gam ɛn , yɛn de piɔu luɔi bi kek aa tɔu ne yɛn etok te nuo yɛn thin ; ke ke bi dhueendi tiŋ , dhueeŋ ci gam ɛn ; nɔn ci yin a nhiaar ɣɔn ŋoote piny ke kene cak .

text: O righteous Father , the world hath not known thee : but I have known thee , and these have known that thou hast sent me .
text2: Waar , Raan piɛthpiɔu , yin kuc kɔc ke piny nɔm ; ku yin ŋiɛc , ku ŋic kɔcke nɔn ee yin e toc ɛn ;

text: And I have declared unto them thy name , and will declare it : that the love wherewith thou hast loved me may be in them , and I in them .
text2: ku aca ke tɔ ŋic rinku , ku aba ke tɔ ŋic ; ke nhieer ee yin a nhiaar bi nu e keyiic , ku nuo e keyiic .

text: When Jesus had spoken these words , he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron , where was a garden , into the which he entered , and his disciples .
text2: Na wen , aci Yecu kake lueel , ke lɔ biic keke kɔcken e piooce , lek ku tem nyin cɔl Kidiron ; ku jeneen anu lɔɔk etɛɛn , ago lɔ thin , yen keke kɔckɛn e piooce .

text: And Judas also , which betrayed him , knew the place : for Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples .
text2: Ku Judath aya , raan bi e nyiɛɛn , aŋic etɛɛn : ne luɔi ee kek cool e mat keniim etɛɛn , yen Yecu keke kɔckɛn e piooce .

text: Judas then , having received a band of men and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees , cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons .
text2: Na wen , aci Judath rem e alathkeer noom keke banyken , tede banydit ke ka ke Nhialic ku Parithai , ke ke jɔ bɛn etɛɛn , ke ke muk kuthyuui ku mɛckealath ku ka yeke biok .

text: Jesus therefore , knowing all things that should come upon him , went forth , and said unto them , Whom seek ye ?
text2: Go Yecu , ne ŋiny ŋic en kaŋ kedhie ka bi yok , go lɔ biic tede keek , le ku thieec keek , yan , Eeŋa kaarki ?

text: They answered him , Jesus of Nazareth . Jesus saith unto them , I am he . And Judas also , which betrayed him , stood with them .
text2: Goki bɛɛr , yan , Yecu de Nadhareth . Go Yecu ke yɔɔk , yan , Ya ki . Ku Judath aya , raan nyiin en , akaac etɛɛn keke keek etok .

text: As soon then as he had said unto them , I am he , they went backward , and fell to the ground .
text2: Na wen , aci ke yɔɔk , yan , Ya ki , ke ke jɔ lɔ cieen , wiikki .

text: Then asked he them again , Whom seek ye ? And they said , Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Go ke bɛ thieec , yan , Eeŋa kaarki ? Goki lueel , yɛn , Yecu de Nadhareth .

text: Jesus answered , I have told you that I am he : if therefore ye seek me , let these go their way :
text2: Go Yecu bɛɛr , yan , Aca lɛk week , yan , Ee yɛn ee yen : enɔɔne , te kaar wek ɛn , ke we pal kɔcke e ke jel :

text: That the saying might be fulfilled , which he spake , Of them which thou gavest me have I lost none .
text2: luɔi bi jam wen ci lueel aa yic , yan , Ne kɔcke yiic kɔc ci gam ɛn , acin toŋ ca tɔ mar .

text: Then Simon Peter having a sword drew it , and smote the high priest ' s servant , and cut off his right ear . The servant ' s name was Malchus .
text2: Na wen , ke Thimon Petero , raan cath ke abatau , ke miit bei , yup lim e bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic , kip yiny cuec wei . Rin ke lime acɔl Malko .

text: Then said Jesus unto Peter , Put up thy sword into the sheath : the cup which my Father hath given me , shall I not drink it ?
text2: Go Yecu Petero yɔɔk , yan , Taauwe abatau e thiondeyic : biny cii Waar gam ɛn , ca bi dek e ye ?

text: Then the band and the captain and officers of the Jews took Jesus , and bound him ,
text2: Go rem ku bɛny de rem ku bany ke Judai agoki Yecu dɔm , ku dutki ,

text: And led him away to Annas first ; for he was father in law to Caiaphas , which was the high priest that same year .
text2: goki thel , kɔnki lɛɛr te nu Anath ; luɔi ee yen thun e Kayapath , raan wen eye bɛnyditt tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic eruune .

text: Now Caiaphas was he , which gave counsel to the Jews , that it was expedient that one man should die for the people .
text2: Ku Kayapath , yen aye raan waan yin Judai loŋ , yan , aŋuan te bi raan tok thou e nyin e kɔc yiic .

text: And Simon Peter followed Jesus , and so did another disciple : that disciple was known unto the high priest , and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest .
text2: Ku kuany Thimon Petero Yecu cok , ayi raan daŋ e piooce . Ku raane aŋic bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic , go lɔ keke Yecu etok e aloocic , alooc de bɛnydiit e ka ke Nhialic ;

text: But Peter stood at the door without . Then went out that other disciple , which was known unto the high priest , and spake unto her that kept the door , and brought in Peter .
text2: ku kaac Petero ɣot thok biic . Na wen , ke raan daŋ e piooce raan ŋic bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic , ke lɔ biic , le ku jiɛɛm keke nyan tit ɣot thok , ku bii Petero ɣot .

text: Then saith the damsel that kept the door unto Peter , Art not thou also one of this man ' s disciples ? He saith , I am not .
