text2: Go Paulo keke Baranaba agoki nyin riɛl , ku jɔki lueel , yan , Jam e Nhialic aci dhil kɔn guieer week . Ku enɔɔne , luɔi ca wek e nyaai , ku cak rot tɔ ye kɔc cii roŋ ne piir athɛɛr , tieŋki , wo e ro yal te nu Juoor .

text: For so hath the Lord commanded us , saying , I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles , that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth .
text2: Yen aye ke ci Bɛnydit thɔn wo , yan , Yin ca taau ba ya keɣeer bi Juoor aa riaau , Ku ba ya kede kunydewei aɣet te le piny thar guut .

text: And when the Gentiles heard this , they were glad , and glorified the word of the Lord : and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed .
text2: Te ci Juoor kene piŋ , agoki piɔth miɛt , ku lecki jam e Nhialic : ago kɔc ebɛn kɔc ci kɔn lɔc , an , bik dɛ piir athɛɛr , agoki gam .

text: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region .
text2: Go jam e Bɛnydit go piny kiet nɔm pinye ebɛn .

text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women , and the chief men of the city , and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas , and expelled them out of their coasts .
text2: Na wen , ke Judai ke ke keek dieer dit dieer rieu Nhialic , ku roor dit ke panydit , ku riirki keniim bik Paulo yɔŋ keke Baranaba , goki ke cieec pinyden .

text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them , and came unto Iconium .
text2: Ku keek , te ci kek abuni tɛŋ wei e kecok ne jany bi kek ke jɔɔny , ke ke bɔ Yikonion .

text: And the disciples were filled with joy , and with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Go kɔcpiooce piɔth miɛt alal , ku thieŋki ne Weidit Ɣer .

text: And it came to pass in Iconium , that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews , and so spake , that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed .
text2: Na wen , te nu kek Yikonion , ke ke lɔ luaŋ ee Judai lɔŋ thin , keek kaarou etok , ku jɔki kɔc guieer , ago kut diit e kɔc gam , Judai ayi Giriku aya .

text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles , and made their minds evil affected against the brethren .
text2: Go Judai reec gam goki Juoor kɛɛk , ku tɔki ke nhiany piɔth ne wathii .

text: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord , which gave testimony unto the word of his grace , and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands .
text2: Agoki ceŋ etɛɛn e akool juec ku yek wel guiir ke ke ye nyin riɛl e Bɛnyditic , ago Benydit aa caatɔ de jam de dhueeŋ de yenpiɔu , go gook tɔ loi e kecin , ku ka gɛiye kɔc .

text: But the multitude of the city was divided : and part held with the Jews , and part with the apostles .
text2: Ku kut e kɔc nu panydit acik rot tek ; kɔc kɔk acik mat e Judai , ku mat kɔc kɔk e tuuc .

text: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles , and also of the Jews with their rulers , to use them despitefully , and to stone them ,
text2: Na wen , ke Juoor keke Judai ku bany ceŋ keek , te ci kek tɔŋ lɛɛr e ke riŋ , lek ke kuur , ku biookki keek e kur ,

text: They were ware of it , and fled unto Lystra and Derbe , cities of Lycaonia , and unto the region that lieth round about :
text2: agoki ŋic kek tuuc , ku kɔtki , lek e pɛɛnydit kɔk , yi Luthura ku Derbe , kek pɛɛnydit ke Lukaonia , ku leki e bɛi nu e kekec aya :

text: And there they preached the gospel .
text2: agoki welpiɛth guiir etɛɛn .

text: And there sat a certain man at Lystra , impotent in his feet , being a cripple from his mother ' s womb , who never had walked :
text2: Ku ade mony nu Luthura , mony cin riɛl e yecok , ku ye cool e rɛɛr , ke ye aduany ken kɔn cath anande ecaŋɣɔn dhieethe ye .

text: The same heard Paul speak : who stedfastly beholding him , and perceiving that he had faith to be healed ,
text2: Monye aci Paulo pıŋ te guiir en wel : na wen , ke toom Paulo guop alal , ku tiŋ nɔn ciɛth en ke gam bi e tɔ dem ,

text: Said with a loud voice , Stand upright on thy feet . And he leaped and walked .
text2: go yɔɔk e rol dit , yan , Kaace ke yi kim ro piny . Go kɛɛc nhial ku ciɛth .

text: And when the people saw what Paul had done , they lifted up their voices , saying in the speech of Lycaonia , The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men .
text2: Na wen , aci kut e kɔc luɔi e looi Paulo tiŋ , ke ke jɔt kerot , jamki ne thoŋdɛn e Lukaonia , luelki , yan , Yieth acik loony piny tede wook ke ke cit gup kɔc .

text: And they called Barnabas , Jupiter ; and Paul , Mercurius , because he was the chief speaker .
text2: Goki Baranaba tɔ ye Dhio ; ku tɔki Paulo Kereme , luɔi ee yen raan e wel dap guiir .

text: Then the priest of Jupiter , which was before their city , brought oxen and garlands unto the gates , and would have done sacrifice with the people .
text2: Na wen , ke guny de Dhio , yanh nu luaŋde e kal thok kal e panydit , ke bii mioor e kɛl thook , ku bii gool , an , bi lam keke kut e kɔc , ku nak .

text: Which when the apostles , Barnabas and Paul , heard of , they rent their clothes , and ran in among the people , crying out ,
text2: Na wen , aci tuuc e piŋ , ke yi Paulo keke Baranaba , ke ke ret lupɔɔken yiic , ku kɔtki lek e kɔc yiic cil , ke ke cot ,

text: And saying , Sirs , why do ye these things ? We also are men of like passions with you , and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God , which made heaven , and earth , and the sea , and all things that are therein :
text2: yan , Wek roor , eeŋo luɔɔi wek kake ? Wok ee kɔc tei , wok kit piɔth e week , ku wek guiirku wel piɛth , ke we bi rot yal wei e kaɣaar yiic cit ekake , ku jaki wepiɔth wɛl Nhialic piir , Raan e cak nhial ku piny ku abapdit , ku ka nu e keyiic kedhie :

text: Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways .
text2: ku aci juoor kedhie pal cath e kuɛɛrken ɣɔn nu rɛm thɛɛr .

text: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness , in that he did good , and gave us rain from heaven , and fruitful seasons , filling our hearts with food and gladness .
text2: Ku aken ro pɔl te cin caatɔde tei , aa ye cool e loi luɔi piɛth , ee wo miɔɔc ne deŋ bɔ nhial ayi pɛi ee kaŋ ke luɔk , go wo tɔ kueth e kecam abuk piɔth miɛt .

text: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people , that they had not done sacrifice unto them .
text2: Ku ciɛk an , cik kake lueel , ke pɛn pen kek kɔc luɔi lam kek keek , aci duɛɛr dhal .

text: And there came thither certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium , who persuaded the people , and , having stoned Paul , drew him out of the city , supposing he had been dead .
text2: Na wen , ke Judai bɔ e Antiokia keke Yikonion ke ke ɣet etɛɛn : agoki kut e kɔc weŋ , ku biookki Paulo ne kur , ku thelki biic e panydit kec , aluelki , an , ci yien thou .

text: Howbeit , as the disciples stood round about him , he rose up , and came into the city : and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe .
text2: Ku te ci kɔcpiooce ye geeu , ke jɔt rot le panydit : na ɣɔnmiak , ke jel keke Baranaba lek Derbe .

text: And when they had preached the gospel to that city , and had taught many , they returned again to Lystra , and to Iconium , and Antioch ,
text2: Na wen , acik welpiɛth guieer panydiite , ku weetki kɔc juec abik aa kɔcpiooce , ke ke dhuny keniim Luthura , ku Yikonion , ku Antiokia ,

text: Confirming the souls of the disciples , and exhorting them to continue in the faith , and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: ku ritki kɔcpiooce piɔth , yookki keek , yan , bik aa tɔu e gamic apiɛth , ku yan , ne guom ee wok katuc juec guum en abi wo dhil lɔ e ciɛɛŋ de Nhialicic .

text: And when they had ordained them elders in every church , and had prayed with fasting , they commended them to the Lord , on whom they believed .
text2: Agoki roordit lɔc e kanithɔɔ yiic ebɛn , ku te ci kek lɔŋ ne rɛɛc reec kek cam , ke ke pɛlki e Bɛnydit cin , Bɛnydit cik gam .

text: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia , they came to Pamphylia .
text2: Ku te ci kek Pithidia teekic , ke ke bɔ Pampulia .

text: And when they had preached the word in Perga , they went down into Attalia :
text2: Na wen , acik wel guiir e Perga , ke ke lɔ Atalia ;

text: And thence sailed to Antioch , from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled .
text2: ku jelki etɛɛn ne abel lek Antiokia , paan ci wathii ke kɔn tɔɔŋ thin waan , an , bik cath ne dhueeŋ de Nhialic piɔu ne kede luɔiden , luɔi cik guɔ thol enɔɔne .

text: And when they were come , and had gathered the church together , they rehearsed all that God had done with them , and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles .
text2: Na wen , acik bɛn , ke ke tɔ kanithɔ gueer , ku guiirki keek kerieec cii Nhialic looi keke keek , ku luɔi ci en ɣon e gam liep Juoor .

text: And there they abode long time with the disciples .
text2: Ku jɔki reer etɛɛn e akool juec ne kɔcpiooce .

text: And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren , and said , Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses , ye cannot be saved .
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc kɔk e ke bɔ e Judaya , bik ku weetki wathii , yan , Te kene we cueel cit man e tau de ciɛɛŋ de Mothe , ke we cii dueere kony wei .

text: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them , they determined that Paul and Barnabas , and certain other of them , should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question .
text2: Goki teer cak ne Paulo ku Baranaba , teer dit e wel juec bɛɛi : na wen , ke lueel kɔc , yan , bi Paulo lɔ Jeruthalem keke Baranaba , ku kɔc kɔk e keyiic , lek te nu tuuc ku roordit , lek jame guiir .

text: And being brought on their way by the church , they passed through Phenice and Samaria , declaring the conversion of the Gentiles : and they caused great joy unto all the brethren .
text2: Go kanithɔ ke ruac kueer , ku jɔki Poiniki teekic keke Thamaria , ke ke lek kɔc puŋ ci Juoor kepiɔth pɔk Nhialic : goki wathii tɔ mit piɔth alal .

text: And when they were come to Jerusalem , they were received of the church , and of the apostles and elders , and they declared all things that God had done with them .
text2: Na wen , acik ɣet Jeruthalem , ke ke loor kanithɔ ayi tuuc ku roordit , ku jɔki ke guieer kerieec ebɛn ka cii Nhialic looi keke keek .

text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed , saying , That it was needful to circumcise them , and to command them to keep the law of Moses .
text2: Ku jɔt kɔc kɔk rot , kɔc ke rem e Parithai kɔc ci gam , ku jɔki lueel , yan , Juoor abike dhil cueel , ku abuk keek dhil yɔɔk , yan , bik loŋ de Mothe dhil aa muk ebɛn .

text: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter .
text2: Go tuuc ku roordit goki gueer bik jame bɛn woiyic .

text: And when there had been much disputing , Peter rose up , and said unto them , Men and brethren , ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us , that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel , and believe .
text2: Na wen , aci kɔc teer e teer dit , ke Petero jɔt rot , ku lueel , yan , Wathii , aŋiɛcki lony ci Nhialic a lɔc waan e weyiic , yan , bi Juoor welpiɛth piŋ e yathok , ku gamki .

text: And God , which knoweth the hearts , bare them witness , giving them the Holy Ghost , even as he did unto us ;
text2: Ku Nhialic , Raan ŋic kɔc piɔth , aci aa caatɔden , ne miɔc ci en keek miɔɔc ne Weidit Ɣer , acit man ci en wo miɔɔc ;

text: And put no difference between us and them , purifying their hearts by faith .
text2: ku acin puny ci en wo pɔɔc yiic , wook ne keek , waan ci en keek waak piɔth ne gam .

text: Now therefore why tempt ye God , to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples , which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear ?
text2: Na enɔɔne , eeŋo thɛmki Nhialic , bak kethiek taau e kɔcpiooce yieth , kethiek ci warkuɔ dhal e jot ayi wook ?

text: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved , even as they .
text2: Wok gam tei nɔn bi wo kony wei ne dhueeŋ e Bɛnydit Yecu Kritho piɔu , acit man e kek aya .

text: Then all the multitude kept silence , and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul , declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them .
text2: Na wen , ke kut e kɔc ebɛn ke ke jɔ mim , ku piŋki kede Baranaba ku Paulo , ke ke guiir gook ku ka ye kɔc ke gai , ka cii Nhialic looi e Juoor yiic ne kecin .

text: And after they had held their peace , James answered , saying , Men and brethren , hearken unto me :
text2: Na wen , acik jamden thol , ke Jakop beer , lueel , yan , Wathii , piɛŋki kedi :

text: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles , to take out of them a people for his name .
text2: Thimeon aci week guieer ne nɛm tueŋ ci Nhialic Juoor kɔn neem , bi kɔc bɛn bɛɛi bei e keyiic , ne baŋ de rinke .

text: And to this agree the words of the prophets ; as it is written ,
text2: Ku wel ke nebi arɛmki ne kene ; acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan ,

text: After this I will return , and will build again the tabernacle of David , which is fallen down ; and I will build again the ruins thereof , and I will set it up :
text2: Na ele e kake cok , ke yɛn bi anɔm dhuny , Guɔ keemɔ de Dabid wen ci wiik aguɔ bɛ yik ; Ku pɛɛny ci riaak aba ke bɛ yik , Ku ta ke kaac :

text: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord , and all the Gentiles , upon whom my name is called , saith the Lord , who doeth all these things .
text2: Luɔi bi kɔc Nhialic kɔɔr , kɔc ci doŋ , Ayi Juoor kedhie Juoor ci cɔɔl ne rinki ; Jam de Bɛnydit ki , Bɛnydit loi kake kedhie .

text: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world .
text2: Luɔi looi ebɛn aŋic Nhialic te ɣɔn gɔle kaŋ .

text: Wherefore my sentence is , that we trouble not them , which from among the Gentiles are turned to God :
text2: Enɔɔne di , loŋdi ki , yan , Duku kɔc e jut kɔc ci Kepiɔth wɛl Nhialic ne Juoor yiic ;

text: But that we write unto them , that they abstain from pollutions of idols , and from fornication , and from things strangled , and from blood .
text2: ku abuk keek gaar tei , yan , bik luɔi de yieth pɔl luɔi nhiany , ku palki dhoom , ku cam de lai ci dec , ku riɛm .

text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him , being read in the synagogues every sabbath day .
text2: Mothe ade kɔc e loŋde guiir ecaŋɣɔn wut ebɛn , jamde aye kueenic e luek ke Nhialic yiic e akool ke thabath kedhie .

text: Then pleased it the apostles and elders , with the whole church , to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas ; namely , Judas surnamed Barsabas , and Silas , chief men among the brethren :
text2: Go tuuc ku roordit ku kanithɔ ebɛn agoki loŋ mat e kepiɔth , yan , bik kɔc ci lɔc ne remdenic tuɔɔc Antiokia , bik cath e Paulo keke Baranaba ; ke yi Judath cɔl Barthaba , ku Thila , kɔc dit e kɔc yiic :

text: And they wrote letters by them after this manner ; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia :
text2: goki awarek gɔɔr tɔki luɛthki , awarek lueel en , yan , Wek thieec tuuc ku roordit ku wathii , wek mithekɔckuɔn nu e Juoor yiic , kɔc tɔu ne Antiokia , ku Thuria , ku Kilikia :

text: Forasmuch as we have heard , that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words , subverting your souls , saying , Ye must be circumcised , and keep the law : to whom we gave no such commandment :
text2: Acuk piŋ nɔn de kɔc kɔk ci jal e woyiic , kɔc ci week jut ne wel weete ke , ku lieepki weniim , luelki , yan , bi we dhil cueel , ku bak loŋ aa dot ; ku acin ke cuk thɔn keek ;

text: It seemed good unto us , being assembled with one accord , to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul ,
text2: agoku loŋ mat e wopiɔth ne gueer ci wo gueer ne piɔn tok , an , buk kɔc cuk lɔc tuoc week bik cath e Baranaba ku Paulo , kɔc nhiaarku ,

text: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: kɔc ci weiken kuɔɔn ne baŋ de rin ke Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho .

text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas , who shall also tell you the same things by mouth .
text2: Yen a toc wok Judath ku Thila , kɔc bi we lɛk wel manke ne kethook .

text: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost , and to us , to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things ;
text2: Apiɛth tede Weidit Ɣer ayi wook , yan , Acin daŋ buk taau e weyieth , ee kake tei ka bak dhil looi ;

text: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols , and from blood , and from things strangled , and from fornication : from which if ye keep yourselves , ye shall do well . Fare ye well .
text2: yan , bak cam e riŋ ci gam yieth pɔl , ku riɛm , ku ka ci dec , ku dhoom , te ca wek kake pɔl , ka we ye kepiɛth looi . Niɛnki apiɛth .

text: So when they were dismissed , they came to Antioch : and when they had gathered the multitude together , they delivered the epistle :
text2: Na wen , acike tɔ jel , ke ke bɔ Antiokia ; ku te ci kek kut e kɔc tɔ gueer , ke ke jɔki gam awarek .

text: Which when they had read , they rejoiced for the consolation .
text2: Agoki kueen , ku jɔki piɔth miɛt ne muŋ ci ke muk piɔth .

text: And Judas and Silas , being prophets also themselves , exhorted the brethren with many words , and confirmed them .
text2: Go Judath ku Thila , luɔi ee kek nebii aya , agoki wathii guieer wel juec , ku ritki kepiɔth .

text: And after they had tarried there a space , they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles .
text2: Na wen , acik nin lɛɛr etɛɛn , ke ke tɔ jel apiɛth ne wathii bik lɔ te nu tuuc .

text: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still .
text2: Ku Thila amit piɔu ne reer reer en etɛɛn .

text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch , teaching and preaching the word of the Lord , with many others also .
text2: Ku dɔŋ Paulo ku Baranaba Antiokia , ke ke ye kɔc wɛɛt guiirki keek jam e Bɛnydit , ne kɔc juec kɔk aya .

text: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas , Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord , and see how they do .
text2: Na wen , acik nhi lɛɛr , ke Paulo yook Baranaba , yan , Jɔku woniim bɛ dhuny lok mithekɔckuɔ bɛ neem e panyditic ebɛn te waan ee wok jam ee Bɛnydit guiir thin , ke wo bi tau tɔu kek tiŋ .

text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John , whose surname was Mark .
text2: Ago Baranaba piɔu dɛ luɔi bi kek Jɔn lɛɛr bi lɔ cath ke keek , rinkɛn kɔk acɔlke Mak .

text: But Paul thought not good to take him with them , who departed from them from Pamphylia , and went not with them to the work .
text2: Ku lueel Paulo , yan , cii piɛth luɔi bi kek raan lɛɛr raan waan e jel e kelɔm e Pampulia , ku reec cath ke keek e luɔiyic .

text: And the contention was so sharp between them , that they departed asunder one from the other : and so Barnabas took Mark , and sailed unto Cyprus ;
text2: Agoki teer alal apɔk kek , ku jɔ Baranaba Mak lɛɛr , jel abelic le Kupurio ;

text: And Paul chose Silas , and departed , being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God .
text2: ku lɔc Paulo Thila , ku jel , aci wathii ke kɔn tɔɔŋ , yan , bi dhueeŋ e Nhialic piɔu cath ke keek .

text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia , confirming the churches .
text2: Go Thuria ku Kilikia teek yiic , ke tɔ kanithɔɔ kaac arik

text: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra : and , behold , a certain disciple was there , named Timotheus , the son of a certain woman , which was a Jewess , and believed ; but his father was a Greek :
text2: Go ɣet Derbe ku Luthura aya : ku ade raanpiooce etɛɛn , cɔl Timotheo , wen e tiiŋ ci gam , ku ye nyan e Judai ; ku wun ee Giriki .

text: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium .
text2: Ku mɛnhe ee mɛnh ci leec e wathii wɛɛt nu Luthura ku Yikonion .

text: Him would Paul have to go forth with him ; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters : for they knew all that his father was a Greek .
text2: Ku Paulo ade piɔu luɔi bi mɛnhe cath keke yen : go noom ku cueel , ne biak de Judai rɛɛr etɛɛn : wun aŋic kɔc kedhie nɔn ee yen Giriki .

text: And as they went through the cities , they delivered them the decrees for to keep , that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem .
text2: Na wen , te ciɛth kek e pɛɛnydit yiic , ke ke yin kɔc looŋ bik muk , looŋ cii tuuc lueel ku roordit nu Jeruthalem .

text: And so were the churches established in the faith , and increased in number daily .
text2: Ago kanithɔɔ tɔ ril ne gam kedhie , ku ŋuek kuenden enyin e akoolnyiin kedhie .

text: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia , and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia ,
text2: Go Paulo ku kɔc cath e yen goki lɔ teek Purugia ku piny e Galatia , ku pen Weidit Ɣer keek ne guieer bi kek jam guiir ne Athia ;

text: After they were come to Mysia , they assayed to go into Bithynia : but the Spirit suffered them not .
text2: na wen , acik ɣet Muthia , ke ke them luɔi bi kek lɔ Bithunia , go Weidit ke Yecu ke peen ;

text: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas .
text2: goki teek e Muthia , ku jɔki bɛn Toroa .

text: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night ; There stood a man of Macedonia , and prayed him , saying , Come over into Macedonia , and help us .
text2: Ku tul raan tede Paulo wakɔu ke e nyuoth ; ee raan e Makedonia akaac ke laŋ , yan , Ba lɔŋda paan e Makedonia , ba wo bɛn kony .

text: And after he had seen the vision , immediately we endeavored to go into Macedonia , assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them .
text2: Na wen , aci raane tiŋ , goku te bi wo lɔ Makedonia dap kɔɔr , ayok lueel e wopiɔth , an , ci Bɛnydit wo dhil cɔɔl , buk welpiɛth lɔ guieer keek .

text: Therefore loosing from Troas , we came with a straight course to Samothracia , and the next day to Neapolis ;
text2: Goku jal e Toroa e abel , ku ciɛthku kueer lɔ cit aɣet Thamotharake , na ɣɔnmiak ke wo jɔ ɣet Neapoli ;

text: And from thence to Philippi , which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia , and a colony : and we were in that city abiding certain days .
text2: ku jelku etɛɛn lok Pilipoi , yen aye panydit de naamden dit e Makedonia biake , ku ye piny ci Romai ɣap thin aya : agoku reer e panydiite e akoolke .

text: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side , where prayer was wont to be made ; and we sat down , and spake unto the women which resorted thither .
text2: Na wen , ekool e thabath , ke wo lɔ panydit kec e wɛɛryɔu te ye kɔc lɔŋ thin ; loku ku nyucku piny , jamku ne dieer ci gueer etɛɛn .

text: And a certain woman named Lydia , a seller of purple , of the city of Thyatira , which worshipped God , heard us : whose heart the Lord opened , that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul .
text2: Ku ade tiiŋ ci jamda piŋ , cɔl Ludia , tiiŋ e lupɔ thith amujuŋ ɣaac , abɔ panydit cɔl Thuatira , ku ye tiiŋ rieu Nhialic : piɔnde acii Bɛnydit liep , bi ka lueel Paulo cok e piŋ en ke .

text: And when she was baptized , and her household , she besought us , saying , If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , come into my house , and abide there . And she constrained us .
text2: Na wen , aci baptith , keke dhiende ebɛn , ke laŋ wook , yan , Te ca wek a tɔ ye raan e ka ke Bɛnydit dot , baki ɣondi , bak bɛn reer tliin . Go wo dhil tɔ ye kamaanke .

text: And it came to pass , as we went to prayer , a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us , which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying :
text2: Na wen , ekool tok , te le wok te ye kɔc lɔŋ , ke wo jɔ rɔm ne nyan lim , nyan de guop yanh cɔl nyieel , ku ye banyke tɔ yok weu juec ne caar ee yen cɔɔr .

text: The same followed Paul and us , and cried , saying , These men are the servants of the most high God , which shew unto us the way of salvation .
text2: Go wo kuany cok woke Paulo , en enyane , ke ye coot , yan , Roorke ayek him ke Nhialic Awarjaŋ , kɔc guiir wook ne kueer e kunydewei .

text: And this did she many days . But Paul , being grieved , turned and said to the spirit , I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her . And he came out the same hour .
text2: Go kene looi e akool juec . Na wen , ke Paulo diu piɔu , ku puk rot , yook jɔŋe , yan , Ne rin ke Yecu Kritho yin yɔɔk , yan , Ba bei e yeguop . Go bɛn bei e thaar mane guop .

text: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone , they caught Paul and Silas , and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers ,
text2: Na wen , aci banyke e tiŋ nɔn ci aŋɔthdɛn e weu jal , ke ke dɔm Paulo ku Thila , ku thelki keek e thuukic e bany niim bany e loŋ guiir ;

text: And brought them to the magistrates , saying , These men , being Jews , do exceedingly trouble our city ,
text2: na wen , ke ke leerki e bany ke tɔŋ niim , ku luelki , yan , Kɔcke , Judaike , ayek panydandit jut alal ne jamden ,

text: And teach customs , which are not lawful for us to receive , neither to observe , being Romans .
text2: ku yek kɔc wɛɛt e ciɛɛŋ cii piɛth e luɔi dɔm wok en , ku loiku , wok Romai .

text: And the multitude rose up together against them : and the magistrates rent off their clothes , and commanded to beat them .
text2: Na wen , ke kut e kɔc e ke jɔt rot kedhie luelki ater ne keek : go bany ke tɔŋ agoki lupɔɔken tɔ reete bei e kegup , ku luelki , an , bike dui e wɛt .

text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them , they cast them into prison , charging the jailor to keep them safely :
text2: Agoki ke dui e wɛt juec , ku tɛɛuki keek e aloocic , ku yookki raan tit alooc , yan , bi ke cok e tit en keek :

text: Who , having received such a charge , thrust them into the inner prison , and made their feet fast in the stocks .
text2: ku yen , te ci e lɛk loŋ cit ekene , ke ke jɔ taau e aloocic cil , ku mɛc kecok e tiim kɔɔth .

text: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed , and sang praises unto God : and the prisoners heard them .
text2: Na wen , e wɛɛric cil , ke Paulo ku Thila ke ke laŋ ku kitki diɛt leec kek ke Nhialic , ku piŋ kɔc kɔk ci mac e keek etok .

text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken : and immediately all the doors were opened , and every one ' s bands were loosed .
text2: Na wen , ke piny jɔ ro guɔ niɛŋ aret ethiau , abi alooc niɛŋ aɣet ethar : go thok ke alooc rot liep kedhie enɔnthiine ; ku ruet joth rot kedhie joth mace kɔc cok .

text: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep , and seeing the prison doors open , he drew out his sword , and would have killed himself , supposing that the prisoners had been fled .
text2: Na wen , ke raan e alooc tiit paac , ku tiŋ thok ke alooc aɣɔɔrki , go abataude miet bei , an , nɛk rot , alueel , an , ci kɔc ci mac kat .

text: But Paul cried with a loud voice , saying , Do thyself no harm : for we are all here .
text2: Go Paulo coot e rol dit , an , Du ro nak ; wok ki ene , wodhie .

text: Then he called for a light , and sprang in , and came trembling , and fell down before Paul and Silas ,
text2: Na wen , ke cool mac , ku kɛɛc ɣot , bi ke lɛthe , ku jɔ wiik e Paulo nɔm keke Thila ,

text: And brought them out , and said , Sirs , what must I do to be saved ?
text2: ago ke bɛɛi bei , ku thieec keek , yan , Wek bany , eeŋo ba looi , ke bi a kony wei ?

text: And they said , Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ , and thou shalt be saved , and thy house .
text2: Goki lueel , yan , Gam Bɛnydit Yecu Kritho , ke yi bi kony wei , weke dhiendu .

text: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord , and to all that were in his house .
text2: Goki guieer jam e Bɛnydit , yen keke dhiende ebɛn .

text: And he took them the same hour of the night , and washed their stripes ; and was baptized , he and all his , straightway .
text2: Na wen , ke ke leer e thaar mane guop , ku piny e wakɔu , le ku wɛɛk tetokken ; go baptith enɔnthiine , yen keke dhiende ebɛn .

text: And when he had brought them into his house , he set meat before them , and rejoiced , believing in God with all his house .
text2: Na wen , ke ke bii ɣonde , ku tɛɛu kecam e keniim , ke mit piɔu alal , keke dhiende ebɛn , ne gam wen ci kek Nhialic gam .

text: And when it was day , the magistrates sent the serjeants , saying , Let those men go .
text2: Na wen , aci piny ru , ke bany ke tɔŋ ke ke toc cawiic , yan , Taki kɔcke lony .

text: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul , The magistrates have sent to let you go : now therefore depart , and go in peace .
text2: Go raan e alooc tiit go welke lɛk Paulo , yan , Bany ke tɔŋ acik thɔn , yan , lony week : jaki jal enɔɔne , we bi cath apiɛth .

text: But Paul said unto them , They have beaten us openly uncondemned , being Romans , and have cast us into prison ; and now do they thrust us out privily ? nay verily ; but let them come themselves and fetch us out .
text2: Go Paulo lueel , yan , Acik wo dui e kɔc niim , ke wo kene yiek niim gaak , ku yok Romai , ku acik wo cuat e aloocic ; ku dueerki wook jap biic ecueer enɔɔne ? Acie yen ; ne ke bɔ kekgup , bik wo bɛn bɛɛi bei .

text: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates : and they feared , when they heard that they were Romans .
text2: Na wen , ke cawiic e ke lɔ lek bany ke tɔŋ lɛk welke ; goki riɔɔc , te ci kek e piŋ nɔn ee kek Romai ;

text: And they came and besought them , and brought them out , and desired them to depart out of the city .
text2: agoki bɛn , bik ku laŋki keek ; ku biiki ke bei e aloocic , laŋki keek , yan , bik jal panydit .

text: And they went out of the prison , and entered into the house of Lydia and when they had seen the brethren , they comforted them , and departed .
text2: Goki jal e aloocic , lek ɣon e Ludia : na wen , acik wathii tiŋ , ke ke ritki piɔth , ku jɔki jal .

text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where was a synagogue of the Jews :
text2: Na wen , acik teek Ampipoli , ku Apolonia , ke ke jɔ bɛn Thethalonike , paan de yic luaŋ ee Judai lɔŋ thin :

text: And Paul , as his manner was , went in unto them , and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures ,
text2: go Paulo lɔ luɛɛk tenu keek , acit man ee yen cool e loi en en , ku jɔ wel guiir keke keek e akool ke thabath kadiak ne kacigɔɔr yiic ,

text: Opening and alleging , that Christ must needs have suffered , and risen again from the dead ; and that this Jesus , whom I preach unto you , is Christ .
text2: ee kaŋ weer thaar , ku nyuth keek apiɛth , yan , Kritho aci kaŋ dhil guum , ku be ro jɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic ; ku ye lueel aya , yan , Yecuye , raan guieer ɛn week kede , yen aye Kritho .

text: And some of them believed , and consorted with Paul and Silas ; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude , and of the chief women not a few .
text2: Go kɔc kɔk gam , ku matki e yi Paulo keke Thila ; ayi rem diit e Giriku rieu Nhialic , keke dieer dit dieer juec emaath .

text: But the Jews which believed not , moved with envy , took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort , and gathered a company , and set all the city on an uproar , and assaulted the house of Jason , and sought to bring them out to the people .
text2: Na wen , ke Judai reec gam , ke ke dɔm tiɛɛl , ku cɔlki roor rac ne kɔc ke thuukic , bik ke bɛn kony , goki rem kut , abik panydit tɔ pal awuɔɔu ebɛn , goki tɔŋ lɛɛr ɣon e Jathon , akɔɔrki Paulo keke Thila luɔi bi kek ke bɛɛi bei yinki ke kɔc .

text: And when they found them not , they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city , crying , These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also ;
text2: Na wen , acik ke yok aliu , ke ke thel Jathon keke wɛɛt kɔk leerki keek e bany niim , bany ceŋ panydit , ke ke cot , yan , Kɔcke kɔc ci piny yiek anuɔɔn e piny nɔm ebɛn acik bɛn ene aya ;

text: Whom Jason hath received : and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying that there is another king , one Jesus .
text2: ku aci Jathon ke gam ɣot : ku kɔcke kedhie ayek looŋ ke Kaithar rɛɛc gam ; ayek lueel , yan , de malik daŋ , cɔl Yecu .

text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city , when they heard these things .
text2: Goki kɔc tɔ diɛɛr ayi bany ceŋ panydit aya , te ci kek kake piŋ .

text: And when they had taken security of Jason , and of the other , they let them go .
text2: Na wen , ke ke nom weu juec tede Jathon ayi wɛɛt kɔk , ku jɔki ke pɔl .

text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea : who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews .
text2: Go wathii Paulo dap tɔ jel wakɔu keke Thila , lek Beroya : na wen , acik ɣeet , ke ke lɔ luaŋ ee Judai lɔŋ thin .

text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica , in that they received the word with all readiness of mind , and searched the scriptures daily , whether those things were so .
text2: Ku kɔcke ee kɔc ci ŋiec dhieeth awarki Judai nu Thethalonike , agoki jam dap piŋ ne piɔnmit , ku jɔki kacigɔɔr aa woi yiic e akoolnyiin kedhie , ke bik ŋic nɔn tɔuwe kaŋ aya .

text: Therefore many of them believed ; also of honourable women which were Greeks , and of men , not a few .
text2: Yen aa gɛme kɔc juec e keyiic ; ayi Giriki juec emaath , dieer dit ku roor .

text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea , they came thither also , and stirred up the people .
text2: Na wen , aci Judai nu Thethalonike e piŋ nɔn ci jam e Nhialic guiir ne Paulo e Beroya , ke ke lɔ etɛɛn aya , lek kɔc noon .

text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea : but Silas and Timotheus abode there still .
text2: Go wathii Paulo tɔ jel enɔnthiine cit ke lɔ e abapdit nɔm : ku dɔŋ Thila etɛɛn keke Timotheo .

text: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens : and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed , they departed .
text2: Go kɔc wen ruɛc Paulo agoki lɛɛr ɣeetki Athenai : na wen , aci Paulo ke thɔn , an , bik Thila ku Timotheo yɔɔk , yan , Banki wecok , ke we bɔ te nuo yɛn , ke ke jɔ jal .

text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens , his spirit was stirred in him , when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry .
text2: Ku te waan tiite Paulo keek e Athenai , ke jɔ piɔu diu nɔn ci en panydit tiŋ aci ro gam lam de yieth eliŋliŋ .

text: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews , and with the devout persons , and in the market daily with them that met with him .
text2: Go lɔ luaŋ ee Judai lɔŋ thin , le wel guiir keke Judai , ku kɔc kɔk rieu Nhialic , ku ye lɔ e thuukic e akoolnyiin kedhie le wel guiir keke kɔc ci yok etɛɛn .

text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans , and of the Stoicks , encountered him . And some said , What will this babbler say ? other some , He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods : because he preached unto them Jesus , and the resurrection .
text2: Ku ade kɔc pel niim , ke yi Epikureoi ku Thotoikoi , kɔc ci e gek . Go kɔc kɔk lueel , yan , Raan wooŋe bi ŋo lueel ? Ku lueel kɔk , yan , Acit ke guiir jam de yieth mɛɛn kucku : ne guiir ci Paulo keek guieer jam de Yecu , ku jon bi kɔc ro jɔt .

text: And they took him , and brought him unto Areopagus , saying , May we know what this new doctrine , whereof thou speakest , is ?
text2: Goki dɔm , ku leerki Areopagi , ku thiecki , yan , Duɛɛre wo tɔ ŋic weetduon guiir , weet ci piac bɛɛi , nɔn ee yen ŋo ?

text: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears : we would know therefore what these things mean .
text2: Yin e wo tɔ piŋ jam mɛɛn pei : wo de piɔth nɔn bi yin wo lɛk welke thaar .

text: ( For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else , but either to tell , or to hear some new thing . )
text2: ( Kɔc ke Athenai kedhie ku kamaan e tɔu etɛɛn acin luɔi daŋ yek looi , ee luɛl bi kek ka ci piac bɛɛi ya lueel tei , ku piŋ bi kek keek aa piŋ ) .

text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars ' hill , and said , Ye men of Athens , I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious .
text2: Go Paulo kɔɔc e Areopagoyic cil , ku lueel , yan , Wek roor ke Athenai , wek ca tiŋ nɔn aa wek kɔc rieu yieth alal ne kerieec ebɛn .

text: For as I passed by , and beheld your devotions , I found an altar with this inscription , TO THE UNKNOWN GOD . Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship , him declare I unto you .
text2: Waan tɛɛk ɛn kueer , yɛn e kaŋ tiŋ ka lamki , aguɔ yiŋ tok yok aya , yiŋ de lam , aci gaar kɔu wel , yan , KEDE NHIALIC KUCKU . Yen , Raan yak lam ke kuocki , yen a guieer week enɔɔne .

text: God that made the world and all things therein , seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth , dwelleth not in temples made with hands ;
text2: Nhialic , Raan e cak piny ku ka nu e yenɔm kedhie , luɔi ee yen Bɛnydiit e paannhial ku piny , acie reer e luek yiic , luek ci yik e kɔc cin ,

text: Neither is worshipped with men ' s hands , as though he needed any thing , seeing he giveth to all life , and breath , and all things ;
text2: ku acie kony e kɔc cin , cit nɔn dɛk en e kaŋ , ee yen e kɔc miɔɔc kedhie ne piir , ku wei , ku kaŋ kedhie ;

text: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth , and hath determined the times before appointed , and the bounds of their habitation ;
text2: ku yen e juoor tɔ dhieth ebɛn ne riɛm tok , abik piny ɣap nɔm ebɛn , ku ye keek gam runkɛn ci kɔn lueel ɣɔn thɛɛr , ku gɛm keek akɛɛth ke pinydɛn bi kek ɣap thin ;

text: That they should seek the Lord , if haply they might feel after him , and find him , though he be not far from every one of us :
text2: luɔi bi kek Bɛnydit aa kɔɔr , agoki piny ruany , nɔn de te bi kek e yok , ciɛk , an , cii mec tede wook wodhie :

text: For in him we live , and move , and have our being ; as certain also of your own poets have said , For we are also his offspring .
text2: yen a piir wok , ku yok cath , ku yok nu ne yen ; acit man e ke cii cieekkuon kɔk lueel , yan , Wok ee mithkɛn ci dhieeth ayadaŋ .

text: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God , we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold , or silver , or stone , graven by art and man ' s device .
text2: Ku luɔi ee wok mith ke Nhialic , ka cii piɛth luɔi dueer wok e lueel , yan , Nhialic acit man e adhaap , ku ateek , ku kuur , ke ye kɔc cueec eteet ku ne cap ee raan cak .

text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at ; but now commandeth all men every where to repent :
text2: Run ɣɔn kek aye run ke kuny kuce kɔc kaŋ , ago Nhialic lɔ lik tei ; ku enɔɔne e thɔn , an , bi kɔc kepiɔth puk kedhie e piny nɔm ebɛn :

text: Because he hath appointed a day , in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained ; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men , in that he hath raised him from the dead .
text2: luɔi ci en kool tok lueel , kool bi en loŋ de piny guiir e guieer piɛth ne raan ci tɔ ye bɛny e loŋ guiir ; ku aci kene tɔ ŋic kɔc kedhie , an , ee jam yic , ne jon ci en e jɔt bei e kɔc ci thou yiic .

text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some mocked : and others said , We will hear thee again of this matter .
text2: Na wen , acik jame piŋ , jam de jonerot e kɔc ci thou , ke jɔ kɔc kɔk geet ; ku lueel kɔk , yan , Kedu abuk bɛ piŋ ne kede ecooke .

text: So Paul departed from among them .
text2: Yen aye jal e jele Paulo e keyiic .

text: Howbeit certain men clave unto him , and believed : among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
text2: Ku ade kɔc toktook ci mat e yen , ku gamki : raan tok e keek acɔl Dionuthio , raan de Areopago , ku tiiŋ cɔl Damari , ku nu kɔc kɔk ayadaŋ .

text: After these things Paul departed from Athens , and came to Corinth ;
text2: Na wen , aci kake thok , ke jel e Athenai , bi Korintho .

text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , lately come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla ; ( because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome : ) and came unto them .
text2: Ku yok Judai tok etɛɛn cɔl Akula , raan ci dhieeth e Ponto , ku aa piɛc bɛn e Yitalia , keke Pirithikila tiiŋde , ne biak de loŋ cii Kulaudio lueel , yan , bi Judai jal e Roma kedhie : go bɛn tede keek ;

text: And because he was of the same craft , he abode with them , and wrought : for by their occupation they were tentmakers .
text2: ago reer ke keek , luɔi ee kek ateet kit , agoki ya luui etok ; ayek ateet e keemɔɔ cueec .

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks .
text2: Go wel aa guiir luaŋ e Nhialic e akool ke thabath kedhie , ke bi Judai tɔ gam welke , ayi Girikii .

text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia , Paul was pressed in the spirit , and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Na wen , aci Thila bɛn Makedonia keke Timotheo , ke Paulo jieth piɔu , go cok e guiir en Judai , yan , Yecu yen aye Kritho .

text: And when they opposed themselves , and blasphemed , he shook his raiment , and said unto them , Your blood be upon your own heads ; I am clean : from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles .
text2: Ku te ci kek ater cak ku lɛtki , ke Paulo teŋ lupɔde , ku jɔ keek yɔɔk , yan , E riɛmdun tɔu e weyieth ; yɛn iiu thin : ele enɔɔne , yɛn bi lɔ tede Juoor .

text: And he departed thence , and entered into a certain man ' s house , named Justus , one that worshipped God , whose house joined hard to the synagogue .
text2: Go jal etɛɛn , le ɣon e raan cɔl Juthuto , raan rieu Nhialic , thieeke ɣonde keke luaŋ e Nhialic .

text: And Crispus , the chief ruler of the synagogue , believed on the Lord with all his house ; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized .
text2: Ku Kirithipo , bɛny e luaŋ e Nhialic , aci Bɛnydit gam keke dhiende ebɛn ; ku gam Korinthoi juec ayadaŋ , te ci kek jam piŋ , agoke baptith .

text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision , Be not afraid , but speak , and hold not thy peace :
text2: Ku yook Bɛnydit Paulo wakɔu ke e nyuoth , yan , Du riɔc , ye wel guiir , du mim :

text: For I am with thee , and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee : for I have much people in this city .
text2: yɛn cath wo yin , ku acin raan bi ro yiek ater ke yin , bi yi nɔk : yɛn de kɔc juec e panydiiteyic .

text: And he continued there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
text2: Go reer etɛɛn e ruun tok ku pɛi kadhetem , ke ye jam e Nhialic guiir e keyiic .

text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia , the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul , and brought him to the judgment seat ,
text2: Na ɣɔn , nu Galio mudhiir e Akaya , ke Judai ke ke jɔt rot e piɔn tok lek tɔŋ yien Paulo , ku biiki te ye bany loŋ guiir thin ,

text: Saying , This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law .
text2: ku luelki , yan , Raane ee kɔc weŋ , an , bik Nhialic aa lam ne lam de ater keke loŋda .

text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth , Gallio said unto the Jews , If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness , O ye Jews , reason would that I should bear with you :
text2: Na wen , ke Paulo , yan , tueer ethok , ke Galio yook Judai , yan , Tee yen jam de luɔi rac ayi kerɛɛc cii raan looi ecueer , wek Judai , adi piɛth luɔi ban kedun piŋ :

text: But if it be a question of words and names , and of your law , look ye to it ; for I will be no judge of such matters .
text2: ku na enɔɔne , tee yen teer e wel tei , ku rin , ku loŋdun week , jaki woiyic week wapac ; yɛn cin piɔu luɔi ban ke cit ekene guiir .

text: And he drave them from the judgment seat .
text2: Go ke cieec ɣon ee loŋ guiir thin .

text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the chief ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment seat . And Gallio cared for none of those things .
text2: Go Girikii kedhie goki Thothene dɔm , yen aye bɛnydiit e luaŋ e Nhialic , ku duiki e ɣot thok ɣon ee loŋ guiir thin . Ku Galio aken yecin tuɛɛl thin , aa rɛɛr .

text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while , and then took his leave of the brethren , and sailed thence into Syria , and with him Priscilla and Aquila ; having shorn his head in Cenchrea : for he had a vow .
text2: Na wen , ke Paulo ŋoot ke rɛɛr etɛɛn e nin juec , na ɣɔn , ke tɔŋ wathii , ku jel le Thuria ne abel , ku cath Pirithikila ku Akula ne yen ; aci enom muut e Kenkurea : ne kede jam waan ci lɛk Nhialic .

text: And he came to Ephesus , and left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews .
text2: Go bɛn Epetho , ku nyieeŋ keek piny etɛɛn : na wen , ke yenguop ke lɔ luaŋ e Nhialic , le wel guiir keke Judai .

text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them , he consented not ;
text2: Goki lɔŋ , an , Yok e yi rɛɛr weke wook , go jai ;

text: But bade them farewell , saying , I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem : but I will return again unto you , if God will . And he sailed from Ephesus .
text2: go keek tɔɔŋ , ku lueel , yan , Ahith bɔ enɔɔne aba dhil lɔ looi Jeruthalem ; ku yɛn bi anɔm dɔk week tei , te ci Nhialic e lueel . Go jal e Epetho ke cath e abel .

text: And when he had landed at Caesarea , and gone up , and saluted the church , he went down to Antioch .
text2: Na wen , aci bɛn bei e abelic e Kaithareia , ke jɔ kanithɔ lɔ thieec , ku jɔ lɔ Antiokia .

text: And after he had spent some time there , he departed , and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order , strengthening all the disciples .
text2: Na wen , aci reer etɛɛn e akoolke , ke jɔ jal , le paan e Galatia kuanyic , ayi paan e Purugia , ke tɔ kɔcpiooce ril e gam kedhie .

text: And a certain Jew named Apollos , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man , and mighty in the scriptures , came to Ephesus .
text2: Na wen , ke Judai tok bɔ Epetho , cɔl Apolo , ee raan ci dhieeth e Alekandaria , raan ŋic wel guiir , ku ŋic kacigɔɔr alal .

text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in the spirit , he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord , knowing only the baptism of John .
text2: Monye aci weet ne kueer e Bɛnydit ; ku ye raan lethic , go kɔc guieer ku weet keek ne ka ke Bɛnydit ke cin cook wɛɛc , ku ŋoot ke ŋic baptinh e Jɔn tei .

text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue : whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard , they took him unto them , and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly .
text2: Go jam gɔl luaŋ e Nhialic ke ye nyin riɛl : na wen , aci Akula keke Pirithikila e piŋ , ke leerki ɣonden , ku weetki apiɛth ne kueer e Nhialic .

text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia , the brethren wrote , exhorting the disciples to receive him : who , when he was come , helped them much which had believed through grace :
text2: Na wen , aci piɔu dɛ luɔi bi en teek le Akaya , ke wathii ke ke jɔ awarek gaar kɔcpiooce etɛɛn , laŋki keek , yan , bik loor : ku te ci en bɛn etɛɛn , ke jɔ kɔc ci gam ne dhueeŋ de Nhialic piɔu kony alal :

text: For he mightily convinced the Jews , and that publickly , shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ .
text2: aa ye Judai tiaam e wel aret e kɔc niim , ne nyuuth ee yen keek nyuooth egɔk ne kacigɔɔr , yan , Yecu yen aye Kritho .

text: And it came to pass , that , while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus : and finding certain disciples ,
text2: Na wen , te ŋoot Apolo ke tɔu e Korintho , ke Paulo bɔ Epetho , te ci en bɛi rɛɛr caath yiic , ku yok kɔc tokiook etɛɛn kɔcpiooce :

text: He said unto them , Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed ? And they said unto him , We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost .
text2: go ke thieec , yan , Cak Weidit Ɣer noom waan gam wek ? Goki yɔɔk , yan , Ei ; ciɛk , an , de Weidit Ɣer nu akenku piŋ ayadaŋ .

text: And he said unto them , Unto what then were ye baptized ? And they said , Unto John ' s baptism .
text2: Go ke thieec , yan , Ku ye baptinh ŋo ci we baptith ? Goki lueel , yan , Ee baptinh e Jɔn .

text: Then said Paul , John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance , saying unto the people , that they should believe on him which should come after him , that is , on Christ Jesus .
text2: Go Paulo lueel , yan , Jɔn aa ye kɔc baptith eyic ne baptinh de puŋdepiɔu , ku ye kɔc yɔɔk , yan , bik raan gam raan bɔ e yecok , yen aye Kritho Yecu .

text: When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Na wen , acik kene piŋ , ke ke baptith ne rin ke Bɛnydit Yecu .

text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them , the Holy Ghost came on them ; and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
text2: Ku te ci Paulo yecin thany e kegup , ke Weidit Ɣer ke ke bɔ e kegup ; agoki jam gɔl ne thook lei , ku guiirki wel ke Nhialic .

text: And all the men were about twelve .
text2: Kuen e kɔcke acit thieer ku rou kedhie .

text: And he went into the synagogue , and spake boldly for the space of three months , disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God .
text2: Go Paulo lɔ luaŋ e Nhialic , ku ye wel guiir ke ye nyin riɛl e pɛi kadiak , aa ye kaŋ wɛɛr kɔc , ku weet keek apiɛth ne kede ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic .

text: But when divers were hardened , and believed not , but spake evil of that way before the multitude , he departed from them , and separated the disciples , disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus .
text2: Na wen , aci kɔc kɔk niim riɛl , ke ke reec gam , ku luelki kerac ne Kueere e kut e kɔc niim , go Paulo jal e keyiic , ku tɛɛu kɔcpiooce pei , go jam wɛɛr kɔc e akooinyiin kedhie luaŋ de guieer e wel , luaŋ de raan cɔl Turano .

text: And this continued by the space of two years ; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
text2: Ee kene looi e run kaarou ; ago kɔc rɛɛr e Athia ebɛn goki jam e Bɛnydit piŋ , Judai ayi Giriku .

text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul :
text2: Go Nhialic gook tɔ loi ne cin e Paulo , gook bi kɔc ke gai :

text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out of them .
text2: aɣɔl lupɔɔ ke abiɔɔr ayi lupɔɔ ee cieŋ , acike bɛɛi bei e yeguop , leereke tede kɔc tok gup , go juai jal e kegup , ku bɔ jɔɔk rac bei e kegup ayadaŋ .

text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews , exorcists , took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus , saying , We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth .
text2: Ku ade kɔc arieeu , kɔc ke Judai , kɔc e jɔɔk rac cieec . Na wen , ke kɔcke ke ke ye rin ke Yecu cɔɔl e kɔc niim kɔc de gup jɔɔk rac , ayek lueel , yan , Wek yookku ne Yecu , raan guiire Paulo rinke .

text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva , a Jew , and chief of the priests , which did so .
text2: Ade kɔc kadherou kɔc e kene looi , kek aye wɛɛt ke raan tok cɔl Thekewa , ee Judai , ku ye bɛnydiit e ka ke Nhialic .

text: And the evil spirit answered and said , Jesus I know , and Paul I know ; but who are ye ?
text2: Go jɔŋ rac bɛɛr , yan , Yecu aŋiɛc , ku ŋiɛc Paulo , ku week , yak yiŋa ?

text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them , and overcame them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
text2: Na wen , ke raan de guop jɔŋ rac kɛɛc e keyiic , wit keek , ago ke tiaam , adhil kek kat e ɣone ke ke cin kɔɔth lupɔɔ , ku cike dui alal .

text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus ; and fear fell on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
text2: Go kɔc tɔu e Epetho kedhie , Judai ayi Girikii , agoki kake piŋ ; goki piɔth pau kedhie , go rin ke Bɛnydit Yecu aa leec .

text: And many that believed came , and confessed , and shewed their deeds .
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc ci gam ke ke bɔ , ku gamki ca wooc , luelki karɛc cik looi .

text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together , and burned them before all men : and they counted the price of them , and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver .
text2: Go kɔc juec kɔc e thueth goki awareekken bɛɛi tetok , ku jɔki ke nyop e kɔc niim kedhie : goki ɣooc de awareek kueen , ku yokki agum kadhieny de jinii .

text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed .
text2: Go jam de Benydit lɔ ke ŋuak rot aya , ku tiem aret .

text: After these things were ended , Paul purposed in the spirit , when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , After I have been there , I must also see Rome .
text2: Na wen , aci kake thok , ke lueel Paulo e yepiɔu , an , bi lɔ Jeruthalem , te ci en teek Makedonia ku Akaya , alueel , yan , Na elemiak , te can lɔ tɛɛn , ke yɛn bi Roma dhil tiŋ aya .

text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him , Timotheus and Erastus ; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season .
text2: Go kɔc kaarou tuɔɔc Makedonia e kɔc yiic kɔc e yen kony , Timotheo keke Erathato ; ku dɔŋ guop Athia e akoolke .

text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way .
text2: Ku e akoolke gup , anuɔɔn dit aci rot cak ne kede Kueere .

text: For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , which made silver shrines for Diana , brought no small gain unto the craftsmen ;
text2: Ade raan cɔl Demeturio , aten e ateek thɔɔth , raan e kathii yeke Diana lam cueec e ateek , ku ye ateet kɔk tɔ yok weu juec ;

text: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation , and said , Sirs , ye know that by this craft we have our wealth .
text2: na wen , ke cɔl ateet kedhie , keke ateet ke luɔi cit ekene , ku yook keek , yan , Week wathii , thathe aŋiɛcki nɔn ee yen e weukuɔ bɛɛi , weu bi wok ke piir .

text: Moreover ye see and hear , that not alone at Ephesus , but almost throughout all Asia , this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people , saying that they be no gods , which are made with hands :
text2: Ku tieŋki aya ku piɛŋki , nɔn ci Paulo kɔc juec weŋ ku yɛl keek wei , acie Epetho etok , ee piny de Athia nɔm ebɛn , aye keek yɔɔk , yan , Ka ye cueec e kɔc cin , aciki e Nhialic .

text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought ; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised , and her magnificence should be destroyed , whom all Asia and the world worshippeth .
text2: Ku enɔɔne riɔɔc anu , nɔn bi atenda tɔ cin naamde ; ku acie en etok , riɔɔc anu aya , luɔi bi luaŋdit e Diana biɔɔn , tɔ cin naamde , yen gok diit e yanh e tik , ago dhueeŋdɛn dit riɔɔk ebɛn , ku yen aye lam ne piny de Athia ebɛn , aɣet piny nɔm ebɛn .

text: And when they heard these sayings , they were full of wrath , and cried out , saying , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Na wen , acik jame piŋ , ke ke goth alal , ku jɔki coot , yan , Diana de Epetho yen adit .

text: And the whole city was filled with confusion : and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia , Paul ' s companions in travel , they rushed with one accord into the theatre .
text2: Go panydit a wenwen ebɛn : goki Gayo dɔm keke Aritharko , kɔc ke Makedonia , kɔc e cath e Paulo , ku lek e riaaŋditic ke ke riŋ e piɔn tok , riaaŋ wen ee kɔc gueer thin .

text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people , the disciples suffered him not .
text2: Na wen , ke Paulo de piɔu luɔi bi en lɔ thin te nu kɔc , ku jɔ peen e kɔcpiooce .

text: And certain of the chief of Asia , which were his friends , sent unto him , desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre .
text2: Go kɔc kɔk ne kɔc dit ke Athia , kɔc maath e Paulo , goki thɔn ku laŋki , yan , Du ro lɔ kuɔɔn e riaaŋditic .

text: Some therefore cried one thing , and some another : for the assembly was confused ; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together .
text2: Ku kɔc aake ye coot , kɔk ayek kene lueel , ku luel kɔk kene : kɔc ci gueer acike liaap niim kedhie , tedit e kɔc akucki ke e gueer kek .

text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude , the Jews putting him forward . And Alexander beckoned with the hand , and would have made his defence unto the people .
text2: Goki Alekandaro tuɛɛl e kut e kɔc niim , ee Judai kek aa tɛɛu en tueŋ . Go Alekandaro kɔc nieu e yecin , akɔɔr luɔi bi en kede lueel e kut e kɔc niim .

text: But when they knew that he was a Jew , all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Na wen , acik e ŋic nɔn ee yen Judai , ke ke cot alal ne rol tok , ku coolki e cɔt e thaar kaarou , luelki , yan , Diana de Epetho yen adit .

text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people , he said , Ye men of Ephesus , what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana , and of the image which fell down from Jupiter ?
text2: Na wen , ke katip de panydit ke jɔ kut e kɔc tɔ lɔ diu , ku jɔ lueel , yan , Week , kɔc ke Epetho , de raan kuc panydit Epetho , nɔn ee yen tin e luaŋ de Diana , gok de yanh e tik , ku nɔn ee yen tin e ke ci loony piny ne Dhio ?

text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against , ye ought to be quiet , and to do nothing rashly .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , luɔi cin en raan dueer kake jɔɔny , aŋuan te pal wek wepiɔth piny , ku duoki kaŋ e looi eruprup .

text: For ye have brought hither these men , which are neither robbers of churches , nor yet blasphemers of your goddess .
text2: Kɔcke acak keek bɛɛi etene , kɔc ken ka nu e luek yiic kual luek ke lam , ku kenki yanhduon e tik lat aya .

text: Wherefore if Demetrius , and the craftsmen which are with him , have a matter against any man , the law is open , and there are deputies : let them implead one another .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , te de Demeturio ke bi en goony keke raan , ayi ateet cath ne yen , te de kek ke bi kek goony , makamɔɔ ayeke taau piny , ku nu bany ke luk : tɔki keek gɔɔny rot .

text: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters , it shall be determined in a lawful assembly .
text2: Ku na thieec wek ne kɔk , abi dhil lueel e makamɔyic ekooldɛn e ye taau piny .

text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day ' s uproar , there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse .
text2: Wok riɔc enɔɔne , e cɔt bi wo cɔɔl ne kede anuɔɔn de akoole , acin ke e gueer e kɔc : ku acin ke dueerku lueel , yan , Ke e gueer wok , ki .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he dismissed the assembly .
text2: Na wen , aci kake lueel , ke tɔ kɔc ci gueer jel .

text: And after the uproar was ceased , Paul called unto him the disciples , and embraced them , and departed for to go into Macedonia .
text2: Na wen , aci anuɔɔn jɔ thok , ke Paulo cɔl kɔcpiooce , ku jɔ ke riit piɔth ; na wen , ke ke tɛɛŋ , ku jel le Makedonia .

text: And when he had gone over those parts , and had given them much exhortation , he came into Greece ,
text2: Ku te ci en pinye caathic , go kɔcpiooce riit piɔth ne wel juec , ke jɔ bɛn paan e Giriki .

text: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
text2: Ku jɔ reer etɛɛn e pɛi kadiak ; na wen , ke Judai e ke mat kethook , an , bik nɔk , waan , an , le Thuria ne abel , go Paulo nyueth guop , ago piɔu dɛ luɔi bi en enɔm pɔk cieen e kueer tek Makedonia .

text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea ; and of the Thessalonians , Aristarchus and Secundus ; and Gaius of Derbe , and Timotheus ; and of Asia , Tychicus and Trophimus .
text2: Go ruac e raan e Beroya cɔl Thopataro , wen e Puro , aɣeet kek Athia ; ayi Aritharko ku Thekando , kɔc ke Thethalonike , ayi Gayo de Derbe , ku Timotheo ; ku Tukiko keke Toropimo , kɔc ke Athia ; kɔc e ruɛc en , ka .

text: These going before tarried for us at Troas .
text2: Kɔcke acik lɔ tueŋ lek wo tiit Toroa .

text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread , and came unto them to Troas in five days ; where we abode seven days .
text2: Ku wook , wo e jel Pilipoi e abel , te ci akool ke kuin kene tup thok , goku bɛn te nu kek e Torao e nin kadhic , ku rɛɛrku etɛɛn e nin kadherou .

text: And upon the first day of the week , when the disciples came together to break bread , Paul preached unto them , ready to depart on the morrow ; and continued his speech until midnight .
text2: Na wen , ekool toŋ wen ee akool dherou , te ci kɔcpiooce gueer bik kuin bɛn wokic , ke ke jɔ Paulo guieer wel , akɔɔr jal bi en jal miak ; go cool e jam adiite piny .

text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber , where they were gathered together .
text2: Ku ade mɛc juec mɛc ke alath , ɣon ci kek gueer thin , ee ɣon nu nhial .

text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus , being fallen into a deep sleep : and as Paul was long preaching , he sunk down with sleep , and fell down from the third loft , and was taken up dead .
text2: Ku rɛɛr dhuŋ toŋ cɔl Yutuko aweeruyin , ke ye thiai ke nin : na wen , aci Paulo tedit guiir , ke jɔ thiai ke nhi , go loony piny ɣon nhial wen ee ɣoot diak , go jɔt ke ye thou .

text: And Paul went down , and fell on him , and embracing him said , Trouble not yourselves ; for his life is in him .
text2: Na wen , ke Paulo lɔ piny , ku cuɛt rot e yekɔu , go kuak e yecin , ku jɔ lueel , yan , Duoki diɛɛr ; weike anuki e yeguop .

text: When he therefore was come up again , and had broken bread , and eaten , and talked a long while , even till break of day , so he departed .
text2: Go bɛ lɔ nhial , le kuin wokic , ku ciɛm ; ku te ci kek abarɔ bɛ mat aru piny , ke jɔ jal .

text: And they brought the young man alive , and were not a little comforted .
text2: Goki dhuŋ wen bɛɛi ke piir , ku jɔke muk piɔth aret .

text: And we went before to ship , and sailed unto Assos , there intending to take in Paul : for so had he appointed , minding himself to go afoot .
text2: Ku wook , wok aa kɔn lɔ tueŋ te nu abel , ku jɔku jal e abel lok Atho , wo de piɔth luɔi bi wo Paulo taau e abelic etɛɛn ; cit man ci yen e kɔn lueel , akɔɔr luɔi bi en teek biic yetok .

text: And when he met with us at Assos , we took him in , and came to Mitylene .
text2: Na wen , acuk jɔ rɔm e Atho , agoku noom , tɛɛuku e abeiic , ku jɔku bɛn Mitulene .

text: And we sailed thence , and came the next day over against Chios ; and the next day we arrived at Samos , and tarried at Trogyllium ; and the next day we came to Miletus .
text2: Na wen , ke wok jel etɛɛn e abel , na ɣɔnmiak , ke wo jɔ ɣet e Kio nɔm ; na ɣɔnmiak , ke wo jɔ ɣet Thamo , agoku cool Terogilium ; na ɣɔnmiak , ke wo jɔ ɣet Mileto .

text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus , because he would not spend the time in Asia : for he hasted , if it were possible for him , to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost .
text2: Paulo aa de piɔu luɔi bi en Epetho winy thok e abel , acin piɔu luɔi bi en ceŋ Athia ; aa cath alal , nɔn de te bi en nu Jeruthalem ekool e Thierdhic .

text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus , and called the elders of the church .
text2: Go kɔc tooc e Mileto lek Epetho , lek roordit ke kanithɔ cɔɔl .

text: And when they were come to him , he said unto them , Ye know , from the first day that I came into Asia , after what manner I have been with you at all seasons ,
text2: Na wen , acik bɛn te nu yen , ke ke yook , yan , Week , wek ŋic reer aa yɛn reer e weyiic ecaŋɣɔn gɔl ekool tueŋ e kan ɛn bɛn Athia aɣet ci enɔɔne .

text: Serving the Lord with all humility of mind , and with many tears , and temptations , which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews :
text2: Yɛn ee ka ke Bɛnydit looi ne kuur aa yɛn rot kuɔɔr piny , ku ne dhien dit aa yɛn dhiau , ku ne them dit ee ya them ne baŋ de man cii Judai kethook mat , an , bik a nɔk :

text: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you , but have shewed you , and have taught you publickly , and from house to house ,
text2: ku ŋiɛcki aya nɔn cin en jam ca pɛn week , jam dueer we muk ; yɛn aa ye week guieer wel ku wɛɛt week e kɔc niim ayi ɣoot yiic ,

text: Testifying both to the Jews , and also to the Greeks , repentance toward God , and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: yɛn aa ye ya caatɔ lɛk Judai ayi Girikii aya puŋ bi kek kepiɔth pɔk Nhialic , ku gam bi kek Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho gam .

text: And now , behold , I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem , not knowing the things that shall befall me there :
text2: Ku enɔɔne , yɛn lɔ Jeruthalem , ke yɛn ci mac ne weiki , ka ba yok etɛɛn akuoc ke :

text: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city , saying that bonds and afflictions abide me .
text2: Weidit Ɣer tei ayek aa caatɔ , lek ɛn e pɛɛnydit yiic ebɛn , yan , Joth ku ketuc ba guum atitki yɛn etɛɛn .

text: But none of these things move me , neither count I my life dear unto myself , so that I might finish my course with joy , and the ministry , which I have received of the Lord Jesus , to testify the gospel of the grace of God .
text2: Ku acin ke e ya tɔ dit e kake yiic , acakaa piirdi aca dueer theek , luɔi ban luɔidi thol e miɛtepiɔu , ku thɔl luɔi cii Bɛnydit Yecu taau e yacin , yan , ban aa caatɔ , ba welpiɛth aa guiir , welpiɛth ke dhueeŋ de Nhialic piɔu .

text: And now , behold , I know that ye all , among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God , shall see my face no more .
text2: Ku tieŋki , enɔɔne , wek kɔc aa yɛn ke cath e weyiic , ke ya guiir ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic , aŋiɛc nɔn ca wek a bi bɛ tiŋ nyin anandun wedhie .

text: Wherefore I take you to record this day , that I am pure from the blood of all men .
text2: Yɛn ee guɔ aa caatɔ e weniim ekoole , yan , Riɛm e raan ebɛn aliu e yayeth .

text: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God .
text2: Luɔi can week lɛk loŋ de Nhialic ebɛn , acin ke ca mɔny week .

text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves , and to all the flock , over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers , to feed the church of God , which he hath purchased with his own blood .
text2: Yen tieŋ wek rot , ku tiɛetki luny de thok ebɛn , luny cii Weidit Ɣer taau e wecin abak tht , bak kanithɔ de Nhialic aa caam , kanithɔ ci ɣɔɔc e riɛmde guop .

text: For I know this , that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you , not sparing the flock .
text2: Aŋiɛc nɔn bi aŋuooth rac lɔɔk bɛn e weyiic , te can jal , aŋuooth cii luny bi pɔl ; ku kɔc kɔk abik rot jɔt e weyiic gup aya , kɔc bi jam rac lueel , lek kɔcpiooce thɛl e kecok .

text: Therefore watch , and remember , that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears .
text2: Yen tiɛɛt wek rot , ku takki weniim nɔn kɛn ɛn weet pɔl weet aa yɛn week wɛɛt wedhie e run kadiak , wɛɛrwakɔu ku akol , ke ya ye dhiau e piu ke yɛnnyin .

text: And now , brethren , I commend you to God , and to the word of his grace , which is able to build you up , and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , wathii , wek taau e Nhialic cin , ayi jam de dhueeŋ de yenpiɔu , jam dueer week kueet , agoki week gam biakduon bak lɔɔk lak e kɔc ɣerpiɔth yiic kedhie .

text: I have coveted no man ' s silver , or gold , or apparel .
text2: Acin ateek ke raan daŋ ca woi e yapiɔu , ayi adhaap ayi lupɔde aya .

text: Yea , ye yourselves know , that these hands have ministered unto my necessities , and to them that were with me .
text2: Week wegup aŋiɛcki , nɔn ee cinkienke kek aa muk ɛn , ayi kɔc waan cath ne yɛn aya .

text: I have shewed you all things , how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak , and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , how he said , It is more blessed to give than to receive .
text2: We ca nyuoth kerieec ebɛn , luɔi ba wek aa luui aya , aguɔki kɔc kuany nyiin dhil aa muk , ku yak weniim tak ne wel ke Bɛnydit Yecu , waan lueel en en , yan , Raan yin raan daŋ kaŋ , yen aye thieei awar raan e yine kaŋ .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he kneeled down , and prayed with them all .
text2: Na wen , aci kake lueel , ke jɔ emiɔl tuk , ku jɔ lɔŋ ke keek etok kedhie .

text: And they all wept sore , and fell on Paul ' s neck , and kissed him ,
text2: Goki dhiau aret kedhie , ku kuakki Paulo yeth , ku cimki ,

text: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake , that they should see his face no more . And they accompanied him unto the ship .
text2: ke ke dhiau e dhien dit alal , ne jam wen ci lueel , yan , ciki bi bɛ tiŋ nyin ananden . Goki ruac e abel nɔm .

text: And it came to pass , that after we were gotten from them , and had launched , we came with a straight course unto Coos , and the day following unto Rhodes , and from thence unto Patara :
text2: Na wen , acuk pɔk wo keek , ke abel jɔ yup , ku jɔku jal , lok kueer lɔ citic ɣetku Koth , na ɣɔnmiak ke wo jɔ bɛn Roda , ku jelku etɛɛn lok Patara .

text: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia , we went aboard , and set forth .
text2: Agoku abel lɔ Poiniki yok , ku jɔku lɔ thin , jelku .

text: Now when we had discovered Cyprus , we left it on the left hand , and sailed into Syria , and landed at Tyre : for there the ship was to unlade her burden .
text2: Na wen , acuk Kupurio tiŋ nɔm , goku nyaaŋ piny e baŋ cam , ku jɔku lɔ Thuria , goku bɛn bei e Turo , ka ɣɛɛc abel ayeke bɛɛi bei etɛɛn .

text: And finding disciples , we tarried there seven days : who said to Paul through the Spirit , that he should not go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Na wen , acuk kɔcpiooce yok etɛɛn , ke wo jɔ reer etɛɛn e nin kadherou : go kɔcke Paulo yɔɔk ne Weidit Ɣer , an , cii Jeruthalem bi kacic .

text: And when we had accomplished those days , we departed and went our way ; and they all brought us on our way , with wives and children , till we were out of the city : and we kneeled down on the shore , and prayed .
text2: Na wen , acuk akoolke lɛɛr , ke wo jɔ jal lok e kueerda ; goki wo ruac kedhie , keke dieerken ku mithken , abuk ɣet e panydit kec : goku womiɔl tuk e abapdit yɔu , ku lɛŋku ;

text: And when we had taken our leave one of another , we took ship ; and they returned home again .
text2: na wen , acuk rot tɔɔŋ , ke wo jɔ lɔ e abelic , ku dhunyki keniim bei .

text: And when we had finished our course from Tyre , we came to Ptolemais , and saluted the brethren , and abode with them one day .
text2: Ku wook , te ci wok jal e Turo , ɣetku Potolemai , ke cathdan e abeiic e jɔ thok ; goku wathii thieec etɛɛn , ku jɔku reer e keek ekool tok .

text: And the next day we that were of Paul ' s company departed , and came unto Caesarea : and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist , which was one of the seven ; and abode with him .
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , ke wo jɔ jal wo kɔc wen cath e Paulo , joku bɛn Kaidhareia ; goku lɔ ɣon e Pilip , raan ŋic welpiɛth guiir , ku ye raan toŋ e kɔc kadherou yiic , goku reer e yen .

text: And the same man had four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy .
text2: Raane ade nyiirke kaŋuan , dhueec kene thiaak , dhueec e wel guiir .

text: And as we tarried there many days , there came down from Judaea a certain prophet , named Agabus .
text2: Na wen , atɔuku etɛɛn e akool juec , ke raan bɔ piny Judaya , ke ye nebi , rinke acɔlke Agabo .

text: And when he was come unto us , he took Paul ' s girdle , and bound his own hands and feet , and said , Thus saith the Holy Ghost , So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle , and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles .
text2: Na wen , ke bɔ te nu wok , bi ku noom diion wen ee Paulo eyic duut , ku duut rot , cin ku cok , ku jɔ lueel , yan , Ne Weidit Ɣer aleyɔɔ , yan , Raan de yethione abii Judai nu Jeruthalem duut aya , ku jɔki yien Juoor .

text: And when we heard these things , both we , and they of that place , besought him not to go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Na wen , acuk kake piŋ , ke wook ayi wathii nu etɛɛn ke jɔku lɔŋ , an , Du lɔ Jeruthalem .

text: Then Paul answered , What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart ? for I am ready not to be bound only , but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Go Paulo bɛɛr , an , Eeŋo luɔɔiki wakya , abak a tɔ cuan piɔu ne dhiendun ? Acie many mɛce ya e Jeruthalem en gam etok , ayi thuɔɔu aca gam aya , ne baŋ de rin ke Bɛnydit Yecu .

text: And when he would not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , The will of the Lord be done .
text2: Na wen , areec keda gam , ke wo jɔ jam pɔl , ku luelku , yan , Abi looi tei ne kede piɔn e Bɛnydit .

text: And after those days we took up our carriages , and went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Na wen , aci akoolke wan , ke wo dut weukuɔ , ku jɔku lɔ Jeruthalem .

text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea , and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus , an old disciple , with whom we should lodge .
text2: Ku wo ruɛce e kɔc kɔk e kɔcpiooce nu Kaidhareia , ku aciɛthki ne raan cɔl Manathon , mony e bɔ Kupurio , ee raan e kɔn e piɔɔc thɛɛr , ku ye raan bi wok reer ɣonde .

text: And when we were come to Jerusalem , the brethren received us gladly .
text2: Na wen , acuk ɣet Jeruthalem , ke wo loor wathii ne piɔnmit .

text: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James ; and all the elders were present .
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , ke Paulo lɔ ke wook etok tede Jakop ; ku nu roordit kedhie ne yen etok .

text: And when he had saluted them , he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry .
text2: Na wen , aci ke thieec , ke ke guiir kaŋ cooke ku cooke , ka cii Nhialic looi e Juoor yiic ne luɔide .

text: And when they heard it , they glorified the Lord , and said unto him , Thou seest , brother , how many thousands of Jews there are which believe ; and they are all zealous of the law :
text2: Na wen , acik e piŋ , ke ke jɔ Nhialic lɛc nɔm , ku yookki , yan , Kɛne tiŋ enɔɔne , mɛnhwaada , kut diit e Judai ci gam , nɔn juec kek alal ; ku nɔn leth kek yiic e baŋ de loŋ kedhie :

text: And they are informed of thee , that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses , saying that they ought not to circumcise their children , neither to walk after the customs .
text2: ku acik kedu piŋ nɔn weet yin Judai nu e Juoor yiic ebɛn , yan , bik Mothe pɔl , ku nɔn lek yin keek , yan , ciki mithken bi dhil aa cueel , ku ciki ciɛɛŋ thɛɛr e kuanyic .

text: What is it therefore ? the multitude must needs come together : for they will hear that thou art come .
text2: Eeŋo buk jɔ looi ? kut e kɔc abik dhil gueer ; abik dhil piŋ nɔn ci yin bɛn .

text: Do therefore this that we say to thee : We have four men which have a vow on them ;
text2: Yen looi yin ke lekku yin : Wo de roor kaŋuan etene , roor de jam cik lɛk Nhialic aŋoot e keyieth ;

text: Them take , and purify thyself with them , and be at charges with them , that they may shave their heads : and all may know that those things , whereof they were informed concerning thee , are nothing ; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly , and keepest the law .
text2: mate ro keek , wak yiguop aba guop piath we keek , ku game keek weu bi kek keniim muut : yen abi kɔc e ŋic kedhie nɔn ee yen lueth yen jam cik piŋ ne kedu ; ku bik ŋic nɔn reer yin e reer piɛth , ku nɔn dot yin loŋ e muk .

text: As touching the Gentiles which believe , we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing , save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols , and from blood , and from strangled , and from fornication .
text2: Ku na Juoor ci gam , acuk ke gaar loŋ cuk thol e guieer , yan , acin ke bik aa looi ke cit ekene , ee cokke kapac , yan , bik rot aa tiit ne ka ci kɔn yien yieth , ku riɛm , ku ka ci dec , ku dhoom .

text: Then Paul took the men , and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple , to signify the accomplishment of the days of purifcation , until that an offering should be offered for every one of them .
text2: Go Paulo ro mat e roorke ; na ɣɔnmiak , aci yeguop waak abi guop a wic ke keek etok , ke jɔ lɔ luaŋdiit e Nhialic le lɛk kɔc thok ci akool e wɛk e gup thok , ku tɔu etɛɛn , aɣet te bi kedaŋ gam Nhialic ne biakden kedhie .

text: And when the seven days were almost ended , the Jews which were of Asia , when they saw him in the temple , stirred up all the people , and laid hands on him ,
text2: Na wen , aci akool kadherou thiɔk e thok , ke Judai e bɔ piny de Athia , te ci kek Paulo tiŋ e luaŋditic , ke ke guet kut e kɔc niim kedhie ku jɔki dɔm ,

text: Crying out , Men of Israel , help : This is the man , that teacheth all men every where against the people , and the law , and this place : and further brought Greeks also into the temple , and hath polluted this holy place .
text2: ku cotki , yan , Week , roor ke Yithiael , kuɔnyki wook , kene ee raan e kɔc wɛɛt e jam de ater ke jurda , ku loŋ , ku luaŋe , e piny nɔm ebɛn : ku daŋ aya , aci Girikii bɛɛi e luaŋdit e Nhialicic , go teɣeere tɔ nhiany .

text: ( For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian , whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple . )
text2: Aake ci Toropimo kɔn tiŋ waan keke Paulo e panyditic , yen aye raan e Epetho , goki lueel , an , ci Paulo yien bɛɛi e luaŋditic .

text: And all the city was moved , and the people ran together : and they took Paul , and drew him out of the temple : and forthwith the doors were shut .
text2: Go panydit nuɔɔn ebɛn ku jɔ kɔc bɛn e ke riŋ etok : goki Paulo dɔm , ku thelki biic luaŋdit e Nhialic : ku dap thok ke luaŋdit guur .

text: And as they went about to kill him , tidings came unto the chief captain of the band , that all Jerusalem was in an uproar .
text2: Na wen , akɔɔrki nɔn bi kek Paulo nɔk , ke jam bɔ tede bɛnydit e rem de alathkeer , yan , ci Jeruthalem nuɔɔn ebɛn .

text: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions , and ran down unto them : and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers , they left beating of Paul .
text2: Go alathkeer dap cɔɔl enɔnthiine , keke banyken , ku dap kat ke lɔ te nu kek : na wen , acik bɛnydit tiŋ keke alathkeer , ke ke jɔ Paulo pɔl e dui .

text: Then the chief captain came near , and took him , and commanded him to be bound with two chains ; and demanded who he was , and what he had done .
text2: Go bɛnydit alathker lɔ te nu yen , le ku dɔm , ku tɔ rek e joth kaarou ; go thieec , an , Ee yin ŋa ? eeŋo ci looi ?

text: And some cried one thing , some another , among the multitude : and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult , he commanded him to be carried into the castle .
text2: Go kɔk coot luelki cooke , ku cot kɔk luelki cooke , ne kut e kɔc yiic : na wen , te cin en te dueer en kedaŋ ŋic egɔk , ne biak de anuɔɔn , ke yook , an , bi lɛɛr e aloocic .

text: And when he came upon the stairs , so it was , that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people .
text2: Na wen , aci ɣet te ye kɔc lɔ nhial , ke dhile ɣaac alathkeer ne jieep jieepe yen e kɔc ;

text: For the multitude of the people followed after , crying , Away with him .
text2: acii kut e kɔc biɔɔth cok , ke ke cot , yan , Eeŋo ca wek eraane nyiɛɛi ?

text: And as Paul was to be led into the castle , he said unto the chief captain , May I speak unto thee ? Who said , Canst thou speak Greek ?
text2: Na wen , an , leere yen e aloocditic , ke Paulo thiec bɛnydit alathker , an , Dueerku kaŋ lueel woke yin ? Go , an , Ŋic thoŋ e Giriki ?

text: Art not thou that Egyptian , which before these days madest an uproar , and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers ?
text2: Ci ye mony e Ripe , raan akɔlɔn cak anuɔɔn , raan waan leer agum kaŋuan e kɔc e jɔɔric , kek aye luuc e kɔc nɔk , ci ye yen ?
