text: But Paul said , I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , a citizen of no mean city : and , I beseech thee , suffer me to speak unto the people .
text2: Go Paulo bɛɛr , yan , Yɛn ee Judai nɔm , raan e bɔ Tartho de Kilikia , panydit ba yɛn thin acie pany youyou : ku yin laŋ , yan , Pal ɛn ajam wo kɔc .

text: And when he had given him licence , Paul stood on the stairs , and beckoned with the hand unto the people . And when there was made a great silence , he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue , saying ,
text2: Go gam , go Paulo kɔɔc te ye kɔc lɔ nhial , ku nieu kɔc e yecin . Na wen , aci kɔc lɔ diu alal , ke jɔ jam ke keek ne thoŋ de Eberuu , lueel , yan ,

text: Men , brethren , and fathers , hear ye my defence which I make now unto you .
text2: Week , wɛɛtkewaar ku warkuɔ , piɛŋki kedien luɛɛl e weniim enɔɔne .

text: ( And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them , they kept the more silence : and he saith , )
text2: Na wen , acik e piŋ nɔn jiɛɛm en ke keek ne thoŋ de Eberuu , ke ke lɔ lik alaldiite : go lueel , yan ,

text: I am verily a man which am a Jew , born in Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers , and was zealous toward God , as ye all are this day .
text2: Yɛn e Judai nɔm egɔk , ku yɛn aa dhieeth e Tartho e Kilikia , ku yɛn aa muk e panydiiteyic , ke ya ye piɔɔc e Gamaliɛl , ku ye ya wɛɛt e tau de loŋ de kuarkuɔ , tau agɔk , aguɔ yic lɛth ne kede Nhialic , acit man e wek wedhie ekoole .

text: And I persecuted this way unto the death , binding and delivering into prisons both men and women .
text2: Yɛn aa ye kɔc cath e Kueere yɔŋ athou kek , ku aake ya duut , ku mac keek e aloc yiic , roor ayi diaar .

text: As also the high priest doth bear me witness , and all the estate of the elders : from whom also I received letters unto the brethren , and went to Damascus , to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem , for to be punished .
text2: Bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic ee caatɔdi ne ecooke aya , ayi roordit ebɛn : awareek aca ke noom tede keek aya , awareek ba yien wathii , guɔ lɔ Damathko , la kɔc e tɔu etɛɛn lɔ bɛɛi Jeruthalem , ke ke rɛk , abik kedɛn tuc bɛn yok .

text: And it came to pass , that , as I made my journey , and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon , suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me .
text2: Na wen , acath kueer , ku ca ɣeet tethiɔk keke Damathko , te kɛɛc akɔl cil , ke keditt ɣeer e piny riaau go tuol e yalɔɔm ethiau , keɣeer bɔ nhial .

text: And I fell unto the ground , and heard a voice saying unto me , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ?
text2: Guɔ wiik , ku piɛŋ rol leke yɛn , an , Thaulo , Thaulo , eeŋo yɔŋe yɛn ?

text: And I answered , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said unto me , I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom thou persecutest .
text2: Guɔ thieec , yan , Ee yin ŋa , Bɛnydit ? Go , an , Yɛn Yecu de Nadhareth , raan yɔŋe .

text: And they that were with me saw indeed the light , and were afraid ; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me .
text2: Go kɔc cath e yɛn goki keɣer tiŋ , agoki riɔɔc : ku kenki rol e raan jam ke yɛn piŋ .

text: And I said , What shall I do , Lord ? And the Lord said unto me , Arise , and go into Damascus ; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do .
text2: Guɔ thieec , yan , Eeŋo ba looi , Bɛnydit ? Go Bɛnydit lueel , yan , Jɔt rot , lɔ Damathko ; ka ba dhil looi abike lɛk yin etɛɛn , kaŋ kedhie .

text: And when I could not see for the glory of that light , being led by the hand of them that were with me , I came into Damascus .
text2: Na wen , aca cien te daai ne riaau ci keɣeere a riaau nyin , ke ya dɔm cin e kɔc wen cath e yɛn , thelki ya , guɔ jɔ bɛn Damathko .

text: And one Ananias , a devout man according to the law , having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there ,
text2: Ku ade raan cɔl Anania , raan rieu Nhialic ku dot loŋ , ku ye raan piɛth rin tede Judai waan rɛɛr etɛɛn kedhie ,

text: Came unto me , and stood , and said unto me , Brother Saul , receive thy sight . And the same hour I looked up upon him .
text2: raane e jɔ bɛn tede yɛn , bi ku kɛɛc e yalɔɔm , go a yɔɔk , yan , Thaulo , mɛnhkai , bɛye yin . Guɔ yin enɔnthiine , ku wɔi guop .

text: And he said , The God of our fathers hath chosen thee , that thou shouldest know his will , and see that Just One , and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Nhialic de warkuɔ aci yi lɔc , ba kede piɔnde bɛn ŋic , ago Raan Piɛthpiɔuwe tiŋ , ku jɔ jam e yenthok piŋ .

text: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard .
text2: Yin bi aa caatɔde e kɔc yiic kedhie , ne ka ci tiŋ ku piŋ ke .

text: And now why tarriest thou ? arise , and be baptized , and wash away thy sins , calling on the name of the Lord .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , eeŋo gau yi ? Jɔt rot , ke yi baptith , aba karɛcku waak wei , ku jɔ rin ke Bɛnydit cɔɔl .

text: And it came to pass , that , when I was come again to Jerusalem , even while I prayed in the temple , I was in a trance ;
text2: Na wen , te can anɔm bɛ dhuony Jeruthalem , ke ya laŋ e luaŋdiit e Nhialicic , ku ja kaŋ tiŋ ke ya nyuoth , guɔ Yecu tiŋ ke yook ɛn , an , Dap jal e Jeruthalem enɔnthiine : jamduon ee lueel e kedi aciki bi gam .

text: And I said , Lord , they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee :
text2: Guɔ lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , aŋicki nɔn can kɔc gam yin tɔ mac , ku ya ke dui e luek ke Nhialic yiic kedhie :

text: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed , I also was standing by , and consenting unto his death , and kept the raiment of them that slew him .
text2: ku waan leuwe riɛm e Thepano caatɔduon waan ci nɔk , ke yɛn aa kaac etɛɛn aya , ku gam thonde , guɔ lupɔɔ ke kɔc nak en tiit .

text: And he said unto me , Depart : for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles .
text2: Go ya yɔɔk , yan , Jel tei : yin ba tuɔɔc temec ya te nu Juoor .

text: And they gave him audience unto this word , and then lifted up their voices , and said , Away with such a fellow from the earth : for it is not fit that he should live .
text2: Goki ka lueel Paulo piŋ aɣet jame : na wen , ke ke jɔt kerot , aluelki , yan , Nyaaiye raan cit ekene e piny nɔm : acii piɛth luɔi bi en piir .

text: And as they cried out , and cast off their clothes , and threw dust into the air ,
text2: Na wen , ke ke cot arek abik lupɔɔken cuat piny , ku deenyki abuni nhial aya ,

text: The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle , and bade that he should be examined by scourging ; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him .
text2: ke jɔ bɛnydit alathker lueel , yan , bi Paulo lɛɛr e aloocic , ku lueel , yan , bi luɔp ne dui bi e dui e waat , ke bi thar e ke ye kɔc coot aya ŋic .

text: And as they bound him with thongs , Paul said unto the centurion that stood by , Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman , and uncondemned ?
text2: Na wen , adutki yen e wiin , ke Paulo thiec bɛny de rem , bɛny kaac e yelɔɔm , yan , Ci pal week nɔn ba wek raan dui e waat ku ye Romai , te ŋoot en ke kene yiek yeth gaak ?

text: When the centurion heard that , he went and told the chief captain , saying , Take heed what thou doest : for this man is a Roman .
text2: Te ci en ekene piŋ , ke bɛny de rem jɔ lɔ lɛk bɛnydit alathker , yan , Tiŋ rot e ke loi ; raane ee Romai .

text: Then the chief captain came , and said unto him , Tell me , art thou a Roman ? He said , Yea .
text2: Go bɛnydit alathker bɛn , ku jɔ thieec , yan , Lɛke yɛn , ye Romai ? Go , yan , Ɣɛɛ .

text: And the chief captain answered , With a great sum obtained I this freedom . And Paul said , But I was free born .
text2: Go bɛnydit alathker bɛɛr , yan , Yɛn e weu juec taau piny ne biak ban aa dil . Go Paulo lueel , yan , Ku yɛn e dhieth ke ya ye dii .

text: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him : and the chief captain also was afraid , after he knew that he was a Roman , and because he had bound him .
text2: Go kɔc jal e yelɔɔm enɔnthiine , kɔc wen , an , bik e luɔp ne dui : bɛnydit alathker e riɔɔc aya , te ci en e ŋic nɔn ee yen Romai , wen ci en e tɔ dut .

text: On the morrow , because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews , he loosed him from his bands , and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear , and brought Paul down , and set him before them .
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , nɔn de yen piɔu luɔi bi en thar e kedaŋ ŋic egɔk , ke gɔɔnye Judai ye , ke jɔ Paulo lony e joth yiic , ku cɔɔl banydit ke ka ke Nhialic keke kɔc ke loŋ kedhie , an , bik bɛn . Go Paulo bɛɛi , ku tɛɛuwe e keniim .

text: And Paul , earnestly beholding the council , said , Men and brethren , I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day .
text2: Na wen , ke Paulo jɔ kɔc nu e loŋic toom gup , ku lueel , yan , Week , wɛɛtkewaar , yɛn ee reer e reerdi ne piɔn agɔk e Nhialic nɔm aɣet ci ekoole .

text: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth .
text2: Go Anania , bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic , go kɔc kaac e yelɔɔm yɔɔk , yan , Biakki thok .

text: Then said Paul unto him , God shall smite thee , thou whited wall : for sittest thou to judge me after the law , and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law ?
text2: Go Paulo yɔɔk , yan , Yin bii Nhialic biɔɔk , yin ee pany ci rɔɔth kɔu e keɣer : rɛɛre etɛɛn , ba kedi bɛn guiir ne kede loŋ , ku ba kɔc yɔɔk , yan , bik a biɔɔk , ago loŋ jɔ wooc aya ?

text: And they that stood by said , Revilest thou God ' s high priest ?
text2: Go kɔc kaac etɛɛn goki thieec , yan , Lat bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic ?

text: Then said Paul , I wist not , brethren , that he was the high priest : for it is written , Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people .
text2: Go Paulo lueel , yan , Wathii , aa kuoc nɔn ee yen bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic : aci gɔɔr , yan , Du bɛny ceŋ kɔckun e lat .

text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees , and the other Pharisees , he cried out in the council , Men and brethren , I am a Pharisee , the son of a Pharisee : of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question .
text2: Na wen , aci Paulo kɔc nu e loŋic tiŋ , yan , biak tok ee Thadokai , ku biak tok ee Parithai , ke jɔ coot e loŋic , yan , Wɛɛtkewaar , yɛn ee Parithai , wen e Parithai : ne aŋɔth aa yɛn ŋɔth ku ne jon bi kɔc ci thou rot jɔt , en a guiire kedi .

text: And when he had so said , there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees : and the multitude was divided .
text2: Ku te ci en ekene lueel , ke teer cak rot e yi Parithai keke Thadokai , go kɔc nu e loŋ nɔm goki keyiic tek .

text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection , neither angel , nor spirit : but the Pharisees confess both .
text2: Aye Thadokai lueel , yan , Jon bi kɔc rot jɔt aliu , ayi tunynhial , ayi jɔk aliuki : ku ye Parithai ke gam kedhie .

text: And there arose a great cry : and the scribes that were of the Pharisees ' part arose , and strove , saying , We find no evil in this man : but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him , let us not fight against God .
text2: Go awuɔɔu dit rot cak : kɔc e loŋ gɔɔr kɔc e mat e Parithai acik rot jɔt , teerki , aluelki , yan , Acin kerɛɛc cuk yok tede raane : ku na de jɔŋ ci jam keke yen , ayi tuny nhial , duku biɔk e Nhialic .

text: And when there arose a great dissension , the chief captain , fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them , commanded the soldiers to go down , and to take him by force from among them , and to bring him into the castle .
text2: Na wen , aci teer dit ro cak , ke bɛnydit alathker riɔc luɔi bi Paulo cuaan e kɔc cin , go alathkeer yɔɔk , an , bik lɔ piny , lek thɛl bei e kɔc yiic , ku biiki e aloocic .

text: And the night following the Lord stood by him , and said , Be of good cheer , Paul : for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem , so must thou bear witness also at Rome .
text2: Na ɣɔnakɔu , ke Bɛnydit jɔ kɔɔc e Paulo lɔɔm , ku lueel , yan , Rit yiniɔu , Paulo : acit man ci yin aa caatɔ ne kedi e Jeruthalem , ke yin bi dhil aa caatɔ e Roma aya .

text: And when it was day , certain of the Jews banded together , and bound themselves under a curse , saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul .
text2: Na wen , aci piny ru , ke Judai kɔk e ke jɔ kethook mat , goki mel cam alal , yan , ciki dek ku ciki cam , te ŋoot kek ke ke ken Paulo nɔk .

text: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy .
text2: Kɔc ci kethook mat aya awarki thierŋuan .

text: And they came to the chief priests and elders , and said , We have bound ourselves under a great curse , that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul .
text2: Goki lɔ tede banydit ke ka ke Nhialic ku roordit , ku luelki , yan , Wok e mel cam alal , yan , acin ke buk thieep te ŋoot wok ke wo ken Paulo nɔk .

text: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow , as though ye would inquire something more perfectly concerning him : and we , or ever he come near , are ready to kill him .
text2: Ku week enɔɔne , weke kɔc nu e loŋ nɔm , we bi bɛnydit alathker yɔɔk , an , bi Paulo bɛɛi piny yine week , an , kaarki luɔi ba wek kaŋ luɔp ne kede , ka bak ŋic egɔk : ku wook , te ŋoot en ke ken ɣet tethiɔk , ke wo ye thiɔk e naŋ nɛk wok en .

text: And when Paul ' s sister ' s son heard of their lying in wait , he went and entered into the castle , and told Paul .
text2: Na wen , aci wen e nyankene Paulo both buuthe ke piŋ , ke jɔ lɔ , ku le e aloocditic le lɛk Paulo .

text: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him , and said , Bring this young man unto the chief captain : for he hath a certain thing to tell him .
text2: Go Paulo bɛny tok cɔɔl , bɛny de rem , ku lueel , yan , Lɛɛre dhuŋe tede bɛnydit alathker : ade ke bi lɔ lɛk en .

text: So he took him , and brought him to the chief captain , and said , Paul the prisoner called me unto him , and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee , who hath something to say unto thee .
text2: Go noom , bii e bɛnydit alathker nɔm , ku lueel , yan , Paulo , raan ci mac , aci a cɔɔl , ku lɛŋ ɛn , yan , ba dhuŋe bɛɛi tede yin , ade ke bi lek yin .

text: Then the chief captain took him by the hand , and went with him aside privately , and asked him , What is that thou hast to tell me ?
text2: Go bɛnydit alathker dɔm cin , ku jɔki rot miɛɛt kec , te cin kɔc , go thieec , yan , Ee kaŋo ke cath ke yin ke ba lɛk ɛn ?

text: And he said , The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council , as though they would inquire somewhat of him more perfectly .
text2: Go lueel , yan , Judai acik kethook mat , luɔi bi kek yi lɔŋ , an , ba Paulo bɛɛi e loŋ nɔm miak , an , kɔɔrki luɔi bi kek kaŋ luɔp ne kede , ka bik ŋic egɔk .

text: But do not thou yield unto them : for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men , which have bound themselves with an oath , that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him : and now are they ready , looking for a promise from thee .
text2: Yen du yin keden gam : ade kɔc buth en kueer , awarki thierŋuan , kɔc ci mel cam , an , ciki cam ku ciki dek te ŋoot kek ke kenki nɔk : ku acik thok enɔɔne , atitki jam bi bɛn tede yin .

text: So the chief captain then let the young man depart , and charged him , See thou tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me .
text2: Go bɛnydit alathker dhuŋe tɔ jel , ku yook , yan , Du lek raan daŋ nɔn ci yin a nyuoth kake .

text: And he called unto him two centurions , saying , Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea , and horsemen threescore and ten , and spearmen two hundred , at the third hour of the night ;
text2: Go bany ke rem cɔɔl kaarou , ku jɔ ke yɔɔk , yan , Taki bot ke alathkeer kaarou guik bik lɔ Kaithareia , ayi alathkeer cath e joŋgoor kɔɔth kathierdherou , ku alathkeer muk tɔɔŋ bot kaarou , abik jal e thaar kadiak elewakɔu :

text: And provide them beasts , that they may set Paul on , and bring him safe unto Felix the governor .
text2: ku we bi joŋgoor yok ayadaŋ , bi kek Paulo taau e kekɔɔth , bik lɔ lɛɛr yinki mudhiir Pelik apiɛth .

text: And he wrote a letter after this manner :
text2: Go awarek gɔɔr ale :

text: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting .
text2: yan , Mudhiir Pelik adhuɛŋ piɛth arac , yin thieec , yɛn Kulaudio Luthia .

text: This man was taken of the Jews , and should have been killed of them : then came I with an army , and rescued him , having understood that he was a Roman .
text2: Raane acii Judai dɔm , ku acik duɛɛr nɔk , guɔ bɛn wo tɔŋ , ku kuɔny : aca piŋ nɔn ee yen dil e Romai .

text: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him , I brought him forth into their council :
text2: Na wen , aa dɛ piɔu luɔi ban goony gɔɔny kek en ŋic , ke ja bɛɛi e loŋden nɔm :

text: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law , but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: aguɔ piŋ nɔn ci e gaany ne kede loŋden tei , ku kene gaany ne ke dueere ye tɔ nak , ku ne ke dueere ye tɔ mac aya .

text: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man , I sent straightway to thee , and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him . Farewell .
text2: Ku aci lɛk ɛn nɔn buuthe Judai yen , aguɔ dap tɔ yine yin , ku ca kɔc gɔɔny en yɔɔk aya , yan , bik kedɛn e gɔɔny kek en lueel e yinɔm . Yin bi nin apiɛth .

text: Then the soldiers , as it was commanded them , took Paul , and brought him by night to Antipatris .
text2: Go alathkeer Paulo noom , acit man ci e lɛk keek , ku biiki Antipatiri wakɔu .

text: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him , and returned to the castle :
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , ke alathkeer cath piny ke ke dhuny keniim aloocdit : ku nyieeŋki alathkeer cath e joŋgoor kɔɔth piny , bik lɔɔk cath e Paulo .

text: Who , when they came to Caesarea , and delivered the epistle to the governor , presented Paul also before him .
text2: Na wen , acik bɛn Kaithareia , ke ke jɔ awarek yien mudhiir , ku tɛɛuki Paulo e yenɔm aya .

text: And when the governor had read the letter , he asked of what province he was . And when he understood that he was of Cilicia ;
text2: Te ci mudhiir awarek kueenic , ke jɔ thieec , yan , Yee raan e pinyou ? Te ci en e piŋ nɔn ee yen raan e Kilikia ,

text: I will hear thee , said he , when thine accusers are also come . And he commanded him to be kept in Herod ' s judgment hall .
text2: ke jɔ lueel , yan , Kedu aba piŋ , te ci kɔc gɔɔny yin bɛn aya . Go kɔc yɔɔk , an , bik mac aloocdiit e Kerod , alooc e guieer e loŋ .

text: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders , and with a certain orator named Tertullus , who informed the governor against Paul .
text2: Na wen , aci akool kadhic thok , ke Anania bɛny diit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic ke jɔ bɛn keke roordit , ke ke cath ne raan ŋic jam guiir raan cɔl Tertulo ; ku jɔki mudhiir nyuoth jamden ne Paulo .

text: And when he was called forth , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness , and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence ,
text2: Na wen , aci cɔɔl , ke Tertulo gɔl gɔny gɔɔny en Paulo , yan , Nɔn reer wok ke piny lɔ diu aret , e ke bɔ e ciindu , ku nɔn ci luɔi piɛth aret luoi jurda ne piath e yinɔm ,

text: We accept it always , and in all places , most noble Felix , with all thankfulness .
text2: yen aye wok kaŋ noom ke wo lec yinɔm ne piɔnmit , e akoolnyiin kedhie ku piny ebɛn , ku jɔku aa lueel , an , Thieithieei , yin Pelik adhuɛŋ piɛth alal .

text: Notwithstanding , that I be not further tedious unto thee , I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words .
text2: Na enɔɔne , ke can yi tɔ bap , yin laŋ , an , Piŋ welkuɔn lik ke yi hir yipiɔu .

text: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow , and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world , and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes :
text2: Wok e raane yok aye raan rac etaiwei , ku ye raan e Judai kɛɛk kedhie e piny nɔm ebɛn , ee raan ditt e rem de Nadharani :

text: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple : whom we took , and would have judged according to our law .
text2: aci them aya luɔi bi en luaŋdiit e Nhialic tɔ riaak : agoku dɔm , ku deku piɔth luɔi bi wok kede guiir e kede loŋda .

text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us , and with great violence took him away out of our hands ,
text2: Go Luthia bɛnydiit alathker guɔ bɛn , ku jɔ dɔm bei e wocin e riɛl dit ,

text: Commanding his accusers to come unto thee : by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things , whereof we accuse him .
text2: ku yook kɔc gɔɔny en , an , bik bɛn tede yin : na enɔɔne , te ci yin e thieec yinguop , ke yin dueer kake ŋic egɔk , ka gɔɔny wok ke yen , kaŋ ebɛn .

text: And the Jews also assented , saying that these things were so .
text2: Go Judai gam aya , luelki , an , kake ayinki ya .

text: Then Paul , after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak , answered , Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation , I do the more cheerfully answer for myself :
text2: Na wen , aci mudhiir e nieu , ke Paulo beer , yan , Bɛnydit , aŋiɛc nɔn ee yin jure cieŋ e run juec , en a luɛɛl ɛn kedi e piɔnmit :

text: Because that thou mayest understand , that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship .
text2: aduɛɛre ŋic enɔɔne , yan , nin acik thieer ku rou tei , te waan la yɛn Jeruthalem la lam :

text: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man , neither raising up the people , neither in the synagogues , nor in the city :
text2: ku yɛn kene kɔc yok ke ya cak teer wo kɔc e luaŋdit e Nhialicic , ku kene ya yok aya ke ya tɔ kɔc wou e luek ke Nhialic yiic , ayi panyditic .

text: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me .
text2: Ku ka gɔɔny kek ɛn enɔɔne , aciki ke dueer tɔ ye yith .

text: But this I confess unto thee , that after the way which they call heresy , so worship I the God of my fathers , believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets :
text2: Ku cooke aca gam e yinɔm tei , yan , Lam luelki , yan , ee lam mɛɛn , yen aya yɛn Nhialic de kuarkuɔ lam , ku yɛn gam ka ci gɔɔr e loŋ de Motheyic ku nebi yiic , kaŋ kedhie :

text: And have hope toward God , which they themselves also allow , that there shall be a resurrection of the dead , both of the just and unjust .
text2: ku yɛn ŋath Nhialic , ayi keek aya , ee Nhialic en ŋathki , nɔn bi jonerot e kɔc ci thou nu , kɔc piɛthpiɔth ayi kɔc rac piɔth .

text: And herein do I exercise myself , to have always a conscience void of offence toward God , and toward men .
text2: Ku yɛn ee ro them e cooke , yan , ba ya cath ne piɔn agɔk anandi , ku cin ke ya wooc e Nhialic nɔm ku kɔc niim ayadaŋ .

text: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation , and offerings .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , te can run juec lɛɛr , ke yɛn e jɔ bɛn ba ka ci gam ne dhueeŋ bɛn yien jurda , ayi ka ci yien Nhialic :

text: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple , neither with multitude , nor with tumult .
text2: ago Judai kɔk bɔ Athia agoki bɛn , ku yokki yɛn luaŋdiit e Nhialic , ke ya piɛth guop , ku cin kut e kɔc cath e yɛn , ku cin awuɔɔu nu :

text: Who ought to have been here before thee , and object , if they had ought against me .
text2: kɔcke adi cik bɛn e yinɔm , bik a bɛn gaany , te de yen ke bi kek a gaany .

text: Or else let these same here say , if they have found any evil doing in me , while I stood before the council ,
text2: Ayi kɔcke etene , tɔ luelki keek gup , nɔn de kerɛɛcdien cik yok te waan kaac ɛn e loŋ nɔm ,

text: Except it be for this one voice , that I cried standing among them , Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day .
text2: ee jam toŋe tei , jam waan cɔɔt ɛn , waan kaac ɛn e keyiic , yan , Ne kede jonerot e kɔc ci thou , yen a guiire loŋdi e weniim ekoole .

text: And when Felix heard these things , having more perfect knowledge of that way , he deferred them , and said , When Lysias the chief captain shall come down , I will know the uttermost of your matter .
text2: Na wen , aci Pelik kake piŋ , luɔi ŋic en jam de Kueer aret , ke ke jɔ rieec , go lueel , yan , Miak te ci Ludiia bɛnydit alathker bɛn , ke yɛn bi jamdun jɔ woiyic apiɛth .

text: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul , and to let him have liberty , and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him .
text2: Go bɛny de rem yɔɔk , an , bi Paulo aa tht , ku tɔ rɛɛr apiɛth ; ku cii kɔcken bi pɛn bɛn e yelɔɔm , bik kede bɛn looi .

text: And after certain days , when Felix came with his wife Drusilla , which was a Jewess , he sent for Paul , and heard him concerning the faith in Christ .
text2: Na wen , aci nhi lik thok , ke Pelik jɔ bɛn keke Duruthila tiiŋde , ee nyan e Judai , go Paulo tɔ cɔl , ku jɔ piŋ waan guiir en kede gam de Kritho .

text: And as he reasoned of righteousness , temperance , and judgment to come Felix trembled , and answered , Go thy way for this time ; when I have a convenient season , I will call for thee .
text2: Na wen , aguiir Paulo kede piathepiɔu , ku ne dom ee raan rot dɔm , ku ne guieer bi loŋ de kɔc guiir rial , ke Pelik jɔ riɔɔc aret , go bɛɛr , yan , Jɔ jal enɔɔne : na miak , te can akool piɛth yok , ke yin ba cɔɔl .

text: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul , that he might loose him : wherefore he sent for him the oftener , and communed with him .
text2: Ku aŋath Paulo aya , nɔn bi en e waac e weu , ke bi lony : yen aa ye yen cool e cɔɔl en en , bi jam ke yen .

text: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix ' room : and Felix , willing to shew the Jews a pleasure , left Paul bound .
text2: Na wen , aci run kaarou thok , ke Porukio Pethetɔ loony e nyin e Pelikic ; go Pelik piɔu dɛ luɔi bi en Judai tɔ mit piɔu , go Paulo nyaaŋ piny amac .

text: Now when Festus was come into the province , after three days he ascended from Caesarea to Jerusalem .
text2: Na wen , aci Petheto bɛn piny , ke jɔ nin lɛɛr kadiak , ku jɔ jal Kaithareia le Jeruthalem .

text: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul , and besought him ,
text2: Go bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic ku roordit ke Judai goki Paulo gaany e yenɔm , ku jɔki lɔŋ ,

text: And desired favour against him , that he would send for him to Jerusalem , laying wait in the way to kill him .
text2: lipki , ke bi Paulo tɔ biiye Jeruthalem ; akɔɔrki nɔn bi kek e buuth e kueer kec , bik nɔk .

text: But Festus answered , that Paul should be kept at Caesarea , and that he himself would depart shortly thither .
text2: Go Petheto bɛɛr , yan , e Paulo yok ke mac e Kaithareia , ku lueel e yenguop , an , bi dap jal , ke lɔ tɛɛn .

text: Let them therefore , said he , which among you are able , go down with me , and accuse this man , if there be any wickedness in him .
text2: Go , an , Na de kɔc nu e weyiic , kɔc dueer lɔ , e ke lɔ ne yɛn etok , bik raane lɔ gaany , nɔn de yen ke ci wooc .

text: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days , he went down unto Caesarea ; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought .
text2: Go reer e keyiic te cit nin kabɛt ku nɔn thieer kek , ke jɔ lɔ Kaithareia ; na ɣɔnmiak , ke nyuc e thoony e guieereloŋ , go lueel , yan , e Paulo biiye .

text: And when he was come , the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about , and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul , which they could not prove .
text2: Na wen , aci bɛn , ke Judai e bɔ e Jeruthalem , ke ke jɔ kɔɔc e yelɔɔm , goki Paulo gaany e kajuec kathiek , ku acin te bi kek ke tɔ ye yith .

text: While he answered for himself , Neither against the law of the Jews , neither against the temple , nor yet against Caesar , have I offended any thing at all .
text2: Go Paulo bɛɛr ne kede guop , yan , Acin kerɛɛc ca wooc ne loŋ de Judai , ayi luaŋdiit e Nhialic , ayi Kaithar , acin cook tok .

text: But Festus , willing to do the Jews a pleasure , answered Paul , and said , Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these things before me ?
text2: Na wen , ke Petheto , ke kɔɔr luɔi bi en Judai tɔ mit piɔth , go Paulo thieec , yan , Duɛɛre lɔ Jeruthalem , bi jamdu lɔ guiir e yanɔm etɛɛn , ne ka ci yi gaanye ?

text: Then said Paul , I stand at Caesar ' s judgment seat , where I ought to be judged : to the Jews have I done no wrong , as thou very well knowest .
text2: Go Paulo lueel , yan , Yɛn kaac e thoony de Kaithar nɔm , thoony e guieereloŋ , yen aye te bi kedi dhil guiir thin : acin ke ca wac Judai , kene aŋic egɔk aya .

text: For if I be an offender , or have committed any thing worthy of death , I refuse not to die : but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me , no man may deliver me unto them . I appeal unto Caesar .
text2: Ku na de ke ca wooc , ku na de kerɛɛc ca looi kerɛɛc roŋ ke luɔi bi a nɔk , ke yɛn cii dueer jai e thuɔɔu : ku te cii kek e yith , kek kak e gɔɔny kek ɛne , ke luɔi dueer raan a tɔ yine keek aliu . Yɛn bi kedi lɛɛr e Kaithar nɔm .

text: Then Festus , when he had conferred with the council , answered , Hast thou appealed unto Caesar ? unto Caesar shalt thou go .
text2: Go Petheto jam guiir keke kɔc nu e loŋic , ku jɔ bɛɛr , yan , Ci guɔ lueel , an , ba kedu lɛɛr e Kaithar nɔm ? Apiɛth , yin bi jɔ lɔ e Kaithar nɔm .

text: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus .
text2: Na wen , aci nhi kɔk thok , ke malik Agiripa jɔ bɛn keke Berenike , ke ke bɔ Kaithareia , bik Petheto bɛn thieec .

text: And when they had been there many days , Festus declared Paul ' s cause unto the king , saying , There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix :
text2: Ku te ci kek guɔ reer etɛɛn e nhi juec , ke Petheto jɔ malik guieer jam de Paulo , yan , Ade raan cii Pelik nyaaŋ piny ke mac :

text: About whom , when I was at Jerusalem , the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me , desiring to have judgment against him .
text2: na wen , te nuɔ yɛn Jeruthalem , ke banydit ke ka ke Nhialic keke roordit ke Judai ke ke jɔ ya guieer kede , akɔɔrki luɔi ban loŋde teem , an , e nak .

text: To whom I answered , It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die , before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face , and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him .
text2: Aguɔ keden bɛɛr , yan , Acie ciɛɛŋ de Romai , an , bik raan yien kɔc , lɔ nɔk , te ŋoote raan ci gaany ke ken ethok kɔn tuoom keke kɔc gɔɔny en , ago pal luɛl lueel en kede ne ke e gɔɔnye ye .

text: Therefore , when they were come hither , without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat , and commanded the man to be brought forth .
text2: Na wen , acik bɛn ene , ke ya ken gaau , ɣɔnmiak guop yɛn e nyuc e thoony e guieereloŋ , ku yɔɔk kɔc , yan , bik raan bɛɛi .

text: Against whom when the accusers stood up , they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed :
text2: Na wen , aci kɔc gɔɔny en rot jɔt , akenki gaany ne kak e ya lueel e yapiɔu , yan , bi kek e gaany :

text: But had certain questions against him of their own superstition , and of one Jesus , which was dead , whom Paul affirmed to be alive .
text2: aterden ne yen ee jam de lam ee kek yiethken lam kapac , ku ye jam de raan cɔl Yecu , raan ci thou , ku ye Paulo ŋak , an , piir enɔɔne .

text: And because I doubted of such manner of questions , I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these matters .
text2: Na wen , aci a dhal luɔi ban kede guiir , guɔ Paulo thieec , yan , Duɛɛre lɔ Jeruthalem , ke kedu bi lɔ guiir etɛɛn ne kake .

text: But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus , I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Caesar .
text2: Go Paulo lɔŋ , an , bi yok ke tɔu , bi kede lɔ piŋ e Augoutho nɔm , aguɔ lueel , an , bi yok ke mac aɣet kool ban e tɔ yine Kaithar .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Festus , I would also hear the man myself . To morrow , said he , thou shalt hear him .
text2: Go Agiripa Petheto yɔɔk , yan , Ayik ɛn aya , yɛn de piɔu luɔi ban kede raane piŋ . Go , an , Aba piŋ miak .

text: And on the morrow , when Agrippa was come , and Bernice , with great pomp , and was entered into the place of hearing , with the chief captains , and principal men of the city , at Festus ' commandment Paul was brought forth .
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , aci Agiripa bɛn keke Berenike , ke ke bɔ ne dhueeŋ dit , ku jɔki lɔ aloocdit alooc de guieereloŋ , keke banydit alathker ku roordit ke panydit , go Petheto Paulo tɔ cɔl , go bɛɛi e keniim .

text: And Festus said , King Agrippa , and all men which are here present with us , ye see this man , about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me , both at Jerusalem , and also here , crying that he ought not to live any longer .
text2: Go Petheto lueel , yan , Yin malik Agiripa , weke kɔc nu etene wedhie , raane a wɔiki , raan cii kɔc ke Judai kedhie a loŋ ne kede , ayi Jeruthalem ayi etene , ku cotki , yan , Raane acii piɛth ke luɔi bi en bɛ piir .

text: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death , and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus , I have determined to send him .
text2: Ku luɔi cin en ke ca yok , ke bi e nɔk , ku luɔi ci en a lɔŋ , yenguop , yan , bi kede lɛɛr e Augoutho nɔm , ke guɔ lueel , yan , ba tɔ leere .

text: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord . Wherefore I have brought him forth before you , and specially before thee , O king Agrippa , that , after examination had , I might have somewhat to write .
text2: Ku acin jam yic cath ke yɛn , jam ba gaar bɛnydan dit ne kede . Yen a bɛɛi ɛn en e weniim , ayik yinɔm , yin malik Agiripa ; na ele , te ca wek e thieec apiɛth , ke yɛn bi dɛ kedien ba gɔɔr .

text: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner , and not withal to signify the crimes laid against him .
text2: Aca lueel , yan , Ee keɣɔric , te ta yɛn raan ci mac leere tedaŋ , ke ya ken raan yine ye nyuoth thar e ke e gɔɔnye yen .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Thou art permitted to speak for thyself . Then Paul stretched forth the hand , and answered for himself :
text2: Go Agiripa Paulo yɔɔk , yan , Yin dueer jam e rot yitok . Go Paulo yecin rieny tueŋ , ku jɔ kede lueel jɛi en rot :

text: I think myself happy , king Agrippa , because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews :
text2: Yan , Aya lueel , yan , ca guop miɛt ekoole , yin malik Agiripa , luɔi ban kedi lueel e yinɔm , ne ka ci Judai a gaany kedhie :

text: Especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews : wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently .
text2: ku luɔi ŋic yin ciɛɛŋ de Judai ku wel luelki kedhie , yen a miɛt ɛn guop aret , aguɔ yi lɔŋ , yan , Piŋ kedi ke yi liir yiniɔu .

text: My manner of life from my youth , which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem , know all the Jews ;
text2: Tau e tau ɛn waan aa yɛn meth , waan rɛɛr ɛn woke jurdi e Jeruthalem , aŋic Judai ebɛn ;

text: Which knew me from the beginning , if they would testify , that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee .
text2: aake ŋic ɛn waan thɛɛr , te de kek piɔth luɔi bi kek e lueel , aŋicki taudi nɔn e tau ɛn ke ya ye Parithai , yen aye rem ril etor ne lamda .

text: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers :
text2: Ku yɛn kaac enɔɔne , ku aguiir loŋdi ne baŋ de aŋɔth ŋath ɛn jam cii Nhialic kɔn lɛk warkuɔ ;

text: Unto which promise our twelve tribes , instantly serving God day and night , hope to come . For which hope ' s sake , king Agrippa , I am accused of the Jews .
text2: ku dhienkuɔ kathieer ku rou kek aye jame ŋɔɔth , luɔi bi en aa yic , ku yek Nhialic lam aret akol ku wakɔu . Ne baŋ de aŋɔthe , yin malik Agiripa , yen a gɔɔnye Judai yɛn ekoole .

text: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you , that God should raise the dead ?
text2: Eeŋo luɛɛl wek en , an , ee ke cii kɔc dueer gam , yen jon bi Nhialic kɔc ci thou jat nhial ?

text: I verily thought with myself , that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Yɛnguop aa ya lueel waan , an , ba kajuec dhil looi ater ne rin ke Yecu de Nadhareth .

text: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem : and many of the saints did I shut up in prison , having received authority from the chief priests ; and when they were put to death , I gave my voice against them .
text2: Aguɔ looi aya e Jeruthalem : yɛn e riɛl noom tede banydit ke ka ke Nhialic , ku ja kɔc juec mac e aloc yiic , kɔc ɣerpiɔth ; ku ekool cike nɔk , yɛn e thonden gam .

text: And I punished them oft in every synagogue , and compelled them to blaspheme ; and being exceedingly mad against them , I persecuted them even unto strange cities .
text2: Aake ya cool e duoi ɛn ke e luek ke Nhialic yiic kedhie , ku ja ke dhil aa tɔ lat Nhialic ; aguɔ ke yɔŋ ɣɛɛt ɛn pɛɛnydit lei ne agonhdiit aa yɛn gɔth wo keek .

text: Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests ,
text2: Waan luɔɔi ɛn ekake , ke ya keny Damathko , ku cath wo riɛl ku bɛɛny cii banydit ke ka ke Nhialic yien ɛn :

text: At midday , O king , I saw in the way a light from heaven , above the brightness of the sun , shining round about me and them which journeyed with me .
text2: na wen , akaac akɔl cil , yin malik , ke ya tiŋ keɣer kueer , keɣeer bɔ nhial , ke war akɔl e riau , ku jɔ piny riaau e yalɔɔm , ayi kɔc lɔm kɔc ciɛth wok .

text: And when we were all fallen to the earth , I heard a voice speaking unto me , and saying in the Hebrew tongue , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks .
text2: Na wen , acuk wiik wodhie , ke ya piŋ rol jam ke yɛn ne thoŋ e Eberu , yan , Thaulo , Thaulo , eeŋo yɔŋ yin ɛn ? Atok te wec yin wiɛth thook .

text: And I said , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said , I am Jesus whom thou persecutest .
text2: Guɔ thieec , yan , Ee yin ŋa , Bɛnydit ? Go bɛɛr , yan , Yɛn Yecu , raan yɔŋe .

text: But rise , and stand upon thy feet : for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose , to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen , and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee ;
text2: Jɔt rot tei , kaace e yicok : yɛn e jɔ tuol tede yin , luɔi ban yi tɔ ye raan e kaki looi ku ye caatɔdi ne ka ci guɔ tiŋ , ayi ka ba yɛn ke bɛ tuol e keyiic tede yin ;

text: Delivering thee from the people , and from the Gentiles , unto whom now I send thee ,
text2: yin ba luok e kɔc cin , ayi Juoor cin , Juoor tuɔɔc ɛn yin tede keek enɔɔne ,

text: To open their eyes , and to turn them from darkness to light , and from the power of Satan unto God , that they may receive forgiveness of sins , and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me .
text2: lɔ keek liep nyiin , ke ke bi ro yal bei e cuɔlepinyic lek teɣer , ku yɛlki rot bei e riɛl e Catanic , lek te nu Nhialic , agoki nyiɛɛi de karac yok , ku yokki ke bik lɔɔk lak ne kɔc etok kɔc ci tɔ ɣerpiɔth ne gam ci kek a gam .

text: Whereupon , O king Agrippa , I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision :
text2: Yen akɛn ɛn ke ci nyuoth ɛn rɛɛc , ke bɔ nhial , yin malik Agiripa ;

text: But shewed first unto them of Damascus , and at Jerusalem , and throughout all the coasts of Judaea , and then to the Gentiles , that they should repent and turn to God , and do works meet for repentance .
text2: yɛn e kɔc nu Damathko kɔn guieer , na wen , ke ya guiir kɔc nu Jeruthalem , ku piny e Judaya ebɛn , ku guieer Juoor aya , yɔɔk keek , yan , bik kepiɔth puk ku welki kepiɔth Nhialic , agoki kaŋ aa looi ka roŋ ne puŋdepiɔu .

text: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple , and went about to kill me .
text2: Guiir guieer ɛn kɔc kake , yen aa dɔme Judai yɛn e luaŋditt e Nhialicic , ku kɔɔrki luɔi bi kek a nɔk .

text: Having therefore obtained help of God , I continue unto this day , witnessing both to small and great , saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come :
text2: Nhialic yen aa kony a tei , aguɔ tɔu aɣet ci ekoole , ke ya ye cool e guiir kɔc , kɔc kor ayi kɔc dit , ku acin kɔk aa lɛk keek , ee kak e lueel nebii tei , ayi Mothe , yan , bik tic :

text: That Christ should suffer , and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead , and should shew light unto the people , and to the Gentiles .
text2: yan , bi Kritho ketuc dhil guum , ku bi aa raan bi rot kɔn jɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic , ago kɔc guieer jam de ɣɛɛrepiny , ayi Judai ayi Juoor .

text: And as he thus spake for himself , Festus said with a loud voice , Paul , thou art beside thyself ; much learning doth make thee mad .
text2: Na wen , te ŋoote Paulo ke luel kede , ke jɔ Petheto lueel e rol dit , yan , Paulo , yin e miɔl ; ŋiny ŋic yin kaŋ aret aci yi tɔ miɔl .

text: But he said , I am not mad , most noble Festus ; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness .
text2: Go bɛɛr , yan , Yɛn ken miɔl , yin adhuɛŋ dit Petheto ; yɛn luel wel yith wel ke piathenɔm .

text: For the king knoweth of these things , before whom also I speak freely : for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him ; for this thing was not done in a corner .
text2: Kake aŋic malik keek , yɛn e kaŋ lueel e yenɔm ke ya ril nyin : aŋiɛc egɔk , yan , acin tok e kake yiic ke ci thien en ; kene akene looi athian .

text: King Agrippa , believest thou the prophets ? I know that thou believest .
text2: Yin , malik Agiripa , gam nebii ? Aŋiɛc nɔn gɛm yin keek .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian .
text2: Go Agiripa Paulo yɔɔk , yan , Yin de piɔu luɔi bi yin a weŋ ne jam thiinakaŋ , ago ya tɔ ye Krithian .

text: And Paul said , I would to God , that not only thou , but also all that hear me this day , were both almost , and altogether such as I am , except these bonds .
text2: Go Paulo bɛɛr , yan , Nɔn ee yen jam thiinakaŋ ku nɔn ee yen jam dit , yɛn laŋ Nhialic , acie kedu yin yitok , ee kede kɔc kedhie aya , kɔc piŋ kedi ekoole , ke we bi ciet ɛn , ejothke tei , e ke bi liu .

text: And when he had thus spoken , the king rose up , and the governor , and Bernice , and they that sat with them :
text2: Na wen , aci kake lueel , ke malik jɔt rot keke mudhiir , ku Berenike , ayi kɔc rɛɛr ne keek :

text: And when they were gone aside , they talked between themselves , saying , This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: goki nyai e yelɔɔm , ku guiirki kapac , luelki , yan , Raane acin ke ci looi ke roŋ ke luɔi dueere ye nɔk , ayi many mɛce yen aya .

text: Then said Agrippa unto Festus , This man might have been set at liberty , if he had not appealed unto Caesar .
text2: Go Agiripa Petheto yɔɔk , yan , Raane adi ci lony , tee ken kede lɛɛr e Kaithar nɔm .

text: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy , they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius , a centurion of Augustus ' band .
text2: Na wen , aci lueel , yan , buk cath ne abel lok Yitalia , ke ke jɔ Paulo keke kɔc kɔk ci mac yien raan cɔl Julio , ee bɛny de rem cɔl rem de Augoutho .

text: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium , we launched , meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia ; one Aristarchus , a Macedonian of Thessalonica , being with us .
text2: Goku lɔ e abelic , abel e Adramution , ku jɔku yup , ayok lueel , yan , buk cath ke wo kuany wɛɛr nɔm piny de Athia ; ku ciɛthku ne Aritharko , raan e Makedonia bɔ Thethalonike .

text: And the next day we touched at Sidon . And Julius courteously entreated Paul , and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself .
text2: Na ɣɔnmiak , ke wo jɔ kɔɔc e Thidon : ku Julio aci Paulo luoi apiɛth etɛɛn , go pɔl a lɔ tede mathke , bik en lɔ kony .

text: And when we had launched from thence , we sailed under Cyprus , because the winds were contrary .
text2: Na wen , acuk lony etɛɛn , ke wo jɔ cath e Kupurio yɔu , ne luɔi ci yom abel peen cath aret .

text: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia , we came to Myra , a city of Lycia .
text2: Na wen , acuk teek e wɛɛr e Kilikia keke Pampulia , ke wo jɔ ɣet Mura , ee paan toŋ nu Lukia .

text: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy ; and he put us therein .
text2: Go bɛny de rem abel yok etɛɛn , abel e Alekandaria lɔ Yitalia , ku jɔ wo taau thin .

text: And when we had sailed slowly many days , and scarce were come over against Cnidus , the wind not suffering us , we sailed under Crete , over against Salmone ;
text2: Na wen , ke wo ye cath ediirdiir e nhi juec , aci wo duɛɛr dhal e yiit bi wo yin piny ne Kinido , ne pɛn ci yom wo peen , goku teek e Kerete yɔu , ku jɔku yiit piny e Thalmone :

text: And , hardly passing it , came unto a place which is called The fair havens ; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea .
text2: ku te ŋoot wok ke wo ken tuure winy thok , ke wo jɔ ɣet te cɔl Wanh Lɔdip , athiɔk keke panydit cɔl Lathaia .

text: Now when much time was spent , and when sailing was now dangerous , because the fast was now already past , Paul admonished them ,
text2: Na wen , acuk nin juec lɛɛr , abi riɔɔc guɔ nu enɔɔne ne cath e abel , ahith ee cam rɛɛc e guɔ thok aya , ke Paulo jɔ kɔc yɔɔk ale ,

text: And said unto them , Sirs , I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage , not only of the lading and ship , but also of our lives .
text2: yan , Bany , yɛn e cathe tiŋ , cath ciɛth wok , nɔn bi wo dak aret , ku riaak abi nu , acie riaak de weu tei ayi abel , ee weikuɔ ayadaŋ .

text: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship , more than those things which were spoken by Paul .
text2: Go bɛny de rem ago jam de raan kuath abel gam ayi jam de wun abel , ku reec ka lueel Paulo .

text: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in , the more part advised to depart thence also , if by any means they might attain to Phenice , and there to winter ; which is an haven of Crete , and lieth toward the south west and north west .
text2: Ku luɔi rɛɛce wanhe ne mai bi abel mai thin , ke jɔ tedit e kɔc guɔ lueel , an , buk yup ku themku nɔn dueer wo ɣet Poiniki , buk lɔ mai etɛɛn ; Poiniki ee wanh e Kerete , wanh ee abeel mac thin , ku ci eyic wɛl wowic ku ten ee akɔl lɔ piny , ayi rut ku ten ee akɔl lɔ piny .

text: And when the south wind blew softly , supposing that they had obtained their purpose , loosing thence , they sailed close by Crete .
text2: Na wen , aci wowic pot emaath , ke jɔki lueel , yan , Ke nu e wopiɔth ka , acuk yok , goki abel yup , ku jɔki teek e Kerete yɔu , ke ke kuany wɛɛr yɔu .

text: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind , called Euroclydon .
text2: Na wen , acin tediit cik lɛɛr , ke amaŋdit bɔ ne keniim tueŋ , amaŋ cɔl Eurakulo :

text: And when the ship was caught , and could not bear up into the wind , we let her drive .
text2: go abel dɔm e yom , aci enɔm duɛɛr cɔk e yomic , goku pɔl , a kuɛɛth yom .

text: And running under a certain island which is called Clauda , we had much work to come by the boat :
text2: Goku riŋ e tuur yɔu , tuur thiin cɔl Kauda , ku aci wo duɛɛr dhal ne thel bi wok abelthiine thɛl thin :

text: Which when they had taken up , they used helps , undergirding the ship ; and , fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands , strake sail , and so were driven .
text2: na wen , acik abel thiine jat nhial , ke ke jɔ wiin a tɛɛk abel thar , duut kek en , ke bi riɛl ; ku luɔi riɔɔc kek e cot bi abel cot e liɛɛt kɔcic , ke ke jɔ lupɔ de abel dak bei , bi yom ke kuaath tei .

text: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest , the next day they lightened the ship ;
text2: Ku na ɣɔnmiak , luɔi ci amaŋ abel tɔ lɔ jaŋjaŋ alal , ke ke jɔ weu kɔk dhil dɛɛny wei e abelic ;

text: And the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship .
text2: ku ekool ee kek diak wok e ka ke abel cuat wei e wocin .

text: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared , and no small tempest lay on us , all hope that we should be saved was then taken away .
text2: Ku jɔku nin juec lɛɛr ke akɔl ayi kuɛl ke ke cii tiec kedhie , ku ŋoot amaŋ ke put alal , ago aŋɔth e ŋathku , yan , bi wo kony , go jal e wopiɔth .

text: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them , and said , Sirs , ye should have hearkened unto me , and not have loosed from Crete , and to have gained this harm and loss .
text2: Na wen , aci kɔc cam rɛɛc e nhi juec , ke Paulo jɔt rot e kɔc yiic cil , ku jɔ lueel , yan , Week bany , tee we e jamdi piŋ waan , ku tee wo ken lony Kerete , adi ci ŋuan , ku kerɛɛce adi ken nu enɔɔne ayi eriaake .

text: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer : for there shall be no loss of any man ' s life among you , but of the ship .
text2: Ku wek yɔɔk enɔɔne , yan , Ruɔmki wepiɔth tei : acin maar bi kɔc maar e weyiic , ee abel tei en abi maar .

text: For there stood by me this night the angel of God , whose I am , and whom I serve ,
text2: Tunynhial aa kaac e yalɔɔm wenakɔu , tuny de Nhialic , Nhialic aa yɛn limde ku ya kake looi ,

text: Saying , Fear not , Paul ; thou must be brought before Caesar : and , lo , God hath given thee all them that sail with thee .
text2: ku jɔ lueel , yan , Du riɔc , Paulo ; yin bi dhil lɛɛr e Kaithar nɔm : ku tiŋ , Nhialic aci yi gam piir piire kɔc cath wek kedhie ayadaŋ .

text: Wherefore , sirs , be of good cheer : for I believe God , that it shall be even as it was told me .
text2: Yen ruɔm wek wepiɔth , bany : yɛn gam Nhialic , nɔn bi en aa yic aya , cit man ci en e lɛk ɛn .

text: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island .
text2: Wo bi dhil cuat e tuur tok nɔm tei .

text: But when the fourteenth night was come , as we were driven up and down in Adria , about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country ;
text2: Na wen , aci nin guɔ thieer ku ŋuan , ke wo ye biak tɛɛn ku biɛke wo tɛɛn abapdiit de Adria , te ci piny dit , ke jɔ kɔc lni abelic lueel , yan , de piny ci guɔ thiɔk ;

text: And sounded , and found it twenty fathoms : and when they had gone a little further , they sounded again , and found it fifteen fathoms .
text2: agoki them e wien , ku yokki acit bɛɛr e kɔc kathierou : na wen , acik lɔ tueŋ emaath , ke jɔki bɛ them , ku yokki acit bɛɛr e kɔc kathieer ku dhic .

text: Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks , they cast four anchors out of the stern , and wished for the day .
text2: Na wen , ke ke riɔc nɔn bi wo ɣaal e kur yiic , agoki weu ke abel kaŋuan cuat piny e abapditic abel thar cieen , weu e abel mɔk piny , ku jɔki runepiny tht alal .

text: And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship , when they had let down the boat into the sea , under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship ,
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc lui abelic , an , kɔtki abelic , goki abel thiine luai piny wiir , ke loiki ecueer , an , cuɛtki weu e abel mɔk piny wiir , e abel nɔm tueŋ ,

text: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers , Except these abide in the ship , ye cannot be saved .
text2: go Paulo bɛny de rem yɔɔk , ku yook alathkeer kɔk , yan , Te kene kɔcke reer e abelic , ke we cii dueere kony .

text: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat , and let her fall off .
text2: Go alathkeer wiin ke abel thiine ŋnith kɔɔth , ku palki a loony wiir .

text: And while the day was coming on , Paul besought them all to take meat , saying , This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting , having taken nothing .
text2: Na wen , akɔɔr piny ru , ke Paulo jɔ kɔc lɔŋ kedhie , yan , bik kecam thieep , yan , Nin kathieer ku ŋuan ke we rɛɛr ecaŋwaan , ke we cii cam .

text: Wherefore I pray you to take some meat : for this is for your health : for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you .
text2: Jaki cam , wek laŋ : yen aba wek piir : acin nhiem toŋ e raan tok bi maar e weyiic .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he took bread , and gave thanks to God in presence of them all : and when he had broken it , he began to eat .
text2: Na wen , aci kene lueel , ke jɔ kuin ci pam noom , ku jɔ Nhialic yɔɔk , an , Thieithieei , e keniim kedhie : na wen , ke wɛkic , ciɛm .

text: Then were they all of good cheer , and they also took some meat .
text2: Goki kepiɔth rom , ku nomki kecam ayadaŋ , ciɛmki .

text: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls .
text2: Wok kɔc e nu abelic wodhie , wok ee bot kaarou ku thierdherou ku dhetem .

text: And when they had eaten enough , they lightened the ship , and cast out the wheat into the sea .
text2: Na wen , acik cam acik kuɛth , ke ke jɔ agamɔ cuat wiir , ke abel bi pial .

text: And when it was day , they knew not the land : but they discovered a certain creek with a shore , into the which they were minded , if it were possible , to thrust in the ship .
text2: Te ci piny guɔ ru , agoki piny kuc , nɔn ee yen pinyou : acik nyin thiine yok , nyin de yɔu liɛɛt , goki lueel , an , bik them nɔn dueer kek abel yien yal thin .

text: And when they had taken up the anchors , they committed themselves unto the sea , and loosed the rudder bands , and hoised up the mainsail to the wind , and made toward shore .
text2: Na wen , acik weu wen e abel mɔk piny ŋuiɛth wei , pɛlike wiir , ku dakki wiin wen ee abel puk , ku jɔtki lupɔ nhial lupɔ nu e abel nɔm tueŋ , bi yom kuaath , goki cath lek te nu piny de liɛɛt .

text: And falling into a place where two seas met , they ran the ship aground ; and the forepart stuck fast , and remained unmoveable , but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves .
text2: Na wen , acik leu te nu kiɛɛr kaarou , ke ke jɔ abel tɔ lɔ biic ; go abel nɔm nuɛt piny ku jɔ kɔɔc aril , ku dhoŋ abel thar ne riɛl e apiɔɔk .

text: And the soldiers ' counsel was to kill the prisoners , lest any of them should swim out , and escape .
text2: Go alathkeer loŋden lueel , yan , bi kɔc ci mac nɔk , ke bi cien raan bi kuaŋ ke lɔ biic , go ban .

text: But the centurion , willing to save Paul , kept them from their purpose ; and commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea , and get to land :
text2: Go bɛny de rem ke peen , akɔɔr luɔi bi en Paulo kony , go lueel , yan , bi kɔc ŋic kuaŋ ro kɔn cuat wiir , lek biic :

text: And the rest , some on boards , and some on broken pieces of the ship . And so it came to pass , that they escaped all safe to land .
text2: ku bi kɔc ci doŋ lɔ biic , kɔk e pɛɛm niim , ku kɔk e ka ke abel niim . Goki lɔ biic aya , acik jɔ poth kedhie .

text: And when they were escaped , then they knew that the island was called Melita .
text2: Na wen , acuk guɔ poth , ke wo jɔ tuur ŋic nɔn cɔle yen Melita .

text: And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness : for they kindled a fire , and received us every one , because of the present rain , and because of the cold .
text2: Go kɔc de pinye agoki wo muk apiɛth : acik mac kooth , ku tɔki wook e kamaan wodhie , luɔi ci deŋ tuɛny , ku de piny wiir .

text: And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks , and laid them on the fire , there came a viper out of the heat , and fastened on his hand .
text2: Go Paulo dut toŋ e tiim kuany ; na wen , aci ke taau mɛɛc , ke deŋakook jɔ bɛn bei ne tuoc de mac , go ro dɛɛr e yecin .

text: And when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand , they said among themselves , No doubt this man is a murderer , whom , though he hath escaped the sea , yet vengeance suffereth not to live .
text2: Na wen , aci kɔc ke pinye kerac tiŋ , ke lɔ nornor e Paulo cin , ke ke jɔ rot yɔɔk kapac , yan , Raane e raan daŋ dhil nɔk ; ku ciɛk , an , ci ban abapditic , ka ŋoot ke bi aciɛɛnde nɔk .

text: And he shook off the beast into the fire , and felt no harm .
text2: Na wen , ke jɔ kerac tɛŋ mɛɛc tei , ku cin kerɛɛc ci yok .

text: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen , or fallen down dead suddenly : but after they had looked a great while , and saw no harm come to him , they changed their minds , and said that he was a god .
text2: Goki tiit , yan , bi lɔɔk but , ku nɔn bi en wiik , ku jɔ thou enɔnthiine : na wen , acik tiit ecaŋawen , ku acin kerɛɛc ci yok cik tiŋ , ke ke jɔ keniim bɛ cat , ku luelkti , yan , ee yath .

text: In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island , whose name was Publius ; who received us , and lodged us three days courteously .
text2: Ku ade dum ke raandit de tuur raan cɔl Publio , thiaak etɛɛn ; raane aci wo nyuooc apiɛth , tɔ wook e kamaanke e nin kadiak .

text: And it came to pass , that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux : to whom Paul entered in , and prayed , and laid his hands on him , and healed him .
text2: Ku dhɔt wun Publio piny ke juai , ku cii thien e yac dɔm aya : ago Paulo lɔ neem , le ɣon nu yen thin , le ku lɛŋ , ku jɔ ecin thany e yeguop , go tɔ waar .

text: So when this was done , others also , which had diseases in the island , came , and were healed :
text2: Na wen , ke kɔc kɔk de gup juai e tuuric ke ke jɔ bɛn , agoki dem :

text: Who also honoured us with many honours ; and when we departed , they laded us with such things as were necessary .
text2: agoki wo miɔɔc apiɛth ne kajuec ; na wen , ekool e jel wok , ke ke jɔ wo gam ka kɔɔrku kedhie .

text: And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria , which had wintered in the isle , whose sign was Castor and Pollux .
text2: Na wen , acuk pɛi lɛɛr kadiak , ke wo jɔ jal e Alekandaria , abel waan mai tuur , abel de Wɛɛt Acuek ci guaŋ e yenɔm tueŋ .

text: And landing at Syracuse , we tarried there three days .
text2: Agoku lɔ piny e Thurakoutha , ku jɔku reer etɛɛn e akool kadiak .

text: And from thence we fetched a compass , and came to Rhegium : and after one day the south wind blew , and we came the next day to Puteoli :
text2: Na wen , acuk jal etɛɛn , ke wo jɔ ro yal , ɣetku Regio : na ɣɔnmiak , ke wowic leu , agoku bɛn Puteoli ekool tok :

text: Where we found brethren , and were desired to tarry with them seven days : and so we went toward Rome .
text2: ade wɛɛtamathkuɔn cuk yok etɛɛn , acik wo cɔɔl , yan , buk reer e keek e akool kadherou : ku jɔku ɣet Roma aya .

text: And from thence , when the brethren heard of us , they came to meet us as far as Appiiforum , and The three taverns : whom when Paul saw , he thanked God , and took courage .
text2: Na wen , ke wɛɛtamathkuɔn nu Roma , te ci kek keda piŋ , ke ke jɔ bɛn bei bik wo bɛn loor aɣet Thuuk de Apio , ku Luek Kadiak : na wen , aci Paulo ke tiŋ , ke jɔ Nhialic leec , go yepiɔu rom .

text: And when we came to Rome , the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard : but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him .
text2: Na wen , acuk ɣet Roma , ke bɛny de rem jɔ kɔc ci mac yien bɛny de kalakon : go Paulo pɔl a rɛɛr etok , ke tht alathker tok tei .

text: And it came to pass , that after three days Paul called the chief of the Jews together : and when they were come together , he said unto them , Men and brethren , though I have committed nothing against the people , or customs of our fathers , yet was I delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans .
text2: Na wen , aci nin kadiak wan , ke Paulo cɔl kɔcdit ke Judai abik bɛn gueer te nu yen : te ci kek gueer , ke jɔ ke yɔɔk , yan , Wathii , ciɛk an , cin ater ca cak woke kɔc , ayi ciɛɛŋ de warkuɔ , ke yɛn ci yien Romai e Jeruthalem ke ya mac :

text: Who , when they had examined me , would have let me go , because there was no cause of death in me .
text2: na wen , acik a thieec , ke ke kɔɔr luɔi bi kek a pɔl , luɔi cin en kerɛɛc ca looi , ke bi ya nɔk .

text: But when the Jews spake against it , I was constrained to appeal unto Caesar ; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of .
text2: Na wen , aci Judai ye ŋak ater , ke ya jɔ dhil lɔŋ , an , ba kedi lɛɛr e Kaithar nɔm ; ku acin ke ban kɔcki lɔ gaany tei .

text: For this cause therefore have I called for you , to see you , and to speak with you : because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain .
text2: Ke e caal ɛn week ka , ee tiŋ ban week tiŋ , aguɔ jam wo week : ne baŋ de aŋɔth de Yithrael , yen a mɛce yɛn e jothe .

text: And they said unto him , We neither received letters out of Judaea concerning thee , neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee .
text2: Goki yɔɔk , yan , Acin awareek cuk yok ne kedu awareek bɔ Judaya , ku acin raan tok e wɛɛtakeckuɔ ci bɛn ene , raan cath ke jam rac ne kedu .

text: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest : for as concerning this sect , we know that every where it is spoken against .
text2: Wo de piɔth tei , luɔi bi wok ke ba lueel piŋ : ku na ereme , aŋicku nɔn lueele kɔc ater e yen e baai nɔm ebɛn .

text: And when they had appointed him a day , there came many to him into his lodging ; to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God , persuading them concerning Jesus , both out of the law of Moses , and out of the prophets , from morning till evening .
text2: Goki akol lueel , akool bi kek bɛn : na wen , ke kɔc juec e ke bɔ ɣon reer en thin , ago keek guieer wel , ku lek keek ka ke ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic , ciɛk ɣɔnmiak aɣet theen , anyuth keek ka ke Yecu , e loŋ de Motheyic ayi nebii yiic aya .

text: And some believed the things which were spoken , and some believed not .
text2: Go kɔc kɔk ka lueel gam , ku reec kɔk .

text: And when they agreed not among themselves , they departed , after that Paul had spoken one word , Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers ,
text2: Na wen , aken jamden rɔm , ke ke jɔ jal , te ci Paulo jam tok lueel , yan , Ee yic yen ke cii Weidit Ɣer lɛk warkuɔ ne nebi Yithaya ,

text: Saying , Go unto this people , and say , Hearing ye shall hear , and shall not understand ; and seeing ye shall see , and not perceive :
text2: yan , Lɔ tede kɔcke , lɔ ku luel , yan , Ciɛk an , piɛŋki , ka bak piŋ , ku acaki bi yokic : Ku ciɛk an , tieŋki , ka bak tiŋ , ku acaki bi gɔɔk :

text: For the heart of this people is waxed gross , and their ears are dull of hearing , and their eyes have they closed ; lest they should see with their eyes , and hear with their ears , and understand with their heart , and should be converted , and I should heal them .
text2: Piɔn e kɔcke aci guɔ cuai , Ku aciki e piŋ apiɛth e keyith , Ku acik kenyin hiɛɛn ; Ke ke cii bi daai e kenyin , Ku piŋki e keyith , Ku yokki jam e kepiɔth , Ku jɔki kepiɔth puk , Aguɔ keek tɔ dem .

text: Be it known therefore unto you , that the salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles , and that they will hear it .
text2: Yen ŋiɛc wek cooke , yan , Kuny e Nhialic aci tɔ yine Juoor , ku abik dhil piŋ .

text: And when he had said these words , the Jews departed , and had great reasoning among themselves .
text2: Na wen , aci kake lueel , ke Judai e ke jel , ke ke teer aret kapac .

text: And Paul dwelt two whole years in his own hired house , and received all that came in unto him ,
text2: Ago Paulo reer ɣonde guop ɣon ci kiir e weu , ku jɔ run thol kaarou , ke ye kɔc nyuooc kedhie kɔc e bɛn tede yen ,

text: Preaching the kingdom of God , and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ , with all confidence , no man forbidding him .
text2: aa ye keek guieer ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic , ku ye ke wɛɛt ne ka ke Bɛnydit Yecu Kritho ke ye nyin riɛl , ku acin raan e ye pɛn guieer .

text: Paul , a servant of Jesus Christ , called to be an apostle , separated unto the gospel of God ,
text2: Yɛn Paulo , lim de Yecu Kritho , raan ci cɔɔl , an , bi aa tuc , raan ci tɔɔu pei ne kede welpiɛth ke Nhialic ,

text: ( Which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures , )
text2: welpiɛth ci kɔn tɔ lueel nebiike ne kacigɔɔr yiic kaɣer yiic .

text: Concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord , which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh ;
text2: Welpiɛthke ee ka ke Wende , raan ci dhieeth e dhien e Dabid kuɛɛre ne kede guop ,

text: And declared to be the Son of God with power , according to the spirit of holiness , by the resurrection from the dead :
text2: ku ci tic ne riɛl dit nɔn ee yen Wen e Nhialic , ne kede Wei ke ɣɛɛrepiɔu , ne jon ci en rot jɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic ; yen Yecu Kritho Bɛnydiitda ,

text: By whom we have received grace and apostleship , for obedience to the faith among all nations , for his name :
text2: raan ci wo tɔ yok dhueeŋdepiɔu , ku yokku tuoc ci wo tooc , ne luɔi bi kɔc wel aa piŋ ku gamki keek e juoor yiic kedhie , ne baŋ de rinke .

text: Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ :
text2: Ku week aya , wek nu e keyiic , wek kɔc ci cɔɔl , bak aa kɔc ke Yecu Kritho ;

text: To all that be in Rome , beloved of God , called to be saints : Grace to you and peace from God our Father , and the Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: wek kɔc nu Roma wedhie , kɔc nhiɛɛr Nhialic , ku ci we cɔɔl , bak aa kɔc ɣerpiɔth . E dhueeŋdepiɔu tɔu e weyiic keke mat , e ke bɔ tede Nhialic Waada keke Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho .

text: First , I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all , that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world .
text2: Cook tueŋ ka , yɛn lec Nhialicdi ne Yecu Kritho e biakdun week wedhie , luɔi ci gamdun lueel e piny nɔm ebɛn .

text: For God is my witness , whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son , that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers ;
text2: Nhialic , Raan aa luooi ne weiki ne welpiɛth ke Wende , yen aye caatɔdi , ne luɛl aa yɛn cool e luel kedun acin pek e lɔŋdiyic ,

text: Making request , if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you .
text2: yɛn ee cool e lɔŋ , nɔn bi en dɛ te ban week kɛny e keny piɛth ekool bi ro yok ne kede piɔn e Nhialic , aguɔ bɛn tede week .

text: For I long to see you , that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift , to the end ye may be established ;
text2: We ca tak adi tieŋ week , aguɔ we miɔɔc e ke de wei , ke bi we tɔ kaac aril ;

text: That is , that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me .
text2: yen aye ke bi wo muk piɔth woke week etok , ne gam ci wo gam wodhie , gamdun week ayi gamdi .

text: Now I would not have you ignorant , brethren , that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you , ( but was let hitherto , ) that I might have some fruit among you also , even as among other Gentiles .
text2: Ku yɛn de piɔu luɔi ŋiɛc wek en , wek mithekɔckuɔ , nɔn can e lueel e yapiɔu raanjuec ne bɛn ban bɛn tede week , ku yɛn ci peen aɣet ci enɔɔne ; yɛn kɔɔr ke bi luɔk e weyiic ayadaŋ , acit man can e yok e juoor kɔk yiic .

text: I am debtor both to the Greeks , and to the Barbarians ; both to the wise , and to the unwise .
text2: Ayi Giriki ayi juur ceŋ e ciɛɛŋden , ayi kɔc pelniim , ayi kɔc kuc wel , keden anu e yayeth .

text: So , as much as in me is , I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also .
text2: Yen tede ka , yɛn cii dueer jai , yɛn dueer welpiɛth guieer week aya , wek kɔc nu Roma .

text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ : for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth ; to the Jew first , and also to the Greek .
text2: Yɛn cie yaar ne baŋ de welpiɛth ke Kritho ; kek aye riɛldiit e Nhialic riɛl e raan kony wei ebɛn raan ci gam , gɔl e Judai , mɛt Giriki thin aya .

text: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith : as it is written , The just shall live by faith .
text2: Piathepiɔu bɔ tede Nhialic aci nyuɔɔth e welke yiic ne gam bi kɔc gam ; acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Raan piɛthpiɔu abi aa piir ne gam .

text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men , who hold the truth in unrighteousness ;
text2: Ku agonhdiit e Nhialic agonh bɔ nhial aci nyuɔɔth e baŋ de rɛɛc reece kɔc Nhialic gam ku baŋ de luɔi rɛɛc ee kɔc looi , kɔc e yic waan cieen ne rac de kepiɔth .

text: Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them ; for God hath shewed it unto them .
text2: Ke dueere kɔc ŋic ne kede Nhialic aci jɔ lɔ gɔk tede keek ; acii Nhialic nyuoth keek .

text: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen , being understood by the things that are made , even his eternal power and Godhead ; so that they are without excuse :
text2: Ka ke Nhialic ɣɔn ciɛke piny , ka cii dueere tiŋ , ka cit riɛldɛn thɛɛr , ku luɔi ee yen Nhialic , kake ayeke ŋic egɔk , ayeke ŋic ne ka ci cueec . Ku acin ke bi kek rot kɔc ;

text: Because that , when they knew God , they glorified him not as God , neither were thankful ; but became vain in their imaginations , and their foolish heart was darkened .
text2: ku te ciɛk kek Nhialic ŋic , ka ciki e rieu e rieeu ee Nhialic rieu , ku ciki e leec ; acik aa kɔc e ɣɔric tak e kepiɔth , ago piɔndɛn piɔl ago cuɔl ecut .

text: Professing themselves to be wise , they became fools ,
text2: Aake ye rot tɔ ye kɔc pelniim , ku acik aa kɔc piɔlpiɔth ,

text: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man , and to birds , and fourfooted beasts , and creeping things .
text2: ku aake ye dhueeŋ de Nhialic cii dueer dhiap puk tɔki cit ke ci cueec cit guop raan bi dhiap , ayi diɛt , ayi lɛn de cok kaŋuan , ayi ka mol piny .

text: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts , to dishonour their own bodies between themselves :
text2: Yen aa kune Nhialic keek luɔi col ne dom ci ŋɔɔŋ de kerac ke dɔm , abik dhueeŋ de kegup riɔɔk e rot kapac ;

text: Who changed the truth of God into a lie , and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator , who is blessed for ever . Amen .
text2: kɔc ci yic de Nhialic puk tɔki ye lueth , ku yek ke ci cueec rieu ku yek luooi , awar Acieŋ e cak kaŋ , Raan cath ke athiɛɛi aɣet athɛɛr . Amen .

text: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections : for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature :
text2: Yen aa koone Nhialic keek abik kacol ecut aa kɔɔr e kepiɔth ; acakaa dieerken gup ayek ciɛɛŋ de tik puk , ciɛɛŋ e ciɛke piny , ku jɔki ciɛɛŋ e cii piny cak kɔɔr

text: And likewise also the men , leaving the natural use of the woman , burned in their lust one toward another ; men with men working that which is unseemly , and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet .
text2: Ku roor ayadaŋ , ayek luɔi de tik pɔl , luɔi de ciɛɛŋ e ciɛke piny , ago ŋɔɔŋ de roor ke dɔm aret , ago roor ke cii piɛth aa luoi roor , agoki kaŋ aa yok e kegup ka bi roŋ ne kerɛɛc cik wooc .

text: And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge , God gave them over to a reprobate mind , to do those things which are not convenient ;
text2: Rɛɛc ci kek ŋiny de Nhialic rɛɛc muk e kepiɔth , yen aa koone Nhialic keek , abik niim rac etaiwei , bik kaŋ aa looi ka cii roŋ e luɔi dueer raan ke looi .

text: Being filled with all unrighteousness , fornication , wickedness , covetousness , maliciousness ; full of envy , murder , debate , deceit , malignity ; whisperers ,
text2: Ayek piɔth thiaŋ ne racdepiɔu , dhoom , kɔɔr e kerac , wni de kalei , luɔi anyaak ; ayek thiaŋ ne tiɛɛl , nak , ater , rueeny , cuɔlepiɔu ; ayek mantuum ,

text: Backbiters , haters of God , despiteful , proud , boasters , inventors of evil things , disobedient to parents ,
text2: ayek kɔc e kɔc cak thook , kɔc man Nhialic , kɔc tat gup , kɔc dit piɔth , kɔc e rot leec , kɔc e cap rac cak , kɔc e ka ke kɔc e dhieth keek rɛɛc piŋ ,

text: Without understanding , covenantbreakers , without natural affection , implacable , unmerciful :
text2: kɔc cin niim , kɔc cin piɔth , kɔc e kaŋ riic , kɔc cin kokepiɔu .

text: Who knowing the judgment of God , that they which commit such things are worthy of death , not only do the same , but have pleasure in them that do them .
text2: Kɔcke , te ciɛk kek loŋ e lueel Nhialic ŋic , an , kɔc e ka cit ekake looi aroŋki e thuɔɔu , ke ke ŋoot e ke ye kake looi , ku yek piɔth rɔm ayadaŋ ne kɔc e ke looi .

text: Therefore thou art inexcusable , O man , whosoever thou art that judgest : for wherein thou judgest another , thou condemnest thyself ; for thou that judgest doest the same things .
text2: Yen enɔɔne , yin ŋadi , yin raan jany raan daŋ , yin cin te bi yin rot kɔc ; jany jieeny yin raan daŋ , yen a jieeny yin rot ; yin raan jany raan daŋ , yin ee kaŋ looi kamanke gup .

text: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things .
text2: Ku aŋicku jany ee Nhialic kɔc jɔɔny , kɔc e ka cit ekake looi , nɔn ee yen jany yic .

text: And thinkest thou this , O man , that judgest them which do such things , and doest the same , that thou shalt escape the judgment of God ?
text2: Ku yin ŋadi , yin raan e kɔc jɔɔny , kɔc e ka cit ekake looi , ku ye kamanke looi gup , ye lueel e yipiɔu , an , ba poth e jany bi Nhialic yi jɔɔny ?

text: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering ; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance ?
text2: Ku ci dhueeŋ de yenpiɔu guɔ biɔɔn dhueeŋ gok , ayi dit e liɛɛr e yenpiɔu , ku guom guum en kajuec , ku kuc dhueeŋ de Nhialic piɔu nɔn thel en yin tede puŋ bi yin yiniɔu puk ?

text: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God ;
text2: Ku yin , ne riɛl ril yin piɔu , ku ne rɛɛc reec yin puŋ de yinpiɔu , yin e rot kuɛt agonhdit aɣet akool e agɔth , akool e nyuoth bi loŋ piɛth ci Nhialic guiir rot nyuɔɔth .

text: Who will render to every man according to his deeds :
text2: Ago raan ebɛn gam kede , ke bi roŋ ke luɔidɛn ci looi .

text: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality , eternal life :
text2: Kɔc kɔɔr dhueeŋ ku rieeu ku luɔi cii kek bi dhiap , kɔc e kepiɛth looi ne iiɛɛr e kepiɔth , kek abi gam piir athɛɛr ;

text: But unto them that are contentious , and do not obey the truth , but obey unrighteousness , indignation and wrath ,
text2: ku kɔc e wel tɛɛr , kɔc reec yic gam , ku gamki kerac , kek abi diu de Nhialic piɔu yok keke agɔth ,

text: Tribulation and anguish , upon every soul of man that doeth evil , of the Jew first , and also of the Gentile ;
text2: ku yokki ketuc bi keek dhal ku acɔt bi kek niim acɔt , raan ebɛn raan e kerac looi , gɔl e Judai , mɛt Giriki thin aya ;

text: But glory , honour , and peace , to every man that worketh good , to the Jew first , and also to the Gentile :
text2: ku dhueeŋ ku rieeu ku mat , kek abi tɔu ne raan e kepiɛth looi , gɔl e Judai , mɛt Giriki thin aya .

text: For there is no respect of persons with God .
text2: Kueny ee kɔc kuany yiic aliu tede Nhialic .

text: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law : and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law ;
text2: Kɔc kedhie kɔc e kerac looi ku liu loŋ tede keek , kek abi maar ke cin loŋ ; ku kɔc kedhie kɔc e kerac looi , ku nu loŋ tede keek , kek abi jɔɔny ne loŋ .

text: ( For not the hearers of the law are just before God , but the doers of the law shall be justified .
text2: Ku acie kɔc piŋ loŋ tei , kek ee kɔc piɛthpiɔth tede Nhialic , ee kɔc e loŋ looi , kek abi tɔ ye kɔc piɛthpiɔth .

text: For when the Gentiles , which have not the law , do by nature the things contained in the law , these , having not the law , are a law unto themselves :
text2: Ku Juoor , kɔc cin loŋ cath ke keek , te ci ke ka nu e loŋic looi , ne ciɛɛŋ e ciɛke keek , kek gup , ciɛk , an , cin loŋ ŋicki , ke loŋ anu e kepiɔth .

text: Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts , their conscience also bearing witness , and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another ; )
text2: Anyoothki luɔi de loŋ nɔn ci e gɔɔr e kepiɔth , ku ŋiny de kepiɔth ee rɔm keke loŋ aya , agoki loŋ guiir e kepiɔth kapac , go raan rot gaany , ku nɔn de en te bi en ro kony , go ro kony ,

text: In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel .
text2: kool bi Nhialic ka cii kɔc moony jɔɔny ne Yecu Kritho , ne kede welkienpiɛth .

text: Behold , thou art called a Jew , and restest in the law , and makest thy boast of God ,
text2: Tiŋ , yin cɔl Judai , ku rɛɛre e loŋic , ku lec rot ne Nhialic ,

text: And knowest his will , and approvest the things that are more excellent , being instructed out of the law ;
text2: ku yin ŋic ke nu e yepiɔu , ku mite piɔu weke kapiɛth alaldhte , ku ci weet ne kede loŋ ,

text: And art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind , a light of them which are in darkness ,
text2: ku yin e ro ŋɔɔth nɔn ee yin raan e cɔɔr thel , ku ye many e kɔc nu tecol riaau ,

text: An instructor of the foolish , a teacher of babes , which hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law .
text2: ku nɔn ee yin raan e kɔc piɔlpiɔth wɛɛt , raan e miththiiakaŋ wɛɛt , luɔi muk yin tau de ŋinydekaŋ keke yic e loŋic ;

text: Thou therefore which teachest another , teachest thou not thyself ? thou that preachest a man should not steal , dost thou steal ?
text2: na yin enɔɔne , yin raan e raan daŋ wɛɛt , cii rot e wɛɛt ayadaŋ ? Yin ee kɔc yɔɔk , an , Duoki e kual , ku yin guop , ye kual ?

text: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery , dost thou commit adultery ? thou that abhorrest idols , dost thou commit sacrilege ?
text2: yin raan e kɔc yɔɔk , an , Duoki e lɔ ne dieer lei , ye lɔ we dieer lei yin ? Yin raan e yieth maan , ye luek ke Nhialic tɔ nhiany , yin ?

text: Thou that makest thy boast of the law , through breaking the law dishonourest thou God ?
text2: Yin raan e ro leec ne loŋ , ye Nhialic tɔ bni , yin , ne wac ee yin loŋ woocic ?

text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you , as it is written .
text2: Rin ke Nhialic ayeke laat e Juooric ne baŋdun , acit man ci e gɔɔr .

text: For circumcision verily profiteth , if thou keep the law : but if thou be a breaker of the law , thy circumcision is made uncircumcision .
text2: Cuɛl ee kepiɛth eyic , te dot yin loŋ apiɛth ; ku te ee yin raan e loŋ woocic , ke cuɛldu aci tɔ ye cien cuɛl .

text: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law , shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision ?
text2: Ku raan kene cueel , te ci en loŋ tiiŋic , ke cien cuɛlde cii bi tɔ ye cuɛl ?

text: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature , if it fulfil the law , judge thee , who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law ?
text2: Ku raan kene cueel , ne caŋ e dhiethe ye , te ci en loŋ aa tiiŋic , cii yi bi jɔɔny , yin raan e loŋ woocic , acakaa yin eye raan cath we jam ci gɔɔr ayi cuɛl ?

text: For he is not a Jew , which is one outwardly ; neither is that circumcision , which is outward in the flesh :
text2: Raan acie Judai nɔm , ten ee yen Judai e biak biic tei ; ayi cuɛl , acie ke ye tic e biak biic e raan guop tei .

text: But he is a Jew , which is one inwardly ; and circumcision is that of the heart , in the spirit , and not in the letter ; whose praise is not of men , but of God .
