text2: Raan ee ya Judai nɔm , ten ee yen Judai e yeyac thin ; ku cuɛl ee kede raan piɔu , ee kede wei , acie kede jam tei . Lɛcde acii bɔ tede kɔc , abɔ tede Nhialic .

text: What advantage then hath the Jew ? or what profit is there of circumcision ?
text2: Ku na Judai enɔɔne , war wɛɛr en kɔc akou ? Ku cuɛl , piathdɛn bi bɛɛi akou ?

text: Much every way : chiefly , because that unto them were committed the oracles of God .
text2: Piathden adit ne cok ebɛn . Ku cook dit , ki , tɛɛu ci wel ke Nhialic taau e kecin .

text: For what if some did not believe ? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect ?
text2: Ku na ciɛk dɛ kɔc kɔk kuc kaŋ dot , eeŋodaŋ ? Kuny kuc kek kaŋ dot , bi ŋiny ŋice Nhialic kaŋ dot tɔ cin naamde ?

text: God forbid : yea , let God be true , but every man a liar ; as it is written , That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings , and mightest overcome when thou art judged .
text2: Aci bi aa yen ! yeka , tɔ Nhialic e yic , ciɛk , an , ye raan ebɛn alueeth , acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Luɔi bi yi tɔ piɛthpiɔu ne wel lueel , Ku luɔi bi yin kɔc tiaam te guiire loŋdu .

text: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God , what shall we say ? Is God unrighteous who taketh vengeance ? ( I speak as a man )
text2: Ku na rac de wopiɔth , te ci en piath e Nhialic piɔu nyuɔɔth , buk ŋo lueel ? Rac Nhialic , te ci en kɔc luoi ketuc e agɔth ? ( yɛn jam cit man e raan tei . )

text: God forbid : for then how shall God judge the world ?
text2: Aci bi aa yen ! Te nu yen , ke Nhialic dueer loŋ de piny nɔm guiir adi ?

text: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory ; why yet am I also judged as a sinner ?
text2: Te ci yic de Nhialic ro ŋuak ne luenhdi , ago aa kede dhueeŋde , eeŋo ŋoote loŋdi ke guiir , aca ciet raan e kerac looi ?

text: And not rather , ( as we be slanderously reported , and as some affirm that we say , ) Let us do evil , that good may come ? whose damnation is just .
text2: Ku eeŋo cii wok kerac e looi , ke kepiɛth bi bɛn ? cit man ci wo cak thook , an , yok lueel , ku ye kɔc kɔk ŋak , yan , yok lueel . Kɔc luel en aroŋki ne gaak bi ke gɔk .

text: What then ? are we better than they ? No , in no wise : for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles , that they are all under sin ;
text2: Jɔ aa ŋo ? warku keek e piath ? Ei , acie yen ! wok e kɔc kɔn nyuooth , Judai ayi Giriki , nɔn reer kek e keracic kedhie ;

text: As it is written , There is none righteous , no , not one :
text2: acit man ci e goor , yan , Acin raan piɛthpiɔu nu , acin raan tok ;

text: There is none that understandeth , there is none that seeketh after God .
text2: Acin raan ŋic kaŋ , acin raan e Nhialic kɔɔr ;

text: They are all gone out of the way , they are together become unprofitable ; there is none that doeth good , no , not one .
text2: Acik ro yal wei kueer kedhie , acik aa kɔc baaŋ kedhie ; Acin raan e kepiɛth looi , acakaa raan tok aliu .

text: Their throat is an open sepulchre ; with their tongues they have used deceit ; the poison of asps is under their lips :
text2: Rolden ee raŋ ɣɔɔr nɔm ; Ayek jam erueeny e keliep ; Wirii de karac anu e kethook thin ;

text: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness :
text2: Acik thook thiaŋ e lam rac ku kɛcdepiɔu ; Aŋicki kat aret ne leu bi kek riɛm leu ;

text: Destruction and misery are in their ways :
text2: Riaak keke mumdenɔm anuki e kuɛɛrken yiic ;

text: And the way of peace have they not known :
text2: Kueer e mat acik guɔ kuc ;

text: There is no fear of God before their eyes .
text2: Ayek nyin cien rieeu de Nhialic .

text: Now we know that what things soever the law saith , it saith to them who are under the law : that every mouth may be stopped , and all the world may become guilty before God .
text2: Na enɔɔne , aŋicku , yan , ke lueel loŋ , aye lɛk kɔc rɛɛr e loŋic , ke kɔc e ke bi kethook ruɔɔt kedhie , ago piny nɔm ebɛn yiek yeth gaak e Nhialic nɔm .

text: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight : for by the law is the knowledge of sin .
text2: Acin raan toŋ bi tɔ piɛthpiɔu e yenɔm ne luɔi de loŋ ; ee loŋ yen e bii ŋiny de kerac .

text: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested , being witnessed by the law and the prophets ;
text2: Ku enɔɔne piathepiɔu bɔ tede Nhialic aci tic , ku liu loŋ thin , ku loŋ keke nebii ayek caatɔɔ ne yen ;

text: Even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe : for there is no difference :
text2: yen aye piathepiɔu bɔ tede Nhialic ne gam de Yecu Kritho , bi tede kɔc kedhie , ku bi e kɔc gup kedhie , kɔc gam ; ku acin puny ee kɔc pɔɔc yiic ;

text: For all have sinned , and come short of the glory of God ;
text2: kɔc acik kerac wooc kedhie , ku dɛkki ne dhuɛɛŋ de Nhialic ;

text: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus :
text2: ku ayeke tɔ piɛthpiɔth youyou ne dhueeŋ de yenpiɔu ne weer ci ke wɛɛr bei e Kritho Yecuyic ,

text: Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood , to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past , through the forbearance of God ;
text2: raan cii Nhialic taau e kɔc niim , an , bi aa ke bi Nhialic luk , ne gam bi kɔc riɛmde gam . Kene ee nyuoth nyooth en piath e yenpiɔu , ɣɔn pɛl en karɛc ci looi thɛɛr , ne liɛɛr e yenpiɔu ;

text: To declare , I say , at this time his righteousness : that he might be just , and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus .
text2: ku ye nyuoth nyooth en piath e yenpiɔu enɔɔne , nɔn ee yen bɛny e loŋ tiiŋic , ku ye bɛny e raan gam Yecu tɔ piɛthpiɔu ayadaŋ .

text: Where is boasting then ? It is excluded . By what law ? of works ? Nay : but by the law of faith .
text2: Lɛc dueer raan ro leec akou enɔɔne ? Aliu , aye nyaai . Ne loŋou ? Ne loŋ de luɔi ? Acie yen ; ne loŋ de gam , yen a nyiɛɛiye ye .

text: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law .
text2: Agoku jɔ lueel , yan , Raan aye tɔ piɛthpiɔu ne gam , te hiuwe luɔi de loŋ thin .

text: Is he the God of the Jews only ? is he not also of the Gentiles ? Yes , of the Gentiles also :
text2: Ku ye Nhialic de Judai kapac ? Cie Nhialic de Juoor ayadaŋ ? Ɣɛɛ , ee kede Juoor ayadaŋ ;

text: Seeing it is one God , which shall justify the circumcision by faith , and uncircumcision through faith .
text2: luɔi ee yen Nhialic toŋe , Raan bi kɔc ci cueel tɔ piɛthpiɔth ne gam , ku tɔ kɔc kene cueel piɛthpiɔth ne gam ayadaŋ .

text: Do we then make void the law through faith ? God forbid : yea , we establish the law .
text2: Enɔɔne , yok loŋ tɔ cin naamde ne gam ? Ei ! acie yen , wok tɔ loŋ kaac apiɛth .

text: What shall we say then that Abraham our father , as pertaining to the flesh , hath found ?
text2: Eeŋo buk jɔ lueel ne kede Abraɣam waada ne dhieth , ke ci yok ?

text: For if Abraham were justified by works , he hath whereof to glory ; but not before God .
text2: Ku te ci Abraɣam tɔ piɛthpiɔu ne luɔidɛn ci looi , ka cath keke ke dueer en ro leec ; ku acii rot dueer leec e Nhialic nɔm .

text: For what saith the scripture ? Abraham believed God , and it was counted unto him for righteousness .
text2: Kecigɔɔr e lueel adi ? Yan , Abraɣam e Nhialic gam , ago tɔ ye piathepiɔu tede yen .

text: Now to him that worketh is the reward not reckoned of grace , but of debt .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , raan e kaŋ looi , ke bi yok thin , acie tɔ ye kede dhueeŋ , aye tɔ ye ariop .

text: But to him that worketh not , but believeth on him that justifieth the ungodly , his faith is counted for righteousness .
text2: Ku raan cie luui , ku aye Raan gam , Raan e kɔc racpiɔth tɔ piɛthpiɔth , gam gɛm en aci tɔ ye piathepiɔu .

text: Even as David also describeth the blessedness of the man , unto whom God imputeth righteousness without works ,
text2: Acit man lueele Dabid athiɛɛi de raan cii Nhialic tɔ piɛthpiɔu , ke hiuwe luɔi thin ; yan ,

text: Saying , Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven , and whose sins are covered .
text2: Thieithieei ne kɔc ci pal karɛcken , Kɔc cii kakɛn cik wooc kum .

text: Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin .
text2: Thieithieei ne raan cii Bɛnydit bi yiek yeth kerac .

text: Cometh this blessedness then upon the circumcision only , or upon the uncircumcision also ? for we say that faith was reckoned to Abraham for righteousness .
text2: Bɔ athiɛɛiye enɔɔne e kɔc ci cueel gup kapac , ku bɔ e kɔc kene cueel gup aya ? Luɔi ci wok e lueel , an , Gam aye tɔ ye piathepiɔu tede Abraɣam .

text: How was it then reckoned ? when he was in circumcision , or in uncircumcision ? Not in circumcision , but in uncircumcision .
text2: E tɔ ye piathepiɔu adi ? ɣɔn ci e cueel , ku ye ɣɔn kene ye cueel ? Acie ɣɔn ci e cueel , ee ɣɔn kene ye cueel .

text: And he received the sign of circumcision , a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had yet being uncircumcised : that he might be the father of all them that believe , though they be not circumcised ; that righteousness might be imputed unto them also :
text2: Ago cuɛl noom , bi aa ŋiny bi ye ŋic , ku bi aa bɔt de piathepiɔu ci yok ne gam , piathepiɔu ɣɔn cath keke yen ɣɔn ŋoot en ke kene cueel . Ago aa wun kɔc gam kedhie , acakaa te keneke cueel , ke piathepiɔu bi tɔ ye keden ayadaŋ ;

text: And the father of circumcision to them who are not of the circumcision only , but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham , which he had being yet uncircumcised .
text2: ku ci aa wun cuɛl tede kɔc , acie kɔc ci cueel kapac , ee kɔc e waardan Abraɣam kuany cok e gam aya , gam waan cath keke yen te ŋoot en ke kene cueel .

text: For the promise , that he should be the heir of the world , was not to Abraham , or to his seed , through the law , but through the righteousness of faith .
text2: Luɛl ci ye kɔn lueel , an , bi aa raan bi piny lɔɔk lak , aaci bɔ tede Abraɣam ayi kaude ne loŋ , aa bɔ ne piathepiɔu ci yok ne gam .

text: For if they which are of the law be heirs , faith is made void , and the promise made of none effect :
text2: Ku tee ye kɔc ke loŋ kek bi piny lɔɔk lak , ke gam adi bi aa ɣɔric , ku ke ci kɔn lueel adi bi aa ke cin namde .

text: Because the law worketh wrath : for where no law is , there is no transgression .
text2: Ee loŋ yen e agɔth bɛɛi ; ku te cin loŋ , ke wac ee kɔc wooc aliu .

text: Therefore it is of faith , that it might be by grace ; to the end the promise might be sure to all the seed ; not to that only which is of the law , but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham ; who is the father of us all ,
text2: Yen abi yen ne gam , ke bi aa kede dhueeŋ ; ago ke ci kɔn lueel , ago dhil aa kede kaude ebɛn ; acie kede kɔc nu e loŋic kapac , ee kede kɔc nu e gamic aya , gam de Abraɣam , yen aye waarda wook wodhie ;

text: ( As it is written , I have made thee a father of many nations , ) before him whom he believed , even God , who quickeneth the dead , and calleth those things which be not as though they were .
text2: acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Yin ca tɔ ye wun juur juec ; aye waada e Nhialic nom , Raan ci gam , Raan e kɔc ci thou tɔ piir , ku ye Raan e kaliu tɔ cit ka nu .

text: Who against hope believed in hope , that he might become the father of many nations ; according to that which was spoken , So shall thy seed be .
text2: Yen Abraɣam , raan waan ci gam ne aŋɔth ŋɛɛth , ku ke e ŋɛɛth aliu , luɔi bi en aa wun juur juec , acit man e ke ci lueel , yan , Tau de kaudu , ki .

text: And being not weak in faith , he considered not his own body now dead , when he was about an hundred years old , neither yet the deadness of Sara ' s womb :
text2: Ku luɔi cii en e raan koor e gam , yen aken en e lueel ne kede yenguop , yan , e thɔl thou enɔɔne , te ci runke ciet nɔn e bɔt , ayi tɛɛm ci Thara tɛɛm , aken tak aya .

text: He staggered not at the promise of God through unbelief ; but was strong in faith , giving glory to God ;
text2: Ku ke ci Nhialic kɔn lueel aken piɔu ŋit e ye ne dak de gam , aci gam e gam ril , go Nhialic lɛc nɔm ,

text: And being fully persuaded that , what he had promised , he was able also to perform .
text2: aci gam edhoc , an , ke ci kɔn lueel , en Nhialic , abi leu ne luɔi .

text: And therefore it was imputed to him for righteousness .
text2: Yen aa tɔ ye piathepiɔu tede yen aya .

text: Now it was not written for his sake alone , that it was imputed to him ;
text2: Ku akene gɔɔr ne biak de yen etok , nɔn ci e tɔ ye kede ;

text: But for us also , to whom it shall be imputed , if we believe on him that raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead ;
text2: ee biak de wook aya , ku abi tɔ ye piathepiɔu tede wook aya , te gɛm wok Raan ci Yecu Bɛnydiitda jat nhial e kɔc ci thou yiic ;

text: Who was delivered for our offences , and was raised again for our justification .
text2: yen Yecu , raan ci ro gam thuɔɔu ne kede wac cuk wooc , ku beye jat nhial ke bi wo tɔ piɛthpiɔth .

text: Therefore being justified by faith , we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ :
text2: Ku enɔɔne , nɔn ci wo tɔ piɛthpiɔth ne gam , wok ci mat e Nhialic ne Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho ;

text: By whom also we have access by faith into this grace wherein we stand , and rejoice in hope of the glory of God .
text2: raan ci wo liep kueer le wok e dhueeŋic dhueeŋ tɔu wok thin enɔɔne , ne gam ci wok gam , agoku piɔth miɛt ne ŋath ŋɛɛth wok dhueeŋ de Nhialic .

text: And not only so , but we glory in tribulations also : knowing that tribulation worketh patience ;
text2: Ku acie yen etok , wok lec rot ne karil dhal wook ayadaŋ ; ne ŋiny ŋic wok en , an , Karil dhal wook , yen aye guomdekaŋ bɛɛi ;

text: And patience , experience ; and experience , hope :
text2: ku guomdekaŋ ee raan tɔ giu ; ku giu ci raan giu yen aye aŋɔth bɛɛi ;

text: And hope maketh not ashamed ; because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost which is given unto us .
text2: ku aŋɔth acii raan e tɔ yaar , luɔi ci nhieer e Nhialic luooŋ e wopiɔth ne Weidit Ɣer Wei ci gam wook .

text: For when we were yet without strength , in due time Christ died for the ungodly .
text2: Ku te waan ŋoot wok ke wok cin riɛl , ke jɔ Kritho thou ekooldɛn piɛth ne biak de kɔc kuc Nhialic rieu .

text: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die : yet peradventure for a good man some would even dare to die .
text2: Ku raan acii thuɔɔu dueer dap gam , ciɛk , an , e baŋ de raan piɛthpiɔu ; ku abi yien dɛ kɔc toktook kɔc dueer rot kuɔn thuɔɔu ne biak de raan piɛthpiɔu .

text: But God commendeth his love toward us , in that , while we were yet sinners , Christ died for us .
text2: Ku Nhialic e nhieerde nyuɔɔth , nhieer nhiɛɛr en wook , ne thon ci Yecu Kritho thou ne biakda , ku ŋootku e wo ye kɔc e kerac looi .

text: Much more then , being now justified by his blood , we shall be saved from wrath through him .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , nɔn ci wo guɔ tɔ piɛthpiɔth ne riɛmde , ke kuny bi en wo kony ne agɔth yen apiɔl awar ekene aret .

text: For if , when we were enemies , we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son , much more , being reconciled , we shall be saved by his life .
text2: Te ci wo maat ne Nhialic ne thon ci Wende thou , ke wo ŋoot e wo ye kɔc de ater , na enɔɔne , nɔn ci wo guɔ maat , ke kuny bi wo kony ne piir piir en , yen apiɔl awar ekene aret .

text: And not only so , but we also joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ , by whom we have now received the atonement .
text2: Ku acie yen etok , wok mit piɔth ayadaŋ e Nhialicic ne Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho , raan e yok wok mat ne yen .

text: Wherefore , as by one man sin entered into the world , and death by sin ; and so death passed upon all men , for that all have sinned :
text2: Yen tede ka , kerac aa bɔ e piny nɔm ne raan tok , ku bɔ thuɔɔu e kerac cok , go thuɔɔu jɔ loony e kɔc gup kedhie , luɔi ci kɔc kaŋ wooc kedhie : —

text: ( For until the law sin was in the world : but sin is not imputed when there is no law .
text2: ku te ɣon ŋoote loŋ ke liu , kerac aa nu e piny nɔm ; ku kerac acie taau e kɔc yieth te cin en loŋ .

text: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam to Moses , even over them that had not sinned after the similitude of Adam ' s transgression , who is the figure of him that was to come .
text2: Ku thuɔɔu yen aa ceŋ piny tei , gɔl te ɣɔn nu Adam ɣeet e Mothe , aa ceŋ kɔc acakaa kɔc ken kerac wooc cit man e kerɛɛc e looi Adam , yen acit raan ci lueel , an , bi bɛn .

text: But not as the offence , so also is the free gift . For if through the offence of one many be dead , much more the grace of God , and the gift by grace , which is by one man , Jesus Christ , hath abounded unto many .
text2: Ku miɔc youyou acii cit wac ci raan wooc . Ku na ci kɔc juec thou ne wac cii raan tok wooc , ke dhueeŋ de Nhialic ku miɔc bɔ ne dhueeŋ , dhueeŋ biiye raan tok , Yecu Kritho , ka cik ro ŋuak aret tede kɔc juec .

text: And not as it was by one that sinned , so is the gift : for the judgment was by one to condemnation , but the free gift is of many offences unto justification .
text2: Ku miɔc aya , acii cit luɔi de raan toŋ ci kaŋ wooc . Loŋ ci guiir e kɔc yiek yieth gaak ne baŋ de raan tok , ku miɔc youyou ee kɔc tɔ piɛth piɔth ne kajuec cik wooc .

text: For if by one man ' s offence death reigned by one ; much more they which receive abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness shall reign in life by one , Jesus Christ . )
text2: Ku na ci thuɔɔu piny cieŋ ne baŋ de raan tok , ne wac ci raan tok kedaŋ wooc , awar kene aret , kɔc yok dit de dhueeŋdepiɔu ku yeke miɔɔc ne piathepiɔu , kek abi piny cieŋ ne piir ne baŋ de raan tok , Yecu Kritho .

text: Therefore as by the offence of one judgment came upon all men to condemnation ; even so by the righteousness of one the free gift came upon all men unto justification of life .
text2: Yen tede ka , acit man ci loŋ de kɔc guiir kedhie , ne baŋ de goc de raan tok , ago kɔc yiek yieth gaak kedhie , yen acit yoŋ ci kɔc piathepiɔu yok kedhie ne baŋ de luɔi piɛth de raan tok , ke ke bi piir .

text: For as by one man ' s disobedience many were made sinners , so by the obedience of one shall many be made righteous .
text2: Acit man ci kɔc juec tɔ ye kɔc e kaŋ wooc ne dhaŋ ci raan tok loŋ dhɔŋic , yen acit luɔi bi kɔc juec tɔ piɛthpiɔth ne piŋ ci raan tok kaŋ piŋ .

text: Moreover the law entered , that the offence might abound . But where sin abounded , grace did much more abound :
text2: Ku loŋ aa bɔ thm , e luɔi bi wac ro ŋuak wac wɛɛce kɔc kaŋ ; ku te ci kerac ro ŋuak , ke dhueeŋdepiɔu ŋuak rot aret awar kerac ,

text: That as sin hath reigned unto death , even so might grace reign through righteousness unto eternal life by Jesus Christ our Lord .
text2: luɔi bi dhueeŋdepiɔu piny cieŋ ayadaŋ ne piathepiɔu aɣet piir athɛɛr ne Yecu Kritho Bɛnydiitda , cit man e ciɛɛŋ cieŋe kerac piny aɣet thuɔɔu .

text: What shall we say then ? Shall we continue in sin , that grace may abound ?
text2: Eeŋo daŋ buk lueel ? Buk aa cool e git kerac e luɔi , ke dhueeŋdepiɔu bi ro ŋuak ?

text: God forbid . How shall we , that are dead to sin , live any longer therein ?
text2: Acie yen ! Wok kɔc ci thou tede kerac , buk ŋoot e wo piir thin adi ?

text: Know ye not , that so many of us as were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death ?
text2: Kuocki ekene , yan , Wok wodhie , wok kɔc ci baptith ne kede Kritho Yecu , ke wok ci baptith ne kede thon ci en thou .

text: Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death : that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father , even so we also should walk in newness of life .
text2: Yen ka , wok ci tɔɔu ne yen etok e thuɔɔuwic ne baptinh ci wo baptith , luɔi bi wok tɔu e piir e piɛcku yokic aya , cit man e jon ci Kritho jat nhial e kɔc ci thou yiic ne dhueeŋ de Wun .

text: For if we have been planted together in the likeness of his death , we shall be also in the likeness of his resurrection :
text2: Ku te ci wo mat ne yen etok ne tau de thonde , ke wo bi mat ne yen etok ne tau de jon ci en ro jɔt aya .

text: Knowing this , that our old man is crucified with him , that the body of sin might be destroyed , that henceforth we should not serve sin .
text2: Aŋicku nɔn ci raandan thɛɛr piaat e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu keke yen etok , ke guop de kerac bi riaak , agoku cuo be aa him ke kerac .

text: For he that is dead is freed from sin .
text2: Raan ci thou aci wɛɛn bei e keracic .

text: Now if we be dead with Christ , we believe that we shall also live with him :
text2: Ku enɔɔne , te ci wok thou ne Kritho etok , ke wok gam nɔn bi wok piir ne yen etok .

text: Knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more ; death hath no more dominion over him .
text2: Aŋicku nɔn cii Kritho bi bɛ thou , luɔi ci e guɔ jat nhial e kɔc ci thou yiic ; thuɔɔu acii ye be aa cieŋ .

text: For in that he died , he died unto sin once : but in that he liveth , he liveth unto God .
text2: Ku thon ci en thou , ee tede kerac en e thou en raantok ; ku piir piir en , ee tede Nhialic en a piir en .

text: Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin , but alive unto God through Jesus Christ our Lord .
text2: Ayi week ayadaŋ , yak rot tɔ ye kɔc ci thou edhoc tede kerac , ku taki rot e kɔc piir tede Nhialic ne Kritho Yecu Bɛnydiitda .

text: Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body , that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof .
text2: Yen duo wek kerac tɔ ceŋ piny e wegup , gup de yiic thuɔɔu , abak ŋɔɔŋ ee kɔɔr aa gam .

text: Neither yield ye your members as instruments of unrighteousness unto sin : but yield yourselves unto God , as those that are alive from the dead , and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God .
text2: Ayi ka ke wegup duoki ke gam kerac , abik aa ka ke racdepiɔu bi kerac aa looi ; yak rot gam Nhialic cit man e kɔc ci bɛ piir e kɔc ci thou yiic , ku yak Nhialic gam ka ke wegup abik aa ka ke piathepiɔu .

text: For sin shall not have dominion over you : for ye are not under the law , but under grace .
text2: Kerac acii we bi aa cieŋ , luɔi ca wek e tɔu e loŋic , wek e tɔu e dhueeŋdepiɔuwic .

text: What then ? shall we sin , because we are not under the law , but under grace ? God forbid .
text2: Eeŋo daŋ ? Buk kerac aa looi nɔn liiu wok e loŋic , ku nɔn tɔu wok e dhueeŋdepiɔuwic ? Acie yen !

text: Know ye not , that to whom ye yield yourselves servants to obey , his servants ye are to whom ye obey ; whether of sin unto death , or of obedience unto righteousness ?
text2: Kuocki week , an , Raan ca wek rot tɔ ye liimke , abak ka ke yen aa looi , yen aya wek liimke , yen raan aa wek ka ke looi , nɔn ee yen kerɛɛc e thuɔɔu bɛɛi , ku nɔn ee yen piŋ aa wek ka ke Nhialic piŋ , yen aye piathepiɔu bɛɛi ?

text: But God be thanked , that ye were the servants of sin , but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you .
text2: Ku thieithieei Nhialic , waan thɛɛr wek aa ye him ke kerac , ku we ci tau de weet ci yien week aa gam e wepiɔth enɔɔne .

text: Being then made free from sin , ye became the servants of righteousness .
text2: Ku enɔn ci we luony bei e kerac cin , ke wek ci jɔ aa him ke piathepiɔu .

text: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh : for as ye have yielded your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity ; even so now yield your members servants to righteousness unto holiness .
text2: Yɛn jam cit man e raan tei , ne baŋ de kɔc de guopdun . Acit man ca wek ka ke wegup gam cuɔlepiɔu abik aa liimke , ku acak ke gam rɛɛceloŋ bik loŋ aa rɛɛc , yen abi ciet gam duɛɛr wek ka ke wegup gam piathepiɔu enɔɔne , abik aa liimke , ke bi ɣɛɛrepiɔu bɛɛi .

text: For when ye were the servants of sin , ye were free from righteousness .
text2: Waan aa wek liim ke kerac , ke we ye luony bei e piathepiɔu cin .

text: What fruit had ye then in those things whereof ye are now ashamed ? for the end of those things is death .
text2: Ee luɔk cit ŋo cak guɔ yok waan e kake yiic , ka ya wek gup yaar e keek enɔɔne ? Ee thuɔɔu yen e thok bi kake thok .

text: But now being made free from sin , and become servants to God , ye have your fruit unto holiness , and the end everlasting life .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , nɔn ci we luony bei e kerac cin , aguɔki aa him ke Nhialic , ke we de kakuon ci luɔk enɔɔne ka ke ɣɛɛrepiɔu , ku thok bi en thok ee piir athɛɛr .

text: For the wages of sin is death ; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord .
text2: Ariop de kerac yen aye thuɔɔu ; ku miɔc de Nhialic yen aye piir athɛɛr ne Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho .

text: Know ye not , brethren , ( for I speak to them that know the law , ) how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth ?
text2: Kuocki week enɔɔne , wek mithekɔckuɔ , ( yɛn jam woke kɔc ŋic loŋ ) , kuocki nɔn cieŋe loŋ raan anande te piir en ?

text: For the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to her husband so long as he liveth ; but if the husband be dead , she is loosed from the law of her husband .
text2: Tiiŋ de nɔm monyde acii loŋ mac e monyde lɔɔm anande te piir en ; ku na thou monyde , ka ye luony bei ne loŋ de monyde .

text: So then if , while her husband liveth , she be married to another man , she shall be called an adulteress : but if her husband be dead , she is free from that law ; so that she is no adulteress , though she be married to another man .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , te ŋoote monyde ke piir , ku beye thiaak e mony daŋ , ka bi tɔ ye tiiŋ ci lɔ keke mony lei ; ku na thou monyde , ka ci dɔk yeth e loŋeyin , ago cuo be ye tɔ ye tiiŋ ci lɔ keke mony lei , acakaa yen e beye thiaak e mony daŋ .

text: Wherefore , my brethren , ye also are become dead to the law by the body of Christ ; that ye should be married to another , even to him who is raised from the dead , that we should bring forth fruit unto God .
text2: Ku week aya , wek mithekɔckuɔ , we ci tɔ thou tede loŋ , ne guop de Kritho ; luɔi bi raan daŋ we thiaak , yen e raan waan ci jɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic , luɔi bi wok luɔk ne kede Nhialic .

text: For when we were in the flesh , the motions of sins , which were by the law , did work in our members to bring forth fruit unto death .
text2: Ku te waan reer wok e ka ke guopic , ke ŋɔɔŋ ee wok ŋɔŋ e kerac , ke e bɔ ne loŋ , aa ye luɔide looi e ka ke wogup , bik luɔk ne kede thuɔɔu .

text: But now we are delivered from the law , that being dead wherein we were held ; that we should serve in newness of spirit , and not in the oldness of the letter .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , wo ci luony bei e loŋ cin , ke waan ci wo mac thin e guɔ thou ; luɔi bi wok kaŋ aa looi ne wei cuk piac yok , ku cuku kaŋ e looi ne kathɛɛr ci gɔɔr e loŋic .

text: What shall we say then ? Is the law sin ? God forbid . Nay , I had not known sin , but by the law : for I had not known lust , except the law had said , Thou shalt not covet .
text2: Eeŋo buk jɔ lueel ? Ee kerac en loŋ ? Ei ! Acie yen . Ku adi ca kerac jɔ kuc , tee loŋ liu ; ku adi ca ŋɔɔŋ de kerac kuc , tee kene loŋ lueel , yan , Du kalei e woi e yiniɔu .

text: But sin , taking occasion by the commandment , wrought in me all manner of concupiscence . For without the law sin was dead .
text2: Kerac , te ci en kooldɛn piɛth jɔ yok , ne cook de loŋ ci yinn wook , ke jɔ wni de kalei ebɛn tɔ lɔ e yapiɔu ; ku te liiuwe loŋ , kerac ee thou .

text: For I was alive without the law once : but when the commandment came , sin revived , and I died .
text2: Ku yɛn , yɛn ee piir waan hiuwe loŋ ; ku te ci cook de loŋ bɛn , ke kerac e bɛ piir , aguɔ thou yɛn ;

text: And the commandment , which was ordained to life , I found to be unto death .
text2: guɔ cook de loŋ ci yien kɔc ne kede piir , guɔ yok aye kede thuɔɔu ;

text: For sin , taking occasion by the commandment , deceived me , and by it slew me .
text2: kerac aci akoldɛn piɛth jɔ yok ne cook de loŋ , go ya math , ago ya nɔk e yen .

text: Wherefore the law is holy , and the commandment holy , and just , and good .
text2: Yen tede ka , loŋ aɣeric eyic , ku cook de loŋ aɣeric , ku diik , ku piɛth .

text: Was then that which is good made death unto me ? God forbid . But sin , that it might appear sin , working death in me by that which is good ; that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , ci kepiɛth ro guɔ puk aye thuɔɔu tede yɛn ? Ei ! Acie yen . Ee kerac , luɔi bi en guɔ tic nɔn ee yen kerac guop , yen aa luui ɛn thuɔɔu ne kepiɛth ; ke kerac bi jɔ rac etaiwei ne loŋ .

text: For we know that the law is spiritual : but I am carnal , sold under sin .
text2: Loŋ aŋicku nɔn ee yen kede wei ; ku yɛn ee raan e piny tei , yɛn ci ɣaac ke yɛn ci aa lim de kerac .

text: For that which I do I allow not : for what I would , that do I not ; but what I hate , that do I .
text2: Ku ke ya looi enɔɔne , aca gam nɔn ee yen luɔidi ; ku ke nu e yapiɔu , an , ba ya looi , aca ye looi ; ee ke maan , yen aya looi .

text: If then I do that which I would not , I consent unto the law that it is good .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , te luɔɔi ɛn ke liu e yapiɔu , yɛn gam loŋ nɔn ee yen piɛth .

text: Now then it is no more I that do it , but sin that dwelleth in me .
text2: Yen acii be aa yɛn e ye looi , ee kerɛɛc rɛɛr e yayic , aye ye looi .

text: For I know that in me ( that is , in my flesh , ) dwelleth no good thing : for to will is present with me ; but how to perform that which is good I find not .
text2: Ku aŋiɛc nɔn cin en kepiɛth toŋ rɛɛr e yayic ; ( ee guopdiyic en luɛɛl ; ) ku piɔn duɛɛr ɛn kaŋ looi acath ke yɛn , ku ke ban kepiɛth looi , aba thol , akɛn guɔ yok .

text: For the good that I would I do not : but the evil which I would not , that I do .
text2: Ku kepiɛth nu e yapiɔu , an , ba ya looi , aca ye looi ; ku kerɛɛc liu e yapiɔu , yen aya looi .

text: Now if I do that I would not , it is no more I that do it , but sin that dwelleth in me .
text2: Ku na ya ke liu e yapiɔu looi , ka cii be aa yɛn e ye looi , ee kerɛɛc rɛɛr e yayic , yen aye ye looi .

text: I find then a law , that , when I would do good , evil is present with me .
text2: Yɛn e loŋ daŋ yok enɔɔne , an , Kool dɛ yɛn piɔu luɔi luɔɔi ɛn kepiɛth , ke kerac tɔu keke yɛn .

text: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man :
text2: Yɛn mit piɔu woke loŋ de Nhialic e yayin thin ;

text: But I see another law in my members , warring against the law of my mind , and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members .
text2: ku yɛn e loŋ daŋ yok e ka ke yɛnguop yiic , loŋ de ater keke loŋ de yanɔm , loŋ e yɛn thel cit man e raan ci peec abi ya tɔ ye lim de loŋ de kerac , loŋ nu e ka ke yɛnguop yiic .

text: O wretched man that I am ! who shall deliver me from the body of this death ?
text2: Amawoou yɛn kuany nyin oou ! Eeŋa bi a luak bei ne guop cath ke thuɔɔuweyic ?

text: I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord . So then with the mind I myself serve the law of God ; but with the flesh the law of sin .
text2: Yɛn lec Nhialic ne Yecu Kritho Bɛnydiitda . Yen ka , yɛn guop , yɛn woke nɔmdi , yɛn ee ka ke loŋ de Nhialic looi ; ku woke guopdi , yɛn ee ka ke loŋ de kerac looi .

text: There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus , who walk not after the flesh , but after the Spirit .
text2: Yen ka , acin gaak be nu e kɔc yieth kɔc nu e Kritho Yecuyic , kek kɔc cie tɔu e tau de guop , ayek tɔu e tau de wei .

text: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death .
text2: Ku loŋ de Wei ke piir , loŋ nu e Kritho Yecuyic , aci a luony bei ne loŋ de kerac keke thuɔɔu .

text: For what the law could not do , in that it was weak through the flesh , God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh , and for sin , condemned sin in the flesh :
text2: Ke ci loŋ dhal e luɔi , ne kɔc kɔɔc en ne baŋ de guop , acii Nhialic ŋiec looi , waan tooc en Wende guop , ke cath ke guop cit guop deyic kerac , ku aa tuuc ne baŋ de kerac , ago kerɛɛc nu e guopic gɔk ,

text: That the righteousness of the law might be fulfilled in us , who walk not after the flesh , but after the Spirit .
text2: luɔi bi ke lueel loŋ aa tiiŋic e woyiic , wok kɔc cie tɔu e tau de guop , wok ee tɔu e tau de Wei .

text: For they that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh ; but they that are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit .
text2: Kɔc e tɔu e tau de guop ayek ka ke guop tak ; ku kɔc e tɔu e tau de Wei ayek ka ke Wei tak .

text: For to be carnally minded is death ; but to be spiritually minded is life and peace .
text2: Taŋ ee raan ka ke guop tak yen aye thuɔɔu ; ku taŋ ee raan ka ke Wei tak yen aye piir ku ye mat .

text: Because the carnal mind is enmity against God : for it is not subject to the law of God , neither indeed can be .
text2: E luɔi de yen ater keke Nhialic , yen taŋ ee raan ka ke guop tak ; ku acii kede loŋ de Nhialic e piŋ , ku acie leu e piŋ ayadaŋ ;

text: So then they that are in the flesh cannot please God .
text2: yen ka , kɔc e tɔu e tau de guop aciki Nhialic dueer tɔ mit piɔu .

text: But ye are not in the flesh , but in the Spirit , if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you . Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ , he is none of his .
text2: Ku week , wek cie tɔu e tau de guop , ee tau de Wei yen tau wek , te reere Wei ke Nhialic e weyiic eyic . Ku na de raan nu raan cii cath ke Wei ke Kritho , ka cie kede .

text: And if Christ be in you , the body is dead because of sin ; but the Spirit is life because of righteousness .
text2: Ku te nu Kritho e weyiic , ke guop e thou ne baŋ de kerac , ku piir Wei ne baŋ de piathepiɔu .

text: But if the Spirit of him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwell in you , he that raised up Christ from the dead shall also quicken your mortal bodies by his Spirit that dwelleth in you .
text2: Ku te reere Wei e weyiic , ke Wei ke Raan waan ci Yecu jat nhial e kɔc ci thou yiic , te reer kek e weyiic , ke Raan ci Kritho jat nhial e kɔc ci thou yiic , yen abi week tɔ piir gup gup de yiic thuɔɔu , ne riel e Weikɛn e reer e weyiic .

text: Therefore , brethren , we are debtors , not to the flesh , to live after the flesh .
text2: Yen ka , wek mithekɔckuɔ , luɔi bi wok ka ke guop aa looi , acii nu e woyieth ;

text: For if ye live after the flesh , ye shall die : but if ye through the Spirit do mortify the deeds of the body , ye shall live .
text2: ku te ya wek ka ke guop looi , ke we bi thou ; ku te ya wek luɔi de guop yiekic thuɔɔu ne riɛl e Wei , ke we bi piir .

text: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God , they are the sons of God .
text2: Kɔc ebɛn kɔc ee thel e Wei ke Nhialic , kek aye mith ke Nhialic .

text: For ye have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear ; but ye have received the Spirit of adoption , whereby we cry , Abba , Father .
text2: Wek kene bɛ gam piɔn e him , piɔn riɔc , wek ci gam piɔn e mith ci muk , piɔn e wo tɔ cot , an , Abba , Waada .

text: The Spirit itself beareth witness with our spirit , that we are the children of God :
text2: Weidit gup kek aye jam mat ne piɔthkuɔ etok , alekki wook nɔn ee wok mith ke Nhialic ;

text: And if children , then heirs ; heirs of God , and joint - heirs with Christ ; if so be that we suffer with him , that we may be also glorified together .
text2: ku ten ee wok mith , ke wo bi kaŋ lɔɔk lak ; wok ee mith bi ka ke Nhialic lɔɔk lak , ku lookku kaŋ rɔm ne Kritho etok ; na yok kaŋ guum ne yen etok , ke wo bi gam dhueeŋ etok .

text: For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed in us .
text2: Cook ca kueen e yapiɔu ka , an , Karɛc yok guum enɔɔne , acinki naamden , aciki dueere kieet e dhueeŋ bi dap nyuoth wook .

text: For the earnest expectation of the creature waiteth for the manifestation of the sons of God .
text2: Ka ci cak ebɛn ayek kaŋ ŋɔɔth aret , atitki kool e tic bi wɛɛt ke Nhialic tic .

text: For the creature was made subject to vanity , not willingly , but by reason of him who hath subjected the same in hope ,
text2: Ku ka ci cak ebɛn acike taau e ɣɔric cok , acie kede piɔnden etok , ku e kede piɔn e Raan ɣon tɛɛu keek e kaŋ cok , ne ŋath bi kek e ŋɔɔth ,

text: Because the creature itself also shall be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the glorious liberty of the children of God .
text2: an , bi ka ci cak luony bei e himic , liim e dhiap de kaŋ , agoki aa cath e kede yenhden ne cath ee mith ke Nhialic cath e dhueeŋ .

text: For we know that the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in pain together until now .
text2: Ku ka ci cak ebɛn aŋicku nɔn keŋ kek etok ku reme kegup acit man e tiiŋ kɔɔr dhieth aɣet ci enɔɔne .

text: And not only they , but ourselves also , which have the firstfruits of the Spirit , even we ourselves groan within ourselves , waiting for the adoption , to wit , the redemption of our body .
text2: Ku acie keek kapac , ee wok aya , wok kɔc cath ne Wei , biak ci kɔn gam wook , wok gup , wok keŋ e woyiic , wok ee muŋ bi wo muk tiit , yen aye wɛɛr bi wo wɛɛr gup bci .

text: For we are saved by hope : but hope that is seen is not hope : for what a man seeth , why doth he yet hope for ?
text2: Wo ci kony wci ne aŋɔth ŋathku . Ku ke ci raan tiŋ acie tɔ ye aŋɔth . Ke ci raan tiŋ eeŋo dueere ye bɛ ŋɔɔth ?

text: But if we hope for that we see not , then do we with patience wait for it .
text2: Ku na ŋathku ka kenku tiŋ , yen abuk aa tiit ne piɔn lir .

text: Likewise the Spirit also helpeth our infirmities : for we know not what we should pray for as we ought : but the Spirit itself maketh intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered .
text2: Ku Weidit ee wo kony aya ne kɔc kɔɔc wok ; lɔŋ bi wok lɔŋ apiɛth akucku , ku Weidit guop yen aye lɔŋ ne biakda ne keŋ cii dueere lueel .

text: And he that searcheth the hearts knoweth what is the mind of the Spirit , because he maketh intercession for the saints according to the will of God .
text2: Ku Raan e kɔc woi piɔth thin ee piɔn e Weidit ŋic , tau tɔu en , luɔi ee yen lɔŋ ne biak de kɔc ɣerpiɔth ne kede piɔn e Nhialic .

text: And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God , to them who are the called according to his purpose .
text2: Cook ŋicku ki , an , Kerieec ebɛn ee mat etok , bi kɔc nhiaar Nhialic bɛn luoi kepiɛth , kɔc ci cɔɔl e kede piɔnde .

text: For whom he did foreknow , he also did predestinate to be conformed to the image of his Son , that he might be the firstborn among many brethren .
text2: Ku kɔc waan ci kɔn ŋic tueŋ , kek aa kɔn lɔc e yen , bike tɔ kit gup ne Wende , luɔi bi en aa kɛɛi e mith juec yiic mith ke Wun .

text: Moreover whom he did predestinate , them he also called : and whom he called , them he also justified : and whom he justified , them he also glorified .
text2: Ku kɔc ɣɔn ci kɔn lɔc , kek ayeke cɔɔl e yen , ku kɔc ci cɔɔl e ye , kek ayeke tɔ piɛthpiɔth e yen , ku kɔc ci tɔ piɛthpiɔth , kek ayeke gam dhueeŋ e yen .

text: What shall we then say to these things ? If God be for us , who can be against us ?
text2: Buk ŋo jɔ lueel ne kede kake ? Te mɛte Nhialic ke wook , ke eeŋa bi dɛ ater ke wook ?

text: He that spared not his own Son , but delivered him up for us all , how shall he not with him also freely give us all things ?
text2: Yen Nhialic , Raan waan ken Wende peen , Wende guop , ku aci e yien Raan thuɔɔu e biakda wook wodhie , eekaŋo cii en wo bi miɔɔc e kaŋ kedhie aya ne yen etok e dhueeŋ ?

text: Who shall lay any thing to the charge of God ' s elect ? It is God that justifieth .
text2: Eeŋa bi kɔc cii Nhialic lɔc lɔ gaany ? Ee Nhialic yen aye Raan e keek tɔ cin yieth gaak ;

text: Who is he that condemneth ? It is Christ that died , yea rather , that is risen again , who is even at the right hand of God , who also maketh intercession for us .
text2: Eeŋa bi wo yiek yieth gaak ? Kritho raan waan ci thou , yeka , aŋuan bi wok e lueel , an , raan ci bɛ jat nhial , raan nu e baŋ cueny de Nhialic , yen aye raan e lɔŋ ne biakda aya .

text: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ ? shall tribulation , or distress , or persecution , or famine , or nakedness , or peril , or sword ?
text2: Eeŋa bi wo paak ne nhieer e Kritho ? Keril gumku bi leu , ayi kerɛɛc dhal wook , ayi yoŋ , ayi cɔk , ayi cien cin wokɔɔth lupɔɔ , ayi riɔɔc , ayi tɔŋ , de toŋ bi leu e keyiic ?

text: As it is written , For thy sake we are killed all the day long ; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter .
text2: Acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Ne biakdu wok e nɔk ekool ebɛn ; Wo ci tɔ ye thok bi tem rot .

text: Nay , in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us .
text2: Acie yen , ku ne kake yiic kedhie wok ee joot e tɔŋ tiaam aret ne riɛl e raan ci wo nhiaar .

text: For I am persuaded , that neither death , nor life , nor angels , nor principalities , nor powers , nor things present , nor things to come ,
text2: Cook ŋiɛc e yapiɔu aret ki , an , Thuɔɔu , ayi piir , ayi tuuc bɔ nhial , ayi bany , ayi riɛl , ayi ka ke enɔɔne , ayi ka bi nu wadaŋ ,

text: Nor height , nor depth , nor any other creature , shall be able to separate us from the love of God , which is in Christ Jesus our Lord .
text2: ayi bɛɛr bɛɛre kaŋ , ayi tethuth , ayi te de yen daŋ ci cak , acin tok e kake yiic toŋ bi pɛɛk leu , pɛɛk bi en wo paak ne nhieer e Nhialic , nhieer nu e Kritho Yecu Bɛnydiitdayin .

text: I say the truth in Christ , I lie not , my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Ghost ,
text2: Ee yin en luɛɛl e Krithoyic , yɛn cii lueth tor , ku jam ca yok e yapiɔu ee caatɔ keke yɛn etok e Weidit Ɣer yiic ,

text: That I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart .
text2: yan , Yɛn e piɔu jiɛth aret ku ya coole dhiau piɔu acin pek .

text: For I could wish that myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren , my kinsmen according to the flesh :
text2: Ku aduɛɛr lueel e yapiɔu , an , adi miɛt piɔu tee ya ye guop dɛ aciɛɛn bi ya cieec e Kritho nɔm ne baŋ de mithekɔckuɔ , kɔc rɛɛn wok ne dhienh e dhieethe wook .

text: Who are Israelites ; to whom pertaineth the adoption , and the glory , and the covenants , and the giving of the law , and the service of God , and the promises ;
text2: Ayek kɔc ke Yithrael , ku muŋ ci Nhialic ke muk e dhueeŋ ee keden , ayi looŋ ci mac , ayi tɛɛu ci loŋ tau piny , ku luɔi de ka ke Nhialic , ku ka ci kɔn lueel , an , bike gam keek , ayek kaken ;

text: Whose are the fathers , and of whom as concerning the flesh Christ came , who is over all , God blessed for ever . Amen .
text2: kuarkuɔ ayek kaken , ayi Kritho aya abɔ ne keek ne dhienh e dhieethe ye , raan nu e kaŋ niim kedhie , ku ye Nhialic de guop athiɛɛi athɛɛr . Amen .

text: Not as though the word of God hath taken none effect . For they are not all Israel , which are of Israel :
text2: Ku akɛn lueel , nɔn cin en ke ci wel ke Nhialic leu , acie yen . Ku aciki e Yithiael niim kedhie , kek kɔc ke Yithrael ,

text: Neither , because they are the seed of Abraham , are they all children : but , In Isaac shall thy seed be called .
text2: ku aciki e mith ke Abraɣam kedhie , e luɔi ee Abraɣam kuɛɛreden ; ku aye lueel , yan , Kaudu abi kuɛɛn e Yithakic .

text: That is , They which are the children of the flesh , these are not the children of God : but the children of the promise are counted for the seed .
text2: Tharde ki , yan , Mith ke guop acie keek ee mith ke Nhialic , ee mith ke ka ci kɔn lueel , keek ayeke tɔ ye kau .

text: For this is the word of promise , At this time will I come , and Sara shall have a son .
text2: Jam ci kɔn lueel ki , yan , Eleruoon , acit piny ekene , ke yɛn bi bɛn , ku Thara abi nɔm dɛ wende .

text: And not only this ; but when Rebecca also had conceived by one , even by our father Isaac ;
text2: Ku acie kene etok ; Rebeka aya , te ci en acuek yok ne mony tok , yen aye Yithaak waada ,

text: ( For the children being not yet born , neither having done any good or evil , that the purpose of God according to election might stand , not of works , but of him that calleth ; )
text2: ku te ŋoote mithke ke ke kene guɔ dhieeth , ku acin ke cik looi ayi kepiɛth ayi kerac , luɔi bi loŋ cii Nhialic lueel e yepiɔu ne kede lɔny lɔc en kɔc , luɔi bi en tɔu tede , ku acie ne kede ke cii raan looi , ee jam e Raan e kɔc cɔɔl ;

text: It was said unto her , The elder shall serve the younger .
text2: ke jɔ lɛk en , an , Mɛnh dit abi aa lim de mɛnh koor .

text: As it is written , Jacob have I loved , but Esau have I hated .
text2: Acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Jakop aca nhiaar guop , ku maan Ethau .

text: What shall we say then ? Is there unrighteousness with God ? God forbid .
text2: Eeŋo buk jɔ lueel ? De jam rɛɛc cath ke Nhialic ? Ei , acie yen !

text: For he saith to Moses , I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy , and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion .
text2: Ku aci lɛk Mothe , yan , Yɛn bi piɔu kok woke raan ca tak , an , ba piɔu kok wo yen , ku ba apiɔu wɛl raan ca tak , an , ba apiɔu wɛl en .

text: So then it is not of him that willeth , nor of him that runneth , but of God that sheweth mercy .
text2: Yen ka , acie jam de raan kɔɔr kedaŋ aret , ku acie jam de raan lui aret , ee jam de Nhialic , Raan cath keke kokepiɔu .

text: For the scripture saith unto Pharaoh , Even for this same purpose have I raised thee up , that I might shew my power in thee , and that my name might be declared throughout all the earth .
text2: Ku kecigɔɔr aci lɛk Paro , yan , Yen kede ekene yen aa jat ɛn yin nhial , ke ya bi riɛldi nyuɔɔth e yiyic , ke bi rinki aa lueel e piny nɔm ebɛn .

text: Therefore hath he mercy on whom he will have mercy , and whom he will he hardeneth .
text2: Yen tede ka , ee piɔu kok keke raan nu e yepiɔu , ku raan ci tak , an , bi tɔ ril nɔm , ke tɔ ril nɔm .

text: Thou wilt say then unto me , Why doth he yet find fault ? For who hath resisted his will ?
text2: Yin bi a jɔ thieec , yan , Eeŋo daŋ ŋoot en ke ye kɔc gɔk ? Eeŋa dueer en pɛn kede piɔnde ?

text: Nay but , O man , who art thou that repliest against God ? Shall the thing formed say to him that formed it , Why hast thou made me thus ?
text2: Ku yin ŋadi , yee ŋa , raan beer Nhialic thok ? Ke ci cueec bi raan e cuec en yɔɔk , yan , Eeŋo e yin a looi aya ?

text: Hath not the potter power over the clay , of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour , and another unto dishonour ?
text2: Ku cueny e tony , cii cath ke riɛl bi en tony cueec kaarou ne tiɔm toŋe , ee toony tok kede dhueeŋ , ku cii toony tok e kede dhueeŋ ?

text: What if God , willing to shew his wrath , and to make his power known , endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath fitted to destruction :
text2: Ku na Nhialic , te de yen piɔu luɔi bi en agɔnhde nyuɔɔth , ku tɔ riɛlde ŋic , eeŋodaŋ , acakaa yen eci tony ke agɔth guum ne liɛɛr diit e yenpiɔu , kek tony ci roŋ ne riaak bi ke riɔɔk ;

text: And that he might make known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy , which he had afore prepared unto glory ,
text2: ku bi dit e dhueeŋde nyuɔɔth ne tony ke kokdepiɔu , tony ci kɔn looi , bik aa ka ke dhueeŋ ,

text: Even us , whom he hath called , not of the Jews only , but also of the Gentiles ?
text2: ee wook gup , wok kɔc ci cɔɔl , aci e Judaiyic etok , e Juooric aya ?

text: As he saith also in Osee , I will call them my people , which were not my people ; and her beloved , which was not beloved .
text2: Acit man ci e lueel ne Kothea , yan , Yɛn bi kɔc tɔ ye kɔcki , kɔc e cie kɔcki waan ; Ku ta raan e raan nhiaar , raan e cie nhiaar waan .

text: And it shall come to pass , that in the place where it was said unto them , Ye are not my people ; there shall they be called the children of the living God .
text2: Ku teman waan ci ke yɔɔk tliin , yan , We cie kɔcki , Yen etemane guop yen abike cɔɔl thin , yan , Wek ee wɛɛt ke Nhialic piir .

text: Esaias also crieth concerning Israel , Though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea , a remnant shall be saved :
text2: Ku Yithaya ee coot ne kede Yithrael , yan , Na cak mith ke Yithrael juec acitki nɔn e liɛɛt nu abapdit , ee biak ci doŋ tei , yen abi kony wei ;

text: For he will finish the work , and cut it short in righteousness : because a short work will the Lord make upon the earth .
text2: abi luɔi thol , teem acek ne piathepiɔu ; Bɛnydit abi luɔi ci teem acek looi e piny nɔm .

text: And as Esaias said before , Except the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed , we had been as Sodoma , and been made like unto Gomorrha .
text2: Ku acit man ci Yithaya ye kɔn lueel , yan , Tee kene Bɛnydiit de Rɛmdit wo nyaŋ kau , Adi cuk ciet Thɔdɔm , ku adi ci wo tɔ cit Gɔmɔra .

text: What shall we say then ? That the Gentiles , which followed not after righteousness , have attained to righteousness , even the righteousness which is of faith .
text2: Eeŋo buk jɔ lueel ? Yan , Juoor , kɔc e cii piathepiɔu e cop , acik piathepiɔu yok , yen aye piathepiɔu bɔ ne gam ;

text: But Israel , which followed after the law of righteousness , hath not attained to the law of righteousness .
text2: ku Yithrael , kɔc e ye loŋ de piathepiɔu cop , akenki loŋ de piathepiɔu gith .

text: Wherefore ? Because they sought it not by faith , but as it were by the works of the law . For they stumbled at that stumblingstone ;
text2: Ee kaŋo ? Ee luɔi e cii kek en e kɔɔr ne gam , aa yek kɔɔr ne luɔi de loŋ . Aake kɔth e kuur e kɔth ,

text: As it is written , Behold , I lay in Sion a stumblingstone and rock of offence : and whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed .
text2: acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Tieŋki , yɛn e kuur e kɔth tuɛɛl e Dhiɔnic , ku ye kuur diit ee kɔc tɔ kɔth aret ; Ku raan ebɛn raan gam en , acii bi yaar .

text: Brethren , my heart ' s desire and prayer to God for Israel is , that they might be saved .
text2: Wek mithekɔckuɔ , ke kaar e yapiɔu ki , yɛn guop , ku laŋ laŋ ɛn Nhialic ne biak de Yithiael ki , ee kuny bi ke kony wei .

text: For I bear them record that they have a zeal of God , but not according to knowledge .
text2: Ku yɛn ee caatɔden e dit diit kek piɔth e kede Nhialic , ku aciki kaŋ ŋic apiɛth .

text: For they being ignorant of God ' s righteousness , and going about to establish their own righteousness , have not submitted themselves unto the righteousness of God .
text2: Ku keek , ne kuny kuc kek piathepiɔu bɔ tede Nhialic , ku ŋath ŋɛɛth kek piathdɛn e piɔu etok , aake ye piathepiɔu bɔ tede Nhialic rɛɛc gam .

text: For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to every one that believeth .
text2: Ku Kritho yen aye thok de loŋ ne kede piathepiɔu tede raan ebɛn raan gam .

text: For Moses describeth the righteousness which is of the law , That the man which doeth those things shall live by them .
text2: Ku Mothe e kaŋ gɔɔr ale , ne kede piathepiɔu wen bɔ ne loŋ , yan , Raan e kake looi abi piir e keek .

text: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise , Say not in thine heart , Who shall ascend into heaven ? ( that is , to bring Christ down from above : )
text2: Ku piathepiɔu wen bɔ ne gam aye lueel ale , yan , Du luel e yipiɔu , yan , Eeŋa bi lɔ paannhial ? ( luɛɛlde ki , ee bii le en Kritho bɛɛi piny . )

text: Or , Who shall descend into the deep ? ( that is , to bring up Christ again from the dead . )
text2: Ku du luel aya , yan , Eeŋa bi lɔ piny tethuth ? ( luɛɛlde ki , ee bii le yen Kritho bɛɛi nhial e kɔc ci thou yiic . )

text: But what saith it ? The word is nigh thee , even in thy mouth , and in thy heart : that is , the word of faith , which we preach ;
text2: Ku ye ŋo lueel ? Yan , Jam athiaak ke yin , anu e yithok , ku nu e yipiɔu aya ; yen aye jam de gam , jam guiirku ;

text: That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus , and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead , thou shalt be saved .
text2: yan , Te gɛm yin Bɛnydit Yecu e yithok , ku gam e yipiɔu , nɔn ci Nhialic e jɔt e kɔc ci thou yiic , ke yin bi kony wei .

text: For with the heart man believeth unto righteousness ; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation .
text2: Gam ee raan gam e yepiɔu yen aye yen piathepiɔu yok ; ku luɛɛl ee raan gamde lueel e yethok yen aye yen kunydewei yok .

text: For the scripture saith , Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed .
text2: Ku kecigɔɔr aye lueel , yan , Raan ebɛn raan gam en acii bi yaar .

text: For there is no difference between the Jew and the Greek : for the same Lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him .
text2: Acin te ci kɔc keyiic tek , Judai ayi Girikii ; ee Bɛnydiit toŋe Bɛny nu e kɔc niim kedhie , yen ee piɔu adhuɛŋ ke kɔc cɔl en kedhie .

text: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved .
text2: Raan ebɛn raan e Bɛnydit cɔɔl rin ka bi kony wei .

text: How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed ? and how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard ? and how shall they hear without a preacher ?
text2: Ku enɔɔne , bik raan aa cɔɔl rin adiaa raan kenki gam ? Ku bik raan gam adi , raan ken kek kede piŋ ? Ku bik piŋ adi , te hiuwe raan e keek guiir ?

text: And how shall they preach , except they be sent ? as it is written , How beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel of peace , and bring glad tidings of good things !
text2: Ku bik aa guiir adi , te keneke tooc ? Acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Eeŋo ci kɔc cok dikedik ale , kɔc e welpiɛth guiir , wel ke mat , kɔc e welpiɛth guiir , wel ke kepiɛth ?

text: But they have not all obeyed the gospel . For Esaias saith , Lord , who hath believed our report ?
text2: Ku akenki welpiɛth gam kedhie , cit man ci Yithaya ye lueel , yan , Bɛnydit , eeŋa ci guieerda gam ?

text: So then faith cometh by hearing , and hearing by the word of God .
text2: Yen ka , Gam abɔ ne piŋ de wel , ku bɔ piŋ de wel ne jam de Nhialic .

text: But I say , Have they not heard ? Yes verily , their sound went into all the earth , and their words unto the ends of the world .
text2: Ku wek thieec , yan , Kɛnki piŋ ? Go , an , Ɣɛɛ , ee yic , Rolden aci thiei e piny nɔm ebɛn , Ku lɔ welken guut e piny thar .

text: But I say , Did not Israel know ? First Moses saith , I will provoke you to jealousy by them that are no people , and by a foolish nation I will anger you .
text2: Aguɔ bɛ thieec , yan , Ken ŋic en Yithrael ? Go , an , Aci Mothe kɔn lueel , yan , We ba tɔ dɔm tiɛɛl ne jur cie tɔ ye jur , Ku ta week goth alal ne jur kuc wel .

text: But Esaias is very bold , and saith , I was found of them that sought me not ; I was made manifest unto them that asked not after me .
text2: Ku Yithaya e ŋeeny aret , lueel , yan , Yɛn cii kɔc yok , kɔc e ken a kɔɔr ; Yɛn ci nyuoth kɔc , kɔc e ken a luɔp .

text: But to Israel he saith , All day long I have stretched forth my hands unto a disobedient and gainsaying people .
text2: Ku yook Yithrael , yan , Yɛn e cool e rieny ɛn acin ecaŋawen e kɔc reec gam , kɔc nhiaar jany .

text: I say then , Hath God cast away his people ? God forbid . For I also am an Israelite , of the seed of Abraham , of the tribe of Benjamin .
text2: Guɔ jɔ thieec , an , Ci Nhialic kɔcke cuat wei ? Ei ! Acie yen ! Yɛn aya , yɛn ee raan e Yithrael , ne kau de Abraɣam , ne dhien e Benjamin .

text: God hath not cast away his people which he foreknew . Wot ye not what the scripture saith of Elias ? how he maketh intercession to God against Israel , saying ,
text2: Nhialic aken kɔcke cuat wei , kɔckɛn ci kɔn lɔc . Kuocki ke lueel kecigɔɔr ne kede Elija ? Laŋ ci en Nhialic lɔŋ ne kede Yithrael , yan ,

text: Lord , they have killed thy prophets , and digged down thine altars ; and I am left alone , and they seek my life .
text2: Bɛnydit , acik nebiiku nɔk , ku acik yikkuon ke lam thuoor piny ; adɔɔŋ ɛn atok , ku akɔɔrki naŋ nɛk kek ɛn .

text: But what saith the answer of God unto him ? I have reserved to myself seven thousand men , who have not bowed the knee to the image of Baal .
text2: Ku beer beere Nhialic en e luel ŋo ? Yan , Yɛn e ro bɔth agum kadherou de roor kɔc ken kemiɔl tuk e Baal nɔm .

text: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace .
text2: Ku yen enɔɔne aya , biak ci doŋ anu ne ke ci lɔc ne dhueeŋdepiɔu .

text: And if by grace , then is it no more of works : otherwise grace is no more grace . But if it be of works , then is it no more grace : otherwise work is no more work .
text2: Ku te ee yen kede dhueeŋdepiɔu , ka cii be ya kede luɔi ; ten ee yen en , ke dhueeŋdepiɔu acii be ya dhueeŋdepiɔu ; ku te ee yen kede luɔi , ka cii be ya kede dhueeŋdepiɔu ; ten ee yen en , ke luɔi acii be ya luɔi .

text: What then ? Israel hath not obtained that which he seeketh for ; but the election hath obtained it , and the rest were blinded
text2: Jɔ aa ŋo ? Yithrael aken ke kɔɔr yok ; ku biak ci lɔc , yen aci e yok , ku kɔc kɔk acike tɔ ril niim ,

text: ( According as it is written , God hath given them the spirit of slumber , eyes that they should not see , and ears that they should not hear ; ) unto this day .
text2: acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Nhialic aci ke gam piɔn e nin , ku gɛm keek nyin cii daai , ku yith cii kaŋ e piŋ , aɣet ci ekoole .

text: And David saith , Let their table be made a snare , and a trap , and a stumbling block , and a recompence unto them :
text2: Go Dabid lueel , yan , Tɔ pamdɛn e cam e acerek , ku ke bi keek aa dɔm , Ayi ke bi keek tɔ kɔth , ayi kedɛn tuc bik yok ;

text: Let their eyes be darkened , that they may not see , and bow down their back alway .
text2: Tɔ ke lɔ nyiin dudur , ke ke cii bi daai , Ku tɔ ke tot kekɔɔth ananden .

text: I say then , Have they stumbled that they should fall ? God forbid : but rather through their fall salvation is come unto the Gentiles , for to provoke them to jealousy .
text2: Aguɔ jɔ thieec , yan , E ke kɔth abik wiik ? Acie yen . Ku kɔth ci kek kɔth , yen a yoke Juoor kunydewei , ke Yithrael bi tiɛɛl dɔm .

text: Now if the fall of them be the riches of the world , and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles ; how much more their fulness ?
text2: Ku enɔɔne , kɔth kɔth kek , te ci en aa kuɛth ci piny tɔ kueth nɔm , ku kuur koor kek , te ci en aa kuɛth ci Juoor tɔ kueth , na piathden , bi kene woor e war ŋo ?

text: For I speak to you Gentiles , inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles , I magnify mine office :
text2: Yɛn jam wo week , wek Juoor , ku luɔi aa yɛn tuny e Juoor , yen a lɛɛc ɛn luɔidi ;

text: If by any means I may provoke to emulation them which are my flesh , and might save some of them .
text2: nɔn de te ban kɔcki tɔ dɔm tiɛɛl , aguɔ kɔk kony wei e keyiic .

text: For if the casting away of them be the reconciling of the world , what shall the receiving of them be , but life from the dead ?
text2: Ku na cuɛt cuɛteke wei , te ee yen mɛɛt bi piny nɔm maat , ku dom bi ke bɛ dɔm , bi ciet ŋo , cii bi aa piir e kɔc ci thou yiic ?

text: For if the firstfruit be holy , the lump is also holy : and if the root be holy , so are the branches .
text2: Ku na ɣer awany tueŋic , ka yen ɣɛɛr e awacic ebɛn ka ; ku tim , te ɣeere meideyic , ka yen ɣɛɛr e keerke yiic ka .

text: And if some of the branches be broken off , and thou , being a wild olive tree , wert graffed in among them , and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree ;
text2: Ku na ci keer kɔk cak dhuoŋ bei , ku yin , yin ee keer e olip e cil roor , na ci yi cak tuɛɛl e keyiic , aba cil we keek etok , ago rɔm we keek etok ne cuai de tim de olip , ke bɔ ne meiyic ;

text: Boast not against the branches . But if thou boast , thou bearest not the root , but the root thee .
text2: ke yi du rot e leec e ker niim . Ku te leec yin rot , tak yinɔm nɔn cie yin e muk meei , ee meei yen amuk yin .

text: Thou wilt say then , The branches were broken off , that I might be graffed in .
text2: Ku ba jɔ lueel , yan , Keerke acike dhuoŋ bei , luɔi bi a tuɛɛl thin , aba cil .

text: Well ; because of unbelief they were broken off , and thou standest by faith . Be not highminded , but fear :
text2: Ee yindu ; ne baŋ de rɛɛc de gam yen a dhuŋeke bei , ku yin , yin kaac ne gam . Du yinɔm muk nhial , ye riɔɔc tei .

text: For if God spared not the natural branches , take heed lest he also spare not thee .
text2: Ku te kene Nhialic keer thɛɛr ke tim pɔl , ke ye rot tiit , ke yi cii bi pɔl ayadan .

text: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God : on them which fell , severity ; but toward thee , goodness , if thou continue in his goodness : otherwise thou also shalt be cut off .
text2: Wɔiki enɔɔne , piath e Nhialic piɔu ayi riɛl e yenpiɔu : tede kɔc waan ci wiik , ee riɛlepiɔu ; ku tede yin , ee piathepiɔu , te ee yin cool e reer e piath de yenpiɔuyic ; na reec , ke yin bi tɛɛm bei aya .

text: And they also , if they abide not still in unbelief , shall be graffed in : for God is able to graff them in again .
text2: Ku keek ayadaŋ , te cii kek e cool e reec gam , ka bike tuɛɛl thin abik cil ; Nhialic acath ke riɛl bi en ke bɛ tuɛɛl thin abik cil .

text: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature , and wert graffed contrary to nature into a good olive tree : how much more shall these , which be the natural branches , be graffed into their own olive tree ?
text2: Ku te ci yi ŋuoot bei e tim de olip waan , tim e cil roor tei , ago tuɛɛl e tim de olip piɛthic , ku tueel tueele yi thin acii cit ciɛɛŋduon e ciɛke yi ; na kake kek keer thɛɛr ke tim , tueel bike bɛ tuɛɛl e timdenic guop tim de olip , cii bi pial awar tueel e tueele yin aret ?

text: For I would not , brethren , that ye should be ignorant of this mystery , lest ye should be wise in your own conceits ; that blindness in part is happened to Israel , until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in .
text2: Ku yɛn cin piɔu , wek mithekɔckuɔ , luɔi kuoc wek ecooke , cook ci thiaan , ke we cii rot bi leec , yan , pɛlki niim . Cook ci thiaan , ki , yan , Biak toŋ de Yithrael aci tɔ ril nɔm , aɣet kool bi kuɛth de juoor bɛn thin ;

text: And so all Israel shall be saved : as it is written , There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer , and shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob :
text2: ago Yithrael kony wei ebɛn aya , acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Raan e kɔc luok abi bɛn bei e Dhiɔnic , Go rɛɛc reec kek Nhialic dak wei e Jakopic ;

text: For this is my covenant unto them , when I shall take away their sins .
text2: Ku yen aye loŋ buk mac wo keek atok , Kool ban karɛcken nyaai .

text: As concerning the gospel , they are enemies for your sakes : but as touching the election , they are beloved for the fathers ' sakes .
text2: Ne kede welpiɛth , ayek kɔc de ater ne Nhialic ne baŋdun ; ku ne kede lony lɔce keek , ayek kɔc nhiaar ne baŋ de warkuɔ .

text: For the gifts and calling of God are without repentance .
text2: Miɔc de Nhialic ku cɔt cɔɔl en kɔc , Nhialic acii keek e bɛ riic .

text: For as ye in times past have not believed God , yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief :
text2: Ku acit man waan ca wek Nhialic e gam , ku we ci kokdepiɔu yok enɔɔne ne rɛɛc reec kek gam ,

text: Even so have these also now not believed , that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy .
text2: yen aacii kek e gam aya , ke ke bi kokdepiɔu yok ne kokdepiɔu cak yok week .

text: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief , that he might have mercy upon all .
text2: Kɔc aci Nhialic ke mac etok kedhie ne rɛɛc reec kek gam , ke bi piɔu kok keke keek kedhie .

text: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God ! how unsearchable are his judgments , and his ways past finding out !
text2: Eeŋo diite pɛl e Nhialic nɔm aya , ayi ŋiny ŋic en kaŋ ! Looŋkɛn ci guiir bi raan ke gii thaar nɛn , ku kuɛɛrke bi raan ke yok adi ?

text: For who hath known the mind of the Lord ? or who hath been his counseller ?
text2: Eeŋa e ŋic piɔn e Bɛnydit ? Ku eeŋa e tɔ rot e raan e yen lɛk loŋ ?

text: Or who hath first given to him , and it shall be recompensed unto him again ?
text2: Ku eeŋa ci e kɔn miɔɔc e kaŋ , ka bi bɛ cuol en ?

text: For of him , and through him , and to him , are all things : to whom be glory for ever . Amen .
text2: Kerieec ɛbɛn ee kake , ku bɔ ne yen , ku le tede yen . E dhueeŋ tɔu keke yen aɣet athɛɛr . Amen .

text: I beseech you therefore , brethren , by the mercies of God , that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice , holy , acceptable unto God , which is your reasonable service .
text2: Yen a laŋ ɛn week , mithekɔckuɔ , ne kok e Nhialic piɔu , an , Gamki gupkun abik aa ke ci lam ke piir , ke ɣeric , ke mit e Nhialic piɔu , lamduon piɛth ki .

text: And be not conformed to this world : but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind , that ye may prove what is that good , and acceptable , and perfect , will of God .
text2: Ku duoki tau de pinye nɔm enɔɔne e dɔmic , jaki rot puk ne luɔi e piɛce we looi niim , ke we bi kede piɔn e Nhialic aa them nɔn yin en di , piɔn piɛthe , ku mit , ku ci dikedik .

text: For I say , through the grace given unto me , to every man that is among you , not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think ; but to think soberly , according as God hath dealt to every man the measure of faith .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , ne dhueeŋdepiɔu ci gam ɛn , yen a lɛk raan ebɛn ne weyiic , yan , E cin raan e ro tɔ dit e dit cii roŋ ke ye ; yak rot tɔ nu e kaamic , acit man ci Nhialic kɔc tɛk gam raan ebɛn .

text: For as we have many members in one body , and all members have not the same office :
text2: Ku acit man de raan kajuec e yeguop , ku ye guop toŋe , ku luɔi de ka ke guop ebɛn aciki e kit ;

text: So we , being many , are one body in Christ , and every one members one of another .
text2: ayi wook ayadaŋ , wok juec , ku yok guop tok e Krithoyic , ku wook wodhie wok raan e rot wapac .

text: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us , whether prophecy , let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith ;
text2: Ku enɔɔne , luɔi ciɛth wok ne ka ci gam wook ka kith yiic bik roŋ ne luɔi de dhueeŋ ci gam wook , nɔn ee yen caar ee wok cɔɔr , yok cɔɔr e caar e roŋ ke gamda ;

text: Or ministry , let us wait on our ministering : or he that teacheth , on teaching ;
text2: ku nɔn ee yen luɔi ee wok kɔc luooi , yok keda looi apiɛth ; ku raan e weet , e ye weet apiɛth ;

text: Or he that exhorteth , on exhortation : he that giveth , let him do it with simplicity ; he that ruleth , with diligence ; he that sheweth mercy , with cheerfulness .
text2: ku raan e kɔc guieer wel , e ye kɔc guieer apiɛth ; raan e miooc , e ye miooc e piɔn tok ; raan nu e kɔc niim , e ye kede looi ke leth guop ; raan e piɔu kok , e ye luui e piɔn mit .

text: Let love be without dissimulation . Abhor that which is evil ; cleave to that which is good .
text2: Taki nhieer nu , nhieer cinic rueeny . Yak kerac maan etaiwei , ku yak kepiɛth dɔm e dom ril .

text: Be kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love ; in honour preferring one another ;
text2: Yak rot nhiaar ne nhieer e mith ke raan tok ; e ŋɛk e ŋɛk rieu awar rieeu rieu en rot .

text: Not slothful in business ; fervent in spirit ; serving the Lord ;
text2: E cin raan e rot dak e luɔide ; yak yiic leth ne Weidit , yak ka ke Bɛnydit looi .

text: Rejoicing in hope ; patient in tribulation ; continuing instant in prayer ;
text2: Yak piɔth miɛt e aŋɔth ŋathki ; yak keril dhal week guum ; yak lɔŋ cok e giet wek en .

text: Distributing to the necessity of saints ; given to hospitality .
text2: Yak kakun tek ne kɔc ɣerpiɔth , te de yen ke dak kek ; yak kamaan ŋic aret .

text: Bless them which persecute you : bless , and curse not .
text2: Yak kɔc yɔŋ week thieei ; yak ke thieei , duoki ke lam aciɛɛn .

text: Rejoice with them that do rejoice , and weep with them that weep .
text2: Yak piɔth miɛt etok ne kɔc mit piɔth ; yak dhiau etok ne kɔc dhiau .

text: Be of the same mind one toward another . Mind not high things , but condescend to men of low estate . Be not wise in your own conceits .
text2: Taki piɔndun e tok . Duoki wepiɔth e tuɔm ka ke bany , yak reer apiɛth ne kɔc cin naamden . Duoki rot e leec , yan , Pɛlki niim .

text: Recompense to no man evil for evil . Provide things honest in the sight of all men .
text2: Duoki kerɛɛc e raan luoi week e cool e kerac anandun . Thɛmki nɔn ba wek kapiɛth aa looi e kɔc niim kedhie .

text: If it be possible , as much as lieth in you , live peaceably with all men .
text2: Te lɛu wek reer emaath ne kɔc kedhie , ke we them reer ba wek reer .

text: Dearly beloved , avenge not yourselves , but rather give place unto wrath : for it is written , Vengeance is mine ; I will repay , saith the Lord .
text2: Duoki rot e guoor , wek kɔc nhiaar , yak agɔth pat kueer ; luɔi ci e gɔɔr , yan , Guur ee kedi ; aba cool yɛn , jam de Bɛnydit ka .

text: Therefore if thine enemy hunger , feed him ; if he thirst , give him drink : for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head .
text2: Yen tede ka , na nak cɔk raan man yin , ke tɔ cam ; na nak reu en , ke tɔ dek ; luɔi loi wuya , yen abi yin en tɔ gɔk rot etok .

text: Be not overcome of evil , but overcome evil with good .
text2: Duoki rot e tɔ tiɛɛm kerac , yak kerac tiaam ne piath .

text: Let every soul be subject unto the higher powers . For there is no power but of God : the powers that be are ordained of God .
text2: E raan ebɛn e ye bany piŋ thook , bany ci taau e kɔc niim . Acin bɛny daŋ nu , ee bany e bɔ tede Nhialic kapac ; ku bany nu enɔɔne , ee Nhialic yen e dɔm keek .

text: Whosoever therefore resisteth the power , resisteth the ordinance of God : and they that resist shall receive to themselves damnation .
text2: Ku raan e bɛny ŋeny , ka ci loŋ cii Nhialic lueel ŋeny ; ku kɔc e ŋeeny aya , abik ketuc yok e jamdenic .

text: For rulers are not a terror to good works , but to the evil . Wilt thou then not be afraid of the power ? do that which is good , and thou shalt have praise of the same :
text2: Ku bany aciki kɔc e kepiɛth looi e tɔ riɔc , ee kɔc e kerac looi kek ayek tɔ riɔc . De yipiɔu luɔi cii yin bi riɔɔc e bany ? Ye kepiɛth looi , ke bi yin leec yen bɛny ;

text: For he is the minister of God to thee for good . But if thou do that which is evil , be afraid ; for he beareth not the sword in vain : for he is the minister of God , a revenger to execute wrath upon him that doeth evil .
text2: ee raan e ka ke Nhialic looi ne kede piathdu . Ku na ye kerac looi , ke yi jɔ riɔɔc ; abatau acie mɔk ɣɔric ; ee raan e ka ke Nhialic looi , raan e raan e kerac looi guoor e agɔth .

text: Wherefore ye must needs be subject , not only for wrath , but also for conscience sake .
text2: Yen a ba wek jamde dhil aa piŋ , acie baŋ de agɔth etok , ee baŋ de loŋ ee raan yok e yepiɔu aya .

text: For for this cause pay ye tribute also : for they are God ' s ministers , attending continually upon this very thing .
text2: Ku yen a ya wek atholbo kut aya ; ayek kɔc e ka ke Nhialic looi , kɔc e cool e tit luɔi mane guop .

text: Render therefore to all their dues : tribute to whom tribute is due ; custom to whom custom ; fear to whom fear ; honour to whom honour .
text2: Yen a wek kɔc kedhie gam kaken ; an , ee atholbo , ke we gɛm atholbo ; an , ee guaaric , ke we gɛm guaaric ; an , ee rieeu , ke rieuki ; an , ee thɛk e guop , ke thɛkki guop .

text: Owe no man any thing , but to love one another : for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law .
text2: Duoki e cath ne kany de raan daŋ , ee nhieer tei , nhieer ba wek rot aa nhiaar ; raan e raan daŋ nhiaar aci loŋ tiiŋic .

text: For this , Thou shalt not commit adultery , Thou shalt not kill , Thou shalt not steal , Thou shalt not bear false witness , Thou shalt not covet ; and if there be any other commandment , it is briefly comprehended in this saying , namely , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: Yan , Du lɔ weke tiiŋ de raan daŋ , Du raan nak abi thou , Du kuel , Du raan ciek thok , Du kalei woi e yipiɔu , ku na de cook daŋ nu , cook de loŋ , ayeke mat niim kedhie ne loŋ toŋe , yan , Yin bi raan rɛɛr keke yin nhiaar cit man nhiɛɛr yin rot .

text: Love worketh no ill to his neighbour : therefore love is the fulfilling of the law .
text2: Nhieer acin kerɛɛc e luoi raan rɛɛr ke raan ; yen aye nhieer loŋ tiiŋic .

text: And that , knowing the time , that now it is high time to awake out of sleep : for now is our salvation nearer than when we believed .
text2: Ku cooke aya , yan , Yak piny ŋic , nɔn ee yen akool bi wok dhil paac e ninic ; kuny bi wo kony wei e guɔ thiɔk enɔɔne awar waan kɔn wo gam .

text: The night is far spent , the day is at hand : let us therefore cast off the works of darkness , and let us put on the armour of light .
text2: Piny e dit , ku a kɔɔr ru ; jɔku luɔi de cuɔlepiny cuat wei , ku jɔku ka ke ɣɛɛrepiny dɔm , ka ke tɔŋ .

text: Let us walk honestly , as in the day ; not in rioting and drunkenness , not in chambering and wantonness , not in strife and envying .
text2: Yok ŋiec reer apiɛth , luɔi ee yen akol ; yok thueec pɔl , ku win ee mɔu wo wit , ayi ŋɔɔŋ de tik ayi luɔi rac , ayi ater ayi tiɛɛl .

text: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ , and make not provision for the flesh , to fulfil the lusts thereof .
text2: Jaki Bɛnydit Yecu Kritho cieŋ cit lupɔ , ku duoki e diɛɛr ne karɛc kɔɔr guop .

text: Him that is weak in the faith receive ye , but not to doubtful disputations .
text2: Raan dɛk e gam , ke damki , ku duoki wel e tɛɛr ne yen .

text: For one believeth that he may eat all things : another , who is weak , eateth herbs .
text2: Ŋɛk aye gam luɔi dueer en cam e kerieec ebɛn , ku cam ŋɛk e wal tei , ne kɔc kɔɔc en .

text: Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not ; and let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth : for God hath received him .
text2: Raan e cam , e cii raan cie cam e biɔɔn guop ; ku raan cie cam , e cii raan e cam e gɔk ; acii Nhialic dɔm .

text: Who art thou that judgest another man ' s servant ? to his own master he standeth or falleth . Yea , he shall be holden up : for God is able to make him stand .
text2: Ee yin ŋa , yin raan e lim de raan daŋ gɔk ? Kɔɔc kɛɛc en , ku wiik wiik en , ee kede bɛnyde guop etok . Yeka , ku abi mɔk nhial ; Nhialic ade riɛl bi en e tɔ kaac .

text: One man esteemeth one day above another : another esteemeth every day alike . Let every man be fully persuaded in his own mind .
text2: Raan tok aye kool tok rieu awar kool daŋ ; ku lueel raan daŋ , yan , Akool akitki . E raan ebɛn e ye kedaŋ ŋic egɔk e yepiɔu .

text: He that regardeth the day , regardeth it unto the Lord ; and he that regardeth not the day , to the Lord he doth not regard it . He that eateth , eateth to the Lord , for he giveth God thanks ; and he that eateth not , to the Lord he eateth not , and giveth God thanks .
text2: Raan rieu akol , ee kede Bɛnydit en a rieu en en ; ku raan cii akol e rieu , ee kede Bɛnydit en acii en en e rieu . Ku raan e cam , ee cam ne kede Bɛnydit , ago lueel , an , Thieithieei Nhialic ; ku raan cie cam , ee kede Bɛnydit en acii en e cam , ku lueel , an , Thieithieei Nhialic .

text: For none of us liveth to himself , and no man dieth to himself .
text2: Ku acin raan tok ne wook , raan piir e kede etok , ku acin raan thou e kede etok .

text: For whether we live , we live unto the Lord ; and whether we die , we die unto the Lord : whether we live therefore , or die , we are the Lord ' s .
text2: Piir piir wok , ee kede Bɛnydit en piir wok ; ku thon thou wok , ee kede Bɛnydit en thou wok ; ayi te piir wok ayi te thou wok , wok ee kɔc ke Bɛnydit .

text: For to this end Christ both died , and rose , and revived , that he might be Lord both of the dead and living .
text2: Ku yen aa thouwe Kritho , ku jɔt rot be piir , luɔi bi en aa Bɛnydiit e kɔc ci thou ayi kɔc piir .

text: But why dost thou judge thy brother ? or why dost thou set at nought thy brother ? for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ .
text2: Ku yin , eeŋo gɛk yin mɛnhkui ? Ku eeŋo biɔɔn yin mɛnhkui guop aya ? Wok wodhie , wo bi kɔɔc e thoony e Kritho nɔm , thoony ee loŋ guiir .

text: For it is written , As I live , saith the Lord , every knee shall bow to me , and every tongue shall confess to God .
text2: Cit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Alueel Bɛnydit , yan , Ten aa yɛn Nhialic piir , ke miɔl kedhie abike tuk e yanɔm , Ku liep kedhie abik aca wooc gam e Nhialic nɔm .

text: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God .
text2: Yen ka , wok wodhie , ŋɛk abi kede yenguop lɛk Nhialic .

text: Let us not therefore judge one another any more : but judge this rather , that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brother ' s way .
text2: Yen du wo rot e bɛ gɔk ; aŋuan luɔi bi wok loŋe lueel e wopiɔth , yan , E cin raan e kedaŋ taau kueer , ke bi mɛnhkene tɔ kɔth , ayi te bi e tɔ wieek .

text: I know , and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus , that there is nothing unclean of itself : but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean , to him it is unclean .
text2: Cook ŋiɛc ka , aca cok e ŋiɛc ɛn en egɔk e Bɛnydit Yecuyic , yan , Acin ken ee rac etok ; ku raan e tɔ kedaŋ rac , ke jɔ rac tede yen .

text: But if thy brother be grieved with thy meat , now walkest thou not charitably . Destroy not him with thy meat , for whom Christ died .
text2: Te ci mɛnhkni piɔu diu ne baŋ de riiŋduon e cuet , ke yin cii be reer e reer e nhieer . Du raan riak ne riiŋduon e cuet , raan waan thouwe Kritho ne biakde .

text: Let not then your good be evil spoken of :
text2: Duoki piathdun e tɔ leke kerac .

text: For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink ; but righteousness , and peace , and joy in the Holy Ghost .
text2: Ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic acie cam ku acie dek , ee piathepiɔu , ku mat , ku piɔnmit e Weidit Ɣer yiic .

text: For he that in these things serveth Christ is acceptable to God , and approved of men .
text2: Ku raan e Kritho luooi apiɛth e kake yiic , ka piɛth e Nhialic piɔu , ku aye kɔc tɔ ye raan piɛth ayadaŋ .

text: Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace , and things wherewith one may edify another .
text2: Yen ee wok ka ke mat cop ayi ka ke kuɛt bi wok kueet .

text: For meat destroy not the work of God . All things indeed are pure ; but it is evil for that man who eateth with offence .
text2: Du luɔi de Nhialic riak ne baŋ de riŋ . Kerieec ebɛn aɣeric tei ; ku ee kerac tede raan e kedaŋ cam , ago kaŋ wooc thin .

text: It is good neither to eat flesh , nor to drink wine , nor any thing whereby thy brother stumbleth , or is offended , or is made weak .
text2: Apiɛth luɔi cii yin riŋ bi aa cuet , ku luɔi cii yin mɔu bi aa dek , ku luɔi cii yin kaŋ bi aa looi ebɛn , ka bi mɛnhkui tɔ wac kaŋ , ku ka bi e tɔ wieek , ku ka bi e tɔ kɔc .

text: Hast thou faith ? have it to thyself before God . Happy is he that condemneth not himself in that thing which he alloweth .
text2: De gam cath ke yin ? E cath ke yin yitok e Nhialic nyin . Thieithieei e raan ken ro gɔk ne ke ci en ro pal luɔi .

text: And he that doubteth is damned if he eat , because he eateth not of faith : for whatsoever is not of faith is sin .
text2: Ku raan e piɔu wil e kaamic , te ciɛm en , aye jɔɔny , luɔi liiuwe gam thin ; ku kerieec ebɛn ke liiuwe gam thin , yen aye kerac .

text: We then that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak , and not to please ourselves .
text2: Wok kɔc ril , wo bi kɔc dhil aa muk ne kɔc kɔɔc kek , ku cuku e luui ne kede piɔnda .

text: Let every one of us please his neighbour for his good to edification .
text2: Wook wodhie e ŋɛk e ye raan reer kek kony abi piɔu miɛt , e kede piathde , ku kede kuɛt bi ye kueet .

text: For even Christ pleased not himself ; but , as it is written , The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell on me .
text2: Acakaa Kritho guop , aacii kede yenpiɔu e looi ; ku , acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Gaŋ gɛke kɔc yin aci loony e yayeth .

text: For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning , that we through patience and comfort of the scriptures might have hope .
