text2: Ku ka ci gɔɔr ɣɔn thɛɛr kedhie aake gaar ne weet bi wo weet , ke wo bi dɛ aŋɔth ŋathku ne guomdekaŋ ayi muŋdepiɔu kak e biiye kacigɔɔr .

text: Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be likeminded one toward another according to Christ Jesus :
text2: Ku enɔɔne , Nhialic de guomdekaŋ keke muŋdepiɔu , e week tɔ luel jam tok wapac jam roŋ ke Kritho Yecu ;

text: That ye may with one mind and one mouth glorify God , even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: ke we bi Nhialic aa leec nɔm ne piɔn tok ku ne thoŋ tok , yen aye Wun Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho .

text: Wherefore receive ye one another , as Christ also received us to the glory of God .
text2: Yen aa wek rot dɔm wapac , acit nɔn ci Kritho wook dɔm ayadaŋ , ke Nhialic bi leec .

text: Now I say that Jesus Christ was a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God , to confirm the promises made unto the fathers :
text2: Aluɛɛl ale , yan , Yecu Kritho aci aa raan e aŋueel luooi ne baŋ de yin de Nhialic , ke bi ka ci kɔn lɛk kuarkuɔ tɔ ye yith ,

text: And that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy ; as it is written , For this cause I will confess to thee among the Gentiles , and sing unto thy name .
text2: ku luɔi bi Juoor Nhialic aa lɛc nɔm ayadaŋ ne baŋ de kok ci en piɔu kok ke keek ; acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Yen aba yɛn kedu gam e Juoor yiic , Ku piaany rinku .

text: And again he saith , Rejoice , ye Gentiles , with his people .
text2: Ku be lueel , yan , Yak piɔth miɛt , wek Juoor , ne kɔcke etok .

text: And again , Praise the Lord , all ye Gentiles ; and laud him , all ye people .
text2: Ku be lueel , yan , Yak Bɛnydit piɔɔny , wek Juoor wedhie ; Ku yak leec nɔm , wek kɔc wedhie .

text: And again , Esaias saith , There shall be a root of Jesse , and he that shall rise to reign over the Gentiles ; in him shall the Gentiles trust .
text2: Ku be Yithaya lueel , yan , Abi dɛ meei de Jethe , Ku bi dɛ raan bi ro jɔt le Juoor cieŋ ; Yen abi Juoor aa ŋɔɔth .

text: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing , that ye may abound in hope , through the power of the Holy Ghost .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , Nhialic de aŋɔth e week thiɔɔŋ piɔth ne miɛtepiɔu ebɛn keke mat ne gam gam wek , ke aŋɔth ŋath wek abi lɔ ke dit , ne riɛl e Weidit Ɣer .

text: And I myself also am persuaded of you , my brethren , that ye also are full of goodness , filled with all knowledge , able also to admonish one another .
text2: Ku yɛn guop yɛn e kedun guɔ ŋic e yapiɔu aya , wek mithekɔckuɔ , dit diite piathdun , ku dit e ŋiny ŋiɛc wek kaŋ , ku leu aa wek rot leu e weet .

text: Nevertheless , brethren , I have written the more boldly unto you in some sort , as putting you in mind , because of the grace that is given to me of God ,
text2: Ku we ca gaar cok kɔk ke ya ril nyin aret , e taŋ tak ɛn weniim ne ke cak kɔn ŋic , ne baŋ de dhueeŋ ci Nhialic gam ɛn ,

text: That I should be the minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles , ministering the gospel of God , that the offering up of the Gentiles might be acceptable , being sanctified by the Holy Ghost .
text2: ke yɛn bi aa raan e Yecu Kritho luooi e Juoor yiic , raan e welpiɛth ke Nhialic luoi keek , ke gɛm ci Juoor gam Nhialic ke bi aa lam mit e Nhialic piɔu , lam ci tɔ ɣeric ne Weidit Ɣer .

text: I have therefore whereof I may glory through Jesus Christ in those things which pertain to God .
text2: Yen a cath ɛn woke ke duɛɛr ɛn ro leec e Kritho Yecuyic ne ka ke luɔi de Nhialic .

text: For I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ hath not wrought by me , to make the Gentiles obedient , by word and deed ,
text2: Yɛn cii jam daŋ duɛɛr lueel , ee jam de ke ci Kritho looi ne yɛn etok , ne jam ayi luɔi , bi en Juoor tɔ piŋ wel ,

text: Through mighty signs and wonders , by the power of the Spirit of God ; so that from Jerusalem , and round about unto Illyricum , I have fully preached the gospel of Christ .
text2: ku ne gook ril ayi kagai ci looi , ne riɛl e Weidit ke Nhialic ; ku yɛn atok , agal e Jeruthalem ku bɛi nu e yekec , a le guoot piny de Yilurikon , yɛn e welpiɛth ke Kritho thol e guieer ;

text: Yea , so have I strived to preach the gospel , not where Christ was named , lest I should build upon another man ' s foundation :
text2: yeka , aa nu e yapiɔu luɔi ban welpiɛth aa guiir , te kene rin ke Kritho kɔn lueel , ku yɛn aa cin piɔu luɔi ban yik e keerkeer e raan daŋ nɔm ;

text: But as it is written , To whom he was not spoken of , they shall see : and they that have not heard shall understand .
text2: ku acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Kɔc kene lɛk e kede , kek abi tiŋ , Ku kɔc ken kɔn piŋ , kek abi jam yokic .

text: For which cause also I have been much hindered from coming to you .
text2: Yen aye cool e peene ya bɛn ba yɛn bɛn tede week .

text: But now having no more place in these parts , and having a great desire these many years to come unto you ;
text2: Ku enɔɔne luɔi cin en tedien be nu e bɛike yiic , ku luɔi aa yɛn piɔu dɛ lɔ la yɛn tede week e run juecke ,

text: Whensoever I take my journey into Spain , I will come to you : for I trust to see you in my journey , and to be brought on my way thitherward by you , if first I be somewhat filled with your company .
text2: ke yɛn bi jɔ lɔ tede week , miak te keny ɛn Thepaniya ; ( yɛn de piɔu luɔi ban we tiŋ miak te tɛɛk ɛn , aguɔki ya ruac kueer lɔ tɛɛn , te can piɔu kɔn a yum emaath e abarɔdun )

text: But now I go unto Jerusalem to minister unto the saints .
text2: ku yɛn lɔ Jeruthalem enɔɔne , la kɔc ɣerpiɔth a luooi .

text: For it hath pleased them of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor saints which are at Jerusalem .
text2: Kɔc ke Makedonia keke Akaya acik kaŋ juɛɛr kɔc ne miɛt e kekpiɔth kɔc ɣerpiɔth kuany nyiin nu Jeruthalem .

text: It hath pleased them verily ; and their debtors they are . For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things , their duty is also to minister unto them in carnal things .
text2: Acik ke juaar ne miɛt e kekpiɔth ; ku anu e keyieth luɔi bi kek ke miɔɔc . Ku Juoor , te ci kek aa kɔc rom ne keek etok ne kakɛn e Wei , aye guɔ nu e keyieth ayadaŋ luɔi bi kek ke kony ne ka ke piny .

text: When therefore I have performed this , and have sealed to them this fruit , I will come by you into Spain .
text2: Na miak , aca luɔiye thol , ku ca ka ci luɔke dhiel keek , ke we ba baar te la yɛn Thepaniya .

text: And I am sure that , when I come unto you , I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ .
text2: Ku aŋiɛc bɛn ban bɛn tede week , nɔn ban bɛn ne dit de athiɛɛi de welpiɛth ke Kritho .

text: Now I beseech you , brethren , for the Lord Jesus Christ ' s sake , and for the love of the Spirit , that ye strive together with me in your prayers to God for me ;
text2: Ku enɔɔne , wek laŋ , wek mithekɔckuɔ , ne biak de Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho , ku nhieer e Weidit Ɣer , an , bak a kony ne lɔŋ aa wek Nhialic lɔŋ aret ne biakdi , cit man e kɔc wiet ;

text: That I may be delivered from them that do not believe in Judaea ; and that my service which I have for Jerusalem may be accepted of the saints ;
text2: ke ya bi luok e kɔc reec gam cin , kɔc nu Judaya , ku laŋki aya , ne kede luɔi ba looi e Jeruthalem , nɔn bi en miɛt e kɔc ɣerpiɔth piɔth ;

text: That I may come unto you with joy by the will of God , and may with you be refreshed .
text2: ku nɔn ban bɛn tede week ne piɔnmit , te ci Nhialic e lueel , agoku aa lɔŋ etok woke week .

text: Now the God of peace be with you all . Amen .
text2: Nhialic de mat , e tɔu ke week wedhie . Amen .

text: I commend unto you Phebe our sister , which is a servant of the church which is at Cenchrea :
text2: Wek lɛk Pibi nyankeneda , raan e kanithɔ luooi kanithɔ nu Kenkurea ;

text: That ye receive her in the Lord , as becometh saints , and that ye assist her in whatsoever business she hath need of you : for she hath been a succourer of many , and of myself also .
text2: an , bak nyuooc e baŋ de Bɛnydit , e nyuuc roŋ ke kɔc ɣerpiɔth , ku bak kony te de yen ke bi kɔɔr tede week ; ee raan ci kɔc juec kony , ayik ɛn ayadaŋ .

text: Greet Priscilla and Aquila my helpers in Christ Jesus :
text2: Thiecki Pirithila keke Akula kɔc luui wok etok e Kritho Yecuyic ,

text: Who have for my life laid down their own necks : unto whom not only I give thanks , but also all the churches of the Gentiles .
text2: kɔc ci weiken kuɔɔn ne baŋ de weiki ; ee kɔc aa yɔɔk , an , Thieithieei , ku acie yɛn atok , ee kanithɔɔ ke Juoor kedhie ayadaŋ ;

text: Likewise greet the church that is in their house . Salute my wellbeloved Epaenetus , who is the firstfruits of Achaia unto Christ .
text2: ku thiecki kanithɔ nu ɣonden ayadaŋ . Thiecki Epaineto raan nhiaar , raan ci Kritho kɔn gam e Akaya .

text: Greet Mary , who bestowed much labour on us .
text2: Thiecki Mari , raan ci kajuec looi ne baŋda .

text: Salute Andronicus and Junia , my kinsmen , and my fellowprisoners , who are of note among the apostles , who also were in Christ before me .
text2: Thiecki Andoroniko ku Junia , kɔckuɔ , ku ye kɔc waan mɛc wok etok , kek kɔc de naamden e tuuc yiic , kɔc ci Kritho kɔn gam ke ya ŋoot .

text: Greet Amplias my beloved in the Lord .
text2: Thiecki Ampiliato raan nhiaar e Bɛnyditic .

text: Salute Urbane , our helper in Christ , and Stachys my beloved .
text2: Thiecki Urbano raan e luui wok etok e Krithoyic , keke Thataku raan nhiaar .

text: Salute Apelles approved in Christ . Salute them which are of Aristobulus ' household .
text2: Thiecki Apele raan ci leec e Krithoyic . Thiecki kɔc ke dhien e Arithobolo .

text: Salute Herodion my kinsman . Greet them that be of the household of Narcissus , which are in the Lord .
text2: Thiecki Kerodion raanda . Thiecki kɔc ke dhien e Narkitho kɔc nu e Bɛnyditic .

text: Salute Tryphena and Tryphosa , who labour in the Lord . Salute the beloved Persis , which laboured much in the Lord .
text2: Thiecki Turupaina keke Turupotha , kɔc e luui e Bɛnyditic . Thiecki Perthith , raan nhiaar , raan e luui aret e Bɛnyditic .

text: Salute Rufus chosen in the Lord , and his mother and mine .
text2: Thiecki Rupo raan ci lɔc e Bɛnyditic , keke man ku ye maar ayadaŋ .

text: Salute Asyncritus , Phlegon , Hermas , Patrobas , Hermes , and the brethren which are with them .
text2: Thiecki Athunkiritho ku Pelogon , ku Kerme , ku Pataroba , ku Kerma , keke mithekɔckuɔn rɛɛr ne keek .

text: Salute Philologus , and Julia , Nereus , and his sister , and Olympas , and all the saints which are with them .
text2: Thiecki Pilolago ku Julia , ku Nereu keke nyankene , ku Olumpa , ku kɔc ɣerpiɔth rɛɛr ne keek kedhie .

text: Salute one another with an holy kiss . The churches of Christ salute you .
text2: Thiecki rot wapac ne ciem ɣeric . Wek thieec kanithɔɔ ke Kritho kedhie .

text: Now I beseech you , brethren , mark them which cause divisions and offences contrary to the doctrine which ye have learned ; and avoid them .
text2: Ku wek yɔɔk , wek mithekɔckuɔ , wɔiki kɔc e kɔc paak ku kɔc e kak e kɔc tɔ wac kaŋ cak , kɔc e weet e weete week riɔɔk ; pakki ne keek .

text: For they that are such serve not our Lord Jesus Christ , but their own belly ; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple .
text2: Kɔc cit keek aciki Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho e luooi , e keyiic kek luuiki ; ku ayek kɔc cin piɔth kerac math piɔth ne wel mit luelki , ayi weŋ ee kek kɔc weŋ .

text: For your obedience is come abroad unto all men . I am glad therefore on your behalf : but yet I would have you wise unto that which is good , and simple concerning evil .
text2: Ku piŋ piɛŋ wek loŋ aci ɣet tede kɔc kedhie . Aguɔ piɔu miɛt ne baŋdun ; ku enɔɔne yɛn kɔɔr luɔi ba wek aa kɔc pelniim te lɔ kepiɛth , ku yak kɔc kuc kaŋ te lɔ kerac .

text: And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly . The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you . Amen .
text2: Ku Nhialic de mat abi Catan dap tɔ dum e wecok piny . E dhueeŋ de Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho piɔu e ye tɔu ke week . Amen .

text: Timotheus my workfellow , and Lucius , and Jason , and Sosipater , my kinsmen , salute you .
text2: Wek thieec Timotheo raan luui wok etok ; ayi Lukio ku Jathon ku Thothipataro , kɔckuɔ .

text: I Tertius , who wrote this epistle , salute you in the Lord .
text2: Yɛn Tertio , raan e gaar awareke , wek thieec e Bɛnyditic .

text: Gaius mine host , and of the whole church , saluteth you . Erastus the chamberlain of the city saluteth you , and Quartus a brother .
text2: Wek thieec Gayo raan ci a tɔ ye kaman , ku ye raan e kanithɔ tɔ ye kaman ebɛn . Wek thieec Erathato raan e ka ke panydit dot , keke Kuarto mɛnhkeneda .

text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all . Amen .
text2: E dhueeŋ de Bɛnydit Yecu Kritho piɔu e ye tɔu ke week wedhie . Amen .

text: Now to him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel , and the preaching of Jesus Christ , according to the revelation of the mystery , which was kept secret since the world began ,
text2: Ku enɔɔne , thieithieei e Raan cath ke riɛl bi en we tɔ kaac aril ne kede welkien piɛth , ku guieer ci Yecu Kritho guieer kɔc , ku nyuoth ci ke waan ci moony te ɣɔn ciɛke piny nyuɔɔth ,

text: But now is made manifest , and by the scriptures of the prophets , according to the commandment of the everlasting God , made known to all nations for the obedience of faith :
text2: ku aci tɔ tiec enɔɔne , ku tɔ ŋic juoor ebɛn ne kacigɔɔr e nebii , acit loŋ cii Nhialic de piir athɛɛr lueel , bi kek wel aa piŋ ku gamki ke ;

text: To God only wise , be glory through Jesus Christ for ever . Amen .
text2: e Nhialic de nɔm pɛl , yen etok , e ye tɔu ke dhueeŋ aɣet athɛɛr . Amen .

text: Be ye followers of me , even as I also am of Christ .
text2: Yɛn Paulo , raan ci cɔɔl bi aa tuny e Yecu Kritho ne kede piɔn e Nhialic , woke Thothene mɛnhkeneda ,

text: Now I praise you , brethren , that ye remember me in all things , and keep the ordinances , as I delivered them to you .
text2: awarek en gɛɛrku kanithɔ de Nhialic nu Korintho , kɔc wen ci tɔ ɣerpiɔth e Yecu Krithoyic , kɔc wen ci cɔɔl bik aa kɔc ɣerpiɔth , keke kɔc kedhie kɔc nu e wuot yiic ebɛn , kɔc e rin ke Yecu Kritho Bɛnydiitda cɔɔl , ee Bɛnyden keek ku ye Bɛnyda wook .

text: But I would have you know , that the head of every man is Christ ; and the head of the woman is the man ; and the head of Christ is God .
text2: E dhueeŋdepiɔu tɔu e weyiic , ayi mat , e ke bɔ tede Nhialic Waada keke Bɛnydit Yecu Kritho .

text: Every man praying or prophesying , having his head covered , dishonoureth his head .
text2: Yɛn ee cool e lec Nhialicdi ne baŋdun , ne kede dhueeŋ de Nhialic piɔu dhueeŋ ci gam week e Kritho Yecuyic ;

text: But every woman that prayeth or prophesieth with her head uncovered dishonoureth her head : for that is even all one as if she were shaven .
text2: luɔi ci en week tɔ kueth e kerieec ebɛn , ne ŋiec jam ebɛn ku ne ŋiny de kaŋ ebɛn ;

text: For if the woman be not covered , let her also be shorn : but if it be a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven , let her be covered .
text2: acit man ci jam tɔ ye yin e weyiic jam ci lueel e kede Kritho .

text: For a man indeed ought not to cover his head , forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God : but the woman is the glory of the man .
text2: ago cien miɔc toŋ dak week , te tiɛɛt wek nyuoth bi Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho ro nyuɔɔth ;

text: For the man is not of the woman ; but the woman of the man .
text2: raan bi week muk abak riɛl a thooke piny , ke bi cien ke bi we gɔk ekool e Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho .

text: Neither was the man created for the woman ; but the woman for the man .
text2: Nhialic ee Raan adot , Raan ci we cɔɔl ne kede maath de Wenden Yecu Kritho Bɛnydittda .

text: For this cause ought the woman to have power on her head because of the angels .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , wek laŋ , wek mithekɔckuɔ , ne rin ke Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho , an , Yak jam tok lueel wedhie , ku e cin teŋ tɛk wek weyiic ; ku we bi weyiic mat etok e piɔn tok ku ne loŋ tok , loŋ luɛlki .

text: Nevertheless neither is the man without the woman , neither the woman without the man , in the Lord .
text2: Ku ade jam ci lɛk ɛn e dhien e Kuloe e kedun , wek mithekɔckuɔ , yan , nu ateer e weyiic .

text: For as the woman is of the man , even so is the man also by the woman ; but all things of god .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , we lɛk kene , yan , Raan ebɛn ne weyiic , aye ŋɛk lueel , yan , Yɛn ee raan e Paulo , ku lueel ŋɛk , yan , Yɛn ee raan e Apolo , ku lueel ŋɛk , yan , Yen ee raan e Kepath , ku e ŋɛk , yan , Yɛn ee raan e Kritho .

text: Judge in yourselves : is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered ?
text2: Ci Kritho eyic tek ? Ci Paulo piaat e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu ne baŋdun ? ku week , ci we baptith ne rin ke Paulo ?

text: Doth not even nature itself teach you , that , if a man have long hair , it is a shame unto him ?
text2: Yɛn lec Nhialic luɔi cin en raan ca baptith e weyiic , ee Kirithipo ku Gayo kapac ;

text: But if a woman have long hair , it is a glory to her : for her hair is given her for a covering .
text2: ke cin raan bi e lueel , yan , ca kɔc baptith ne rinki .

text: But if any man seem to be contentious , we have no such custom , neither the churches of God .
text2: Ayi dhien e Thepana aya aca ke baptith : ku akuoc nɔn de raan daŋ ca baptith .

text: Now in this that I declare unto you I praise you not , that ye come together not for the better , but for the worse .
text2: Kritho aken a tooc , ba kɔc bɛn baptith , ee guieer ban welpiɛth aa guiir , en aa tooc en ɛn : ku acie pɛl pɛl ɛn nɔm en duɛɛr ɛn welpiɛth aa guiir , ke tim ci riiu nɔm cii bi aa ɣɔric tim de Kritho .

text: For first of all , when ye come together in the church , I hear that there be divisions among you ; and I partly believe it .
text2: Ku guieer e wel ke tim ci riiu nɔm ee keɣɔric tede kɔc bi maar ; ku ye riɛldht e Nhialic tede wook wok kɔc kony wei .

text: For there must be also heresies among you , that they which are approved may be made manifest among you .
text2: Ne gaar cie gɔɔr , yan , Yɛn bi pɛlenɔm e kɔc pelniim riɔɔk , Ku ŋinydekaŋ de kɔc ŋic kaŋ aba nyaai .

text: When ye come together therefore into one place , this is not to eat the Lord ' s supper .
text2: Raan pelnɔm akou ? raan e loŋ gɔɔr akou ? raan ŋic wel teet nu nou , raan e pinye nɔm ? pɛlenɔm e kɔc ke pinye nɔm kene Nhialic tɔ ye keɣɔric ?

text: For in eating every one taketh before other his own supper : and one is hungry , and another is drunken .
text2: Ku te ci kɔc ke piny nɔm Nhialic guɔ kuc ne pɛl e keniim , cit man ci Nhialic e lueel ne pɛl e yenɔm , ke Nhialic jɔ piɔu miɛt luɔi bi en kɔc gam kony wei ne keɣɔric cɔl guieer e welpiɛth .

text: What ? have ye not houses to eat and to drink in ? or despise ye the church of God , and shame them that have not ? What shall I say to you ? shall I praise you in this ? I praise you not .
text2: Judai akɔɔrki gok bi nyuoth keek , ku kɔɔr Giriki pɛlenɔm :

text: For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you , That the Lord Jesus the same night in which he was betrayed took bread :
text2: ku wook , wok guiir Kritho , raan ci piaat e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu , tede Judai , ee ke ye kɔc tɔ kɔth , ku tede Giriku ee keɣɔric ;

text: And when he had given thanks , he brake it , and said , Take , eat : this is my body , which is broken for you : this do in remembrance of me .
text2: ku tede kɔc ci cɔɔl , Judai ayi Girikii , yen aye Kritho , riɛldiit e Nhialic , ku ye pɛlenɔm e Nhialic .

text: After the same manner also he took the cup , when he had supped , saying , This cup is the new testament in my blood : this do ye , as oft as ye drink it , in remembrance of me .
text2: Acakaa pial e Nhialic piɔu awar kɔc ne pɛlenɔm ; ku kɔc kɔɔce Nhialic awar kɔc ne riɛl .

text: For as often as ye eat this bread , and drink this cup , ye do shew the Lord ' s death till he come .
text2: Ku we ye cɔt cɔɔle we tiŋ , wek mithekɔckuɔ , yan , Acin kɔc juec ci cɔɔl , kɔc ci kɔc ke piny nɔm tɔ ye kɔc pel niim ayi kɔc ril , ayi kɔc ci dhieeth e dhien e bɛny :

text: Wherefore whosoever shall eat this bread , and drink this cup of the Lord , unworthily , shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord .
text2: ee dhan ke piny nɔm kek e lɔc Nhialic , bi kɔc pelniim tɔ yaar : ku lɔc Nhialic kɔc kɔc , bi kɔc ril tɔ yaar ;

text: But let a man examine himself , and so let him eat of that bread , and drink of that cup .
text2: ayi ka youyou ka ke piny nɔm , ayi ka ci biɔɔn , aci Nhialic ke lɔc , acakaa ka liu aya , bi en ka nu tɔ cin naamden ;

text: For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily , eateth and drinketh damnation to himself , not discerning the Lord ' s body .
text2: ke bi cien raan toŋ bi ro leec e yenɔm .

text: For this cause many are weak and sickly among you , and many sleep .
text2: Ku yen aye week tɔ tɔu e Kritho Yecuyic , raan cii Nhialic tɔ ye pɛlenɔm ne baŋda , ku piathepiɔu , ku ɣɛɛrepiɔu , ku weer weere wo bei ;

text: For if we would judge ourselves , we should not be judged .
text2: abi ciet man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Raan e ro leec , ke lec rot e Bɛnyditic .

text: Now concerning spiritual gifts , brethren , I would not have you ignorant .
text2: Ku yɛn , mithekɔckuɔ , waan ba yɛn tede week , yɛn aa cii bɔ wo ŋiec jam ayi pɛlenɔm , waan guieer ɛn week jam ne kede Nhialic .

text: Ye know that ye were Gentiles , carried away unto these dumb idols , even as ye were led .
text2: Yɛn ci loŋ teem e yapiɔu , yan , Acin ke ba ŋic e weyiic , ee Yecu Kritho etok , ku pieet e pieete yen e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu .

text: Wherefore I give you to understand , that no man speaking by the Spirit of God calleth Jesus accursed : and that no man can say that Jesus is the Lord , but by the Holy Ghost .
text2: Ku yɛn aa ye reer e weyiic ke ya kɔc , ku riaac , ku lɛthe yɛn aret .

text: Now there are diversities of gifts , but the same Spirit .
text2: Ku jamdi ayi guieer e ya yɛn guiir aake cin yiic wel e kɔc weŋ , wel ke pɛl e raan nɔm , aake ye cath ne nyuuth ee Weidit ke nyuɔɔth ayi riɛldɛndit ;

text: And there are differences of administrations , but the same Lord .
text2: ke gamdun cii ro bi ŋɔɔth ne pɛl e raan nɔm , abi ro ŋɔɔth ne riɛlditt e Nhialic .

text: And there are diversities of operations , but it is the same God which worketh all in all .
text2: Ku wok ee jam de pɛlenɔm lueel woke kɔc ci ŋuɛn ; ku acie pɛlenɔm e pinye enɔɔne , ku acie pɛlenɔm e banydit ke pinye nɔm , bany bi cien naamden rial .

text: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit withal .
text2: Wok ee pɛl e Nhialic nɔm lueel , pɛl ci yal kɔu bei , ee jam ci thiaan , jam cii Nhialic kɔn lueel e yepiɔu te ŋoote piny ke liu , an , bi aa kede dhueeŋde .

text: For to one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom ; to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit ;
text2: Yen aye pɛlenɔm cin raan toŋ de bany ke pinye nɔm e ci e ŋic ; tee cik ŋic , adi kenki Bɛnydiit e dhueeŋ piaat e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu .

text: To another faith by the same Spirit ; to another the gifts of healing by the same Spirit ;
text2: Ku acit man ci e gɔɔr , yan , Akeneke tiŋ e raan nyin , ku akeneke piŋ e raan yic , Ku akenki lɔ e raan piɔu , Ke ka cii Nhialic guik ne kede kɔc nhiaar en .

text: To another the working of miracles ; to another prophecy ; to another discerning of spirits ; to another divers kinds of tongues ; to another the interpretation of tongues :
text2: Ku wo cii Nhialic nyuoth keek ne Weikɛndit : Weidit ee kaŋ kɔɔr yiic kedhie , yeka , ayi kathuth ke Nhialic .

text: But all these worketh that one and the selfsame Spirit , dividing to every man severally as he will .
text2: Ku ee raanou ŋic ka ke raan , ee piɔn e raan etok , piɔn cath ke ye ? Yen acit en nɔn cin en raan ŋic ka ke Nhialic aya , ee Wei ke Nhialic kapac , kek aŋic keek .

text: For as the body is one , and hath many members , and all the members of that one body , being many , are one body : so also is Christ .
text2: Ku wok aa cii gɛme wei ke piny nɔm , ee wei e bɔ tede Nhialic kek aa gɛme wook , luɔi bi wo kaŋ ŋic ka cii Nhialic gam wook edhueeŋ .

text: For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body , whether we be Jews or Gentiles , whether we be bond or free ; and have been all made to drink into one Spirit .
text2: Kek ayok ke guiir ne wel ci Weidit Ɣer wo wɛɛt , ku cuku keek e guiir ne wel ci wo wɛɛt e pɛl e raan nɔm ; ka ke Wei ayok ke guiir ne wel ke Wei .

text: For the body is not one member , but many .
text2: Ku raan e yepiɔu tuom ka ke piny acii ka ke Wei ke Nhialic e dɔm , aye keek tɔ ye kaɣar yiic ; ku acii keek dueer ŋic , luɔi ye ke yok yiic ne Wei .

text: If the foot shall say , Because I am not the hand , I am not of the body ; is it therefore not of the body ?
text2: Ku raan e yepiɔu tuom ka ke Wei , yen aye kaŋ yok yiic kedhie , ku yenguop acin raan bi ye yokic .

text: And if the ear shall say , Because I am not the eye , I am not of the body ; is it therefore not of the body ?
text2: Ku eeŋa e ŋic piɔn e Bɛnydit , bi en e wɛɛt ? Ku wook , wok cath ne piɔn e Bɛnydit .

text: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels , and have not charity , I am become as sounding brass , or a tinkling cymbal .
text2: Ku yɛn , mithekɔckuɔ , yɛn aa cii dueer jam woke week waan , cit kɔc ci kepiɔth tuom ka ke Wei , yɛn aa ye jam wo week cit kɔc ci kepiɔth tuom ka ke guop tei , cit mith thiiatetet e Krithoyic .

text: And though I have the gift of prophecy , and understand all mysteries , and all knowledge ; and though I have all faith , so that I could remove mountains , and have not charity , I am nothing .
text2: We ca tɔ rueth e ca , ku acin riiŋ ca gam week ; wek aa ken riŋ guɔ leu e cuet : ku acakaa enɔɔne , acaki e leu ;

text: And though I bestow all my goods to feed the poor , and though I give my body to be burned , and have not charity , it profiteth me nothing .
text2: we ŋoot e we tum wepiɔth ka ke piny . Ku nɔn tɔuwe tiɛɛl e weyiic ayi ateer ayi teŋ aa wek weyiic tek , caki wepiɔth e tuom ka ke piny , ku caki e reer e reer e kɔc tei ?

text: Charity suffereth long , and is kind ; charity envieth not ; charity vaunteth not itself , is not puffed up ,
text2: Ku ten e ŋɛk e lueel , yan , Yɛn ee kede Paulo , ku lueel ŋɛk , yan , Yɛn ee kede Apolo ; caki e kɔc e kepiɔth tuom ka ke piny ?

text: Doth not behave itself unseemly , seeketh not her own , is not easily provoked , thinketh no evil ;
text2: Paulo ee ŋa ? ku Apolo ee ŋa ? Ciki e kɔc e luui tei , kɔc ci we tɔ gam , cit man ci Bɛnydit e gam ŋɛk ku gɛm ŋɛk ?

text: Rejoiceth not in iniquity , but rejoiceth in the truth ;
text2: Yɛn e com , Apolo en aaye piook , ku ee Nhialic en aaye kaŋ tɔ cil .

text: Beareth all things , believeth all things , hopeth all things , endureth all things .
text2: Yen acin raan e com naamde , ku cin raan e piook naamde , ee Nhialic raan e kaŋ tɔ cil , yen ade nɔm .

text: Charity never faileth : but whether there be prophecies , they shall fail ; whether there be tongues , they shall cease ; whether there be knowledge , it shall vanish away .
text2: Ku raan e com keke raan e piook ayek tok , ku raan ebɛn abi ariopde yok , ariop bi roŋ ke luɔide yenguop .

text: For we know in part , and we prophesy in part .
text2: Wok ee kɔc e luui ne Nhialic etok : wek ee dom e Nhialic , ku yak alooc de Nhialic .

text: But when that which is perfect is come , then that which is in part shall be done away .
text2: Luɔi luɔɔi ɛn ke ci taau e yacin ne dhueeŋ de Nhialic piɔu , yen aa kɛɛr ɛn keerkeer , cit man aten pelnɔm nu e ateet niim , ku ee raan daŋ yen a yik thin . Ku tɔ raan ebɛn cok e woi en yin yik en thin .

text: When I was a child , I spake as a child , I understood as a child , I thought as a child : but when I became a man , I put away childish things .
text2: Ku keerkeer daŋ acin raan dueer e leu e kɛɛr , ee ke ye thok e kɛɛr etok , yen aye Yecu Kritho .

text: For now we see through a glass , darkly ; but then face to face : now I know in part ; but then shall I know even as also I am known .
text2: Ku na yik raan e keerkeere nɔm , ku yiŋ yik en e yenɔm , nɔn ee yen adhaap , ku nɔn ee yen ateek , nɔn ee yen kuur lak , nɔn ee yen tim , nɔn ee yen wal , nɔn ee yen anin ;

text: And now abideth faith , hope , charity , these three ; but the greatest of these is charity .
text2: ke luɔi de raan ebɛn abi tic wadaŋ : ekoole yen abi e nyuɔɔth , ee mac en abi e nyuɔɔth ; ku luɔi de raan ebɛn abii mac them , nɔn ee yen luɔi cit ŋo .

text: Follow after charity , and desire spiritual gifts , but rather that ye may prophesy .
text2: Tɔ lueel raan ne kede wook nɔn ee wok kɔc e ka ke Kritho looi , kɔc cii ka ke Nhialic taau e kecin , ka ci thiaan ɣɔn .

text: For he that speaketh in an unknown tongue speaketh not unto men , but unto God : for no man understandeth him ; howbeit in the spirit he speaketh mysteries .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , raan cii kaŋ taau e yecin , abi dhil aa raan adot .

text: But he that prophesieth speaketh unto men to edification , and exhortation , and comfort .
text2: Ku ne yɛn , ee kecin naamde nɔn ba wek a thieec ne ka ca looi , ku nɔn bi kɔc a thieec aya : yeka , ayik ɛn guop , yɛn cii rot e thieec .

text: He that speaketh in an unknown tongue edifieth himself ; but he that prophesieth edifieth the church .
text2: Acin ke ŋiɛc rot ; ku acie kene yen a tɔ yɛn e raan piɛthpiɔu : Raan e ya thieec , en aye Bɛnydit .

text: I would that ye all spake with tongues , but rather that ye prophesied : for greater is he that prophesieth than he that speaketh with tongues , except he interpret , that the church may receive edifying .
text2: Yen cin en ke yak jɔɔny te ŋoot akooldit wei , te ŋoote Bɛnydit ke ken bɛn , raan bi ka ci thiaan tecol bɛɛi teɣer , ku bi looŋ ee lueel e kɔc piɔth tɔ tiec ; ekoole yen abii raan ebɛn lɛc yok tede Nhialic .

text: Now , brethren , if I come unto you speaking with tongues , what shall I profit you , except I shall speak to you either by revelation , or by knowledge , or by prophesying , or by doctrine ?
text2: Ku kake , wek mithekɔckuɔ , aca ke lueel ne kedi woke Apolo ne baŋdun week , luɔi ban week wɛɛt , an , Duoki kɔc e rieu awar ke ci gɔɔr , ku e cin raan e dit e ŋɛk tɛɛr , an , diit awar ŋɛk .

text: And even things without life giving sound , whether pipe or harp , except they give a distinction in the sounds , how shall it be known what is piped or harped ?
text2: Eeŋa e yi tɔ tɔu pei ? ku eeŋo cath ke yin ke kene gam yi ? Ku na ci gam yin , ka eeŋo e yin ro leec , acit man e ke kene gam yin ?

text: For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound , who shall prepare himself to the battle ?
text2: We e guɔ kuɛth etaiwei , wek juec e kakun enɔɔne , wek e piny cieŋ cit man e bany , ke wok liu thin : ku adi ya piɔu miɛt , tee we ceŋ piny eyin , ke wo dueer piny cieŋ ne week etok .

text: So likewise ye , except ye utter by the tongue words easy to be understood , how shall it be known what is spoken ? for ye shall speak into the air .
text2: Ku ne yapiɔu , wo cii Nhialic taau cieen wok tuuc , cit man e kɔc ci gam thuɔɔu : wo ci tɔ ye ke bi aa woi e piny nɔm , bi tuucnhial aa woi , ayi kɔc .

text: There are , it may be , so many kinds of voices in the world , and none of them is without signification .
text2: Wok ee dhan ne baŋ de Kritho , ku wek ee kɔc pelniim e Krithoyic ; wok kɔc gup , ku wek ril ; wek de niim dhueeŋ , wok cin naamda .

text: Therefore if I know not the meaning of the voice , I shall be unto him that speaketh a barbarian , and he that speaketh shall be a barbarian unto me .
text2: Aɣet ci enɔɔne , wok ee cɔk nɔk ayi reu , ku cinku kɔɔth lupɔɔ , ku bieke wook e kɔc cin , wok e taai , wo cin niim wut ;

text: Even so ye , forasmuch as ye are zealous of spiritual gifts , seek that ye may excel to the edifying of the church .
text2: wok ee cool e loi luɔi e wocin : lat wo , ke luelku , yan , Thieithieei ; yɔŋ wo , ke gumku ;

text: Wherefore let him that speaketh in an unknown tongue pray that he may interpret .
text2: leke wo kerac , ke wo laŋ kɔc : wo ci tɔ ye nuoon e piny nɔm , ku tɔ wook e ayil e kaŋ kedhie aɣet ci ekoole .

text: For if I pray in an unknown tongue , my spirit prayeth , but my understanding is unfruitful .
text2: Yɛn cii kake gaar luɔi ban we tɔ yaar , ku wek a nen cit man e mithkien nhiaar gup .

text: What is it then ? I will pray with the spirit , and I will pray with the understanding also : I will sing with the spirit , and I will sing with the understanding also .
text2: Ku na cak dɛ agum de kɔc kathieer nu , kɔc e week wɛɛt e ka ke Kritho , ku acin warkun juec nu : we ca dhieeth e Krithoyic ne guieer e welpiɛth .

text: Else when thou shalt bless with the spirit , how shall he that occupieth the room of the unlearned say Amen at thy giving of thanks , seeing he understandeth not what thou sayest ?
text2: Yen a yɔɔk ɛn week , yan , Yak taudi dɔmic .

text: For thou verily givest thanks well , but the other is not edified .
text2: Yen aa tuoc ɛn Timotheo week , ee wendien nhiaar ku ee raan adot e ka ke Bɛnydit , en abi week tɔ tak weniim ne tau aa yen tɔu e Krithoyic , acit man wɛɛt ɛn baai ebɛn e kanithɔyin ebɛn .

text: I thank my God , I speak with tongues more than ye all :
text2: Ku kɔc kɔk e weyiic acik niim dham , ayek lueel , yan , ca bi bɛn tede week .

text: Yet in the church I had rather speak five words with my understanding , that by my voice I might teach others also , than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue .
text2: Ku yɛn bi dap bɛn tede week , te nu en e Bɛnydit piɔu , aguɔ riɛl e kɔcke ŋic , kɔc wen ci niim dham , acie jamden tei .

text: Brethren , be not children in understanding : howbeit in malice be ye children , but in understanding be men .
text2: Ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic acie jam tei , ee riɛldit .

text: In the law it is written , With men of other tongues and other lips will I speak unto this people ; and yet for all that will they not hear me , saith the Lord .
text2: E wepiɔth wakdi ? Ba bɛn tede week ke ya muk thieny duoi ɛn week , ku ba bɛn woke nhieer ku piɔn lir ?

text: Moreover , brethren , I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you , which also ye have received , and wherein ye stand ;
text2: Aye lueel e raan ebɛn , an , nu dhoom e weyiic , ku dhoom yinya aliu acakaa Juoor yiic aliu , yan , bi raan tiiŋ de wun noom .

text: By which also ye are saved , if ye keep in memory what I preached unto you , unless ye have believed in vain .
text2: Ku we e niim dham , ku kɛnki dhiau , ke raan ci ekene looi bi jɔt e weyiic .

text: For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received , how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures ;
text2: Ku yɛn , raan liu guop e weyiic , ku nu ne weike , yɛn ci loŋ de raan ci kene looi guɔ teem , cit man e kee nu ,

text: And that he was buried , and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures :
text2: yan , Ne rin ke Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho , te ca wek gueer etok , week ne weiki , ku ne riɛldiit e Bɛnydit Yecu Kritho ,

text: And that he was seen of Cephas , then of the twelve :
text2: ke we bi eraane yien Catan le riɔɔk guop , ke bi kony wei ekool e Bɛnydit Yecu .

text: After that , he was seen of above five hundred brethren at once ; of whom the greater part remain unto this present , but some are fallen asleep .
text2: Lɛc aa wek rot leec acii piɛth . Kuocki luɔu thiinakaŋ nɔn ee yen awany dit tɔ piɔɔr ebɛn ?

text: After that , he was seen of James ; then of all the apostles .
text2: Yen waak wek luɔu thɛɛr wei , ke we bi aa awany e piɛc nuaai , cit man waan cien wek yiic luɔu . Nyɔŋdan amaal de Winythok ee guɔ nɔk ne baŋda , yen Kritho .

text: And last of all he was seen of me also , as of one born out of due time .
text2: Yen ciɛm wok kuin e aliith , kuin cinic luɔu thɛɛr , ku cinic luɔu de anyaak , ku rɛɛcdepiɔu , yok cam e knin cinic luɔu knin e piɔn yic agɔk .

text: For I am the least of the apostles , that am not meet to be called an apostle , because I persecuted the church of God .
text2: Aca gaar week waan e awarekic , yan , Duoki e mat ne dhoom etok ;

text: But by the grace of God I am what I am : and his grace which was bestowed upon me was not in vain ; but I laboured more abundantly than they all : yet not I , but the grace of God which was with me .
text2: ku akɛn lueel , yan , bak pɔk etaiwei weke dhoom ke pinye nɔm , ayi kɔc dit piɔth , ayi cuɛɛr , ayi kɔc e yieth lam ; yen aduɛɛr wek dhil jal e piny nɔm .

text: Therefore whether it were I or they , so we preach , and so ye believed .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , aca gaar week , yan , Duoki e mat etok ne raan ci tɔ ye mɛnhkeneda , te ee yen dhom , ku nɔn ee yen raan dit piɔu , ku nɔn ee yen raan e yieth lam , ayi raan e kɔc laat , ayi raan e ro tɔ wit e mɔu , ayi cuɛɛr ; raan cit ekene , acakaa kecam , ke we duoki rom ne yen .

text: Now if Christ be preached that he rose from the dead , how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead ?
text2: Guieer e loŋ e kɔc tɔu biic eeŋodi thin ? Cie kedun , an , bak loŋ de kɔc nu e kanithɔyic aa guiir ?

text: But if there be no resurrection of the dead , then is Christ not risen :
text2: Ku kɔc e tɔu biic loŋden abii Nhialic guiir . Jaki raan rɛɛce bɛɛi bei e weyiic .

text: Now concerning the collection for the saints , as I have given order to the churches of Galatia , even so do ye .
text2: Te de yen raan nu e weyiic raan de nɔm gɔny keke raan daŋ , dueer dhil lɔ gɔɔny e kɔc rac niim , ku cii lɔ gɔɔny e kɔc ɣerpiɔth niim ?

text: Upon the first day of the week let every one of you lay by him in store , as God hath prospered him , that there be no gatherings when I come .
text2: Kuocki kɔc ɣerpiɔth nɔn bi kek loŋ de kɔc ke piny nɔm aa gulir ? Ku te bi loŋ de kɔc ke piny nɔm aa guiir e week , caki dueer roŋ ne guieer ba wek looŋ thiiakaŋ aa guiir ?

text: And when I come , whomsoever ye shall approve by your letters , them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem .
text2: Kuocki nɔn hi wo loŋ de tuucnhial aa guiir ? Ku na guieer e ka ke pinye nɔm enɔɔne , cii piɔl e kene aret ?

text: And if it be meet that I go also , they shall go with me .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , te dɛ wek niim gɔɔny ne ka ke pinye enɔɔne , jaki kɔc taau e gɔɔny niim kɔc cin naamden e kanithɔyic .

text: Now I will come unto you , when I shall pass through Macedonia : for I do pass through Macedonia .
text2: Ee yaar ba wek yaar , en a luɛɛl ɛn ekene . Ye guop ka , cin raan toŋ pelnɔm e weyiic , raan dueer loŋ de raan keke mɛnhkene ŋiec guiir ?

text: And it may be that I will abide , yea , and winter with you , that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , raan ee lɔ gɔɔny ke mɛnhkene , acakaa e kɔc reec gam niim .

text: For I will not see you now by the way ; but I trust to tarry a while with you , if the Lord permit .
text2: Yen aya wek kedaŋ jɔ wooc alaldiite , ne goony aa wek rot gaany wapac . Eeŋo ca wek kerac e guum tei ? Eeŋo ca wek rot e tɔ cam tei ?

text: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost .
text2: Ku we ye kɔc luoi kerac , ku yak kɔc cam , ayi kɔckun aya .

text: For a great door and effectual is opened unto me , and there are many adversaries .
text2: Kuocki kɔc racpiɔth nɔn cii kek ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic bi lɔɔk lak ? Duoki rot e tɔ mɛthe : dhoom , ayi kɔc e yieth lam , ayi kɔc e dieer lei kɔɔr , ayi dieer e roor kɔɔr , ayi roor e rot tɔ ye diaar , ayi roor e nhi e roor ,

text: Now if Timotheus come , see that he may be with you without fear : for he worketh the work of the Lord , as I also do .
text2: ayi cuɛɛr , ayi kɔc e weu nhiaar , ayi kɔc e rot tɔ wit e mɔu , ayi kɔc e kɔc laat , ayi kɔc e kɔc rum , keek kedhie , aciki ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic bi lɔɔk lak .

text: Let no man therefore despise him : but conduct him forth in peace , that he may come unto me : for I look for him with the brethren .
text2: Ku kɔc kɔk e weyiic aake ye kɔc cit keek : ku enɔɔne we ci waak , we ci tɔ ɣerpiɔth , we ci tɔ piɛthpiɔth ne rin ke Bɛnydit Yecu , ku ne Weidit ke Nhialicda .

text: As touching our brother Apollos , I greatly desired him to come unto you with the brethren : but his will was not at all to come at this time ; but he will come when he shall have convenient time .
text2: Kaŋ kedhie acike pal ɛn ; ku kaŋ aciki e dɛ piathden kedhie ; kaŋ kedhie acike pal ɛn , ku yɛn ci bi tuɛɛl e kedaŋ cok bi a cieŋ .

text: Watch ye , stand fast in the faith , quit you like men , be strong .
text2: Kecam ee kede yac , ku yac ee kede kecam ; ku Nhialic abi keek riɔɔk kedhie . Ku guop de raan acie kede dhoom , ee kede Bɛnydit , ku Bɛnydit ee kede raan guop .

text: Let all your things be done with charity .
text2: Ku Nhialic e Bɛnydit jat nhial , ku abi wo jat nhial aya ne riɛldiit e yencin .

text: I beseech you , brethren , ( ye know the house of Stephanas , that it is the firstfruits of Achaia , and that they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints , )
text2: Kuocki wegup , nɔn ee kek ka ke Kritho ? Ku ba ka ke Kritho noom , ta keek e ka ke akɔɔrroor ? Ei ! Acii bi aa yen !

text: That ye submit yourselves unto such , and to every one that helpeth with us , and laboureth .
text2: Kuocki ecooke , yan , Raan e mat keke akɔɔrroor , ke ye guop tok keke ycn etok ? Aa lueel , yan , Keek kaarou abik aa guop tok .

text: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus : for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied .
text2: Ku raan ci mat keke Bɛnydit kek aye wei tok .

text: For they have refreshed my spirit and yours : therefore acknowledge ye them that are such .
text2: Yak kat ne dhoom . Kerɛɛc ebɛn ken ee raan looi anu e raan guop biic ; ku raan dhom ee guopde luoi kerac .

text: The churches of Asia salute you . Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord , with the church that is in their house .
text2: Ku kuocki guopdun nɔn ee yen luaŋditt e Weidit Ɣer nu e weyiic , Wei cak yok tede Nhialic , ku wek cie cath e naamdun ?

text: All the brethren greet you . Greet ye one another with an holy kiss .
text2: We ci ɣɔɔc e ɣooc tuc : yen aa wek Nhialic tɔ yok dhueeŋ ne guopdunic ayi weikun yiic , kek ka ke Nhialic ka .

text: Paul , an apostle , ( not of men , neither by man , but by Jesus Christ , and God the Father , who raised him from the dead ; )
text2: Yɛn Paulo , tuc , ( ku ca ye tuny e kɔc , ku acie raan en ee toc ɛn , ee Yecu Kritho , keke Nhialic Waada , Raan e jɔt en e kɔc ci thou yiic ) ,

text: And all the brethren which are with me , unto the churches of Galatia :
text2: yɛn woke mithekɔckuɔn tɔu ne yɛn etok , awarek en gɛɛrku kanithɔɔ ke Galatai .

text: Grace be to you and peace from God the Father , and from our Lord Jesus Christ ,
text2: E dhueeŋdepiɔu keke mat e ke tɔu ne week , ne ke bɔ tede Nhialic Waada , ku Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho ,

text: Who gave himself for our sins , that he might deliver us from this present evil world , according to the will of God and our Father :
text2: raan ci ro gaam ne biak de karɛc cuk looi , luɔi bi en wo luok ne pinye nɔm enɔɔne , piny rɛɛce , ne kede piɔn e Nhialic Waada :

text: To whom be glory for ever and ever . Amen .
text2: e dhueeŋ e ye tɔu keke yen aɣet athɛɛr ya . Amen .

text: I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel :
text2: Yɛn gai e ke ca wek ro dap guɔ rat wei wakya e Raan lɔɔm Raan ci we caal e dhueeŋic dhueeŋ de Kritho piɔu , lak welpiɛth kɔk gam :

text: Which is not another ; but there be some that trouble you , and would pervert the gospel of Christ .
text2: ku acin welpiɛth kɔk nu , wel yith ; ku ade kɔc e week tɔ diɛɛr e wel , akɔɔrki luɔi bi kek welpiɛth ke Kritho puk kɔɔth .

text: But though we , or an angel from heaven , preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you , let him be accursed .
text2: Ku na cakaa wook , ku na cakaa tuny bɔ nhial , te de en raan guiir week welpiɛth mɛɛn pei , wel cii thoŋ ke wel waan guiirku week , ne bi guop dɛ aciɛɛn .

text: As we said before , so say I now again , If any man preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received , let him be accursed .
text2: Acit man e ke cuk kɔn lueel waan , aba bɛ nyɔkic , aleyɔɔ , Te de en raan guiir week welpiɛth mɛɛn pei wel cii thoŋ ke wel waan cak noom , ne bi guop dɛ aciɛɛn .

text: For do I now persuade men , or God ? or do I seek to please men ? for if I yet pleased men , I should not be the servant of Christ .
text2: Kaar luɔi bi kɔc piɔth miɛt ne yɛn enɔɔne , ku ye Nhialic ? kaar luɔi ban kɔc kɔc nyiin ? Tee ya ŋoot ke ya ye kɔc kɔc nyiin , adi ca ye lim de Kritho .

text: But I certify you , brethren , that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , we ta ŋic ekene , wek mithekɔckuɔ , yan , Welpiɛth ca guiir waan , aciki e ka ke raan .

text: For I neither received it of man , neither was I taught it , but by the revelation of Jesus Christ .
text2: Ku aake ca yok tede raan , ku kene ya wɛɛt aya , ee nyuuth ci Yecu Kritho a nyuooth tei .

text: For ye have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews ' religion , how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God , and wasted it :
text2: Wek e taudi piŋ taudien aa yɛn tɔu ɣɔn e lam e Judaiyic , lam ee kek Nhialic lam , luɔi aa yɛn kanithɔ de Nhialic yɔŋ e yoŋ rac etaiwei , ku riaar :

text: And profited in the Jews ' religion above many my equals in mine own nation , being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers .
text2: ku yɛn e kɔc juec riic wok woor ne lam de Judai , luɔi aa yɛn yic lɛth alal ka waar keek ne kede ciɛɛŋ thɛɛr e kuarkuɔ .

text: But when it pleased God , who separated me from my mother ' s womb , and called me by his grace ,
text2: Ku Nhialic , Raan ci a tɔɔu pei ne maar yac , go ya cɔɔl ne dhueeŋ de yenpiɔu , te ci en piɔu miɛt ,

text: To reveal his Son in me , that I might preach him among the heathen ; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood :
text2: luɔi bi en a nyuoth Wende e yapiɔu , ke yɛn bi welkɛn piɛth aa guiir e Juoor yiic ; ku enɔnthiine yɛn ken loŋ guiir woke kɔckuɔ :

text: Neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me ; but I went into Arabia , and returned again unto Damascus .
text2: ku kɛn lɔ Jeruthalem te nu kɔc e ye tuuc ɣɔn ŋuɔɔt ɛn ; ku yɛn e jal ke ya lɔ Arabia ; na wen , ke ya be yanɔm pɔk Damathko .

text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter , and abode with him fifteen days .
text2: Na wen , aca run lɛɛr kadiak , ke ya lɔ Jeruthalem kɛny Petero , aguɔ reer wo yen e akool kathieer ku dhic .

text: But other of the apostles saw I none , save James the Lord ' s brother .
text2: Ku acin tuny daŋ ca tiŋ , ee Jakop etok , manhe e Bɛnydit .

text: Now the things which I write unto you , behold , before God , I lie not .
text2: Ku ka gaar week enɔɔne , di , yɛn cii lueth tor , aŋic Nhialic .

text: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia ;
text2: Na wen , ke ya lɔ piny de Thuria ku Kilikia .

text: And was unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ :
text2: Ku yɛn ŋoot ke ya kuc guop e kanithɔɔ ke Judaya , kanithɔɔ nu e Krithoyic :

text: But they had heard only , That he which persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed .
text2: acik kedi piŋ tei , yan , Raan waan e wo yɔŋ , yen aye kɔc guieer gam enɔɔne , gam waan ee riɔɔk ;

text: And they glorified God in me .
text2: agoki Nhialic leec ne kedi .

text: Then fourteen years after I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas , and took Titus with me also .
text2: Na wen , aci run wan kathieer ku ŋuan , ke ya be lɔ Jeruthalem woke Baranaba etok , ku wo cath woke Tito ayadaŋ .

text: And I went up by revelation , and communicated unto them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles , but privately to them which were of reputation , lest by any means I should run , or had run , in vain .
text2: Ku yan e lɔ ne kede nyuuth ci a nyuooth ; aguɔ welpiɛth lueel e keniim welpiɛth aa cool e guiɛɛr ɛn keek e Juoor yiic ; aa ke luɛɛl e kɔc de naamden niim kapac te cin kɔc , nɔn bi en yien aa ɣɔric , yen ke luɔɔi , ayi ka ca looi ɣɔn nɔn ee kek ɣaar yiic ayadaŋ .

text: But neither Titus , who was with me , being a Greek , was compelled to be circumcised :
text2: Ku acakaa Tito akene dhil tɔ cuel ayadaŋ , ku ye Giriki :

text: And that because of false brethren unawares brought in , who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus , that they might bring us into bondage :
text2: ee jam de mithekɔckuɔn kɔk aluɛth , kɔc ci bɛn thin ecueer , en aa jɛi wok e cuɛlde , ayek cathda bɛn neem , cath ciɛth wok e kede yenhda e Kritho Yecuyin , luɔi bi kek wo tɔ ye liim .

text: To whom we gave place by subjection , no , not for an hour ; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you .
text2: Ku akenku ke tɔ tiam wook , buk aa reer e loŋdenic , acin thaar tok ; luɔi bi yic de welpiɛth aa tɔu ke week .

text: But of these who seemed to be somewhat , ( whatsoever they were , it maketh no matter to me : God accepteth no man ' s person : ) for they who seemed to be somewhat in conference added nothing to me :
text2: Ku kɔcke kɔc ci tɔ ye kɔc de naamden , ( acakaa kek e ye ŋo , acakaa kek e dit ku acakaa kek e kor , akitki tede yɛn : Nhialic acin raan e rieu guop ) kɔcke kɔc ci tɔ ye kɔc dit acin loŋ daŋ cik lɛk ɛn :

text: But contrariwise , when they saw that the gospel of the uncircumcision was committed unto me , as the gospel of the circumcision was unto Peter ;
text2: acie yen , ku te ci kek e tiŋ , nɔn ci guieer taau e yacin guieer ban welpiɛth guieer kɔc kene cueel , acit man ci guieer bi en aŋueel guieer taau e Petero cin ,

text: ( For he that wrought effectually in Peter to the apostleship of the circumcision , the same was mighty in me toward the Gentiles : )
text2: ( ku Raan waan e luui keke Petero ne kede tuoc ci e tuoc aŋueel , yen aaye luui keke yɛn ayadaŋ ne kede Juoor ) ;

text: And when James , Cephas , and John , who seemed to be pillars , perceived the grace that was given unto me , they gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship ; that we should go unto the heathen , and they unto the circumcision .
text2: na wen , te ci kek dhueeŋ ŋic dhueeŋ ci gam ɛn , ke yi Jakop , ku Kepath , ku Jɔn , kɔc ci tɔ ye meen ke kanithɔ , ke ke gɛm wook cin cueec ke maath , wo woke Baranaba , yan , buk lɔ tede Juoor wook , ku leki tede aŋueel ;

text: Only they would that we should remember the poor ; the same which I also was forward to do .
text2: ee cooke etok tei , yan , taŋ bi wok kɔc kuany nyiin aa tak ; ku yen ecook mane guop aa ya yɛn cool e lethic e ye .

text: But when Peter was come to Antioch , I withstood him to the face , because he was to be blamed .
text2: Na wen , aci Petero bɛn Antiokia , ke ja jɔɔny e yenɔm , luɔi de yen yeth gaak .

text: For before that certain came from James , he did eat with the Gentiles : but when they were come , he withdrew and separated himself , fearing them which were of the circumcision .
text2: Ɣɔn ŋoote kɔc kɔk e ke ken bɛn tede Jakop , aa ye cam keke Juoor etok : na wen , aci kɔcke bɛn , ke jɔ enɔm dak cieen , go ro tɔɔu pei , ne riɔɔc ee yen riɔɔc e aŋueel .

text: And the other Jews dissembled likewise with him ; insomuch that Barnabas also was carried away with their dissimulation .
text2: Ago Judai kɔk ayadaŋ luui erueeny ne yen etok ; arek abi Baranaba thɛl wei ne rueenyden aya .

text: But when I saw that they walked not uprightly according to the truth of the gospel , I said unto Peter before them all , If thou , being a Jew , livest after the manner of Gentiles , and not as do the Jews , why compellest thou the Gentiles to live as do the Jews ?
text2: Na wen , aca reerden tiŋ , nɔn cii en e reer piɛth reer roŋ ke yic de welpiɛth , ke ya ja Petero yɔɔk e kɔc niim kedhie , yan , Yin , yin ee Judai nɔm , te reer yin e reer e Juoor ku cii cit reer e reere Judai , eeŋo e yin Juoor dhil tɔ rɛɛr e reer e Judai ?

text: We who are Jews by nature , and not sinners of the Gentiles ,
text2: Wok kɔc ci dhieeth ke wo ye Judai , ku wo cie Juoor e karac looi ,

text: Knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law , but by the faith of Jesus Christ , even we have believed in Jesus Christ , that we might be justified by the faith of Christ , and not by the works of the law : for by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified .
text2: aŋicku nɔn kene raan tɔ piɛthpiɔu ne luɔi de loŋ , ee gam de Yecu Kritho etok , en ee raan tɔ piɛthpiɔu , ayi wok ayadaŋ , wo e Yecu Kritho gam , luɔi bi wo tɔ piɛthpiɔth ne gam ci wo Kritho gam , ku acie ne luɔi de loŋ : ne cin cin en raan toŋ bi tɔ piɛthpiɔu ne luɔi de loŋ .

text: But if , while we seek to be justified by Christ , we ourselves also are found sinners , is therefore Christ the minister of sin ? God forbid .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , te kɔɔr wok luɔi bi wo tɔ piɛthpiɔu e Krithoyic , ku wo wogup , wo ci yok a ye kɔc e kerac looi ayadaŋ , ke Kritho ee raan e kede kerac looi ? Acie yen !

text: For if I build again the things which I destroyed , I make myself a transgressor .
text2: Ku te can kake bɛ yik , ka waan ca ŋaany , ke yɛn e ro tɔ ye raan e kaŋ wooc .

text: For I through the law am dead to the law , that I might live unto God .
text2: Ku ne loŋ yɛn ci guɔ thou ne kede loŋ , luɔi ban piir ne kede Nhialic .

text: I am crucified with Christ : nevertheless I live ; yet not I , but Christ liveth in me : and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God , who loved me , and gave himself for me .
text2: Yɛn ci piaat e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu woke Kritho etok ; ku yɛn ŋoot ke ya piir ; ku acii be aa yɛn , ee Kritho en piir e yaguop : ku piir pieer ɛn e guopic enɔɔne , ee gam en a pieer ɛn , gam aa yɛn Wen e Nhialic gam , raan e nhiaar ɛn , ago ro gaam ne biakdi .

text: I do not frustrate the grace of God : for if righteousness come by the law , then Christ is dead in vain .
text2: Yɛn cii dhueeŋ de Nhialic piɔu e tɔ cin naamde : ku te bi piathepiɔu tede loŋ , ke thon e thouwe Kritho ee ɣɔric .

text: O foolish Galatians , who hath bewitched you , that ye should not obey the truth , before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been evidently set forth , crucified among you ?
text2: Wek Galatai mum niim oou , eeŋa ci we thueeth , ba we yin cuo piŋ , wek kɔc cii Yecu Kritho taau e weniim edei , ke ye piaat e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu ?

text: This only would I learn of you , Received ye the Spirit by the works of the law , or by the hearing of faith ?
text2: Ee cooke yetok en a kaar luɔi ban e piŋ tede week , Cak Weidit yok ne luɔi de loŋ , ku cak ke yok ne piŋ ca wek e piŋ , aguɔki gam ?

text: Are ye so foolish ? having begun in the Spirit , are ye now made perfect by the flesh ?
text2: Mum mɔɔm weniim ka ? nɔn ca wek gamdun gɔl e Wei yiic , bak thol e guopic enɔɔne ?

text: Have ye suffered so many things in vain ? if it be yet in vain .
text2: Ee ɣɔric en e guoom wek kajueec cit ekake ? ku cie ɣɔric en e guom wek ?

text: He therefore that ministereth to you the Spirit , and worketh miracles among you , doeth he it by the works of the law , or by the hearing of faith ?
text2: Raan e week yien Weidit enɔɔne , ku ye luɔi ril looi e weyiic , ee luɔi de loŋ en e ye yen e looi , ku ye looi ne gam de ke ci piŋ ?

text: Even as Abraham believed God , and it was accounted to him for righteousness .
text2: Acit man ci Abraɣam Nhialic gam , ago tɔ ye piathepiɔu tede yen .

text: Know ye therefore that they which are of faith , the same are the children of Abraham .
text2: Yen ŋiɛc wek cooke , yan , Kɔc ke gam kek aye mith ke Abraɣam .

text: And the scripture , foreseeing that God would justify the heathen through faith , preached before the gospel unto Abraham , saying , In thee shall all nations be blessed .
text2: Ku kecigɔɔr , te ci en e kɔn tiŋ nɔn bi Nhialic Juoor tɔ piɛthpiɔth ne gam , ke jɔ welpiɛth kɔn guieer Abraɣam , yan , Juoor ebɛn abi thieei ne yin .

text: So then they which be of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham .
text2: Ago kɔc ke gam agoke guɔ thieei ne Abraɣam etok , raan ŋic gam .

text: For as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse : for it is written , Cursed is every one that continueth not in all things which are written in the book of the law to do them .
text2: Ku kɔc ke luɔi de loŋ kek atɔuki e aciɛɛnic kedhie : luɔi ci e gɔɔr , yan , Raan ebɛn raan cie cool e dot ka ci gɔɔr e awarek de loŋic kedhie , bi keek aa looi , ka ci cieen .

text: But that no man is justified by the law in the sight of God , it is evident : for , The just shall live by faith .
text2: Ku cin cin en raan ci tɔ piɛthpiɔu ne loŋ e Nhialic nɔm , yen aye tic egɔk : luɔi ci e gɔɔr , yan , Raan piɛthpiɔu abi piir e gam ;

text: And the law is not of faith : but , The man that doeth them shall live in them .
text2: ku loŋ acie kede gam : ku aye gɔɔr , yan , Raan e keek looi , yen abi piir e keyiic .

text: Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law , being made a curse for us : for it is written , Cursed is every one that hangeth on a tree :
text2: Kritho aci wo wɛɛr bei e aciɛɛn e loŋic , luɔi ci e tɔ ye aciɛɛn ne biakda : luɔi ci e gɔɔr , yan , Raan ebɛn raan nɔɔk e tim nɔm , ka ci cieen :

text: That the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ ; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith .
text2: e luɔi bi athiɛɛi de Abraɣam bɛn e Juoor gup ne Yecu Kritho ; ku luɔi bi wo kaŋ yok ka ci kɔn lueel , yan , bi ke gam wook , kek aye Weidit , ne gam gɛm wok .

text: Brethren , I speak after the manner of men ; Though it be but a man ' s covenant , yet if it be confirmed , no man disannulleth , or addeth thereto .
text2: Wek mithekɔckuɔ , yɛn jam e jam e kɔc tei : Loŋ ci mac , acakaa yen e ye loŋ e raan tei , te ci e mac egɔk , ka cin raan bi e tɔ cin naamde , ku acin raan bi wel kɔk taau thin .

text: Now to Abraham and his seed were the promises made . He saith not , And to seeds , as of many ; but as of one , And to thy seed , which is Christ .
text2: Ku ka ci kɔn lueel , an , bi ke gam en , ayeke lɛk Abraɣam keke kaude . Aken lueel , yan , Aba ke gam kɔth , cit nɔn juec kek ; ee tok en e lueel , yan , Aba ke gam kaudu , yen aye Kritho .

text: And this I say , that the covenant , that was confirmed before of God in Christ , the law , which was four hundred and thirty years after , cannot disannul , that it should make the promise of none effect .
text2: Tharde ki yen a luɛɛl , yan , Loŋ ci mac ɣɔn , loŋ ŋoote Nhialic ke kaac thin egɔk , yan , ee kede Kritho , acii dueere tɔ cin naamde ne loŋ de Mothe , loŋ ci yien kɔc e loŋe cok , wen ci en run lɛɛr bot kaŋuan ku thierdiak , ku ke ci kɔn lueel , an , bi gam en , acii loŋ de Mothe dueer tɔ cin naamde .

text: For if the inheritance be of the law , it is no more of promise : but God gave it to Abraham by promise .
text2: Ku ke bi lɔɔk lak e kɔc , te bi en ne loŋ , ka cii be aa ke ci kɔn lueel , yan , bi gam : ku aci Nhialic gam Abraɣam ne luɛl ci en e kɔn lueel , yan , bi gam en .

text: Wherefore then serveth the law ? It was added because of transgressions , till the seed should come to whom the promise was made ; and it was ordained by angels in the hand of a mediator .
text2: Ku loŋ , eeŋodɛn bi looi ? Aci taau thin ne biak de wac ci kɔc kaŋ wooc , aɣet te bi kau bɛn , kau ci kɔn lueel , yan , bi gam en ; ku aci ŋiec guik apiɛth e tuucuhial , ku jɔ taau e raan e kɔc luk cin .

text: Now a mediator is not a mediator of one , but God is one .
text2: Ku raan e kɔc luk , acie raan tok en ee luook ; ku Nhialic en aye tok .

text: Is the law then against the promises of God ? God forbid : for if there had been a law given which could have given life , verily righteousness should have been by the law .
text2: Ku loŋ enɔɔne , deki ater ne ka ci Nhialic kɔn lueel , an , bi ke gam kɔc ? Acie yen ! ku te e de loŋ ci yien kɔc nu , loŋ dueer kɔc tɔ piir , eyic , piathepiɔu adi ci bɛn tede loŋ .

text: But the scripture hath concluded all under sin , that the promise by faith of Jesus Christ might be given to them that believe .
text2: Ku kecigɔɔr aci jaŋ ebɛn mac e keracic , luɔi bi ke ci kɔn lueel , an , bi yien kɔc , ne gam ci kek Yecu Kritho gam , luɔi bi e yien kɔc ci gam .

text: But before faith came , we were kept under the law , shut up unto the faith which should afterwards be revealed .
text2: Ku te ŋoote gam ke ken bɛn , wok ci mac , ku tit wo e loŋic , wo ci yok e wo mac aɣet kool bi gam bɛn , gam bi nyuoth kɔc elemiak .

text: Wherefore the law was our schoolmaster to bring us unto Christ , that we might be justified by faith .
text2: Yen tede ka , loŋ en aye raan e wo wɛɛt cit mith , leer wook te nu Kritho , luɔi bi wo tɔ piɛthpiɔth ne gam .

text: But after that faith is come , we are no longer under a schoolmaster .
text2: Ku enɔn ci gam guɔ bɛn , ke wo cii be aa mith nu e raan e wo wɛɛt cok .

text: For ye are all the children of God by faith in Christ Jesus .
text2: Wek ee wɛɛt ke Nhialic wedhie ne gam ca wek Kritho Yecu gam .

text: For as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ .
text2: We wedhie , we kɔc ci baptith e Krithoyic , we ci Kritho taau e wekɔɔth .

text: There is neither Jew nor Greek , there is neither bond nor free , there is neither male nor female : for ye are all one in Christ Jesus .
text2: Judai ayi Giriki aliu etene , ayi lim ayi raan e cath e kede yenhde aliuki ayi moc ayi tik aliuki aya : wek wedhie wek ee tok ne Kritho Yecuyic .

text: And if ye be Christ ' s , then are ye Abraham ' s seed , and heirs according to the promise .
text2: Ku te ya wek kɔc ke Kritho , ke wek ee kau de Abraɣam , ku yak kɔc bi kaŋ lɔɔk lak , acit man e ke ci kɔn lueel .

text: Now I say , That the heir , as long as he is a child , differeth nothing from a servant , though he be lord of all ;
text2: Ku aluɛɛl enɔɔne , yan , Raan bi ka ke wun lɔɔk lak , te ŋoot en ke ye meth , ka cin pɛɛk bi ye paak keke lim , acakaa yen e ye bɛny nu e kaŋ niim kedhie ;

text: But is under tutors and governors until the time appointed of the father .
text2: ku ye reer e kɔc cok kɔc e ye muk ku kɔc ci taau e dhien nɔm , aɣet kool bii wun lueel .

text: Even so we , when we were children , were in bondage under the elements of the world :
text2: Yen acit wook aya , ɣɔn ee wok mith , wo ci tɔ ye liim buk aa tɔu e ka ke piny nɔm cok :

text: But when the fulness of the time was come , God sent forth his Son , made of a woman , made under the law ,
text2: na wen , aci run thok , ke Nhialic toc Wende , bi dhieeth e tik , ku dhieth e loŋic ,

text: To redeem them that were under the law , that we might receive the adoption of sons .
text2: luɔi bi en kɔc nu e loŋic wɛɛr bei , ago wo tɔ muk abuk aa wɛɛtke .

text: And because ye are sons , God hath sent forth the Spirit of his Son into your hearts , crying , Abba , Father .
text2: Ku luɔi aa wek wɛɛtke , ke Nhialic jɔ Wei ke Wende tuɔɔc e wepiɔth , ke ke cot , yan , Abba , Waar .

text: Wherefore thou art no more a servant , but a son ; and if a son , then an heir of God through Christ .
text2: Yen ka , yin cii be ŋoot ke yi ye lim , yin ee wende ; ku ten ee yin wende , ke yin ee wen bi ka ke Nhialic lɔɔk lak ne Kritho .

text: Howbeit then , when ye knew not God , ye did service unto them which by nature are no gods .
text2: Ku waan kuoc wek Nhialic , wek aa ye him ke yiethkun yieth cie Nhialic ne ciɛɛŋdɛn e ciɛke keek :

text: But now , after that ye have known God , or rather are known of God , how turn ye again to the weak and beggarly elements , whereunto ye desire again to be in bondage ?
text2: ku enɔɔne , nɔn ca wek Nhialic ŋic , ku aŋuan luɔi lueel wok en , an , we cii Nhialic ŋic , eeŋo bɛ wek rot pɔk ka cin naamden , ka cin riɛl ku kuanyki nyiin , ku dɛki piɔth luɔi ba wek rot bɛ tɔ ye liimken raanrou ?

text: Ye observe days , and months , and times , and years .
text2: Wek ee akool theek , ayi pɛi , ayi te cit nɔn e rut ku ruel , ayi run , ayak ke theek .

text: I am afraid of you , lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain .
text2: Yɛn e riɔɔc e kedun , akuoc nɔn ee yen ɣɔric yen naŋ can ro nak piny e luɔi ne biakdun .

text: Brethren , I beseech you , be as I am ; for I am as ye are : ye have not injured me at all .
text2: Wek mithekɔckuɔ , wek laŋ , yan , Yak tɔu cit man e yɛn , ku yɛn aya , yɛn e tɔu cit man e wek . Acin ke cak wac a ;

text: Ye know how through infirmity of the flesh I preached the gospel unto you at the first .
text2: ku aŋiɛcki nɔn can welpiɛth kɔn guieer week ne kɔc kaac ɛn guop ;

text: And my temptation which was in my flesh ye despised not , nor rejected ; but received me as an angel of God , even as Christ Jesus .
text2: ku them ci a them e guopdiyic akɛnki biɔɔn , ku we ken a koon ; we ci a rieu cit tuny de Nhialic ku cit Kritho Yecu guop .

text: Where is then the blessedness ye spake of ? for I bear you record , that , if it had been possible , ye would have plucked out your own eyes , and have given them to me .
text2: Athiɛɛiduon waan ci guɔ lɔ nou ? Yɛn ee caatɔdun e cooke , yan , Tee cak leu e luɔi , adi cak wenyiin tuok bei , yienki keek yɛn .

text: Am I therefore become your enemy , because I tell you the truth ?
text2: Ca ro tɔ ye raan de ater ke week , nɔn can week lɛk yic ?

text: They zealously affect you , but not well ; yea , they would exclude you , that ye might affect them .
text2: Kɔɔr ee kek cok e kɔɔr kek week acii piɛth ; ee luɔi bi ke we guoor biic , en anu e kepiɔth , ke ke bak cok e kaar wek keek .

text: But it is good to be zealously affected always in a good thing , and not only when I am present with you .
text2: Ku apiɛth nɔn ba wek aa cok e kaar wek kepiɛth e akoolnyiin kedhie , ku acie te nuo yɛn e weyiic tei .

text: My little children , of whom I travail in birth again until Christ be formed in you ,
text2: Wek mithkienthiike , yɛn e bɛ rɔɔp e dhienhdun , aɣet te bi Kritho cueec e weyiic .

text: I desire to be present with you now , and to change my voice ; for I stand in doubt of you .
text2: Yeka , yɛn dueer piɔu miɛt te nuo yɛn wo week enɔɔne , aguɔ arol puk ; luɔi cɔm ɛn piɔu e kedun .

text: Tell me , ye that desire to be under the law , do ye not hear the law ?
text2: Lɛkki yɛn , wek kɔc kɔɔr reer e loŋic , cakki kede loŋ e piŋ ?

text: For it is written , that Abraham had two sons , the one by a bondmaid , the other by a freewoman .
text2: Luɔi ci e gɔɔr , yan , Abraɣam aa de wɛɛtke kaarou , tok e dhieeth e nyan lim , ku dhieth tok e nyan e cath e kede yenhde .

text: But he who was of the bondwoman was born after the flesh ; but he of the freewoman was by promise .
text2: Ku wen e nyan lim e dhieeth e kede guop tei ; ku wen e nyan e cath e kede yenhde e dhieeth e ke ci kɔn lueel .

text: Which things are an allegory : for these are the two covenants ; the one from the mount Sinai , which gendereth to bondage , which is Agar .
text2: Kake ayek kaaŋ : dieerke ayek looŋ kaarou looŋ ci mac ; tok a bɔ e kuurdit Thinai , ku ye mith dhieeth ke ke ye liim , en aye Agar .

text: For this Agar is mount Sinai in Arabia , and answereth to Jerusalem which now is , and is in bondage with her children .
text2: Ku Agare en aye kuurdit Thinai paan e Alarap , ku athoŋ ke Jeruthalem nu enɔɔne : ka ye tɔu ke ye lim keke mithke .

text: But Jerusalem which is above is free , which is the mother of us all .
text2: Ku Jeruthalem nu nhial ee cath e kede yenhde , yen aye maada wodhie .

text: For it is written , Rejoice , thou barren that bearest not ; break forth and cry , thou that travailest not : for the desolate hath many more children than she which hath an husband .
text2: Luɔi ci e gɔɔr , yan , Mit piɔu , yin tiiŋ rol , tiiŋ cie dhieth ; Ɣɔɔre yirol piny , cot aret , yin e tiiŋ cie rɔɔp : Mith ke tiiŋ thuoom awarki mith ke tiiŋ de monyde aretdiite .

text: Now we , brethren , as Isaac was , are the children of promise .
text2: Ku wook , mithekɔckuɔ , wok cit Yithak , wok ee mith ke ke ci kɔn lueel .

text: But as then he that was born after the flesh persecuted him that was born after the Spirit , even so it is now .
text2: Ku acit man ɣɔn e mɛnh ci dhieeth e kede guop ee yen mɛnh ci dhieeth e kede Wei yɔŋ , yen anu yen enɔɔne aya .

text: Nevertheless what saith the scripture ? Cast out the bondwoman and her son : for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the freewoman .
text2: Ku kecigɔɔr ee lueel adi ? yan , Ciec nyan lim keke wende : wen e nyan lim acii ka ke wun bi lɔɔk lak keke wen e nyan e cath e kede yenhde .

text: So then , brethren , we are not children of the bondwoman , but of the free .
text2: Yen tede ka , wo cie mith ke nyan lim , wok ee mith ke nyan e cath e kede yenhde .

text: Stand fast therefore in the liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free , and be not entangled again with the yoke of bondage .
text2: Cath bi wok aa cath e kede yenhda , en aa lony Kritho wook ; yen kaac wek thin aril , ku duoki weyieth be tɔ rek , abak aa liim .

text: Behold , I Paul say unto you , that if ye be circumcised , Christ shall profit you nothing .
text2: Wɔiki da , wek lɛk , yɛn Paulo , yan , Te bi we cueel , ke Kritho acin piathdɛn bi nu tede week .

text: For I testify again to every man that is circumcised , that he is a debtor to do the whole law .
text2: Yeka , yɛn ee caatɔ lek raan e ro tɔ cuel ebɛn , yan , luɔi bi en loŋ aa looi ebɛn anu e yeyeth .

text: Christ is become of no effect unto you , whosoever of you are justified by the law ; ye are fallen from grace .
text2: Kritho aci tɔ cin naamde tede week , wek kɔc kɔɔr luɔi bi we tɔ piɛthpiɔth ne loŋ , week wedhie ; wek ci loony wei e dhueeŋdepiɔu yic .

text: For we through the Spirit wait for the hope of righteousness by faith .
text2: Ku wook , aŋɔth e piathepiɔu wen bɔ ne gam en a yok tiit ne Weidit .

text: For in Jesus Christ neither circumcision availeth anything , nor uncircumcision ; but faith which worketh by love .
text2: Ku ne Kritho Yecuyic cuɛl acin naamde ayi luɔi kene raan cueel ; ee gam lui ne nhieer en ade nɔm .

text: Ye did run well ; who did hinder you that ye should not obey the truth ?
text2: Wek aake ye riŋ apiɛth ; eeŋa e we pɛn piŋ piɛŋ wek yic ?

text: This persuasion cometh not of him that calleth you .
text2: Weŋ ci we weŋe acii bɔ tede raan e cɔl week .

text: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump .
text2: Luɔu thiinakaŋ ee amiɛɛn dit tɔ piɔɔr ebɛn .

text: I have confidence in you through the Lord , that ye will be none otherwise minded : but he that troubleth you shall bear his judgment , whosoever he be .
text2: Yɛn ŋath Bɛnydit ne kedun ke cin loŋ daŋ bak dɔm : ku raan e we tɔ diɛɛr e wel abi kede yok e yenhde , acakaa yen e ye raan yindi .

text: And I , brethren , if I yet preach circumcision , why do I yet suffer persecution ? then is the offence of the cross ceased .
text2: Ku yɛn , mithekɔckuɔ , te ŋuɔɔt ɛn ke ya guiir jam de cuɛl , ke yeŋo ŋuɔɔt ɛn ke ya yɔŋ kɔc ? yen adi ci nyaai , yen kɔth ee kɔc kɔth e tim ci riiu nɔm .

text: I would they were even cut off which trouble you .
text2: Yɛn dueer piɔu miɛt te ci kɔc e we tɔ diɛɛr e wel rot tɛɛm wei .

text: For , brethren , ye have been called unto liberty ; only use not liberty for an occasion to the flesh , but by love serve one another .
text2: Ee cath ba wek aa cath e kede yenhdun en aa cɔɔle week , wek mithekɔckuɔ , ku cath aa wek cath e kede yenhdun duoki ye kuoc dɔm , taki ye ke de luɔi de guop , ku yak rot luooi cit man e him , ne nhieer aa wek rot nhiaar .

text: For all the law is fulfilled in one word , even in this ; Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: Loŋ ebɛn aye tiiŋic e jam tok , jam e lueel aleyɔɔ , yan , Yin bi raan rɛɛr ke yin aa nhiaar cit man nhiɛɛr yin rot .

text: But if ye bite and devour one another , take heed that ye be not consumed one of another .
text2: Ku te ya wek rot kaac , ku yak rot cam , tiɛɛtki rot ke we cii ro bi thol wapac .

text: This I say then , Walk in the Spirit , and ye shall not fulful the lust of the flesh .
text2: Ku aluɛɛl aleyɔɔ , yan , Cathki ne Wcidit yiic , ke we cii ka kɔɔr guop bi aa looi .

text: For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit , and the Spirit against the flesh : and these are contrary the one to the other : so that ye cannot do the things that ye would .
text2: Guop ee tɔŋ cam keke Wei , ku ye Wei tɔŋ cam ne guop ; ku kake ayek gɔm kapac ; ku wek cii ka kaarki e wepiɔth dueer aa looi .

text: But if ye be led of the Spirit , ye are not under the law .
text2: Ku te ye we thel e Wei , ke we cie tɔu e loŋic .

text: Now the works of the flesh are manifest , which are these ; Adultery , fornication , uncleanness , lasciviousness ,
text2: Ku luɔi de guop aye tic egɔk , kek ki ; kɔɔr e diaar , luɔi col , dhoom ,

text: Idolatry , witchcraft , hatred , variance , emulations , wrath , strife , seditions , heresies ,
text2: lam de yieth , athuɛɛth , man mɛɛne kɔc rot , ateer , tiɛɛl , agooth , ateer ke dit , teŋ ee kɔc keyiic tek , dom de weet rac ,

text: Envyings , murders , drunkenness , revellings , and such like : of the which I tell you before , as I have also told you in time past , that they which do such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God .
text2: wui de kalei , naŋ de kɔc , win ee kɔc wit e mɔu , thueec deyin kerac , ku ka kɔk cit e kake ; ka ke guop ka : ku akan lɛk week enɔɔne ne kede kake , acit man can e kɔn lɛk week ɣɔn ne keden , yan , Kɔc e ka cit e kake looi , aciki ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic bi lɔɔk lak .

text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love , joy , peace , longsuffering , gentleness , goodness , faith ,
text2: Ku ka ci luɔk e Weidit , kek aye nhieer , miɛtepiɔu , mat , guom de kajuec , ŋiec reer emaath , dhueeŋ , don e kaŋ ,

text: Meekness , temperance : against such there is no law .
text2: kuur e raan ro tɔ koor , dom de rot : acin loŋ de ater ne ka cit e kake .

text: And they that are Christ ' s have crucified the flesh with the affections and lusts .
text2: Ku kɔc wen e ya kɔc ke Kritho acik guop piaat e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu keke kak ee guop kɔɔr etok , ayi ŋɔɔŋ e ye dɔm .

text: If we live in the Spirit , let us also walk in the Spirit .
text2: Te piir wok e Wei yiic , ke wo ye cath e Wei yiic ayadaŋ .

text: Let us not be desirous of vain glory , provoking one another , envying one another .
text2: Duku lɛc ɣɔric e kɔɔr , duku rot e jut , duku yiic e dɛ tiɛɛl e rot .

text: Brethren , if a man be overtaken in a fault , ye which are spiritual , restore such an one in the spirit of meekness ; considering thyself , lest thou also be tempted .
text2: Wek mithekɔckuɔ , na de raan ci cak dɔm ne kerɛɛc ci looi , ke wek kɔc ke Wei , jaki raan cit ekene dak kueer , ne kuur aa wek rot kuɔɔr piny ; ye yipiɔu woi , ke yi cii bi them aya .

text: Bear ye one another ' s burdens , and so fulfil the law of Christ .
text2: E ŋɛk e ŋɛk kony ne ke nuan en , yen aba wek loŋ de Kritho aa tiiŋic .

text: For if a man think himself to be something , when he is nothing , he deceiveth himself .
text2: Ku te de en raan e ro tɔ ye raan de naamde , ku acin naamde , ka mɛth rot tei .

text: But let every man prove his own work , and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone , and not in another .
text2: Raan ebɛn e ŋɛk e ye luɔide yenguop thɔɔŋ e yepiɔu , yen abi en dɛ te bi en ro leec ne kede yen etok , ku acie ne kede raan daŋ .

text: For every man shall bear his own burden .
text2: Raan ebɛn ŋɛk abi thieec e kede luɔide .

text: Let him that is taught in the word communicate unto him that teacheth in all good things .
text2: Ku raan e weete ne wel e ye kake rɔɔm keke raan weet en etok , kakɛn piɛth ebɛn .

text: Be not deceived ; God is not mocked : for whatsoever a man soweth , that shall he also reap .
text2: Duoki rot tɔ mɛthe ; Nhialic acie dɔl guop : te de yen ke com raan , ke yen abi tem aya .

text: For he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption ; but he that soweth to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting .
text2: Raan e com ne kede guopde , ka bi kede guop tem , en aye dhiap de kaŋ ; ku raan e com ne kede Wei , abi kede Wei tem , yen aye piir athɛɛr .

text: And let us not be weary in well doing : for in due season we shall reap , if we faint not .
text2: Ku duku wopiɔth tɔ bap ne luɔi de kepiɛth : wo bi tem ekool piɛth e tem , te ken wok bap .

text: As we have therefore opportunity , let us do good unto all men , especially unto them who are of the household of faith .
text2: Yen ee wo kɔc jɔ luooi apiɛth kedhie , e akool bi ro yok , ku kɔckuɔn ci wok gam etok abuk ke ya luooi apiɛth aretditte .

text: Ye see how large a letter I have written unto you with mine own hand .
text2: Wɔiki gaar gaar ɛn week e yacin , dit diit en nyin .

text: As many as desire to make a fair shew in the flesh , they constrain you to be circumcised ; only lest they should suffer persecution for the cross of Christ .
text2: Kɔc ebɛn kɔc kɔɔr luɔi bi ke ŋic e ye kɔc piɛth e guopic , kek a dhil week tɔ cuel ; ee luɔi cii ke bi yɔŋ tei ne biak de tim ci riiu nɔm tim de Kritho .

text: For neither they themselves who are circumcised keep the law ; but desire to have you circumcised , that they may glory in your flesh .
text2: Acakaa kegup kek kɔc ci cueel , aciki loŋ e dot apiɛth ayadaŋ ; akɔɔrki luɔi bi we cueel , ke ke bi rot aa leec e guopdunic .

text: But God forbid that I should glory , save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ , by whom the world is crucified unto me , and I unto the world .
text2: Ku yɛn , lɛc ban ro leec aliu etaiwei , ee kede tim ci riiu nɔm etok , tim de Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho , raan ci ka ke piny nɔm tɔ pieete e tim kɔu tede yɛn , ku pieete ya e tim kɔu tede ka ke piny nɔm .

text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth anything , nor uncircumcision , but a new creature .
text2: Ku cuɛl ayi luɔi kene raan cueel , acinki naamden e Yecu Krithoyic ; ee raan ci piac cak , yetok .

text: And as many as walk according to this rule , peace be on them , and mercy , and upon the Israel of God .
text2: Ku kɔc kedhie , kɔc e mat e cooke , e mat e ye tɔu ke keek ayi kokdepiɔu , ku e ke tɔu ne Yithiael de Nhialic .

text: From henceforth let no man trouble me : for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Gɔl ekoole , ne cin raan e ya jut : yɛn cath wo pieer ke Bɛnydit Yecu ci gɔɔr e yaguop .

text: Brethren , the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit . Amen .
text2: E dhueeŋ de Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho piɔu e ye tɔu ke weikun , wek mithekɔckuɔ . Amen .

text: Paul , an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God , to the saints which are at Ephesus , and to the faithful in Christ Jesus :
text2: Yɛn Paulo , tuny e Yecu Kritho ne kede piɔn e Nhialic , awarek en gaar kɔc ɣerpiɔth nu Epetho , keke kɔc adoot kɔc nu e Kritho Yecuyic ;

text: Grace be to you , and peace , from God our Father , and from the Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: E dhueeŋdepiɔu e tɔu ke week , ku mat , ne ke bɔ tede Nhialic Waada keke Bɛnydit Yecu Kritho .

text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ :
text2: Thieithieei e Nhialic , Wun Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho , Raan ci wo thieei e athiɛɛi de wei ebɛn , athiɛɛi de ka ke paanhial , ne Krithoyic ;

text: According as he hath chosen us in him before the foundation of the world , that we should be holy and without blame before him in love :
text2: acit man ci en wo lɔc ne Krithoyic ɣɔn thɛɛr aŋoot piny ke kene cak , ne nhieer nhiɛɛr en wook , luɔi bi wok piɔth ɣɛɛr ku cin ke bi wo gɔk e yenɔm .

text: Having predestinated us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to himself , according to the good pleasure of his will ,
text2: Aci wo kɔn meek e yepiɔu nɔn bi en wo muk tɔ wook e wɛɛt ke yenguop ne Yecu Kruho , acit man e miɛt mit en piɔu ,

text: To the praise of the glory of his grace , wherein he hath made us accepted in the beloved .
text2: ne lɛc bi dhueeŋ de yenpiɔu aa leec dhueeŋ ci lakelak , dhueeŋ ci gam wook edhueeŋ ne biak de Raan Nhiɛɛr ,

text: In whom we have redemption through his blood , the forgiveness of sins , according to the riches of his grace ;
