text2: Rɛɛrki ne kɔc nu biic e reer e kɔc pelniim , ku yak ka ke enɔɔne wɛɛr bei e keracic .

text: Let your speech be alway with grace , seasoned with salt , that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man .
text2: Yak jamdun tɔ cath ke dhueeŋdepiɔu anandun , cit man e knin ci wac e amiiɔ , ke we bi kede raan ebɛn ŋiɛc bɛɛr apiɛth .

text: All my state shall Tychicus declare unto you , who is a beloved brother , and a faithful minister and fellowservant in the Lord :
text2: Taudi ebɛn abi Tukiko lɛk week , ee mɛnhkenedan nhiaar , ku ye raan e kaŋ dot e luɔi , raan ee wok him etok e Bɛnyditic .

text: Whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose , that he might know your estate , and comfort your hearts ;
text2: Yen aa tuoc ɛn en week , ke we bi tauda ŋic , ku bi we muk piɔth ;

text: With Onesimus , a faithful and beloved brother , who is one of you . They shall make known unto you all things which are done here .
text2: yen keke Onethimo , mɛnhkenedan adot ku nhiaar , ku ye raandun . Kek abi we tɔ ŋic ka ci looi ene kedhie .

text: Aristarchus my fellowprisoner saluteth you , and Marcus , sister ' s son to Barnabas , ( touching whom ye received commandments : if he come unto you , receive him ; )
text2: Wek thieec Aritharko raan mɛc wok etok , ku wek thieec Mak aya , wen e nyankene Baranaba ( we ci yien thok ne kede ; te ci en bɛn tede week , ke damki ) ,

text: And Jesus , which is called Justus , who are of the circumcision . These only are my fellowworkers unto the kingdom of God , which have been a comfort unto me .
text2: ku Yecu , raan cɔl Juthutho aya , keke kɔc nu e aŋueel yiic ; kɔcke kapac ayek kɔc luui wok etok ne kede ciɛɛŋ de Nhialic , kɔc ci a muk piɔu .

text: Epaphras , who is one of you , a servant of Christ , saluteth you , always labouring fervently for you in prayers , that ye may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God .
text2: Wek thieec Epapara , raandun , ku ye raan e Yecu Kritho luooi , ee cool e nɛk rot piny e lɔŋdeyic ne biakdun , ke we bi aa kɔɔc aril , ke we bi piɔth a dikedik ku kuɛthki ne kede piɔn e Nhialic ebɛn .

text: For I bear him record , that he hath a great zeal for you , and them that are in Laodicea , and them in Hierapolis .
text2: Yɛn ee caatɔ de lɛth ee yen yic lɛth e luɔi aret ne biakdun , ku ne biak de kɔc nu Laodikia , ayi kɔc nu Kierapoli .

text: Luke , the beloved physician , and Demas , greet you .
text2: Wek thieec Luk , akim nhiaar , ku Demath .

text: Salute the brethren which are in Laodicea , and Nymphas , and the church which is in his house .
text2: Thiecki mithekɔckuɔn nu Laodikia , ku Numpa , ku kanithɔ nu ɣonde .

text: And when this epistle is read among you , cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans ; and that ye likewise read the epistle from Laodicea .
text2: Ku te ci awareke kueenic e weyiic , taki kuen e kanithɔ de kɔc ke Laodikiayic aya ; ayi week , we bi kede Laodikia kueenic aya .

text: And say to Archippus , Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord , that thou fulfil it .
text2: Ku yɔɔkki Arkipo , yan , Ye luɔi tiit apiɛth luɔi ci yok tede Bɛnydit , aba thol apiɛth .

text: The salutation by the hand of me Paul . Remember my bonds . Grace be with you . Amen .
text2: Thiecdien e yɛncin ki , yɛn Paulo . Takki weniim e joth mac ɛn ke . E dhueeŋdepiɔu tɔu ke week . Amen .

text: Paul , a servant of God , and an apostle of Jesus Christ , according to the faith of God ' s elect , and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness ;
text2: Yɛn Paulo , lim e Nhialic , ku ye tuny e Yecu Kritho , ne kede gam de kɔc cii Nhialic lɔc , ku ne kede ŋiny bi kɔc yic ŋic egɔk , yic e roŋ ke rieeu de Nhialic ,

text: In hope of eternal life , which God , that cannot lie , promised before the world began ;
text2: ne aŋɔth de piir athɛɛr , piir cii Nhialic Raan cii lueth dueer toor kɔn lueel , an , bi gam kɔc , ɣɔn ŋoote piny ke kene cak ;

text: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching , which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour ;
text2: ku aci jamde nyuoth kɔc ekooldɛn piɛth ne guieer e welpiɛth , guieer ci taau e yacin ne kede loŋ de Nhialic Konyda ;

text: To Titus , mine own son after the common faith : Grace , mercy , and peace , from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour .
text2: awarek en gaar Tito , mɛnhdien yin ne kede gamdan cuk rɔm etok : E dhueeŋdepiɔu ku mat e ke ye tɔu ne yin , ne ke bɔ tede Nhialic Waada keke Bɛnydit Yecu Kritho Konyda .

text: For this cause left I thee in Crete , that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting , and ordain elders in every city , as I had appointed thee :
text2: En aa nyaaŋ ɛn yin piny e Kerete waan , luɔi bi yin kaŋ kiɛm piny ka ŋoot ke ke de te dak , ku jɔ kɔcdit dɔm kɔc bi tɔu e kɔc niim e pɛɛnydit yiic ebɛn , acit man can e kɔn lɛk yin ;

text: If any be blameless , the husband of one wife , having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly .
text2: na de raan cin ke bi e gɔk , mony de tiiŋ tok , raan de mithkɛn ci gam , mith kene kɔn gaany ne baŋ de thueec de kaŋ ku rɛɛc de loŋ .

text: For a bishop must be blameless , as the steward of God ; not selfwilled , not soon angry , not given to wine , no striker , not given to filthy lucre ;
text2: Raan e kɔc ci gam tht abi dhil aa raan cin ke bi e gɔk , luɔi ee yen raan e dhien e Nhialic tiit ; acie raan e kede yenpiɔu kɔɔr , ku cie raan e dap gɔth , ku cii mɔu e nhiaar , ku cie raan e kɔc dap dui , ku cii weu ke ayaar e nhiaar ;

text: But a lover of hospitality , a lover of good men , sober , just , holy , temperate ;
text2: ku abi aa raan ŋic kaman , raan nhiaar kepiɛth , raan piɛth nɔm , raan ŋic loŋ piɛth lueel , raan ɣerpiɔu , raan ŋic ro muk ;

text: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught , that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers .
text2: raan e wel yith ŋiec dot cit man ci e wɛɛt , luɔi dueer en kɔc riit piɔth ne weet piɛth , ku ŋic kɔc jany en guut e loŋ .

text: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers , specially they of the circumcision :
text2: Ade kɔc juec nu , kɔc e loŋ rɛɛc piŋ , kɔc e ɣɔric lueel , ku yek kɔc math , ku tedit e keek ee kɔc aŋuɛl ,

text: Whose mouths must be stopped , who subvert whole houses , teaching things which they ought not , for filthy lucre ' s sake .
text2: kɔcke abike dhil ruɔɔt thook ; ayek dhien riɔɔk eliŋliŋ , ku yek kɔc wɛɛt e ke cii piɛth , ne biak de nhieer nhiɛɛr kek weu ke ayaar .

text: One of themselves , even a prophet of their own , said , The Cretians are alway liars , evil beasts , slow bellies .
text2: Raan tok e keyiic gup , ee nebiden guop , aci lueel , an , Keretai ayek lueth toor ecaŋɣɔn , ayek lai rɛc ci wath , cieem lir yiic ethuaat .

text: This witness is true . Wherefore rebuke them sharply , that they may be sound in the faith ;
text2: Ke lueel caatɔye ee yic . Yen ee yin keek jɔɔny e jany rac , ke ke bi a tɔu e gamic ke cin kerac ,

text: Not giving heed to Jewish fables , and commandments of men , that turn from the truth .
text2: ku ciki kɔɔr ee Judai paar e piŋ , ayi looŋ lueel kɔc tei , kɔc e rot yal wei e yinic .

text: Unto the pure all things are pure : but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure ; but even their mind and conscience is defiled .
text2: Kaŋ kedhie aɣerki yiic etop tede kɔc ɣer yiic etop : ku kɔc ci piɔth nhiany ku kɔc reec gam , acin keɣeric etop nu tede keek ; keniim ayi kepiɔth acik nhiany kedhie .

text: They profess that they know God ; but in works they deny him , being abominable , and disobedient , and unto every good work reprobate .
text2: Ayek lueel , an , ŋicki Nhialic ; ku yek jai ne luɔiden , ee kɔc rac etaiwei , ayek loŋ rɛɛc piŋ , ku cinki naamden ne luɔi piɛth ebɛn .

text: But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine :
text2: Ku yin , ye kaŋ lueel ka roŋ ne weet piɛth :

text: That the aged men be sober , grave , temperate , sound in faith , in charity , in patience .
text2: an , e roordit e ke ye rot tiit apiɛth , ku yek kɔc piɛth niim , kɔc e niim tieer , kɔc e tɔu apiɛth e gam , ku nhieer , ku ruotepiɔu .

text: The aged women likewise , that they be in behaviour as becometh holiness , not false accusers , not given to much wine , teachers of good things ;
text2: Yen abi yin dieer dit yɔɔk aya , yan , bik aa tɔu e tau de kɔc ɣerpiɔth , ke ke cii bi aa mantuum , ku ciki bi aa liim ke mɔn dit , abik aa kɔc e weet e kepiɛth ;

text: That they may teach the young women to be sober , to love their husbands , to love their children ,
text2: ku bik dieer kor aa wɛɛt ke ke bi roorken nhiaar , ku nhiaarki mithken ,

text: To be discreet , chaste , keepers at home , good , obedient to their own husbands , that the word of God be not blasphemed .
text2: ke ke bi aa dieer e niim tieer , dieer ɣerpiɔth etop , dieer e tɔu e dhienken , dieer piɛth , ee jam de roorken gup piŋ , ke jam e Nhialic ke cii bi aa laat .

text: Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded .
text2: Ku yook dhuok ayadaŋ , an , yek niim tieer .

text: In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works : in doctrine shewing uncorruptness , gravity , sincerity ,
text2: Ku yin bi ro tɔ ye raan bi kɔc kede dɔmic , ne luɔi piɛth ebɛn : tɔ weetdu tɔu ke cinic kenhiany , ke ye weet thiek , cinic rueeny ,

text: Sound speech , that cannot be condemned ; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed , having no evil thing to say of you .
text2: ye jam e jam piɛth , jam cii dueere jɔɔny ; ke raan de ater ke yin ke bi yaar , acin jam rɛɛc dueere lueel e kedun .

text: Exhort servants to be obedient unto their own masters , and to please them well in all things ; not answering again ;
text2: Ku yook liim , yan , bik reer e banyken cok , banyken gup , agoki ke tɔ mit piɔth e kerieec ebɛn ; ku ciki loŋ e bɛɛr ;

text: Not purloining , but shewing all good fidelity ; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things .
text2: ku ciki kaŋ e noom ecueer , ku bik kaŋ aa dot apiɛth ; agoki weet de Nhialic Konyda aa kiir e kerieecic ebɛn .

text: For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men ,
text2: Dhueeŋ de Nhialic piɔu e jɔ tic dhueeŋ bii kunydewei , yin raan ebɛn ,

text: Teaching us that , denying ungodliness and worldly lusts , we should live soberly , righteously , and godly , in this present world ;
text2: ee wo wɛɛt , an , buk kuny kuce Nhialic rieu jai , ku jeiku ŋɔɔŋ de ka ke piny nɔm , agoku reer ke wo ye niim tieer , ku piɛthku piɔth , ku yok Nhialic rieu e pinye nɔm enɔɔne ;

text: Looking for that blessed hope , and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ ;
text2: ku yok aŋɔth ci thieei tiit , ku titku tuol bi dhueeŋ de Nhialicdandit ku Konydan Yecu Kritho tuol ;

text: Who gave himself for us , that he might redeem us from all iniquity , and purify unto himself a peculiar people , zealous of good works .
text2: raan ci ro gam thuɔɔu ne biakda , luɔi bi en wo wɛɛr bei e luɔi racic ebɛn , ago jur mɛɛn tɔ ɣerpiɔu etop abi aa kede , jur lethic e luɔi piɛth .

text: These things speak , and exhort , and rebuke with all authority . Let no man despise thee .
text2: Ye kake lueel , riit yin ke kɔc piɔth , ku jany keek ne riɛl ebɛn . E cin raan bi yi biɔɔn .

text: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers , to obey magistrates , to be ready to every good work ,
text2: Ye ke tak niim ke ke bi aa reer e bany cok , ku reerki e kɔc nu e keniim cok , ku yek loŋ piŋ , ku yek luɔi piɛth ebɛn dap gam ,

text: To speak evil of no man , to be no brawlers , but gentle , shewing all meekness unto all men .
text2: ku e cin raan yek lat , e cin akɔŋ yek kɔɔr , e ke ye jam emaath , ku ke ye kuur ee kek ro kuɔɔr piny alal nyuoth raan ebɛn .

text: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish , disobedient , deceived , serving divers lusts and pleasures , living in malice and envy , hateful , and hating one another .
text2: Ku wook ayadaŋ wok aa ye kɔc cin niim waan thɛɛr , kɔc e loŋ rɛɛc piŋ , kɔc ci math , wok aa ye him ke ŋɔɔŋ e wo dɔm ŋɔɔŋ kithyic , ku yok him ke kamit yok kɔɔr e wopiɔth , wok aa ye tɔu ke wo racpiɔth deku yiic tiɛɛl , ku man kɔc wook , ku manku rot .

text: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared ,
text2: Na wen , aci piath e piɔn e Nhialic Konyda tic , piath piɛth en piɔu keke kɔc , ku tiec nhieer nhiɛɛr en kɔc ,

text: Not by works of righteousness which we have done , but according to his mercy he saved us , by the washing of regeneration , and renewing of the Holy Ghost ;
text2: ke jɔ wo kony wei , ku acie ne luɔi de kepiɛth cuk looi wogup , ee kok de yenpiɔu en aa kony en wook , ne wɛk de dhienh ci wo bɛ dhieeth , ku ne caŋ ci Weidit Ɣer wo bɛ cak ,

text: Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour ;
text2: ke Wei ci luooŋ e wogup abuk kuɛth e keek ne Yecu Kritho Konyda ;

text: That being justified by his grace , we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life .
text2: luɔi bi wo tɔ piɛthpiɔth ne dhueeŋ de yenpiɔu , ago wo tɔ ye kɔc bi kaŋ lɔɔk lak ne aŋɔth ŋɛɛth wok piir athɛɛr .

text: This is a faithful saying , and these things I will that thou affirm constantly , that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works . These things are good and profitable unto men .
text2: Ee jam yic ekene , ku yɛn de piɔu luɔi bi yin kake aa ŋak niim aret , ke kɔc ci Nhialic gam ke ke bi rot tiit apiɛth , agoki aa coo ! e loi luɔi piɛth . Kake apiɛthki ku adeki naamden tede kɔc .

text: But avoid foolish questions , and genealogies , and contentions , and strivings about the law ; for they are unprofitable and vain .
text2: Ku kaace ya ne lop ee kɔc luɔp e ɣɔric , ku jam ne kede kuarken e kɔc , ku ateer , ku teer ee kɔc teer ne kede loŋ ; kake acin kepiɛth ee yok thin , ee ka ɣaar yiic .

text: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject ;
text2: Raan e weet yalic , te ci yin e jɔɔny raantok ayi raanrou , ke jɔ rɛɛc ;

text: Knowing that he that is such is subverted , and sinneth , being condemned of himself .
text2: luɔi ŋic yin en , yan , raan cit ekene aci enɔm cɔk wei , ee kedaŋ wooc , ku aci ro jɔɔny etok .

text: When I shall send Artemas unto thee , or Tychicus , be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis : for I have determined there to winter .
text2: Te tuɔɔc ɛn Artema tede yin , ayi Tukiko , ke yi cok e them yin bɛn bi yin bɛn te nuo yɛn Nikopoli : ne luɔi can e dhel e yapiɔu nɔn ban rut thol etɛɛn .

text: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently , that nothing be wanting unto them .
text2: Cok e ruɛc yin Dhena raan ŋic loŋ keke Apolo e kueerden , ke cin ke bi dak tede keek .

text: And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses , that they be not unfruitful .
text2: Ayi kɔckuɔ aya tɔ ke weete apiɛth ke ke bi aa cool e loi luɔi piɛth , agoki ke piir kek aa yok , ku ciki e tɔu ke ke cii lok .

text: All that are with me salute thee . Greet them that love us in the faith . Grace be with you all . Amen .
text2: Yin thieec kɔc rɛɛr ne yɛn etok kedhie . Thiec kɔc nhiaar wook ne gam . E dhueeŋdepiɔu e ye tɔu ke week wedhie . Amen .

text: Paul , a prisoner of Jesus Christ , and Timothy our brother , unto Philemon our dearly beloved , and fellowlabourer ,
text2: Yɛn Paulo , raan ci mac e kede Yecu Kritho , woke Timotheo mɛnhkeneda , awarek en gɛɛrku yin Pilemon raan nhiaarku , ku ye raan e luui ke wook etok ,

text: And to our beloved Apphia , and Archippus our fellowsoldier , and to the church in thy house :
text2: ku Apia nyankeneda , ku Arkipo raan e tɔŋ biok ke wook etok , ku kanithɔ nu ɣondu :

text: Grace to you , and peace , from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: E dhueeŋdepiɔu ku mat e ke ye tɔu ne week , ne ke bɔ tede Nhialic Waada keke Bɛnydit Yecu Kritho .

text: I thank my God , making mention of thee always in my prayers ,
text2: Yɛn ee Nhialicdi leec , ku yin a cool e luɛɛl rin e loŋdiyic ,

text: Hearing of thy love and faith , which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus , and toward all saints ;
text2: piŋ can nhieerdu piŋ ku piɛŋ gamduon ci yin Bɛnydit Yecu gam , ku nhieer nhiɛɛr yin kɔc ɣerpiɔth kedhie ;

text: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus .
text2: ku yɛn ee lɔŋ , ke man mɛte kɔc e gamduyic ke bi dɛ naamdɛn dit , agoki kepiɛth ebɛn ŋic egɔk kepiɛth yok yok , ne Kritho Yecu .

text: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love , because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee , brother .
text2: Wok mit piɔth alal ku ci wo riit piɔth ne nhieerduon ee yin kɔc nhiaar , luɔi ci kɔc ɣerpiɔth tɔ lɔ piɔth guik piny ne yin , mɛwaar .

text: Wherefore , though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient ,
text2: Ku enɔɔne , acakaa yɛn e dueer yin yɔɔk aril , an , dhil kepiɛth looi ,

text: Yet for love ' s sake I rather beseech thee , being such an one as Paul the aged , and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ .
text2: ku ne biak de nhieer nhiaar ɛn yin , yin laŋ tei , yɛn raan cɔl Paulo mony ci dhiɔp , ku ye raan mac enɔɔne aya ne baŋ de Yecu Kritho :

text: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus , whom I have begotten in my bonds :
text2: yin laŋ ne biak de mɛnhdi Onethimo , mɛnh ca dhieeth e jothki yiic ,

text: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable , but now profitable to thee and to me :
text2: ee mɛnh waan cin naamde tede yin , ku enɔɔne e dɛ naamde tede yin ku tede yɛn :

text: Whom I have sent again : thou therefore receive him , that is , mine own bowels :
text2: ku aca bɛ tuoc yin yenguop , ku yin , beye dɔm , yen yanydi ki :

text: Whom I would have retained with me , that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel :
text2: ku yɛn aa de piɔu luɔi ban e peen bi reer ke yɛn le e nyinduyic , bi kaki aa looi ne mac mac ɛn ne baŋ de welpiɛth :

text: But without thy mind would I do nothing ; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity , but willingly .
text2: ku acin ke duɛɛr looi te kɛn ɛn kede piɔndu piŋ ; ke cin raan bi yi cieŋ ne luɔiduon e dhueeŋ , abi aa kede yinpiɔu etok .

text: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season , that thou shouldest receive him for ever ;
text2: Thar e ke pak wek e akool liaakaŋ ayin aa luɔi bi yin e bɛ noom abi aa kedu anande ;

text: Not now as a servant , but above a servant , a brother beloved , specially to me , but how much more unto thee , both in the flesh , and in the Lord ?
text2: ku cii bi bɛ ciet man e iim tei , abi lim woor , ee mɛnhkui nhiaar , arek ɛn a nhiaar alal , ku yin , cii nhiaar e nhieer war nhieer nhiaar ɛn en , e yeguop ku ne Bɛnyditic aya ?

text: If thou count me therefore a partner , receive him as myself .
text2: Te ci yin a tɔ ye raan ram wek kaŋ etok , ke jɔ dɔm cit man dueer yin a dɔm .

text: If he hath wronged thee , or oweth thee ought , put that on mine account ;
text2: Ku te ci en yin wac kaŋ , ku na de keduon cath ke ye , ke jɔ taau e yayeth ;

text: I Paul have written it with mine own hand , I will repay it : albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides .
text2: yɛn Paulo , aca gɔɔr e yacin guop , aba cool : ku yɛn aca dueer lɛk yin en yoŋ ci yin weiku yok tede yɛn aya .

text: Yea , brother , let me have joy of thee in the Lord : refresh my bowels in the Lord .
text2: Yeka , mɛwaar , tɔ ya mit piɔu wo yin e Bɛnyditic : tɔ ya lɔ piɔu guik piny e Krithoyic .

text: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee , knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say .
text2: Aŋiɛc nɔn bi yin kedi gam , yen a gaar ɛn yin , ku aŋiɛc nɔn bi yin ke war ke luɛɛl looi ayadaŋ .

text: But withal prepare me also a lodging : for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you .
text2: Ku guik te ban reer aya : yɛn ŋath nɔn bi a yien week ne kede lɔŋduon aa wek lɔŋ .

text: There salute thee Epaphras , my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus ;
text2: Yin thieec Epepara , raan mac wok etok ne biak de Kritho Yecu ;

text: Marcus , Aristarchus , Demas , Lucas , my fellowlabourers .
text2: ku Mak aya , ku Aritharko , ku Demath , ku Luk , kɔc e luui wok etok .

text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit . Amen .
text2: E dhueeŋ de Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho piɔu e ye tɔu ke weikun . Amen .

text: God , who at sundry times and in divers manners spake in time past unto the fathers by the prophets ,
text2: Nhialic , ɣɔn ee yen jam ke kuarkuɔ ɣɔnthɛɛr e ruun mɛɛn ku ne jam kithic ne nebii thook ,

text: Hath in these last days spoken unto us by his Son , whom he hath appointed heir of all things , by whom also he made the worlds ;
text2: ke jɔ jam ke wook e akool cieenke ne Wende , Wendɛn ci dɔm bi aa raan bi kaŋ lɔɔk lak kedhie , ku ci piny cak ne yen aya .

text: Who being the brightness of his glory , and the express image of his person , and upholding all things by the word of his power , when he had by himself purged our sins , sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high ;
text2: Yen aye riau de dhueeŋde , ku ye ciet tau de yenguop , ku ye kaŋ mɔk teden kedhie ne jamdɛn ril etor , ku te ci en karɛckuɔ waak wei yen etok , ke jɔ nyuc piny e ciin cueny de Dhueeŋdiit nu nhial ;

text: Being made so much better than the angels , as he hath by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they .
text2: nɔn ci en tuucnhial guɔ woor alal e piath , acit man ci en rin piɛth yok rin war keek alal .

text: For unto which of the angels said he at any time , Thou art my Son , this day have I begotten thee ? And again , I will be to him a Father , and he shall be to me a Son ?
text2: Ku ye tunynhialou cii Nhialic kɔn yɔɔk , an , Yin ee Wendi , Ekoole yen aa dhieeth ɛn yin ? ku be lueel , yan , Yɛn bi aa Wun , Ku yen abi aa Wendi ?

text: And again , when he bringeth in the firstbegotten into the world , he saith , And let all the angels of God worship him .
text2: Ku ɣɔn be yen Wendɛn kɛɛi bɛɛi e piny nɔm , ke jɔ lueel , yan , E lɛm tuuc ke Nhialic kedhie .

text: And of the angels he saith , Who maketh his angels spirits , and his ministers a flame of fire .
text2: Ku jɔ lueel ne kede tuucnhial , yan , Raan e tuuckɛnnhial tɔ ye wei , Ku tɔ kɔc e kake looi e liem de mac :

text: But unto the Son he saith , Thy throne , O God , is for ever and ever : a sceptre of righteousness is the sceptre of thy kingdom .
text2: ku jɔ lueel ne kede Wende , yan , Thoonyduondit , yin Nhialic , atɔu ecaŋɣɔn ku bi ɣet athɛɛr ; Ku wai de tieŋ ee loŋ tiiŋic yen aye wai de ciɛɛŋdu .

text: Thou hast loved righteousness , and hated iniquity ; therefore God , even thy God , hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows .
text2: Yin e piathepiɔu nhiaar , ku man dhaŋ ee loŋ dhɔŋic ; En aa tɔce Nhialic yin , yen Nhialicdu , Tɔc yin e miok de miɛtepiɔu awar wɛɛt rieec wek .

text: And , Thou , Lord , in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth ; and the heavens are the works of thine hands :
text2: Ku cooke aya , yan , Yin , Bɛnydit , ɣɔn gɔle kaŋ yin e piny tɔ kaac e keerkeerdeyic , Ku tenhial ee luɔi de yincin :

text: They shall perish ; but thou remainest ; and they all shall wax old as doth a garment ;
text2: Abik maar etaiwei ; ku yin bi doŋ : Ku abik ceŋ ku jɔki riaak ebɛn cit man e lupɔ ;

text: And as a vesture shalt thou fold them up , and they shall be changed : but thou art the same , and thy years shall not fail .
text2: Ku aba ke dol yiic cit man e alulut , Agoki rot puk . Ku yin ee tɔu e tauduone , Ku runku aciki bi dak .

text: But to which of the angels said he at any time , Sit on my right hand , until I make thine enemies thy footstool ?
text2: Ku e tunynhialou e ci yɔɔk anande , yan , Nyuc e ciin cuenydi , Aɣet te ban kɔc dɛ wek ater tɔ ye ken ee yin yicok dhɔɔr ?

text: Are they not all ministering spirits , sent forth to minister for them who shall be heirs of salvation ?
text2: Ciki e wei e ka ke kɔc looi kedhie , wei ci tooc , lek kaŋ aa looi ne biak de kɔc bi kunydewei lɔɔk lak ?

text: Therefore we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things which we have heard , lest at any time we should let them slip .
text2: Yen a dueer wok dhil aa cok e dot wok ka cuk piŋ alal , ke bi cien te bi wo jal e keyiic ke kucku rot .

text: For if the word spoken by angels was stedfast , and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompence of reward ;
text2: Ku te ci jam ci lueel e tuucnhial jɔ kɔɔc aril , ke kerieec ee raan wooc ebɛn ayi rɛɛc ee raan loŋ rɛɛc piŋ ebɛn ten aaye raan tɔ yok kedɛn tuc ke roŋ ke ke ci wooc ;

text: How shall we escape , if we neglect so great salvation ; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord , and was confirmed unto us by them that heard him ;
text2: ke wook , buk poth adi , te biɔɔn wok kunydewei kuny diit yinya ? Yen kuny ci kɔn lueel e Bɛnydit ɣɔnthɛɛr , ku cii kɔc ɣɔn piŋ en nyɔk wook e luɛl ;

text: God also bearing them witness , both with signs and wonders , and with divers miracles , and gifts of the Holy Ghost , according to his own will ?
text2: go Nhialic ro tɔ ye caatɔden aya , ne gook ku kak ee kɔc ke gai , ku ne luɔi kithic , ku ne miɔc e bɔ ne Weidit Ɣer , ne kede piɔnde guop .

text: For unto the angels hath he not put in subjection the world to come , whereof we speak .
text2: Ku aken piny bi bɛn taau e tuucnhial cok , piny jiɛɛm wok e kede .

text: But one in a certain place testified , saying , What is man , that thou art mindful of him ? or the son of man , that thou visitest him ?
text2: Ku ade raan ci e lueel tedaŋ , yan , Raan ee kaŋo , ke tɛk yin en ? Ayi wen e raan , ee kaŋo , ke diir yin e kede ?

text: Thou madest him a little lower than the angels ; thou crownedst him with glory and honour , and didst set him over the works of thy hands :
text2: Aci tɔ koor emaath e tuucnhial ; Ku ci yiek nɔm gol e dhueeŋ ku rieeu , Ku jɔ taau e ka ci cueec e yicin niim :

text: Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet . For in that he put all in subjection under him , he left nothing that is not put under him . But now we see not yet all things put under him .
text2: Yin e kerieec taau e yecok ebɛn , bi ke cieŋ . Ku tɛɛu ci en kerieec taau e yecok ebɛn , en a cin en ke ci nyaaŋ piny ke kene taau e yecok . Ku wo ŋoot e wo ken kerieec guɔ tiŋ aci taau e yecok ebɛn .

text: But we see Jesus , who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death , crowned with glory and honour ; that he by the grace of God should taste death for every man .
text2: Ee Yecu yen woiku , raan waan ci tɔ koor emaath e tuucnhial ne guom bi en thuɔɔu guum , yen woiku aci yiek nɔm gol e dhueeŋ ku rieeu , luɔi bi en thuɔɔu thieep ne kede raan ebɛn ne dhueeŋ de Nhialic piɔu .

text: For it became him , for whom are all things , and by whom are all things , in bringing many sons unto glory , to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings .
text2: Ku aci roŋ ke Nhialic , Raan ee tɔuwe kaŋ kedhie ne kede , ku yen e bii kaŋ kedhie , waan bii en wɛɛt juec te nu dhueeŋ , aci roŋ ke yen , luɔi bi en bɛny e ke wat bɛnydɛn e kunydewei tɔ ye dikedik ne ka ci guum .

text: For both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctified are all of one : for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren ,
text2: Ku raan e kɔc tɔ ɣerpiɔth ayi kɔc ci tɔ ɣerpiɔth wuonden ee tok kedhie : yen acii yen e yaar , te tɔ en keek e mithekɔcken ,

text: Saying , I will declare thy name unto my brethren , in the midst of the church will I sing praise unto thee .
text2: lueel , yan , Rinku aba ke lueel e mithekɔckuɔ niim , Yin ba piɔɔny e kanithɔyic cil .

text: And again , I will put my trust in him . And again , Behold I and the children which God hath given me .
text2: Ku be lueel , yan , Yɛn bi rot ŋɔɔth e yen . Ku be lueel , yan , Tieŋki , yɛn woke mith e gɛme Nhialic ɛn .

text: Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood , he also himself likewise took part of the same ; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death , that is , the devil ;
text2: Ku cath ciɛthe mith e guop deyic riŋ ku riɛm , yen acit cath ciɛth en ke guop deyic riŋ ku riɛm aya , luɔi bi en raan cath ke riɛl e thuɔɔu tɔ cin naamde eliŋliŋ , yen aye jɔŋdiit rac ;

text: And deliver them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage .
text2: ago kɔc luony bei kɔc ci tɔ ye him ecaŋɣɔn ne riɔɔc ee kek riɔɔc e thuɔɔu .

text: For verily he took not on him the nature of angels ; but he took on him the seed of Abraham .
text2: Ee yin , acie tau de tuucnhial yen e dɔme ye , ee kau de Abraɣam , en e dɔme ye .

text: Wherefore in all things it behoved him to be made like unto his brethren , that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God , to make reconciliation for the sins of the people .
text2: Yen aa dhil en ro tɔ kit keke mithekɔcken e kerieecic ebɛn , luɔi bi en aa bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic , bɛny kok piɔu ku ye adot ne ka ke Nhialic , ago mat lueel ne baŋ de karɛc cii kɔc looi .

text: For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted , he is able to succour them that are tempted .
text2: Ku guom ci en kaŋ guum yenguop , ɣɔn ci e them , en a dueer en kɔc them aa leu e kuny .

text: Wherefore , holy brethren , partakers of the heavenly calling , consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession , Christ Jesus ;
text2: Yen ka , wek mithekɔckuɔn ɣerpiɔth , kɔc e cɔt e tenhial rɔm etok , takki weniim e Tunydit ku Bɛnydiit Tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic , Bɛnydiit e gamda , yen aye Yecu ;

text: Who was faithful to him that appointed him , as also Moses was faithful in all his house .
text2: raan e ka ke Raan e dɔm en ŋiec dot apiɛth , cit man e ye Mothe ka ke ɣonde ŋiec dot ebɛn .

text: For this man was counted worthy of more glory than Moses , inasmuch as he who hath builded the house hath more honour than the house .
text2: Ku aye tɔ ye raan war Mothe e dhueeŋ , cit man wɛɛre raan e yik ɣot ɣot .

text: For every house is builded by some man ; but he that built all things is God .
text2: Ku ɣot ebɛn ade raan e yik en ; ku Raan e kerieec yik ebɛn ee Nhialic .

text: And Moses verily was faithful in all his house , as a servant , for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken after ;
text2: Ku ee yic , Mothe aaye raan ee ka ke dhiende dot apiɛth kedhie , cit man e raan e ka ke bɛnyde looi , ku aci aa caatɔ de wel bi lɔɔk lueel rial ;

text: But Christ as a son over his own house ; whose house are we , if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end .
text2: ku Kritho aa cit man e wen e bɛny , wen nu e dhiende nɔm ; ku dhiende yen aye wook , te ye wo ŋeenyda cok e muk wok en , ku mukku aŋɔthda apiɛth aŋɔth ee wok rot leec athooke kaŋ .

text: Wherefore ( as the Holy Ghost saith , To day if ye will hear his voice ,
text2: Yen ka , acit man lueele Weidit Ɣer en , yan , Ekoole , te piɛŋ wek rolde ,

text: Harden not your hearts , as in the provocation , in the day of temptation in the wilderness :
text2: Ke we duoki weniim tɔ ril , cit man ɣɔn ekool e gɔɔidepiɔu , Cit kool e them e jɔɔric ,

text: When your fathers tempted me , proved me , and saw my works forty years .
text2: Ɣɔn jute kuarkun ɛn e them , Ku yek luɔidi tiŋ e run kathierŋuan .

text: Wherefore I was grieved with that generation , and said , They do alway err in their heart ; and they have not known my ways .
text2: Yen aa dhiaau ɛn piɔu ne reme , Ku ja lueel , an , Ayek cool e wac kaŋ e kepiɔth : Ku kucki kuɛɛrki ;

text: So I sware in my wrath , They shall not enter into my rest . )
text2: Yen aa luɛɛl ɛn kueŋ e agonhdiyic , Ke ke cii bi lɔ e lɔŋdiyic .

text: Take heed , brethren , lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief , in departing from the living God .
text2: Yak rot tiit , wek mithekɔckuɔ , ke bi cien raan e weyiic , raan cath ke piɔn rɛɛc reec gam , raan e ro dak cieen ne Nhialic piir :

text: But exhort one another daily , while it is called To day ; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin .
text2: ku yak wepiɔth riit wapac e akooinyiin kedhie , te ŋoot en ke ye tɔ ye Ekoole ; ke cin raan tok e weyiic raan bi nɔm riɛl ne mɛth ee kerac kɔc math :

text: For we are made partakers of Christ , if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast unto the end ;
text2: luɔi ci wo jɔ aa kɔc e kaŋ rɔm ne Kritho etok , ten ee wok gamdan cuk kɔn gam cok e muk wok en athooke kaŋ :

text: While it is said , To day if ye will hear his voice , harden not your hearts , as in the provocation .
text2: te ŋoot en ke lueel , yan , Ekoole , te piɛŋ wek rolde , Ke we duoki weniim tɔ ril , acit man ɣɔn e kɔc e looi ekool e gɔɔidepiɔu .

text: For some , when they had heard , did provoke : howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses .
text2: Ku kɔc kɔk , te ci kek e piŋ , acik Nhialic tɔ gai piɔu ; ku acie kɔc kedhie kɔc e bɔ bei e Rip ne Mothe etok .

text: But with whom was he grieved forty years ? was it not with them that had sinned , whose carcases fell in the wilderness ?
text2: Ku ci piɔu diu ke yi ŋa e run kathierŋuan ? Cie kɔc ci kerac looi , kɔc ci gupken doŋ e jɔɔric ɣɔn wieek kek ?

text: And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest , but to them that believed not ?
text2: Ku ci kueŋ lueel keke yi ŋa , ke ke cii bi lɔ e lɔŋdeyic ? Ken kueŋ lueel keke kɔc reec loŋ piŋ ?

text: So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief .
text2: Acuk tiŋ enɔɔne , nɔn ee rɛɛc reec kek gam en aacii kek lɔ thin leu .

text: Let us therefore fear , lest , a promise being left us of entering into his rest , any of you should seem to come short of it .
text2: Yen ka , enɔn ci wo nyaŋ jam ci kɔn lueel , jam de lɔ dueer wo lɔ e lɔŋdeyin , yok riɔɔc , ke cii bi dɛ raan e weyiic , raan cit ke bi e daak .

text: For unto us was the gospel preached , as well as unto them : but the word preached did not profit them , not being mixed with faith in them that heard it .
text2: Ku welpiɛth acike guieer wook eyic , cit man ɣɔn ee ke guieer keek : ku jam ci guiir acin kepiɛth cik yok thin , luɔi kene ye mat ke gam e kɔc yiic kɔc e piŋ en .

text: For we which have believed do enter into rest , as he said , As I have sworn in my wrath , if they shall enter into my rest : although the works were finished from the foundation of the world .
text2: Ku wok kɔc ci gam , wo lɔ e lɔŋeyic ; acit man ci en e lueel , yan , Cit man can kueŋ lueel e agonhdiyin , yan , Aciki bi lɔ e lɔŋdiyic : acakaa luɔi yen e ci guɔ thok ɣɔn ciɛke piny thar .

text: For he spake in a certain place of the seventh day on this wise , And God did rest the seventh day from all his works .
text2: Ku aci lueel tedaŋ ne kede kool ee kekdherou ale , yan , Na wen , ekool ee kekdherou ke Nhialic lɔŋ ne luɔide ebɛn ;

text: And in this place again , If they shall enter into my rest .
text2: ku aci bɛ lueel tene , yan , Aciki bi lɔ e lɔŋdiyic .

text: Seeing therefore it remaineth that some must enter therein , and they to whom it was first preached entered not in because of unbelief :
text2: Ku enɔɔne , e doŋ ke bi kɔc kɔk dhil lɔ thin , ku kɔc ci kɔn guieer welpiɛth akenki lɔ thin ne biak de rɛɛc reec kek gam ,

text: Again , he limiteth a certain day , saying in David , To day , after so long a time ; as it is said , To day if ye will hear his voice , harden not your hearts .
text2: ago kool tok dhel e yepiɔu , ku jɔ lueel e Dabid thok , te ci run juec wan , yan , Ekoole , acit man ci e kɔn lueel , Ekoole , te piɛŋ wek rolde , Ke we duoki weniim tɔ ril .

text: For if Jesus had given them rest , then would he not afterward have spoken of another day .
text2: Ku tee ke ci guɔ gam lɔŋ ne Jocua , adi ken jam bɛ lueel e kede kool daŋ .

text: There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God .
text2: Yen a ŋoot ke tɔuwe lɔŋ de thabath enɔɔne tede kɔc ke Nhialic .

text: For he that is entered into his rest , he also hath ceased from his own works , as God did from his .
text2: Ku raan ci lɔ e lɔŋdeyic aci lɔŋ ayadaŋ ne luɔide , cit man ci Nhialic lɔŋ ne luɔide .

text: Let us labour therefore to enter into that rest , lest any man fall after the same example of unbelief .
text2: Yen ee wo cok e them wok lɔ bi wo lɔ e lɔŋeyic , ke cin raan bi wiik ne dom bi en rɛɛcdɛn reec kek gam dɔmic .

text: For the word of God is quick , and powerful , and sharper than any twoedged sword , piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit , and of the joints and marrow , and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart .
text2: Jam e Nhialic apiir , ku cath ke riɛldit , amoth thok awar abatau ebɛn , abatau athok rou , ku ee raan gutic arek abi piɔu paak keke wei , ku ye yom paak nyiin ayi nyol e yom yiic , ku ye kaŋ woiyiic kak ee raan tak e yepiɔu ayi loŋ ee raan lueel e yepiɔu .

text: Neither is there any creature that is not manifest in his sight : but all things are naked and opened unto the eyes of him with whom we have to do .
text2: Ku acin ke ci cak ke cii tiec e yenɔm : kerieec ebɛn aciɛthki aya ku ɣɔɔrki niim e yenyin yen Raan de wok jam .

text: Seeing then that we have a great high priest , that is passed into the heavens , Jesus the Son of God , let us hold fast our profession .
text2: Ku enɔn ciɛth wok ne Bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic bɛny de naamdɛn dit , bɛny ci teek ke lɔ paannhial , Yecu Wen e Nhialic , yok gamda muk aril .

text: For we have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities ; but was in all points tempted like as we are , yet without sin .
text2: Bɛnydandiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic acie raan cii piɔu dueer dhiau keke wook etok ne kɔc kɔɔc wok ; ee raan ci them e kerieecic ebɛn , cit man e wok , ku cin kerɛɛc ci looi .

text: Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace , that we may obtain mercy , and find grace to help in time of need .
text2: Yen ee wok rot cuɔt tethiɔk te nu thoonydiit de dhueeŋdepiɔu ke wo ril nyiin , ke wo bi kokepiɔu yok , ku yokku dhueeŋdepiɔu bi wo kony ekool de yen ke dak wook .

text: For every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in things pertaining to God , that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins :
text2: Ku bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic ebɛn , bɛny ci kuɛny bei e kɔc yiic , aye dɔm e nyin e kɔc yiic bi ka ke Nhialic aa looi , ku bi kak e gɛme kɔc lam ayi ka bi nɔk ne kede karac :

text: Who can have compassion on the ignorant , and on them that are out of the way ; for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity .
text2: ku adueer epiɔu liir keke kɔc kuc kaŋ ku kɔc e kaŋ wooc , ne took ci e tuɔɔk ne kɔc de guop aya ;

text: And by reason hereof he ought , as for the people , so also for himself , to offer for sins .
text2: yen aye yen ka ke karac dhil lam , ayi ka ke karɛcke yenguop aya , cit man ee yen ka ke karɛc ke kɔc lam .

text: And no man taketh this honour unto himself , but he that is called of God , as was Aaron .
text2: Ku acin raan e bɛɛnye dɔm ne kede nɔmde , ee raan cii Nhialic cɔɔl etok , cit man e Aaron .

text: So also Christ glorified not himself to be made an high priest ; but he that said unto him , Thou art my Son , to day have I begotten thee .
text2: Ayi Kritho ayadaŋ , aa cii rot ŋic bɛɛny bi aa bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic , ee Raan e yook en , an , Yin ee Wendi , Ekoole en a dhieeth ɛn yin :

text: As he saith also in another place , Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec .
text2: cit man ci e lueel tedaŋ , an , Yin ee bɛny e ka ke Nhialic aɣet athɛɛr Bɛny ci loony e bɛɛny e Melkidhedekic .

text: Who in the days of his flesh , when he had offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears unto him that was able to save him from death , and was heard in that he feared ;
text2: Yen Yecu , ɣɔn tɔu en ke ye raan , te ci en Nhialic lam ne lɔŋ ku pal , ke ye coot e rol dit ku dhiɛɛu , lɛm Raan e leu en e kuny kuny en en bei e thuɔɔuwic , ku ci kede piŋ ne rieeu ee yen Nhialic rieu ,

text: Though he were a Son , yet learned he obedience by the things which he suffered ;
text2: acakaa yen e ye Wende , ke ye weet e piŋdejam ne ka ci guum ;

text: And being made perfect , he became the author of eternal salvation unto all them that obey him ;
text2: na wen , aci thok e weet , ke ci aa raan ee kɔc e kede piŋ tɔ yok kunydewei kuny bi ɣet athɛɛr ;

text: Called of God an high priest after the order of Melchisedec .
text2: raan cii Nhialic dɔm e kɔc niim , tɔ ye bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic bɛny ci loony e bɛɛny e Melkidhedekic .

text: Of whom we have many things to say , and hard to be uttered , seeing ye are dull of hearing .
text2: Ku wo de niim jam juec jam dueerku lueel ne kede , ku ye jam ril e wer bi e weer thar , luɔi ca wek kaŋ e dap piŋ enɔɔne .

text: For when for the time ye ought to be teachers , ye have need that one teach you again which be the first principles of the oracles of God ; and are become such as have need of milk , and not of strong meat .
text2: Ee yic , adi cak aa kɔc e kɔc kɔk wɛɛt enɔɔne , runkun acik juec , ku we kɔɔr raan bi we bɛ wɛɛt enɔɔne ne cook tueŋ cook ke caŋ e ciɛke wel ke Nhialic ; ku we ci ciet kɔc e ca kɔɔr , ku ciki kuin ril e kɔɔr .

text: For every one that useth milk is unskilful in the word of righteousness : for he is a babe .
text2: Raan ebɛn raan e rueth e ca ee raan ŋoot ke ken weet e jam de piathepiɔu ; ee mɛnhthiinakaŋ tei .

text: But strong meat belongeth to them that are of full age , even those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil .
text2: Ku kuin ril ee kede kɔc ci dit , kek kɔc ci niim piath ne them e ye kek rot them , agoki kaŋ ŋiec pɔɔc apiɛth , kepiɛth ayi kerac .

text: Therefore leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ , let us go on unto perfection ; not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works , and of faith toward God ,
text2: Yen pɛl wok jam de cook tueŋ e kede Kritho , ku jɔku lɔ tueŋ aɣet dit bi wo thok e dit ; ku duku keerkeer e weet be wecic , yen aye jam de wel ee raan epiɔu wɛl wei e luɔi cinic piir , ku jam de gam ee raan Nhialic gam ,

text: Of the doctrine of baptisms , and of laying on of hands , and of resurrection of the dead , and of eternal judgment .
text2: ku weet e kede baptiith , ku thany ee kɔc kɔc thany e kecin , ku jonerot e kɔc ci thou , ku guieereloŋ guieer bi tɔu athɛɛr .

text: And this will we do , if God permit .
text2: Ku kene abuk looi , te ci Nhialic e gam .

text: For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened , and have tasted of the heavenly gift , and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost ,
text2: Ku na kɔc ci ɣɛɛrepiny kɔn yok , ku cik miɔc e bɔ nhial thieep , ku cik aa kɔc e rɔm etok ne Weidit Ɣer ,

text: And have tasted the good word of God , and the powers of the world to come ,
text2: ku thiepki jam piɛth e Nhialic , ku riɛldiit e piny bi bɛn ,

text: If they shall fall away , to renew them again unto repentance ; seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh , and put him to an open shame .
text2: kɔcke , te ci kek dɔɔk cieen , acin ke dueer keek bɛ tɔ nyɔk piɔth e puk ; luɔi ee kek rot bɛ piat Wen e Nhialic e tim ci riiu nɔm kɔu , ku yek tɔ yaar e kɔc niim .

text: For the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it , and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed , receiveth blessing from God :
text2: Piny ee deŋ e cool e bɛn e yenɔm dek , ku jɔ wal aa bɛɛi wɛl piɛth bi kɔc aa cam kɔc cii piny puur e keden , pinye ee athiɛɛi yok tede Nhialic .

text: But that which beareth thorns and briers is rejected , and is nigh unto cursing ; whose end is to be burned .
text2: Ku na bii kuɔɔth tei ayi thil , ka bi rɛɛc tɔ cin naamde , ku dueer thiɔk ke cien ; ku thokde ee nyop bi e nyop .

text: But , beloved , we are persuaded better things of you , and things that accompany salvation , though we thus speak .
text2: Ku week , wek kɔc nhiaar , wo ŋath ka ŋuan tede week , ka cath e kunydewei , acakaa wok e jam aya .

text: For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love , which ye have shewed toward his name , in that ye have ministered to the saints , and do minister .
text2: Nhialic acie raan cin piɔu raan dueer nɔm maar e luɔidun lethic ku nhieer ɣɔn nhiaar wek rinke , ɣɔn aa wek ka ke kɔc ɣerpiɔth looi , ku yak ke looi aɣet ci enɔɔne .

text: And we desire that every one of you do shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end :
text2: Ku wo de piɔth luɔi ba wek yiic lɛth e lɛth mane guop wedhie , aguɔki tɔu abak piɔth a yum ne aŋɔthdun athooke kaŋ ,

text: That ye be not slothful , but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises .
text2: ke we cii bi aa adaakrot , abak aa kɔc ee tau de kɔc dɔmic kɔc e ka ci kɔn lueel lɔɔk lak , ne gam ku ne guom ee kek kaŋ ŋiec guum .

text: For when God made promise to Abraham , because he could swear by no greater , he sware by himself ,
text2: Ku ɣɔn ci Nhialic Abraɣam lɛk ke bi gam en , luɔi cin en raan dit war en nu , raan dueer en guutguut lueel e ye , ke jɔ guutguut lueel e rot , yan ,

text: Saying , Surely blessing I will bless thee , and multiplying I will multiply thee .
text2: Yin ba dhil thieei e athiɛɛi dit , ku yin ba dhil ŋuak nyin e ŋueŋ dit

text: And so , after he had patiently endured , he obtained the promise .
text2: Na wen , te ci en kaŋ guum e piɔn lir , ke jɔ ke ci kɔn lueel , an , bi gam en , yok .

text: For men verily swear by the greater : and an oath for confirmation is to them an end of all strife .
text2: Ku kɔc ayek guutguut lueel ne ke war keek : ku te lueele raan guutguut , tɔ yen jamde kaac , en aye teer thok ebɛn tede keek .

text: Wherein God , willing more abundantly to shew unto the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel , confirmed it by an oath :
text2: Ago Nhialic , luɔi de en piɔu nɔn bi en kɔc bi ka ci kɔn lueel lɔɔk lak nyuoth loŋ de yenpiɔu , nɔn ee yen loŋ cii ro dueer puk , ke jɔ guutguut taau thin ;

text: That by two immutable things , in which it was impossible for God to lie , we might have a strong consolation , who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us :
text2: ke wo dueer wopiɔth riit alal ne kaŋ kaarou ka cii ro dueer puk , ka cii Nhialic ke lueth dueer toor thin , wok kɔc ci kat ke wo bɛɛk wei , lok aŋɔth ci taau e woniim dɔm ;

text: Which hope we have as an anchor of the soul , both sure and stedfast , and which entereth into that within the veil ;
text2: yen aye aŋɔth cath ke wook , aŋɔth ci wo mac piɔth cit man e wenh e abel mac , aŋɔth cii ŋɛth e peeric , akaac aril , ku jɔ lɔ thin te nu ke nu e lupɔ dhil baŋtui ;

text: Whither the forerunner is for us entered , even Jesus , made an high priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec .
text2: ee te ci Yecu raan e kɔc wat kɔn lɔ thin ne biakda , luɔi ci en aa bɛnydht tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic aɣet athɛɛr , bɛny ci loony e bɛɛny e Melkidhedekic .

text: For this Melchisedec , king of Salem , priest of the most high God , who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings , and blessed him ;
text2: Ku takki weniim e Melkidhedeke , malik de Thalem , ku ye bɛny e ka ke Nhialic Awarjaŋ , bɛny ɣɔn loor Abraɣam nɔm ɣɔn dhuny en enɔm te ɣɔn nɛk en maliik , ago thieei ,

text: To whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all ; first being by interpretation King of righteousness , and after that also King of Salem , which is , King of peace ;
text2: bɛny ci Abraɣam gam biakde ne kaŋ yiic kedhie , gɛm toŋ wen thieere kaŋ . Ku rinke , te puke ye , aci kɔn aa Malik de piathepiɔu , ku ye Malik de Thalem aya , yen aye Malik de mat .

text: Without father , without mother , without descent , having neither beginning of days , nor end of life ; but made like unto the Son of God ; abideth a priest continually .
text2: Acin wun ku cin man , ku cin kuarken , gol ci akoolke gɔl aliu , ku cin thok bi piirde thok , ku ci tɔ cit Wen e Nhialic , go tɔu ke ye bɛny e ka ke Nhialic aɣet athɛɛr .

text: Now consider how great this man was , unto whom even the patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils .
text2: Jaki weniim cat e raane , dit diit en , raan ci Abraɣam kuɛɛredan thɛɛr gam biakde ne ka ci yak , gɛm toŋ wen thieere kaŋ .

text: And verily they that are of the sons of Levi , who receive the office of the priesthood , have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law , that is , of their brethren , though they come out of the loins of Abraham :
text2: Ku ee yic , wɛɛt ke Lebi , kɔc e luɔi de bɛny de ka ke Nhialic dɔm , kek adeki riɛl bi ke kaŋ noom tede kɔc , nomki toŋ wen thieere kaŋ ne kede loŋ , ayek ke noom tede mithekɔcken , acakaa kek e bɔ bei e Abraɣamic .

text: But he whose descent is not counted from them received tithes of Abraham , and blessed him that had the promises .
text2: Ku raane , raan de kuarken pei , kuarkɛn cie kɔc dhien e Lebi , aci biakde noom tede Abraɣam , noom toŋ wen thieere kaŋ , ku jɔ raan thieei raan cath keke ka ci lueel , an , bi ke gam en .

text: And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better .
text2: Ku cooke acii dueere jɔɔny , yan , Raan koor aye thieei e raan ŋuan .

text: And here men that die receive tithes ; but there he receiveth them , of whom it is witnessed that he liveth .
text2: Ku etene , kɔc bi thou kek ee kaŋ noom nomki toŋ wen thieere kaŋ ; ku tɛɛn , raan ee kaŋ noom raan ci caatɔ lueel ne kede , an , apiir .

text: And as I may so say , Levi also , who receiveth tithes , payed tithes in Abraham .
text2: Ku adueere lueel ale , yan , Ayi Lebi aya , raan ee toŋ wen thieere kaŋ noom tede kɔc , yen aa gɛm toŋ wen thieere kaŋ ne Abraɣam ;

text: For he was yet in the loins of his father , when Melchisedec met him .
text2: luɔi ŋoot en ke nu e wunic ɣɔn loore Melkidhedek enɔm .

text: If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood , ( for under it the people received the law , ) what further need was there that another priest should rise after the order of Melchisedec , and not be called after the order of Aaron ?
text2: Ku enɔɔne , te ci dikdepiɔu guɔ bɛn ne bɛɛny de dhien e Lebi ( ku kɔc acik loŋ yok ne yen ) , de ke ye bɛ dak , ke bi bɛny daŋ ro dhil bɛ jot , bɛny loony e bɛɛny e Melkidhedekic , ku cii loony e bɛɛny e Aronic ?

text: For the priesthood being changed , there is made of necessity a change also of the law .
text2: Ku na ci bɛɛny ro puk , ke loŋ jɔ rot dhil puk ayadaŋ .

text: For he of whom these things are spoken pertaineth to another tribe , of which no man gave attendance at the altar .
text2: Ku raan cii kake lueel ne kede , ee raan e dhien mɛɛn , acin raan e dhienden ee luui ten ee lam .

text: For it is evident that our Lord sprang out of Juda ; of which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priesthood .
text2: Acok aa yic nɔn e dhieethe Bɛnydiitda dhien e Juda ; ku acin ke cii Mothe lueel ne dhiene e kede bany ke ka ke Nhialic .

text: And it is yet far more evident : for that after the similitude of Melchisedec there ariseth another priest ,
text2: Ku puŋ bi loŋ ro dhil puk acok e ŋic yen egɔk ne gaar ci e gaar , yan , Bɛny mɛɛn abi ro jɔt bɛny loony e bɛɛny e Melkidhedekic ,

text: Who is made , not after the law of a carnal commandment , but after the power of an endless life .
text2: raan ci tɔ ye bɛny , acie kede loŋ de jam de dhien e dhiethe raan tei , ee kede riɛl e piir cin thokde .

text: For he testifieth , Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec .
text2: Ne luɛl ci e lueel ne kede , yan , Yin ee bɛny de ka ke Nhialic aɣet athɛɛr Bɛny ci loony e bɛɛny e Melkidhedekic .

text: For there is verily a disannulling of the commandment going before for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof .
text2: Ku loŋ ci lɔ tueŋ aye guɔ pɔl eliŋliŋ ne kɔc kɔɔc en , ku ne cien piathdɛn ci bɛɛi ,

text: For the law made nothing perfect , but the bringing in of a better hope did ; by the which we draw nigh unto God .
text2: ( luɔi cin en ke ci loŋ tɔ ye dikedik , ) ago aŋɔth ŋuan bɛɛi thin , aŋɔth ee wo tɔ cuot rot tethiɔk ne Nhialic .

text: And inasmuch as not without an oath he was made priest :
text2: Ku akene dɔm aye bɛny ke cin guutguut ci lueel .

text: ( For those priests were made without an oath ; but this with an oath by him that said unto him , The Lord sware and will not repent , Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec : )
text2: Ku keek ayeke dɔm aye bany ke cin guutguut ci lueel ; ku yen aye dɔm aye bɛny ne guutguut ci lueel ne raan e yook en , yan , Bɛnydit aci guutguut lueel ku cii epiɔu bi puk , yan , Yin ee bɛny e ka ke Nhialic aɣet athɛɛr .

text: By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better testament .
text2: Yen aye Yecu tɔ ye raan ci yeyeth mac e loŋ ŋuanic aret .

text: And they truly were many priests , because they were not suffered to continue by reason of death :
text2: Ku keek ayeke dɔm aye bany ke ke juec , ne pɛn ci thuɔɔu ke pɛn tɔu ananden ;

text: But this man , because he continueth ever , hath an unchangeable priesthood .
text2: ku raane , ne tau tɔu en athɛɛr , yen a ciɛth en ke bɛɛny cii raan daŋ dueer lɔɔk noom .

text: Wherefore he is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him , seeing he ever liveth to make intercession for them .
text2: Yen a dueer en kɔc leu e kuny kony en keek wei etaitai , kɔc e rot cuot Nhialic ne yen , ne piir piir en athɛɛr ke ye cool e lɔŋ ne biakden .

text: For such an high priest became us , who is holy , harmless , undefiled , separate from sinners , and made higher than the heavens ;
text2: Bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic bɛny cit ekene yen aa roŋ ke wook , bɛny ɣerpiɔu , ku cin piɔu kerac , ku cin piɔu acuɔl , raan ci poc pei e kɔc e kerac looi yiic , ku ci jat nhial abi tenhial woor ;

text: Who needeth not daily , as those high priests , to offer up sacrifice , first for his own sins , and then for the people ' s : for this he did once , when he offered up himself .
text2: ku acin te bi en kaŋ dhil aa lam e akoolnyiin kedhie , cit man ee kek kɔn lam ne kede karɛc ke kekgup , na ele , ke jɔki lam ne kede karɛc ke kɔc : aci kene looi raantok ku acin daŋ , ekool ci en rot gam .

text: For the law maketh men high priests which have infirmity ; but the word of the oath , which was since the law , maketh the Son , who is consecrated for evermore .
text2: Ku loŋ ee kɔc dɔm aye bany ke ka ke Nhialic kɔc cath ne kɔcdeguop ; ku jam de guutguut , jam e bɔ e loŋ cok , e Wen e Nhialic dɔm aye bɛny , raan ci tɔ ye dikedik aɣet athɛɛr .

text: Now of the things which we have spoken this is the sum : We have such an high priest , who is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens ;
text2: Ku enɔɔne , cook tueŋ nu e ka luelku niim , ki , yan , Wo cath ne bɛnydiit tueŋ de ka ke Nhialice , bɛny ci nyuc piny e ciin cueny e thoonydiit e Dhueeŋdiit nu paannhial ,

text: A minister of the sanctuary , and of the true tabernacle , which the Lord pitched , and not man .
text2: bɛny e ka ke teɣeric looi , ku ye ka ke keemɔ yic looi , keemɔ e pieet e Bɛnydit , ku cie raan en e pieet e .

text: For every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices : wherefore it is of necessity that this man have somewhat also to offer .
text2: Ku bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic ebɛn aye dɔm bi ka ci gam aa lam ayi ka bi nɔk : yen aye bɛnydiite dhil cath keke ke bi lam aya .

text: For if he were on earth , he should not be a priest , seeing that there are priests that offer gifts according to the law :
text2: Ku tee nu e piny nɔm , adi cie bɛny e ka ke Nhialic eliŋliŋ , luɔi de yen bany e ka ci gam lam ne kede loŋ .

text: Who serve unto the example and shadow of heavenly things , as Moses was admonished of God when he was about to make the tabernacle : for , See , saith he , that thou make all things according to the pattern shewed to thee in the mount .
text2: Banyke ayek ka ke ke cit teɣeric nu paannhial looi , kak e atiepden tei , cit man ci Nhialic Mothe wɛɛt , ɣɔn kɔɔr en luɔi looi en keemɔ : aci lɛk en , an , Woi apiɛth , yin bi kaŋ looi kedhie , cit man ɣɔn ci ke nyuoth yin e kuurdit nɔm .

text: But now hath he obtained a more excellent ministry , by how much also he is the mediator of a better covenant , which was established upon better promises .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , Kritho aci luɔi piɛth aret dɔm luɔi war luɔiden e piath , luɔi ee yen raan e kɔc maat , ku ye caatɔ de lɔŋ ci mac , loŋ piɛth waar loŋ waan , loŋ ci mac ne jam piɛth war jam waan jam de ka bi gam kɔc .

text: For if that first covenant had been faultless , then should no place have been sought for the second .
text2: Ku loŋ ci mac tueŋe , tee cinic ke bi e gɔk , ke tede loŋ ee kek rou adi kene kɔɔr .

text: For finding fault with them , he saith , Behold , the days come , saith the Lord , when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah :
text2: Ku ɣɔn gɛk en keek , ke jɔ lueel , yan , Tieŋki , alueel Bɛnydit , yan , Akool abiki , Kool ban loŋ e piac gɔl mac woke dhien e Yithrael ku dhien e Juda ;

text: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt ; because they continued not in my covenant , and I regarded them not , saith the Lord .
text2: Acii cit man e loŋ ca mac ɣɔn woke kuarken Kool ɣɔn dam ɛn kecin thɛl ke bei paan e Rip ; Luɔi reec kek reer e loŋdiyic , Aguɔ piɔu cien ke , ke lueel Bɛnydit ki .

text: For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days , saith the Lord ; I will put my laws into their mind , and write them in their hearts : and I will be to them a God , and they shall be to me a people :
text2: Ku kene ee loŋ ba mac woke dhien e Yithrael E akoolke cok , alueel Bɛnydit ; Looŋki aba ke taau e keniim , Ku gaar keek e kepiɔth : Ku yɛn bi aa Nhialicden , Ku abik aa kɔcki .

text: And they shall not teach every man his neighbour , and every man his brother , saying , Know the Lord : for all shall know me , from the least to the greatest .
text2: Ku ŋɛk acii raan rɛɛr ke yen bi aa wɛɛt , Ku cii ŋɛk mɛnhkene e wɛɛt , yan , Ŋic Bɛnydit , Luɔi bi kɔc a ŋic kedhie , Gɔl e raan koor aɣet raandiit e keyiic .

text: For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness , and their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more .
text2: Yɛn bi piɔu kok woke kerɛɛcdɛn e kekpiɔth , Ku karɛc cik looi ayi rɛɛc reec kek loŋ aca ke bi bɛ tak anandi .

text: In that he saith , A new covenant , he hath made the first old . Now that which decayeth and waxeth old is ready to vanish away .
text2: Ku luɛl lueel en en , an , Loŋ ci piac mac , ee luɔi ci en loŋ ci mac tueŋ tɔ ye kethɛɛr . Ku ke ye dhiɔp abi aa kethɛɛr abi dap lɔ riar piny .

text: Then verily the first covenant had also ordinances of divine service , and a worldly sanctuary .
text2: Ku loŋ ci kɔn mac acath keke luɔidɛn e guiɛɛk de ka ke Nhialic , ku de tedɛn ɣeric , tede piny nɔm .

text: For there was a tabernacle made ; the first , wherein was the candlestick , and the table , and the shewbread ; which is called the sanctuary .
text2: Ade keemɔ ci cueec , biak thiɔke , adeyic ken ee manydealath taau e yenɔm , ayi pamdit , ayi kuin ci pam ci gam Nhialic ; te ye cɔl Teɣeric ki .

text: And after the second veil , the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of all ;
text2: Ku lupɔ dhiil e kaŋ gel biaktni , ee te cɔl Teɣeric Ewic war kerieec ;

text: Which had the golden censer , and the ark of the covenant overlaid round about with gold , wherein was the golden pot that had manna , and Aaron ' s rod that budded , and the tables of the covenant ;
text2: te deyic thaŋ de tol tum ci cueec e adhaap , ku athanduŋ de loŋ ci mac , ke ci yiek kɔu adhaap ebɛn , ku adeyic tony e adhaap deyic mana , ayi wai de Aaron wai ɣɔn ci nyok , ku moc gaak , ayi pɛɛm ke loŋ ci mac ;

text: And over it the cherubims of glory shadowing the mercyseat ; of which we cannot now speak particularly .
text2: ku kaac cerubiim ke dhueeŋ e athanduk nɔm , kumki thoony de luk e atiepden , ku kake acuku ke dueer giit nyiin e luɛl enɔɔne .

text: Now when these things were thus ordained , the priests went always into the first tabernacle , accomplishing the service of God .
text2: Ku te ci kake thok e guiɛɛk aya , ke bany ke ka ke Nhialic ke ke ye cool e lɔ e keemɔyin biak thiɔke , lek luɔidɛn e Nhialic aa looi ;

text: But into the second went the high priest alone once every year , not without blood , which he offered for himself , and for the errors of the people :
text2: ku keemɔ biak wen ee kekiou yen aye bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic lɔ thin , yen etok , raantok e run tokic , ku acie lɔ thin te cin riɛm , riɛm ee lɔ gam Nhialic ne kede guop , ku ne kede ka ci kɔc wooo ke kucki rot .

text: The Holy Ghost this signifying , that the way into the holiest of all was not yet made manifest , while as the first tabernacle was yet standing :
text2: Yen aye Weidit Ɣer kɔc nyuoth cooke , yan , Kueer lɔ teɣeric ewic aŋoot ke kene tɔ tiec , te ŋoote keemɔ tueŋ ke kaac .

text: Which was a figure for the time then present , in which were offered both gifts and sacrifices , that could not make him that did the service perfect , as pertaining to the conscience ;
text2: Ku kene ee kaaŋ ne kede ekool enɔɔne ; kool ee kaŋ lam thin ka gɛme kɔc ku yeke nɔk , ka cii kɔc e lam keek dueer tɔ ye piɔth dikedik , ke bi cien ke ŋicki rot ,

text: Which stood only in meats and drinks , and divers washings , and carnal ordinances , imposed on them until the time of reformation .
text2: ayek luɔi de ka ke guop tei ( yi kecam ku kadek ku wɛk kithic ) , ka ci taau e kɔc yinth aɣet kool e piath bi kaŋ tɔ piɛth .

text: But Christ being come an high priest of good things to come , by a greater and more perfect tabernacle , not made with hands , that is to say , not of this building ;
text2: Na wen , ke Kritho bɔ ke ye bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic bɛny de kapiɛth bi bɛn , ne keemɔ ŋuan nyin , ku ci dikedik awar keemɔ waan , ku aa cii cuec e raan cin , tharde ki , an , acie kede caŋe ,

text: Neither by the blood of goats and calves , but by his own blood he entered in once into the holy place , having obtained eternal redemption for us .
text2: ku acin riɛm de thok bɔɔth ku mioor e muk , ee riɛm de yenguop yen e muk , ku jɔ lɔ teɣeric raantok ku cin daŋ , ne weer ci en kɔc wɛɛr bei aɣet athɛɛr .

text: For if the blood of bulls and of goats , and the ashes of an heifer sprinkling the unclean , sanctifieth to the purifying of the flesh :
text2: Ku riɛm de thok bɔɔth ku mioor , keke arom de dau , te ci ke pɔɔr e kɔc gup kɔc ci wook e kecol , ago ke tɔ piɛth gup :

text: How much more shall the blood of Christ , who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without spot to God , purge your conscience from dead works to serve the living God ?
text2: na riɛm de Kritho raan ci ro gam Nhialic ke cin guop tethiin col , ne Weidit e tɔu athɛɛr , bi keek woor e war yindi ne wɛk bi en week waak piɔth ne luɔi ci thou , abi cien ke ŋiɛcki rot , ke we bi ka ke Nhialic piir aa looi ?

text: And for this cause he is the mediator of the new testament , that by means of death , for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first testament , they which are called might receive the promise of eternal inheritance .
text2: Yen aye yen raan e kɔc maat ku ye caatɔ de loŋ ci piac mac , ago ka ci kɔc wooc cool ne thon ci en thou , kɔc rɛɛr e loŋ ci kɔn mac tueŋic , ke kɔc ci cɔɔl ke ke bi ke ci kɔn lueel lɔɔk lak , ke bi tɔu athɛɛr .

text: For where a testament is , there must also of necessity be the death of the testator .
text2: Ku te nu awarek de teŋ de weu , ke raan e gaar awarek abi dhil kɔn thou , ku jɔ weu tek .

text: For a testament is of force after men are dead : otherwise it is of no strength at all while the testator liveth .
text2: Awarek de teŋ de weu ade naamde te ci raan guɔ thou : ku na ken raan thou , ke awarek acin naamde anande te ŋoote raan e gaar en ke piir .

text: Whereupon neither the first testament was dedicated without blood .
text2: Yen akene loŋ ci mac tueŋ cak thar aya te cin riɛm .

text: For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law , he took the blood of calves and of goats , with water , and scarlet wool , and hyssop , and sprinkled both the book , and all the people ,
text2: Ku te ci Mothe kɔc kedhie lɛk cok ke loŋ ebɛn ne kede loŋ , ke jɔ riɛm de mioor ku thok bɔɔth noom , keke piu ku nhim ke thok nhim thith ku wɛɛl cɔl kithop , go ke wieeth e awarek kɔu ku wiith ke e kɔc gup kedhie aya ,

text: Saying , This is the blood of the testament which God hath enjoined unto you .
text2: lueel , an , Riɛm de loŋ ki , loŋ cii Nhialic mac ke week .

text: Moreover he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle , and all the vessels of the ministry .
text2: Ku jɔ riɛm wieeth e keemɔ kɔu e wiith awen , ku wiith e tony kɔɔth kedhie aya tony ke luɔi de Nhialic .

text: And almost all things are by the law purged with blood ; and without shedding of blood is no remission .
text2: Ku ne kede loŋ tedit e kaŋ kedhie ayeke tɔ ɣer yiic ne riɛm , adɔŋ tokiook tei , ku te cin lɛu e riɛm ka cin pal e karac .

text: It was therefore necessary that the patterns of things in the heavens should be purified with these ; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these .
text2: Ku ka ci looi ka cit ka nu paannhial aake ye dhil tɔ ɣer yiic ne kake ; ku ka nu paannhial gup ayeke dhil tɔ ɣer yiic ne kapiɛth ci nɔk ka war ekake .

text: For Christ is not entered into the holy places made with hands , which are the figures of the true ; but into heaven itself , now to appear in the presence of God for us :
text2: Ku Kritho aken lɔ teɣeric ci looi e kɔc cin , ee ke cit teɣeric yic tei ; ee paannhial guop en aa le en thin , le ku tic e Nhialic nɔm ne biakda enɔɔne :

text: Nor yet that he should offer himself often , as the high priest entereth into the holy place every year with blood of others ;
text2: ku acie luɔi bi en ro gaam raanjuec ; cit man ee bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic lɔ thin e run nyiin , ke muk riɛm cie kede ;

text: For then must he often have suffered since the foundation of the world : but now once in the end of the world hath he appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself .
text2: na ci looi aya , ka di ci aa cool e gum kaŋ raanjuec te ɣɔn ciɛke piny : ku enɔɔne aci ro nyuɔɔth raantok ne thok de piny , bi kerac bɛn nyaai ne naŋ ci e nɔk .

text: And as it is appointed unto men once to die , but after this the judgment :
text2: Ku acit man ci loŋ taau piny , an , bi kɔc thou raantok , ku bi guieereloŋ jɔ lɔɔk bɛn ;

text: So Christ was once offered to bear the sins of many ; and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time without sin unto salvation .
text2: ayi Kritho aya , te ci en rot gaam raantok bi karɛc ke kɔc juec bɛn jɔt , ka bi bɛ tic e renden tede kɔc tit en , ke cin kerɛɛc cath ke yen , ne kuny bi en ke kony wei .

text: For the law having a shadow of good things to come , and not the very image of the things , can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect .
text2: Ku loŋ , luɔi ciɛth en keke atiep de kapiɛth bi bɛn tei , ku cie cath ke guop de kaŋ gup , ka cii kɔc dueer tɔ ye piɔth dikedik ananden , kɔc e ro cuɔt tethiɔk , ne ka yek cool e lɛm kek ke ku nakki keek e run nyiin ebɛn .

text: For then would they not have ceased to be offered ? because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins .
text2: Ka di keneke pɔl e lam ? Kɔc e lam , tee ke ci tɔ ɣer piɔth raan tok , ka di cin ŋiny de karɛc ci doŋ e kepiɔth .

text: But in those sacrifices there is a remembrance again made of sins every year .
text2: Ku naŋ e ye kake nɔk , yen aye kɔc keniim tak e karɛcken e run nyiin kedhie .

text: For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins .
text2: Riɛm de mioor ku thok bɔɔth aciki karac dueer leu ne nyiɛɛi .

text: Wherefore when he cometh into the world , he saith , Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not , but a body hast thou prepared me :
text2: Yen a lueel en en , te bi en e piny nɔm , yan , Naŋ de kaŋ ku gɛm e kaŋ aake kɛne ya kɔɔr , Ee guop yen aa cueec yin ɛn ;

text: In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hast had no pleasure .
text2: Nyum de ka ci gam ku naŋ de kaŋ e baŋ de kerac aake cii yin e tɔ mit piɔu :

text: Then said I , Lo , I come ( in the volume of the book it is written of me , ) to do thy will , O God .
text2: Aguɔ jɔ lueel , yan , Ya ki , yɛn bɔ , ( Kedi aci gɔɔr e awarek ci dolic ) Ba kede piɔndu bɛn looi , yin Nhialic .

text: Above when he said , Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and offering for sin thou wouldest not , neither hadst pleasure therein ; which are offered by the law ;
text2: Te ci en e kɔn lueel , yan , Ka ci nɔk ku ka ci gam ku ka ci lam ku nyop ke ku ka ci nɔk ne baŋ de kerac aa ke kɛne ya kɔɔr , ku cii piɔu e miɛt we keek aya ( ka ye lam ne kede loŋ ka ) ,

text: Then said he , Lo , I come to do thy will , O God . He taketh away the first , that he may establish the second .
text2: ke jɔ lueel , yan , Ya ki , yɛn bɔ , ba kede piɔndu bɛn looi . E ketueŋ nyaai , ke bi ke bɔ cieen tɔ kaac .

text: By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all .
text2: Ku e kede piɔn e Nhialice , en aa tɔ wo ɣerpiɔth ne gam ci guop de Yecu Kritho gaam raantok ku jɔ thok .

text: And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices , which can never take away sins :
text2: Ku bɛny de ka ke Nhialic ebɛn ee kɔɔc e akool nyiin ke loi luɔide ku ye cool e lam kamanke ka bi nɔk , ka cii karac dueer leu e nyiɛɛi ananden .

text: But this man , after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever , sat down on the right hand of God ;
text2: Ku raane , te ci en toŋ ci nɔk e baŋ de karac gaam ke bi dɛ naamde athɛɛr , ke jɔ nyuc e ciin cueny de Nhialic ;

text: From henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool .
text2: ku jɔ reer , tiit kool bi kɔc de ater ne yen tɔ ye ke bi en ecok dhɔɔr .

text: For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified .
text2: Ku gɛm ci en tok gaam , en aci en kɔc tɔ ye piɔth dikedik aɣet athɛɛr , kɔc wen ci tɔ ɣerpiɔth .

text: Whereof the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us : for after that he had said before ,
text2: Ku Weidit Ɣer kek aye caatɔ ne ecooke , lekki wook : ku te ci en e kɔn lueel , yan ,

text: This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days , saith the Lord , I will put my laws into their hearts , and in their minds will I write them ;
text2: Loŋdi ki , loŋ ba mac wo keek E ninke cok , ke lueel Bɛnydit ki : An , Yɛn bi looŋki taau e kepiɔth , Ku gaar keek e keniim ; ke jɔ lueel , yan ,

text: And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more .
text2: Ku karɛcken ku rɛɛc reec kek loŋ aca ke bi bɛ tak anandi .

text: Now where remission of these is , there is no more offering for sin .
text2: Ku te ci kake pal kɔc eliŋliŋ , ka cin ke bi bɛ aa gam ne baŋ de kerac .

text: Having therefore , brethren , boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus ,
text2: Yen ka , wek mithekɔckuɔ , wo dueer lɔ teɣeric ewic ne riɛm de Yecu ke wo ril nyiin ,

text: By a new and living way , which he hath consecrated for us , through the veil , that is to say , his flesh ;
text2: ne kueer ci liep wook , kueer ci piac looi kueer piir , teek e lupɔ e kaŋ gelic , yen aye guopde ;

text: And having an high priest over the house of God ;
text2: ku wo de Bɛnydiit e ka ke Nhialic nu e dhien e Nhialic nɔm ;

text: Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith , having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience , and our bodies washed with pure water .
text2: yen cot wo rot tethiɔk ne piɔn yic ne gam ci wo ŋiec gam alal , te ci wo yoor piɔth ke bi cien ke ŋicku rot , ku ci wo waak gup ne piu atop :

text: Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering ; ( for he is faithful that promised ; )
text2: yok gamdan ee wok aŋɔthda gam muk aril , ke wo cii piɔth wiel , luɔi ee yen Raan adot , yen Raan e tɔ wo ŋɔth :

text: And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works :
text2: ku yok woniim cat ne luɔi bi wok rot kuot nhieer ku luɔi piɛth ;

text: Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together , as the manner of some is ; but exhorting one another : and so much the more , as ye see the day approaching .
text2: ku duku gueer ee wo gueer e pɔl , acit man e kɔc kɔk , ku yok wopiɔth riit wapac ; ku cok e luɔɔi wek ekene , ne tiŋ aa wek akol tiŋ ke ɣeet tethiɔk .

text: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth , there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins ,
text2: Ku te ye wok kerac looi ke ŋicku , ke wo ci ŋiny de yic kɔn yok , ka cin ke ci nɔk ne baŋ de karac ci doŋ tede wook ,

text: But a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation , which shall devour the adversaries .
text2: ee tiet deyin riɔɔc tiet e guieereloŋ , ku tuoc de many bi kɔc luel ater nyop .

text: He that despised Moses ' law died without mercy under two or three witnesses :
text2: Raan ci loŋ de Mothe tɔ cin naamde aye nɔk ke cin raan kok piɔu ke yen , ne liep ke caatɔɔ kaarou ayi diak :

text: Of how much sorer punishment , suppose ye , shall he be thought worthy , who hath trodden under foot the Son of God , and hath counted the blood of the covenant , wherewith he was sanctified , an unholy thing , and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace ?
text2: ku ketuc bi raan yok , ketuc roŋ ke yen , ne week , an , bi kene woor e war yindi , raan ci Wen e Nhialic dum e yecok , ku jɔ riɛm de loŋ ci mac tɔ ye riɛm youyou , yen riɛm ɣɔn ci e tɔ ɣerpiɔu , ku lɛt Weidit ke dhueeŋdepiɔu e lan rac ?

text: For we know him that hath said , Vengeance belongeth unto me , I will recompense , saith the Lord . And again , The Lord shall judge his people .
text2: Wo ŋic Raan ci e lueci , yan , Guur ee kedit yɛn bi kɔc cuoot , alueel Bɛnydit . Ku be lueel , yan , Bɛnydit abi loŋ de kɔcke guiir .

text: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God .
text2: Loony ee raan loony e Nhialic piir cin ee ke dueere raan riɔɔc aret .

text: But call to remembrance the former days , in which , after ye were illuminated , ye endured a great fight of afflictions ;
text2: Ku week , catki weniim e kool ɣɔn , ɣɔn kɔne we liep nyiin abak teɣer tiŋ , kool aa wek ateer dit guum , ateer e ka ci week dhal ;

text: Partly , whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions ; and partly , whilst ye became companions of them that were so used .
text2: biak tok , ɣɔn ca we tɔ ye kɔc bi toom gup e kɔc ne caŋ ee we cak thook ku ne ka ye we dhal ; ku biak tok , ɣɔn aa wek kɔc rom etok ne kɔc ci luoi karɛc yinya .

text: For ye had compassion of me in my bonds , and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods , knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance .
text2: We ci piɔth kok ne kɔc ci mac , ku cak yaŋ ci weukun yak guum ke we mit piɔth aya , luɔi ŋiɛc wek en e wepiɔth nɔn cath wek ne keduon piɛth paannhial , ke war keek ku ye ke bi tɔu .

text: Cast not away therefore your confidence , which hath great recompence of reward .
text2: Yen duo wek riɛl aa wek wenyiin riil pal , ee ke cath keke ariop dit .

text: For ye have need of patience , that , after ye have done the will of God , ye might receive the promise .
text2: We bi kaŋ dhil aa guum , ku na elemiak , te ca wek kede piɔn e Nhialic thol e luɔi , ke we bi ke ci kɔn lueel yok .

text: For yet a little while , and he that shall come will come , and will not tarry .
text2: E doŋ ke ye tethiinakaŋ tei , Ke raan bɔ ke bi bɛn , ku cii bi bɛ gaau .

text: Now the just shall live by faith : but if any man draw back , my soul shall have no pleasure in him .
text2: Ku raan piɛthpiɔu abi piir ne gam : Ku te cot en rot cieen , ke piɔndi acii be miɛt keke yen .

text: But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition ; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul .
text2: Ku wook , wo cii mat ne kɔc e rot cuɔt cieen lek e riaakic ; wok ee kɔc ke gam kɔc bi kony wei .

text: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for , the evidence of things not seen .
text2: Ku gam ee thar e aŋɔth ŋɛɛthe raan kaŋ , ku ye ken e raan tɔ ŋic kaŋ egɔk ka kene kɔn tiŋ .

text: For by it the elders obtained a good report .
text2: Yen aye kɔcdit ɣɔn tɔ yok rin piɛth .

text: Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God , so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear .
text2: Ee gam en a ŋic wok nɔn ci piny cak ne jam e Nhialic , ku nɔn kene ka ye tiŋ cak ne ka tiec .

text: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain , by which he obtained witness that he was righteous , God testifying of his gifts : and by it he being dead yet speaketh .
text2: Ee gam en aa lɛm Aabel Nhialic ne kepiɛth ci nɔk awar kede Kain , ku yen aye lueel , an , ee raan piɛthpiɔu , aci Nhialic aa caatɔ de ka ci gam : ku yen a ŋoot en ke jam , acakaa nɔn thou en .

text: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death ; and was not found , because God had translated him : for before his translation he had this testimony , that he pleased God .
text2: Ee gam en aa leere Enok nhial , ke cii thuɔɔu bi tiŋ ; ku akene yok , luɔi ci Nhialic e lɛɛr . Ku te ŋoot en ke kene guɔ lɛɛr , aye lueel ne kede , yan , ci Nhialic tɔ mit piɔu :

text: But without faith it is impossible to please him : for he that cometh to God must believe that he is , and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him .
text2: ku te cin en gam acin ke dueer raan Nhialic tɔ mit piɔu : ku raan bɔ tede Nhialic abi dhil gam nɔn nu yen , ku gɛm nɔn ee yen Raan e kɔc riɔp kɔc e cok e kɔɔr kek e .

text: By faith Noah , being warned of God of things not seen as yet , moved with fear , prepared an ark to the saving of his house ; by the which he condemned the world , and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith .
text2: Ee gam en aa riɔɔce Noa , ɣɔn ci Nhialic e wɛɛt ne kede ka ŋoot e ke kene tiŋ , go abel cueec kony en dhiende ; en a jieeny en kɔc ke piny nɔm , ago aa raan bi piathepiɔu bɔ ne gam lɔɔk lak .

text: By faith Abraham , when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance , obeyed ; and he went out , not knowing whither he went .
text2: Ee gam en aa gɛme Abraɣam , ɣɔn ci e cɔɔl , an , bi jal paande le paan bi noom bi aa kedɛn bi lɔɔk lak ; go jal , ke kuc te le yen thin .

text: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise , as in a strange country , dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob , the heirs with him of the same promise :
text2: Ee gam yen aa reer en paan ci lueel , an , bi gam en , cit man e raan rɛɛr paan lei , aa ye reer e keemɔɔ yiic keke Yithak ku Jakop , kɔc bi keman ci lueele lɔɔk lak ne yen etok :

text: For he looked for a city which hath foundations , whose builder and maker is God .
text2: aa ye panydiit ci thar ɣet tiit , panydiit ee Nhialic en e yik en ku yen e cuec en .

text: Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed , and was delivered of a child when she was past age , because she judged him faithful who had promised .
text2: Ee gam aya en a yok Thara riɛl bi en riɛm yok , ago dhieth , ke runkɛn e dhieth e ke ye cak wan , luɔi ci en Raan waan ci e lueel tɔ ye adot .

text: Therefore sprang there even of one , and him as good as dead , so many as the stars of the sky in multitude , and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable .
text2: Ago kɔc ci dhieeth e raan tok , ku yen ee raan kit ke raan ci thou aya , agoki juec alal cit man e kuɛl nu nhial , ku citki liɛɛt nu e wɛɛryɔu , cii dueere leu ne kuɛn .
