text: These all died in faith , not having received the promises , but having seen them afar off , and were persuaded of them , and embraced them , and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth .
text2: Kɔcke kedhie acik thou e gamic , ke ke ken kaŋ guɔ yok , ka ci lueel , an , bi ke gam keek , ku acik ke tiŋ temec tei , abik ke ŋic egɔk , ku thiecki keek , ku acik gam nɔn ee kek kamaan e piny nɔm tei , kɔc mec e wunden .

text: For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country .
text2: Ku kɔc e ka cit e kake lueel ayek tɔ ŋic kɔc nɔn kɔɔr kek paanden .

text: And truly , if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out , they might have had opportunity to have returned .
text2: Ku tee ke ci paan e bi kek thin tak eyic , adi cik kool piɛth yok , kool adi ci kek keniim bɛ dhuny .

text: But now they desire a better country , that is , an heavenly : wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God : for he hath prepared for them a city .
text2: Ku adhuurki paan ŋuan enɔɔne , yen aye paan nu nhial : en acii Nhialic e yaar e keek , ne luɔi bi e tɔ ye Nhialicden : ku aci keek guiek panydit .

text: By faith Abraham , when he was tried , offered up Isaac : and he that had received the promises offered up his only begotten son ,
text2: Ee gam en aa lɛm Abraɣam Yithak , ɣɔn theme yen : yeka , raan ɣɔn ci lɛk jam de ka bi gam en , aci wendɛn ci dhieeth etok lam ;

text: Of whom it was said , That in Isaac shall thy seed be called :
text2: wendɛn ci kede lueel , yan , Kaudu abi teek e Yithakic :

text: Accounting that God was able to raise him up , even from the dead ; from whence also he received him in a figure .
text2: aa ye lueel , yan , dueere Nhialic jat nhial , acakaa ne kɔc ci thou yiic ; ku aci bɛ yok ayadaŋ , ke cit ke e bɔ bei e kɔc ci thou yiic .

text: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come .
text2: Ee gam en aa thieeiye Yithak Jakop ku Ethau , lek keek ka bi bɛn .

text: By faith Jacob , when he was a dying , blessed both the sons of Joseph ; and worshipped , leaning upon the top of his staff .
text2: Ee gam en aa thieeiye Jakop wɛɛt ke Jothep kaarou , ɣɔn kɔɔr en thuɔɔu ; ago lam ke gut piny e waide .

text: By faith Joseph , when he died , made mention of the departing of the children of Israel ; and gave commandment concerning his bones .
text2: Ee gam en aa lueele Jothep jal e mith ke Yithrael , ɣɔn kɔɔr en thook ; ku thon kɔc kede yomke .

text: By faith Moses , when he was born , was hid three months of his parents , because they saw he was a proper child ; and they were not afraid of the king ' s commandment .
text2: Ee gam en aa thiɛɛne Mothe ɣɔn dhieethe ye , thian e pɛi kadiak e yi wun ke man , luɔi ci kek e tiŋ nɔn ee yen mɛnhthiin lak ; ku aciki riɔc ne loŋ de malik .

text: By faith Moses , when he was come to years , refused to be called the son of Pharaoh ' s daughter ;
text2: Ee gam en aa jiɛɛiye Mothe , te ci en dit , jiɛɛi e cɔt bi en aa cɔɔl , an , wen e nyan e Paro ;

text: Choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God , than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season ;
text2: e kede lɔc , yan , aŋuan bi en kerac guum ke kɔc ke Nhialic etok , ne luɔi bi en miɛt de luɔi de kerac yok , miɛt bi dap jal ;

text: Esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt : for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward .
text2: aye lueel e yepiɔu , yan , kuon bi e koon ne biak de Kritho ee wcu juec awarki weu ci kut niim e Rip : aa ye yenyin cuat te nu ariop bi ye riɔp .

text: By faith he forsook Egypt , not fearing the wrath of the king : for he endured , as seeing him who is invisible .
text2: Ee gam en aa jel en e Rip eliŋliŋ , ke cii riɔc e agonh e malik : aa ye yepiɔu rom , cit man ee yen raan tiŋ raan cii dueere tiŋ .

text: Through faith he kept the passover , and the sprinkling of blood , lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them .
text2: Ee gam en aa looi yen alith cɔl Winythok ayi wiith ci riɛm wieeth , ke raan nak mith e kɛɛiyeke ke cii keek bi jak .

text: By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry land : which the Egyptians assaying to do were drowned .
text2: Ee gam en aa teem kek Abapdit Thith , cit man e piny ril : na wen , an , them kɔc ke Rip e , ke ke jɔ guɔ mou .

text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down , after they were compassed about seven days .
text2: Ee gam ɛn aa wieeke pɛɛny ke Jeriko , te ɣɔn ci ke jɔ wil kɔɔth e akool kadherou .

text: By faith the harlot Rahab perished not with them that believed not , when she had received the spies with peace .
text2: Ee gam en aa cii Rakap akɔɔrroor thou keke kɔc reec gam etok , ɣɔn ci en neem nyuooc ke cin tɔŋ .

text: And what shall I more say ? for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon , and of Barak , and of Samson , and of Jephthae ; of David also , and Samuel , and of the prophets :
text2: Ku ye jam daŋou ba lueel ? acin te laau ban jam lueel e kede Gideɔn , ku Barak , ku Thamthon , ku Jeptha ; ayi kede Dabid aya , ku Thamuel , ku nebii :

text: Who through faith subdued kingdoms , wrought righteousness , obtained promises , stopped the mouths of lions ,
text2: kɔc ɣɔn ci bɛi ceŋ maliik tiaam ne gam , ku yek ka ke piathepiɔu looi , ku yek kaŋ yok ka ci lueel , an , bi ke gam keek , acik kɔɔr dɔm thook ,

text: Quenched the violence of fire , escaped the edge of the sword , out of weakness were made strong , waxed valiant in fight , turned to flight the armies of the aliens .
text2: acik riɛl e mac tɔ liu , acik poth e abatau thok , ciɛk , an , kɔcki , acike tɔ ril , acik ŋeeny e tɔŋ alal , ku jɔki tɔɔŋ ke juur lei cop .

text: Women received their dead raised to life again : and others were tortured , not accepting deliverance ; that they might obtain a better resurrection :
text2: Diaar acik kɔckɛn ci thou bɛ yok ne jon ci kek ro jɔt : ku nak kɔc kɔk aleŋ , areecki weer bi ke wɛɛr bei ; luɔi bi kek jonerot ŋuan yok .

text: And others had trial of cruel mockings and scourgings , yea , moreover of bonds and imprisonment :
text2: Ku kɔk aake ye them ne gɛt geete ke gup , ku dui duiye keek e wɛt , yeka , ayi many mɛce keek e joth , ku tɛɛu tɛɛuwe keek e aloc yiic :

text: They were stoned , they were sawn asunder , were tempted , were slain with the sword : they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins ; being destitute , afflicted , tormented ;
text2: aake ye biɔɔk e kur , ku yeke ŋnith kɔɔth e rou , aake ye them , aake nak ne abatau : aake ye tai ke ke ceŋ biɔŋ ke amɛl , ku biɔŋ ke bɔɔth ; aake ye abuur , ku ye karil ke dhal , ku yeke luoi kerac

text: ( Of whom the world was not worthy : ) they wandered in deserts , and in mountains , and in dens and caves of the earth .
text2: ( ku piny arac , aa cii roŋ ke keek ) , aake ye tai e jɔɔr yiic ku kur yiic ku kɔk yiic , ku pɔl yiic pɔl ke piny .

text: And these all , having obtained a good report through faith , received not the promise :
text2: Ku kɔcke kedhie , te ci kek rin piɛth jɔ guɔ yok ne gamden , ke ke ken ke ci lueel , an , bi gam kɔc yok ,

text: God having provided some better thing for us , that they without us should not be made perfect .
text2: luɔi ci Nhialic kɔn diɛɛr e ke ŋuan ne keda , ke ke cii bi tɔ ye dikedik te liu wok .

text: Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses , let us lay aside every weight , and the sin which doth so easily beset us , and let us run with patience the race that is set before us ,
text2: Yen tede ka , ke wook aya , luɔi ci wo tuɔɔk e luan e caatɔɔ luan diit yinya , yok kethiek bɛɛi bei ebɛn , ku palku karɛɛc e wo dap wook , ku yok riŋ e kueer ci taau e woniim tueŋ ke wo lir piɔth ,

text: Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith ; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross , despising the shame , and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God .
text2: ku yok Yecu woi , raan e cak gamda ku bi thol , raan ci tiim ci riiu nɔm guum ne ayum de piɔu ci taau e yenɔm tueŋ , go ayaar tɔ cin naamde , ku jɔ nyuc piny e ciin cueny de thoonydiit e Nhialic .

text: For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself , lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds .
text2: Yen tak wek weniim e raan ee teer diit yinya guum , teer e kɔc e kerac looi , ke we cii bi dak , ku caki piɔth bi bap .

text: Ye have not yet resisted unto blood , striving against sin .
text2: We ŋoot e we ken biok abi riɛm kueer , ne wit wiet wek e kerac .

text: And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children , My son , despise not thou the chastening of the Lord , nor faint when thou art rebuked of him :
text2: Ku we e niim maar e guieer aa wek guieer e ye , cit guieer ee mithwat guieer , yan , Wendi , du weet e Bɛnydit e biɔɔn , Ku du bap te jieeny en yin ;

text: For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth , and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth .
text2: Raan nhiɛɛr Bɛnydit en aye wɛɛt , Ku ye meth dui ebɛn , mɛnh ci dɔm a ye wende .

text: If ye endure chastening , God dealeth with you as with sons ; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not ?
text2: Te ya wek weet guum , ke Nhialic ee reer ke week cit man e wɛɛtke ; ee wenou nu wen cii wun e wɛɛt ?

text: But if ye be without chastisement , whereof all are partakers , then are ye bastards , and not sons .
text2: Ku te rɛɛr wek ke we cie wɛɛt , cit man ee mith wɛɛt ebɛn , ke we ye adhiethleer , ku caki e wɛɛt yith .

text: Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us , and we gave them reverence : shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits , and live ?
text2: Ku cooke ayadaŋ , wok aa de warkuɔn e wogup , warkuɔn e wo wɛɛt , ku yok ke rieu gup : cii ŋuan alal luɔi bi wo kede Waardan e weikuɔ aa piŋ , agoku piir ?

text: For they verily for a few days chastened us after their own pleasure ; but he for our profit , that we might be partakers of his holiness .
text2: Ku ee yic aake ye wo wɛɛt e akool liaakaŋ e weet piɛth e kekpiɔth ; ku weet weet en wook ee kede piathda , ke wo bi ɣɛɛr e yenpiɔu rɔm ne yen etok .

text: Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous , but grievous : nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby .
text2: Ku weet ebɛn acit ke cii mit enɔɔne , ee dhieeu bɛɛi : ku elemiak ke jɔ luɔk e ka ke reer adiu ne kede kɔc waan ci wɛɛt e ye , ka ke piathepiɔu .

text: Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down , and the feeble knees ;
text2: Yen jat wek cin ci luaac piny nhial , ku riɛnyki miɔl ci nueŋ ;

text: And make straight paths for your feet , lest that which is lame be turned out of the way ; but let it rather be healed .
text2: ku luɔiki kuɛɛr lɔ cit ka ke wekcok , ke ŋɔl cii ro bi yal kueer , aŋuɛɛn e luɔi bi en dem .

text: Follow peace with all men , and holiness , without which no man shall see the Lord :
text2: Yak cok e kaar wek reer adiu weke kɔc kedhie , ku kaarki ɣɛɛrepiɔu ; na cin ɣɛɛrepiɔu , ka cin raan dueer Bɛnydit tiŋ .

text: Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God ; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you , and thereby many be defiled ;
text2: Yak cok e tiɛɛt wek rot , ke cin raan bi dak e dhueeŋ de Nhialic piɔu ; ke cin meei de kɛcdepiɔu bi cil , ago we nuaan , ku tɔ kɔc juec nhiany piɔth ;

text: Lest there be any fornicator , or profane person , as Esau , who for one morsel of meat sold his birthright .
text2: ke cin dhom bi nu e weyiic , ayi raan cin guop athɛɛk , cit man e Ethau , raan ɣɔn ɣɔɔc athiɛɛidɛn e kɛɛi ne aduŋ toŋ de kecam .

text: For ye know how that afterward , when he would have inherited the blessing , he was rejected : for he found no place of repentance , though he sought it carefully with tears .
text2: Ku aŋiɛcki nɔn ci e rɛɛc ɣɔn kɔɔr en luɔi bi en athiɛɛi lɔɔk lak ( ku acin tede puŋdepiɔu ci yok , ) ciɛk , an , cok e kɔɔr en en ke dhiau e piu ke yenyin .

text: For ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched , and that burned with fire , nor unto blackness , and darkness , and tempest ,
text2: Ku wek ken bɛn tede kuurdit kuur dueere jak , kuur ɣɔn dep e mac , ku te nu cuɔlepiny , ku mɔɔth , ku amaŋ ,

text: And the sound of a trumpet , and the voice of words ; which voice they that heard intreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more :
text2: ku te koothe kaaŋ , ku te nu rol e jam ne wel ; rol ɣɔn piŋ kɔc , ke jɔki lɔŋ , an , E cin jam bi bɛ lɛk wook :

text: ( For they could not endure that which was commanded , And if so much as a beast touch the mountain , it shall be stoned , or thrust through with a dart :
text2: aciki jam ci thɔn keek dueer guum , yan , Acakaa lɛi te jiɛk en kuurdit , ka bi biɔɔk e kur , ku nɔn thɛɛre ye e tɔŋ ;

text: And so terrible was the sight , that Moses said , I exceedingly fear and quake : )
text2: ku pau e pɛuwe kɔc e tiŋ ke ci tuol adit alal , arek abi Mothe lueel , yan , Yɛn e piɔu pɛu wei ku lɛthe ya alal !

text: But ye are come unto mount Sion , and unto the city of the living God , the heavenly Jerusalem , and to an innumerable company of angels ,
text2: Ku we ci bɛn te nu kuurdit Dhiɔn , ku te nu panydiit e Nhialic piir , yen aye Jeruthalem nu paannhial , ku te nu rɛm ke tuucnhial rɛm cii dueere leu nyin e kuɛn ,

text: To the general assembly and church of the firstborn , which are written in heaven , and to God the Judge of all , and to the spirits of just men made perfect ,
text2: ku te ci kɔc keniim kut ebɛn , ku kanithɔ de kɔc e kɛɛiyeke kɔc ci gɔɔr paannhial , ku te nu Nhialic Bɛny e loŋ de kɔc guiir kedhie , ku te nu wei ke kɔc piɛthpiɔth kɔc ci tɔ ye piɔth dikedik ,

text: And to Jesus the mediator of the new covenant , and to the blood of sprinkling , that speaketh better things than that of Abel .
text2: ku te nu Yecu raan e kɔc maat ku ye caatɔ de loŋ ci piac mac , ku te nu riɛm e wieeth , riɛm luel jam ŋuan ne ke lueel riɛm de Aabel .

text: See that ye refuse not him that speaketh . For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth , much more shall not we escape , if we turn away from him that speaketh from heaven :
text2: Wek mathdhien duoki raan jam ke week e rɛɛc . Te kene kɔc ban kɔc ɣɔn reec kede raan e lek keek e piny nɔm , na wook , te yɛl wok rot wei e raan lek wook ke nu paannhial , ke wo bi ban dhal alaldiite ;

text: Whose voice then shook the earth : but now he hath promised , saying , Yet once more I shake not the earth only , but also heaven .
text2: raan ci rolde piny niɛŋ ɣɔn ; ku aci lueel enɔɔne , yan , E doŋ ke ye nieŋ tok , ku acie piny etok , ayi tenhial aya aba niɛŋ .

text: And this word , Yet once more , signifieth the removing of those things that are shaken , as of things that are made , that those things which cannot be shaken may remain .
text2: Kee lueel en en , yan , E doŋ ke ye nieŋ tok , ee nyiɛɛi de ka ci niɛŋ yen e lueel , cit man e ka ci cak , luɔi bi ka cii dueere niɛŋ doŋ .

text: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved , let us have grace , whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear :
text2: Yen ka , luɔi yok wok ciɛɛŋ cii dueere niɛŋ , yen dɔm wo dhueeŋdepiɔu , buk ka ke Nhialic aa looi ne rieeu ku riɔɔc , ke bi piɔu miɛt : Nhialicda yen aye many e kaŋ cam aya .

text: Let brotherly love continue .
text2: Yak cool e nhiaar rot e nhieer e mith ke raan tok .

text: Be not forgetful to entertain strangers : for thereby some have entertained angels unawares .
text2: Duoki niim e maar e ŋiny de kamaan : ade kɔc ŋic kamaan kɔc ci tuucnhial nyuooc ke ke kucki .

text: Remember them that are in bonds , as bound with them ; and them which suffer adversity , as being yourselves also in the body .
text2: Yak weniim tak e kɔc ci mac , cit man e kak e mac ne keek etok ; ayi kɔc e luoi kerac , yak weniim tak e keek , ne ŋoot ŋuɔɔt wek ke we cath ne gupkun .

text: Marriage is honourable in all , and the bed undefiled : but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge .
text2: E thieek e rieu e weyiic wedhie , ku bioŋ e thieek e cii e tɔ nhiany : dhoom ku roor e dieer lei kɔɔr , ku akɔɔrroor , loŋden abii Nhialic guiir atuc .

text: Let your conversation be without covetousness ; and be content with such things as ye have : for he hath said , I will never leave thee , nor forsake thee .
text2: Yak tɔu e we cii weu nhiaar : yak piɔth aa yum ne ka cath e week : luɔi ci en e lueel , yan , Yin ca bi pɔl anandi , ku ca yi bi nyaaŋ piny aya .

text: So that we may boldly say , The Lord is my helper , and I will not fear what man shall do unto me .
text2: Yen a dueer wok e lueel , ke wo ril nyiin , yan , Bɛnydit ee konydi ; yɛn cii bi riɔɔc : Eeŋo bi raan luoi yɛn ?

text: Remember them which have the rule over you , who have spoken unto you the word of God : whose faith follow , considering the end of their conversation .
text2: Yak weniim tak e kɔc e nu e weniim , kɔc ci wek lɛk jam e Nhialic ; yak tauden thɔɔŋ e wepiɔth , thok e thook en , ku yak gamden kuany cok .

text: Jesus Christ the same yesterday , and to day , and for ever .
text2: Yecu Kritho ee tɔu e tau mane guop , waanakol , ayi ekoole , yeka , aɣet athɛɛr .

text: Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines . For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace ; not with meats , which have not profited them that have been occupied therein .
text2: Duoki rot e tɔ leere tɛn ku tɛn ne weet mɛɛn kithic : apiɛth te ci piɔn e raan tɔ kaac aril ne dhueeŋdepiɔu ; ku acie ne kecam , acin kepiɛth cii kɔc yok thin kɔc e kepiɔth tuom keek .

text: We have an altar , whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle .
text2: Wo de niim yiŋ de lam , ku kɔc e ka ke keemɔ looi acin keden thin , aciki dueer aa cam e yen .

text: For the bodies of those beasts , whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin , are burned without the camp .
text2: Lai ee riɛmden bɛɛi teɣeric ne bɛnydiit tueŋ e ka ke Nhialic ne baŋ de kerac , gupken ayeke nyop e wut kec biic .

text: Wherefore Jesus also , that he might sanctify the people with his own blood , suffered without the gate .
text2: Yen aa guume Yecu thuɔɔu e kalthok biic aya , luɔi bi en kɔc tɔ ɣerpiɔth ne riɛm de yenguop .

text: Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp , bearing his reproach .
text2: Yen le wok e wut kec biic te nu yen , ke wo gum kuon ci e koon .

text: For here have we no continuing city , but we seek one to come .
text2: Etene wo cin panydiit bi tɔu anande , ee panydiit bi bɛn en kɔɔrku .

text: By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually , that is , the fruit of our lips giving thanks to his name .
text2: Yen ee wok cool e lam Nhialic ne yen , e lam de lɛc leec wok en , yen aye jam e bɛn bei e wothook gɛm wok rinke .

text: But to do good and to communicate forget not : for with such sacrifices God is well pleased .
text2: Ku duoki niim e maar ne luɔi de kepiɛth ku teŋ aa wek kakun tɛk kɔc : luɔi yinya ee lam mit e Nhialic piɔu alal .

text: Obey them that have the rule over you , and submit yourselves : for they watch for your souls , as they that must give account , that they may do it with joy , and not with grief : for that is unprofitable for you .
text2: Yak ka ke kɔc nu e weniim piŋ , ku taauki rot e kecok : ayek weikun tiit , cit kɔc bi kuen lueel rial ; ke ke bi kene looi ne miɛtepiɔu ku ciki e looi ne dhiendepiɔu : kene adi rɛɛc tede week .

text: Pray for us : for we trust we have a good conscience , in all things willing to live honestly .
text2: Yak lɔŋ ne biakda : wo ŋic wopiɔth nɔn le wok piɔth gɔk , ku nɔn kɔɔr wok luɔi bi wok tɔu e tau piɛth e kerieecic ebɛn .

text: But I beseech you the rather to do this , that I may be restored to you the sooner .
text2: Ku kene a lɛk week alaldiite , ke ya bi dap tɔ puke nɔm week .

text: Now the God of peace , that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus , that great shepherd of the sheep , through the blood of the everlasting covenant ,
text2: Ku enɔɔne , Nhialic de mat , Raan ci Bɛnydan Yecu Tin diit e thok bɛ bɛɛi e kɔc ci thou yiic , ne riɛm de loŋ ci mac athɛɛr ,

text: Make you perfect in every good work to do his will , working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight , through Jesus Christ ; to whom be glory for ever and ever . Amen .
text2: e we tɔ ye dikedik e luɔi piɛthic ebɛn , ke we bi kede piɔnde aa looi , ago kemit e yepiɔu aa looi e weyiic ne Yecu Kritho ; e dhueeŋ e ye tɔu keke yen aɣet athɛɛr ya . Amen .

text: And I beseech you , brethren , suffer the word of exhortation : for I have written a letter unto you in few words .
text2: Ku wek yɔɔk , mithekɔckuɔ , mɔkki jam de rietepiɔu : we ca gaar wel liaakaŋ tei .

text: Know ye that our brother Timothy is set at liberty ; with whom , if he come shortly , I will see you .
text2: Jaki ŋic nɔn ci mɛnhkenedan Timotheo lony ; ku we ba tiŋ ne yen etok , te ci en dap bɛn .

text: Salute all them that have the rule over you , and all the saints . They of Italy salute you .
text2: Thiecki kɔc nu e weniim kedhie , ku kɔc ɣerpiɔth kedhie . Wek thieec kɔc ke Yitalia .

text: Grace be with you all . Amen .
text2: E dhueeŋdepiɔu e ye tɔu keke week wedhie . Amen .

text: James , a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ , to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad , greeting .
text2: Jakop , lim e Nhialic keke Bɛnydit Yecu Kritho , athiec juur kathieer ku rou , juur ci thiei roor .

text: My brethren , count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations ;
text2: Yak tɔ ye ke ba wek piɔth miɛt alal , wek mithekɔckuɔ , te ya wek loony e themic , them kith yiic ;

text: Knowing this , that the trying of your faith worketh patience .
text2: ne ŋiny ŋiɛc wek them ee gamdun them , nɔn ee yen guomdekaŋ looi .

text: But let patience have her perfect work , that ye may be perfect and entire , wanting nothing .
text2: Ku taki guomdekaŋ thol luɔide abi dikedik , ke we bi dikedik ku cathki ne kerieec , acin ke dak week .

text: If any of you lack wisdom , let him ask of God , that giveth to all men liberally , and upbraideth not ; and it shall be given him .
text2: Ku na de raan ne weyiic raan dɛk e pɛlenɔm , ke lim tede Nhialic , Raan e kɔc miɔɔc kedhie edhueeŋ , ku cii kɔc e gɔk ; ku abi gam en .

text: But let him ask in faith , nothing wavering . For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed .
text2: Ku tɔ iip ne gam ci en gam , ku cii piɔu wiel e kaamic : raan wiel piɔu e kaamic acit apiɔŋ de kiirdit , apiɔŋ cii yom kuaath ku thec nhial .

text: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord .
text2: E cii raane luel e yepiɔu nɔn bi en kedaŋ yok tede Bɛnydit ;

text: A double minded man is unstable in all his ways .
text2: ee raan e piɔu rou , ku cie cath ekimpiny e kuɛɛrke kedhie .

text: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted :
text2: E mɛnhkenedan nu cieen e mit piɔu nɔn ci e taau tueŋ :

text: But the rich , in that he is made low : because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away .
text2: ku raan juec e kake e mit piɔu , te ci e taau cieen ; ne kuel bi en ro dap kual cit man e gaak de wal .

text: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat , but it withereth the grass , and the flower thereof falleth , and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth : so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways .
text2: Te ci akɔl ruɛl ago tuoc cit man e mac , ee wal tɔ biɔɔr , ku jɔ gaakde tɛŋ wei , ago lak de yenguop liu ; yen acit yom bi raan juec e kake yom e kuɛɛrke yiic .

text: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation : for when he is tried , he shall receive the crown of life , which the Lord hath promised to them that love him .
text2: Thieithieei raan e them guum : te ci en thok e them , ka bi gol e piir yok , gol cii Bɛnydit kɔn lueel , an , bi gam kɔc nhiaar en .

text: Let no man say when he is tempted , I am tempted of God : for God cannot be tempted with evil , neither tempteth he any man :
text2: E cin raan e ye lueel , te theme ye , yan , Yɛn them Nhialic ; Nhialic acii dueere them e kerac , ku yenguop acin raan e them ayadaŋ :

text: But every man is tempted , when he is drawn away of his own lust , and enticed .
text2: raan ebɛn aye them , te ci e thɛl wei ne ŋɔɔŋ de yenpiɔu , ŋɔɔŋ de kerac , ago math .

text: Then when lust hath conceived , it bringeth forth sin : and sin , when it is finished , bringeth forth death .
text2: Ku ŋɔɔŋ de kerac , te ci en liac , ke dhieth kerac ; ku kerac , te ci en thok e luɔi , ke bii thuɔɔu .

text: Do not err , my beloved brethren .
text2: Duoki rot e tɔ mɛthe , wek mithekɔckuɔn nhiaar .

text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above , and cometh down from the Father of lights , with whom is no variableness , neither shadow of turning .
text2: Miɔc piɛth ebɛn , ku miɔc ci dikedik ebɛn , abɔ tenhial , ke loony piny tede Wun ɣɛɛrepiny , Raan cii epiɔu e pɔɔk , ku cin atieptiep de yal de rot .

text: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth , that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures .
text2: Ne loŋ ci lueel e yepiɔu en aa dhieeth en wook ne jam de yin , luɔi bi wok ciet ka ci kɔn luɔk , ne ka ci cak kedhie .

text: Wherefore , my beloved brethren , let every man be swift to hear , slow to speak , slow to wrath :
text2: Yen ka , wek mithekɔckuɔn nhiaar , raan ebɛn e yeyin mɔth e piŋ , ku ye ro gɔɔu ne jam , ku ye ro gɔɔu e agɔth :

text: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God .
text2: agonh e raan acii piath e Nhialic piɔu e looi .

text: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness , and receive with meekness the engrafted word , which is able to save your souls .
text2: Yen pal wek cuɔlepiɔu ebɛn , ku luɔi rɛɛc gak , ku jaki jam ci piith e weyiic dɔm ne kuur aa wek rot tɔ kor , yen aye jam dueer we kony wei .

text: But be ye doers of the word , and not hearers only , deceiving your own selves .
text2: Ku yak kɔc e jam looi , ku caki e kɔc e piŋ tei , kɔc mɛth rot .

text: For if any be a hearer of the word , and not a doer , he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass :
text2: Na de raan e jam piŋ tei , ku cie raan e jam looi , ka cit raan woi enyin e menhdheric , nyindɛn e dhieth ke ye :

text: For he beholdeth himself , and goeth his way , and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was .
text2: e yeguop woi , ku jel , go nɔm dap maar e tau tɔu en , nɔn ee yen raan yindi .

text: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty , and continueth therein , he being not a forgetful hearer , but a doer of the work , this man shall be blessed in his deed .
text2: Ku raan e loŋ ci dikedik woiyin , loŋ de luny ee kɔc lony , ku jɔ aa cool thin ku acie raan e piŋ ku jɔ nɔm maar , ee raan e luɔi looi , eraane abi thieei ne luɔidɛn ee yen e looi .

text: If any man among you seem to be religious , and bridleth not his tongue , but deceiveth his own heart , this man ' s religion is vain .
text2: Na de raan e weyiic raan cit ke rieu Nhialic , ku cii yeliep e dɔm , ku e yepiɔu math tei , ke rieeu rieuwe raane Nhialic ee keɣɔric .

text: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this , To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction , and to keep himself unspotted from the world .
text2: Rieeu de Nhialic ki , rieeu ɣeric etop , ku cinic tenhiany e Nhialic Waada nɔm , yan , Nɛm ee raan abɛɛr ku dieer cin niim roor neem ne kedɛn tuc dhal keek , ku luɔi ee raan ro ŋiec muk ke cin piɔu tecol e biiye ka ke piny nɔm .

text: My brethren , have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Lord of glory , with respect of persons .
text2: Wek mithekɔckuɔ , duoki gam de Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho , Bɛnydiit de dhueeŋ e muk ne kueny aa wek kɔc kuany yiic .

text: For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring , in goodly apparel , and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment ;
text2: Ku na bɔ raan ɣon aa wek gueer thin , ku ye raan ceŋ jonh adhaap , ku ceŋ lupɔɔ ci lakelak , ku bɔ raan kuany nyin ayadaŋ raan ceŋ lupɔɔ nhianu ;

text: And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing , and say unto him , Sit thou here in a good place ; and say to the poor , Stand thou there , or sit here under my footstool :
text2: aguɔki raan ceŋ lupɔ ci lakelak rieu , ku yɔɔkki , yan , Nyuc etene , tepiɛthe ; ku yɔɔkki raan kuany nyin , yan , Kaace tɛɛn , ku nɔn nyuuc yin piny e yacok ene ;

text: Are ye not then partial in yourselves , and are become judges of evil thoughts ?
text2: ke we ken kɔc jɔ guɔ pɔc wei e weyiic , ku taki rot e bany e looŋ rac bɛɛi ?

text: Hearken , my beloved brethren , Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith , and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him ?
text2: Piɛŋki , wek mithekɔckuɔn nhiaar ; ken Nhialic kɔc kuany nyiin lɔc , kɔc kuany nyiin ne kake piny nɔm , bik aa kɔc diit e gam , ku yek kɔc bi ciɛɛŋ lɔɔk lak , ciɛɛŋ cii Nhialic kɔn lueel , an , bi gam kɔc nhiaar en ?

text: But ye have despised the poor . Do not rich men oppress you , and draw you before the judgment seats ?
text2: Ku week , we ye raan kuany nyin tɔ cin naamde . Ku na kɔc cuai , ciki week e cieŋ e ciɛɛŋ rac , ku ciki week e thɛl e bany ke goony niim ?

text: Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called ?
text2: Ciki rin ke dhueeŋ e laat e lan rac , rin ee we cɔɔl e keek ?

text: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself , ye do well :
text2: Ku te ca wek loŋ tiiŋic , loŋ de naamde ku cin ke war en , cit man e kecigɔɔr , yan , Nhiaar raan rɛɛr keke yin cit man nhiɛɛr yin rot , ke we ye kepiɛth looi :

text: But if ye have respect to persons , ye commit sin , and are convinced of the law as transgressors .
text2: ku na yak kɔc kuany yiic , ke we ye kerac looi , ago we jɔɔny e loŋ , yan , cak loŋ woocic .

text: For whosoever shall keep the whole law , and yet offend in one point , he is guilty of all .
text2: Raan e loŋ tiiŋic ebɛn , ku wac cook tok tei , ke dhaŋ de loŋic ebɛn anu e yeyeth .

text: For he that said , Do not commit adultery , said also , Do not kill . Now if thou commit no adultery , yet if thou kill , thou art become a transgressor of the law .
text2: Raan e luel en , an , Du lɔ we tiiŋ de raan daŋ , aci lueel ayadaŋ , yan , Du raan daŋ nak abi thou . Ku enɔɔne , te ken yin cak lɔ we tiiŋ de raan daŋ , ku ci raan nɔk aci thou , ke yin ci aa raan ci loŋ woocic .

text: So speak ye , and so do , as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty .
text2: Yak jam ale , ku yak luui ale , cit man e kɔc bi loŋden guiir ne kede loŋ de luny ee kɔc lony .

text: For he shall have judgment without mercy , that hath shewed no mercy ; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment .
text2: Raan e kaŋ looi egiɛɛŋ , ke loŋde abi guiir egiɛɛŋ , ku acin kokdepiɔu bi yok ; ku kokdepiɔu ee ro leec ekool e guieereloŋ .

text: What doth it profit , my brethren , though a man say he hath faith , and have not works ? can faith save him ?
text2: Naamde akou , wek mithekɔckuɔ , te lueele raan en , an , Yɛn cath wo gam , ku liu luɔi tede yen ? dueere gam kony ?

text: If a brother or sister be naked , and destitute of daily food ,
text2: Ku na de mɛnhkenedun cin kɔu lupɔ , ku nɔn ee yen nyankenedun , ku cin ke bi ya cam e akoolnyiin kedhie ,

text: And one of you say unto them , Depart in peace , be ye warmed and filled ; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body ; what doth it profit ?
text2: ku te ci raan tok e weyiic ke yɔɔk , yan , Jalki tei , we bi nin apiɛth , we bi gup tuoc tei , ku we bi kuɛth ; ku kɛnki keek miɔɔc ne ka ke guop ka bi keek muk , naamde akou ?

text: Even so faith , if it hath not works , is dead , being alone .
text2: Yen acit gam aya , te cin en luɔi cath keke yen , ka ci thou , ne reer reer en etok .

text: Yea , a man may say , Thou hast faith , and I have works : shew me thy faith without thy works , and I will shew thee my faith by my works .
text2: Yeka , adueere raan lueel , yan , Yin cath we gam , ku yɛn cath wo luɔi ; nyuothe yɛn gamdu gam cin luɔi cath keke yen , ku yin ba nyuoth gamdi ne luɔidi .

text: Thou believest that there is one God ; thou doest well : the devils also believe , and tremble .
text2: Aci gam nɔn ee Nhialic tok tei ; aci tiiŋ nɔm : aci jɔɔk rac gam ayadaŋ , ku lɛtheke .

text: But wilt thou know , O vain man , that faith without works is dead ?
text2: Ku yin , yin raan ɣɔric , de yipiɔu luɔi bi yin cooke ŋic , yan , Gam cin luɔi cath keke yen e thou ?

text: Was not Abraham our father justified by works , when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar ?
text2: Na kuɛɛreda Abraɣam , kene tɔ ye raan piɛthpiɔu ne luɔi , ɣɔn lɛm en Yithak wende e yiŋ de lam nɔm ?

text: Seest thou how faith wrought with his works , and by works was faith made perfect ?
text2: Kɛne gam tiŋ luɔi ci en luui etok keke luɔide , ago gam aa dikedik ne luɔi ; ago kecigɔɔr aa yic ke luel en , yan , Abraɣam e Nhialic gam , ago gamde tɔ ye piath de yenpiɔu , ago cɔl mɛthe e Nhialic ?

text: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified , and not by faith only .
text2: Acak jɔ tiŋ enɔɔne , nɔn ee raan tɔ piɛthpiɔu ne luɔi , ku acie ne gam etok .

text: Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works , when she had received the messengers , and had sent them out another way ?
text2: Ku yen acit Rakap akɔɔrroor aya . Kene tɔ piɛthpiɔu ne luɔi aya , ɣɔn ci en kɔc ci tooc nyuooc , ago ke tɔ jel tekki e kueer daŋ ?

text: For as the body without the spirit is dead , so faith without works is dead also .
text2: Yen ka , acit thon ci guop thou , guop cinic wei , yen acit thon ci gam thou , gam cin luɔi cath keke yen .

text: My brethren , be not many masters , knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation .
text2: Duoki rot tɔ ye bany juec bany e kɔc wɛɛt , wek mithekɔckuɔ , aŋiɛcki nɔn bi loŋda tuoc e guieer , wok kɔc e kɔc wɛɛt .

text: For in many things we offend all . If any man offend not in word , the same is a perfect man , and able also to bridle the whole body .
text2: Wok e cool e wac kaŋ wodhie . Na de raan cii kaŋ e wooc e jam , ke yen aye raan ci dikedik , ka dueer yeguop muk apiɛth ebɛn .

text: Behold , we put bits in the horses ' mouths , that they may obey us ; and we turn about their whole body .
text2: Tieŋki , wo ye joth tuɛɛl e joŋgoor thook , luɔi bi kek keda piŋ ; agoku ke puk gup ebɛn .

text: Behold also the ships , which though they be so great , and are driven of fierce winds , yet are they turned about with a very small helm , whithersoever the governor listeth .
text2: Woiki abeel wiir ayadaŋ , na cakaa kek e dit , ku yeke kuaath e yom dit alal , ku ayeke puk tei ne kethiin e abel puk , biake ku biake , ne kede raan piɔu raan e keek puk .

text: Even so the tongue is a little member , and boasteth great things . Behold , how great a matter a little fire kindleth !
text2: Yen acit nɔn ee liep kethiinakaŋ , ku ye ro leec e kajuec . Wɔiki juec de tiim bi ɣɔk mac ne many thiinakaŋ !

text: And the tongue is a fire , a world of iniquity : so is the tongue among our members , that it defileth the whole body , and setteth on fire the course of nature ; and it is set on fire of hell .
text2: Ku liep ee mac , ee piny ci nɔm thiaŋ ke kerac ; tau ee liep tɔu e ka ke wogup yiic ki , ee ken e guop tɔ col ebɛn , ku ye kueer e kecicak cuiny thok e mac ; ku yenguop aye cuiny thok e many e giɛna .

text: For every kind of beasts , and of birds , and of serpents , and of things in the sea , is tamed , and hath been tamed of mankind :
text2: Kerieec ebɛn , lai ayi diɛt , ayi ka ye mol piny , ayi ka nu wiir , adueereke tɔ piŋ jam , ku ayeke tɔ piŋ jam ne lɛn cɔl raan :

text: But the tongue can no man tame ; it is an unruly evil , full of deadly poison .
text2: ee liep etok , en acin raan dueer e tɔ piŋ jam ; ee kerɛɛc e kɔc dhal e muk piny , ku athiaŋ ke wirii wen e kɔc nɔk .

text: Therewith bless we God , even the Father ; and therewith curse we men , which are made after the similitude of God .
text2: Ee liep en a ye wok Nhialic Waada yɔɔk , an , Thieithieei ; ku ee liep ayadaŋ en a ye wok kɔc lam kerac , kɔc ci cak abi tauden ciet tau de Nhialic :

text: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing . My brethren , these things ought not so to be .
text2: e thoŋ toŋe en a ye athiɛɛi bɛn bei ku yen bi lam rac bei aya . Acii piɛth , wek mithekɔckuɔ , tau tɔuwe kake aya .

text: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and bitter ?
text2: Na yith , bi piu mit bɛɛi bei ayi piu kec ne thoŋdɛn toŋe ?

text: Can the fig tree , my brethren , bear olive berries ? either a vine , figs ? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh .
text2: Ayi ŋaap , wek mithekɔckuɔ , dueer luɔk e mith ke olip ? ayi tim cɔl eenap , dueer luɔk e mith ke ŋaap ? acin ymh nu ayadaŋ , yinh dueer tul e piu eketheketh ayi piu niit .

text: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you ? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom .
text2: Eeŋa e weyiic raan peinɔm ku ye raan ŋic kaŋ ? e ye luɔide nyuɔɔth ne reer ŋic en reer ke ye ro kuɔɔr piny e kuur ee raan pel nɔm ro kuɔɔr piny .

text: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts , glory not , and lie not against the truth .
text2: Ku na yak yiic dɛ tiɛɛl kec ku dɛki piɔth ater , ke we duoki rot e leec , ku duoki yin e cak thok .

text: This wisdom descendeth not from above , but is earthly , sensual , devilish .
text2: Kene acie pɛlenɔm bɔ nhial , ee kede piny tei , ee kede raan piɔu , ku ye kede jɔŋ rac .

text: For where envying and strife is , there is confusion and every evil work .
text2: Te nu tiɛɛl ayi ater , en aye tede awenwen ayi luɔi rɛɛc ebɛn .

text: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure , then peaceable , gentle , and easy to be intreated , full of mercy and good fruits , without partiality , and without hypocrisy .
text2: Ku pɛlenɔm bɔ nhial ee kɔn yic ɣɛɛr etop , na wen , ke jɔ mat kɔɔr , ku ye jam emaath , ku ye kede dap pɔl , ee piɔu dap kok , ku ye dap luɔk e mithkɛn piɛth , acii kɔc e kuany yiic , ku cin yacaguk .

text: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace .
text2: Ku kɔth ke piathepiɔu ayeke com ne mat ne kede kɔc e kɔc maat .

text: From whence come wars and fightings among you ? come they not hence , even of your lusts that war in your members ?
text2: Ye tɔɔŋ bɛn tenou ku ye piɔt ee kɔc piɔt bɛn tenou bik e weyiic ? Ciki e bɛn e ŋɔɔŋ e we dɔm , ŋɔɔŋ e tɔŋ biok e ka ke wegup yiic ?

text: Ye lust , and have not : ye kill , and desire to have , and cannot obtain : ye fight and war , yet ye have not , because ye ask not .
text2: Wek ee ŋɔɔŋ de kaŋ dɔm , ku caki keek e yok ; we ye kɔc nɔk abik thou , ku ye tiɛɛl we dɔm , ku we cii kaŋ dueer aa yok : wek ee piɔt ku yak tɔŋ lɛɛr ; ku ŋuɔɔtki ke we cin niim kaŋ , luɔi ca wek e lip .

text: Ye ask , and receive not , because ye ask amiss , that ye may consume it upon your lusts .
text2: We ye lip , ku caki kaŋ e yok , ne lip aa wek kuoc lip , ee ke ba wek kaŋ aa tluai wei e kamit kaarki , en aa yak lip .

text: Ye adulterers and adulteresses , know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God ? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God .
text2: Wek roor akɔɔrdiaar ku dieer akɔɔrroor , kuocki maath e ka ke piny nɔm nɔn ee yen ater lueel keke Nhialic ? Yen na de raan kɔɔr nɔn bi en maath keke ka ke piny nɔm , ka ye ro tɔ ye raan de ater keke Nhialic .

text: Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain , The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy ?
text2: Ku yak lueel e wepiɔth , yan , Kecigɔɔr ee ɣɔric lueel ? Wei ci tɔ rɛɛr e woyiic ye ŋɔɔŋ ke dɔm ayi tiɛɛl ?

text: But he giveth more grace . Wherefore he saith , God resisteth the proud , but giveth grace unto the humble .
text2: Acie yen ; ee dhueeŋdepiɔu ŋuak nyin . En a lueel en en , yan , Nhialic ee kɔc e rot tɔ dit ŋɛny , ku ye kɔc e ro tɔ kor miɔɔc e dhueeŋdepiɔu .

text: Submit yourselves therefore to God . Resist the devil , and he will flee from you .
text2: Yen taau wek rot e Nhialic cok ; ku yak jɔŋdiit rac ŋɛny , ka bi aa kat e week .

text: Draw nigh to God , and he will draw nigh to you . Cleanse your hands , ye sinners ; and purify your hearts , ye double minded .
text2: Yak rot cuot Nhialic , ka bi rot aa cuot week . Wakki wecin abik piath , we kɔc e kerac looi ; ku taki wepiɔth ɣer , wek kɔc e piɔth rou .

text: Be afflicted , and mourn , and weep : let your laughter be turned to mourning , and your joy to heaviness .
text2: Jiɛthki piɔth , ku yak thuc , ku dhiauki : taki dɔldun puk rot aye dhieeu , ku taki miɛt e wepiɔth puk rot aye jiɛthepiɔu .

text: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord , and he shall lift you up .
text2: Kuɔɔrki rot piny e Nhialic nɔm , ke bi we jat nhial .

text: Speak not evil one of another , brethren . He that speaketh evil of his brother , and judgeth his brother , speaketh evil of the law , and judgeth the law : but if thou judge the law , thou art not a doer of the law , but a judge .
text2: Duoki rot e lɛk kerac , wek mithekɔckuɔ . Raan e mɛnhkene lɛk kerac , ku ye mɛnhkene gɔk , ee loŋ en lek kerac , ku ee loŋ en gɛk : ku te gɛk yin loŋ , ke yin cie raan e loŋ looi , yin ee bɛny e loŋ guiir .

text: There is one lawgiver , who is able to save and to destroy : who art thou that judgest another ?
text2: Raan tok yen aye raan e kɔc yien loŋ ku ye bɛny e loŋ guiir , ku yen aye Raan cath ke riɛl kuny en ku nɛk en : ku yin ee ŋa , yin raan e raan rɛɛr ke yin gɔk ?

text: Go to now , ye that say , To day or to morrow we will go into such a city , and continue there a year , and buy and sell , and get gain :
text2: Cai week , wek kɔc e ye lueel , yan , Ekoole ayi miak wo bi dhil lɔ paane lok run tok thol etɛɛn , agoku kaŋ aa ɣɔɔc ku ɣɛɛcku kaŋ , ago weukuɔ kenyiin ŋuak :

text: Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow . For what is your life ? It is even a vapour , that appeareth for a little time , and then vanisheth away .
text2: ku wek kuc ke bi tic miak . Ee kaŋo e weikun ? Ayek ruu tei , ruu e tic tethiinakaŋ , na ele , ke jɔ guɔ riaar .

text: For that ye ought to say , If the Lord will , we shall live , and do this , or that .
text2: Aŋuan luɔi ba wek e lueel , yan , Te nu piir bi wok piir e Bɛnydit piɔu , ke wo bi piir , agoku kene looi , ku nɔn ee yen kene .

text: But now ye rejoice in your boastings : all such rejoicing is evil .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , wek e rot tɔ ye adhueŋ ne lɛc aa wek rot leec : lɛc cit ekene ebɛn ee kerac .

text: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good , and doeth it not , to him it is sin .
text2: Yen ka , raan ŋic kepiɛth bi looi , ku cii loi , ke yen aye kerɛɛc nu e yeyeth .

text: Go to now , ye rich men , weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon you .
text2: Cai week wek kɔc cuai , dhiauki abak kiɛɛu moc , ne katuc bɔ ka bi we dhal !

text: Your riches are corrupted , and your garments are motheaten .
text2: Kakun juec acik rop , ku lupɔɔkun aci parpar ke cam .

text: Your gold and silver is cankered ; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you , and shall eat your flesh as it were fire . Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days .
text2: Adhaapdun ku ateŋdun acik keth , ku kethden abi aa caatɔ de ater ke week , ku bi riiŋdun cam cit man e mac . Wek e weukun kut ne kede kool rial .

text: Behold , the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields , which is of you kept back by fraud , crieth : and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth .
text2: Wɔiki , ariop de kɔc e luui kɔc e dumkun tem , ariop cak pɛn keek ecueer , amoc kiɛɛu : ago kiɛɛu de kɔc tem jɔ ɣet e Bɛnydit yin , Bɛnydiit de Remdit .

text: Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth , and been wanton ; ye have nourished your hearts , as in a day of slaughter .
text2: We ye ro ŋiec kapiɛth e piny nɔm , ku yak kuɛth e yanydun kɔɔr ; we ye rot tɔ kueth e kuɛth ee kɔc kuɛth ekool e kaŋ nɔk .

text: Ye have condemned and killed the just ; and he doth not resist you .
text2: Wek e raan piɛthpiɔu gɔk , ku nakki ; ku acin ŋeny ee yen week ŋɛny .

text: Be patient therefore , brethren , unto the coming of the Lord . Behold , the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth , and hath long patience for it , until he receive the early and latter rain .
text2: Yak piɔth liɛɛr , wek mithekɔckuɔ , aɣet bɛn bi Bɛnydit bɛn . Wɔiki , raan de dom ee kapiɛth ee piny ke luɔk tiit , ke lir piɔu ne ye , aɣet te bi en deŋ yok , deŋ yaak ayi deŋ anyɔɔc .

text: Be ye also patient ; stablish your hearts : for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh .
text2: Ku week , yak piɔth liɛɛr ayadaŋ ; cok e ruɔm wek wepiɔth : bɛn e Bɛnydit e guɔ thiɔk .

text: Grudge not one against another , brethren , lest ye be condemned : behold , the judge standeth before the door .
text2: Duoki e dok e rot wapac , wek mithekɔckuɔ , ke we cii bi yiek yinth gaak : bɛny e loŋ guiir ka , kaac ɣot thoke .

text: Take , my brethren , the prophets , who have spoken in the name of the Lord , for an example of suffering affliction , and of patience .
text2: Na nebii ɣɔn e jam ne rin ke Bɛnydit , wek mithekɔckuɔ , yak ke tɔ ye kɔc ba wek tauden aa dɔmic ne guom de kerac ku ne liɛɛrepiɔu .

text: Behold , we count them happy which endure . Ye have heard of the patience of Job , and have seen the end of the Lord ; that the Lord is very pitiful , and of tender mercy .
text2: Tieŋki , wo ye kɔc e kaŋ guum tɔ ye kɔc ci thieei : we ye guom ci Jop kaŋ guum piŋ , ku we ci thok de luɔi de Bɛnydit tiŋ ; ŋiny ŋice Bɛnydit kɔc kuany nyiin , ku luɔi ee yen piɔu dap kok .

text: But above all things , my brethren , swear not , neither by heaven , neither by the earth , neither by any other oath : but let your yea be yea ; and your nay , nay ; lest ye fall into condemnation .
text2: Ku cook nu e cok niim kedhie , wek mithekɔckuɔ , duoki guutguut e lueel , duoki guutguut e lɛk paannhial , ayi piny nɔm , ayi te de en daŋ e ye guutguut lueel : te gam wek , ke yak lueel , yan , Ɣɛɛ , ku te jai wek , ke yak lueel , yan , Ei ; ke we cii bi yiek yieth gaak .

text: Is any among you afflicted ? let him pray . Is any merry ? let him sing psalms .
text2: De raan e weyiic raan gum ketuc ? e laŋ . De raan mit piɔu ? e piɔny Nhialic e dit .

text: Is any sick among you ? let him call for the elders of the church ; and let them pray over him , anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord :
text2: De raan tok e weyiic ? e cɔl kɔcdit ke kanithɔ ; ku e ke laŋ ne biakde , ku tɔcki guop e miok ne rin ke Bɛnydit :

text: And the prayer of faith shall save the sick , and the Lord shall raise him up ; and if he have committed sins , they shall be forgiven him .
text2: ku lɔŋ nu gam thin yen abi raan tok kony , go Bɛnydit jat nhial ; ku na de karɛc ci looi , ka bike pal en .

text: Confess your faults one to another , and pray one for another , that ye may be healed . The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much .
text2: Yen aa wek cawooc gam e rot wapac , ku yak lɔŋ ne rot wapac , ke we bi dem . Pal e raan piɛthpiɔu , pal cath ke riɛl , en aye kajuec tiaam .

text: Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are , and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain : and it rained not on the earth by the space of three years and six months .
text2: Elija aa ye raan cit piɔu wook , na wen , ke lɔŋ aret ke deŋ cii bi tuɛny ; ago ken tuɛny e piny nɔm e run kadiak ku pɛi kadhetem .

text: And he prayed again , and the heaven gave rain , and the earth brought forth her fruit .
text2: Na wen , ke be lɔŋ , ago tenhial piny miɔɔc ne deŋ , go piny luɔk e mithke .

text: Brethren , if any of you do err from the truth , and one convert him ;
text2: Wek mithekɔckuɔ , na de raan e weyiic raan ci ro yal e yicic , ku jɔ puk piɔu e raan daŋ ;

text: Let him know , that he which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death , and shall hide a multitude of sins .
text2: tɔ ŋic ecooke , yan , Raan e raan e kerac looi puk piɔu ne wac ci en kueer wooc , ka bi raan kony wei ne thuɔɔu , ku jɔ kut diit e karac kum .

text: Jude , the servant of Jesus Christ , and brother of James , to them that are sanctified by God the Father , and preserved in Jesus Christ , and called :
text2: Yɛn Juda , lim e Yecu Kritho , ku ya manhe e Jakop , awarek en gaar kɔc ci cɔɔl , kɔc nhiɛɛr Nhialic Waada , ku cike muk e Yecu Kritho yic :

text: Mercy unto you , and peace , and love , be multiplied .
text2: E kokdepiɔu , ku mat , ku nhieer , e ke ye lɔ ke ke ŋuak kenyiin tede week .

text: Beloved , when I gave all diligence to write unto you of the common salvation , it was needful for me to write unto you , and exhort you that ye should earnestly contend for the faith which was once delivered unto the saints .
text2: Wek kɔc nhiaar , waan aa yɛn cok e kaar ɛn gɛɛr gaar ɛn week awarek ne kede kunydewei kuny nu wok thin wodhie , ke ja ŋic e yapiɔu nɔn ban week dhil gaar jam riɛɛt ɛn wepiɔth ke we bi cok e teer ne kede gam , gam ci yinn kɔc ɣerpiɔth raantok .

text: For there are certain men crept in unawares , who were before of old ordained to this condemnation , ungodly men , turning the grace of our God into lasciviousness , and denying the only Lord God , and our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Luɔi de en kɔc kɔk ci bɛn thin ecueer , kɔc ci kɔn meek ɣɔn thɛɛr , bik kedɛn tuce yok , kɔc reec Nhialic rieu , ku yek dhueeŋ de Nhialicda piɔu puk tɔki ye kede dhoom , ku reecki Bɛnydiit toŋ nu e woniim , Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho .

text: I will therefore put you in remembrance , though ye once knew this , how that the Lord , having saved the people out of the land of Egypt , afterward destroyed them that believed not .
text2: Ku yɛn de piɔu luɔi tak ɛn weniim , ciɛk an , cak kene kɔn ŋic , naŋ cii Bɛnydit kɔc reec gam nɔk , acakaa yen e ci kɔc kɔn kony bii ke bei paan e Rip .

text: And the angels which kept not their first estate , but left their own habitation , he hath reserved in everlasting chains under darkness unto the judgment of the great day .
text2: Ayi tuucnhial tuuc ɣɔn reec tɔu e ciɛɛŋic ciɛɛŋ e ciɛke ke thin , ku jɔki paandɛn ee kek reer thin pɔl , keek aake cii Nhialic mac tecol ne joth bi tɔu athɛɛr bik kool diit e guieereloŋ tiit .

text: Even as Sodom and Gomorrha , and the cities about them in like manner , giving themselves over to fornication , and going after strange flesh , are set forth for an example , suffering the vengeance of eternal fire .
text2: Cit man e Thɔdom ku Gɔmora , ayi pɛɛnydit e nu kec , te ci kek rot aa gam luɔi de dhoom , cit man e tuucnhialke , ku yek gup lei kɔɔr , ke ke jɔ taau e kɔc niim abi aa ke ye kɔc bɛɛi niim , ne yoŋ ci kek ketucden yok mɛɛc many tɔu athɛɛr .

text: Likewise also these filthy dreamers defile the flesh , despise dominion , and speak evil of dignities .
text2: Ku kɔcke aya , acit ke keek , kɔc e nyuoth e kerac , ayek kegup tɔ nhiany , ku yek bany kuoc rieu , ku yek adhueŋ laat e lɛɛt rac .

text: Yet Michael the archangel , when contending with the devil he disputed about the body of Moses , durst not bring against him a railing accusation , but said , The Lord rebuke thee .
text2: Ku Mikael tuny nu e tuucnhial niim , ɣɔn teer en keke jɔŋdiit rac , teerki guop de Mothe , aken nyin riɛl bi lat ɣɔn gɔɔny en en , aa lueel tei , yan , Ee Bɛnydit en bi yi jɔɔny .

text: But these speak evil of those things which they know not : but what they know naturally , as brute beasts , in those things they corrupt themselves .
text2: Ku kɔcke , te de yen ka kucki ka yek ke lat ; ku te de yen ka ŋicki ne taudɛn ci cak ke , cit man e lai cin niim , ka yek rot riɔɔk e kake .

text: Woe unto them ! for they have gone in the way of Cain , and ran greedily after the error of Balaam for reward , and perished in the gainsaying of Core .
text2: Amawoou ne keek ! acik cath e kueer e Kain , ku acik ro jaac lek wac ci Balaam kaŋ wooc kuanyic ne kede ariop , ku acik maar e ater e Kora .

text: These are spots in your feasts of charity , when they feast with you , feeding themselves without fear : clouds they are without water , carried about of winds ; trees whose fruit withereth , without fruit , twice dead , plucked up by the roots ;
text2: Kɔcke ayek kuur ci thiaan ne kecamduon e nhieeric , te ye kek rɔm e week etok e kecam , ku yek keyac thiɔɔŋ ke ke cii riɔc ; ayek luaat cin yiic piu , luaat ee yom kuaath ; tiim ee mithken dap yom , agoki cuo lok , tiim ci thou raanrou , agoke woth bei ne meiken ;

text: Raging waves of the sea , foaming out their own shame ; wandering stars , to whom is reserved the blackness of darkness for ever .
text2: apiɔŋ e abapdit apiɔŋ ee ro miɔɔk abik ayarden gut cit man e amoth ; kuɛl e tai , kuɛl ci dueer col ecut tɔɔu bi aa keden aɣet athɛɛr .

text: And Enoch also , the seventh from Adam , prophesied of these , saying , Behold , the Lord cometh with ten thousands of his saints ,
text2: Ku Enok aya , raan e rem wen ee rɛm dherou gɔl Adam , yen aa kɔn jam guiir ne kɔcke , lueel , an , Tieŋki , Bɛnydit abɔ ke cath ke remdɛn ɣerpiɔu agum de kɔc kathieer ku thieer ,

text: To execute judgment upon all , and to convince all that are ungodly among them of all their ungodly deeds which they have ungodly committed , and of all their hard speeches which ungodly sinners have spoken against him .
text2: bi kɔc bɛn tɔ yok kedɛn tuc kedhie , ku bi kɔc reec Nhialic rieu bɛn jɔɔny ne luɔidɛn rɛɛc cik looi ebɛn ne rɛɛc reec kek Nhialic rieu , ku jany kɔc ne jam tuc cik lɛk en ebɛn , kek kɔc e kerac looi kɔc reec Nhialic rieu .

text: These are murmurers , complainers , walking after their own lusts ; and their mouth speaketh great swelling words , having men ' s persons in admiration because of advantage .
text2: Kɔcke ayek kɔc e dok e keyac , kɔc e piɔth dap dit , ku yek ŋɔɔŋdɛn rac kuany cok ( ayek jam diit ɣɔric lueel e kethook ) , ku yek kɔc kɔk kɔc nyiin nɔn de en ke bik yok .

text: But , beloved , remember ye the words which were spoken before of the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ ;
text2: Ku week , we kɔc nhiaar , yak weniim tak ne wel waan cii tuuc ke Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho kɔn lueel ,

text: How that they told you there should be mockers in the last time , who should walk after their own ungodly lusts .
text2: wel waan ci ke lɛk week , yan , Kool rial kɔc de gup agɛɛt abik dhil nu , kɔc bi ŋɔɔŋkɛn rac aa kuany cok .

text: These be they who separate themselves , sensual , having not the Spirit .
text2: Kɔcke ee kɔc e rot pɔc bei , kɔc e kepiɔth tuom ka ke piny , kɔc liiuwe Weidit tede keek .

text: But ye , beloved , building up yourselves on your most holy faith , praying in the Holy Ghost ,
text2: Ku week , we kɔc nhiaar , yak ro yik e gamduon ca we gam , gam ɣeric ewic , ku yak lɔŋ ne Weidit Ɣer ,

text: Keep yourselves in the love of God , looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto eternal life .
text2: ku yak rot mɔk e nhieer e Nhialicic , abak kok de Bɛnydan Yecu Kritho piɔu aa tiit a yɔk wek piir athɛɛr .

text: And of some have compassion , making a difference :
text2: Yak piɔth kok e kɔc kɔk , kɔc ayeke paak ;

text: And others save with fear , pulling them out of the fire ; hating even the garment spotted by the flesh .
text2: ku yak kɔc kɔk kony ne riɔɔc riaac wek , abak ke ya dɔɔr bei mɛɛc ; ayi lupɔ aya abak maan lupɔ ci nyuel ne rac de guop .

text: Now unto him that is able to keep you from falling , and to present you faultless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy ,
text2: Ku enɔɔne , Nhialic Raan ŋic week gel ke we cii bi aa wiik , ku ŋic week taau e dhueeŋde nɔm ke cin ke bi we gɔk , abak piɔth a yum alal ,

text: To the only wise God our Saviour , be glory and majesty , dominion and power , both now and ever . Amen .
text2: Nhialic pelnɔm , cin Nhialic ee kek rou , ku ye Konydan e wei ne Yecu Kritho Bɛnydiitda , e dhueeŋ e ye tɔu ke ye , ku dit , ku riɛl , ku bɛɛny , ɣɔn thɛɛr ya ayi enɔɔne , aɣet athɛɛr ya . Amen .

text: The Revelation of Jesus Christ , which God gave unto him , to shew unto his servants things which must shortly come to pass ; and he sent and signified it by his angel unto his servant John :
text2: Nyuutii de Yecu Kritho , nyuuth cii Nhialic gam en , bi liimke bɛn nyuoth ka bi dhil dap tic : go tunydɛnnhial tuooc le limdɛn Jɔn lɛk :

text: Who bare record of the word of God , and of the testimony of Jesus Christ , and of all things that he saw .
text2: raan ci aa caatɔ luel jam e Nhialic , ku jam yic de Yecu Kritho , ku ka ci tiŋ kedhie .

text: Blessed is he that readeth , and they that hear the words of this prophecy , and keep those things which are written therein : for the time is at hand .
text2: Thieithieei raan e wel kueen ayi kɔc e wel ke ka guiir enɔɔne piŋ , ku jɔki kacigɔɔr thin aa dot : e luɔi ci akool thiɔk .

text: John to the seven churches which are in Asia : Grace be unto you , and peace , from him which is , and which was , and which is to come ; and from the seven Spirits which are before his throne ;
text2: Yɛn Jɔn , awarek en gaar kanithɔɔ kadherou nu Athia : E dhueeŋdepiɔu e ye tɔu ke week , ku mat , ne ke bɔ tede Raan nu , ku aa nu , ku abi bɛn ; ku ne ke bɔ tede Wei kadherou Wei nu e thoonydɛn diit nɔm ;

text: And from Jesus Christ , who is the faithful witness , and the first begotten of the dead , and the prince of the kings of the earth . Unto him that loved us , and washed us from our sins in his own blood ,
text2: ku ne ke bɔ tede Yecu Kritho , ee caatɔ adot , ku ye raan ci dhieeth ke ye kɛɛi e kɔc ci thou yiic , ku ye bɛnydiit nu e maliik ke piny niim . Raan e wo nhiaar , ago wo waak ne karɛckuɔ ne riɛm de yenguop ;

text: And hath made us kings and priests unto God and his Father ; to him be glory and dominion for ever and ever . Amen .
text2: ku ci wo tɔ ye maliik ku bany ke ka ke Nhialic e Nhialic Wun nɔm ; e dhueeŋ e ye tɔu ke yen ayi ciɛɛŋ aɣet athɛɛr ya . Amen .

text: Behold , he cometh with clouds ; and every eye shall see him , and they also which pierced him : and all kindreds of the earth shall wail because of him . Even so , Amen .
text2: Tieŋki , abɔ keke luaat ; ku abi tiŋ e kɔc nyiin kedhie , ayi kɔc ɣon guut en aya ; ku juur ke piny nɔm ebɛn abik dhuoor ne biakde . Ee yen . Amen .

text: I am Alpha and Omega , the beginning and the ending , saith the Lord , which is , and which was , and which is to come , the Almighty .
text2: Yɛn aye Alpa ku ya Omega , gɔl e kaŋ ku thok e kaŋ , kee lueel Bɛnydit Nhialic ka , Bɛnydiit nu , ku aa nu , ku bi bɛn , Raan e kaŋ leu ebɛn .

text: I John , who also am your brother , and companion in tribulation , and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ , was in the isle that is called Patmos , for the word of God , and for the testimony of Jesus Christ .
text2: Yɛn Jɔn , mɛnhkenedun , ku ya raan e mat woke week etok ne ketuc e wo dhal , ku yok mat etok aya ne ciɛɛŋ de Yecu Kritho ku ne liɛɛr e yenpiɔu , yɛn aa nu tuur cɔl Patmo , ne baŋ de jam e Nhialic ku ne luɔi aa yɛn caatɔ ne kede Yecu Kritho .

text: I was in the Spirit on the Lord ' s day , and heard behind me a great voice , as of a trumpet ,
text2: Yɛn aa cath wo Weidit ekool e Bɛnydit ; na wen , ke ya piŋ roldiit cit rol e kaaŋ e yakɔu cieen ,

text: Saying , I am Alpha and Omega , the first and the last : and , What thou seest , write in a book , and send it unto the seven churches which are in Asia ; unto Ephesus , and unto Smyrna , and unto Pergamos , and unto Thyatira , and unto Sardis , and unto Philadelphia , and unto Laodicea .
text2: rol luel en , yan , Yɛn ee Alpa ku ya Omega , yɛn ee Tueŋ ku ya Cieen : Gaar ke ci tiŋ e awarekic , ku tɔ yine kanithɔɔ nu Athia kadherou : Epetho , ku Thumurua , ku Pergamo , ku Thuatira , ku Thardith , ku Piiadelpia , ku Laodikia .

text: And I turned to see the voice that spake with me . And being turned , I saw seven golden candlesticks ;
text2: Guɔ ro puk , tieŋ raan jam ke yɛn . Na wen , ca ro puk , ke ya tiŋ camadaan e adhaap kadherou ;

text: And in the midst of the seven candlesticks one like unto the Son of man , clothed with a garment down to the foot , and girt about the paps with a golden girdle .
text2: ku kaac ke cit Wen e raan e camadaan yiic cii , aceŋ ahilut pek e yecok piny , ku ci thionh e adhaap duoot e yeteŋ .

text: His head and his hairs were white like wool , as white as snow ; and his eyes were as a flame of fire ;
text2: Ku ɣeer nɔm e wic cit man e alanh ɣerewic , acit kɔɔi ɣeer e lony nhial paan hir e pinyde : ku cit nyin liem de mac ;

text: And his feet like unto fine brass , as if they burned in a furnace ; and his voice as the sound of many waters .
text2: ku cit cok malaŋ ci lɔ bilbil , cit malaŋ ci leeŋ e manyditic , abi lɔ wai : ku cit rol awuoou de pieeu .

text: And he had in his right hand seven stars : and out of his mouth went a sharp twoedged sword : and his countenance was as the sun shineth in his strength .
text2: Ku aa muk kuɛl kadherou e ciin cuenyde : ku bɔ abatau bei e yethok , abatau moth e thok kaarou : ku cit nyin akɔl te ruel en alal .

text: And when I saw him , I fell at his feet as dead . And he laid his right hand upon me , saying unto me , Fear not ; I am the first and the last :
text2: Na wen , aca ye tiŋ , ke ya jɔ wiik e yecok cit man e ke ci thou . Go ciin cuenyde taau e yaguop , yook ɛn , yan , Du riɔc : yɛn ee tueŋ , ku ya cieen ,

text: I am he that liveth , and was dead ; and , behold , I am alive for evermore , Amen ; and have the keys of hell and of death .
text2: ku ya raan piir ; yɛn aaci thou , ku tiŋ , ya ki piire aɣet wadaŋ thɛɛr , ku yɛn cath wo mukthɛɛr ke thuɔɔu ku paan e kɔc ci thou .

text: Write the things which thou hast seen , and the things which are , and the things which shall be hereafter ;
text2: Yen gɛɛr yin ka ci tiŋ , ayi ka nu , ayi ka bi rot lɔɔk yok e kake cok :

text: The mystery of the seven stars which thou sawest in my right hand , and the seven golden candlesticks . The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches : and the seven candlesticks which thou sawest are the seven churches .
text2: cook ci thiaan , ki , cook e kede kuɛl kadherou kuɛl ci tiŋ e ciin cuenydi , ku camadaan e adhaap kadherou . Kuɛl kadherou ayek tuuc ke kanithɔɔ kadherou : ku camadaan kadherou ayek kanithɔɔ kadherou .

text: Unto the angel of the church of Ephesus write ; These things saith he that holdeth the seven stars in his right hand , who walketh in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks ;
text2: Gaare tuny de kanithɔ nu Epetho ale : Kake aluel raan keek , raan muk kuɛl kadherou e ciin cuenyde , raan cath e camadaan e adhaap kadherou yiic cil :

text: I know thy works , and thy labour , and thy patience , and how thou canst not bear them which are evil : and thou hast tried them which say they are apostles , and are not , and hast found them liars :
text2: Yɛn ŋic luɔidu , ayi luɔiduon tuc , ayi liɛɛr e yinpiɔu , ku luɔi cii yin kede kɔc rac dueer guum , ku them ci yin kɔc them kɔc e rot tɔ ye tuuc ku ciki ye tuuc , ago ke yok aye aluɛth ;

text: And hast borne , and hast patience , and for my name ' s sake hast laboured , and hast not fainted .
text2: ku ŋiɛc guom ee yin kaŋ guum e liɛɛr e yinpiɔu ne baŋ de rinki , ku naŋ ee yin ro nak piny e luɔi ku cii bap .

text: Nevertheless I have somewhat against thee , because thou hast left thy first love .
text2: Ku ade cook ban yin jɔɔny , e luɔi ci yin nhieerduon tueŋ pɔl .

text: Remember therefore from whence thou art fallen , and repent , and do the first works ; or else I will come unto thee quickly , and will remove thy candlestick out of his place , except thou repent .
text2: Tak yinɔm e te waan loony yin thin , ku puk yipiɔu , ba luɔi tueŋ waan looi ; be , yan , cii e loi , ke yɛn bi dap bɛn tede yin , ba ku nyaai camadandu tede , te ken yin yipiɔu puk .

text: But this thou hast , that thou hatest the deeds of the Nicolaitans , which I also hate .
text2: Ku cooke ee keduon piɛth , man mɛɛn yin luɔi de Nikolaitai , luɔi maan aya .

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches ; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the tree of life , which is in the midst of the paradise of God .
text2: Raan de yic , ke piŋ ke leke Weidit kanithɔɔ . Raan e tiam , aba pal cam e tim de piir , tim nu Paradeitho de Nhialic .

text: And unto the angel of the church in Smyrna write ; These things saith the first and the last , which was dead , and is alive ;
text2: Ku gaar tuny de kanithɔ nu Thumurna ale : Kake aluel raan keek , raan tueŋ ku ye raan cieen , raan eci thou , ku be piir :

text: I know thy works , and tribulation , and poverty , ( but thou art rich ) and I know the blasphemy of them which say they are Jews , and are not , but are the synagogue of Satan .
text2: Yɛn ŋic luɔidu , ku ŋiɛc ketuc e yin dhal , ayi kuany ci yin nyin kuany ( ku yin ci bany ) , ku ŋiɛc lɛɛt rɛɛc de kɔc ee ye lueel , an , yek Judai , ku ciki ye Judai , ku yek luaŋ de Catan .

text: Fear none of those things which thou shalt suffer : behold , the devil shall cast some of you into prison , that ye may be tried ; and ye shall have tribulation ten days : be thou faithful unto death , and I will give thee a crown of life .
text2: Du riɔc etaitai ne ka ba guum . Tiŋ , jɔŋdiit rac akɔɔr luɔi bi en kɔc kɔk e weyiic cuat e aloocic , luɔi bi we them ; ku we bi ketuc dhal week yok e nhi kathieer . E gamdu dot a thou yin , ke yin ba miɔɔc nɔm e gol e piir .

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches ; He that overcometh shall not be hurt of the second death .
text2: Raan de yic , ke piŋ ke leke Weidit kanithɔɔ . Raan e tiam acii thon ee yi rou bi nɔk .

text: And to the angel of the church in Pergamos write ; These things saith he which hath the sharp sword with two edges ;
text2: Ku gaar tuny de kanithɔ nu Pergamo ale : Kake aluel raan keek , raan muk abatau moth e thok kaarou :

text: I know thy works , and where thou dwellest , even where Satan ' s seat is : and thou holdest fast my name , and hast not denied my faith , even in those days wherein Antipas was my faithful martyr , who was slain among you , where Satan dwelleth .
text2: Yɛn ŋic luɔidu , ku ŋiɛc te tɔu yin thin , yen te nu thoony e Catan ; ku yin ee rinki dot e muk , ku kɛne gam gɛm yin ɛn jai , acakaa kool ɣɔn nu Antipa caatɔdien adot , raan ci nɔk e weyiic , te ye Catan reer .

text: But I have a few things against thee , because thou hast there them that hold the doctrine of Balaam , who taught Balac to cast a stumblingblock before the children of Israel , to eat things sacrificed unto idols , and to commit fornication .
text2: Ku yɛn cath wo cok liaakaŋ cok ban ke yi jɔɔny ; cook tok ki , nɔn de yin kɔc etɛɛn kɔc e weet e Balaam muk , raan ɣɔn weet Balak , an , bi ke bi kɔc tɔ kɔth cuat kueer e mith ke Yithrael , yan , bi ka ci lam yinth aa cam , ku bik diaar aa kɔɔr .

text: So hast thou also them that hold the doctrine of the Nicolaitans , which thing I hate .
text2: Ku cooke aya , nɔn de yin kɔc e weet e Nikolaitai muk aya .

text: Repent ; or else I will come unto thee quickly , and will fight against them with the sword of my mouth .
text2: Yen puk yin yiniɔu ; be , an , jai , ke yɛn bi dap bɛn tede yin , ba bɛn biok wo keek ne abatau de yɛnthok .

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches ; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the hidden manna , and will give him a white stone , and in the stone a new name written , which no man knoweth saving he that receiveth it .
text2: Raan de yic , ke piŋ ke leke Weidit kanithɔɔ . Raan e tiam , aba pal cam e mana ci thiaan , ku aba miɔɔc ne kɔi ɣer , kɔɔi cii rin e piɛc cak gɔɔr e yekɔu , rin cin raan ŋic keek , ee raan ci gam en etok .

text: And unto the angel of the church in Thyatira write ; These things saith the Son of God , who hath his eyes like unto a flame of fire , and his feet are like fine brass ;
text2: Ku gaar tuny de kanithɔ nu Thuatira ale : Kake aluel Wen e Nhialic keek , raan cit nyin liem e mac , ku cit cok malaŋ ci lɔ bilbil :

text: I know thy works , and charity , and service , and faith , and thy patience , and thy works ; and the last to be more than the first .
text2: Yɛn ŋic luɔidu , ku nhieerdu , ku kuny ee yin kɔc kony , ku gamdu , ku liɛɛr e yinpiɔu , ku ŋiɛc luɔiduon cieen nɔn wɛɛr en luɔiduon tueŋ .

text: Notwithstanding I have a few things against thee , because thou sufferest that woman Jezebel , which calleth herself a prophetess , to teach and to seduce my servants to commit fornication , and to eat things sacrificed unto idols .
text2: Ku yɛn cath wo cook ban yin jɔɔny , pal ee yin tiiŋ cɔl Jedhebel pɔl , tiiŋ ee ro tɔ ye tiiŋ nebi ; ku ye liimki wɛɛt , mɛth en keek , yan , bik diaar aa kɔɔr , ku bik ka ci lam yieth aa cam .

text: And I gave her space to repent of her fornication ; and she repented not .
text2: Ku aca gam akool , yan , bi yepiɔu yinn puk e kɔɔr ee yen roor kɔɔr ; ku reec epiɔu puk .

text: Behold , I will cast her into a bed , and them that commit adultery with her into great tribulation , except they repent of their deeds .
text2: Tiŋ , aba cuat e laŋgarep nɔm , yen keke roor e tɔu ne yen etok , bi ketuc ke dhal alal , te reec kek kepiɔth puk ne luɔidɛn yek looi .

text: And I will kill her children with death ; and all the churches shall know that I am he which searcheth the reins and hearts : and I will give unto every one of you according to your works .
text2: Ku mithke aba ke nɔk abik thou ; ku abi kanithɔɔ ŋic kedhie , nɔn aa yɛn raan e kɔc caath piɔth , wɔi ke nu e kɔc yiic thin : kuyɛn bi raan ebɛn gam ke roŋ ke luɔide week wedhie .

text: But unto you I say , and unto the rest in Thyatira , as many as have not this doctrine , and which have not known the depths of Satan , as they speak ; I will put upon you none other burden .
text2: Ku wek yɔɔk , ku yɔɔk kɔc kɔk nu Thuatira , te de en kɔc cii weete e muk , kɔc kuc kathuth ke Catan , acit man ee kek e lueel , wek yɔɔk , yan , Acin kethieek daŋ ba taau e weyieth .

text: But that which ye have already hold fast till I come .
text2: Ku ke cath ke week enɔɔne tei , yak muk aril aɣet te ban bɛn .

text: And he that overcometh , and keepeth my works unto the end , to him will I give power over the nations :
text2: Ku raan e tiam , raan e luɔidi dot athooke kaŋ , yen aba gam riɛl e juoor niim :

text: And he shall rule them with a rod of iron ; as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to shivers : even as I received of my Father .
text2: ku abi keek aa cieŋ ne thieny weeth , ku abik thou abik e thoorthoor cit man e tony ke tiɔp ; acit man e riɛl ca yok tede Waar :

text: And I will give him the morning star .
text2: ku aba gam cieer e runepiny .

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches .
text2: Raan de yin , ke piŋ ke leke Weidit kanithɔɔ .

text: And unto the angel of the church in Sardis write ; These things saith he that hath the seven Spirits of God , and the seven stars ; I know thy works , that thou hast a name that thou livest , and art dead .
text2: Ku gaar tuny de kanithɔ nu Thardith ale : Kake aluel raan keek , raan de Wei ke Nhialic kadherou , ku kuɛl kadherou : Yɛn ŋic luɔidu , yin cath we rin cit man e ke piir , ku yin ci thou .

text: Be watchful , and strengthen the things which remain , that are ready to die : for I have not found thy works perfect before God .
text2: Ye ro tiit , ba ka ci doŋ tɔ ril , kak e ci thiɔk e thuɔɔu : luɔidu akɛn yok aci dikedik e Nhialic nɔm .

text: Remember therefore how thou hast received and heard , and hold fast , and repent . If therefore thou shalt not watch , I will come on thee as a thief , and thou shalt not know what hour I will come upon thee .
text2: Yen tɛk yin yinɔm e yoŋ ci yin kaŋ yok ku piŋ ci yin kaŋ piŋ ; ku jɔ ke dot , ku puk yipiɔu . Ku be , yan , rɛɛce ro tiit , ke yɛn bi bɛn tede yin cit man e cuɛɛr , ku thaar ban bɛn tede yin aba kuc eliŋliŋ .

text: Thou hast a few names even in Sardis which have not defiled their garments ; and they shall walk with me in white : for they are worthy .
text2: Ku yin de kɔc tokiook Thardith , kɔc ken lupɔɔken tɔ col : ku kɔcke abik aa cath ne yɛn etok ke ke ceŋ lupɔ ɣer : luɔi piɛth kek .

text: He that overcometh , the same shall be clothed in white raiment ; and I will not blot out his name out of the book of life , but I will confess his name before my Father , and before his angels .
text2: Raan e tiam ka bi yink kɔu lupɔɔ ɣer aya ; ku rinke aca ke bi cuoth bei e awarek de piiric , ku rinke aba ke gam e Waar nɔm , ku tuuckɛn nhial niim .

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches .
text2: Raan de yin , ke piŋ ke leke Weidit kanithɔɔ .

text: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write ; These things saith he that is holy , he that is true , he that hath the key of David , he that openeth , and no man shutteth ; and shutteth , and no man openeth ;
text2: Ku gaar tuny de kanithɔ nu Piladelpia ale ; Kake aluel raan ɣerpiɔu keek , raan yic , raan cath ke mukthaar e Dabid , raan e ɣot tueer , ku cin raan bi e thiook , ku ye ɣot thiook , ku cin raan bi e tueer :

text: I know thy works : behold , I have set before thee an open door , and no man can shut it : for thou hast a little strength , and hast kept my word , and hast not denied my name .
text2: Yɛn ŋic luɔidu ( tiŋ , ɣon ci liep thok aca tuɛɛl e yinɔm tueŋ , ɣon cin raan dueer e leu e thiɔk ) , luɔi ciɛth yin we riɛl thiinakaŋ , ku ye jamdi dot , ku kɛne rinki jai .

text: Behold , I will make them of the synagogue of Satan , which say they are Jews , and are not , but do lie ; behold , I will make them to come and worship before thy feet , and to know that I have loved thee .
text2: Tiŋ , yɛn bi kɔc ke luaŋ de Catan tɔ bɔ , kɔc e rot tɔ ye Judai , ku ciki ye Judai , ku ye lueth en torki ; tiŋ , aba ke tɔ bɔ bik ku gutki keniim piny e yicok , ku ta ŋicki nɔn can yi nhiaar .

text: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience , I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation , which shall come upon all the world , to try them that dwell upon the earth .
text2: Luɔi ci yin jamdi muk jam de ruot can apiɔu ruut , ke yin ba muk aya ne thaar e them , thaar bi dap bɛn e piny nɔm ebɛn , bi kɔc tɔu e piny nɔm bɛn them kedhie .

text: Behold , I come quickly : hold that fast which thou hast , that no man take thy crown .
text2: Ya ki , dap bɛne : ye ke cath ke yin cok e muk yin en , ke bi cien raan bi golduon e dhueeŋ noom .

text: Him that overcometh will I make a pillar in the temple of my God , and he shall go no more out : and I will write upon him the name of my God , and the name of the city of my God , which is new Jerusalem , which cometh down out of heaven from my God : and I will write upon him my new name .
text2: Raan e tiam , aba tɔ ye men e luaŋditt e Nhialicdiyic , ku aci bi bɛ lɔ biic : ku aba gaar nɔm rin ke Nhialicdi , ku rin ke panydiit e Nhialicdi ; yen aye Jeruthalem ci piac yik , a bɔ piny tenhial tede Nhialicdi ; ku gaar nɔm rinkien ci piac cak .

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches .
text2: Raan de yic , ke piŋ ke leke Weidit kanithɔɔ .

text: And unto the angel of the church of the Laodiceans write ; These things saith the Amen , the faithful and true witness , the beginning of the creation of God ;
text2: Ku gaar tuny de kanithɔ nu Laodikia ale ; Kake aluel Amen keek , en aye caatɔ adot ku ye yic , gɔl e caŋ e ciɛke Nhialic kaŋ :

text: I know thy works , that thou art neither cold nor hot : I would thou wert cold or hot .
text2: Yɛn ŋic luɔidu , yin cii lir , ku cii tuc : adi ca piɔu miɛt tee yi lir ku nɔn e tuc yin .

text: So then because thou art lukewarm , and neither cold nor hot , I will spue thee out of my mouth .
text2: Ku enɔɔne , luɔi moor yin tei , ku cii lir ku cii tuc , yen a kaar ɛn luɔi ban yi ŋɔk bei e yathok .

text: Because thou sayest , I am rich , and increased with goods , and have need of nothing ; and knowest not that thou art wretched , and miserable , and poor , and blind , and naked :
text2: Ne luɛl ee yin e lueel , yan , Yɛn ci bany e kaŋ , yɛn ci ro kuɛt weu juec , ku acin ke dak ɛn ; ku kuc nɔn ŋɔɔŋ yin guop , ku ye raan rac , ku kuany nyin ku ye cɔɔr ku cine kɔu lupɔ :

text: I counsel thee to buy of me gold tried in the fire , that thou mayest be rich ; and white raiment , that thou mayest be clothed , and that the shame of thy nakedness do not appear ; and anoint thine eyes with eyesalve , that thou mayest see .
text2: en a lɛk ɛn e yin , yan , Ɣɔc adham ci mac tɔ lɔ wai tede yɛn , ke yi bi bany ; ku ɣɔc lupɔɔ ɣer , ke yi bi kɔu dɛ lupɔ , go ayaar e cin cin yin kɔu lupɔ cuo tiec : ku jɔ yinyin tɔc e wɛɛl e nyin , ke yi bi daai .

text: As many as I love , I rebuke and chasten : be zealous therefore , and repent .
text2: Kɔc nhiaar ebɛn , kek aya nen ku ya ke wɛɛt cit mith : yen leth yin yic , ku puk yiniɔu .

text: Behold , I stand at the door , and knock : if any man hear my voice , and open the door , I will come in to him , and will sup with him , and he with me .
text2: Ya ki , kaac ɣot thoke , ke ya tɔŋ ɣot thok : te de en raan piŋ arol ku liep ɣot thok , ke yɛn bi bɛn ɣot tede yen , ku buk aa cam etok , yɛn woke yen .

text: To him that overcometh will I grant to sit with me in my throne , even as I also overcame , and am set down with my Father in his throne .
text2: Raan e tiam , aba tɔ nyuc keke yɛn etok e thoonydien ditt nɔm , cit man can tiam aya , aguɔ jɔ nyuc woke Waar etok e thoonyde nɔm .

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches .
text2: Raan de yic , ke piŋ ke leke Weidit kanithɔɔ .

text: After this I looked , and , behold , a door was opened in heaven : and the first voice which I heard was as it were of a trumpet talking with me ; which said , Come up hither , and I will shew thee things which must be hereafter .
text2: Na wen , aci kake thok , ke ya jɔt anyin , guɔ paannhial tiŋ aci liep thok , ku rol ca kɔn piŋ acit rol e kaaŋ ke jam ke yɛn , lueel , yan , Ba nhial tene , ku yin ba nyuoth ka bi dhil lɔɔk tic e kake cok .

text: And immediately I was in the spirit : and , behold , a throne was set in heaven , and one sat on the throne .
text2: Na wen , ke Weidit e ke jɔ nyuc e yaguop enɔnthiine : ku jɔ thoonydit tiŋ aci tuɛɛl piny paannhial . ku rɛɛr Raan e thoonydit nɔm ;

text: And he that sat was to look upon like a jasper and a sardine stone : and there was a rainbow round about the throne , in sight like unto an emerald .
text2: ku Raan rɛɛr acit nyin kuur thith cɔl jathpi ayi kuur cɔl thardiɔn : ku nu miit ee thoonydit geeu , ke cit nyin kuur tɔc cɔl thamarakdo .

text: And round about the throne were four and twenty seats : and upon the seats I saw four and twenty elders sitting , clothed in white raiment ; and they had on their heads crowns of gold .
text2: Ku ade thony kɔk kathierou ku ŋuan ke ke ci thoonydit gɛɛu cil : ku yɛn e roordit tiŋ kathierou ku ŋuan ke ke rɛɛr , aceŋki lupɔɔ ɣer ; ku ceŋki gool ke dhueeŋ e keniim gool ke adhaap .

text: And out of the throne proceeded lightnings and thunderings and voices : and there were seven lamps of fire burning before the throne , which are the seven Spirits of God .
text2: Ku bɔ wiiedaŋ bei e thoonyditic ku maaredaŋ ku kɔc rot . Ku nu mɛckcalath kadherou ke ke dɛp e thoonydit nɔm tueŋ , kek aye Wei ke Nhialic kadherou ;

text: And before the throne there was a sea of glass like unto crystal : and in the midst of the throne , and round about the throne , were four beasts full of eyes before and behind .
text2: ku nu ke cit wɛɛr acidhath e thoonydit nɔm tueŋ , cit kuur cɔl kuruthalo ; ku lai kaŋuan anuki e kaam de thoonydit keke thony kɔk ee thoonydit geeu , lai ci gup thiaŋ e nyiin , tueŋ ku cieen .
